༄༅། །འཕགས་པ་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་རྡོ་རྗེ་གཅོད་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་བཞུགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire title structure" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འཕགས་པ་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་རྡོ་རྗེ་གཅོད་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བ [Type: Center | Desc: "The core title of the text" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཕགས་པ་ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Descriptor indicating the exalted nature of the text" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་ [Type: Center | Desc: "One component of the title, referring to the Prajnaparamita classification" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཀྱི་ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Genitive case marker showing relationship" | Implicit: ""]
        └── རྡོ་རྗེ་གཅོད་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བ [Type: Parallel | Desc: "Parallel component of the title, referring to the Sanskrit name" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཞེས་བྱ་བ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Phrase indicating the naming or designation of the text" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཞུགས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "Verbal element indicating the text's presence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ༄༅། ། [Type: Punctuation | Desc: "Traditional Tibetan text opening markers" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ། ། [Type: Punctuation | Desc: "Traditional Tibetan text closing punctuation" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ༄༅། ། : [opening ornament] [traditional Tibetan textual beginning marker that indicates the start of a significant text]
- འཕགས་པ་ : Noble [honorific prefix from `འཕགས་པ་`: exalted, superior, noble; indicates the text's sacred or elevated status]
- ཤེས་རབ་ : wisdom [from `ཤེས་རབ་`: transcendent wisdom, prajñā; refers to the highest form of discriminating wisdom]
- ཀྱི་ : of [genitive case marker connecting "wisdom" with "perfection"; indicates possession or relation]
- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ : to the other shore [locative of `ཕ་རོལ་`: opposite shore, far side; metaphorically indicates transcendence or going beyond]
- ཕྱིན་པ་ : perfection [from `ཕྱིན་པ་`: to reach, arrive at, perfect; refers to the perfection or completion, pāramitā]
- རྡོ་རྗེ་ : vajra [from `རྡོ་རྗེ་`: diamond, thunderbolt; symbolizes indestructibility and spiritual power]
- གཅོད་པ་ : cutter [from `གཅོད་པ་`: to cut, sever; indicates the text's function of cutting through ignorance or illusion]
- ཞེས་ : called [quotative particle indicating the preceding text is a name or designation]
- བྱ་བ་ : named [from `བྱ་བ་`: to call, to name; functions as part of the phrase "called" or "named"]
- བཞུགས་སོ : is contained herein [honorific verb `བཞུགས་`: to sit, to be present; with final particle `སོ` indicating completion; indicates that the text follows]
- ། ། : [closing ornament] [traditional Tibetan textual ending punctuation marking the completion of the title]

རྒྱ་གར་སྐད་དུ། ཨརྱཱ་བཛྲ་ཙྪེད་ཀ་པྲཛྙཱ་པ་ར་མི་ཏཱ་ནཱ་མ་མ་ཧཱ་ཡ་ན་སཱུ་ཏྲ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene representing the Sanskrit title of a Buddhist sutra in Tibetan transliteration" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རྒྱ་གར་སྐད་དུ། [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Indicates that what follows is in Sanskrit language" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཨརྱཱ་བཛྲ་ཙྪེད་ཀ་པྲཛྙཱ་པ་ར་མི་ཏཱ་ནཱ་མ་མ་ཧཱ་ཡ་ན་སཱུ་ཏྲ། [Type: Complex | Desc: "The complete Sanskrit title of the Buddhist text" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཨརྱཱ [Type: Center | Desc: "The term indicating the noble or exalted nature of the text" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཛྲ [Type: Center | Desc: "Refers to the diamond or vajra aspect of the text" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཙྪེད་ཀ [Type: Center | Desc: "Refers to the cutting function described in the text" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── པྲཛྙཱ [Type: Center | Desc: "Refers to the wisdom aspect of the text" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── པ་ར་མི་ཏཱ [Type: Center | Desc: "Refers to the perfection or transcendent aspect" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ནཱ་མ [Type: Function | Desc: "Functional term indicating 'named' or 'called'" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མ་ཧཱ་ཡ་ན་སཱུ་ཏྲ [Type: Center | Desc: "Indicates this is a Mahayana Sutra text" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མ་ཧཱ་ཡ་ན [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates the type of Buddhist tradition (Great Vehicle)" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སཱུ་ཏྲ [Type: Center | Desc: "Identifies the text as a sutra (discourse of the Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རྒྱ་གར་སྐད་དུ། : In the language of India [Locative case marker `དུ་` added to `རྒྱ་གར་སྐད་` (Sanskrit/Indian language); indicates that what follows is presented in Sanskrit; functions as an Adverbial modifier setting the linguistic context]

- ཨརྱཱ : Noble [Sanskrit term transliterated into Tibetan; indicates the exalted or superior nature of the text; serves as an honorific qualifier for the text title]

- བཛྲ : Vajra [Sanskrit term transliterated into Tibetan; literally "diamond" or "thunderbolt"; refers to the indestructible, diamond-like quality of the wisdom being described; functions as a key component of the text's title]

- ཙྪེད་ཀ : Cutter [Sanskrit term transliterated into Tibetan; refers to the cutting or severing function; indicates the text's purpose of cutting through ignorance or delusion; acts as a descriptor of the vajra's function]

- པྲཛྙཱ : Wisdom [Sanskrit term transliterated into Tibetan; refers to transcendent wisdom or insight; a central concept in Buddhist philosophy; represents the primary subject matter of the text]

- པ་ར་མི་ཏཱ : Perfection [Sanskrit term transliterated into Tibetan; refers to the transcendent or "gone beyond" quality; indicates the perfected state of wisdom; completes the concept of "perfection of wisdom"]

- ནཱ་མ : Named [Sanskrit term transliterated into Tibetan; functions as a connector indicating "called" or "named"; serves as a functional term linking the title to its classification]

- མ་ཧཱ་ཡ་ན : Mahayana [Sanskrit term transliterated into Tibetan; literally "Great Vehicle"; refers to one of the major traditions of Buddhism; elaborates on the type of Buddhist text being presented]

- སཱུ་ཏྲ : Sutra [Sanskrit term transliterated into Tibetan; refers to a discourse attributed to the Buddha; identifies the genre of the text as a canonical Buddhist scripture]

བོད་སྐད་དུ། འཕགས་པ་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་རྡོ་རྗེ་གཅོད་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ཐེག་པ་ཆེན་པོའི་མདོ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing the entire title in Tibetan" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བོད་སྐད་དུ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Introductory phrase indicating language" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བོད་སྐད [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "Specifies the language (Tibetan)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དུ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Locative case marker indicating 'in' or 'as'" | Implicit: ""]
    └── འཕགས་པ་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་རྡོ་རྗེ་གཅོད་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ཐེག་པ་ཆེན་པོའི་མདོ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The main title of the sutra" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཕགས་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Honorific qualifier for the text, meaning 'noble' or 'exalted'" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ [Type: Center | Desc: "Central concept of the Perfection of Wisdom" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཤེས་རབ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The wisdom that is being perfected" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཀྱི [Type: Function | Desc: "Genitive case marker indicating possession or connection" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The concept of perfection or going beyond" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཕ་རོལ [Type: Center | Desc: "The 'other shore' or 'beyond' which is part of the perfection concept" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relator expressing the action of going to or reaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རྡོ་རྗེ་གཅོད་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration specifying the particular name or aspect of the perfection of wisdom" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རྡོ་རྗེ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Descriptor qualifying the cutting action as diamond-like or indestructible" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གཅོད་པ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept of cutting or severing" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཞེས་བྱ་བ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Phrase that connects the name to the object" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཐེག་པ་ཆེན་པོའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Qualifier specifying the type of sutra (Mahayana)" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཐེག་པ་ཆེན་པོ [Type: Center | Desc: "The concept of Mahayana or Great Vehicle" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འི [Type: Function | Desc: "Genitive case marker connecting Great Vehicle to Sutra" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མདོ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The scripture or discourse itself" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཐེག་པ་ཆེན་པོའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Qualifier specifying the type of sutra (Mahayana)" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཐེག་པ་ཆེན་པོ [Type: Center | Desc: "The concept of Mahayana or Great Vehicle" | Implicit: ""]
                └── འི [Type: Function | Desc: "Genitive case marker connecting Great Vehicle to Sutra" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བོད་སྐད་ : Tibetan language [Compound noun; `བོད་`: Tibet + `སྐད་`: language; refers to the medium of expression; functions as Location participant in the semantic structure]
- དུ། : in [Terminative case marker; indicates "in" or "as"; connects the language specification to the title; serves as a relator in the semantic structure]
- འཕགས་པ་ : Noble [Honorific qualifier; from `འཕགས་པ་`: exalted, superior, noble; designates the sacred or elevated status of the text; functions as an elaborator that qualifies the entire text]
- ཤེས་རབ་ : wisdom [Noun; the concept of discriminating awareness or transcendent knowledge; functions as the patient participant being perfected]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive case marker; indicates possession or relationship; connects wisdom to perfection; functions as a grammatical connector]
- ཕ་རོལ་ : beyond [Noun; lit. "other shore" or "far side"; metaphorical reference to transcendence; forms part of the perfection concept]
- ཏུ་ : to [Terminative case marker; indicates direction or purpose; connects to the verb "gone"]
- ཕྱིན་པ་ : perfection [Verbal noun from `ཕྱིན་པ་`: to go beyond, to perfect; completion of crossing over; together with ཕ་རོལ་ and ཏུ་ forms "pāramitā" or "perfection"]
- རྡོ་རྗེ་ : vajra [Noun; diamond, thunderbolt; symbolizes indestructibility and power; qualifies the cutting action as diamond-like or indestructible]
- གཅོད་པ་ : cutter [Verbal noun from `གཅོད་པ་`: to cut, sever; describes the text's function of cutting through ignorance and conceptual constructs]
- ཞེས་ : called [Quotative particle; connects the preceding name to the phrase "called"; functions as a relator in the semantic structure]
- བྱ་བ་ : named [Verbal noun from `བྱེད་པ་`: to do, to name; together with ཞེས་ forms the phrase "that which is called"; serves to connect the title to the classification]
- ཐེག་པ་ : vehicle [Noun; refers to a spiritual path or method; here specifying the tradition of Buddhism]
- ཆེན་པོའི་ : great [Adjective + genitive marker; `ཆེན་པོ་`: great, vast + `འི་`: genitive case; qualifies the vehicle as "Great" (Mahāyāna); functions as elaborator]
- མདོ། : sutra [Noun; Buddhist scripture containing teachings attributed to the Buddha; the main text type being identified; functions as the patient participant in the semantic structure]

ucca_formatted:
སངས་རྒྱས་དང་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཐམས་ཅད་ལ་ཕྱག་འཚལ་ལོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire homage statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [I] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit first person agent performing the homage" | Implicit: "Implicit first person agent performing the homage"]
    ├── ཕྱག་འཚལ་ལོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of paying homage" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སངས་རྒྱས་དང་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཐམས་ཅད་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Recipients of the homage" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སངས་རྒྱས [Type: Center | Desc: "First core entity in the recipient phrase" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction linking the two recipients" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ [Type: Center | Desc: "Second core entity in the recipient phrase" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Quantifier modifying the recipients" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ལ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Dative case marker indicating the recipients" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ། [Type: Punctuation | Desc: "Tibetan sentence-ending punctuation mark (shad)" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Noun; literally "awakened one" or "one who has removed (སངས་) and realized (རྒྱས་)"; refers to a fully enlightened being; functions as one of the main recipients of homage]
- དང་ : and [Conjunction; connects the two recipients of homage; links Buddhas with Bodhisattvas as equal objects of veneration]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : Bodhisattvas [Compound noun; བྱང་ཆུབ་ (awakening/enlightenment) + སེམས་དཔའ་ (heroic mind/being); refers to beings who seek awakening for the benefit of all; functions as the second main recipient of homage]
- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Universal quantifier; modifies both སངས་རྒྱས་ and བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་; emphasizes the comprehensive nature of the homage to include all awakened beings without exception]
- ལ་ : to [Dative case marker; indicates the direction/recipient of the homage; marks the preceding noun phrase as the indirect object]
- ཕྱག་འཚལ་ལོ་ : I prostrate/pay homage [Verb phrase; ཕྱག་འཚལ་ (prostrate/pay homage) + ལོ་ (final particle indicating statement/declaration); first-person present tense; the main action of the sentence performed by an implicit "I" as the agent]
- ། : [Tibetan punctuation mark (shad); indicates end of sentence or verse; equivalent to a period in English]

ucca_formatted:
འདི་སྐད་བདག་གིས་ཐོས་པ་དུས་གཅིག་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene of the opening formula" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བདག་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker/narrator who heard the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [establishing credibility through direct testimony] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Indicates that 'I' refers to direct personal testimony, not secondhand information, establishing the credibility of transmission" | Implicit: "direct personal testimony"]
    ├── ཐོས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of hearing the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་སྐད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The content that was heard" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [refers to the teachings that follow] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Indicates that 'thus' refers to the content that follows in the text" | Implicit: "referring to following content"]
    └── དུས་གཅིག་ན [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Temporal adverbial indicating when the hearing occurred" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གཅིག [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Specifies the quantity of 'time'" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [indicating the rarity of hearing such teachings] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Indicates that 'at one time' suggests the rarity and preciousness of hearing such teachings, which aren't available at all times" | Implicit: "rare opportunity"]
glossary:
- འདི་སྐད་ : thus [Demonstrative + `སྐད་`: words, speech; here referring specifically to the teaching that follows in the text; functions as Patient in the sentence, indicating the content that was heard]
- བདག་གིས་ : I [Ergative of `བདག་`: I, self; the first-person narrator establishing credibility through direct testimony; functions as Agent who performs the hearing]
- ཐོས་པ་ : heard [Perfect form of `ཐོས་`: to hear; the main process of the sentence indicating direct reception of the teaching; establishes transmission lineage]
- དུས་ : time [Noun `དུས་`: time, occasion; part of a temporal adverbial phrase]
- གཅིག་ : one [Numeral modifying `དུས་`; indicates a specific, singular occasion; implies the rarity and preciousness of the opportunity to hear these teachings]
- ན། : at [Locative particle marking time; completes the temporal adverbial phrase "at one time"; sets the temporal frame for the entire narrative that follows]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མཉན་ཡོད་ན་རྒྱལ་བུ་རྒྱལ་བྱེད་ཀྱི་ཚལ་མགོན་མེད་ཟས་སྦྱིན་གྱི་ཀུན་དགའ་ར་བ་ན། དགེ་སློང་སྟོང་ཉིས་བརྒྱ་ལྔ་བཅུའི་དགེ་སློང་གི་དགེ་འདུན་ཆེན་པོ་དང༌། བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་རབ་ཏུ་མང་པོ་དག་དང་ཐབས་གཅིག་ཏུ་བཞུགས་སོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node representing the entire text with parallel scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མཉན་ཡོད་ན་རྒྱལ་བུ་རྒྱལ་བྱེད་ཀྱི་ཚལ་མགོན་མེད་ཟས་སྦྱིན་གྱི་ཀུན་དགའ་ར་བ་ན [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing the Buddha's location" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The main agent of the first scene - the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཞུགས [Type: Process | Desc: "Implicit process of the first scene - the Buddha residing/dwelling" | Implicit: "Implied verb of residing"]
        └── མཉན་ཡོད་ན་རྒྱལ་བུ་རྒྱལ་བྱེད་ཀྱི་ཚལ་མགོན་མེད་ཟས་སྦྱིན་གྱི་ཀུན་དགའ་ར་བ་ན [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "Location where the Buddha was residing" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མཉན་ཡོད་ན [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "The city where the Buddha was residing" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── མཉན་ཡོད [Type: Center | Desc: "The name of the city" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ན [Type: Center | Desc: "Locative particle indicating location" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རྒྱལ་བུ་རྒྱལ་བྱེད་ཀྱི་ཚལ [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "The grove owned by Prince Jeta" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── རྒྱལ་བུ་རྒྱལ་བྱེད [Type: Center | Desc: "The prince who owned the grove" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཀྱི [Type: Relator | Desc: "Possessive marker indicating ownership" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཚལ [Type: Center | Desc: "The grove itself" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མགོན་མེད་ཟས་སྦྱིན་གྱི་ཀུན་དགའ་ར་བ [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "The park owned by Anathapindada within the grove" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དགེ་སློང་སྟོང་ཉིས་བརྒྱ་ལྔ་བཅུའི་དགེ་སློང་གི་དགེ་འདུན་ཆེན་པོ་དང༌། བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་རབ་ཏུ་མང་པོ་དག་དང་ཐབས་གཅིག་ཏུ་བཞུགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene describing the Buddha's companions" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The main agent of the second scene - the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཞུགས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The explicit process of the second scene - dwelling/residing" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དགེ་སློང་གི་དགེ་འདུན་ཆེན་པོ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The monastic assembly that accompanied the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དགེ་སློང་སྟོང་ཉིས་བརྒྱ་ལྔ་བཅུའི་དགེ་སློང [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration specifying the number of monks" | Implicit: ""]
                └── སྟོང་ཉིས་བརྒྱ་ལྔ་བཅུའི [Type: Quantity | Desc: "The number of monks in the assembly" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཆེན་པོ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborator describing the magnitude of the assembly" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་རབ་ཏུ་མང་པོ་དག [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The bodhisattvas that accompanied the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborator describing the magnitude of the bodhisattvas" | Implicit: ""]
                └── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ [Type: Center | Desc: "The bodhisattvas themselves" | Implicit: ""]
            └── རབ་ཏུ་མང་པོ་དག [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Quantity describing the number of bodhisattvas" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཐབས་གཅིག་ཏུ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relator connecting the Buddha with his companions" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Nominative of `བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་`: epithet of the Buddha; one who has conquered (བཅོམ་) defilements, possesses (ལྡན་) qualities, and has transcended (འདས་) suffering; functions as the main Agent in both scenes]

- མཉན་ཡོད་ : Śrāvastī [Proper noun: name of an ancient city in northern India; a major location where Buddha taught; serves as the primary geographical setting]

- ན་ : in [Locative particle indicating location; connects the Buddha to the specific place where he was residing]

- རྒྱལ་བུ་ : Prince [Nominative of `རྒྱལ་བུ་`: son of a king; refers to a specific historical figure]

- རྒྱལ་བྱེད་ : Jeta [Proper noun: name of the prince who owned the grove; forms compound with previous term as "Prince Jeta"]

- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle indicating possession; shows that the grove belonged to Prince Jeta]

- ཚལ་ : Grove [Nominative of `ཚལ་`: garden or grove; refers to the wooded area that contained the park]

- མགོན་མེད་ : Anātha [Proper noun: literally "without protector"; first part of Anāthapindada's name; describes his generosity to those without protection]

- ཟས་སྦྱིན་ : Pindada [Proper noun: literally "food giver"; second part of the name; refers to the wealthy merchant who donated the park]

- གྱི་ : of [Genitive particle indicating possession; shows that the park belonged to Anāthapindada]

- ཀུན་དགའ་ར་བ་ : pleasure garden [Nominative of `ཀུན་དགའ་ར་བ་`: park or monastic compound; literally "enclosure of complete joy"; the specific location where the teaching took place]

- ན : in [Locative particle indicating location; marks the end of the complex locative phrase]

- དགེ་སློང་ : monks [Nominative of `དགེ་སློང་`: fully ordained Buddhist monks; refers to the Buddha's monastic followers]

- སྟོང་ཉིས་བརྒྱ་ལྔ་བཅུའི་ : one thousand two hundred and fifty [Genitive numeral: 1,250; specifies the exact number of monks present; functions as a Quantity modifier]

- དགེ་སློང་གི་ : of monks [Genitive of `དགེ་སློང་`: fully ordained Buddhist monks; connects the specific number to the assembly]

- དགེ་འདུན་ : sangha [Nominative of `དགེ་འདུན་`: monastic community or assembly; the ordained followers who practice the Buddha's teachings]

- ཆེན་པོ་ : great [Adjectival modifier: large or significant; emphasizes the importance of the monastic assembly; functions as an Elaborator]

- དང༌ : and [Conjunction: connects the monastic assembly with the bodhisattvas as co-Recipients in the scene]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattvas [Nominative of `བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་`: beings dedicated to achieving enlightenment for the benefit of all; advanced spiritual practitioners who accompanied the Buddha]

- སེམས་དཔའ་ : beings [Nominative of `སེམས་དཔའ་`: courageous beings; emphasizes the nature of the bodhisattvas]

- ཆེན་པོ་ : great [Adjectival modifier: significant or advanced; qualifies the bodhisattvas as highly developed practitioners; functions as an Elaborator]

- རབ་ཏུ་ : very [Adverbial intensifier: extremely or thoroughly; intensifies the following quantity word]

- མང་པོ་ : many [Quantifier: numerous or abundant; indicates a large number of bodhisattvas were present; functions as a Quantity descriptor]

- དག་ : plural marker [Grammatical particle: indicates plurality; emphasizes that multiple bodhisattvas were present]

- དང་ : with [Conjunction: connects the Buddha to his accompaniments; indicates accompaniment]

- ཐབས་གཅིག་ཏུ་ : together [Adverbial phrase: literally "as one method"; indicates the Buddha was in the company of both groups simultaneously; functions as a Relator]

- བཞུགས་སོ : dwelled [Verb in past tense with final particle: honorific form of "to sit" or "to reside"; indicates that the Buddha was staying at this location with his followers; functions as the main Process of the scene]

- ། ། : end of text [Punctuation: double shad marking the conclusion of a section or text]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ནས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་སྔ་དྲོའི་དུས་ཀྱི་ཚེ། ཤམ་ཐབས་དང་ཆོས་གོས་སྐུ་ལ་གསོལ་ཏེ། ལྷུང་བཟེད་བསྣམས་ནས་མཉན་ཡོད་ཀྱི་གྲོང་ཁྱེར་ཆེན་པོར་བསོད་སྙོམས་ཀྱི་ཕྱིར་གཤེགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main event of the Buddha going for alms" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ནས [Type: Linker | Desc: "Temporal linker connecting to previous context" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the agent of all actions" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྔ་དྲོའི་དུས་ཀྱི་ཚེ། ཤམ་ཐབས་དང་ཆོས་གོས་སྐུ་ལ་གསོལ་ཏེ། ལྷུང་བཟེད་བསྣམས་ནས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Sequential preparations before the Buddha's main action of going for alms" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྔ་དྲོའི་དུས་ཀྱི་ཚེ [Type: Time | Desc: "Temporal setting for the Buddha's activities" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྔ་དྲོའི་དུས་ཀྱི་ཚེ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Specific time of day when the Buddha's activities took place" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཤམ་ཐབས་དང་ཆོས་གོས་སྐུ་ལ་གསོལ་ཏེ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First preparatory action - putting on robes" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཤམ་ཐབས་དང་ཆོས་གོས [Type: Participant-Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborative details of what the Buddha put on" | Implicit: ""]
                └── དང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector between the two types of robes" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྐུ་ལ [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "Location where the robes were placed" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གསོལ་ཏེ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of putting on the robes" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ལྷུང་བཟེད་བསྣམས་ནས [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second preparatory action - taking the alms bowl" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ལྷུང་བཟེད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object being carried by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བསྣམས་ནས [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of carrying/taking the alms bowl" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྔ་དྲོའི་དུས་ཀྱི་ཚེ [Type: Time | Desc: "Temporal setting for the Buddha's activities" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སྔ་དྲོའི་དུས་ཀྱི་ཚེ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Specific time of day when the Buddha's activities took place" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མཉན་ཡོད་ཀྱི་གྲོང་ཁྱེར་ཆེན་པོར་བསོད་སྙོམས་ཀྱི་ཕྱིར་གཤེགས་སོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main action of going to the city for alms" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མཉན་ཡོད་ཀྱི་གྲོང་ཁྱེར་ཆེན་པོར [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "Destination of the Buddha's movement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསོད་སྙོམས་ཀྱི་ཕྱིར [Type: Purpose | Desc: "Immediate purpose of going to the city - to collect alms" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གཤེགས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of going/proceeding to the city" | Implicit: ""]
    └── གདུལ་བྱའི་དོན་དུ [Type: Purpose | Desc: "Broader purpose of the Buddha's actions - to benefit disciples and others" | Implicit: "This is an implicit purpose not directly stated in the text but contextually understood from Buddhist teachings about why the Buddha collects alms"]
glossary:
- དེ་ནས : Then [Adverbial particle; temporal connector linking to previous context; functions as a scene linker in the narrative]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས : the Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; literally "the transcendent destroyer" (of afflictions); main agent of all actions in the passage]
- སྔ་དྲོའི་ : of the morning [Genitive of `སྔ་དྲོ`: morning; specifies the time period; functions as temporal setting]
- དུས་ : time [Noun: period, moment; forms temporal phrase with previous word]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle connecting `དུས་` with `ཚེ`; shows possessive relationship]
- ཚེ། : at that time [Temporal noun indicating when an action takes place; marks the temporal setting of the Buddha's activities]
- ཤམ་ཐབས་ : lower robe [Noun: the monastic lower garment; one of the three robes of a Buddhist monk; patient/object in the dressing scene]
- དང་ : and [Conjunction: links the two types of robes being put on]
- ཆོས་གོས་ : dharma robe [Noun: the upper monastic garment; religious clothing worn by Buddhist monastics; second patient/object in the dressing scene]
- སྐུ་ : body [Honorific noun for the Buddha's body; location where robes were placed; functions as a location participant]
- ལ་ : on [Locative particle indicating placement on the Buddha's body]
- གསོལ་ : put on [Verb: honorific for "to wear, put on"; process of dressing in the robes]
- ཏེ། : having [Connective particle marking completed action before proceeding to next action]
- ལྷུང་བཟེད་ : alms bowl [Noun: the bowl used by monastics for collecting donated food; patient/object being carried]
- བསྣམས་ : carried [Verb: honorific for "to carry, hold"; process of taking the alms bowl]
- ནས་ : having [Connective particle indicating the sequence of actions; marks completion of preparatory activities]
- མཉན་ཡོད་ : Śrāvastī [Proper noun: name of an ancient Indian city; location of the narrative]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle connecting city name with "great city"]
- གྲོང་ཁྱེར་ : city [Noun: urban settlement; part of the destination compound]
- ཆེན་པོར་ : great, to the great [Adjectival noun with terminative particle; qualifies the city and indicates destination; functions as goal participant]
- བསོད་སྙོམས་ : alms [Noun: food offerings collected by monastics; object of the Buddha's journey]
- ཀྱི་ : for [Genitive particle used here to indicate purpose]
- ཕྱིར་ : for the sake of [Purposive noun: indicates the immediate purpose of the Buddha's journey; functions as purpose marker]
- གཤེགས་སོ : proceeded [Verb (honorific) with final particle: honorific for "to go"; main process of the narrative; completes the main action of the passage]
- ། : [Sentence-ending marker]

དེ་ནས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མཉན་ཡོད་ཀྱི་གྲོང་ཁྱེར་ཆེན་པོར་བསོད་སྙོམས་ཀྱི་ཕྱིར་གཤེགས་ནས་ཞལ་ཟས་གསོལ་ཏེ་ཟས་ཀྱི་བྱ་བ་མཛད་དེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing the Buddha's activities" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ནས [Type: Linker | Desc: "Temporal connector indicating sequence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as agent of all described actions" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མཉན་ཡོད་ཀྱི་གྲོང་ཁྱེར་ཆེན་པོར [Type: Setting-Location | Desc: "Setting for the scene rather than a participant" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བསོད་སྙོམས་ཀྱི་ཕྱིར [Type: Purpose | Desc: "Purpose of Buddha's journey into the city" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གཤེགས་ནས [Type: Process | Desc: "First action in sequence - going for alms" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གཤེགས [Type: Center | Desc: "Core of the process of going" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- དེ་ནས། : Then [Temporal adverb, lit. "from that"; indicates sequential action; functions as a Linker connecting this scene to prior events]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས། : the Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); primary Agent of all actions in this passage]

- མཉན་ཡོད་ཀྱི། : of Śrāvastī [Genitive case of `མཉན་ཡོད་` (Sanskrit: Śrāvastī); ancient Indian city; marks ownership/location]

- གྲོང་ཁྱེར། : city [Noun, urban settlement larger than a town; part of compound phrase describing location]

- ཆེན་པོར། : to the great [Terminative case of `ཆེན་པོ་` (great, large); indicates movement toward; completes the location Setting]

- བསོད་སྙོམས་ཀྱི། : for alms [Genitive case of `བསོད་སྙོམས་` (alms, food offerings); indicates purpose]

- ཕྱིར། : in order to [Purposive particle; completes purpose clause; shows intent behind Buddha's journey]

- གཤེགས་ནས། : having gone [Perfective of honorific verb `གཤེགས་` (to go, proceed); indicates completed action with continuing effects; serves as main Process of first sequence]

- ཞལ་ཟས། : food [Honorific term for food, lit. "face food"; functions as Patient in the consumption process]

- གསོལ་ཏེ། : having eaten [Gerundial form of honorific verb `གསོལ་བ་` (to eat, consume); connects to subsequent action]

- ཟས་ཀྱི། : of the meal [Genitive case of `ཟས་` (food, meal); indicates relationship to following activities]

- བྱ་བ། : activities [Noun from verb `བྱེད་པ་` (to do); refers to post-meal rituals or practices]

- མཛད་དེ། : performed [Perfective of honorific verb `མཛད་པ་` (to do, perform); indicates completion of the meal-related activities]

- ། : [Sentence-final punctuation mark, equivalent to period]

        └── ལྷགས་ནས [Type: Process | Desc: "Second action in the sequence following the first" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ག་ལ་བ་དེར [Type: Adverbial-Location | Desc: "Directional adverbial indicating the location being approached" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ག་ལ་བ [Type: Adverbial-Location | Desc: "Descriptive location phrase referring to where the Buddha was" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- དེ་ནས་ : then, after that [Temporal adverbial; indicates sequence of events; serves as a discourse marker connecting previous events to the next scene where monks approach the Buddha]

- དགེ་སློང་ : monks [Noun; from Sanskrit 'bhikṣu'; ordained male Buddhist monastic practitioners; functions as the main agent in this scene]

- མང་པོས་ : many [Ergative case of `མང་པོ་`: many, numerous; indicates that the many monks are performing the action; marks the agent role in the sentence]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; literally "the one who has conquered (māra/defilements) and possesses (qualities)"; functions as the destination or patient being approached]

- ག་ལ་བ་ : wherever [Interrogative locative that functions as a relative clause marker; indicates the location where the Buddha was staying; establishes the spatial reference point]

- དེར་ : there, to that place [Terminative/allative case of `དེ་`: that; indicates the direction or destination of movement; completes the location phrase "to wherever he was"]

- དོང་སྟེ་ : went [Past tense of `འགྲོ་བ་`: to go; with connective particle `སྟེ་` indicating sequential action; the first stage of the monks' approach to the Buddha]

- ལྷགས་ནས་ : having arrived [Perfect/past tense of `ལྷགས་པ་`: to arrive, come; with the connective particle `ནས་` indicating completed action; the culmination of the monks' movement toward the Buddha]

glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Bhagavan [Honorific epithet for the Buddha; literally "the Blessed One"; the one who has conquered (བཅོམ) defilements, possesses (ལྡན) qualities, and has gone beyond (འདས) samsara; functions as the object of reverence in this scene]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle connecting བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ to ཞབས་; indicates possession or relationship; marks the recipient of the prostration]
- ཞབས་ : feet [Honorific term for 'feet'; from root ཞབས་ meaning 'foot, leg'; refers to the Buddha's feet as the location where homage is paid; functions as the spatial endpoint of the prostration]
- ལ་ : to, at [Allative/locative case marker; indicates the direction or location of the prostration; marks the location where homage is paid]
- མགོ་བོས་ : with the head [Instrumental case of མགོ་བོ་ (head); indicates the body part used to perform the prostration; functions as the instrument used by the implied agent (monks)]
- ཕྱག་འཚལ་ : prostrated [Verb phrase meaning 'to prostrate, pay homage'; from ཕྱག་ (hand/respect) + འཚལ་ (to seek/offer); describes the act of showing reverence by touching one's head to another's feet; functions as the main process in the first clause]
- ཏེ་ : and then [Connective particle; links the prostration with the subsequent action of circumambulation; indicates sequential action]
- ལན་ : times [Noun meaning 'time, occasion, response'; here referring to the count of circumambulations; functions as part of a quantifier phrase]
- གསུམ་ : three [Number modifier; specifies the quantity of circumambulations performed; indicates the completeness of the ritual action]
- བསྐོར་བ་ : circumambulation [Nominalized verb from བསྐོར་ (to circle around); ritual action of walking clockwise around a sacred object or person; here describes a respectful walking around the Buddha]
- བྱས་ : performed [Past tense of བྱེད་ (to do); indicates the completion of the circumambulation; serves as the main verb of the second clause]
- ནས་ : and then, after [Connective particle indicating sequence; links the circumambulation with the subsequent action of sitting down]
- ཕྱོགས་ : side, direction [Noun meaning 'direction, region, side'; here refers to a specific position or place in relation to the Buddha]
- གཅིག་ : one [Number meaning 'one'; modifies ཕྱོགས་ to indicate a single location where the monks gathered; emphasizes unity]
- ཏུ་ : in, at [Terminal particle indicating location; transforms ཕྱོགས་གཅིག་ into an adverbial phrase indicating where the sitting took place]
- འཁོད་ : sat, were seated [Past tense of འཁོད་པ་ (to sit, to be positioned); describes the final action of the sequential ritual; indicates the monks taking their proper places]
- དོ། ། : [Sentence-final particle; indicates the completion of the statement and provides emphatic assertion; marks the conclusion of the entire action sequence]

    ├── འཁོར་དེ་ཉིད་དུ [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "Specific location where Subhuti was present; corresponds to 'तस्यामेव पर्षदि' in Sanskrit" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- ཡང་ : moreover [Connective particle; links this scene with what came before; functions as a discourse linker connecting with previous narrative]
- དེའི་ཚེ་ : at that time [Temporal adverbial; དེ་ + genitive འི་ + ཚེ་; indicates when the event occurred; sets the temporal framework for the scene]
- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : Venerable [Honorific title; literally "one endowed with life"; formal title used for elders or respected monastics; corresponds to Sanskrit आयुष्मान्]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; one of Buddha's chief disciples known for understanding emptiness; the main agent in this scene; corresponds to Sanskrit सुभुति]
- འཁོར་ : assembly [Noun; gathering of disciples; refers to Buddha's audience]
- དེ་ཉིད་དུ་ : in that very [Emphatic locative; དེ་ཉིད་ + locative དུ་; specifies the exact location; corresponds to Sanskrit तस्यामेव]
- འདུས་པར་ : was present [Verbal noun; from འདུ་བ་ "to gather, assemble"; with terminative པར་; general statement of presence]
- གྱུར་ཏེ་ : having become [Auxiliary verb; འགྱུར་བ་ in past tense + connective ཏེ་; indicates transformation or completion of state]
- འདུག་གོ་ : was seated [Final verb; from འདུག་པ་ "to sit, remain"; with final particle གོ་; specifically refers to sitting posture as a more specific elaboration of presence]

glossary:
- དེ་ནས་ : then [Adverbial connective linking to previous context; functions as a temporal linker in the narrative sequence]
- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : venerable [Honorific title literally meaning "endowed with life"; indicates respect for an elder monastic; functions as part of the agent descriptor]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of a chief disciple of the Buddha; the main agent performing the actions in this passage]
- སྟན་ལས་ : from his seat [Ablative case of `སྟན་`: seat, cushion; indicates starting position; functions as the source location]
- ལངས་ : rose [Past tense of `ལང་`: to rise, stand up; main action initiating the sequence]
- ཏེ་ : and then [Connective particle linking sequential actions; indicates that what follows happened after rising]
- བླ་གོས་ : upper robe [Religious garment worn by Buddhist monastics; object being arranged]
- ཕྲག་པ་ : shoulder [Body part where the robe is being arranged]
- གཅིག་ཏུ་ : over one [Terminative case indicating "to one side"; specifies the left shoulder as implied in UCCA]
- གཟར་ : draped [Past tense of `གཟར་བ་`: to drape, arrange cloth; describes arrangement of the robe]
- ནས་ : having [Continuative particle indicating the completion of the previous action before the next begins]
- པུས་མོ་ : knee [Body part being positioned]
- གཡས་པའི་ : right [Genitive form specifying which knee; modifies the following noun]
- ལྷ་ང་ : kneecap [Specific part of the knee being placed on the ground; UCCA implies this is paired with the left foot]
- ས་ལ་ : on the ground [Locative case indicating where the knee is placed]
- བཙུགས་ : placed [Past tense of `འཛུགས་པ་`: to place, set down; describes positioning of the knee]
- ཏེ། : and then [Sentence-final connective particle closing this action and linking to the next]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; object of respect and recipient of the gesture]
- ག་ལ་བ་ : wherever [Relative clause marker indicating location]
- དེར་ : there [Demonstrative indicating specific location where the Buddha was]
- ལོགས་སུ་ : facing toward [Directional marker indicating orientation of Subhuti's gesture]
- ཐལ་མོ་ : palms [Hands in specific ritual position]
- སྦྱར་བ་ : joined [Verbal noun from `སྦྱོར་བ་`: to join; describes the hand gesture of reverence]
- བཏུད་ : bowed [Past tense of `འདུད་པ་`: to bow; respectful gesture as implied in UCCA]
- ནས། : having [Sentence-final continuative particle indicating more action will follow]

                ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the agent performing the action" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་རྣམས་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The great Bodhisattvas as recipients" | Implicit: ""]

                └── to help Bodhisattvas reach the nature of phenomena (dharmatā) [Type: Implicit Participant-Purpose | Desc: "The purpose of the Buddha's beneficial actions" | Implicit: "The underlying purpose of the Buddha's beneficial actions toward the Bodhisattvas"]

                ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Tathagata as the agent" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་རྣམས་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The great Bodhisattvas as recipients" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title of the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་པ་`: conquered (the four demons), `ལྡན་པ་`: possesses (the six qualities), `འདས་པ་`: transcended (cyclic existence); functions as the primary Agent in the first scene]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathagata [Epithet of the Buddha; literally "Thus-Gone One"; one who has gone to/realized suchness (tathātā); another title indicating Buddha as Agent]

- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : Arhat [Literally "Foe-Destroyer"; one who has destroyed the foes of afflictions; epithet qualifying the Buddha's qualities]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : completely [Adverbial phrase indicating perfect or complete manner; modifies the following term]

- རྫོགས་པའི་ : perfected [Genitive of `རྫོགས་པ་`: to complete, perfect; indicates the Buddha has perfected all qualities]

- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [The Awakened One; `སངས་`: cleared away (all obscurations), `རྒྱས་`: developed (all positive qualities); completes the string of epithets identifying the Agent]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates that the Buddha is performing the action of benefiting]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : awakening/enlightenment [Sanskrit: bodhi; state of complete awakening; forms compound with following term]

- སེམས་དཔའ་ : hero of mind [Sanskrit: sattva; brave being committed to enlightenment; together with previous term forms "bodhisattva"]

- སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་ : great hero of mind [Mahāsattva; refers to highly realized bodhisattvas]

- རྣམས་ : plural marker [Indicates multiple bodhisattvas]

- ལ་ : to [Dative case marker; indicates bodhisattvas as Recipients of the Buddha's beneficial actions]

- ཕན་གདགས་པའི་ : of benefiting [Genitive of `ཕན་གདགས་པ་`: to benefit, help, assist; indicates the Process of Buddha's beneficial action]

- དམ་པ་ : excellent/supreme [Refers to the highest quality or sacred nature of the benefit]

- ཇི་སྙེད་པས་ : by as many as [Adverbial phrase indicating extent; `ཇི་སྙེད་`: as many as there are; `པས་`: instrumental case]

- ཕན་གདགས་པ་ : benefits/benefiting [Verbal noun of `ཕན་འདོགས་`: to help, benefit; the Process performed by the Buddha]

- དང༌ : and [Conjunction linking the two parallel scenes]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`; indicates Agent of the second action]

- ཡོངས་སུ་གཏད་པའི་ : of entrusting [Genitive of `ཡོངས་སུ་གཏད་པ་`: to entrust completely; the Process of Buddha's second action]

- དམ་པ་ : excellent/supreme [Refers to the sacred or supreme nature of what is entrusted]

- ཇི་སྙེད་པས་ : by as many as [Adverbial phrase indicating extent]

- ཡོངས་སུ་གཏད་པ་ : entrusting [Verbal noun of `ཡོངས་སུ་གཏོད་པ་`: to entrust completely; the Process performed by the Buddha]

- ནི་ : as for [Topic marker highlighting the preceding statements as the subject of amazement]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Vocative form addressing the Buddha directly]

- ངོ་མཚར་ : wondrous/amazing [From `ངོ་མཚར་བ་`: to be amazed; expresses the State of amazement]

- ལགས་སོ་ : is [Honorific form of the verb "to be" with final particle; expresses polite exclamation]

- བདེ་བར་གཤེགས་པ་ : Sugata [Literally "Well-Gone One"; another epithet of the Buddha; from `བདེ་བ་`: happiness/well and `གཤེགས་པ་`: gone]

        ├── ཇི་ལྟར་སྒྲུབ་པར་བགྱི། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Part 2 of the three-part question" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྒྲུབ་པར་བགྱི [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of practicing" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཇི་ལྟར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Question word for the second part" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཇི་ལྟར་སེམས་རབ་ཏུ་གཟུང་བར་བགྱི། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Part 3 of the three-part question" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གཟུང་བར་བགྱི [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of controlling" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཇི་ལྟར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Question word for the third part" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); addressee in the dialogue being directly addressed by the speaker]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Sanskrit: bodhi; refers to the awakened state of consciousness; here functions as first part of compound]

- སེམས་དཔའི་ : of the hero/being [Genitive of `སེམས་དཔའ་`: mind-hero/bodhisattva; one who seeks enlightenment; second part of the compound 'bodhisattva']

- ཐེག་པ་ : vehicle [Sanskrit: yāna; path or method of spiritual practice; here specifically referring to the bodhisattva path or Mahāyāna]

- ལ་ : in/into [Locative particle indicating location or direction; marks the bodhisattva vehicle as the destination into which one enters]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : correctly/properly [Adverbial form of `ཡང་དག་པ་`: authentic, genuine, correct; modifies the manner of entering the path; indicates complete and proper entry]

- ཞུགས་པས་ : having entered [Agentive/instrumental of `འཇུག་པ་` (to enter, engage in); indicates the completed action of entering the bodhisattva path; functions as a linker connecting the condition to the main question]

- ཇི་ལྟར་ : how [Interrogative adverb; question marker asking about manner or method; modifies the action of abiding]

- གནས་པར་ : to abide/dwell [Terminative of `གནས་པ་`: to abide, remain, dwell; refers to maintaining one's practice on the path; the process being questioned]

- བགྱི། : should I do [Honorific future/present form of `བྱེད་པ་` (to do); indicates respectful question directed to the Buddha; marks this as an honorific request for instruction]

glossary:
- ཇི་ལྟར་ : how [Interrogative adverb; functions as a question marker asking about the manner or method; serves as an Elaborator-interrogative in the semantic structure]

- བསྒྲུབ་པར་ : to accomplish/practice [Future/purposive form of the verb `སྒྲུབ་པ་`: to accomplish, establish, practice; here referring to the spiritual practice of the Perfection of Wisdom; forms the main Process component of the sentence]

- བགྱི། : should I do [Honorific future/voluntative form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do; expressing respectful inquiry about proper action; implies the first-person agent (I) who is asking about how to practice correctly]

    ├── སེམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The mind as the object being controlled" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་ཏུ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Intensifier that elaborates on the process of controlling the mind" | Implicit: ""]

    └── [to prevent distraction and maintain meditation focus] [Type: Implicit Purpose | Desc: "The implicit purpose of mind control - to prevent distraction (རྣམ་པར་གཡེང་བ) and maintain concentration in meditation" | Implicit: "The purpose of mind control is implied from the Buddhist context"]
glossary:
- ཇི་ལྟར་ : how [Interrogative adverbial expressing manner/method; "in what way"; functions as an adverbial modifier querying the manner of the action]
- སེམས་ : mind [Noun in its unmarked form; the object or patient of the action; refers to consciousness or mental continuum that must be controlled in meditation]
- རབ་ཏུ་ : thoroughly [Adverbial intensifier; from `རབ་` (excellent, supreme) + terminative particle `ཏུ་`; emphasizes the completeness or intensity of the action]
- གཟུང་བར་ : to restrain [Verbal noun (nominalized future of `འཛིན་པ་`: to hold/grasp) + terminative/purposive particle `བར་`; indicates the purpose "in order to restrain"]
- བགྱི། : should (I) do [Future/present form of honorific verb `བགྱིད་པ་` (to do); first-person interrogative form here asking how one should perform the action; the implied agent is the practitioner/questioner]

    ├── [Venerable Subhuti] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit speaker Venerable Subhuti who performed the action of speaking" | Implicit: "The speaker Venerable Subhuti who performed the action of speaking is not explicitly mentioned in the text"]
    ├── གསོལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The completed action of speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Adverbial modifier specifying how something was spoken" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དང་ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Temporal connector indicating this action sets the stage for what follows" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་སྐད་ : thus [Demonstrative pronoun 'དེ' (that) + 'སྐད' (speech, words); refers to the speech that was previously spoken; functions as adverbial modifier specifying the manner of speech]
- ཅེས་ : saying [Quotative particle; marks the end of quoted speech; connects the quote to the verb of speaking]
- གསོལ་པ་ : requested/spoke [Perfect form of honorific verb 'གསོལ་བ': to request, speak, beseech; indicates respectful speech directed to someone of higher status; the main process/action in this scene]
- དང་ : and then [Temporal connector/linker; indicates that this action sets the stage for what follows in the narrative; functions as a transition between scenes]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of the Buddha speaking to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who is speaking (the Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [implicit qualities] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration on the Buddha's unique status and awakened qualities" | Implicit: "Buddha's unique status and awakened qualities"]
    ├── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient of the speech (Subhuti)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial describing the manner of speech" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of speaking" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [implicit content] [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implicit content of what was actually said (approval/praise)" | Implicit: "The content of what was actually said"]
    └──  [Type: Ground | Desc: "Ground element connecting the scene to the conventional punctuation" | Implicit: "Connection to conventional punctuation"]
        └── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Tibetan sentence-ending punctuation" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Bhagavan [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to one who has conquered afflictions, possesses all qualities, and transcended samsara; functions as the Agent in the sentence]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker indicating the doer of the action; marks Buddha as the Agent who performs the action of speaking]

- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : Venerable [Honorific address; literally "endowed with life"; traditional form of address for monks; compound of `ཚེ་` (life), `དང་` (and), `ལྡན་པ་` (possessing); serves as an honorific attribute of the Recipient]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of one of Buddha's chief disciples; Sanskrit name transliterated into Tibetan; functions as the Recipient of the speech]

- ལ་ : to [Dative case marker indicating the recipient; marks Subhuti as the one to whom the speech is directed]

- འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་ : thus [Adverbial marker introducing direct speech; compound of `འདི་` (this), `སྐད་` (speech/words), and `ཅེས་` (quotative marker); indicates the manner in which something was said]

- བཀའ་ : speech [Honorific term for the words or teachings of the Buddha; specifically refers to authoritative pronouncements]

- སྩལ་ : proclaimed [Honorific verb meaning "to give/bestow/proclaim"; past tense form indicating the Buddha gave teachings; functions as the main Process in the sentence]

- ཏོ : [Final verb particle marking the end of a statement; indicates completion of the action; combines with the preceding syllable to form the complete verb phrase]

- ། : [Tibetan shad punctuation mark indicating the end of a sentence or clause]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་ལེགས་སོ་ལེགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing Buddha's praise to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Addressee | Desc: "The recipient of the praise (Subhuti)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལེགས་སོ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "First instance of praise or approval" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལེགས་སོ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Second instance of praise or approval (repetition for emphasis)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Buddha] [Type: Participant | Desc: "Implicit speaker (Buddha) who is giving the praise" | Implicit: "The speaker giving praise is implied to be Buddha"]
    └── ལེགས་སོ་ལེགས་སོ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central expression of approval in this utterance" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལེགས་སོ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "First instance of praise or approval" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ལེགས་སོ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Second instance of praise or approval (repetition for emphasis)" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར། : Subhuti [Vocative form; proper name of one of Buddha's chief disciples; functions as the Addressee of Buddha's praise]
- ལེགས་སོ། : excellent! [Exclamatory form of `ལེགས་པ་`: good, excellent; first instance of praise; used by Buddha to express strong approval]
- ལེགས་སོ། : excellent indeed! [Exclamatory form of `ལེགས་པ་`: good, excellent; second instance for emphasis; repetition intensifies the praise and indicates special approval]
- ། : [Sentence-ending shad punctuation mark]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ནོ། །དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ཏེ། [Type: Discourse | Desc: "Dialogue between Subhuti and Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ནོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Person being addressed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The matter being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་བཞིན་ནོ། ། [Type: Adverbial-Affirmation | Desc: "Affirmative statement" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Response statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [Buddha] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha who is responding" | Implicit: "Buddha who is responding"]
        ├── དེ་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The matter being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་བཞིན་ཏེ། [Type: Adverbial-Affirmation | Desc: "Affirmative response" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper noun; name of one of Buddha's chief disciples; addressed as the recipient of Buddha's teaching; functions as Addressee in the dialogue structure]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the previously discussed matter or teaching; serves as Patient/topic of discussion in both statements]
- དེ་བཞིན་ : is just so [Adverbial phrase from `དེ་` (that) + `བཞིན་` (like, in the manner of); indicates affirmation or agreement with something previously stated; functions as the main predicate]
- ནོ། ། : [Final particle marking the end of a declarative statement with emphasis; indicates Subhuti's definitive agreement]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun in the second statement; refers to the same matter being discussed; serves as Patient/topic in Buddha's response]
- དེ་བཞིན་ : is just so [Adverbial phrase expressing agreement; Buddha's confirmation of Subhuti's statement; functions as the main predicate in the response]
- ཏེ། : [Final particle indicating the Buddha's affirmative response continues or has explanatory material following; softer than the definitive "ནོ།" used by Subhuti]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་རྣམས་ལ་ཕན་གདགས་པའི་དམ་པས་ཕན་གདགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene depicting the Tathagata's action of benefiting bodhisattvas" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent performing the action of benefiting" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཕན་གདགས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of providing benefit" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་རྣམས་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipients of the benefit" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཕན་གདགས་པའི་དམ་པས [Type: Manner | Desc: "Describes the quality or manner of the benefit provided" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཕན་གདགས་པའི [Type: Center | Desc: "The core concept of benefit being described" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དམ་པས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Qualifies the benefit as being of supreme or excellent quality" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [six supreme qualities] [Type: Implicit | Desc: "Implicit elaboration of the 'supreme' aspect" | Implicit: "Referring to the six qualities (time, distinction, greatness, stability, pervasiveness, and logic) that make this benefit supreme"]
        └── with [Type: Relator | Desc: "Implicit relator connecting the manner of benefit to the main process" | Implicit: "Implicit relator connecting the manner of benefit to the main process"]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : The Tathagata [Ergative/Agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Thus-Gone One, Buddha; functioning as the main Agent who performs the action of benefiting; literally "one who has gone in such a way"]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Noun: awakening, bodhi; first part of the compound `བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་`; refers to the state of complete awakening]

- སེམས་དཔའ་ : hero [Noun: mind-hero, courageous one; second part of the compound `བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་`; one who strives for enlightenment]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [Compound noun: being who aspires to enlightenment; functioning as part of the Recipient of the benefit]

- སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་ : great hero [Compound noun: great courageous one; qualifier for `བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་`; indicates the advanced spiritual status of these bodhisattvas]

- རྣམས་ : plural marker [Grammatical particle: indicates plurality; makes clear that multiple bodhisattvas are being referred to]

- ལ་ : to [Dative/Locative particle: indicates the recipient; marks `བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་རྣམས་` as the Recipients of the benefit]

- ཕན་གདགས་པའི་ : of benefiting [Genitive form of `ཕན་གདགས་པ་`: to benefit, help; referring to the act of providing benefit; center of the Manner descriptor]

- དམ་པས་ : through supreme means [Instrumental of `དམ་པ་`: supreme, excellent, holy; indicates the superior quality of the benefit being conferred; implicitly refers to six supreme qualities (time, distinction, greatness, stability, pervasiveness, and logic)]

- ཕན་གདགས་སོ། ། : benefits [Verb `ཕན་གདགས་` (to benefit) + final particle `སོ` marking statement completion; main Process of the sentence; the action performed by the Tathagata]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་རྣམས་ལ་ཡོངས་སུ་གཏད་པའི་དམ་པས་ཡོངས་སུ་གཏད་དོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of the Tathagata entrusting something to the Bodhisattvas" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who is doing the entrusting (the Tathagata/Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་རྣམས་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipients of the entrusting (the Bodhisattva Mahasattvas)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [who will help mature beings that are not yet matured] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit elaboration of the Bodhisattvas' role in maturing beings" | Implicit: "Implicit elaboration of the Bodhisattvas' role in maturing beings"]
    ├── ཡོངས་སུ་གཏད་དོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of entrusting" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [for benefiting beings and ensuring the continuity of the teachings] [Type: Purpose | Desc: "The purpose of the entrusting action - to benefit beings and ensure continuity of Dharma" | Implicit: "The purpose of the entrusting action - to benefit beings and ensure continuity of Dharma"]
    ├── ཡོངས་སུ་གཏད་པའི་དམ་པས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The manner or quality of the entrusting action, indicating it was supreme or excellent" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [the Dharma teachings] [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implicit object being entrusted - the Dharma teachings" | Implicit: "The implicit object being entrusted - the Dharma teachings"]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : The Tathagata [Ergative/Instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "the Thus-Gone One", epithet of Buddha; functions as the Agent who performs the entrusting action; indicates active agency in the transmission process]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattvas [Nominative form of `བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་`: beings committed to attaining enlightenment for the benefit of all sentient beings; recipients of the entrusted teachings; identified in UCCA as Recipient participants]

- སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་ : great beings [Appellation of `སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་`: "mahasattva", qualifier indicating advanced bodhisattvas of high spiritual attainment; further specification of the recipients]

- རྣམས་ལ་ : to them [Plural marker + Dative case marker; indicates the direction of the entrusting action toward multiple recipients; completes the recipient phrase]

- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely [Adverbial modifier from `ཡོངས་སུ་`: "thoroughly, completely"; intensifies the action of entrusting; indicates the comprehensive nature of the transmission]

- གཏད་པའི་ : of entrusting [Genitive form of the verb `གཏད་པ་`: "to entrust, hand over"; forms a nominal phrase with the following term; refers to the act of transmission]

- དམ་པས་ : through the supreme [Instrumental case of `དམ་པ་`: "supreme, excellent, holy"; indicates the quality or manner of the entrusting; elaborates on how the transmission was conducted]

- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely [Repetition of the adverbial modifier; reinforces the thoroughness of the action]

- གཏད་དོ : entrusted [Past tense of the verb `གཏད་པ་` + final particle `དོ`; the main Process of the sentence; indicates the completed action of transmission]

- །། : [Sentence-final punctuation marking the end of the statement]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་དེའི་ཕྱིར་ཉོན་ལ་ལེགས་པར་རབ་ཏུ་ཡིད་ལ་ཟུངས་ཤིག་དང༌ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the instruction to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The addressee of the instruction" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེའི་ཕྱིར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Causal adverbial providing reason for the instruction" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཉོན [Type: Process | Desc: "First imperative verb instructing to listen" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལེགས་པར་རབ་ཏུ་ཡིད་ལ་ཟུངས་ཤིག [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second imperative instruction about holding in mind" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལེགས་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial modifying how to hold in mind" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་ཏུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Intensifying adverbial modifying how to hold in mind" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཡིད་ལ [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "Mental location where the content should be held" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཟུངས་ཤིག [Type: Process | Desc: "Second imperative verb instructing to hold in mind" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Discourse connector indicating continuation" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར། : Subhuti [Vocative form of the name of the Buddha's disciple; used here as direct address to the recipient of the instruction]
- དེའི་ཕྱིར། : therefore [Compound of དེ་ + འི་ + ཕྱིར; genitive + purposive particle; functions as a causal adverbial providing the rationale for the following instructions]
- ཉོན། : listen [Imperative form of ཉན་པ་: to listen, hear; first imperative verb directed at Subhuti, commanding attention]
- ལ། : and [Connective particle joining the two imperative verbs; marks transition between related instructions]
- ལེགས་པར། : well/properly [Adverbial form of ལེགས་པ་: good, excellent; modifies how the instruction should be followed; indicates thoroughness and care]
- རབ་ཏུ། : thoroughly/completely [Intensifying adverbial; from རབ་: supreme, excellent + ཏུ་: adverbial particle; reinforces the intensity of the mental action required]
- ཡིད་ལ། : in mind [Locative form of ཡིད་: mind + ལ་: locative particle; specifies the mental location where the teaching should be retained]
- ཟུངས་ཤིག : hold [Imperative form of འཛིན་པ་: to hold, grasp + ཤིག: imperative particle; second imperative verb instructing to retain the teaching mentally]
- དང༌། : and [Conjunction particle indicating that more instruction will follow; signals continuation of discourse]

ucca_formatted:
བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་བཞུགས་པས་ཇི་ལྟར་གནས་པར་བྱ་བ་དང༌། ཇི་ལྟར་བསྒྲུབ་པར་བྱ་བ་དང༌།  ཇི་ལྟར་སེམས་རབ་ཏུ་གཟུང་བར་བྱ་བ་ངས་ཁྱོད་ལ་བཤད་དོ། ། [Type: ParallelScenes | Desc: "Root node containing the entire passage" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་བཞུགས་པས་ཇི་ལྟར་གནས་པར་བྱ་བ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing how to abide in the bodhisattva vehicle" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "Location where one dwells (the bodhisattva vehicle)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཡང་དག་པར་བཞུགས་པས [Type: State | Desc: "State of properly dwelling in the vehicle" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཇི་ལྟར་གནས་པར་བྱ་བ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of abiding or remaining" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཇི་ལྟར་བསྒྲུབ་པར་བྱ་བ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene describing how to practice" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཇི་ལྟར་བསྒྲུབ་པར་བྱ་བ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of practicing or accomplishing" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཇི་ལྟར་སེམས་རབ་ཏུ་གཟུང་བར་བྱ་བ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Third scene describing how to maintain the mind" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Patient participant (mind) that is maintained" | Implicit: ""]
        └── རབ་ཏུ་གཟུང་བར་བྱ་བ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of fully maintaining or holding" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དང༌། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector linking the different scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ངས་ཁྱོད་ལ་བཤད་དོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Final scene describing the act of explanation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ངས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Agent participant who explains" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཁྱོད་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Recipient participant who receives the explanation" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བཤད་དོ། ། [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of explaining" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : awakening [Sanskrit: bodhi; the state of complete enlightenment; functions as part of a compound modifier in the first scene]
- སེམས་དཔའི་ : of the hero/warrior [Genitive of `སེམས་དཔའ་`: hero of awakening, bodhisattva; functions as part of the compound modifier specifying the type of vehicle]
- ཐེག་པ་ : vehicle [Sanskrit: yāna; a spiritual path or method; functions as the Participant-Location in the UCCA structure]
- ལ་ : in, on [Locative particle marking the vehicle as the location where one dwells; connects the participant to the state]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : correctly, properly [Adverbial qualifier derived from `ཡང་དག་པ་`: correct, authentic; modifies how one dwells in the vehicle; part of the State component]
- བཞུགས་པས་ : by dwelling, through abiding [Instrumental/causal of `བཞུགས་པ་`: to dwell, abide, remain (honorific); functioning as a condition for what follows]
- ཇི་ལྟར་ : how [Interrogative adverb introducing the manner; marks the beginning of the Process component in the first scene]
- གནས་པར་ : to abide, to remain [Terminative of `གནས་པ་`: to abide, remain, dwell; the main verb of the first Process component]
- བྱ་བ་ : should be done [Nominalizer from `བྱེད་པ་`: to do; adds modal sense of obligation; completes the Process component]
- དང༌། : and [Conjunction linking the parallel scenes; functions as a Linker in the UCCA structure]
- ཇི་ལྟར་ : how [Interrogative adverb introducing the second scene; marks the beginning of the Process component]
- བསྒྲུབ་པར་ : to practice, to accomplish [Terminative of `སྒྲུབ་པ་`: to accomplish, practice, fulfill; the main verb of the second Process component]
- བྱ་བ་ : should be done [Nominalizer from `བྱེད་པ་`: to do; adds modal sense of obligation; completes the second Process component]
- དང༌། : and [Conjunction linking to the third scene; functions as a Linker in the UCCA structure]
- ཇི་ལྟར་ : how [Interrogative adverb introducing the third scene; marks how the mind should be maintained]
- སེམས་ : mind [Sanskrit: citta; the object that is maintained; functions as the Participant-Patient in the third scene]
- རབ་ཏུ་ : thoroughly, completely [Intensive adverb that modifies the following verb; indicates completeness of the action]
- གཟུང་བར་ : to hold, to maintain [Terminative of `འཛིན་པ་`: to hold, grasp, maintain; the main verb of the third Process component]
- བྱ་བ་ : should be done [Nominalizer from `བྱེད་པ་`: to do; adds modal sense of obligation; completes the third Process component]
- ངས་ : I, by me [Agentive of `ང་`: I, me; functions as the Agent participant in the final scene]
- ཁྱོད་ལ་ : to you [Dative of `ཁྱོད་`: you; functions as the Recipient participant in the final scene]
- བཤད་དོ། ། : will explain [Future tense of `འཆད་པ་`: to explain, teach; with final particle indicating completion; functions as the Process in the final scene]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ནོ། །ཞེས་གསོལ་ནས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root Scene" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The one being addressed" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ནོ [Type: Center-State | Desc: "The core content of what was stated" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཞེས་གསོལ་ནས། [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of speaking" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [Subhadra] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit speaker identified as Subhadra from context" | Implicit: "Subhadra is implied as the speaker from the context"]
        └── དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ནོ [Type: Center-State | Desc: "The core content of what was stated" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Vocative form; literally "one who has conquered and possesses [qualities]"; honorific title for the Buddha; functions as the Addressee of the statement]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; pointing to what was previously stated; part of the affirmative statement]

- དེ་བཞིན་ : just so [Adverbial phrase; literally "like that"; indicates agreement with a previous statement; forms the core content of what is being affirmed]

- ནོ་ : is [Final particle; marks the end of a declarative statement; adds emphasis to the affirmation]

- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative particle; marks the preceding words as a direct quotation; connects the quote to the verb]

- གསོལ་ : said [Past tense of honorific verb `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, to speak (honorifically); indicates respectful speech directed to the Buddha; functions as the main Process in the scene]

- ནས། : after [Connective particle; indicates sequential action; marks the completion of one action before another begins]

ucca_formatted:
ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱི་ལྟར་མཉན་པ་དང༌། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་འདས་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node representing the parallel scenes of Subhuti listening and Buddha speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱི་ལྟར་མཉན་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing Subhuti's listening action" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who performs the listening action" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མཉན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of listening performed by Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [attentively and correctly] [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Implicit attitude marker indicating attentive listening with proper understanding" | Implicit: "Implied manner of listening"]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱི་ལྟར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial expression indicating manner of listening - 'according to the Buddha's teaching'" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha, whose teaching Subhuti is listening to" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [first] [Type: Temporal | Desc: "Implicit temporal marker indicating this scene occurs before the second scene" | Implicit: "Implied temporal sequence"]
    ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction connecting the two scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene describing Buddha's speaking action" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who performs the speaking action" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of speaking performed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི་སྐད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Content of what was spoken by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཅེས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Quotative marker that introduces speech" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient of the Buddha's speech" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : Venerable [Honorific title; literally "one possessing life"; a respectful address for monastics; functions as part of the Agent in the first scene]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of a disciple of Buddha; one of the Buddha's chief disciples known for his understanding of emptiness; Agent who performs the listening in the first scene]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Bhagavan/Buddha [Honorific title for Buddha; literally "the blessed one who has conquered (defilements)" or "one who has transcended"; object of attention in the first scene]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle connecting Buddha and "according to"; indicates possession or relation; forms part of the Adverbial phrase]
- ལྟར་ : according to [Postposition indicating "in accordance with" or "as per"; indicates the manner of listening - Subhuti listened according to Buddha's teaching]
- མཉན་པ་ : listened [Past tense of `ཉན་` (to listen, hear); the main Process of the first scene; implies attentive and correct listening as indicated in the UCCA]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction; connects the two parallel scenes - Subhuti's listening and Buddha's speaking]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ : The Bhagavan/Buddha [Ergative form of `བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་`; marks Buddha as the Agent who performs the action of speaking in the second scene]
- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : Venerable [Honorific title; same as above; here functioning as part of the Recipient of Buddha's speech]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; same as above; Recipient of Buddha's speech in the second scene]
- ལ་ : to [Dative particle indicating the recipient; marks Subhuti as the one to whom Buddha speaks]
- འདི་སྐད་ : these words [Demonstrative (`འདི་` - "this") + `སྐད་` ("speech, words"); refers to the content of Buddha's teaching; Patient in the second scene]
- ཅེས་ : thus/quote [Quotative marker that introduces direct speech; elaborates on the content that follows]
- བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། : proclaimed [Honorific past tense verb for "to speak/say"; `བཀའ་` is honorific term for "word/speech" and `སྩལ་` means "to bestow"; `ཏོ` is the final particle; main Process of the second scene]
- ། : [Sentence-ending mark]

source: རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ལ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པས། འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་སེམས་ཅན་ཇི་ཙམ་སེམས་ཅན་དུ་བསྡུ་བས་བསྡུས་པ། སྒོ་ང་ལས་སྐྱེས་པའམ། མངལ་ལས་སྐྱེས་པའམ། དྲོད་གཤེར་ལས་སྐྱེས་པའམ། རྫུས་ཏེ་སྐྱེས་པའམ། གཟུགས་ཅན་ནམ། གཟུགས་ཅན་མ་ཡིན་པའམ། འདུ་ཤེས་ཅན་ནམ། འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་མིན་ནམ། སེམས་ཅན་གྱི་ཁམས་ཇི་ཙམ་སེམས་ཅན་དུ་གདགས་པའི་བརྟགས་པ་དེ་དག་ཐམས་ཅད་ཕུང་པོ་ལྷག་མ་མེད་པའི་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པའི་དབྱིངས་སུ་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདའོ། །
ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ལ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པས། འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་སེམས་ཅན་ཇི་ཙམ་སེམས་ཅན་དུ་བསྡུ་བས་བསྡུས་པ། སྒོ་ང་ལས་སྐྱེས་པའམ། མངལ་ལས་སྐྱེས་པའམ། དྲོད་གཤེར་ལས་སྐྱེས་པའམ། རྫུས་ཏེ་སྐྱེས་པའམ། གཟུགས་ཅན་ནམ། གཟུགས་ཅན་མ་ཡིན་པའམ། འདུ་ཤེས་ཅན་ནམ། འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་མིན་ནམ། སེམས་ཅན་གྱི་ཁམས་ཇི་ཙམ་སེམས་ཅན་དུ་གདགས་པའི་བརྟགས་པ་དེ་དག་ཐམས་ཅད་ཕུང་པོ་ལྷག་མ་མེད་པའི་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པའི་དབྱིངས་སུ་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire passage about Subhuti and the Bodhisattva's aspiration" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The addressee of the discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་ལ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པས [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the Bodhisattva's correct entry into the vehicle" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ [Type: Center | Desc: "The vehicle or path that is being entered" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པས [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of correctly entering or engaging with the Bodhisattva vehicle" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཡང་དག་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner adverbial modifying how one enters the vehicle" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་སེམས་ཅན་ཇི་ཙམ་སེམས་ཅན་དུ་བསྡུ་བས་བསྡུས་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Mental process scene describing the Bodhisattva's thought or aspiration" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Process | Desc: "The mental process of thinking or considering" | Implicit: ""]
