        └── སེམས་ཅན་ཇི་ཙམ་སེམས་ཅན་དུ་བསྡུ་བས་བསྡུས་པ། སྒོ་ང་ལས་སྐྱེས་པའམ། མངལ་ལས་སྐྱེས་པའམ། དྲོད་གཤེར་ལས་སྐྱེས་པའམ། རྫུས་ཏེ་སྐྱེས་པའམ། གཟུགས་ཅན་ནམ། གཟུགས་ཅན་མ་ཡིན་པའམ། འདུ་ཤེས་ཅན་ནམ། འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་མིན་ནམ། སེམས་ཅན་གྱི་ཁམས་ཇི་ཙམ་སེམས་ཅན་དུ་གདགས་པའི་བརྟགས་པ་དེ་དག [Type: Elaborator-Examples | Desc: "Elaboration providing examples and classifications of sentient beings based on birth type, form, and perception" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སེམས་ཅན་ཇི་ཙམ་སེམས་ཅན་དུ་བསྡུ་བས་བསྡུས་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "General statement about all sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── སེམས་ཅན་ཇི་ཙམ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The sentient beings who are the object of the Bodhisattva's aspiration" | Implicit: ""]
                └── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་བསྡུ་བས་བསྡུས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of being included or categorized as sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྒོ་ང་ལས་སྐྱེས་པའམ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First example of birth type classification - egg-born beings" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── སྒོ་ང་ལས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The source from which these beings are born" | Implicit: ""]
                └── སྐྱེས་པའམ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of being born" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མངལ་ལས་སྐྱེས་པའམ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second example of birth type classification - womb-born beings" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── མངལ་ལས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The source from which these beings are born" | Implicit: ""]
                └── སྐྱེས་པའམ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of being born" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དྲོད་གཤེར་ལས་སྐྱེས་པའམ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Third example of birth type classification - moisture-born beings" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── དྲོད་གཤེར་ལས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The source from which these beings are born" | Implicit: ""]
                └── སྐྱེས་པའམ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of being born" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རྫུས་ཏེ་སྐྱེས་པའམ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Fourth example of birth type classification - spontaneously or miraculously born beings" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── རྫུས་ཏེ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "The manner in which these beings are born" | Implicit: ""]
                └── སྐྱེས་པའམ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of being born" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གཟུགས་ཅན་ནམ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First example of form classification - beings with physical form" | Implicit: ""]
                └── གཟུགས་ཅན [Type: State | Desc: "The state of having form" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གཟུགས་ཅན་མ་ཡིན་པའམ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second example of form classification - formless beings" | Implicit: ""]
                └── གཟུགས་ཅན་མ་ཡིན་པ [Type: State | Desc: "The state of not having form" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འདུ་ཤེས་ཅན་ནམ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First example of perception classification - beings with perception" | Implicit: ""]
                └── འདུ་ཤེས་ཅན [Type: State | Desc: "The state of having perception" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་མིན་ནམ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second example of perception classification - beings with neither perception nor non-perception" | Implicit: ""]
                └── འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་མིན [Type: State | Desc: "The state of being without perception nor non-perception" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སེམས་ཅན་གྱི་ཁམས་ཇི་ཙམ་སེམས་ཅན་དུ་གདགས་པའི་བརྟགས་པ་དེ་དག [Type: Scene | Desc: "Summary statement about all types of sentient beings mentioned" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── སེམས་ཅན་གྱི་ཁམས་ཇི་ཙམ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The scope or extent of sentient beings in all realms" | Implicit: ""]
                └── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་གདགས་པའི་བརྟགས་པ་དེ་དག [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of being designated or categorized as sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཐམས་ཅད་ཕུང་པོ་ལྷག་མ་མེད་པའི་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པའི་དབྱིངས་སུ་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདའོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Final scene describing the purpose of the Bodhisattva's aspiration - to lead all beings to nirvana" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── I (the bodhisattva) [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implied agent (the Bodhisattva) who will lead beings to nirvana" | Implicit: "The implied agent (the Bodhisattva) who will lead beings to nirvana"]
        ├── ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "All the sentient beings previously enumerated" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of leading beings to complete nirvana" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཡོངས་སུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial indicating the completeness of the nirvana" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཕུང་པོ་ལྷག་མ་མེད་པའི་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པའི་དབྱིངས་སུ [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "The location or realm into which beings are led" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཕུང་པོ་ལྷག་མ་མེད་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration specifying the type of nirvana as being without remainder" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མི་གནས་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Additional elaboration clarifying this as the non-abiding nirvana of buddhahood, distinct from the lesser nirvana of śrāvakas" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; the direct addressee of the Buddha's discourse; functions as the Primary Participant-Agent in the passage]

- འདི་ལ་ : in this case [Locative case of `འདི་`: this; here referring to the following teaching or context; serves as a scene-setting element]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ : of the Bodhisattva [Genitive case of `བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་`: one who has generated the mind of awakening; modifies 'vehicle' as the path specific to those who seek buddhahood for all beings]

- ཐེག་པ་ : vehicle [Nominative of `ཐེག་པ་`: vehicle, path, yāna; refers to the Mahāyāna or Great Vehicle path; functions as the Center in the scene]

- ལ་ : in, on [Locative particle marking the object in/on which action occurs; here connecting 'vehicle' with 'correctly entered']

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : correctly, properly [Adverbial form of `ཡང་དག་པ་`: correct, proper, authentic; modifies how one enters the Bodhisattva path; functions as an Adverbial modifier]

- ཞུགས་པས་ : having entered [Instrumental/causal of `འཇུག་པ་`: to enter, engage; past tense form indicating the process of engaging with the Bodhisattva vehicle; functions as the main Process]

- འདི་སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking thus [Terminative of `འདི་སྙམ་`: to think this; introduces the content of the Bodhisattva's thought; functions as the Process within a mental scene]

- བདག་གིས་ : I [Ergative/instrumental of `བདག་`: self, I; marks the agent who makes the aspiration; functions as the Participant-Agent]

- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Nominative of `སེམས་ཅན་`: being possessing mind/consciousness; the object of the Bodhisattva's compassionate activity; functions as a Participant-Patient]

- ཇི་ཙམ་ : however many [Adverbial meaning "as many as"; refers to the totality or scope of all sentient beings without exception]

- སེམས་ཅན་དུ་ : as sentient beings [Terminative case marking classified identity; indicates the category into which beings are placed]

- བསྡུ་བས་ : by categorization [Instrumental of `བསྡུ་བ་`: to gather, collect, categorize; refers to the process of classifying beings]

- བསྡུས་པ་ : are included [Past form of `སྡུད་པ་`: to include, gather; refers to the comprehensive nature of the categorization; functions as Process]

- སྒོ་ང་ལས་ : from eggs [Ablative of `སྒོ་ང་`: egg; indicates origin or source of birth; first of four traditional birth types]

- སྐྱེས་པའམ་ : born or [Past form of `སྐྱེ་བ་`: to be born + disjunctive particle; indicates egg-born beings as one category; functions as Process]

- མངལ་ལས་ : from wombs [Ablative of `མངལ་`: womb; indicates origin or source of birth; second birth type]

- སྐྱེས་པའམ་ : born or [Past form of `སྐྱེ་བ་`: to be born + disjunctive particle; indicates womb-born beings as another category; functions as Process]

- དྲོད་གཤེར་ལས་ : from moisture and heat [Ablative of `དྲོད་གཤེར་`: warmth and moisture; indicates origin or source of birth; third birth type]

- སྐྱེས་པའམ་ : born or [Past form of `སྐྱེ་བ་`: to be born + disjunctive particle; indicates moisture-born beings as another category; functions as Process]

- རྫུས་ཏེ་ : miraculously [Adverbial form indicating spontaneous manner; modifies the manner of birth without parents or physical causes]

- སྐྱེས་པའམ་ : born or [Past form of `སྐྱེ་བ་`: to be born + disjunctive particle; indicates spontaneously-born beings as fourth birth type; functions as Process]

- གཟུགས་ཅན་ནམ་ : with form or [Attributive + disjunctive particle; beings possessing physical form; first category in form classification; functions as State]

- གཟུགས་ཅན་མ་ཡིན་པའམ་ : without form or [Negative of `གཟུགས་ཅན་` + disjunctive particle; beings without physical form; second category in form classification; functions as State]

- འདུ་ཤེས་ཅན་ནམ་ : with perception or [Attributive + disjunctive particle; beings possessing consciousness/perception; first category in perception classification; functions as State]

- འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་ : without perception [Negative of `འདུ་ཤེས་`: perception, consciousness; beings lacking perception]

- འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་མིན་ནམ་ : nor without perception or [Double negative construction + disjunctive particle; beings in the subtle state of neither having nor lacking perception; functions as State]

- སེམས་ཅན་གྱི་ : of sentient beings [Genitive of `སེམས་ཅན་`: sentient beings; possessive marker indicating beings as the object of discussion]

- ཁམས་ : realms [Nominative of `ཁམས་`: realm, domain, dhātu; refers to all possible realms of existence]

- ཇི་ཙམ་ : however many [Adverbial meaning "as many as"; refers to the totality or scope of all realms]

- སེམས་ཅན་དུ་ : as sentient beings [Terminative case marking classified identity; indicates the category into which beings are placed]

- གདགས་པའི་ : are designated [Future of `འདོགས་པ་`: to designate, label + genitive; refers to the conventional labeling process]

- བརྟགས་པ་ : are conceptualized [Past of `རྟོག་པ་`: to conceptualize, imagine; refers to mental categorization]

- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural; refers back to all the previously enumerated types of beings]

- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Universal quantifier; encompasses every being mentioned; functions as Participant-Patient]

- ཕུང་པོ་ : aggregates [Nominative of `ཕུང་པོ་`: heap, skandha; the five psycho-physical aggregates constituting beings]

- ལྷག་མ་མེད་པའི་ : without remainder [Attributive form of negative expression `ལྷག་མ་མེད་པ་`: nothing left over; describes complete nirvana with no residual karma or aggregates; functions as Elaborator]

- མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པའི་ : of nirvana [Genitive of `མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པ་`: passing beyond suffering; the state of complete liberation]

- དབྱིངས་སུ་ : into the realm [Terminative of `དབྱིངས་`: realm, sphere, dhātu; the ultimate dimension or sphere; functions as Participant-Location]

- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely [Adverbial intensifier; emphasizes the completeness of the liberation; functions as Adverbial]

- མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདའོ། : I will lead beyond suffering [Future of `མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདའ་བ་`: to pass beyond suffering + final particle; the Bodhisattva's commitment to lead beings to liberation; functions as the main Process with an implied agent (the Bodhisattva)]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ལྟར་སེམས་ཅན་ཚད་མེད་པ་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་ཀྱང༌། སེམས་ཅན་གང་ཡང་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པར་འགྱུར་བ་མེད་དོ་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The entire sentence describing the paradoxical understanding required for generating bodhicitta" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ལྟར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "An adverbial phrase indicating the manner" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས་ཅན་ཚད་མེད་པ་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་ཀྱང༌། སེམས་ཅན་གང་ཡང་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པར་འགྱུར་བ་མེད་དོ་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Contrast | Desc: "Contrasting statements representing conventional truth vs. ultimate truth" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་ཚད་མེད་པ་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས [Type: Scene | Desc: "The first scene expressing the conventional truth that beings attain nirvana" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སེམས་ཅན་ཚད་མེད་པ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agents who have been conventionally liberated" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས [Type: Process-Conventional | Desc: "The process of liberation from a conventional perspective (kun rdzob)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཀྱང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "A conjunction linking the contrasting scenes" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སེམས་ཅན་གང་ཡང་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པར་འགྱུར་བ་མེད་དོ་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The second scene expressing the ultimate truth that no beings truly attain nirvana" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སེམས་ཅན་གང་ཡང [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agents who from the ultimate perspective do not attain liberation" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པར་འགྱུར་བ་མེད་དོ [Type: Process-Ultimate | Desc: "The process indicating the ultimate truth (don dam) perspective that no beings are truly liberated" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྙམ་དུ [Type: Relator | Desc: "A relator connecting the thought to the act of generating bodhicitta" | Implicit: ""]
    └── སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The scene describing the act of generating bodhicitta based on the understanding of emptiness" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit agent who should generate the thought, specifically identified as the bodhisattva" | Implicit: "The implicit agent who should generate the thought, specifically identified as the bodhisattva"]
        ├── སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of generating bodhicitta" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འོ [Type: Function | Desc: "A function word indicating the end of the sentence" | Implicit: ""]
        └── based on understanding of emptiness [Type: Purpose | Desc: "An implicit connection showing that bodhicitta is generated based on the understanding of emptiness expressed in node 5" | Implicit: "An implicit connection showing that bodhicitta is generated based on the understanding of emptiness expressed in node 5"]
glossary:
- དེ་ལྟར་ : in that way [Adverbial; from `དེ་`: that + `ལྟར་`: like, in the manner of; functions as an adverbial modifier setting up the paradoxical understanding]

- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Compound noun; `སེམས་`: mind + `ཅན་`: possessing; refers to all conscious beings; functions as a Participant-Agent in the first part of the contrast]

- ཚད་མེད་པ་ : immeasurable [Adjective modifying སེམས་ཅན་; from `ཚད་`: measure + `མེད་པ་`: without; describes countless beings; part of the agent phrase]

- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely [Adverb; intensifier indicating thoroughness or completeness; modifies the process of passing beyond suffering]

- མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་ : pass beyond suffering [Verbal phrase; `མྱ་ངན་`: suffering + `ལས་`: from + `འདས་`: to go beyond; technical term for nirvana; functions as Process-Conventional in the UCCA structure]

- ཀྱང༌ : although [Conjunction; adversative marker indicating contrast; links the conventional and ultimate perspectives on liberation]

- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Compound noun; `སེམས་`: mind + `ཅན་`: possessing; refers to all conscious beings; functions as Participant-Agent in the second part of the contrast]

- གང་ཡང་ : any whatsoever [Indefinite pronoun; `གང་`: which, what + `ཡང་`: even, also; emphasizes that not a single being truly attains nirvana in the ultimate sense]

- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely [Adverb; intensifier indicating thoroughness or completeness; modifies the process of passing beyond suffering]

- མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པར་ : as passing beyond suffering [Verbal noun; `མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པ་`: nirvana + terminative case marker `-ར་`; functions as part of the Process-Ultimate in the UCCA structure]

- འགྱུར་བ་ : become [Verbal noun; from `འགྱུར་`: to become, transform; indicates the state of becoming]

- མེད་དོ་ : does not exist [Negative existential verb; `མེད་`: not exist + `དོ་`: sentence-final particle; completes the negation of beings truly attaining nirvana]

- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking [Quotative particle; `སྙམ་`: to think + `-དུ་`: purposive case marker; marks the preceding statement as the content of thought and connects it to the act of generating bodhicitta]

- སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་ : to generate the mind [Verbal noun; `སེམས་`: mind + `བསྐྱེད་པ་`: to generate + `-ར་`: terminative case marker; technical term for generating bodhicitta]

- བྱའོ་ : one should do [Future/imperative form of `བྱེད་`: to do + `འོ་`: sentence-final particle; indicates that generating bodhicitta is what should be done]

        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཞེས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Technical Buddhist term used adverbially in the context of negation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མི་བྱ་བའི [Type: Negated-Process | Desc: "Negated process emphasizing that one would not be called a bodhisattva" | Implicit: ""]

        └── [སེམས་ཅན་ལ་སེམས་ཅན་དུ་བདེན་པར་གྲུབ་པའི་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་ན] [Type: Implicit-Condition | Desc: "Implicit condition mentioned in the commentaries as the reason one would not be called a bodhisattva" | Implicit: "Context from Buddhist philosophy indicates that a bodhisattva who perceives sentient beings as inherently existing is not a true bodhisattva"]
glossary:
## Tibetan Text Glossary

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun, serving as a reference to the previously mentioned concept; functions as the Patient participant in both the question and answer sections]
- ཅིའི་ : what [Interrogative pronoun with genitive case marker; from `ཅི་`: what; used here to inquire about reasons]
- ཕྱིར་ : for the sake of [Postposition indicating purpose or reason; forms part of the interrogative construction that asks "why"]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Verbal phrase marking a rhetorical question; from `ཞེས་`: thus + `ན`: if/when; introduces a philosophical explanation]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun referring to the subject under discussion; same as the first occurrence, functions as Patient participant]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Sanskrit bodhisattva first part; awakening, enlightenment; Buddhist technical term]
- སེམས་དཔའ་ : hero of mind [Sanskrit bodhisattva second part; being who aspires to enlightenment for the benefit of all beings]
- ཞེས་ : thus called [Quotative marker indicating the preceding term is being referenced; marks the term "bodhisattva" as a designation]
- མི་ : not [Negative particle modifying the verb; negates the process of designation]
- བྱ་བའི་ : being called [Future/modal form of `བྱེད་`: to do, with genitive marker; here meaning "to designate as" or "to call"]
- ཕྱིར་ : because [Postposition indicating reason or cause; establishes the causal relationship]
- རོ། : is [Final particle indicating completion of statement with emphasis; marks the end of the explanation]

དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་གང་སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་གམ། སྲོག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་གམ། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་ན། དེ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཞེས་མི་བྱ་བའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Rhetorical question introducing the explanation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The reason being asked about" | Implicit: ""]

            ├── [one] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit person who perceives" | Implicit: "The implicit person who perceives"]

glossary:
- དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ : Why is that [Interrogative; `དེ་` (that) + `ཅིའི་` (why, for what) + `ཕྱིར་` (reason, purpose); introduces rhetorical question functioning as a discourse marker to signal explanation]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional marker; from `ཞེས་` (quotative) + `-ན་` (if); grammatical marker indicating a rhetorical question that establishes premise]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative case; proper name of Buddha's disciple being addressed; functions as recipient of discourse]
- གང་ : whoever [Relative pronoun; establishes conditional agent for following clauses; marks the implicit subject of the perception]
- སེམས་ཅན་དུ་ : as sentient beings [Terminative case of `སེམས་ཅན་` (sentient being); indicates perceiving phenomena as having independent existence; serves as adverbial modifier of perception]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Noun; from `འདུ་` (to gather) + `ཤེས་` (to know); conceptual discrimination that apprehends characteristics; process of conventional designation]
- འཇུག་གམ། : engages in or [Present tense verb + disjunctive particle; `འཇུག་` (to engage, enter into) + `-གམ་` (or); indicates active mental process with interrogative function]
- སྲོག་ཏུ་ : as life-force [Terminative case of `སྲོག་` (life, vitality); perceiving phenomena as having intrinsic life-force; second adverbial modifier in parallel structure]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Noun; repeated term indicating same mental process applied to different object]
- འཇུག་གམ། : engages in or [Present tense verb + disjunctive particle; repeated to create parallel construction]
- གང་ཟག་ཏུ་ : as persons [Terminative case of `གང་ཟག་` (person, individual); perceiving phenomena as having personhood; third adverbial modifier in parallel structure]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Noun; third instance maintaining parallel structure]
- འཇུག་ན། : engages in, then [Present tense verb + conditional particle; `འཇུག་` (to engage) + `-ན་` (if); concludes conditional clause series]
- དེ་ : that one [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the person described in the conditional clauses; functions as patient in result clause]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [Noun compound; `བྱང་ཆུབ་` (enlightenment) + `སེམས་དཔའ་` (hero of mind); one who aspires to enlightenment for all beings; functions as goal in nominal phrase]
- ཞེས་ : called [Quotative particle; marks preceding term as designation being negated]
- མི་བྱ་བའི་ : cannot be designated [Negative future of `བྱེད་` (to do, make); negated state of being called or designated; indicates impossibility]
- ཕྱིར་རོ། ། : because [Final particle; `ཕྱིར་` (purpose marker) + `རོ།` (sentence-final emphatic); indicates reason and conclusion of argument]

ཡང་རབ་འབྱོར་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་དངོས་པོ་ལ་མི་གནས་པར་སྦྱིན་པ་སྦྱིན་པར་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The complete instruction from the Buddha about how bodhisattvas should practice non-abiding generosity" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཡང་ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Discourse marker connecting this teaching to previous instructions" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The disciple being directly addressed by the Buddha, who is receiving this teaching to transmit to others" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who should perform the action of giving without abiding" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དངོས་པོ་ལ་མི་གནས་པར་ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "The crucial philosophical qualifier describing how giving should be performed - without conceptual fixation on subject, object, or action" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དངོས་པོ་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The conceptual reference points (particularly the three spheres of giver, gift, and recipient) that one should not abide in" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མི་གནས་པར་ [Type: State | Desc: "The state of non-abiding or non-attachment that represents the key philosophical dimension of transcendent perfection" | Implicit: ""]
    └── སྦྱིན་པ་སྦྱིན་པར་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action being instructed - the practice of giving that encompasses the six perfections when done without abiding" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སྦྱིན་པ་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object being given, which encompasses three types of giving (material gifts, fearlessness, and Dharma) that represent all six perfections" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཡང་ : furthermore [connective adverb; discourse marker connecting this teaching to previous instructions in the sutra; functions as a Linker to establish continuity between sections]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name; vocative case; name of the Buddha's disciple being directly addressed; functions as Recipient of the teaching]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [compound noun; from `བྱང་ཆུབ་` (enlightenment) + `སེམས་དཔའ་` (hero/warrior of mind); the spiritual practitioner who is the Agent who should perform the action of giving]

- དངོས་པོ་ : things [noun; refers to phenomena or reference points, specifically the three spheres of giving (giver, gift, recipient); functions as Patient within the adverbial phrase]

- ལ་ : in [locative particle; indicates the object toward which non-abiding is directed; establishes relationship between `དངོས་པོ་` and `མི་གནས་པར་`]

- མི་ : not [negative prefix; negates the verb `གནས་པ་`; essential part of the philosophical concept]

- གནས་པར་ : abiding [verbal noun + terminative particle; from `གནས་པ་` (to dwell, abide, fixate); describes the philosophical state of non-attachment; combines with `མི་` to form the adverbial phrase]

- སྦྱིན་པ་ : giving/generosity [verbal noun; from `སྦྱིན་པ་` (to give); represents both the act and object of giving; functions as Patient in the main verbal phrase]

- སྦྱིན་པར་ : giving [verbal noun + terminative particle; from `སྦྱིན་པ་` (to give); part of the verbal construction]

- བྱའོ། ། : should perform [future form of `བྱེད་པ་` (to do) + final particle; completes the verbal phrase indicating prescribed action; marks this as the main Process of the instruction]

        ├── ཅི་ལ་ཡང [Type: Scope | Desc: "The universal scope of non-abiding, indicating that one should not abide in any phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མི་གནས་པར [Type: State | Desc: "The state of non-abiding or non-attachment" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [non-attachment to the three spheres of giving] [Type: Implicit Elaboration | Desc: "Philosophical concept of non-abiding as transcending attachment to giver, gift, and recipient" | Implicit: "Philosophical concept of non-abiding as transcending attachment to giver, gift, and recipient"]
    └── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Tibetan sentence-ending shad punctuation mark" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཅི་ལ་ཡང་ : in anything whatsoever [Combination of `ཅི་` (what/whatever), `ལ་` (locative case marker), and `ཡང་` (also/even); indicates universal scope of non-attachment; functions as part of an Adverbial phrase in the semantic structure]

- མི་ : not [Negation prefix; negates the verb `གནས་པ་`; essential component of the concept of non-abiding]

- གནས་པར་ : abiding [Terminative case of `གནས་པ་`: to abide, dwell, remain; here expressing the state of (not) mentally fixating on or attaching to conceptual objects; forms core State element in adverbial phrase]

- སྦྱིན་པ་ : generosity [Noun form of `སྦྱིན་པ་`: giving, generosity, dāna; functions as the Patient (object) in the sentence; refers both to the act of giving and the conceptual virtue being cultivated]

- སྦྱིན་པར་ : giving [Terminative case of `སྦྱིན་པ་`: to give; verbal noun form indicating the action to be performed; forms part of the main Process of the sentence]

- བྱའོ : should do [Future form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do, with final particle `འོ་` indicating instruction or command; completes the verbal phrase "should practice giving"; the primary Process component]

- ། : [Tibetan punctuation mark (shad) indicating end of sentence]

        └── སྦྱིན་པར [Type: Process | Desc: "The specific action of giving" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མི་གནས་པར [Type: State | Desc: "The philosophical state of non-abiding that characterizes how giving should be practiced" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གཟུགས་ལ [Type: Elaborator-Attribute | Desc: "The specific attribute (form) in which one should not abide while giving" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གཟུགས་ལ [Type: Elaborator-Attribute | Desc: "The specific attribute (form) in which one should not abide while giving" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཡང [Type: Linker | Desc: "A connector indicating that form is one of possibly several things in which one should not abide" | Implicit: ""]
    └── སྦྱིན་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The donation or gift that is being given" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- གཟུགས་ལ་ : in form [Locative case of `གཟུགས་`: form, rūpa; refers to material phenomena or physical form; functions as the object of non-abiding, specifying what not to be attached to during the act of giving]

- ཡང་ : also, even [Emphatic particle; indicates that form is one of possibly several things in which one should not abide; functions as a linker in the semantic structure]

- མི་གནས་པར་ : without abiding [Negative prefix `མི་` + `གནས་པ་`: to abide, dwell + nominalizer + terminative case marker; describes the philosophical state of non-attachment or non-fixation that should characterize the act of giving; central philosophical concept in this instruction]

- སྦྱིན་པ་ : giving, generosity [Noun form of `སྦྱིན་པ་`: to give, dāna; refers to the practice of generosity or the gift itself; functions as the patient or direct object in the sentence]

- སྦྱིན་པར་ : to give [Verb `སྦྱིན་པ་` + terminative case marker; the specific action of giving that is being advised; forms the main process with བྱའོ]

- བྱའོ། ། : should do [Future/imperative form of `བྱེད་`: to do + final particle; indicates instruction or obligation; completes the verbal phrase "should give" and marks this as an instruction to a bodhisattva practitioner]

དེ་བཞིན་དུ་སྒྲ་དང༌། དྲི་དང༌། རོ་དང༌། རེག་བྱ་དང༌། ཆོས་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར་སྦྱིན་པ་སྦྱིན་པར་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the complete instruction on how to give without abiding" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial modifier connecting this instruction to previous ones" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མི་གནས་པར [Type: State | Desc: "State of not abiding that qualifies how giving should be performed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྒྲ་དང༌། དྲི་དང༌། རོ་དང༌། རེག་བྱ་དང༌། ཆོས་ལ་ཡང [Type: Participant | Desc: "The five sense objects in which one should not abide while giving" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྒྲ [Type: Participant | Desc: "The sense object of sound" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དྲི [Type: Participant | Desc: "The sense object of smell" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རོ [Type: Participant | Desc: "The sense object of taste" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རེག་བྱ [Type: Participant | Desc: "The sense object of touch" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཆོས [Type: Participant | Desc: "Mental objects or phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [freedom from conceptual fixation or true existence] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Philosophical concept of freedom from conceptual fixation implied by 'not abiding'" | Implicit: "Philosophical concept of freedom from conceptual fixation implied by 'not abiding'"]
    ├── སྦྱིན་པ་སྦྱིན་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of giving gifts" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྦྱིན་པ [Type: Participant | Desc: "The object being given, which is also the concept of generosity itself" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [dual nature of giving] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Represents the dual nature of 'སྦྱིན་པ' as both the object given and the action itself" | Implicit: "Represents the dual nature of 'སྦྱིན་པ' as both the object given and the action itself"]
    └── [the bodhisattva] [Type: Participant | Desc: "The implicit agent (bodhisattva) who performs the action of giving without abiding" | Implicit: "The implicit agent (bodhisattva) who performs the action of giving without abiding"]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་དུ་ : likewise [Adverbial phrase; `དེ་བཞིན་`: 'in that way' + terminative particle `དུ`; functions as an adverbial modifier connecting this instruction to previous ones in the text]

- སྒྲ་དང༌། : and sound [Noun `སྒྲ་`: 'sound' + conjunction particle `དང༌`; refers to the sense object of sound as one of the five sense objects in which one should not abide]

- དྲི་དང༌། : and smell [Noun `དྲི་`: 'smell, odor' + conjunction particle `དང༌`; refers to the sense object of smell as one of the five sense objects]

- རོ་དང༌། : and taste [Noun `རོ་`: 'taste' + conjunction particle `དང༌`; refers to the sense object of taste as one of the five sense objects]

- རེག་བྱ་དང༌། : and touch [Noun `རེག་བྱ་`: 'tangible object, touch' + conjunction particle `དང༌`; refers to the sense object of touch as one of the five sense objects]

- ཆོས་ལ་ཡང་ : and also in mental phenomena [Noun `ཆོས་`: 'dharma, phenomena, mental objects' + locative particle `ལ་` + emphatic particle `ཡང་`; refers to mental objects as the fifth sense object, with emphasis]

- མི་གནས་པར་ : without abiding [Negation prefix `མི་` + verbal root `གནས་`: 'to abide, dwell' + nominalizer `པ` + terminative particle `ར`; describes the state of not fixating on or conceptually abiding in the sense objects while giving]

- སྦྱིན་པ་ : generosity [Noun `སྦྱིན་པ་`: 'giving, generosity, gift'; functions as both the object being given and the concept of generosity itself, showing dual nature]

- སྦྱིན་པར་ : to give [Verbal noun `སྦྱིན་པ་`: 'to give' + terminative particle `ར`; forms part of the verbal phrase indicating the action to be performed]

- བྱའོ། ། : one should do [Future/imperative form of `བྱེད་`: 'to do' + final particle `འོ` indicating completion; functions as the main verb predicate with imperative sense directed at the implicit bodhisattva agent]

        ├── མཚན་མར་འདུ་ཤེས་པ [Type: Cognitive-State | Desc: "mental conceptualization of marks" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper noun; the name of Buddha's disciple who is being addressed; functions as the Recipient of the teaching in this discourse]

- ཅི་ནས་ཀྱང་ : by all means [Emphatic construction; an emphatic expression meaning "definitely" or "by whatever means necessary"; serves as part of the Adverbial-Manner phrase describing how the bodhisattva should give]

- མཚན་མར་ : in/as characteristics [Terminative case of `མཚན་མ་`: mark, sign, characteristic; refers to conceptual attributes or distinguishing features; part of the cognitive state being rejected]

- འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ : perceiving/conceptualizing [Verbal noun from `འདུ་ཤེས་`: to perceive, recognize, conceptualize; the mental process of labeling phenomena with characteristics]

- ལ་ : regarding/in [Locative particle; indicating the object of non-abiding; connects the cognitive state to the instruction about non-abiding]

- ཡང་ : also/even [Emphatic particle; adding emphasis to the preceding phrase; indicates that even this type of perception should be abandoned]

- མི་གནས་པར་ : without abiding [Negative of `གནས་པ་`: to abide, dwell; with nominalizer and terminative case; describes the state of non-attachment to perceptions]

- དེ་ལྟར་ : in that way [Demonstrative + manner particle; "thus" or "in such a manner"; serves as a Linker connecting the manner to the main action]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔས་ : the bodhisattva [Agentive/Ergative case of `བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་`: bodhisattva, enlightenment being; the Agent who performs the giving]

- སྦྱིན་པ་ : generosity/gift [Noun from `སྦྱིན་པ་`: to give, generosity; the Patient-Gift object that is being given, though partially implicit in the grammatical construction]

- སྦྱིན་ནོ : gives [Present tense of `སྦྱིན་པ་`: to give + final particle `ནོ`; the main Process of giving in the sentence]
