glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; referring to the previously mentioned teaching or statement; functions as the matter being questioned in the UCCA structure]
- ཅིའི་ : for what [Interrogative pronoun in genitive case; from root `ཅི་` meaning "what"; introduces the question]
- ཕྱིར་ : reason [Noun meaning "reason, cause"; here used as part of the interrogative construction]
- ཞེ་ན། : if asked [Conditional form of the verb `ཟེར་` (to say, to ask); marks the end of a rhetorical question; indicates introduction of explanation]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; vocative case; the disciple being addressed by Buddha; functions as recipient of the statement]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [Compound noun; one who aspires to awakening for the benefit of all beings; the central agent in this passage]
- གང་ : who [Relative pronoun; connects the bodhisattva to the following description]
- མི་ : not [Negative prefix; negates the following verb]
- གནས་པར་ : abiding [Verbal noun in terminative case; from `གནས་པ་` meaning "to dwell, to abide"; here refers to non-attachment to conceptual fixation]
- སྦྱིན་པ་ : giving [Noun; generosity, the act of giving; the first of the six perfections]
- སྦྱིན་པ་ : gives [Verb; present tense of "to give"; repetition emphasizes the act]
- དེའི་ : their [Genitive form of the demonstrative pronoun `དེ་`; connects the bodhisattva to their merit]
- བསོད་ནམས་ : merit [Noun; positive karma, spiritual power accumulated through virtuous actions]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; connecting merit to the following noun]
- ཕུང་པོ་ : heap [Noun; aggregate, collection; here referring to the accumulated mass of merit]
- ནི། : indeed [Topic marker particle; emphasizes what follows]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; vocative case; repeated address to emphasize importance]
- ཚད་ : measure [Noun; dimension, limit, quantity; object of the following verb]
- གཟུང་བར་ : to grasp [Verbal noun in terminative case; from `འཛིན་པ་` meaning "to hold, grasp"; here meaning "to measure, calculate"]
- སླ་བ་ : easy [Adjective; something that can be done with ease]
- མ་ཡིན་པའི་ : is not [Negative copula in genitive form; negates the previous statement about being easy]
- ཕྱིར་ : because [Conjunctive particle indicating reason or cause]
- རོ། : is [Final particle; indicates completion of statement with certainty]
- ། : [Final punctuation mark]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། ཤར་ཕྱོགས་ཀྱི་ནམ་མཁའི་ཚད་གཟུང་བར་སླ་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene representing Subhuti being asked a question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The person being addressed (Subhuti)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of asking or thinking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The demonstrative referring to the content of the question" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཤར་ཕྱོགས་ཀྱི་ནམ་མཁའི་ཚད་གཟུང་བར་སླ་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Subscene about measuring the eastern sky" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གཟུང་བར་སླ་སྙམ་མམ [Type: State | Desc: "The state of whether measuring is easy/possible (rhetorical question)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཚད [Type: Participant-Attribute | Desc: "The attribute (measure/dimension) of the sky being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཤར་ཕྱོགས་ཀྱི [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "The location or direction being specified" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ནམ་མཁའི [Type: Participant-Centre | Desc: "The central entity whose measure is being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; name of the Buddha's disciple being addressed; functions as the Agent/addressee of the question in this scene]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the content of the question that follows; functions as the Patient/object of the thinking process]

- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do (you) think [Interrogative phrase; `ཇི་` = how/what, `སྙམ་` = to think/consider, `དུ་` = complementizer particle; introduces the rhetorical question; functions as part of the Process element]

- སེམས། : think? [Present tense verb; root `སེམས་པ་` = to think/consider; completes the questioning phrase with `ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་`; marks the end of the initial address]

- ཤར་ཕྱོགས་ཀྱི་ : of the eastern direction [Genitive construction; `ཤར་ཕྱོགས་` = east/eastern direction, `ཀྱི་` = genitive particle; specifies the location being discussed; functions as a Location modifier]

- ནམ་མཁའི་ : of the sky [Genitive case of `ནམ་མཁའ་` = sky/space; the central entity whose measurability is being questioned; functions as the Centre of the subscene]

- ཚད་ : measure/dimension [Noun; refers to the extent or limit; the attribute of the sky being questioned; functions as an Attribute in relation to the sky]

- གཟུང་བར་ : to grasp/measure [Verbal noun in terminative case; `གཟུང་བ་` = to grasp/hold/measure from root `འཛིན་པ་`, `ར་` = terminative particle indicating purpose; describes the action being questioned]

- སླ་ : easy [Adjective; indicates ease or simplicity; forms part of the rhetorical question about possibility]

- སྙམ་མམ། : do (you) think? [Interrogative final particle; `སྙམ་` = to think, `མམ།` = question particle; completes the rhetorical question with negative implication that it is not possible to measure the eastern sky]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing Subhuti's reply" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent (Subhuti) who is speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསོལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of speaking/replying" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Response | Desc: "Subhuti's direct response to the Bhagavan's previous statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Addressee | Desc: "Direct address to the Bhagavan in vocative case" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ནི [Type: Center | Desc: "The topic that is being negated in the response" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མ་ལགས་སོ [Type: Negator | Desc: "Explicit negation of the previous proposition" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [the previous proposition about bodhisattvas giving without abiding in phenomena] [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implicit content being denied - specifically the teaching that bodhisattvas should give without abiding in phenomena" | Implicit: "The implicit content being denied - specifically the teaching that bodhisattvas should give without abiding in phenomena"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhuti [Instrumental case of `རབ་འབྱོར་`: Subhuti; proper name of the Buddha's disciple; functions as the Agent/speaker in this utterance; instrumental case indicates he is performing the action]

- གསོལ་པ། : replied [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, to speak, to reply; here indicating Subhuti's verbal response to the Buddha; functions as the main Process/verb of the utterance]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་པ་` (conquered [the four maras]), `ལྡན་` (possessing [the qualities of realization]), and `འདས་` (transcended [suffering]); functions as the Addressee in vocative case]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; referring back to the previous proposition stated by the Buddha about bodhisattvas giving without abiding in phenomena; functions as the Center of what is being negated]

- ནི་ : indeed [Topic marker; emphasizing the demonstrative pronoun; clarifies what specifically is being negated]

- མ་ལགས་སོ། : is not so [Negative form of `ལགས་` (honorific verb 'to be'); `མ་` is the negative prefix and `སོ` is the final particle; functions as the Negator that explicitly contradicts the Buddha's previous statement]

source: བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བཞིན་དུ་ལྷོ་དང༌། ནུབ་དང༌། བྱང་དང༌། སྟེང་དང༌། འོག་གི་ཕྱོགས་དང༌། ཕྱོགས་མཚམས་དང༌། ཕྱོགས་བཅུའི་ནམ་མཁའི་ཚད་གཟུང་བར་སླའམ།
ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བཞིན་དུ་ལྷོ་དང༌། ནུབ་དང༌། བྱང་དང༌། སྟེང་དང༌། འོག་གི་ཕྱོགས་དང༌། ཕྱོགས་མཚམས་དང༌། ཕྱོགས་བཅུའི་ནམ་མཁའི་ཚད་གཟུང་བར་སླའམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene of the speech act" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker (agent) of the speech act" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient of the speech act" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་བཞིན་དུ་ལྷོ་དང༌། ནུབ་དང༌། བྱང་དང༌། སྟེང་དང༌། འོག་གི་ཕྱོགས་དང༌། ཕྱོགས་མཚམས་དང༌། ཕྱོགས་བཅུའི་ནམ་མཁའི་ཚད་གཟུང་བར་སླའམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The question being asked about measuring space in all directions" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial indicating comparison to a previous statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལྷོ་དང༌། ནུབ་དང༌། བྱང་དང༌། སྟེང་དང༌། འོག་གི་ཕྱོགས་དང༌། ཕྱོགས་མཚམས་དང༌། ཕྱོགས་བཅུའི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The collection of directions being referred to as a participant in the question" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ལྷོ [Type: Participant | Desc: "Southern direction as part of the collection of directions" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ནུབ [Type: Participant | Desc: "Western direction as part of the collection of directions" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བྱང [Type: Participant | Desc: "Northern direction as part of the collection of directions" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྟེང [Type: Participant | Desc: "Upper direction as part of the collection of directions" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འོག་གི་ཕྱོགས [Type: Participant | Desc: "Lower direction as part of the collection of directions" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཕྱོགས་མཚམས [Type: Participant | Desc: "Intermediate directions as part of the collection of directions" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཕྱོགས་བཅུའི [Type: Participant | Desc: "Summary reference to all ten directions" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction linking the different directions" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ནམ་མཁའི་ཚད [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept being questioned - the measure of space" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གཟུང་བར [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of grasping or measuring" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སླའམ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Question particle asking if the action is easy/possible" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ནམ་མཁའི་ཚད་གཟུང་བར་སླའམ [Type: Center | Desc: "The complete rhetorical question that forms the core of this discourse" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : The Blessed One [honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་པ་` (conquered, destroyed), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to one who has conquered afflictions, possesses qualities, and transcended saṃsāra; functions as the Agent/speaker in this discourse]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker indicating the agent of the action; shows that the Blessed One is performing the action of speaking]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། : proclaimed [honorific verb for speaking; `བཀའ་` (word, speech) + `སྩལ་` (to give, bestow); indicates formal, authoritative speech from the Buddha; functions as the main Process in this scene]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [name of the Buddha's disciple; Sanskrit: Subhūti; one of the main interlocutors in the Prajñāpāramitā literature; recipient of the Buddha's speech]

- དེ་བཞིན་དུ་ : likewise [adverbial phrase; `དེ་` (that) + `བཞིན་` (like, manner) + `དུ་` (terminative particle); refers to comparison with a previous statement; functions as Adverbial modifier linking this statement to previous context]

- ལྷོ་ : south [cardinal direction; first in the sequence of directions being enumerated; part of the collection of directions as Patient in this rhetorical question]

- དང༌། : and [conjunction linking directions in a list]

- ནུབ་ : west [cardinal direction; second in the sequence of directions; part of the collection of directions as Patient]

- དང༌། : and [conjunction linking directions in a list]

- བྱང་ : north [cardinal direction; third in the sequence of directions; part of the collection of directions as Patient]

- དང༌། : and [conjunction linking directions in a list]

- སྟེང་ : above [directional term; fourth in the sequence of directions; refers to the upper direction or zenith; part of the collection of directions as Patient]

- དང༌། : and [conjunction linking directions in a list]

- འོག་གི་ : lower [genitive form of `འོག་` (below, beneath); fifth in the sequence of directions; refers to the nadir; part of the collection of directions as Patient]

- ཕྱོགས་ : direction [noun referring to a cardinal or spatial direction; part of the compound phrase with འོག་གི་]

- དང༌། : and [conjunction linking directions in a list]

- ཕྱོགས་མཚམས་ : intermediate directions [compound referring to directions between the cardinal points (northeast, southeast, etc.); sixth item in the sequence; part of the collection of directions as Patient]

- དང༌། : and [conjunction linking the final element in the list]

- ཕྱོགས་བཅུའི་ : of the ten directions [genitive compound; `ཕྱོགས་` (direction) + `བཅུ་` (ten) + `འི་` (genitive marker); refers to all directions in Buddhist cosmology; summarizes all previously mentioned directions; part of the collection of directions as Patient]

- ནམ་མཁའི་ : of space [genitive form of `ནམ་མཁའ་` (space, sky); refers to the vast empty expanse of the universe; modifies ཚད་, forming the central concept being questioned]

- ཚད་ : measure [noun referring to dimension, limit, or capacity; combined with ནམ་མཁའི་ forms the central concept "measure of space" that is being questioned]

- གཟུང་བར་ : to grasp/measure [future/purposive form of the verb `འཛིན་པ་` (to grasp, hold, measure); indicates the action being questioned; functions as the Process in this scene]

- སླའམ། : is it easy? [interrogative form of `སླ་བ་` (easy, simple) + interrogative particle `འམ་`; forms a rhetorical question asking if the previously described action is possible or easy; functions as the Adverbial modifier that transforms the statement into a question]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: ParallelScene | Desc: "Root node containing the entire utterance" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Scene | Desc: "Speech act of Subhuti addressing the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Speaker (Subhuti) of the utterance" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསོལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of speaking/uttering" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Recipient of the speech (Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Content of Subhuti's statement - a negation scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ནི [Type: Participant-Center | Desc: "Subject of the negation (the referent being negated)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of negation ('is not')" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper noun; name of one of Buddha's chief disciples; functions as the Agent/Speaker in the speech act]
- གྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates Subhuti as the doer/speaker of the utterance]
- གསོལ་པ། : replied/said [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, speak, say; indicates the Process of speaking in this context]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Bhagavan/Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་`: conquered (the four demons), `ལྡན་`: possessing (the qualities), `འདས་`: transcended (samsara); functions as the Addressee of Subhuti's speech]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to a previously mentioned subject or proposition; functions as the Center/Subject of the negation]
- ནི་ : indeed/as for [Topic marker; emphasizes the subject of negation]
- མ་ལགས་ : is not [Negation marker `མ་` + honorific verb `ལགས་` (to be); polite negative existential verb; indicates the Process of negation]
- སོ། : [Final particle marking the end of a statement with slight emphatic force]
- ། : [Tibetan shad punctuation mark indicating end of a clause or sentence]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བཞིན་དུ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་གང་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར་སྦྱིན་པ་སྦྱིན་པ་དེའི་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ནི། རབ་འབྱོར་ཚད་གཟུང་བར་སླ་བ་མ་ཡིན་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha, who is speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བཞིན་དུ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་གང་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར་སྦྱིན་པ་སྦྱིན་པ་དེའི་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ནི། རབ་འབྱོར་ཚད་གཟུང་བར་སླ་བ་མ་ཡིན་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The content of Buddha's speech" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Subhuti, who is being addressed at the beginning of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་དུ་ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Indicates continuation of previous discussion" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The bodhisattva who performs the action of giving" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གང་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར་སྦྱིན་པ་སྦྱིན་པ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The action performed by the bodhisattva" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── སྦྱིན་པ་སྦྱིན་པ་ [Type: Process | Desc: "The core action of giving" | Implicit: ""]
                └── གང་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར་ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner of giving - without attachment or abiding" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── [The special nature of non-abiding giving] [Type: Implicit | Desc: "The implicit concept of non-abiding giving as practiced by bodhisattvas without attachment to giver, gift, or recipient" | Implicit: "The implicit concept of non-abiding giving as practiced by bodhisattvas without attachment to giver, gift, or recipient"]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Subhuti addressed again in the latter part of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The merit accumulation that results from non-abiding giving" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཚད་གཟུང་བར་སླ་བ་མ་ཡིན་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Explains that the merit cannot be measured, providing reason/manner" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to the Buddha who has conquered afflictions, possesses qualities, and transcended samsara; functions as the Agent/Speaker in this discourse]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates that the Buddha is performing the action of speaking; connects the Agent to the Process]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། : proclaimed [Honorific past tense verb `སྩལ་` (to give/bestow) with `བཀའ་` (speech/word); formal expression for "the Buddha said"; marks the Process in the main scene]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of the Buddha's disciple; recipient of the Buddha's teaching; functions as the Addressee in the discourse structure]

- དེ་བཞིན་དུ་ : likewise [Adverbial phrase; `དེ་བཞིན་` (in that way) + locative `དུ་`; indicates continuity with previous discussion; sets framework for the comparison being made]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [Buddhist technical term; `བྱང་ཆུབ་` (enlightenment) + `སེམས་དཔའ་` (hero of mind); refers to one who seeks enlightenment for the benefit of all beings; functions as the Agent of the giving action]

- གང་ལ་ཡང་ : to anything [Generalizer; `གང་` (whatever) + `ལ་` (to) + `ཡང་` (even/also); part of the non-abiding construct; indicates complete non-attachment to any object]

- མི་གནས་པར་ : without abiding [Negated verbal noun as adverbial; `མི་` (not) + `གནས་པ་` (to dwell/abide) + `ར་` (terminative case); describes the mental state of non-attachment during giving; key philosophical concept]

- སྦྱིན་པ་ : giving [Verbal noun; from root `སྦྱིན་` (to give); refers to the act of generosity or charity; functions as the Process in the embedded scene]

- སྦྱིན་པ་ : gives [Verb form of the same root; repetition emphasizes the action; completes the verbal construction "gives gifts/charity"; core Process of the bodhisattva's action]

- དེའི་ : that [Genitive demonstrative; `དེ་` (that) + `འི་` (genitive marker); refers back to the bodhisattva's non-abiding giving; connects the action to its result]

- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ : of merit [Genitive construction; `བསོད་ནམས་` (merit/positive karma) + `ཀྱི་` (genitive marker); indicates the type of accumulation that results; part of the Patient element]

- ཕུང་པོ་ : heap [Noun; literally "aggregate/pile"; Buddhist technical term often used for the five aggregates, here metaphorically referring to a great accumulation of merit; completes the Patient phrase]

- ནི། : is [Topic marker; highlights what follows as important; sets up explanation about the merit's unmeasurable nature]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Same as above; second direct address to emphasize the importance of what follows]

- ཚད་ : measure [Noun; refers to quantification or measurement; part of the verbal construction about impossibility of measuring]

- གཟུང་བར་ : to grasp/comprehend [Verbal noun in terminative case; from `གཟུང་` (to grasp/hold) + `བར་` (terminative); indicates the action that cannot be performed on the merit]

- སླ་བ་ : easy [Adjective; describes the difficulty level; here negated to indicate impossibility]

- མ་ཡིན་པའི་ : is not [Negated copula in attributive form; `མ་` (negative) + `ཡིན་` (to be) + `པའི་` (attributive); constructs the negative quality]

- ཕྱིར་རོ། ། : because [Causal conjunction + final particle; `ཕྱིར་` (for/because) + `རོ` (final particle); concludes the Buddha's statement with the reason for the merit's immeasurability]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་བལྟ་བར་བྱ་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The complete question posed by Buddha to Subhūti about viewing the Tathāgata" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The person being directly addressed with the question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Buddha] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker who is asking the question to Subhūti" | Implicit: "Buddha, the speaker who is asking the question to Subhūti"]
    └── འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས [Type: Scene | Desc: "The act of questioning Subhūti about his thoughts" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object of thought" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of thinking or considering" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "How the thinking is done, interrogative manner" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་བལྟ་བར་བྱ་སྙམ་མམ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The content of what Subhūti is being asked to consider" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object being viewed or perceived" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བལྟ་བར་བྱ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of viewing or observing" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The means or instrument through which the Tathāgata might be viewed" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── [one] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implied agent who would be doing the viewing of the Tathāgata" | Implicit: "The implied agent who would be doing the viewing of the Tathāgata"]
            └── སྙམ་མམ [Type: Interrogative | Desc: "Question marker indicating the interrogative nature of the utterance" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Vocative; proper name of Buddha's disciple who is being directly addressed; functions as the Addressee in the discourse structure]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the question about to be asked; functions as the Patient or object of the thinking process]

- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [Interrogative adverbial phrase; from `སྙམ་པ་`: to think; introduces a question about someone's thoughts; functions as an Adverbial modifying the manner of thinking]

- སེམས : think [Present tense verb; root meaning: to think, consider, reflect; here asking Subhūti to reflect on the question; functions as the main Process of the first clause]

- མཚན་ : marks/characteristics [Noun; refers to the physical attributes or distinguishing features; specifically the notable physical characteristics of a Buddha]

- ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་ : through perfect/excellent [Instrumental case of `ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་`: perfect, excellent, complete; indicates the means by which someone might view the Tathāgata; functions as an Elaborator specifying the means]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་ : the Tathāgata [Terminative/Allative case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "one who has thus gone" or "thus-come one", epithet of the Buddha; functions as the Patient or object being viewed]

- བལྟ་བར་ : to view/see [Purposive form of `བལྟ་བ་`: to look at, observe; indicates the purpose or intention; functions as part of the Process]

- བྱ་ : should do/make [Future/modal auxiliary verb; indicates obligation or possibility; combines with `བལྟ་བར་` to form "should view"; completes the Process element]

- སྙམ་མམ : do you think? [Interrogative form of `སྙམ་པ་`: to think; final question particle `འམ` makes it explicitly interrogative; functions as the Interrogative marker for the entire question]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of Subhuti's response to the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who is speaking (Subhuti)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསོལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of Subhuti replying" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ [Type: Content | Desc: "The content of what Subhuti said to Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient of Subhuti's reply (Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Subhuti's negative response to Buddha's question" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [one should not view the Tathagata merely through his physical marks] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit clarification of what is being negated in Subhuti's response" | Implicit: "Implicit clarification of what is being negated in Subhuti's response"]
    └── In response to previous question [Type: Time | Desc: "Implicit temporal context of this exchange as a response to Buddha's prior question" | Implicit: "Implicit temporal context of this exchange as a response to Buddha's prior question"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhuti [Ergative case marker གྱིས་ attached to the name རབ་འབྱོར་ (Subhuti); indicates Subhuti is the agent performing the action; functions as the main agent/speaker in this scene]

- གསོལ་པ། : replied [Perfect/past tense form of གསོལ་བ་ (to request, to speak respectfully); here indicates Subhuti's act of speaking to Buddha; functions as the main process/action of the scene]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; compound of བཅོམ་ (conquered), ལྡན་ (possessing), and འདས་ (transcended); refers to the Buddha as one who has conquered defilements, possesses qualities, and transcended samsara; functions as the recipient of Subhuti's speech]

- དེ་ནི་ : that [དེ་: demonstrative pronoun "that"; ནི་: topic marker highlighting what is being discussed; together indicating the subject of Subhuti's response, referring back to Buddha's previous question or statement]

- མ་ལགས་སོ། : is not so [མ་: negative prefix; ལགས་: honorific form of "to be"; སོ་: sentence-final particle indicating completion; this is Subhuti's direct negation in response to Buddha's question, implying "that is not the case" regarding viewing the Tathagata through physical marks]

ucca_formatted:
མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་བལྟ་བར་མི་བགྱི་ལགས་སོ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The entire sentence expressing that one should not view the Tathagata through perfect marks" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── The disciple (Subhuti) [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implied addressee of the instruction (the disciple Subhuti) who is being instructed not to view the Tathagata through perfect marks" | Implicit: "The implied addressee of the instruction (the disciple Subhuti) who is being instructed not to view the Tathagata through perfect marks"]
    ├── བལྟ་བར་མི་བགྱི་ལགས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The negated verbal process of viewing" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མི་ [Type: Center-State | Desc: "The negation element of the verbal process, explicitly showing this is a negative instruction" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object of viewing - the Tathagata (Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས [Type: Adverbial-Manner | Desc: "The instrumental means (perfect marks) by which one might incorrectly view the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    └── the Tathagata's true nature transcends physical marks [Type: Implicit Elaborator | Desc: "The implicit philosophical concept that the Tathagata's true nature transcends physical characteristics" | Implicit: "The implicit philosophical concept that the Tathagata's true nature transcends physical characteristics"]
glossary:
- མཚན་ : marks [Noun; the physical characteristics or signs; referring to the Buddha's physical marks; functions as the object of the instrumental case marker]
- ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་ : through perfect/excellent [Instrumental of `ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་`: perfect, excellent, complete; here indicating the means by which one might incorrectly view the Buddha; serves as an Adverbial modifier of manner]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་ : the Tathagata [Terminative case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "Thus-Gone One", epithet of the Buddha; functions as the Patient or object of viewing in the sentence]
- བལྟ་བར་ : to view/regard [Terminative of `བལྟ་བ་`: to look at, view, regard; the main verbal action being negated; forms part of the Process component]
- མི་ : not [Negative particle; negates the following verb; indicates prohibition; central to the negative instruction]
- བགྱི་ : should do [Future/present form of `བགྱིད་པ་`: to do, perform; honorific verb; combined with the negative particle indicates "should not do"]
- ལགས་སོ : is [Copula `ལགས་` with final particle `སོ`; honorific form affirming the statement; marks this as a formal, respectful declaration]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་ཞེས་གང་གསུངས་པ་དེ་ཉིད། མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་མ་མཆིས་པའི་སླད་དུའོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing all parallel scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Question | Desc: "Rhetorical question that sets up the explanation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Reference to previous statement" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Process | Desc: "Questioning process" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་ཞེས་གང་གསུངས་པ་དེ་ཉིད། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The first part of the explanation about what the Tathagata has taught" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The one who spoke about perfect marks" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསུངས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of speaking/teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་ཞེས་གང [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration on what was spoken about by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་ཉིད [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connector linking what was taught to the explanation that follows" | Implicit: ""]
    └── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་མ་མཆིས་པའི་སླད་དུའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The reason or explanation for the Tathagata's teaching, contrasting with the previous scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [In ultimate truth] [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "Implicit Reference to Ultimate Truth" | Implicit: "Reference to Ultimate Truth not explicitly stated but implied by Buddhist philosophical context"]
        ├── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་མ་མཆིས་པའི [Type: Negated State | Desc: "The state of perfect marks not existing in ultimate reality" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སླད་དུའོ། ། [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relator indicating the reason" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to previous statement; functions as Patient in the rhetorical question structure]
- ཅིའི་ : for what reason [Interrogative pronoun ཅི་ "what" + genitive case marker འི་; part of the questioning process]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the purpose of [Postposition indicating purpose or reason; combines with ཅིའི་ to form "for what reason"]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Quotative verb ཞེས་ in conditional form; introduces rhetorical question; completes the questioning process]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Agentive/ergative of དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ "Thus-Gone One"; Buddha's epithet; functions as Agent of the teaching]
- མཚན་ : marks/characteristics [Root noun referring to the distinguishing features or characteristics of a Buddha]
- ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་ : perfect/excellent [Compound adjective meaning "complete, perfect, excellent"; modifies མཚན་ "marks"]
- ཞེས་ : thus/as [Quotative particle introducing quoted speech or terminology]
- གང་ : what/whatever [Relative pronoun; refers to the teaching being discussed; part of the elaboration on what was taught]
- གསུངས་པ་ : taught/spoken [Past tense of གསུང་བ་ "to speak/teach"; honorific verb indicating Buddha's teaching; the main Process in this scene]
- དེ་ཉིད། : that very [དེ་ "that" + ཉིད་ "very/itself"; emphatic demonstrative; functions as connector linking to next statement]
- མཚན་ : marks/characteristics [Same as above; root noun referring to the distinguishing features]
- ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་ : perfect/excellent [Same as above; compound adjective meaning "complete, perfect"]
- མ་མཆིས་པའི་ : do not exist [Negation marker མ་ + honorific verb མཆིས་པ་ "to exist" + genitive འི་; negated state indicating non-existence in ultimate reality]
- སླད་དུའོ། ། : is because [སླད་དུ་ "for the purpose of/because" + འོ་ sentence-final particle; relator indicating reason or explanation]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་པ་དང༌། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "The entire sentence showing parallel scenes connected by a linker" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་པ་དང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The first scene showing Subhuti's speech" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [རབ་འབྱོར] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit speaker (Subhuti) who was making the request" | Implicit: "The speaker Subhuti is implied but not explicitly mentioned in this clause"]
        ├── གསོལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of speaking or requesting" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The content of what was spoken" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དང༌། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Temporal/sequential connector between the two scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The second scene showing the Buddha's response" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the agent of the speaking action" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The person to whom the Buddha is speaking" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of speaking by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདི་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Introduces the content of the Buddha's speech that will follow" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་ : thus [Demonstrative + quotative marker; `དེ་` = that + `སྐད་` = words/speech + `ཅེས་` = quotative particle; refers to the previously spoken words; functions as the content/Patient of what was spoken]
- གསོལ་པ་ : requested/spoke [Past tense verb; `གསོལ་བ་` = to request, speak respectfully; indicates Subhuti's respectful address to the Buddha; functions as the main Process in the first scene]
- དང༌། : and then [Connective particle; temporal/sequential connector linking the two scenes; indicates the transition between Subhuti's question and Buddha's response]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; `བཅོམ་` = conquered + `ལྡན་` = possessing + `འདས་` = transcended; refers to Buddha who has conquered defilements and transcended suffering; functions as the Agent in the second scene]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates that Buddha is the agent performing the action; marks Buddha as the speaker]
- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : Venerable [Honorific title; `ཚེ་` = life + `དང་` = and + `ལྡན་པ་` = possessing; literally "possessing life" but functions as a term of respect for monastics; part of the Recipient description]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; name of the Buddha's disciple who is being addressed; functions as the Recipient of Buddha's speech]
- ལ་ : to [Dative case marker; indicates the recipient of the action; marks Subhuti as the one being addressed]
- འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་ : as follows [Demonstrative + quotative marker; `འདི་` = this + `སྐད་` = words/speech + `ཅེས་` = quotative particle; introduces the content of what will follow; elaborates on what Buddha is about to say]
- བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། : spoke/proclaimed [Honorific past tense verb + final particle; `བཀའ་` = word/speech (honorific) + `སྩལ་` = to give/bestow (honorific); indicates the Buddha's authoritative speech; main Process of the second scene with `ཏོ` marking sentence completion]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་ཇི་ཙམ་དུ་མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་དེ་ཙམ་དུ་བརྫུན་ནོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing Buddha's teaching to Subhuti about marks and falsehood" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The disciple Subhuti to whom Buddha is speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཇི་ཙམ་དུ་མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་དེ་ཙམ་དུ་བརྫུན་ནོ [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Correlative structure showing relationship between extent of marks and extent of falsehood" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཇི་ཙམ་དུ་མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First correlated scene describing the extent of marks" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཇི་ཙམ་དུ [Type: Adverbial-Correlative | Desc: "Adverbial expression indicating proportional relationship" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ [Type: Process-Result | Desc: "The result of conceptual attachment to characteristics or marks" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── མཚན [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The characteristics or marks being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ [Type: Elaborator-Attribute | Desc: "Attribute describing the quality or nature of the marks" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་ཙམ་དུ་བརྫུན་ནོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second correlated scene describing the corresponding extent of falsehood" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་ཙམ་དུ [Type: Adverbial-Correlative | Desc: "Correlative adverbial referring back to the extent mentioned in the first scene" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བརྫུན་ནོ [Type: State | Desc: "Predicate stating the deceptive or false nature from ultimate perspective" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [marks of perfection from ultimate perspective] [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implicit subject that is characterized as false - specifically the marks of perfection when viewed from ultimate reality (དོན་དམ་པར)" | Implicit: "The implicit subject of the falsehood predicate"]
    ├── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Tibetan sentence-final punctuation mark (shad)" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [Buddha] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Buddha (བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས) as the implicit speaker addressing Subhuti" | Implicit: "Implied speaker of the teaching"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative of the proper name; addressing the disciple Subhuti as recipient of Buddha's teaching]

- ཇི་ཙམ་དུ་ : to whatever extent [Correlative adverbial compound; establishes proportional relationship in the first part of correlative structure]

- མཚན་ : marks [Noun; referring to the physical characteristics or signs (lakṣaṇa); functions as Patient in the semantic structure]

- ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་ : are excellent [Attributive verb phrase describing the nature of marks; literally "complete/perfect/excellent"; attributes quality to the marks]

- དེ་ཙམ་དུ་ : to that same extent [Correlative adverbial demonstrative compound; refers back to the extent mentioned in first part of correlative structure]

- བརྫུན་ནོ : they are false [Predicative verb with sentence-final particle; `བརྫུན་` is "false/deception" + `ནོ` assertion marker; statement about the illusory/false nature of marks from ultimate perspective]

- ། : [Sentence-final punctuation mark (shad)]

ucca_formatted:
ཇི་ཙམ་དུ་མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་མེད་པ་དེ་ཙམ་དུ་མི་བརྫུན་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The root scene containing the entire Tibetan statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཇི་ཙམ་དུ་མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་མེད་པ་དེ་ཙམ་དུ [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Parallel structure showing the correlation between the absence of characteristics and the result" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཇི་ཙམ་དུ་མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་མེད་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The conditional scene describing the absence of excellent characteristics" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཇི་ཙམ་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial phrase indicating the extent or degree" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་མེད་པ [Type: State | Desc: "State describing the absence of excellent characteristics" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The participant that is negated in the state" | Implicit: ""]
                └── མེད་པ [Type: Negator | Desc: "Negation marker indicating the absence of the excellent characteristics" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ཙམ་དུ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Correlative scene matching the conditional scene" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེ་ཙམ་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial phrase indicating corresponding degree or extent" | Implicit: ""]
        └── (then) [Type: Implicit Linker | Desc: "Implicit logical connector indicating causal or conditional relationship between the parallel scenes" | Implicit: "Implicit logical connector indicating conditional relationship"]
    ├── མི་བརྫུན [Type: State | Desc: "The resulting state that follows from the conditional relationship in the parallel scenes" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── (ultimate truth/reality) [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "Implicit participant referring to ultimate truth or reality (དོན་དམ་པ) that is not false" | Implicit: "Implicit participant referring to ultimate truth or reality"]
        └── མི་བརྫུན [Type: State | Desc: "State indicating the quality of being not false or being true" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཏེ [Type: Elaborator-Function | Desc: "Clause-final particle indicating that an explanation or elaboration follows" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཇི་ཙམ་དུ་ : to the extent that [Correlative adverbial compound; `ཇི་ཙམ་` (how much/to what extent) + locative/terminative particle `དུ་`; establishes the proportional relationship in the first part of parallel structure; functions as an Adverbial modifier setting up the conditional relationship]

- མཚན་ : characteristics [Noun; refers to defining features or qualities of phenomena; functions as the first part of the compound term for "excellent characteristics"]

- ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་ : excellent/perfect [Adjectival compound; `ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་` literally "abundant, complete, perfect"; modifies "characteristics" to form "excellent characteristics" as the Patient that is being negated]

- མེད་པ་ : are absent [Negative existential verb; negation of `ཡོད་པ་` (to exist); indicates the absence of excellent characteristics; functions as the main Negator in the conditional clause]

- དེ་ཙམ་དུ་ : to that same extent [Correlative adverbial compound; `དེ་ཙམ་` (that much/to that extent) + locative/terminative particle `དུ་`; responds to the initial "ཇི་ཙམ་དུ་" to complete the correlative structure; indicates the proportional relationship]

- མི་ : not [Negative prefix; attaches to verbs to negate them; here negates "བརྫུན" to create "not false"]

- བརྫུན་ : false/deceptive [Verb/adjective; from root `རྫུན་` meaning "falsehood, lie"; here refers to the quality of being false or deceptive; functions as the main State predicate of the concluding clause]

- ཏེ་ : and, therefore [Clause-final particle; indicates that an explanation or elaboration follows; connects this statement to subsequent content; functions as an Elaborator-Function marker]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ལྟར་ན་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ་མཚན་དང་མཚན་མ་མེད་པར་བལྟའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing how to view the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ལྟར་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connects this instruction to previous context" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Practitioner] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit practitioner who is being instructed to view the Tathagata in a certain way" | Implicit: "The implicit practitioner who is being instructed"]
    ├── བལྟའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of viewing or regarding" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object being viewed (the Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མཚན་དང་མཚན་མ་མེད་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Describes the manner of viewing the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མཚན་དང་མཚན་མ [Type: Center | Desc: "The conventional characteristics of the Buddha's form body" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མེད་པར [Type: Attribute | Desc: "Indicates the ultimate non-inherent existence of characteristics" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Sentence-ending punctuation" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [Dual perspective of conventional and ultimate truth] [Type: Context | Desc: "Implicit philosophical context of viewing Buddha's form conventionally while understanding its ultimate emptiness" | Implicit: "Philosophical context of viewing Buddha's form conventionally while understanding its ultimate emptiness"]
glossary:
- དེ་ལྟར་ན : Therefore [Connector/adverbial; compound of `དེ་` (that), `ལྟར་` (like), and `ན` (if/when); "given what was previously stated"; functions as a Linker connecting this instruction to previous context]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ : to the Tathagata [Terminative case (`ལ`) of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ` (Tathagata/Buddha); literally "the one who has gone/come thus"; object (Patient) being viewed in this instruction]

- མཚན་དང་ : characteristics and [Conjunction; `མཚན་` (mark, sign, characteristic) plus connective `དང་` (and); refers to the defined, positive characteristics of the Buddha's form]

- མཚན་མ་ : marks [Noun; similar to `མཚན་` but with slightly different connotation of physical marks or signs; together with `མཚན་` refers to all characteristics, both conceptual and physical]

- མེད་པར་ : as being without [Adverbial form of `མེད་པ` (non-existence, absence); modifies how to view the Tathagata; indicates the ultimate non-inherent existence of characteristics]

- བལྟའོ : one should view [Volitive/imperative form of `ལྟ་བ` (to look, to view); main verb indicating the act of viewing; carries exhortative force; functions as the Process in the sentence]

- ། : [Punctuation mark indicating end of sentence]

དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ་དང༌། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root of the graph covering the entire source text" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ་དང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene: the Buddha's utterance" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [The Blessed One (Buddha)] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha who is the implicit speaker in the first scene" | Implicit: "The Buddha who is the implicit speaker in the first scene"]
        ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of speaking performed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Specifies the manner in which the Buddha spoke" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connects the first scene (Buddha speaking) to the second scene (Subhuti responding) in a temporal sequence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene: Subhuti's response to the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who is addressing the Buddha in the second scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསོལ་ཏོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of speaking or addressing performed by Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient of Subhuti's address, which is the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདི་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Introduces the content of what Subhuti says, functioning as an elaborator of the speech" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [Subhuti's question about the Buddha's form body] [Type: Implicit Content | Desc: "The implied content of Subhuti's speech which is not explicitly stated in this excerpt" | Implicit: "The implied content of Subhuti's speech which is not explicitly stated in this excerpt"]
        └── [Venerable, should one view the Tathagata based on his perfect characteristics?] [Type: Implicit Content | Desc: "The specific question about the Buddha's form body (gzugs sku) and its characteristics that Subhuti asks" | Implicit: "The specific question about the Buddha's form body (gzugs sku) and its characteristics that Subhuti asks"]
glossary:
- དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་ : thus [Adverbial compound: `དེ་`(that) + `སྐད་`(speech/manner) + `ཅེས་`(quotative marker); literally "like that speech"; functions as an Adverbial modifier indicating the manner of speech that preceded this section]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ་ : proclaimed [Past tense of `བཀའ་སྩལ་བ་`: to speak/proclaim (honorific); the process/action performed by the implicit agent (Buddha); indicates authoritative speech]

- དང༌ : and [Linker particle connecting two temporal scenes; here specifically connecting the Buddha's speech with Subhuti's response]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; `བཅོམ་` (conquered) + `ལྡན་` (possessing) + `འདས་` (transcended); one who has conquered afflictions, possesses qualities, and transcended suffering; functions as the recipient of Subhuti's address]

- ལ་ : to [Dative/locative particle marking the recipient of the action; here indicates that Subhuti's speech is directed toward the Buddha]

- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : Venerable [Honorific title; literally "endowed with life/longevity"; traditional epithet for senior monks; part of the agent identification]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of one of Buddha's chief disciples; Sanskrit: Subhūti; the agent/speaker in the second scene]

- གྱིས་ : by [Instrumental/agentive particle marking the agent; indicates Subhuti is performing the action of addressing]

- འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་ : as follows [Elaborator compound: `འདི་`(this) + `སྐད་`(speech/manner) + `ཅེས་`(quotative marker); introduces the content of speech that follows; functions as an elaborator of Subhuti's address]

- གསོལ་ཏོ : addressed [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request/supplicate (honorific); the process/action performed by Subhuti; includes the final particle `ཏོ` marking the end of a statement]

བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མ་འོངས་པའི་དུས་ལྔ་བརྒྱའི་ཐ་མ་ལ། དམ་པའི་ཆོས་རབ་ཏུ་རྣམ་པར་འཇིག་པར་འགྱུར་བ་ན་སེམས་ཅན་གང་ལ་ལ་དག་འདི་ལྟ་བུའི་མདོ་སྡེའི་ཚིག་བཤད་པ་དག་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་འདུ་ཤེས་བསྐྱེད་པར་འགྱུར་བ་འབྱུང་བ་ལྟ་མཆིས་ལགས་སམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene containing a question about future sentient beings' perception" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [རབ་འབྱོར] [Type: Participant-Addresser | Desc: "Implicit addresser (Subhuti) who is asking the question" | Implicit: "Implied speaker identified from context"]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The Buddha who is being addressed with the question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མ་འོངས་པའི་དུས་ལྔ་བརྒྱའི་ཐ་མ་ལ [Type: Time | Desc: "Temporal setting for the question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མ་འོངས་པའི་དུས [Type: Time | Desc: "The general future timeframe being referenced" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ལྔ་བརྒྱའི་ཐ་མ་ལ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Specifies the exact period within the future time" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དམ་པའི་ཆོས་རབ་ཏུ་རྣམ་པར་འཇིག་པར་འགྱུར་བ་ན [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial clause setting the circumstantial context for the main question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དམ་པའི་ཆོས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The holy Dharma which is the patient undergoing the process of disintegration" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་ཏུ་རྣམ་པར་འཇིག་པར་འགྱུར་བ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of the Dharma disintegrating" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ན [Type: Connector | Desc: "Temporal connector linking the disintegration of Dharma to the main question" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific address for Buddha; compound from `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); functions as the addressee of the question]
- མ་འོངས་པའི་ : future [Genitive of `མ་འོངས་པ་`: not-come, future; modifies "time" to indicate a future period; part of the temporal setting expression]
- དུས་ : time [Noun: time, period; refers to the timeframe in which the events are being discussed; forms part of the temporal setting]
- ལྔ་བརྒྱའི་ : five hundred [Genitive of `ལྔ་བརྒྱ་`: five hundred; quantifies the temporal period being specified; elaborates on the specific future time]
- ཐ་མ་ལ། : at the end [Locative of `ཐ་མ་`: end, final part; specifies the conclusion of the five-hundred-year period; completes the temporal setting phrase]
- དམ་པའི་ : holy [Genitive of `དམ་པ་`: holy, sacred, supreme; modifies "Dharma"; indicates the sacred nature of the teachings]
- ཆོས་ : Dharma [Noun: teaching, doctrine, phenomenon; refers to the Buddha's teachings; functions as the patient undergoing disintegration]
- རབ་ཏུ་ : thoroughly [Adverbial intensifier: completely, utterly; intensifies the following verb; emphasizes the complete nature of the disintegration]
- རྣམ་པར་ : completely [Adverbial: fully, completely; further intensifies the disintegration; adds emphasis to the thoroughness of the decline]
- འཇིག་པར་ : will disintegrate [Future form of `འཇིག་པ་`: to destroy, disintegrate; indicates the process happening to the Dharma; core verb in the adverbial clause]
- འགྱུར་བ་ : will become [Nominalizer of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform; indicates the transformation or process; completes the verbal phrase]
- ན་ : when [Temporal connector: when, at the time of; connects the circumstance of the Dharma's disintegration to the main question; functions as a temporal conjunction]
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Compound noun: `སེམས་` (mind) + `ཅན་` (possessor); refers to beings with consciousness; the subjects who might generate correct perception]
- གང་ལ་ལ་ : some, any [Indefinite pronoun: whoever, whatever, some; indicates an unspecified subset of sentient beings; shows uncertainty about which beings will have correct perception]
- དག་ : plural marker [Plural particle: modifies "sentient beings"; indicates multiple beings are being discussed]
- འདི་ལྟ་བུའི་ : such as this [Demonstrative adjective: this kind of, like this; modifies "sūtra"; indicates the text being specifically referenced]
- མདོ་སྡེའི་ : sūtra's [Genitive of `མདོ་སྡེ་`: sūtra, discourse collection; refers to the Buddhist canonical texts; specifies the type of teachings being discussed]
- ཚིག་ : words [Noun: word, phrase, expression; refers to the verbal expressions in the sutras; the content to which correct perception applies]
- བཤད་པ་ : explained [Nominalizer of `བཤད་པ་`: to explain, expound; indicates the process of teaching or explaining the sūtra; refers to the exposition of the teaching]
- དག་ལ་ : toward [Plural marker + dative-locative particle: indicates direction or object toward which the perception is generated]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : correctly [Adverbial: truly, correctly, perfectly; modifies the generation of perception; indicates the authentic quality of understanding]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Noun: perception, cognition, concept; refers to the mental faculty of recognition; the mental process being discussed]
- བསྐྱེད་པར་ : will generate [Future form of `སྐྱེད་པ་`: to generate, produce; indicates the creation of correct perception; the future action of the sentient beings]
- འགྱུར་བ་ : will become [Nominalizer of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform; indicates transformation or development; completes the verbal phrase]
- འབྱུང་བ་ : will arise [Nominalizer of `འབྱུང་བ་`: to arise, emerge, occur; indicates the arising or occurrence of the mentioned phenomenon]
- ལྟ་ : like [Comparative particle: like, as if; introduces a comparison or possibility]
- མཆིས་ : exist [Honorific form of `ཡོད་པ་`: to exist, to be present; polite form used when addressing the Buddha]
- ལགས་སམ། : is it? [Honorific question marker: polite form of interrogative; indicates that a question is being directed to an honored figure (the Buddha)]

བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་གང་ཁྱོད་འདི་སྐད་དུ་མ་འོངས་པའི་དུས་ལྔ་བརྒྱའི་ཐ་མ་ལ། དམ་པའི་ཆོས་རབ་ཏུ་རྣམ་པར་འཇིག་པར་འགྱུར་བ་ན། སེམས་ཅན་གང་ལ་ལ་དག་འདི་ལྟ་བུའི་མདོ་སྡེའི་ཚིག་བཤད་པ་དག་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་འདུ་ཤེས་བསྐྱེད་པར་འགྱུར་བ་འབྱུང་བ་ལྟ་མཆིས་ལགས་སམ་ཞེས་ཁྱོད་དེ་སྐད་མ་ཟེར་ཅིག ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the Buddha's entire statement to Subhūti" | Implicit: ""]

        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Speaker | Desc: "The Buddha as the speaker of the discourse" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of speaking/pronouncement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The addressee of the Buddha's statement" | Implicit: ""]
    └── གང་ཁྱོད་འདི་སྐད་དུ་མ་འོངས་པའི་དུས་ལྔ་བརྒྱའི་ཐ་མ་ལ། དམ་པའི་ཆོས་རབ་ཏུ་རྣམ་པར་འཇིག་པར་འགྱུར་བ་ན། སེམས་ཅན་གང་ལ་ལ་དག་འདི་ལྟ་བུའི་མདོ་སྡེའི་ཚིག་བཤད་པ་དག་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་འདུ་ཤེས་བསྐྱེད་པར་འགྱུར་བ་འབྱུང་བ་ལྟ་མཆིས་ལགས་སམ་ཞེས་ཁྱོད་དེ་སྐད་མ་ཟེར་ཅིག [Type: Scene | Desc: "The Buddha's instruction to Subhūti not to ask a specific question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མ་ཟེར་ཅིག [Type: Process | Desc: "Negative imperative to not speak certain words" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཁྱོད [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Subhūti as the agent being instructed not to speak" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་སྐད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The content that should not be spoken" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གང་ཁྱོད་འདི་སྐད་དུ་མ་འོངས་པའི་དུས་ལྔ་བརྒྱའི་ཐ་མ་ལ། དམ་པའི་ཆོས་རབ་ཏུ་རྣམ་པར་འཇིག་པར་འགྱུར་བ་ན། སེམས་ཅན་གང་ལ་ལ་དག་འདི་ལྟ་བུའི་མདོ་སྡེའི་ཚིག་བཤད་པ་དག་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་འདུ་ཤེས་བསྐྱེད་པར་འགྱུར་བ་འབྱུང་བ་ལྟ་མཆིས་ལགས་སམ་ཞེས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The hypothetical question that Subhūti should not ask" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── མ་འོངས་པའི་དུས་ལྔ་བརྒྱའི་ཐ་མ་ལ། [Type: Time | Desc: "The temporal setting specifically referring to the future time period" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── དམ་པའི་ཆོས་རབ་ཏུ་རྣམ་པར་འཇིག་པར་འགྱུར་བ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The condition of the destruction of the Dharma" | Implicit: ""]
                    ├── དམ་པའི་ཆོས [Type: Participant-Undergoer | Desc: "The Dharma as the entity experiencing destruction" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── རབ་ཏུ་རྣམ་པར་འཇིག་པར་འགྱུར་བ་ན། [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of complete destruction" | Implicit: ""]
                └── སེམས་ཅན་གང་ལ་ལ་དག་འདི་ལྟ་བུའི་མདོ་སྡེའི་ཚིག་བཤད་པ་དག་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་འདུ་ཤེས་བསྐྱེད་པར་འགྱུར་བ་འབྱུང་བ་ལྟ་མཆིས་ལགས་སམ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The question about future beings' correct understanding" | Implicit: ""]
                    ├── སེམས་ཅན་གང་ལ་ལ་དག [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The beings who might understand in the future" | Implicit: ""]
                    ├── འདི་ལྟ་བུའི་མདོ་སྡེའི་ཚིག་བཤད་པ་དག་ལ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The profound and vast teachings of the sutras" | Implicit: ""]
                        └── འདི་ལྟ་བུའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Refers to profound and vast teachings as explained in the commentary" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── ཡང་དག་པར་འདུ་ཤེས་བསྐྱེད་པར་འགྱུར་བ་འབྱུང་བ་ལྟ་མཆིས་ལགས་སམ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of generating correct understanding" | Implicit: ""]
                        └── [དོན་ལ་ཕྱིན་ཅི་མ་ལོག་པར] [Type: Implicit | Desc: "Implicit content specifying the understanding is about the meaning rather than just the words" | Implicit: "Implicit content specifying the understanding is about the meaning rather than just the words"]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ : The Blessed One [Agentive/Ergative case of `བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་`: "the Bhagavān" or "the Buddha"; functions as the Speaker/Agent of the utterance; refers to Śākyamuni Buddha]
- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། : spoke/proclaimed [Honorific past tense verb of `སྩོལ་`: "to give, bestow, speak"; formal speech act of the Buddha; functioning as the main Process in the discourse]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Proper name in vocative case; direct addressee of the Buddha's statement; one of the Buddha's chief disciples known for his understanding of emptiness]
- གང་ཁྱོད་ : you who [Relative pronoun `གང་` + second person pronoun `ཁྱོད་`; refers to Subhūti as the subject being addressed]
- འདི་སྐད་དུ་ : thus/in these words [Demonstrative `འདི་` + `སྐད་` "words/speech" + terminative particle `དུ་`; refers to the content that follows]
- མ་འོངས་པའི་ : future [Negated past of `འོང་` "to come" + genitive particle; the time that has not yet come; functions as a temporal modifier]
- དུས་ : time [Noun meaning "time, period"; base noun modified by "future"]
- ལྔ་བརྒྱའི་ : of five hundred [Numeral `ལྔ་བརྒྱ་` "five hundred" + genitive particle; specifies a duration of years; part of the temporal reference]
- ཐ་མ་ལ། : at the end [Noun `ཐ་མ་` "end, final part" + locative particle; refers to the final period of the specified timeframe]
- དམ་པའི་ : sacred/holy [Noun `དམ་པ་` "holy, sacred" + genitive particle; modifies "Dharma"; indicates the authentic Buddhist teachings]
- ཆོས་ : Dharma [Noun referring to the Buddha's teachings/doctrine; functions as the Undergoer in the destruction scene]
- རབ་ཏུ་ : completely [Intensifying adverb; emphasizes the totality of the destruction; functions as an adverbial modifier]
- རྣམ་པར་ : thoroughly [Adverbial prefix indicating "thoroughly, completely"; further emphasizes the completeness of the destruction]
- འཇིག་པར་ : destroyed/will be destroyed [Verbal noun `འཇིག་པ་` "destruction" + terminative particle; the process being described]
- འགྱུར་བ་ན། : when becomes [Verb `འགྱུར་བ་` "to become, transform" + locative particle `ན་`; indicates a future conditional time]
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Compound noun `སེམས་` "mind" + `ཅན་` "possessing"; refers to all conscious beings; functions as the Agent in the question]
- གང་ལ་ལ་ : some/any [Indefinite pronoun compound `གང་` "which" + reduplication of `ལ་`; means "some" or "whichever"; refers to unspecified future beings]
- དག་ : plural marker [Plural particle indicating multiple sentient beings]
- འདི་ལྟ་བུའི་ : such as this/like this [Demonstrative `འདི་` + `ལྟ་བུ་` "like, similar" + genitive particle; refers to the profound nature of the teachings being discussed]
- མདོ་སྡེའི་ : of the sutras [Compound noun `མདོ་སྡེ་` "collection of sutras" + genitive particle; refers to the canonical Buddhist texts]
- ཚིག་ : words [Noun meaning "words, expressions"; refers to the verbal expressions of the teachings]
- བཤད་པ་ : explained/teachings [Verbal noun from `འཆད་པ་` "to explain"; refers to the explanations or expositions of the sutras]
- དག་ལ་ : toward [Plural marker + locative-allative particle; indicates the object toward which understanding is directed]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : correctly/perfectly [Adverbial phrase `ཡང་དག་པ་` "correct, authentic" + terminative particle; qualifies the type of understanding developed]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception/understanding [Compound noun `འདུ་` "gather" + `ཤེས་` "know"; technical Buddhist term for conceptual understanding or recognition]
- བསྐྱེད་པར་ : generate/develop [Causative form of `སྐྱེ་བ་` "to be born" + terminative particle; refers to the cultivation of understanding]
- འགྱུར་བ་ : will become [Future auxiliary verb indicating change or transformation; marks the future tense]
- འབྱུང་བ་ : arise/emerge [Verbal noun from `འབྱུང་བ་` "to arise, emerge"; refers to the manifestation of understanding]
- ལྟ་མཆིས་ལགས་སམ་ : is it possible [Interrogative construction using honorific auxiliaries `མཆིས་` and `ལགས་` + interrogative particle `སམ་`; forms a respectful question]
- ཞེས་ : saying/thus [Quotative particle marking the end of the quoted speech or thought]
- ཁྱོད་ : you [Second person pronoun referring to Subhūti; the Agent being instructed]
- དེ་སྐད་ : in that way/like that [Demonstrative `དེ་` + `སྐད་` "words/speech"; refers to the content of the question that should not be asked]
- མ་ཟེར་ཅིག : do not say [Negative imperative formed with negation marker `མ་` + verb `ཟེར་` "to say" + imperative particle `ཅིག་`; functions as the main Process of the Buddha's instruction]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་མ་འོངས་པའི་དུས་ལྔ་བརྒྱའི་ཐ་མ་ལ་དམ་པའི་ཆོས་རབ་ཏུ་རྣམ་པར་འཇིག་པར་འགྱུར་བ་ན། བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་ཚུལ་ཁྲིམས་དང་ལྡན་པ། ཡོན་ཏན་དང་ལྡན་པ། ཤེས་རབ་དང་ལྡན་པ་དག་འབྱུང་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire passage about future bodhisattvas appearing during the decline of dharma" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Addressee | Desc: "The person being addressed (Subhuti) by the Buddha at the beginning of this teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མ་འོངས་པའི་དུས་ལྔ་བརྒྱའི་ཐ་མ་ལ་དམ་པའི་ཆོས་རབ་ཏུ་རྣམ་པར་འཇིག་པར་འགྱུར་བ་ན [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Temporal and circumstantial information establishing when the bodhisattvas will arise" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མ་འོངས་པའི་དུས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Time marker indicating the future period" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལྔ་བརྒྱའི [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Quantifier specifying the number of years" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཐ་མ་ལ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Specifies the final period of the five hundred years" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དམ་པའི་ཆོས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The holy Dharma that is disintegrating" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་ཏུ་རྣམ་པར་འཇིག་པར་འགྱུར་བ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of the dharma's complete disintegration" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connects the time of dharma's decline with the arising of bodhisattvas" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་ཚུལ་ཁྲིམས་དང་ལྡན་པ། ཡོན་ཏན་དང་ལྡན་པ། ཤེས་རབ་དང་ལྡན་པ་དག [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The bodhisattva mahasattvas who will arise, with their three qualities" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central referent - great bodhisattva beings" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཚུལ་ཁྲིམས་དང་ལྡན་པ། ཡོན་ཏན་དང་ལྡན་པ། ཤེས་རབ་དང་ལྡན་པ་དག [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration on the three trainings/qualities that characterize the bodhisattvas" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཚུལ་ཁྲིམས་དང་ལྡན་པ [Type: State | Desc: "First quality of the bodhisattvas - their state of possessing moral discipline" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཚུལ་ཁྲིམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The moral discipline possessed by the bodhisattvas" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡོན་ཏན་དང་ལྡན་པ [Type: State | Desc: "Second quality of the bodhisattvas - their state of possessing positive qualities" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཡོན་ཏན [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The qualities possessed by the bodhisattvas" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཤེས་རབ་དང་ལྡན་པ་དག [Type: State | Desc: "Third quality of the bodhisattvas - their state of possessing wisdom" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཤེས་རབ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The wisdom possessed by the bodhisattvas" | Implicit: ""]
    └── འབྱུང་སྟེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of bodhisattvas arising as a response to the dharma's decline" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative form; proper name of Buddha's disciple being addressed at the beginning of this teaching; functions as the direct addressee in this discourse]

- མ་འོངས་པའི་ : of the future [Genitive case of `མ་འོངས་པ་`: that which has not yet come; functions as a temporal modifier indicating a future period]

- དུས་ : time [Noun; referring to a specific temporal period; marks when the following events will occur]

- ལྔ་བརྒྱའི་ : of five hundred [Genitive case numeral; quantifies `དུས་` (years/epochs); specifies the duration of the future period]

- ཐ་མ་ : final period [Noun; refers to the end or conclusion; specifies the last part of the five hundred year period]

- ལ་ : in/during [Locative particle; indicates when the events will take place]

- དམ་པའི་ : holy/sacred [Genitive case of `དམ་པ་`: excellent, supreme; modifies `ཆོས་` to indicate the authentic/true teaching]

- ཆོས་ : Dharma [Noun; Buddha's teachings or doctrine; the subject experiencing decline; functions as the patient in this context]

- རབ་ཏུ་ : completely/thoroughly [Adverbial intensifier; strengthens the sense of disintegration]

- རྣམ་པར་ : thoroughly/completely [Adverbial modifier; indicates the comprehensive nature of the disintegration]

- འཇིག་པར་ : will disintegrate [Verbal noun from `འཇིག་`: to destroy, fall apart; indicates the process happening to the Dharma]

- འགྱུར་བ་ : will become [Future tense verb; indicates the transformation or change that will happen]

- ན་ : when [Temporal conjunction; connects the circumstance of the Dharma's decline with the arising of bodhisattvas]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattvas [Compound noun; beings dedicated to awakening for the benefit of all; functions as the agent in the main clause]

- སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་ : great beings [Compound noun; qualification of the bodhisattvas as mahasattvas or great heroic beings]

- ཚུལ་ཁྲིམས་ : moral discipline [Compound noun; ethical conduct; the first of three qualities possessed by the bodhisattvas]

- དང་ : and [Conjunction; connects items in a list]

- ལྡན་པ་ : endowed with [Verbal adjective from `ལྡན་`: to possess; describes the bodhisattvas as having moral discipline]

- ཡོན་ཏན་ : positive qualities [Compound noun; excellent attributes or virtues; the second quality possessed by the bodhisattvas]

- དང་ : and [Conjunction; connects items in a list]

- ལྡན་པ་ : endowed with [Verbal adjective from `ལྡན་`: to possess; describes the bodhisattvas as having positive qualities]

- ཤེས་རབ་ : wisdom [Compound noun; transcendent understanding or insight; the third quality possessed by the bodhisattvas]

- དང་ : and [Conjunction; connects items in a list]

- ལྡན་པ་ : endowed with [Verbal adjective from `ལྡན་`: to possess; describes the bodhisattvas as having wisdom]

- དག་ : plural marker [Particle; indicates multiple bodhisattvas]

- འབྱུང་ : will arise/appear [Future tense verb; indicates the main action of the bodhisattvas coming forth]

- སྟེ་ : and then/moreover [Continuative particle; suggests that more information will follow about these bodhisattvas]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་དེ་དག་ཀྱང་སངས་རྒྱས་གཅིག་ལ་བསྙེན་བཀུར་བྱས་པ་མ་ཡིན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The main scene describing how the great bodhisattvas have not served just one Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Addressee | Desc: "The vocative case addressing Subhuti directly, not indicating him as an agent" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་དེ་དག [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agents who have not served just one Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཀྱང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Linker modifying the entire statement to indicate 'even these great bodhisattvas'" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སངས་རྒྱས་གཅིག་ལ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The recipient of the service/offering" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གཅིག [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Quantifier directly modifying 'སངས་རྒྱས' to form 'one Buddha'" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བསྙེན་བཀུར་བྱས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of serving and honoring with robes, food, and other offerings" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ན་བཟའ་དང་ཞལ་ཟས་ལ་སོགས་པས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit content specifying the nature of service and offerings" | Implicit: "Clarifies implied or contextually understood content about the types of offerings made"]
    ├── མ་ཡིན [Type: Function | Desc: "Negation of the entire proposition" | Implicit: ""]
    └── སངས་རྒྱས་འབུམ་ཕྲག་དུ་མ་ལ་བསྙེན་བཀུར་ཞིང་དགེ་རྩ་བསྐྱེད་པ་ཡིན [Type: Contrastive | Desc: "Implicit contrastive element showing that they have served many Buddhas, not just one" | Implicit: "Implied contrastive information that clarifies what the bodhisattvas actually did"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative case; name of the Buddha's disciple being directly addressed; functions as Addressee in the discourse structure]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [Compound noun from `བྱང་ཆུབ་` (enlightenment) + `སེམས་དཔའ་` (hero/warrior of mind); one who seeks enlightenment for the benefit of all beings; functions as part of the Agent]

- སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་ : great beings [Compound of `སེམས་དཔའ་` (mind hero) + `ཆེན་པོ་` (great); refers to advanced bodhisattvas of high spiritual attainment; completes the Agent description]

- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural pronoun; refers to the aforementioned great bodhisattvas; completes the Agent phrase]

- ཀྱང་ : even [Emphatic particle; emphasizes that "even these" great bodhisattvas did not serve just one Buddha; functions as a Linker modifying the entire statement]

- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Noun; literally "the awakened one"; the enlightened teacher; serves as part of the Patient in the sentence]

- གཅིག་ : one [Numeral; qualifying Buddha as singular; emphasizes the limitation being negated; functions as Elaborator of `སངས་རྒྱས་`]

- ལ་ : to [Allative case marker; indicates the recipient of the service; completes the Patient phrase]

- བསྙེན་བཀུར་ : service and honor [Compound noun; `བསྙེན་` (to approach/serve) + `བཀུར་` (to honor/respect); refers to making offerings and showing devotion; forms the main Process element]

- བྱས་པ་ : having done [Perfectivizer of `བྱེད་` (to do); forms verbal noun with `བསྙེན་བཀུར་`; completes the Process element]

- མ་ཡིན : is not [Negation marker; `མ་` (negative prefix) + `ཡིན་` (to be); negates the entire proposition; implies that they served many Buddhas instead of just one]

ucca_formatted:
སངས་རྒྱས་གཅིག་ལ་དགེ་བའི་རྩ་བ་བསྐྱེད་པ་མ་ཡིན་གྱི། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of not generating roots of virtue for just one Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Bodhisattvas] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit Participant-Agent: bodhisattvas" | Implicit: "བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ (bodhisattvas)"]
    ├── བསྐྱེད་པ་མ་ཡིན་གྱི [Type: Process | Desc: "The negative process of not generating" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དགེ་བའི་རྩ་བ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The roots of virtue that were not generated" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སངས་རྒྱས་གཅིག་ལ [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The goal towards which the action is directed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སངས་རྒྱས [Type: Center | Desc: "The core entity of the participant-goal phrase" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གཅིག [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Specifies 'just one Buddha' as opposed to many, emphasizing limitation" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [They generated roots of virtue for many (hundreds of thousands of) Buddhas instead] [Type: State | Desc: "Implicit State: they generated roots of virtue for many Buddhas instead" | Implicit: "they generated roots of virtue for many (hundreds of thousands of) Buddhas instead"]
glossary:
- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Noun; honorific title for awakened being; the goal/recipient of the virtuous action according to semantic structure]
- གཅིག་ : one [Numeral; serving as a limiter "just one"; functions as an elaborator specifying limitation]
- ལ་ : for/to/towards [Allative case marker; indicates the goal/recipient of an action; marks the directional relationship] 
- དགེ་བའི་ : of virtue [Genitive of དགེ་བ་ (virtue, wholesome action); modifies the following noun; functions as part of the patient/object affected by the negative process]
- རྩ་བ་ : roots [Noun; literally "roots/foundations"; metaphorical term for foundational virtuous qualities; functions as the patient/object of the verb]
- བསྐྱེད་པ་ : generate/develop/cultivate [Verbal noun from the verb བསྐྱེད་ (to generate, produce); functions as the core process of the sentence]
- མ་ཡིན་གྱི : is not/did not [Negation marker མ་ followed by ཡིན་ (to be) and concluding particle གྱི; negates the preceding verbal phrase; implies contrast with implicit state]
