རབ་འབྱོར་སངས་རྒྱས་འབུམ་ཕྲག་དུ་མ་ལ་བསྙེན་བཀུར་བྱས་ཤིང་སངས་རྒྱས་འབུམ་ཕྲག་དུ་མ་ལ་དགེ་བའི་རྩ་བ་དག་བསྐྱེད་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་དེ་དག་འབྱུང་ངོ་། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene describing the emergence of bodhisattvas who have served many Buddhas" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Addressee | Desc: "The person being addressed by the Buddha in this teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་དེ་དག [Type: Participant-Agent-Center | Desc: "The main subject and central focus of the passage - the bodhisattvas who will emerge" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འབྱུང་ངོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of the passage - the future emergence of the bodhisattvas" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [མ་འོངས་པའི་དུས་སུ] [Type: Implicit Temporal Context | Desc: "Implicit temporal context indicating these bodhisattvas will appear in the future" | Implicit: "Indicates the future time when these bodhisattvas will appear"]
    └── སངས་རྒྱས་འབུམ་ཕྲག་དུ་མ་ལ་བསྙེན་བཀུར་བྱས་ཤིང་སངས་རྒྱས་འབུམ་ཕྲག་དུ་མ་ལ་དགེ་བའི་རྩ་བ་དག་བསྐྱེད་པའི [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Sequential, cumulative actions performed by the bodhisattvas that led to their emergence" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སངས་རྒྱས་འབུམ་ཕྲག་དུ་མ་ལ་བསྙེན་བཀུར་བྱས [Type: Scene | Desc: "First causal action - the bodhisattvas' service to many Buddhas" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བསྙེན་བཀུར་བྱས [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of serving and honoring" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སངས་རྒྱས་འབུམ་ཕྲག་དུ་མ་ལ [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Those to whom the bodhisattvas rendered service and honor" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཤིང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector between the two parallel actions" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སངས་རྒྱས་འབུམ་ཕྲག་དུ་མ་ལ་དགེ་བའི་རྩ་བ་དག་བསྐྱེད་པའི [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second causal action - the bodhisattvas' generation of virtuous roots with many Buddhas" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སངས་རྒྱས་འབུམ་ཕྲག་དུ་མ་ལ [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Those with whom the bodhisattvas generated roots of virtue" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དགེ་བའི་རྩ་བ་དག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The virtuous foundations that were generated by the bodhisattvas" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བསྐྱེད་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of generating or cultivating" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Vocative case; proper name of a prominent disciple of the Buddha; functions as the addressee of this teaching]

- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Nominative case; `སངས་རྒྱས་`: awakened one, an enlightened being; refers to fully enlightened beings who are the object of service]

- འབུམ་ཕྲག་ : hundreds of thousands [Quantifier; `འབུམ་`: hundred thousand + `ཕྲག་`: multiple; numerical descriptor indicating a vast quantity]

- དུ་མ་ : many [Adjectival modifier; `དུ་མ་`: numerous, multiple; describes the large number of Buddhas]

- ལ་ : to [Allative/dative particle marking indirect object; indicates the recipient of service and offerings]

- བསྙེན་བཀུར་ : service and honor [Verbal noun from `བསྙེན་`: to approach, serve + `བཀུར་`: to respect, honor; referring to acts of devotion and reverence]

- བྱས་ : performed [Past tense of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do, perform; indicates completed action of service]

- ཤིང་ : and [Clausal connector; joins two parallel activities performed by the bodhisattvas]

- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Repeated term; same as above; refers to the Buddhas with whom virtuous roots were cultivated]

- འབུམ་ཕྲག་ : hundreds of thousands [Repeated term; same as above]

- དུ་མ་ : many [Repeated term; same as above]

- ལ་ : with [Associative case marker; here indicating relationship with whom the virtuous roots were developed]

- དགེ་བའི་ : virtuous [Genitive of `དགེ་བ་`: virtue, wholesome action; qualities that lead to positive spiritual outcomes]

- རྩ་བ་ : roots [Nominative case; `རྩ་བ་`: root, foundation; metaphorical foundations of spiritual development]

- དག་ : plural marker [Plural particle; indicates multiple virtuous roots]

- བསྐྱེད་པའི་ : who generated [Genitive/attributive of `བསྐྱེད་པ་`: to generate, produce, cultivate; describes the action of developing virtuous qualities]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : awakening [Nominative case; `བྱང་ཆུབ་`: enlightenment, bodhi; the state of complete spiritual awakening]

- སེམས་དཔའ་ : being [Nominative case; `སེམས་དཔའ་`: hero of mind, courageous one; one who aspires to awakening for the benefit of all]

- སེམས་དཔའ་ : being [Repeated term, intensifying the previous]

- ཆེན་པོ་ : great [Adjectival modifier; `ཆེན་པོ་`: great, mighty; describes the high spiritual attainment of these bodhisattvas]

- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative pronoun; `དེ་`: that + `དག་`: plural marker; refers to the bodhisattvas described in the preceding clause]

- འབྱུང་ངོ་ : will emerge [Future tense of `འབྱུང་བ་`: to arise, emerge; with assertive particle `ངོ་`; main verb indicating the future appearance of these bodhisattvas]

- ། ། : [Final punctuation marking end of complete thought]

རབ་འབྱོར་གང་དག་འདི་ལྟ་བུའི་མདོ་སྡེའི་བཤད་པ་དག་ལ་སེམས་དད་པ་གཅིག་ཙམ་རྙེད་པར་འགྱུར་བ་དེ་དག་ནི། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་མཁྱེན་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Addressee | Desc: "The elder Subhuti who is being addressed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་དག་འདི་ལྟ་བུའི་མདོ་སྡེའི་བཤད་པ་དག་ལ་སེམས་དད་པ་གཅིག་ཙམ་རྙེད་པར་འགྱུར་བ་དེ་དག་ནི། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing those who generate faith in the sutras and their teachings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་དག [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The beings who will generate faith" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི་ལྟ་བུའི་མདོ་སྡེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The sutras themselves that are the object of faith" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདི་ལྟ་བུའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Modifier specifying the type of sutras" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཤད་པ་དག་ལ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The explanations or teachings of the sutras that are the object of faith" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མདོ་སྡེའི་བཤད་པ་དག [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept of the teachings or explanations of the sutras" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་དད་པ་གཅིག་ཙམ [Type: State | Desc: "The mental state of faith that generates immeasurable merit" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སེམས་དད་པ [Type: State | Desc: "The mental state of devotion or faith" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གཅིག་ཙམ [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Quantifier emphasizing that even a single moment of faith is significant" | Implicit: ""]
            └── immeasurable merit [Type: Result | Desc: "The implicit result of having faith - generating immeasurable merit as emphasized in the commentaries" | Implicit: "The implicit result of having faith - generating immeasurable merit as emphasized in the commentaries"]
        ├── རྙེད་པར་འགྱུར་བ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of generating or finding faith" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་དག་ནི། [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relator connecting to the next scene" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་མཁྱེན་ཏོ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the Tathagata's knowledge of these beings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Tathagata (Buddha) who knows" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མཁྱེན [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of knowing by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
        └── these beings who have generated faith [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implicit object of the Tathagata's knowledge - the beings who generate faith, their names, bodies, consciousness, and views" | Implicit: "Implicit object of the Tathagata's knowledge - the beings who generate faith, their names, bodies, consciousness, and views"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative; proper name of the Buddha's disciple; directly addressed by the Buddha as the recipient of this teaching; functions as Addressee in the sentence structure]

- གང་དག་ : whoever [Plural indefinite pronoun; refers to potential beings or individuals; functions as the Experiencer or the subject of the conditional clause]

- འདི་ལྟ་བུའི་ : such as this [Genitive of `འདི་ལྟ་བུ་`: like this, of this kind; modifies the sutras being referenced; specifies the particular type of sutras being discussed]

- མདོ་སྡེའི་ : sūtra's [Genitive of `མདོ་སྡེ་`: collection of discourses, sūtra; indicates possession, the explanations belonging to these sutras; connects the sutras to their explanations]

- བཤད་པ་ : explanations [Noun from `འཆད་པ་`: to explain, expound; refers to the teachings or commentaries on the sutras; serves as the object toward which faith is directed]

- དག་ : plural marker [Plural particle; indicates multiple explanations; emphasizes the various teachings]

- ལ་ : toward, in [Allative/locative case marker; indicates the object toward which faith is directed; connects the explanations with the generation of faith]

- སེམས་ : mind [Noun: mind, consciousness; the faculty that experiences faith; forms compound with the following word]

- དད་པ་ : faith [Noun: faith, devotion, confidence; the mental state of conviction in the Buddha's teachings; the key meritorious state being discussed]

- གཅིག་ : one [Numeral: one, single; emphasizes that even a single instance of faith is significant]

- ཙམ་ : merely, just [Restrictive particle: just, only, merely; emphasizes the minimal quantity—even just one moment of faith is valuable]

- རྙེད་པར་ : find, generate [Future of `རྙེད་པ་`: to find, obtain, generate; with the terminative particle `-པར་`; indicates the process of developing or obtaining faith]

- འགྱུར་བ་ : will become [Future of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform; indicates the future attainment of faith; completes the verbal phrase with རྙེད་པར་]

- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural pronoun: those, they; refers back to whoever generates faith; functions as bridge to the next clause]

- ནི། : topic marker [Emphatic particle marking the topic; highlights the beings with faith as the subject of the Buddha's knowledge]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [Ergative of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Thus-Gone One, epithet of the Buddha; agent who performs the action of knowing; indicates the Buddha's omniscient awareness]

- མཁྱེན་ཏོ། : knows [Honorific verb `མཁྱེན་པ་`: to know, understand (honorific); with final particle `ཏོ།` marking the end of the statement; indicates the Buddha's direct knowledge of these beings and their faith]

རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་དག་ནི་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གཟིགས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire utterance" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The person being addressed by the Buddha in this discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་དག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The individuals who are being seen/perceived by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ནི [Type: Function | Desc: "Topic marker emphasizing that 'those' are the focus" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གཟིགས་ཏེ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of seeing/perceiving by the Tathagata with its deeper spiritual significance" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the agent of perception" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གཟིགས [Type: Center | Desc: "The act of seeing that encompasses both physical form and deeper spiritual knowing" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [knowing and seeing] [Type: Elaborator-Attribute | Desc: "Elaboration of 'seeing' to include the deeper meaning of 'མཁྱེན་ཅིང་གཟིགས' (knowing and seeing) that encompasses perception of both physical form and spiritual capacity" | Implicit: "knowing and seeing"]
        ├── ཏེ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Connective particle indicating continuation of the discourse" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [spiritual knowing] [Type: Elaborator-Attribute | Desc: "Implicit content indicating the deeper doctrinal significance of the Tathagata's seeing as spiritual validation" | Implicit: "spiritual knowing"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར : Subhuti [Proper noun; name of a chief disciple of the Buddha; addressee of this discourse; functioning as the addressed participant in this scene]

- དེ་དག : those [Demonstrative pronoun; referring to individuals (likely sentient beings) who are being perceived; functions as the patient of the Buddha's perception]

- ནི : indeed [Topic marker; emphasizes that 'those' are the focus of discussion; establishes the topic of the sentence]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས : by the Tathagata [Agentive/instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ`; epithet of the Buddha meaning 'thus-gone one'; the agent who performs the act of seeing with spiritual insight]

- གཟིགས : sees [Honorific verb form of `མཐོང་`; to see, perceive; implies not just ordinary seeing but a profound spiritual perception that encompasses both physical form and deeper knowing]

- ཏེ། : and [Connective particle; indicates continuation of the discourse; connects this clause to what follows]

རབ་འབྱོར་སེམས་ཅན་དེ་དག་ཐམས་ཅད་ནི་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་བསྐྱེད་ཅིང་ཡོངས་སུ་སྡུད་པར་འགྱུར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire sentence about sentient beings and merit" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས་ཅན་དེ་དག་ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Participant-Topic | Desc: "The sentient beings who are the topic of discussion" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Addressee | Desc: "The person being addressed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ནི [Type: Function | Desc: "Topic marker particle in Tibetan" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The merit that is generated and accumulated" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Describes the quantity of merit as immeasurable" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [through correct perception] [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Implicit content indicating merit is accumulated through proper understanding" | Implicit: "The merit is accumulated through proper understanding"]
    ├── བསྐྱེད་ཅིང་ཡོངས་སུ་སྡུད་པར་འགྱུར་རོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of generating and accumulating merit" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསྐྱེད [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of generating merit when it arises" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡོངས་སུ་སྡུད་པར་འགྱུར་རོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of accumulating merit impressions at the time of cessation" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Sentence-final punctuation" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Proper name of a direct disciple of the Buddha; vocative case indicating he is being directly addressed; functions as the Addressee in the sentence]
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Noun compound from `སེམས་` (mind) + `ཅན་` (possessing); refers to all beings with consciousness; functions as the Topic/Agent of the sentence]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative pronoun; referring to specific sentient beings previously mentioned in the discourse; serves as a deictic specifier]
- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Universal quantifier; from `ཐམས་` (complete) + `ཅད་` (entirety); indicating totality without exception; modifies སེམས་ཅན་དེ་དག་]
- ནི་ : indeed [Topic marker particle; emphasizes the subject and marks it as the topic of discussion]
- བསོད་ནམས་ : merit [Noun; positive karmic energy or virtue; spiritual benefit resulting from positive actions; functions as the Patient in the sentence]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; connecting བསོད་ནམས་ to ཕུང་པོ་; showing possession or relation]
- ཕུང་པོ་ : heap/aggregate [Noun; from `ཕུང་` (pile/mass) + `པོ་` (nominalizer); literally a mass or collection; in Buddhist context refers to accumulation of merit]
- དཔག་ཏུ་ : to measure [Verbal phrase; from `དཔག་` (measure/fathom) + `ཏུ་` (purposive particle); indicates an action to be done]
- མེད་པ་ : without/immeasurable [Negation of existence; from `མེད་` (not exist) + `པ་` (nominalizer); modifies དཔག་ཏུ་ to mean "immeasurable/incalculable"]
- བསྐྱེད་ : generate/produce [Verb; past/future stem of སྐྱེད་པ་ (to generate); indicates the action of creating or bringing forth merit; functions as first Process verb in the compound predicate]
- ཅིང་ : and [Conjunction particle; connects the two verbal actions བསྐྱེད་ and ཡོངས་སུ་སྡུད་པར་]
- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely [Adverbial phrase; intensifier indicating thoroughness or completeness; modifies སྡུད་པར་]
- སྡུད་པར་ : accumulate/gather [Verbal noun; from `སྡུད་` (to collect/gather) + `པར་` (terminative particle); the action of amassing merit; functions as second Process verb]
- འགྱུར་རོ : will become [Verb + final particle; `འགྱུར་` (future tense of "to become") + `རོ` (sentence-final assertive particle); indicates certainty about future occurrence]
- ། : [Sentence-ending punctuation mark; equivalent to a period in English]

དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་དེ་དག་ནི། བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་པར་མི་འགྱུར་ཞིང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "Questioning process" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Topic being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་དེ་དག་ནི། [Type: Center | Desc: "Main subject of discussion" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Addressee | Desc: "Person being addressed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ [Type: Center | Desc: "Buddhist spiritual practitioner" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ [Type: Center | Desc: "Great being" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་དག [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Demonstrative reference" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ནི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Topic marker" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་པར་མི་འགྱུར་ཞིང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Description of mental state" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཇུག་པར་མི་འགྱུར [Type: State-Negated | Desc: "Negation of conceptual state" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Conceptual object not engaged with" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བདག་ཏུ [Type: Elaborator-Relator | Desc: "Reference to the concept of self" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Center | Desc: "Mental perception or conception" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the preceding topic or statement; functions as the patient/topic being questioned in the UCCA structure]
- ཅིའི་ : what's [Interrogative pronoun in genitive case; from `ཅི་`: what; used to ask the reason; forms part of the questioning process]
- ཕྱིར་ : reason [Noun meaning 'reason' or 'purpose'; combines with `ཅིའི་` to form the interrogative phrase 'for what reason'; part of the questioning process]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional particle indicating a rhetorical question; marks the end of the interrogative clause; completes the questioning process]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper noun; name of Buddha's disciple; functions as the addressee being directly spoken to in the discourse]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Noun; from Sanskrit 'bodhi'; refers to awakening or spiritual insight; forms part of the compound term for bodhisattva]
- སེམས་དཔའ་ : being [Noun; literally 'hero of mind'; second part of the compound term for bodhisattva; refers to one who strives for enlightenment]
- སེམས་དཔའ་ : being [Noun; repetition of the previous term; reinforces the concept of bodhisattva]
- ཆེན་པོ་ : great [Adjective; qualifying the bodhisattva as being of high spiritual attainment; indicates advanced practitioners]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural; refers to the previously mentioned bodhisattvas; specifies a particular group]
- ནི། : indeed [Topic marker particle; emphasizes the subject of the sentence; marks what follows as being about these bodhisattvas]
- བདག་ : self [Noun; refers to the concept of inherent, independent self or 'ātman'; the object not engaged with]
- ཏུ་ : as, into [Terminative case particle; indicates transformation or categorization; connects 'self' with 'perception']
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Noun; one of the five aggregates in Buddhism; refers to recognition or conceptual identification; the mental process at issue]
- འཇུག་པར་ : entering into [Verbal noun in terminative case; from `འཇུག་པ་`: to engage with, enter into; refers to the activity of engaging in self-perception]
- མི་ : not [Negative particle; negates the following verb; indicates the absence of the action]
- འགྱུར་ : become [Verb; indicates transformation or changing into a state; here negated to show non-engagement]
- ཞིང༌། : and [Conjunction particle; connects this clause to what follows; indicates this is part of a larger explanation]

ucca_formatted:
སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་མ་ཡིན། སྲོག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་མ་ཡིན། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་པར་མི་འགྱུར་བའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing three negations of perception/conception and their causal explanation" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་མ་ཡིན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First negation: not perceiving as sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [Bodhisattvas] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent - Bodhisattvas who do not perceive" | Implicit: "Bodhisattvas"]
        ├── འདུ་ཤེས་པ་མ་ཡིན [Type: Process | Desc: "Negated process of perception/conception" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སེམས་ཅན་དུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object of perception - represents grasping at 'mine' or possessive self" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྲོག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་མ་ཡིན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second negation: not perceiving as life" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [Bodhisattvas] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent - Bodhisattvas who do not perceive" | Implicit: "Bodhisattvas"]
        ├── འདུ་ཤེས་པ་མ་ཡིན [Type: Process | Desc: "Negated process of perception/conception" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སྲོག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object of perception - represents grasping at one's lifespan" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་པར་མི་འགྱུར་བའི [Type: Scene | Desc: "Third negation: not engaging in the perception of persons" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [Bodhisattvas] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent - Bodhisattvas who do not perceive" | Implicit: "Bodhisattvas"]
        ├── འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་པར་མི་འགྱུར་བའི [Type: Process | Desc: "Negated process of engaging in perception/conception" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གང་ཟག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object of perception - represents grasping at transmigration" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Causal connector providing the reason for all three negations" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Explanation or causal marker rather than a simple connector" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- སེམས་ཅན་དུ་ : as sentient beings [Terminative case marker དུ་ with `སེམས་ཅན་`: sentient being; indicating the object of perception; represents what would be grasped as "mine" or possessive self in Buddhist philosophy]

- འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ : perceive/conceive [Verbal noun from `འདུ་ཤེས་`: perception, conception; refers to the cognitive process of recognizing and categorizing phenomena; functions as the main process in this negation]

- མ་ཡིན། : is not [Negation marker མ་ with copula ཡིན; complete negation of the preceding perception; indicates the absence of this type of conceptualization]

- སྲོག་ཏུ་ : as life [Terminative case marker དུ་ with `སྲོག་`: life, vitality; object of perception in second negation; represents grasping at one's lifespan in Buddhist context]

- འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ : perceive/conceive [Verbal noun from `འདུ་ཤེས་`: perception, conception; parallel to the first instance; functions as the main process in the second negation]

- མ་ཡིན། : is not [Negation marker མ་ with copula ཡིན; complete negation of the preceding perception; indicates the absence of this type of conceptualization]

- གང་ཟག་ཏུ་ : as persons [Terminative case marker དུ་ with `གང་ཟག་`: person, individual; object of perception in third negation; represents grasping at transmigration or personhood in Buddhist context]

- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Noun `འདུ་ཤེས་`: perception, conception; the cognitive act of recognition; forms part of the verbal construction in this third negation]

- འཇུག་པར་ : engage in [Purposive of `འཇུག་པ་`: to engage, enter into; indicates the process of actively engaging in perception; combined with the following verb creates a more nuanced negation]

- མི་འགྱུར་བའི་ : will not occur [Future negative of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, occur, transform; with genitive particle འི་; indicates the non-occurrence of the perceptual process; serves as the main verb in the third negation]

- ཕྱིར་རོ། ། : because/for this reason [Causal connector `ཕྱིར་`: for, because; with final particle རོ; explains that the three preceding negations are causally related; functions as an explanatory conclusion to the entire passage]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་དེ་དག་ཀྱང་ཆོས་སུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་དང༌། ཆོས་མེད་པར་ཡང་འདུ་ཤེས་མི་འཇུག་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "root" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "addressee" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་དེ་དག་ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "main participant" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཀྱང་ཆོས་སུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་དང༌། ཆོས་མེད་པར་ཡང་འདུ་ཤེས་མི་འཇུག་སྟེ། [Type: State | Desc: "state of bodhisattvas' non-conceptualization" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཀྱང་ [Type: Linker | Desc: "additional marker" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་སུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "first state of perception" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── conceptualizing/perceiving [Type: Process | Desc: "implicit perception process" | Implicit: "Implicit perception process"]
            ├── འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ [Type: Process | Desc: "perception process" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཆོས་སུ་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "object of perception" | Implicit: ""]
                └── སུ་ [Type: Function | Desc: "case marker" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཆོས་མེད་པར་ཡང་འདུ་ཤེས་མི་འཇུག་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "second state of perception with causal relationship to first state" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡང་ [Type: Linker | Desc: "additional marker" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འདུ་ཤེས་མི་འཇུག་ [Type: Process | Desc: "negated perception process" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── འདུ་ཤེས་ [Type: Center | Desc: "conceptualization component" | Implicit: ""]
                └── མི་འཇུག་ [Type: Process | Desc: "negated engagement component" | Implicit: ""]
                    ├── མི་ [Type: Function | Desc: "negation marker" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── འཇུག་ [Type: Center | Desc: "engagement verb" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་མེད་པར་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "object of non-perception" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྟེ། [Type: Function | Desc: "connective particle explaining consequence" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Vocative name of the Buddha's disciple being addressed; functions as the recipient/addressee in this discourse]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [Compound term: `བྱང་ཆུབ་` (enlightenment) + `སེམས་དཔའ་` (hero/warrior of mind); one who seeks enlightenment for the benefit of all beings; functions as the main agent/participant in this statement]

- སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་ : great beings [Compound: `སེམས་དཔའ་` (mind-warrior) + `ཆེན་པོ་` (great); mahāsattva in Sanskrit; referring to advanced bodhisattvas of great spiritual capacity; part of the agent in the UCCA structure]

- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural marker; specifies the particular bodhisattvas being discussed; completes the agent phrase]

- ཀྱང་ : also/even [Emphatic and connective particle; indicates additional information about the bodhisattvas; functions as a linker in the semantic structure]

- ཆོས་སུ་ : as dharma/phenomena [Terminative case (`སུ་`) of `ཆོས་` (dharma/phenomena/things); the object of perception; indicates how things appear to consciousness]

- འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ : conceptualize [Verbal noun from `འདུ་ཤེས་` (perception/conception); refers to the process of forming concepts or perceptions about phenomena; functions as the main process in the first state]

- དང༌། : and [Connective particle joining the two clauses about perception; links the first state to the second state]

- ཆོས་མེད་པར་ : as non-dharma/no-phenomena [Terminative form of `ཆོས་མེད་པ་` (absence of dharma/phenomena); object of the negated perception; indicates the opposite concept to dharma]

- ཡང་ : also/even [Emphatic particle; adds emphasis to the second state of perception; functions as a linker in the semantic structure]

- འདུ་ཤེས་ : conception [Noun form of perception/conception; the conceptualization component that is being negated; forms part of the negated process]

- མི་ : not [Negation marker; negates the following verb; part of the negated process]

- འཇུག་ : engage [Present tense verb; literally "to enter/engage/apply"; indicates the activation of conception; the engagement component being negated]

- སྟེ། : thus/therefore [Connective particle concluding the statement; indicates a consequence or explanation follows; functions as the syntactic connector showing causal relationship]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་དག་ནི་འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་པར་ཡང་འཇུག་པར་མི་འགྱུར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of the sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་དག [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The subject of the sentence" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [implicit: བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit elaboration specifying that 'those' refers to bodhisattvas" | Implicit: "Reference to bodhisattvas is implied from context"]
    ├── ནི [Type: Function | Desc: "Topic marker indicating the subject" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner in which the action does not occur" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཡང [Type: Connector | Desc: "Emphasizing particle connecting the concept to the main clause" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདུ་ཤེས་ཡོད་པ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Implicit parallel concept to 'without perception'" | Implicit: "Implied parallel concept based on the context and commentary"]
    ├── འཇུག་པར་འགྱུར་རོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action verb of the sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མི་ [Type: Function | Desc: "Negation that modifies the process" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ། ། [Type: Punctuation | Desc: "Sentence-final punctuation" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་དག་ : they [Nominative plural demonstrative pronoun from `དེ་`: 'that'; refers specifically to bodhisattvas (implicitly understood from context); functions as the Participant-Agent of the sentence]

- ནི་ : as for [Topic marker particle; establishes 'they/those' as the topic of discourse; emphasizes the subject being discussed]

- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Nominative of `འདུ་ཤེས་`: perception, conception, discrimination; technical Buddhist term for the mental factor of recognition or discrimination]

- མེད་པར་ : without [Terminative case of `མེད་པ་`: non-existence, absence; negates `འདུ་ཤེས་` to mean 'without perception'; functions as an Adverbial modifier]

- ཡང་ : even/also [Conjunction particle; emphasizes that this is an additional point; connects the concept to the main clause]

- འཇུག་པར་ : engage in [Terminative case of `འཇུག་པ་`: to enter, engage, be involved; here referring to bodhisattvas' cognitive engagement; part of the main Process in the sentence]

- མི་ : not [Negative particle; directly negates the verb `འགྱུར་`; indicates the impossibility of the action]

- འགྱུར་རོ : will become [Future/present of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform; with final particle `རོ་` marking statement; completes the Process component of the sentence]

- ། ། : [End of sentence punctuation marks; indicates completion of the statement]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་གལ་ཏེ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་དེ་དག་ནི། ཆོས་སུ་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་ན་ཡང་དེ་ཉིད་དེ་དག་གིས་བདག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་ཞིང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node containing the entire text with question and conditional statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Rhetorical question scene that sets up the explanation that follows" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Subject matter being inquired about in the rhetorical question" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of questioning the reason" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གལ་ཏེ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་དེ་དག་ནི། ཆོས་སུ་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་ན [Type: Scene | Desc: "Conditional clause setting up the hypothetical situation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Addressee of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གལ་ཏེ [Type: Ground | Desc: "Initiates the conditional clause that's critical to the logical structure" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་དེ་དག་ནི། [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Agent who would have the perception of dharmas" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་ན [Type: Center | Desc: "Core concept of perception/conception that's central to the conditional statement" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཆོས་སུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object-of-Perception: what is being perceived (dharmas)" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཡང་དེ་ཉིད་དེ་དག་གིས་བདག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་ཞིང། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Consequent clause showing the result of the conditional" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཡང [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connector linking back to the conditional clause, showing that 'even though' relates this consequence to the previous condition" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་དག་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Agent performing the grasping (refers back to the bodhisattvas)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བདག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་ཞིང [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of apprehending or grasping at a self, treated as a single conceptual unit representing the key consequence of mistaken perception" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; functioning as the subject of inquiry in the rhetorical question]
- ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ : for what reason [Interrogative phrase; composed of `ཅི` (what) + genitive particle `འི` + `ཕྱིར` (for, because of); initiates the rhetorical question]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional verbal phrase from `ཞེ་བ` (to say, ask); marks the end of a rhetorical question; functions as a discourse marker]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; vocative case; addressee of the Buddha's statement; functions as recipient in the discourse]
- གལ་ཏེ་ : if [Conditional marker; initiates the hypothetical scenario; frames the logical structure of the argument]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [Sanskrit term; from `བྱང་ཆུབ` (enlightenment) + `སེམས་དཔའ` (hero of mind/awakening); agent in the conditional clause]
- སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་ : great being [Compound term; `སེམས་དཔའ` (mind-hero) + `ཆེན་པོ` (great); elaborates the qualities of the bodhisattva mentioned]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural; specifies a particular group of bodhisattvas; functions as definite reference]
- ནི། : as for [Topic marker; emphasizes the subject of the conditional clause; clarifies what is being discussed]
- ཆོས་སུ་ : as dharmas [Noun `ཆོས` (dharma, phenomena) + terminative case marker `སུ`; object of perception; what is being perceived]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Noun; Sanskrit: saṃjñā; refers to the mental aggregate of recognition/perception; core concept in the conditional statement]
- འཇུག་ན : if engage in [Verb `འཇུག་པ` (to engage, enter) + conditional marker `ན`; completes the protasis of the conditional statement]
- ཡང་ : even [Concessive particle; indicates "even though" or "despite"; connects the condition with its unexpected consequence]
- དེ་ཉིད་ : that very thing [Emphatic demonstrative; from `དེ` (that) + `ཉིད` (itself, precisely); refers to the perception just mentioned]
- དེ་དག་གིས་ : by those [Demonstrative plural `དེ་དག` + instrumental case marker `གིས`; refers back to the bodhisattvas as agents]
- བདག་ཏུ་ : as a self [Noun `བདག` (self) + terminative case marker `ཏུ`; indicates what is being grasped at]
- འཛིན་པར་ : grasping [Verbal noun from `འཛིན་པ` (to grasp, hold) + terminative marker `པར`; describes the act of apprehending]
- འགྱུར་ཞིང༌། : would become and [Verb `འགྱུར་བ` (to become, transform) + connective particle `ཞིང`; indicates consequence and suggests more consequences follow]

སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འཛིན་པ་དང༌། སྲོག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་བའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire text about grasping" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཕྱིར་རོ། [Type: Relator | Desc: "Causal relation marker indicating the reason" | Implicit: ""]
        └── grasping at self/ego-clinging [Type: Elaborate | Desc: "Implied consequence that the three types of grasping lead to self-grasping" | Implicit: "བདག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་"]
    ├── འགྱུར་བའི [Type: State | Desc: "State indicating the consequence of the three types of grasping" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── bodhisattva [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent (bodhisattva) who is doing the grasping" | Implicit: "བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ།"]
    ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འཛིན་པ་དང༌། སྲོག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར [Type: Center | Desc: "Central semantic focus containing the three types of grasping" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འཛིན་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First type of grasping - at sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཛིན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "Action of grasping for the first type" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སེམས་ཅན་དུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object of grasping - sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དང༌། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction linking the first and second types of grasping" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྲོག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second type of grasping - at life" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཛིན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "Action of grasping for the second type" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྲོག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object of grasping - life" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར [Type: Scene | Desc: "Third type of grasping - at persons" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཛིན་པར [Type: Process | Desc: "Action of grasping for the third type" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གང་ཟག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object of grasping - persons" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དང༌། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction linking the second and third types of grasping" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Nominative of `སེམས་ཅན་`: living beings endowed with consciousness; object of grasping in the first type; functions as Patient in the semantic structure]
- དུ་ : as [Terminative particle indicating the way in which something is grasped or perceived; marks the object of fixation]
- འཛིན་པ་ : grasping [Nominalizer of `འཛིན་`: to hold, grasp, fixate; denotes the cognitive action of reifying or conceptualizing entities; functions as Process in the semantic structure]
- དང༌། : and [Conjunction connecting the different types of grasping; links the three parallel scenes of grasping]
- སྲོག་ : life [Nominative of `སྲོག་`: life-force, vitality; the second object of grasping; functions as Patient in the semantic structure]
- ཏུ་ : as [Terminative particle similar to དུ་, indicating the way in which life is grasped or conceptualized]
- གང་ཟག་ : persons [Nominative of `གང་ཟག་`: individual, person; Sanskrit: pudgala; the third object of grasping; functions as Patient in the semantic structure]
- ཏུ་ : as [Terminative particle marking the way persons are grasped conceptually]
- འཛིན་པར་ : grasping at [Dative-locative of `འཛིན་པ་`: grasping; marks the action that leads to the consequence; Process of the third grasping scene]
- འགྱུར་བའི་ : will become [Genitive of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to change, transform, become; indicates the resultant state that follows from the three types of grasping; functions as the State element in the semantic structure]
- ཕྱིར་ : because [Causal connective indicating reason or purpose; links the three types of grasping to their implicit consequence (self-grasping)]
- རོ། : [Final particle marking the end of the sentence; indicates that this is an explanatory statement; often translated as "it is because..."]

གལ་ཏེ་ཆོས་བདག་མེད་པར་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་ན་ཡང་དེ་ཉིད་དེ་དག་གིས་བདག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་ཞིང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire conditional statement about perception and grasping" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གལ་ཏེ་ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conditional marker introducing the hypothetical scene" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་བདག་མེད་པར་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་ན་ཡང་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Conditional scene describing the perception of selflessness" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [Bodhisattvas] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agents (Bodhisattvas) who are perceiving the selflessness of phenomena" | Implicit: "Implicit agents (Bodhisattvas) who are perceiving the selflessness of phenomena"]
        ├── ཆོས་བདག་མེད་པར་ [Type: State | Desc: "Conceptual state of phenomena being without self-nature that is being perceived" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདུ་ཤེས་ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Mode of perception or conceptualization through which the state is apprehended" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འཇུག་ན་ཡང་ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of engaging in the perception, with concessive marker" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་ཉིད་དེ་དག་གིས་བདག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་ཞིང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Resultant scene describing the paradoxical outcome of grasping at self" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ཉིད་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The perception of selflessness that becomes the object of grasping" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་དག་གིས་ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agents (Bodhisattvas) who are grasping at self" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདག་ཏུ་ [Type: State | Desc: "Conceptual state of self-grasping that arises" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་ཞིང༌། [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of transformation into grasping" | Implicit: ""]
        └──  [Type: Causal | Desc: "Implicit causal relationship between the perception of selflessness and the resulting self-grasping" | Implicit: "Implicit causal relationship between the perception of selflessness and the resulting self-grasping"]
glossary:
- གལ་ཏེ་ : if [Conditional marker; introduces a hypothetical scenario; functions as a Linker in the semantic structure]
- ཆོས་ : phenomena [Noun; dharmas, phenomena, mental objects; here refers to all conditioned phenomena that are the objects of perception]
- བདག་ : self [Noun; ātman, essence, inherent identity; used in the philosophical concept of selflessness (anātman)]
- མེད་པར་ : as lacking [Negative existential + terminative case; from `མེད་པ་`: non-existence; indicates the state of phenomena being without self-nature]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Noun; saṃjñā, conceptual recognition; the mental faculty that recognizes and categorizes phenomena; functions as an Adverbial modifier describing the mode of cognition]
- འཇུག་ : engages [Verb, present tense; to enter, engage, initiate; describes the process of the perception being activated or operating]
- ན་ཡང་ : even if [Conditional + concessive particle; indicates a concession that despite the condition being met, the following consequence still occurs]
- དེ་ཉིད་ : that very [Demonstrative + emphasis marker; refers back to the perception of selflessness mentioned earlier; functions as Patient in the resultant scene]
- དེ་དག་གིས་ : by those [Demonstrative plural + agentive case; refers to the implicit agents (Bodhisattvas); functions as Agent in the resultant scene]
- བདག་ཏུ་ : as self [Noun + terminative case; indicates transformation or identification; describes the conceptual state that incorrectly arises]
- འཛིན་པར་ : grasping [Verbal noun + terminative case; from `འཛིན་པ་`: to grasp, hold, conceive; describes the process of clinging to concepts]
- འགྱུར་ : becomes [Verb, future/present tense; to transform, change into; indicates the paradoxical transformation from perceiving selflessness to grasping at self]
- ཞིང༌། : and [Connective particle; links this clause to a subsequent statement; indicates that the thought continues]

སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འཛིན་པ་དང༌། སྲོག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་བའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire statement about different forms of grasping and their causal relationship" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འཛིན་པ་དང༌། སྲོག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Collection of parallel scenes describing three types of grasping" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འཛིན་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing grasping to sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཛིན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of grasping or apprehending" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སེམས་ཅན་དུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Patient of the grasping process - sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction linking the first and second scenes" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྲོག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing grasping to life force" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཛིན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of grasping or apprehending" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྲོག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Patient of the grasping process - life force" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction linking the second and third scenes" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing grasping to persons" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཛིན་པར [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of grasping or apprehending" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གང་ཟག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Patient of the grasping process - persons" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འགྱུར་བའི [Type: Process | Desc: "Result/outcome of the grasping processes, indicating transformation or consequence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་ཟག་ཡོངས་སུ་གཅོད་མཁན་ [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The practitioner who engages in these forms of grasping to self-identity in various ways" | Implicit: "The practitioner who engages in these forms of grasping to self-identity in various ways"]
    └── ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Connector | Desc: "Causal connector indicating the reason or logical consequence, showing that the multiple forms of grasping are causally related" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- སེམས་ཅན་དུ་ : as sentient beings [Terminative case of `སེམས་ཅན་`: sentient being; the conceived object in the first type of grasping; functions as Patient in the semantic structure]

- འཛིན་པ་ : grasping [Nominalizer of `འཛིན་`: to grasp, hold, apprehend; the cognitive process of reifying or conceptualizing; functions as the Process in the first parallel scene]

- དང༌ : and [Conjunction linking the first and second scenes in the parallel structure; connects the different forms of grasping]

- སྲོག་ཏུ་ : as life-force [Terminative case of `སྲོག་`: life, vitality, prāṇa; the object incorrectly apprehended as an enduring entity; functions as Patient in the second parallel scene]

- འཛིན་པ་ : grasping [Nominalizer of `འཛིན་`: to grasp, hold, apprehend; the cognitive process of reifying the concept of life-force; functions as Process in the second parallel scene]

- དང༌ : and [Conjunction linking the second and third scenes; connects the different forms of grasping]

- གང་ཟག་ཏུ་ : as persons [Terminative case of `གང་ཟག་`: person, pudgala; the conceived object in the third type of grasping; functions as Patient in the third parallel scene]

- འཛིན་པར་ : to grasp [Terminative form of `འཛིན་པ་`: grasping; the process of conceptualizing or reifying personhood; functions as Process in the third scene]

- འགྱུར་བའི་ : becoming/occurring [Genitive of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform; indicates the resultant state or transformation that occurs due to these forms of grasping; connects the parallel scenes to their result]

- ཕྱིར་ : because [Causal connector meaning "for the reason that"; indicates that what precedes is the reason for something implied; functions as a logical connector showing causal relationship]

- རོ། ། : [Sentence-final particle indicating completion of thought; combines the statement marker `རོ་` with the double shad `།།` marking the end of a section]

དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔས་ཆོས་ཀྱང་ལོག་པར་གཟུང་བར་མི་བྱ་སྟེ། ཆོས་མ་ཡིན་པ་ཡང་མི་གཟུང་བའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire passage" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Rhetorical question that sets up the explanation" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར [Type: Questioning | Desc: "The questioning element" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ [Type: Center | Desc: "Reference to previous statement being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཞེ་ན [Type: Function | Desc: "Functional element completing the question form" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔས་ཆོས་ཀྱང་ལོག་པར་གཟུང་བར་མི་བྱ་སྟེ། ཆོས་མ་ཡིན་པ་ཡང་མི་གཟུང་བའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The answer to the rhetorical question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Address | Desc: "Addressee of the explanation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔས་ཆོས་ཀྱང་ལོག་པར་གཟུང་བར་མི་བྱ་སྟེ། [Type: State | Desc: "First part of the instruction about not grasping dharma" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔས [Type: Participant | Desc: "The subject who should not grasp" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་ཀྱང་ [Type: Center | Desc: "The object that should not be grasped" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཆོས [Type: Center | Desc: "The concept of dharma" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཀྱང [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Particle indicating addition" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ལོག་པར་གཟུང་བར་མི་བྱ་སྟེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action that should not be performed" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ལོག་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner of grasping that should be avoided" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཆོས་མ་ཡིན་པ་ཡང་མི་གཟུང་བའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Second part of the instruction explaining the reason" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་མ་ཡིན་པ་ཡང [Type: Center | Desc: "The second object that should not be grasped" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཆོས་མ་ཡིན་པ [Type: Center | Desc: "The concept of non-dharma" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── མ [Type: Negation | Desc: "Negation marker for dharma" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཡང [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Particle indicating addition" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མི་གཟུང་བའི་ཕྱིར་རོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The reason for the instruction" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── མི [Type: Negation | Desc: "Negation marker for grasping" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཕྱིར་རོ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relational element indicating reason" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the previous statement; functions as a Center in the UCCA structure, providing reference to what is being questioned]
- ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ : for what reason [Interrogative phrase; composed of `ཅི` (what) + genitive case marker `-འི` + `ཕྱིར` (purpose, reason); forms the core questioning element]
- ཞེ་ན། : if asked [Conditional form of `ཞེས་` (to say, to ask); completes the rhetorical question formula; functions as a functional element in the questioning structure]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; vocative case addressing the disciple Subhuti; functions as the Addressee of the explanation in the UCCA structure]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔས་ : the bodhisattva [Agentive/instrumental case of `བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་` (enlightenment being); the subject who should perform the action; functions as the main Participant in the scene]
- ཆོས་ : dharma [Noun; teachings, phenomena, reality; the first object that should not be grasped incorrectly; functions as the Center in the UCCA structure]
- ཀྱང་ : also, even [Particle indicating addition or emphasis; extends the scope of what should not be grasped; functions as an Adverbial modifier]
- ལོག་པར་ : incorrectly [Adverbial form of `ལོག་པ་` (wrong, reverse, incorrect); describes the manner of grasping that should be avoided; functions as an Adverbial modifier]
- གཟུང་བར་ : to grasp [Verbal noun in terminative case from `འཛིན་པ་` (to hold, grasp); the action being prohibited; forms part of the Process component]
- མི་བྱ་ : should not do [Negative future/modal form of `བྱེད་པ་` (to do); completes the prohibition; key part of the Process component]
- སྟེ། : and, because [Connective particle; joins the first prohibition with its explanation; serves as a discourse marker]
- ཆོས་མ་ཡིན་པ་ : non-dharma [Negated nominal phrase; `ཆོས་` (dharma) + negation marker `མ་` + nominalizer `ཡིན་པ་`; the second object that should not be grasped; functions as the Center of the second part]
- ཡང་ : also, too [Particle indicating addition; links this prohibition to the previous one; functions as an Adverbial modifier]
- མི་གཟུང་བའི་ : not grasping [Negative future verbal noun in genitive case; `མི་` (negation) + `གཟུང་བ་` (grasping) + `-འི` (genitive); the second prohibited action; forms part of the Process component]
- ཕྱིར་རོ། : because, for this reason [Terminative case `ཕྱིར་` (purpose, reason) + final particle `རོ`; indicates this is the reason for the preceding statement; functions as a Relator element marking the reason]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་བས་ན་དེ་ལས་དགོངས་ཏེ་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་གཟིངས་ལྟ་བུར་ཤེས་པ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས་ཆོས་རྣམས་ཀྱང་སྤང་བར་བྱ་ན། ཆོས་མ་ཡིན་པ་རྣམས་ལྟ་ཅི་སྨོས། ཞེས་གསུངས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བས་ན [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Functions as a reason/cause marker rather than a simple connector" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ལས་དགོངས་ཏེ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial modifying the main action" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་གཟིངས་ལྟ་བུར་ཤེས་པ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས་ཆོས་རྣམས་ཀྱང་སྤང་བར་བྱ་ན། ཆོས་མ་ཡིན་པ་རྣམས་ལྟ་ཅི་སྨོས། ཞེས་གསུངས་སོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The main scene of the Tathagata's teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who is speaking (the Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་གཟིངས་ལྟ་བུར་ཤེས་པ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས་ཆོས་རྣམས་ཀྱང་སྤང་བར་བྱ་ན། ཆོས་མ་ཡིན་པ་རྣམས་ལྟ་ཅི་སྨོས [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "The content of the Buddha's teaching containing parallel conditional statements" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་གཟིངས་ལྟ་བུར་ཤེས་པ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས་ཆོས་རྣམས་ཀྱང་སྤང་བར་བྱ་ན [Type: Scene | Desc: "The first part of the conditional statement about abandoning dharmas" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཤེས་པ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The people who understand the dharma as a raft" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་གཟིངས་ལྟ་བུར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma teaching metaphorically described as a raft that is no longer needed after crossing to the other shore" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཆོས་རྣམས་ཀྱང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharmas that should be abandoned" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── སྤང་བར་བྱ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of abandoning" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ན [Type: Connector | Desc: "Conditional marker establishing the logical relationship between clauses" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཆོས་མ་ཡིན་པ་རྣམས་ལྟ་ཅི་སྨོས [Type: Scene | Desc: "The second part of the conditional statement about non-dharmas" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཆོས་མ་ཡིན་པ་རྣམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The non-dharmas referenced in the rhetorical question" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ལྟ་ཅི་སྨོས [Type: Process | Desc: "A rhetorical verbal construction expressing that something is even more obvious" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གསུངས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The speaking action of the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Punctuation mark" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་བས་ན : Therefore [Compound connector: `དེ་` (that) + `བས་` (more than) + `ན` (if); functions as a reason/cause marker introducing the logical conclusion based on preceding arguments]
- དེ་ལས་ : from that [Ablative of `དེ་`: that, it; here indicating the source or basis of the Buddha's contemplation]
- དགོངས་ཏེ : having contemplated [Past stem of `དགོངས་པ་`: to contemplate, consider deeply; with connective particle `ཏེ`; indicates the Buddha's deliberate consideration of a teaching]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས : the Tathagata [Agentive/instrumental of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Thus-Gone One, epithet of the Buddha; functioning as the Agent who is speaking/teaching]
- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : of Dharma [Genitive of `ཆོས་`: dharma, teaching, phenomenon; modifies "enumeration" to indicate the teaching belongs to the Buddhist doctrine]
- རྣམ་གྲངས་ : enumeration [From `རྣམ་པ་`: aspect + `གྲངས་`: number; referring to a specific formulation or exposition of Buddhist teaching]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies the particular teaching being discussed in the immediate context]
- གཟིངས་ : raft [Noun; used in the famous Buddhist metaphor of dharma as a vehicle to cross to liberation]
- ལྟ་བུར : like, as [Comparative particle: `ལྟ་བུ་`: like, similar to + locative-terminative `ར`; establishes the metaphorical relationship]
- ཤེས་པ་ : understanding [Nominalized verb from `ཤེས་`: to know; refers to the cognitive act of comprehending the teaching as a vehicle]
- རྣམས་ཀྱིས : by those who [Pluralizer `རྣམས་` + instrumental/agentive `ཀྱིས`; marks the Agent who understands and should abandon]
- ཆོས་རྣམས་ : dharmas [Plural of `ཆོས་`: dharma, teaching, phenomenon; the objects to be abandoned, referring to conceptual constructs of Buddhism]
- ཀྱང་ : even, also [Emphatic particle; emphasizes that even the dharmas themselves should be abandoned]
- སྤང་བར་ : to abandon [Future/present of `སྤོང་`: to abandon, relinquish + terminative `བར`; indicates the action of letting go]
- བྱ་ : should do [Future/modal auxiliary of `བྱེད་`: to do; creates the imperative sense of necessity]
- ན : if [Conditional particle; establishes the logical premise for the following rhetorical question]
- ཆོས་མ་ཡིན་པ་ : non-dharmas [Negation of `ཆོས་`: dharma with `མ་ཡིན་པ་`: not being; refers to concepts or teachings contrary to Buddhist doctrine]
- རྣམས་ : (plural marker) [Pluralizer; indicates multiple instances of non-dharmas]
- ལྟ་ཅི་སྨོས : what need is there to mention [Rhetorical construction: `ལྟ་`: to look + `ཅི་`: what + `སྨོས་`: to mention; expresses that something is even more obvious or unnecessary to state]
- ཞེས་ : thus, saying [Quotative particle; marks the end of the Buddha's quoted speech]
- གསུངས་སོ : taught, said [Past of `གསུང་`: to speak (honorific) + final particle `སོ`; indicates the Buddha's act of teaching]
- ། : (shad) [Punctuation mark equivalent to period]

ucca_formatted:
གཞན་ཡང་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene depicting the Buddha's teaching to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གཞན་ཡང [Type: Time | Desc: "Temporal marker indicating a new occasion in the discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Agent who is speaking (the Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Disciple receiving the Buddha's teachings on emptiness" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The content of speech" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [teachings on emptiness and non-attachment to dharmas] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit content of the Buddha's speech about not clinging to concepts" | Implicit: "Implicit content of the Buddha's speech about not clinging to concepts"]
    ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The speech act" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [delivering a teaching or instruction] [Type: Center-Elaborator | Desc: "This elaborates that the process is specifically a speech act for delivering Buddhist teachings" | Implicit: "This elaborates that the process is specifically a speech act for delivering Buddhist teachings"]
    └── [पुनरपरं भगवानायुष्मन्तं सुभूतिमेतदवोचत्] [Type: Parallel-Scene | Desc: "Sanskrit parallel of the same content (implicit)" | Implicit: "Sanskrit parallel of the same content"]
glossary:
- གཞན་ཡང་ : furthermore [Adverbial connector; from `གཞན་` meaning "other" + `-ཡང་` meaning "also"; denotes a temporal transition to a new section of the teaching; functions as a Time marker in the discourse structure]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific epithet for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to one who has conquered afflictions, possesses qualities, and transcended samsara; serves as the Agent/speaker in this scene]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates agency or means; marks the Buddha as the active agent performing the action of speaking]

- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : Venerable [Honorific title; literally "possessing life/longevity"; compound of `ཚེ་` (life), `དང་` (and), `ལྡན་པ་` (possessing); formal address for respected monastics; modifies "Subhuti" as part of the Recipient phrase]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; name of one of Buddha's chief disciples, particularly associated with teachings on emptiness; functions as the direct Recipient of the Buddha's speech]

- ལ་ : to [Dative case marker; indicates the recipient of an action; marks Subhuti as the one to whom the speech is directed]

- འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་ : thus [Quotative phrase; literally "in these words"; `འདི་` (this), `སྐད་` (speech/language), `ཅེས་` (quotative marker); introduces direct discourse; functions as Patient indicating the content about to be spoken]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། : proclaimed [Honorific past tense verb; `བཀའ་` (speech/word of Buddha), `སྩལ་` (honorific for "give/bestow"); the verb of speaking appropriate for a Buddha's teachings; marks the completion of the Process of formal religious instruction]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of Buddha asking Subhūti what he thinks" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Person being directly addressed in the question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Demonstrative referring to the content being asked about" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས [Type: State | Desc: "State of thinking or considering rather than an active process" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Buddha] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha (བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས) who is asking the question to Subhūti" | Implicit: "The Buddha who is asking the question to Subhūti"]
    └── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Interrogative adverbial construction indicating this is a rhetorical question" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Vocative case; proper name of the Buddha's disciple being addressed; functions as the Addressee in this rhetorical question]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the content/topic about to be discussed; serves as the Patient or object of contemplation]
- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [Interrogative adverbial construction; composed of ཇི་ "how/what" + སྙམ་ "to think" + དུ་ connective particle; marks this as a rhetorical question inviting reflection]
- སེམས : think/consider [Present tense verb; root meaning "to think/contemplate"; here used as a stative verb rather than an active process; the main predicate of the sentence]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པའི་གང་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་ཡོད་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Interrogative Scene | Desc: "The root node representing the entire interrogative structure of the Buddha's question to Subhūti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་/དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit questioner (Buddha/Tathāgata) asking the question" | Implicit: "The questioner who is not explicitly stated in this sentence"]
    ├── སྙམ་མམ [Type: Process | Desc: "The questioning process marker" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Implicit Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The implicit addressee (Subhūti) being asked the question" | Implicit: "The addressee who is not explicitly mentioned in this sentence"]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པའི་གང་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་ཡོད [Type: Center | Desc: "The core propositional content being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པའི་གང་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central content being questioned about" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་དེ [Type: Center | Desc: "The dharma being questioned about" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པའི་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི [Type: Participant-Scene | Desc: "The embedded scene of the Tathāgata's awakening" | Implicit: ""]
                └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པའི [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent of the awakening process" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of awakening" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The goal or state of enlightenment that was realized" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── བླ་ན་མེད་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration on the quality of enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཡང་དག་པར [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Further elaboration on the quality of enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
                └── རྫོགས་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Further elaboration on the quality of enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཡོད [Type: State | Desc: "The state of existence being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
    └── གང་ཡང [Type: Function | Desc: "Interrogative function that emphasizes the questioning of existence" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པའི་ : of the Tathāgata [Genitive of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "Thus-Gone One"; refers to the Buddha; functions as the agent of the awakening process]
- གང་ : any [Interrogative pronoun; serves as part of the interrogative structure questioning existence]
- བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ : unsurpassed [Adjective from `བླ་ན་མེད་པ་`: without superior, supreme; qualifies the enlightenment as the highest possible state; elaborates on the quality of enlightenment]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfect, authentic [Adverbial modifier from `ཡང་དག་པ་`: genuine, authentic; further elaborates on the quality of enlightenment]
- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive of `རྫོགས་པ་`: complete, perfect; qualifies the enlightenment as fully realized; elaborates on the quality of enlightenment]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་ : into enlightenment [Terminative case of `བྱང་ཆུབ་`: bodhi, awakening; indicates the goal or state that was realized]
- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly [Adverbial modifier from `མངོན་པ་`: manifest, evident; describes how the awakening process occurred]
- རྫོགས་པར་ : completely [Adverbial modifier from `རྫོགས་པ་`: complete, perfect; describes the thoroughness of the awakening]
- སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ : awakened [Genitive of `སངས་རྒྱས་`: to awaken, become a Buddha; refers to the process of attaining Buddhahood]
- ཆོས་ : dharma [Noun: teaching, phenomenon, quality; refers to the doctrine or phenomenon being questioned]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the specific dharma or teaching in question]
- གང་ཡང་ : any whatsoever [Emphatic interrogative construction; intensifies the questioning of existence]
- ཡོད་ : exists [Verb: to exist, to be present; the state of existence being questioned]
- སྙམ་མམ། : do you think? [Interrogative verbal phrase from `སྙམ་`: to think; with interrogative suffix `-འམ`; marks this as a question addressed to the implicit addressee]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་བསྟན་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene containing the questioning event" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Subhuti] [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The addressee is Subhuti, to whom the question is directed" | Implicit: "Subhuti, to whom the question is directed"]
    ├── སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The main questioning process that frames the entire sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་བསྟན [Type: Embedded-Scene | Desc: "The embedded scene about the Tathagata teaching, which is the content being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Tathagata (Thus-Gone One) who is the agent of the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསྟན [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of teaching/explaining the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [in relation to supreme perfect enlightenment] [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Implicit context about the teaching being in relation to supreme perfect enlightenment" | Implicit: "Context about the teaching being in relation to supreme perfect enlightenment"]
        └── ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma (teaching) that is being questioned about" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་དེ [Type: Center | Desc: "The core concept of dharma being referred to" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གང་ཡང [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Interrogative qualifier indicating 'any whatsoever' rather than a quantity" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : By the Tathagata [Instrumental/Agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Thus-Gone One, Buddha; here functioning as the Agent of the teaching action in the embedded scene]

- ཆོས་ : dharma [Root noun: `ཆོས་`: dharma, teaching, phenomenon; functions as the Patient of the teaching action, the core object being taught or explained]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun modifying dharma; specifies a particular teaching being referenced in the context]

- གང་ཡང་ : any whatsoever [Interrogative qualifier: `གང་`: what/which + `ཡང་`: even/also; functions as an Elaborator indicating complete absence rather than quantity]

- བསྟན་ : taught [Past tense of `སྟོན་པ་`: to teach, show, demonstrate; the main Process in the embedded scene describing the Buddha's action]

- སྙམ་ : think [Root verb: `སྙམ་པ་`: to think, consider; functions as the Process of questioning in the main scene]

- མམ། : or not? [Interrogative particle indicating a yes/no question; transforms the sentence into a question addressed to Subhuti (implicit addressee)]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ་དང༌། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing the entire passage with two scenes connected by a linker" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ་དང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing the Buddha's speech act" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent (the Buddha/Bhagavan) who is speaking in the first scene" | Implicit: "The agent (Buddha/Bhagavan) who is speaking is implied but not explicitly mentioned in the text"]
        ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of speaking or proclaiming" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Relator | Desc: "Phrase indicating reference to previously spoken words" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དང༌། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction connecting the two scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene describing Subhuti's response to the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent (Subhuti) who is addressing the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient (the Buddha) being addressed by Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསོལ་ཏོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of addressing or saying" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདི་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Relator | Desc: "Phrase introducing the words about to be spoken" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་ : thus [Adverbial phrase; `དེ་`: that + `སྐད་`: speech/words + `ཅེས་`: quotative marker; refers to words previously spoken; functions as a Relator introducing reported speech]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ་ : proclaimed [Past tense of `བཀའ་སྩལ་བ་`: to proclaim, speak (honorific); indicates the Buddha's speech act; functions as the main Process in the first scene]

- དང༌། : and [Conjunction; connects two scenes temporally; functions as a Linker between the Buddha's speech and Subhuti's response]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ་ : to the Blessed One [Dative/Locative case of `བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་`: the Blessed One, Bhagavan (epithet of Buddha); marks the recipient of Subhuti's address; functions as Participant-Recipient in the second scene]

- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : venerable [Honorific title; `ཚེ་`: life + `དང་`: with + `ལྡན་པ་`: possessing; literally "one endowed with life"; describes Subhuti as an elder monk; part of the Agent phrase]

- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhuti [Ergative case of `རབ་འབྱོར་`: Subhuti (name of disciple); marks the agent performing the action; functions as Participant-Agent in the second scene]

- འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་ : as follows [Adverbial phrase; `འདི་`: this + `སྐད་`: speech/words + `ཅེས་`: quotative marker; introduces words about to be spoken; functions as a Relator introducing forthcoming speech]

- གསོལ་ཏོ། : said, addressed [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to say, request (honorific); indicates Subhuti's speech act directed to the Buddha; functions as the main Process in the second scene]

- ། : [Sentence-final particle; marks end of the section]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་བདག་གིས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་གསུངས་པའི་དོན་འཚལ་བ་ལྟར་ན། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གང་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མ་མཆིས་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "The root node containing the complete utterance by Subhūti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་བདག་གིས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་གསུངས་པའི་དོན་འཚལ་བ་ལྟར་ན [Type: Scene | Desc: "The first scene depicting Subhūti addressing the Buddha and stating his understanding" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The Buddha being addressed by Subhūti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདག་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Subhūti as the one who understands" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་གསུངས་པའི་དོན [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept that is being understood" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the one who taught" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གསུངས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འཚལ་བ་ལྟར་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of understanding or knowing" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གང་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མ་མཆིས་ལགས་སོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The second scene depicting the conclusion of Subhūti's understanding" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Tathagata (Buddha) as the agent" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The qualities elaborating the nature of enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The goal of awakening" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of becoming fully awakened" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མ་མཆིས་ལགས་སོ [Type: Process-Result | Desc: "The result or conclusion expressing the non-existence of dharma" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཆོས་དེ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept that is negated" | Implicit: ""]
    └──  [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connects the understanding (first scene) with its conclusion (second scene)" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Term of address for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered, the four maras), `ལྡན་` (possessing, the qualities), `འདས་` (transcended, samsara); functions as Addressee in the discourse structure]

- བདག་གིས་ : I [Ergative of `བདག་`: self, I; here indicating Subhūti as the agent/speaker; functions as the primary Agent in the first scene]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ : by the Blessed One [Ergative of `བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་`: Buddha; marks the Buddha as the Agent/speaker of the original teaching being referenced; functions as the Agent of the teaching]

- གསུངས་པའི་ : that was taught [Past participle of `གསུང་`: to speak, teach (honorific); with genitive particle connecting to `དོན་`; indicates the Process of teaching performed by the Buddha]

- དོན་ : meaning [Noun: meaning, purpose, intent; the doctrinal content that was taught; functions as the central concept being understood]

- འཚལ་བ་ : understand [Present tense of `འཚལ་བ་`: to know, understand; indicates Subhūti's active comprehension; functions as the main Process in the first scene]

- ལྟར་ན་ : according to [Postposition: according to, in accordance with; connects Subhūti's understanding to what follows; functions as a discourse marker]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Ergative of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Thus-Gone One, epithet of Buddha; marks the Buddha as the Agent in the second scene]

- གང་ : which [Relative pronoun: that which, whatever; introducing the object of attainment; functions as a connector to the following qualities]

- བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ : unsurpassed [Negative of `བླ་ན་`: above, superior; meaning "without anything higher"; qualifies the awakening as supreme; functions as an Elaborator]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfect [Adverbial form of `ཡང་དག་པ་`: authentic, genuine, correct; intensifies the completeness; functions as an Elaborator]

- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive form of `རྫོགས་པ་`: complete, perfect; qualifies the awakening; functions as an Elaborator]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་ : as awakening [Terminative case of `བྱང་ཆུབ་`: enlightenment, bodhi; indicating the goal state; functions as the Goal]

- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly [Adverb: visibly, evidently; intensifies the completeness of awakening; part of the Process description]

- རྫོགས་པར་ : completely [Adverb from `རྫོགས་པ་`: complete; emphasizes the thoroughness of awakening; part of the Process description]

- སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ : awakened [Genitive of `སངས་རྒྱས་`: to become awakened, buddha; the Process of becoming fully enlightened]

- ཆོས་ : dharma [Noun: teaching, phenomenon, quality; the purported object of attainment; functions as the central concept being negated]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun: that; referring to the dharma mentioned; functions to specify the particular dharma]

- གང་ཡང་ : whatsoever [Indefinite pronoun: anything, whatever; reinforces the negation; emphasizes the absence of any dharma]

- མ་མཆིས་ : does not exist [Negative of `མཆིས་`: to exist (honorific); the primary negation in the conclusion; functions as the Result]

- ལགས་སོ་ : it is [Polite final verb: is, are; honorific assertion marker; completes the utterance with formal respect]
