དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་བསྟན་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མ་མཆིས་ལགས་སོ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire statement about the non-existence of dharma taught by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who is said to have taught the dharma (the Tathagata/Thus-Gone One)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བསྟན་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of teaching or expounding the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma (teaching) that is the patient of the teaching action" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Demonstrative that elaborates on which dharma is being referred to" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གང་ཡང [Type: Quantifier | Desc: "Universal quantifier that intensifies the scope of negation applied to dharma" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── in ultimate truth [Type: Contextual-Frame | Desc: "Implicit contextual frame indicating that the negation applies in terms of ultimate truth (don dam pa), not conventional reality" | Implicit: "Refers to the philosophical context of ultimate truth (don dam pa)"]
    └── མ་མཆིས་ལགས་སོ [Type: Negator | Desc: "The philosophical negation that denies the existence of dharma taught by the Tathagata in ultimate truth" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ`: literally "Thus-Gone One", epithet of the Buddha; functions as the Agent who is attributed with the teaching action]

- བསྟན་པའི་ : taught [Genitive/attributive form of `སྟོན་པ`: to teach, show, demonstrate; past tense form connecting to the dharma that follows; functions as the Process that links the Agent to the Patient]

- ཆོས་ : dharma [Root word `ཆོས`: dharma, teaching, phenomenon, truth; the Patient of the teaching action; refers to the Buddha's teachings or doctrines]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun `དེ`: that; elaborates which specific dharma is being referred to; marks the previously mentioned dharma]

- གང་ཡང་ : whatsoever [Combination of `གང`: which, whatever + `ཡང`: even, also; functions as a universal quantifier that extends the scope of the negation; intensifies the negation that follows]

- མ་མཆིས་ : does not exist [Negated form of `མཆིས`: honorific verb for "to exist"; the negation marker `མ` indicates this is a negation in past/present context; functions as the primary Negator of the sentence]

- ལགས་སོ : is [Final particle `ལགས`: honorific copula verb + `སོ`: sentence-final particle indicating a declarative statement; marks formal, respectful speech and completes the negation assertion]

དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའམ། བསྟན་པ་དེ་ནི་གཟུང་དུ་མ་མཆིས་བརྗོད་དུ་མ་མཆིས་ཏེ། [Type: ParallelScene | Desc: "Root node containing the rhetorical question and explanation structure" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Interrogative phrase establishing the rhetorical structure" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ [Type: Function | Desc: "Reference to previous context or statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ [Type: State | Desc: "Interrogative expression inquiring about reason" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཞེ་ན། [Type: Function | Desc: "Question marker in Tibetan" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First part of the explanation about the Tathagata's enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ [Type: Participant | Desc: "Agent of the enlightenment and teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་དེ་ [Type: Participant | Desc: "The object/content that is enlightened or taught" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་ཡང་ [Type: Function | Desc: "Qualifier indicating universality" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of complete enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འམ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Conjunction connecting alternatives" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བསྟན་པ་དེ་ནི་གཟུང་དུ་མ་མཆིས་བརྗོད་དུ་མ་མཆིས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Statement about the ungraspable and inexpressible nature of dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསྟན་པ་དེ་ [Type: Participant | Desc: "The teaching that is being characterized" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ནི་ [Type: Function | Desc: "Topic marker in Tibetan" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གཟུང་དུ་ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Quality of being graspable/conceivable" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མ་མཆིས་ [Type: Negation | Desc: "Negation of graspability" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བརྗོད་དུ་ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Quality of being expressible" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མ་མཆིས་ [Type: Negation | Desc: "Negation of expressibility" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཏེ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Conjunction indicating continuation" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ultimate truth versus conventional reality [Type: ImplicitUnit | Desc: "Implicit philosophical distinction between ultimate and conventional truth" | Implicit: "Clarifies implied philosophical distinction necessary for comprehension"]
        ├── ultimate truth (don dam pa) [Type: ImplicitUnit | Desc: "Implicit reference to ultimate truth" | Implicit: "Implicit reference to the Buddhist concept of ultimate truth"]
        └── conventional reality (tha snyad) [Type: ImplicitUnit | Desc: "Implicit reference to conventional reality" | Implicit: "Implicit reference to the Buddhist concept of conventional reality"]
glossary:
- དེ་ : Why [Demonstrative pronoun; here functioning as an interrogative introduction to the rhetorical question; refers to previous context or statement per UCCA analysis]
- ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ : for what reason [Interrogative expression; ཅི་ (what) + སླད་དུ་ (for the purpose of); functions as the core question element inquiring about reasoning]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Question marker; ཞེ་ (to say) + ན (conditional particle); marks this as a rhetorical question structure]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [Ergative/Instrumental of དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ (Thus-Gone One); a title for the Buddha; functions as the Agent of enlightenment and teaching in this sentence]
- ཆོས་ : dharma [Noun; refers to the Buddha's teaching or doctrine; object/content that is enlightened or taught]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies the particular dharma being referenced; part of the object phrase]
- གང་ཡང་ : whatsoever [གང་ (which, whatever) + ཡང་ (also, even); universal qualifier indicating that no dharma exists that meets the criteria]
- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly [Adverbial prefix meaning "visibly, clearly, manifestly"; part of the compound term for enlightenment]
- རྫོགས་པར་ : completely [Adverbial form of རྫོགས་པ་ (complete, perfect); part of the compound term for enlightenment]
- སངས་རྒྱས་པ : attained enlightenment [Verbal noun from སངས་རྒྱས་ (to awaken, become enlightened); the process of complete enlightenment]
- འམ། : or [Conjunction; connects alternatives between enlightenment and teaching]
- བསྟན་པ་ : teaching [Noun from སྟོན་པ་ (to teach, show); the dharma that is taught by the Buddha]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; identifies the specific teaching being discussed]
- ནི་ : is [Topic marker; highlights the teaching as the subject of discussion]
- གཟུང་དུ་ : to be grasped [གཟུང་བ་ (to grasp, hold) + དུ་ (purposive/terminative particle); quality of being conceptually graspable]
- མ་མཆིས་ : does not exist [མ་ (negative) + མཆིས་ (honorific for "to exist"); negation of graspability]
- བརྗོད་དུ་ : to be expressed [བརྗོད་པ་ (to express, speak) + དུ་ (purposive/terminative particle); quality of being expressible in words]
- མ་མཆིས་ : does not exist [མ་ (negative) + མཆིས་ (honorific for "to exist"); negation of expressibility]
- ཏེ། : and [Conjunction; indicates continuation of thought to be elaborated in subsequent text]

དེ་ནི་ཆོས་ཀྱང་མ་ལགས་ཆོས་མ་མཆིས་པ་ཡང་མ་ལགས་པའི་སླད་དུའོ། ། [Type: ParallelScene | Desc: "Root parallel scene containing two negated statements and their purpose" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ནི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Subject of the parallel statements" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་ཀྱང་མ་ལགས་ཆོས་མ་མཆིས་པ་ཡང་མ་ལགས [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Two parallel negated statements about dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་ཀྱང་མ་ལགས [Type: Scene | Desc: "First negated statement - ultimate truth perspective" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object being negated in first statement" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མ་ལགས [Type: State | Desc: "Negation of first statement" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ལགས [Type: Function | Desc: "Copula functioning as existential verb in first statement" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཀྱང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector emphasizing first negation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── contrasting [Type: ContrastConnector | Desc: "Implicit contrast between ultimate truth (first negation) and conventional truth (second negation)" | Implicit: "Contrast between the two philosophical positions"]
        └── ཆོས་མ་མཆིས་པ་ཡང་མ་ལགས [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second negated statement - conventional truth perspective" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་མ་མཆིས་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Complex object being negated in second statement" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཆོས [Type: Center | Desc: "Core entity in complex object" | Implicit: ""]
                └── མ་མཆིས་པ [Type: State | Desc: "Negated state modifying dharma in complex object" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མ་ལགས [Type: State | Desc: "Negation of second statement" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཡང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector emphasizing second negation" | Implicit: ""]
    └── པའི་སླད་དུའོ [Type: Purpose | Desc: "Purpose clause indicating the reason for the previous statements" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : That [demonstrative pronoun; functions as the subject/patient of the parallel statements; refers to the previously mentioned concept]
- ནི་ : is [topic marker; marks 'དེ་' as the topic of the statements; highlights that the following discussion is about 'that']
- ཆོས་ : dharma [noun; refers to phenomena/teaching/reality; functions as the patient being negated in the first statement from the ultimate truth perspective]
- ཀྱང་ : even/also [emphatic particle; emphasizes the first negation; connects to the parallel structure]
- མ་ལགས་ : is not [negative copula; honorific negation of 'ལགས'; negates the existence of dharma from the ultimate perspective]
- ཆོས་ : dharma [noun; same as above but in the second statement; core entity in the complex object]
- མ་མཆིས་པ་ : non-existent [negated verb 'མཆིས་' (to exist) + nominalizer 'པ'; literally "that which does not exist"; modifies dharma to form a complex concept]
- ཡང་ : also/even [connective particle; emphasizes the second negation; links to the parallel structure]
- མ་ལགས་ : is not [negative copula; same as above; negates the second statement about dharma from conventional perspective]
- པའི་ : that which [genitive nominalizer; connects the preceding statements to their purpose]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the purpose of [purpose marker; indicates the reason for the preceding philosophical statements]
- འོ : is [sentence-final particle; marks the end of the statement with emphasis]
- ། : [sentence marker]

དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། འཕགས་པའི་གང་ཟག་རྣམས་ནི་འདུས་མ་བྱས་ཀྱིས་རབ་ཏུ་བྱེ་བའི་སླད་དུའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the question and answer structure" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question scene asking for the reason" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The referent being asked about" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "The questioning process" | Implicit: ""]
    └── འཕགས་པའི་གང་ཟག་རྣམས་ནི་འདུས་མ་བྱས་ཀྱིས་རབ་ཏུ་བྱེ་བའི་སླད་དུའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Answer scene explaining the reason" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཕགས་པའི་གང་ཟག་རྣམས་ནི [Type: Participant-Center | Desc: "Central entities being characterized in the statement" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འཕགས་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Modifier specifying the type of beings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་ཏུ་བྱེ་བའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of distinguishing or setting apart" | Implicit: ""]
            └── རབ་ཏུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Intensifier for the process of distinction" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདུས་མ་བྱས་ཀྱིས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Means or manner by which noble beings are distinguished" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སླད་དུ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relational marker indicating purpose" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འོ [Type: Function | Desc: "Sentence-final particle" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [ཆོས་ཉིད] [Type: Implicit | Desc: "Implicit concept of true nature that is central to understanding why noble beings are distinguished" | Implicit: "Implied concept of dharmatā or true nature"]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; referring to a preceding statement or proposition; functions as Patient in the question scene]
- ཅིའི་ : for what [Interrogative pronoun in genitive case; from ཅི "what"; asking about reason or purpose]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the purpose of [Postposition indicating purpose or intent; combined with ཅིའི་ expresses "for what purpose"]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional clause marker; from ཞེས་ "thus" + ན "if"; introduces a rhetorical question]
- འཕགས་པའི་ : noble [Genitive of འཕགས་པ་: superior, exalted, noble; modifies གང་ཟག་; describes spiritually advanced beings]
- གང་ཟག་ : persons [Noun: individual, person, pudgala; refers to spiritually accomplished practitioners]
- རྣམས་ : plural [Plural marker; indicates multiple noble persons]
- ནི་ : as for [Topic marker; emphasizes and sets apart the noble persons as the topic]
- འདུས་མ་བྱས་ : the unconditioned [Negated compound from འདུས་བྱས་ "conditioned"; refers to the unconditioned dharma, nirvana; that which is not compounded or fabricated]
- ཀྱིས་ : by means of [Instrumental case marker; indicates the means by which the distinction occurs]
- རབ་ཏུ་ : thoroughly [Intensive adverb; intensifies the following verb; completely, utterly]
- བྱེ་བའི་ : being distinguished [Genitive/purposive form of བྱེ་བ་ "to separate, distinguish"; describes how noble persons are set apart]
- སླད་དུའོ། : it is for the purpose of [Purpose marker སླད་དུ་ + sentence-final particle འོ; indicates the conclusion of the explanation]

བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of the Buddha speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Agent of the speaking action" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་ : son of noble family or [Disjunctive compound; `རིགས་`: family/lineage/caste + `ཀྱི་`: genitive + `བུ་`: son + `འམ་`: disjunctive particle; refers to a male spiritual practitioner of good background; functions as part of the Agent in the conditional clause]

- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་ : daughter of noble family [Compound; `རིགས་`: family/lineage/caste + `ཀྱི་`: genitive + `བུ་མོ་`: daughter; refers to a female spiritual practitioner of good background; functions as part of the Agent in the conditional clause]

- གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་ : any [Indefinite pronoun; `གང་`: which + `ལ་ལ་`: some + `ཞིག་`: indefinite marker; indicates an unspecified person; completes the Agent phrase]

- གིས་ : by [Ergative case marker; indicates the Agent performing the action of filling and giving]

- སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་ : of the trichiliocosm [Genitive compound; `སྟོང་`: thousand + `གསུམ་`: three + `གྱི་`: genitive; refers to a Buddhist cosmological term for a vast universe system; modifies the following noun]

- སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་ : great thousand [Genitive compound; `སྟོང་`: thousand + `ཆེན་པོ`: great + `འི་`: genitive; part of the cosmological description; modifies the following noun]

- འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ : of world [Genitive compound; `འཇིག་རྟེན་`: world/cosmos + `གྱི་`: genitive; modifies the following noun]

- ཁམས་ : realm [Noun; refers to a realm or element; here refers to the universe/world-system; functions as the Patient of the action]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; indicates the specific world-system being referenced; completes the Patient phrase]

- རིན་པོ་ཆེ་ : precious substances [Compound noun; `རིན་པོ་ཆེ་`: precious/jewel; refers to valuable materials; part of the instrument used for filling]

- སྣ་བདུན་ : seven types [Compound; `སྣ་`: types/kinds + `བདུན་`: seven; refers to the traditional seven precious substances (gold, silver, etc.); completes the instrumental phrase]

- གྱིས་ : with [Instrumental case marker; indicates the means by which the world-system is filled]

- རབ་ཏུ་ : completely [Adverbial intensifier; `རབ་`: supreme + `ཏུ་`: adverbializer; intensifies the following verb]

- གང་བར་ : filling [Verbal noun; `གང་བ་`: to fill + `ར་`: terminative case; indicates the action of filling the world-system]

- བྱས་ : did [Past tense of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do; indicates the completion of the filling action]

- ཏེ་ : and then [Connective particle; links sequential actions; connects the filling and giving actions]

- སྦྱིན་པ་ : gift [Noun; `སྦྱིན་པ་`: giving/charity/gift; refers to the act of generosity]

- བྱིན་ : gave [Past tense of `སྦྱིན་པ་`: to give; the action of giving the filled world-system as a gift]

- ན། : if [Conditional particle; establishes the hypothetical scenario; connects the condition with the question that follows]

- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་ : son of noble family or [Repeated term; same as before; here functioning as the Agent of the merit-generating action]

- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་ : daughter of noble family [Repeated term; same as before; here functioning as the Agent of the merit-generating action]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the previously mentioned person; specifies which person would generate merit]

- གཞི་ : basis [Noun; refers to the foundation or cause; here meaning the basis of the action]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the previously described action of giving]

- ལས་ : from [Ablative case marker; indicates the source or origin of the merit]

- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ : of merit [Genitive compound; `བསོད་ནམས་`: merit/virtue + `ཀྱི་`: genitive; modifies the following noun]

- ཕུང་པོ་ : heap [Noun; literally "heap/aggregate"; here refers to a collection or quantity of merit]

- བསྐྱེད་ : generate [Future/present of `སྐྱེད་པ་`: to generate/produce; the action of producing merit]

- མམ། : or not? [Interrogative disjunctive particle; forms a yes/no question; makes the statement rhetorical]

glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས : Subhuti [Instrumental case of `རབ་འབྱོར`: Subhuti (name of principal disciple); functions as Agent-Participant who initiates the speech act; shows who is performing the action]
- གསོལ་པ། : replied [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ`: to ask, request, speak; here functions as the main Process/verb of the scene indicating Subhuti's verbal response]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས : Bhagavan [Honorific title for Buddha; literally "one who has conquered and possesses (qualities)"; functions as the Recipient-Participant who is being addressed]

- ལགས་སོ : it is [Polite existential verb `ལགས` with final particle `སོ`; formal affirmation indicating respect; completes the sentence structure as part of the Adverbial phrase describing the abundance]

glossary:

- གཤེགས་པ : gone [Verbal noun from `གཤེགས`: to go, depart; here referring to "one who has gone to bliss" - a standard epithet for Buddha(s); functions as the head of the Patient/object noun phrase]

- ལགས་སོ : are [Honorific copula `ལགས` + final particle `སོ`; equivalent to "there are" or "exist"; functions as the existential connector that completes the statement]

glossary:

- བུའམ་ : son or [Disjunctive particle `འམ་` attached to `བུ་`: son, boy, child; indicates an alternative between son and daughter; functions as part of the Agent]
- རིགས་ཀྱི་ : of the family/lineage [Genitive of `རིགས་`: family, lineage, class; repetition for the second Agent in the pair]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun, referring to the specific son or daughter mentioned; serves as a definite article]
- དེའི་ : of that [Genitive of `དེ་`: that; links to the foundation/basis mentioned next; part of the causal adverbial phrase]
- གཞི་ : foundation/basis [From `གཞི་`: foundation, base, ground; the underlying cause or source; part of the adverbial causal phrase]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun clarifying which foundation is meant; provides specificity]
- ལས་ : from [Ablative case marker indicating the source or cause; marks the causal relationship between the foundation and the merit]
- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ : of merit [Genitive of `བསོད་ནམས་`: merit, virtue, good karma; describes what kind of accumulation is generated; part of the Patient]
- ཕུང་པོ་ : accumulation/heap [From `ཕུང་པོ་`: heap, aggregate, skandha; the object being generated; functions as the Patient]

- བསྐྱེད་དོ : generates/produces [Perfective verb `བསྐྱེད་` with sentence-final marker `དོ`; from `སྐྱེད་`: to generate, produce, create; the main Process of the sentence]
- ། ། : [End of sentence marker]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་དེ་ཉིད་ཕུང་པོ་མ་མཆིས་པའི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node containing the entire passage" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Interrogative scene questioning the reason" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The referent being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "The questioning process" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་དེ་ཉིད་ཕུང་པོ་མ་མཆིས་པའི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Explanatory scene providing the philosophical answer" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་དེ་ཉིད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The subject being described - merit aggregates" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ [Type: Center | Desc: "The core concept of merit aggregates" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེ་ཉིད [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Emphasizes the specific merit aggregates being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཕུང་པོ་མ་མཆིས་པ [Type: Attribute | Desc: "The negated property attributed to merit aggregates - their ultimate non-existence" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དོན་དམ་པར [Type: Implicit | Desc: "Implicit philosophical concept of ultimate reality context" | Implicit: "Philosophical concept implied by context but not explicitly stated"]
        ├── སྟེ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Connects the subject with its attribute" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སླད་དུ [Type: Purpose-Reason | Desc: "Marker indicating the reason or purpose that links to the earlier question" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the preceding statement or concept being discussed; functions as Patient in the UCCA structure]
- ཅིའི་ : for what [Interrogative pronoun in genitive case; from `ཅི་`: what; used to introduce a questioning of reason]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the sake of/due to [Postposition indicating purpose or reason; connects with `ཅིའི་` to form "for what reason"]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional verb form from `ཞེས་`: to say, speak; introduces rhetorical question; marks the end of the interrogative clause]
- བསོད་ནམས་ : merit [Noun; positive karmic potential; spiritual virtue; functions as possessor in the compound]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; connects `བསོད་ནམས་` with `ཕུང་པོ་`; indicates possession]
- ཕུང་པོ་ : aggregate/heap [Noun; Sanskrit: skandha; collection or accumulation; here referring to collections of merit]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies the particular aggregate being discussed; functions as Elaborator that emphasizes the specific merit aggregate]
- ཉིད་ : itself/precisely [Emphatic particle; highlights the specific identity of the merit aggregate; emphasizes the particular nature being discussed]
- ཕུང་པོ་ : aggregate/heap [Noun; second mention of skandha; the subject of negation in this phrase]
- མ་མཆིས་པའི་ : not existing [Negated verb form; from `མཆིས་པ་`: to exist, be present (honorific); with genitive particle འི་; indicates the non-existence in ultimate reality]
- སླད་དུ་ : because/for the reason that [Postposition indicating purpose or reason; explains why the statement is true]
- སྟེ། : that is/namely [Connective particle; links the explanation with the question; serves as a Relator in the UCCA structure]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་བས་ན་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ཞེས་གསུངས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Discourse connector that links this statement to previous context" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who performs the speaking action" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསུངས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of speaking or teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ཞེས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The quoted content of the Tathagata's speech, showing rhetorical repetition with its relational marker" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The first mention of merit accumulation as quoted speech" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ [Type: Center | Desc: "The first instance of the term 'merit accumulation'" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The second mention of merit accumulation, repeated for rhetorical emphasis" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཞེས [Type: Function | Desc: "Marker indicating reported speech, connecting quoted content to the speaking verb" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [while conventionally named, it lacks inherent existence] [Type: Implicit-Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit philosophical point that merit accumulation is conventionally designated but ultimately empty of inherent existence" | Implicit: "while conventionally named, it lacks inherent existence"]
glossary:
- དེ་བས་ན : Therefore [Conjunctive adverb formed from དེ་ + བས་ + ན, literally "from that"; functions as a discourse connector linking this statement to previous context]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས : the Tathagata [Agentive/Ergative case of དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ (tathāgata): "thus-gone one," an epithet for the Buddha; functions as the Agent who performs the speaking action]
- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ : of merit [Genitive case of བསོད་ནམས (puṇya): positive karmic potential, virtue; indicates possessive relationship]
- ཕུང་པོ་ : accumulation [From ཕུང་པོ (skandha): heap, aggregate, collection; here refers to collection of merit rather than the five aggregates]
- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ : of merit [Repeated genitive phrase for emphasis; same as above]
- ཕུང་པོ་ : accumulation [Repeated noun for emphasis; same as above]
- ཞེས : thus [Quotative particle marking the end of reported speech; connects the quoted content to the speaking verb]
- གསུངས་སོ : proclaimed [Past tense of གསུང (to speak honorifically); with final particle སོ indicating completed action; the main Process verb of the sentence]
- ། ། : [Sentence-final double shad punctuation mark]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་གང་གིས་སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་འདི་རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན་གྱིས་རབ་ཏུ་གང་བར་བྱས་ཏེ་སྦྱིན་པ་བྱིན་པ་བས། གང་གིས་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ལས་ཐ་ན་ཚིག་བཞི་པའི་ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་ཙམ་བཟུང་ནས་གཞན་དག་ལ་འཆད་ཅིང་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ་སྟོན་ན། གཞི་དེ་ལས་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ཆེས་མང་དུ་གྲངས་མེད་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་བསྐྱེད་དོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the Buddha's teaching to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker of the discourse (Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of speaking or teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་གང་གིས་སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་འདི་རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན་གྱིས་རབ་ཏུ་གང་བར་བྱས་ཏེ་སྦྱིན་པ་བྱིན་པ་བས། གང་གིས་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ལས་ཐ་ན་ཚིག་བཞི་པའི་ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་ཙམ་བཟུང་ནས་གཞན་དག་ལ་འཆད་ཅིང་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ་སྟོན་ན། གཞི་དེ་ལས་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ཆེས་མང་དུ་གྲངས་མེད་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་བསྐྱེད་དོ། ། [Type: Contrast | Desc: "The contrastive comparison between material offering and Dharma teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The person being addressed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་གང་གིས་སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་འདི་རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན་གྱིས་རབ་ཏུ་གང་བར་བྱས་ཏེ་སྦྱིན་པ་བྱིན་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scenario: the material offering of precious substances" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་གང་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The hypothetical person making material offerings" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The cosmic scale of the universe to be filled with precious substances" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས [Type: Center | Desc: "The world system or realm" | Implicit: ""]
                └── སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The specific scale of the world system (trichiliocosm)" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The seven types of jewels used for offering" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── རིན་པོ་ཆེ [Type: Center | Desc: "The precious substances or jewels" | Implicit: ""]
                └── སྣ་བདུན [Type: Quantity | Desc: "The quantity and variety of precious substances" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རབ་ཏུ་གང་བར་བྱས་ཏེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of filling the world systems with jewels" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྦྱིན་པ་བྱིན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of giving the jewels as an offering" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་གིས་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ལས་ཐ་ན་ཚིག་བཞི་པའི་ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་ཙམ་བཟུང་ནས་གཞན་དག་ལ་འཆད་ཅིང་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ་སྟོན་ན [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scenario: teaching even a small portion of the Dharma" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གང་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The hypothetical person teaching Dharma" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ལས་ཐ་ན་ཚིག་བཞི་པའི་ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་ཙམ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The content being memorized and taught - even just four lines of verse" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི [Type: Center | Desc: "The source text - this Dharma discourse" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཚིག་བཞི་པའི [Type: Quantifier | Desc: "The quantity of teaching - just four lines" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ [Type: Center | Desc: "The format of the teaching - verse" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཐ་ན་ཙམ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Emphasizing the minimal amount of teaching that still generates merit" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བཟུང་ནས [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of memorizing or holding the verses" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གཞན་དག་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Those receiving the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཆད་ཅིང་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ་སྟོན་ན [Type: Combined Teaching Process | Desc: "The combined process of explaining the words and properly demonstrating the meaning" | Implicit: ""]
            └── to lead beings to enlightenment [Type: Implicit Purpose | Desc: "The implicit purpose of teaching Dharma - to lead beings to liberation" | Implicit: "Clarifies implied or contextually understood content that is not explicitly stated in the original text but necessary for comprehension"]
        ├── བས [Type: Contrastive Linker | Desc: "The comparative marker establishing the teaching of Dharma as superior to material offerings" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གཞི་དེ་ལས་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ཆེས་མང་དུ་གྲངས་མེད་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་བསྐྱེད་དོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The resulting generation of immeasurable merit from teaching Dharma" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ཆེས་མང་དུ་གྲངས་མེད་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The merit generated from teaching Dharma" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ [Type: Center | Desc: "The accumulated merit" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཆེས་མང་དུ་གྲངས་མེད་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ [Type: Quantitative Elaborator | Desc: "Emphasizing the vast, immeasurable quantity of merit" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གཞི་དེ་ལས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The basis for generating merit - teaching Dharma" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བསྐྱེད་དོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of generating or producing merit" | Implicit: ""]
            └── the person teaching Dharma [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implied person who generates merit by teaching Dharma" | Implicit: "Clarifies implied or contextually understood content that is not explicitly stated in the original text but necessary for comprehension"]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : The Blessed One [Honorific term for the Buddha; compound term from 'བཅོམ་' (one who has conquered the afflictions), 'ལྡན་' (possessing qualities), and 'འདས་' (transcended samsara); functions as Agent/speaker in discourse]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker indicating the agent of the action; connects the Buddha to the speaking action]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། : proclaimed [Honorific past tense verb for 'to speak/teach'; from root 'སྩལ་' (to give/bestow); formal speech act marking authoritative Buddhist teaching; functions as main Process in the discourse introduction]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of the Buddha's disciple being addressed; functions as Recipient of the teaching]

- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་ : son of good family or [Compound term 'རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་' (noble son/person of good lineage) plus the disjunctive particle 'འམ་' (or); traditional way of addressing male Buddhist practitioners; part of the hypothetical Agent in first scenario]

- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་ : daughter of good family [Compound term referring to female Buddhist practitioners of good lineage; forms part of the hypothetical Agent in the first scenario]

- གང་གིས་ : whoever [Relative pronoun introducing hypothetical agent; literally "by whomever"; introduces both comparative scenarios]

- སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་ : of the trichiliocosm [Genitive case of 'སྟོང་གསུམ་' (three thousand); technical Buddhist cosmological term referring to a vast cosmic system of worlds; qualifies the world system]

- སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་ : great thousand [Genitive case of 'སྟོང་ཆེན་པོ་' (great thousand); part of the cosmological description; further qualifies the scale of the universe being described]

- འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ : of the world [Genitive case of 'འཇིག་རྟེན་' (world/cosmos); from 'འཇིག་' (to perish) and 'རྟེན་' (support); the transient world system; functions as center of the Patient in the offering scenario]

- ཁམས་ : realm [Noun meaning 'element/realm/world-system'; in Buddhist cosmology refers to domains of existence; completes the cosmic object being filled with jewels]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun referring to the world system; specifies the realm under discussion]

- རིན་པོ་ཆེ་ : precious substances [Compound noun meaning 'precious thing/jewel'; from 'རིན་པོ་' (valuable) and 'ཆེ་' (great); refers to valuable materials being offered]

- སྣ་བདུན་ : seven types [Compound of 'སྣ་' (types/kinds) and 'བདུན་' (seven); traditionally refers to gold, silver, lapis lazuli, crystal, coral, pearl, and carnelian; quantifies the varieties of jewels]

- གྱིས་ : with [Instrumental case marker showing means or instrument; connects the jewels to the action of filling]

- རབ་ཏུ་ : completely [Adverbial intensifier meaning 'thoroughly/utterly'; intensifies the completeness of the filling action]

- གང་བར་ : filled [Verb form of 'གང་བ་' (to fill/be full); indicates the action of filling the cosmos with jewels]

- བྱས་ཏེ་ : having done [Past verbal connector from 'བྱེད་' (to do/make); connects the filling action to the subsequent giving action]

- སྦྱིན་པ་ : giving/generosity [Noun form of 'སྦྱིན་' (to give); refers to the act of charitable giving or offering; Buddhist virtue of generosity]

- བྱིན་པ་ : gave [Past form of 'སྦྱིན་' (to give); completes the description of the generous action of offering jewels]

- བས། : than [Comparative particle marking contrast between two scenarios; establishes the teaching of Dharma as superior to material offerings]

- གང་གིས་ : whoever [Relative pronoun beginning second scenario; same form as earlier but introducing the Dharma-teaching agent]

- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : of Dharma [Genitive case of 'ཆོས་' (Dharma/teaching); refers to Buddhist doctrine or truth; qualifies the discourse being taught]

- རྣམ་གྲངས་ : discourse [Noun meaning 'enumeration/discourse'; technical term for a systematic exposition of Buddhist doctrine]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun referring to the present discourse; the specific teaching being referenced]

- ལས་ : from [Ablative case marker indicating source; shows the discourse as the source of the verse]

- ཐ་ན་ : even [Adverbial phrase meaning 'even/at minimum'; emphasizes that even a minimal teaching effort produces great merit]

- ཚིག་བཞི་པའི་ : four-lined [Adjectival phrase from 'ཚིག་' (word/line) and 'བཞི་' (four); describes the verse structure]

- ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་ : verse [Term for metrical verse in Buddhist texts; from 'ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་' (to arrange in meter); the format of the teaching]

- ཙམ་ : merely/just [Restrictive particle emphasizing the minimal nature; just a small portion of text]

- བཟུང་ནས་ : having memorized [Verbal connector from 'འཛིན་' (to hold/grasp/memorize); describes the mental retention of the teaching]

- གཞན་དག་ : others [Plural form of 'གཞན་' (other); refers to the audience receiving the teaching; functions as Recipient]

- ལ་ : to [Dative case marker indicating recipient; connects the teacher to those being taught]

- འཆད་ : explains [Present verb form of 'འཆད་པ་' (to explain/elucidate); first aspect of teaching—verbal explanation]

- ཅིང་ : and [Connective particle joining two related actions; connects the explaining with demonstrating]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : correctly [Adverbial phrase meaning 'correctly/perfectly'; qualifies the teaching as authentic and accurate]

- རབ་ཏུ་ : thoroughly [Adverbial intensifier meaning 'thoroughly/completely'; intensifies the demonstration action]

- སྟོན་ན། : if demonstrates [Conditional form of 'སྟོན་' (to show/demonstrate); second aspect of teaching—showing the meaning through practice]

- གཞི་ : basis [Noun meaning 'ground/basis/foundation'; refers to the action of teaching as the foundation for merit]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun referring to the teaching activity; identifies the specific basis for merit]

- ལས་ : from [Ablative case marker indicating source; shows the teaching as the source of merit]

- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ : of merit [Genitive case of 'བསོད་ནམས་' (merit/virtue); positive karmic energy generated through virtuous action]

- ཕུང་པོ་ : aggregate/heap [Noun meaning 'heap/mass/collection'; indicates the accumulated merit as a substantial quantity]

- ཆེས་ : far more [Comparative adverb meaning 'much more/very'; intensifies the quantity of merit]

- མང་དུ་ : abundantly [Adverbial phrase meaning 'abundantly/in great quantity'; further emphasizes the volume of merit]

- གྲངས་མེད་ : incalculable [Compound adjective meaning 'countless/numberless'; first of three terms emphasizing immeasurability]

- དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་ : immeasurable [Compound adjective meaning 'immeasurable/boundless'; intensifies the limitless nature of the merit]

- བསྐྱེད་དོ། : is generated [Future-present verb form of 'སྐྱེད་' (to generate/produce) with final particle; indicates the resultant production of merit]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་རྣམས་ཀྱི་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ནི་འདི་ལས་བྱུང་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node containing the entire text" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Rhetorical question setting up explanation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of questioning" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་རྣམས་ཀྱི་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ནི་འདི་ལས་བྱུང་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main explanation of the source of enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Person being addressed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་རྣམས་ཀྱི་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The enlightenment that arises from the teachings" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་རྣམས [Type: Center | Desc: "The possessors of enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "What is possessed by the Buddhas and arises from the teachings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱུང་སྟེ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of arising or emerging" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི་ལས [Type: Participant-Source | Desc: "Source from which enlightenment arises" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཀྱི [Type: Possessive | Desc: "Possessive relationship between the Buddhas and enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the preceding statement or teaching; functions as the object being questioned in the rhetorical question]
- ཅིའི་ : for what [Interrogative + Genitive marker; from `ཅི་`: what, why; used to form the rhetorical question]
- ཕྱིར་ : reason [Noun: reason, purpose; forms part of the rhetorical question asking "for what reason?"]
- ཞེ་ན། : if asked [Quotative verb + conditional particle; marks a rhetorical question; introduces the explanation that follows]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Proper name; the disciple being addressed by the Buddha; functions as the addressee in this discourse]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Thus-Gone One [Epithet of Buddha; Sanskrit Tathāgata; one of the titles of a fully enlightened Buddha; part of the compound describing the possessors of enlightenment]
- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : Foe-Destroyer [Epithet of Buddha; Sanskrit Arhat; one who has destroyed the foes of afflictions; continues the description of Buddhas]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [Adverbial modifier; completely, truly, perfectly; qualifies the complete enlightenment]
- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Verbal adjective + genitive; from `རྫོགས་པ་`: to complete, perfect; describes the complete nature of enlightenment]
- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Noun; the fully awakened one; the culmination of the previous epithets]
- རྣམས་ : plural [Plural marker; indicates multiple Buddhas]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; indicates possession, showing that enlightenment belongs to the Buddhas]
- བླ་ན་ : unsurpassed [Adjective; literally "above-not"; describes the enlightenment as having nothing above or beyond it]
- མེད་པ་ : without [Negative existential verb as adjective; reinforces the "unsurpassed" quality]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [Adverbial modifier; repeats to emphasize the perfection of enlightenment]
- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Verbal adjective + genitive; describes the complete nature of enlightenment]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Noun; Sanskrit bodhi; the state of awakening that is possessed by the Buddhas]
- ནི་ : indeed [Topic marker; highlights the enlightenment as the main topic]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the teaching being given or the scripture itself]
- ལས་ : from [Ablative particle; indicates the source from which enlightenment arises]
- བྱུང་ : arose [Verb in past tense; from `འབྱུང་བ་`: to arise, emerge; describes how enlightenment emerged from the teaching]
- སྟེ། : and, thus [Connective particle; joins this statement to what follows in the text]

སངས་རྒྱས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་རྣམས་ཀྱང་འདི་ལས་སྐྱེས་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing how Buddhas arose from the perfection of wisdom teachings" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སངས་རྒྱས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་རྣམས་ཀྱང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The main participant (Buddhas) who arose from the teachings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སངས་རྒྱས [Type: Center | Desc: "Core reference to the Buddhas" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་རྣམས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Honorific elaboration describing the Buddhas" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཀྱང [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Particle that emphasizes that even the Buddhas themselves arose from this source" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་ལས [Type: Participant-Source | Desc: "The causal source (perfection of wisdom teachings) from which the Buddhas arose" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྐྱེས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main process of the sentence - arising or originating" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འི་ཕྱིར་རོ [Type: Ground | Desc: "Marks the causal relationship and provides justification for the statement" | Implicit: ""]
    └── perfection of wisdom teachings [Type: Implicit | Desc: "Implicit reference to the perfection of wisdom (ཤེར་ཕྱིན) teachings that realize emptiness (སྟོང་ཉིད), which is what 'འདི' refers to" | Implicit: "Implicit reference to the perfection of wisdom (ཤེར་ཕྱིན) teachings that realize emptiness (སྟོང་ཉིད), which is what 'འདི' refers to"]
glossary:
- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddhas [Noun; lit. "awakened ones" or "enlightened ones"; refers to fully enlightened beings who have attained complete awakening; functions as the core participant (Patient) in the sentence]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed Ones [Honorific epithet for Buddhas; from `བཅོམ་` (conquered) + `ལྡན་` (possessing) + `འདས་` (transcended); refers to those who have conquered defilements, possess qualities, and transcended samsara; serves as an honorific elaboration of "Buddhas"]

- རྣམས་ : plural marker [Nominal plural suffix; indicates multiple Buddhas are being referred to]

- ཀྱང་ : also/even [Emphatic particle; emphasizes that even the Buddhas themselves, despite their exalted status, arose from this source; adds emphasis to the subject]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers implicitly to the perfection of wisdom (ཤེར་ཕྱིན) teachings that realize emptiness (སྟོང་ཉིད); functions as the Source participant]

- ལས་ : from [Ablative case marker; indicates the source or origin; here showing causal relationship between the teachings and the arising of Buddhas]

- སྐྱེས་པའི་ : arose [Past tense of `སྐྱེ་བ་`: to be born, arise, originate; the main process of the sentence indicating that Buddhas originated from the perfection of wisdom teachings]

- ཕྱིར་ : because [Causal connective; establishes the logical relationship explaining why something is the case]

- རོ : is [Sentence-final particle; marks the end of a statement and adds assertive force]

- ། : [sentence-final punctuation mark]

དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་རྣམས་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་རྣམས་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནི། སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་དེ་དག་མེད་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པའི་གསུངས་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire text" | Implicit: ""]

    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་རྣམས་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་རྣམས་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནི [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene introducing the concept of Buddha's dharmas" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to a previously mentioned concept; functions as a reference link to prior discussion]
- ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ : for what reason [Interrogative; composed of `ཅི་` (what) + genitive particle `འི་` + `ཕྱིར་` (for the sake of); introduces a rhetorical question]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional clause marker; signals a hypothetical question being posed; acts as a discourse marker]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper noun; name of the Buddha's disciple who is being addressed; functions as the recipient of the teaching]
- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Noun; literally "awakened one"; the fully enlightened being; functions as possessor]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; shows possession relationship between Buddha and dharmas]
- ཆོས་ : dharmas [Noun; teachings, phenomena, qualities; here referring to specific qualities or attributes of a Buddha]
- རྣམས་ : plural [Plural marker; indicates multiple dharmas or qualities]
- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Noun; repetition for emphasis; the awakened one]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; shows possession]
- ཆོས་ : dharmas [Noun; repetition for emphasis; teachings or qualities]
- རྣམས་ : plural [Plural marker; indicates multiple dharmas]
- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative particle; marks the preceding as something that is said or named]
- བྱ་བ་ : called [Verbal noun from `བྱེད་` (to do); what is done or said; indicates naming or designation]
- ནི། : as for [Topic marker; highlights the preceding as the topic of discussion]
- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Noun; the awakened one]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; shows possession]
- ཆོས་ : dharmas [Noun; qualities, phenomena]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative + plural; refers to the previously mentioned dharmas]
- མེད་པར་ : as non-existent [Negation + terminative particle; from `མེད་པ་` (non-existence); indicates the state of not existing ultimately]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པའི་ : Tathagata's [Noun + genitive; "Thus-gone one," an epithet of the Buddha; the agent who taught]
- གསུངས་པའི་ : having taught [Verbal noun + genitive; from `གསུང་` (to speak, teach); refers to Buddha's act of teaching]
- ཕྱིར་ : because [Conjunction; indicates the reason or cause]
- ཏེ། : and so [Continuative particle; connects this statement with what follows]

དེས་ན་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་རྣམས་ཞེས་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing the designation of Buddha's dharmas" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Connector | Desc: "Indicates logical conclusion or result" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་རྣམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharmas or qualities that are possessed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཞེས་བྱའོ [Type: Function | Desc: "Designative marker indicating naming or labeling function" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [existing conventionally but lacking ultimate existence] [Type: Implicit | Desc: "Implicit philosophical context about conventional versus ultimate truth" | Implicit: "Philosophical context about conventional versus ultimate truth"]
    └── སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི [Type: Possession | Desc: "Possessive relation connecting Buddha to the dharmas" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཀྱི [Type: Relator | Desc: "Possessive particle connecting Buddha and dharmas" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སངས་རྒྱས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha who possesses the dharmas" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེས་ན་ : Therefore [Instrumental དེ་ + continuative ན་; indicates logical conclusion based on previous statements; serves as a Connector in the semantic structure showing causality]
- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Noun; lit. "awakened one" or "purified-expanded"; the fully enlightened one who has eliminated all obscurations; functions as Participant-Agent in the semantic structure]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; shows possessive relationship between Buddha and dharmas; serves as a Relator connecting the Agent to what is possessed]
- ཆོས་རྣམས་ : dharmas [Noun ཆོས་ "dharma/teaching" + plural marker རྣམས་; refers to the Buddha's teachings or qualities; functions as Participant-Patient in the semantic structure]
- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative particle; marks designation or labeling; part of the naming function in the sentence]
- བྱའོ : are called [Future/present of བྱེད་པ་ "to do/make" + final particle འོ་; designative construction meaning "are named/called"; functions as the main Process verb in the sentence]
- ། ། : [Sentence-final double shad punctuation mark]

རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Addressee | Desc: "The person being directly addressed with the question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept being considered in the question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས [Type: Process | Desc: "The mental process of thinking or considering" | Implicit: ""]
        └── Buddha [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit questioner (Buddha) asking Subhuti" | Implicit: "The implicit questioner (Buddha) asking Subhuti"]
    └── Buddha [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit questioner (Buddha) asking Subhuti" | Implicit: "The implicit questioner (Buddha) asking Subhuti"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative case; proper name of Buddha's disciple; addressee of the question; functions as the direct recipient of the Buddha's inquiry]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; pointing to the topic about to be discussed; central concept under consideration in the question]

- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [Interrogative phrase; from `ཇི་` (how/what) + `སྙམ་` (to think) + `དུ་` (quotative/complementizer particle); introduces a question seeking opinion]

- སེམས། : do you think? [Present tense of `སེམས་པ་`: to think/consider; rhetorical question marker; marks this as a process of mental consideration; the implied agent is the Buddha as the questioner]

ucca_formatted:
རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པ་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པའི་འབྲས་བུ་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་སྙམ་མམ [Type: Time | Desc: "root_node" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "the_one_being_asked_about" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྙམ་མམ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "interrogative_marker" | Implicit: ""]
    └── འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པའི་འབྲས་བུ་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས [Type: Scene | Desc: "hypothetical_thinking_content" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Center | Desc: "introduces_content_of_thought" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བདག་གིས་རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པའི་འབྲས་བུ་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས [Type: Scene | Desc: "content_of_hypothetical_thought" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བདག་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "agent_of_attainment_with_self_attachment" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པའི་འབྲས་བུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "object_of_attainment" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཐོབ་བོ [Type: Process | Desc: "process_of_attainment" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྙམ་དུ་སེམས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "thinking_process" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པ་ : stream-enterer [Nominal phrase from `རྒྱུན་`: stream, continuum + `ཞུགས་པ་`: entered, joined; refers to a person who has attained the first stage of enlightenment in Buddhism; functions as the Agent/subject of the interrogative sentence]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; points to the hypothetical thought that follows; introduces the content of the thought]

- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking [Complementizer from `སྙམ་པ་`: to think + purposive particle `དུ་`; introduces the content of thought; links the stream-enterer to their mental process]

- བདག་གིས་ : I, myself [Ergative case of `བདག་`: self, I; marks the agent of the attainment verb with sense of self-attachment or ego-clinging; shows who is doing the attaining]

- རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པའི་ : of stream-entry [Genitive case of `རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པ་`: stream-enterer; modifies `འབྲས་བུ་` (fruit); refers to the specific spiritual attainment]

- འབྲས་བུ་ : fruit, result [Nominal phrase; in Buddhist context refers to the spiritual attainment or result of practice; the object being attained]

- ཐོབ་བོ་ : have attained [Verb `ཐོབ་`: to obtain, attain + final particle `བོ་` indicating completion; marks the process of attainment]

- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking [Complementizer from `སྙམ་པ་`: to think + purposive particle `དུ་`; introduces another level of thought]

- སེམས་ : thinks [Present tense verb; refers to the mental process of thinking or conceptualizing; indicates the stream-enterer's ongoing thought process]

- སྙམ་མམ : do you think? [Verb `སྙམ་པ་`: to think + interrogative particle `མམ་`; marks the entire statement as a question directed at the listener]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The entire utterance showing Subhuti's reply to the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker who is making the reply" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསོལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of speaking or replying" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The person being addressed (the Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Center | Desc: "The core statement of Subhuti's response" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ནི [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Topic marker indicating what is being negated" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མ་ལགས [Type: Process | Desc: "The negation verb" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [དོན་དམ་པར་གང་ལ་ཡང་ཞུགས་པ་མ་མཆིས] [Type: Implicit | Desc: "The unstated but contextually clear philosophical point about not entering into anything from an ultimate perspective" | Implicit: "Clarifies the philosophical context that is implied but not explicitly stated"]
        ├── སོ། ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Grammatical particle marking the end of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [འགོག་པ] [Type: Connector | Desc: "Indicates that Subhuti is contradicting or responding to a previous assertion" | Implicit: "Indicates the relationship to previous discourse that is implied"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : by Subhūti [Ergative case marker གྱིས་ attached to Subhūti's name; indicates Subhūti is the agent performing the action of replying; functions as the Speaker/Agent in this utterance]
- གསོལ་པ། : replied [Perfect tense of གསོལ་བ་: to request, speak, reply; here indicates a formal response to the Buddha; functions as the main Process/verb in this scene]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of བཅོམ་པ་ (conquered) + ལྡན་པ་ (possessing) + འདས་པ་ (transcended); recipient of Subhūti's reply; vocative address]
- དེ་ནི་ : that [དེ་: demonstrative pronoun + ནི་: topic marker; refers to the preceding statement or question; sets up what is being negated; functions as a topic marker indicating what will be addressed]
- མ་ལགས་སོ། : is not [མ་: negative prefix + ལགས་: honorific verb "to be" + སོ་: final particle; negates the preceding topic; conveys Subhūti's disagreement with a proposition; the core negative assertion]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་ཅི་ལ་ཡང་ཞུགས་པ་མ་མཆིས་པའི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root of the passage containing a question and its answer" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question part of the question-answer structure" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Demonstrative reference to previous content" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "Interrogative process asking for reason or cause" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་ཅི་ལ་ཡང་ཞུགས་པ་མ་མཆིས་པའི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Answer to the question, explaining why with a philosophical point about non-attachment" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the subject of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཅི་ལ་ཡང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object of non-entering; refers to all phenomena in ultimate reality" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཞུགས་པ་མ་མཆིས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "Negative process indicating Buddha's non-attachment and non-abiding in ultimate reality" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [doctrinal concept of non-attachment] [Type: Implicit | Desc: "Implicit Buddhist philosophical concept of freedom from clinging or pride in ultimate reality" | Implicit: "Implicit Buddhist philosophical concept of freedom from clinging or pride in ultimate reality"]
        └── འི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Indicates reason or purpose, connecting the answer to the question" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [question-answer relation] [Type: Linker | Desc: "Explicit linkage showing the question-answer relationship between nodes 1 and 2" | Implicit: "The logical connection between the question and answer parts of the passage"]
glossary:
- དེ་: this [Demonstrative pronoun; functions as a reference to the previously mentioned content and serves as an Elaborator in the question structure]
- ཅིའི་: for what [Interrogative + genitive case marker; from `ཅི་`: what, which; used here to introduce a question about reason or cause]
- སླད་དུ་: for the purpose of [Purposive case marker; indicates the reason or intention behind an action]
- ཞེ་ན: if it is asked [Conditional clause marker; from `ཞེས་`: quotative + `ན`: conditional; signals the end of a rhetorical question]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་: the Bhagavān [Honorific title for Buddha; from `བཅོམ་`: conquered + `ལྡན་`: possessing + `འདས་`: transcended; refers to the Buddha as the principal Agent in this explanation]
- དེ་: that [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies the Buddha as the subject of the statement]
- ནི་: as for [Topic marker; emphasizes the subject and sets it apart for discussion]
- ཅི་ལ་: in anything [Interrogative + locative; from `ཅི་`: what/anything + `ལ་`: locative case marker; refers to all phenomena as the Patient of non-entering]
- ཡང་: even/also [Emphasizing particle; intensifies the scope to include absolutely everything]
- ཞུགས་པ་: entering/engaging [Verbal noun; from `འཇུག་པ་`: to enter, engage; here negated to indicate non-attachment]
- མ་མཆིས་པ: not existing [Negated honorific verb; from `མ་`: negation + `མཆིས་པ`: honorific for "to exist"; conveys the Buddha's non-attachment to any phenomena]
- འི་: 's [Genitive case marker; connects the preceding clause to the following purpose marker]
- སླད་དུ་: because of [Purposive case marker; indicates that what precedes is the reason for what was asked]
- སྟེ: that is to say [Explanatory conjunction; elaborates on the preceding statement]

ucca_formatted:
དེས་ན་རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པ་ཞེས་བགྱིའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of the sentence about designating someone as a stream-enterer" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Links this statement to a previous context, indicating causality" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── the convention/the tradition [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit agent that designates or calls someone a stream-enterer" | Implicit: "The implicit agent that designates or calls someone a stream-enterer"]
    ├── བགྱིའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of naming or designating" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The term being defined or elaborated upon - stream-enterer" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རྒྱུན [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial element modifying how the entering occurs (continuously/into the stream)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཞུགས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of entering" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཞེས [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relator that connects the term 'stream-enterer' with its designation" | Implicit: ""]
    └── conventional designation [Type: Ground-Conventional Designation | Desc: "Implicit ground indicating that the stream-enterer designation exists in conventional terms while ultimately not entering anything" | Implicit: "Implicit ground indicating that the stream-enterer designation exists in conventional terms while ultimately not entering anything"]
glossary:
- དེས་ : Therefore [Instrumental of `དེ་`: that; here functioning as a causal connector; links this statement to previously established reasoning]
- ན : then [Conditional or causal marker; works with དེས་ to form the connector "therefore, consequently"]
- རྒྱུན་ : stream [Noun: continuum, flow; used as part of the technical Buddhist term for one who has entered the path]
- དུ་ : into [Terminative case marker; indicates direction toward or into the stream]
- ཞུགས་པ : entered [Past form of `འཇུག་པ`: to enter; here a nominal form referring to one who has entered; forms the term for stream-enterer (srota-āpanna)]
- ཞེས : called/termed as [Quotative particle; connects the term being defined to its designation]
- བགྱིའོ : is designated [Honorific form of `བྱེད་པ`: to do, make; here in the sense of "is called/designated"; functions as the main verb of the sentence with an implicit agent]

source: གཟུགས་ལ་ཡང་མ་ཞུགས། སྒྲ་ལ་ཡང་མ་ལགས། དྲི་ལ་ཡང་མ་ལགས། རོ་ལ་ཡང་མ་ལགས། རེག་བྱ་ལ་ཡང་མ་ལགས། ཆོས་རྣམས་ལ་ཡང་མ་ཞུགས་ཏེ།

glossary:
```markdown
- གཟུགས་ལ : in form [Locative case of `གཟུགས་`: form, visual objects, rūpa; refers to the first of the five sensory objects; functions as Patient participant in the sentence]
- ཡང་ : also, even [Adverbial emphasis particle; intensifies the negation that follows; adds emphasis that "not even in form" is there engagement]
- མ་ཞུགས : does not enter [Negated verb `ཞུགས་`: to enter, engage with; negated by མ་ prefix; indicates the process of non-engagement with form; implicit subject is the stream-enterer]
- ། : [Tibetan sentence-ending punctuation mark; separates clauses within the passage]

- སྒྲ་ལ : in sound [Locative case of `སྒྲ་`: sound, auditory objects, śabda; refers to the second of the five sensory objects; functions as Patient participant in the sentence]
- ཡང་ : also, even [Adverbial emphasis particle; intensifies the negation that follows; adds emphasis that "not even in sound" is there engagement]
- མ་ལགས : is not [Negated honorific verb `ལགས་`: to be; negated by མ་ prefix; indicates the process of non-existence in the realm of sound; implicit subject is the stream-enterer]
- ། : [Tibetan sentence-ending punctuation mark; separates clauses within the passage]

- དྲི་ལ : in smell [Locative case of `དྲི་`: smell, odor, gandha; refers to the third of the five sensory objects; functions as Patient participant in the sentence]
- ཡང་ : also, even [Adverbial emphasis particle; intensifies the negation that follows; adds emphasis that "not even in smell" is there engagement]
- མ་ལགས : is not [Negated honorific verb `ལགས་`: to be; negated by མ་ prefix; indicates the process of non-existence in the realm of smell; implicit subject is the stream-enterer]
- ། : [Tibetan sentence-ending punctuation mark; separates clauses within the passage]

- རོ་ལ : in taste [Locative case of `རོ་`: taste, flavor, rasa; refers to the fourth of the five sensory objects; functions as Patient participant in the sentence]
- ཡང་ : also, even [Adverbial emphasis particle; intensifies the negation that follows; adds emphasis that "not even in taste" is there engagement]
- མ་ལགས : is not [Negated honorific verb `ལགས་`: to be; negated by མ་ prefix; indicates the process of non-existence in the realm of taste; implicit subject is the stream-enterer]
- ། : [Tibetan sentence-ending punctuation mark; separates clauses within the passage]

- རེག་བྱ་ལ : in touch [Locative case of `རེག་བྱ་`: tactile sensations, touch, sparśa; refers to the fifth of the five sensory objects; functions as Patient participant in the sentence]
- ཡང་ : also, even [Adverbial emphasis particle; intensifies the negation that follows; adds emphasis that "not even in touch" is there engagement]
- མ་ལགས : is not [Negated honorific verb `ལགས་`: to be; negated by མ་ prefix; indicates the process of non-existence in the realm of touch; implicit subject is the stream-enterer]
- ། : [Tibetan sentence-ending punctuation mark; separates clauses within the passage]

- ཆོས་རྣམས་ལ : in all phenomena [Locative case of `ཆོས་`: dharmas, phenomena, mental objects; with plural marker `རྣམས་` indicating comprehensiveness; refers to all phenomena beyond the five sensory objects; functions as Patient participant in the sentence]
- ཡང་ : also, even [Adverbial emphasis particle; intensifies the negation that follows; adds emphasis that "not even in all phenomena" is there engagement]
- མ་ཞུགས་ : does not enter [Negated verb `ཞུགས་`: to enter, engage with; negated by མ་ prefix; indicates the process of non-engagement with all phenomena; implicit subject is the stream-enterer]
- ཏེ། : and thus [Connective particle indicating this statement summarizes or relates to all previous statements; links this final clause to the preceding five statements about non-engagement with sensory objects]
```

དེས་ན་རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པ་ཞེས་བགྱིའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire statement about designation" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Linker indicating the causal relationship for the designation" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [practitioner] [Type: Participant-Center | Desc: "Implicit entity (practitioner) who is being designated as a stream-enterer" | Implicit: "Practitioner who is being designated"]
    ├── བགྱིའོ [Type: State | Desc: "State verb indicating naming/designation relationship rather than active process" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པ [Type: Participant-Attribute | Desc: "Attribute describing what the implicit participant is called" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རྒྱུན་དུ [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "Goal of the entering action in stream-enterer" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཞུགས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process within the nominal phrase 'stream-enterer'" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [conventional designation only] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit information that this designation is merely conventional rather than ultimate truth" | Implicit: "This designation is merely conventional (ཐ་སྙད) rather than ultimate truth"]
    └── ཞེས [Type: Function | Desc: "Function word connecting the attribute to the state of being called" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེས་ན : therefore [Instrumental (དེས) + Particle (ན); from `དེ`: that, this; functions as a causal connector linking previous reasoning to the conclusion that follows; establishes logical basis for the designation]

- རྒྱུན་དུ་ : into the stream [Terminative case of `རྒྱུན`: stream, continuum, flow; indicates direction or destination; functions as the goal toward which the entering occurs]

- ཞུགས་པ་ : one who has entered [Nominalized form of `འཇུག་པ`: to enter; past tense form indicating completed action; refers to a practitioner who has entered the stream of noble ones; functions as the main descriptive designation]

- ཞེས་ : called, termed as [Quotative particle; marks the preceding term as a designation or label; connects the designation to the verb of naming]

- བགྱིའོ : is designated [Polite/honorific form of `བྱེད་པ`: to do, make; here functioning as a verb of designation or naming; final particle (འོ) marks statement completion; indicates conventional designation rather than ultimate description]

དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་གལ་ཏེ་རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པ་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པའི་འབྲས་བུ་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་པར་གྱུར་ན། དེ་ཉིད་དེའི་བདག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node of the entire graph" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Rhetorical question introducing the explanation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ [Type: Function | Desc: "Reference to previous statement" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Process | Desc: "Questioning process" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་གལ་ཏེ་རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པ་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པའི་འབྲས་བུ་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་པར་གྱུར་ན། དེ་ཉིད་དེའི་བདག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main explanation with conditional statement and consequence" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Addressee of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གལ་ཏེ་རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པ་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པའི་འབྲས་བུ་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་པར་གྱུར་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Conditional clause describing the hypothetical thinking of a Stream-enterer" | Implicit: ""]

            ├── རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པ་ [Type: Participant-Center | Desc: "The subject of the conditional statement" | Implicit: ""]

                └── ཐོབ་བོ་ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of attainment in the Stream-enterer's thought" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ཉིད་དེའི་བདག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Consequence of the Stream-enterer's thought" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་ཉིད་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Reference to the Stream-enterer's thought" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེའི་བདག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་ [Type: State | Desc: "The state of self-grasping that would arise" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འགྱུར་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of becoming or turning into" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བདག་མེད་ཀྱི་ལྟ་བ་དང་འགལ་བ། [Type: Implicit | Desc: "Implicit Buddhist doctrine of no-self that contextualizes why self-grasping is problematic" | Implicit: "Implicit Buddhist doctrine of no-self that contextualizes why self-grasping is problematic"]
glossary:
- དེ་ : why [Demonstrative pronoun; "that/this"; functions as reference to the previous statement in the rhetorical question]
- ཅིའི་ : for what [Interrogative pronoun with genitive case; from `ཅི་`: what; used in rhetorical questioning]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the purpose of [Postposition indicating purpose or reason; here asking for explanation]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional particle marking rhetorical question; signals the introduction of an explanation]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; vocative case addressing the Buddha as recipient of the statement]
- གལ་ཏེ་ : if [Conditional marker introducing a hypothetical scenario]
- རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པ་ : Stream-enterer [Buddhist technical term; refers to one who has entered the stream to enlightenment; functions as the central participant in the conditional statement]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun introducing reported thought]
- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking [Verbal noun indicating quotative speech; marks the beginning of the Stream-enterer's thought]
- བདག་གིས་ : I [First-person pronoun with ergative/instrumental case; the agent in the Stream-enterer's thought]
- རྒྱུན་དུ་ཞུགས་པའི་ : of Stream-entry [Genitive form qualifying `འབྲས་བུ་`; specifies the type of attainment]
- འབྲས་བུ་ : fruit [Buddhist technical term; result or attainment of a spiritual path; the object being attained]
- ཐོབ་བོ་ : have attained [Perfect tense verb with declarative particle; indicates completion of attainment in the Stream-enterer's thought]
- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking [Repeated quotative marker closing the reported thought]
- སེམས་པར་ : were to think [Verbal noun with terminative particle; the mental process of thinking]
- གྱུར་ན། : if became [Conditional marker with verb "to become"; completes the protasis of the conditional statement]
- དེ་ཉིད་ : that very [Emphatic demonstrative; refers back to the Stream-enterer's thought]
- དེའི་ : their [Genitive form of demonstrative pronoun; possessive referring to the Stream-enterer]
- བདག་ཏུ་ : as self [Noun with terminative particle; indicates identity as "self"; part of the self-grasping state]
- འཛིན་པར་ : grasping [Verbal noun with terminative particle; the act of holding onto or grasping at a concept]
- འགྱུར་ : would become [Future/present verb indicating transformation or becoming]
- ལགས་སོ། : is [Honorific form of the verb "to be" with declarative final particle; respectful conclusion]

    ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འཛིན་པ་དང༌། སྲོག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Process" | Implicit: ""]

        ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector between first and second scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྲོག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second type of grasping" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཛིན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "Cognitive process of grasping or clinging" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྲོག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object of grasping: life force" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector between second and third scene" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར [Type: Scene | Desc: "Third type of grasping" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཛིན་པར [Type: Process | Desc: "Cognitive process of grasping or clinging" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གང་ཟག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object of grasping: persons" | Implicit: ""]
    └── འགྱུར་ལགས་སོ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Modal/aspectual element that completes the three parallel scenes" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [noun: from `སེམས་` (mind) + `ཅན་` (possessing); refers to conscious beings in Buddhist cosmology; functions as the object of grasping in the first parallel scene]

- དུ་ : as [terminative case particle: transforms the noun into an adverbial phrase; indicates the manner in which the grasping manifests]

- འཛིན་པ་ : grasping [verbal noun from `འཛིན་` (to hold, grasp, cling to); refers to the cognitive process of clinging to concepts; functions as the main process in the first parallel scene]

- དང༌ : and [conjunction: links the parallel scenes of different types of grasping]

- སྲོག་ : life-force [noun: vital essence or life energy; in Buddhist philosophy, refers to the animating principle; functions as the object of grasping in the second parallel scene]

- ཏུ་ : as [terminative case particle: transforms the noun into an adverbial phrase; indicates the manner in which the grasping manifests]

- འཛིན་པ་ : grasping [verbal noun from `འཛིན་` (to hold, grasp, cling to); refers to the cognitive process of clinging to concepts; functions as the main process in the second parallel scene]

- དང༌ : and [conjunction: links the parallel scenes of different types of grasping]

- གང་ཟག་ : persons [noun: individual, person; in Buddhist philosophy, refers to the conventional designation of a self; functions as the object of grasping in the third parallel scene]

- ཏུ་ : as [terminative case particle: transforms the noun into an adverbial phrase; indicates the manner in which the grasping manifests]

- འཛིན་པར་ : to grasp [verbal noun `འཛིན་པ་` + `ར་` (terminative particle); indicates the action that will occur; functions as the main process in the third parallel scene]

- འགྱུར་ : will become [verb: to transform, change into, become; indicates future tense; functions as the modal/aspectual element that applies to all three scenes]

- ལགས་སོ : is/are [honorific final particle: combination of honorific copula `ལགས་` + final particle `སོ`; marks the end of the statement with a formal, respectful tone]
