བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node representing the entire text with parallel scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene showing the Buddha speaking" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who is speaking (the Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of speaking/teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene representing the question asked by the Buddha to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The person being addressed with the question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི [Type: Center-Elaborator | Desc: "Refers to the subject matter of contemplation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Questioning adverbial phrase modifying the thinking process" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of thinking/contemplating" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སེམས [Type: Center-Experiencer | Desc: "The mental process of Subhuti that is being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [implied philosophical context] [Type: Ground-Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit philosophical context of the question regarding self-grasping and pride in attainment" | Implicit: "Philosophical context regarding self-grasping and pride in attainment"]
        └── [implied connection] [Type: Center-Elaborator | Desc: "Explicitly connects Subhuti to the thinking process" | Implicit: "Connection between Subhuti and the thinking process"]
            ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The person being addressed with the question" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སེམས [Type: Center-Experiencer | Desc: "The mental process of Subhuti that is being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Bhagavan [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to one who has conquered the four māras and possesses the six perfections; functions as the Agent in this utterance]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker indicating the agent of the action; marks Buddha as the speaker/teacher in this scene]

- བཀའ་ : speech [Honorific term for the Buddha's teachings or words; refers specifically to authoritative pronouncements of the Buddha; part of the Process in the first scene]

- སྩལ་པ། : proclaimed [Past tense of `སྩོལ་བ་`: to bestow, grant, proclaim; here indicates the completed action of the Buddha speaking; functions as the main Process in the first scene]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Name of the Buddha's disciple who is being addressed; functions as the Addressee in the second scene; object of the Buddha's question]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun referring to the subject matter about to be discussed; indicates the specific point of contemplation; serves as an elaborator of the central concept]

- ཇི་ : what [Interrogative particle initiating a question; part of the questioning adverbial phrase modifying the thinking process]

- སྙམ་ : think [Verbal noun from `སྙམ་པ་`: to think, consider; part of the questioning adverbial construction "what do you think"]

- དུ་ : as, in what way [Terminative particle completing the adverbial phrase ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ (what do you think); connects the questioning to the process of thinking]

- སེམས། : do you think? [Present tense of `སེམས་པ་`: to think, contemplate; here directly questioning Subhuti's thought process; serves as the main Process in the second scene and implies Subhuti as the Experiencer]

ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བ་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བའི་འབྲས་བུ་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་སྙམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire sentence about a Once-Returner contemplating their attainment" | Implicit: ""]

                └── ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the type of fruit that has been attained" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྙམ་དུ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Connects the embedded thought back to the main scene" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Connects the main scene with the embedded thought content" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བདག་གིས་ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བའི་འབྲས་བུ་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Time | Desc: "The embedded thought content of the Once-Returner" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདག་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker/thinker referring to themselves in the embedded thought" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཐོབ་བོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of attaining performed by the agent in the embedded thought" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བའི་འབྲས་བུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object that has been attained in the embedded thought" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the type of fruit that has been attained" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སྙམ་དུ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Connects the embedded thought back to the main scene" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ལན་ཅིག་ : once [Adverbial modifier; from `ལན་` (time, occasion) + `ཅིག` (one, single); specifies the frequency of return; part of the technical Buddhist term for a Once-Returner]
- ཕྱིར་འོང་བ་ : Once-Returner [Nominalized form of `ཕྱིར་` (back, again) + `འོང་` (to come); technical Buddhist term for someone who will be reborn in the desire realm only once more before attaining liberation; functions as the main Agent/subject of the sentence]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; indicates the specific thought that follows; introduces the content of contemplation]
- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking [Purposive or quotative particle from `སྙམ་པ་` (to think); connects the main statement with the embedded thought; functions as a Relator in the semantic structure]
- བདག་གིས་ : I, myself [Ergative case of `བདག་` (self, I); marks the Agent/subject in the embedded thought; indicates the person who has attained the fruit]
- ལན་ཅིག་ : once [Adverbial modifier; same as above; part of the technical term within the embedded thought]
- ཕྱིར་འོང་བའི་ : of the Once-Returner [Genitive case of `ཕྱིར་འོང་བ་`; modifies `འབྲས་བུ་` (fruit); indicates possession or specification of the type of fruit attained]
- འབྲས་བུ་ : fruit, result [Noun; technical Buddhist term referring to the spiritual attainment or result; functions as the Patient/object of attainment in the semantic structure]
- ཐོབ་བོ་ : have attained [Verb `ཐོབ་` (to attain, obtain) + final particle `བོ་` indicating completion; marks the Process/action in the embedded thought]
- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking [Same as above; another quotative marker connecting the embedded thought back to the main verb]
- སེམས་ : thinks [Present tense verb from `སེམས་པ་` (to think); main Process/verb of the sentence; indicates the mental activity of the Once-Returner]
- སྙམ : it is thought [Final particle indicating reported speech or thought; completes the framing of the entire contemplation]

glossary:
## Word-by-Word Glossary

- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhūti [Ergative case of `རབ་འབྱོར་`: name of a disciple of the Buddha; here marking Subhūti as the agent/speaker who is responding; functions as the agent/speaker in the dialogue structure]

- གསོལ་པ། : replied [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, speak, reply; here indicating a formal response in conversation; functions as the main verbal process of the utterance]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Bhagavān [Vocative form addressing the Buddha; literally "the Transcendent Destroyer" (of afflictions); here used as a respectful address to the Buddha; functions as the addressee of Subhūti's statement]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to a previously mentioned concept or assertion; here referring to what is being negated in the conversation; functions as the center of the negation]

- ནི་ : indeed [Topic marker particle; emphasizes the preceding term; here marking "that" as the specific topic being negated; functions to highlight the object of negation]

- མ་ལགས་སོ། : is not [Negative form of `ལགས་`: honorific form of "to be"; negation marker `མ་` + honorific verb `ལགས་` + final particle `སོ`; here expressing respectful denial or negation to the Buddha; functions as the negation predicate with implied content being negated]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། གང་ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བ་ཉིད་དུ་ཞུགས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མ་མཆིས་པའི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The referent being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "Questioning process" | Implicit: ""]
    └── གང་ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བ་ཉིད་དུ་ཞུགས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མ་མཆིས་པའི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Answer" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བ་ཉིད་དུ་ཞུགས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma being negated" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་དེ [Type: Center | Desc: "The dharma or phenomenon in question" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གང་ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བ་ཉིད་དུ་ཞུགས་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Description of the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཞུགས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of entering" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བ་ཉིད་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Buddhist technical term for once-returner status" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་ཡང་མ་མཆིས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "Negation of existence" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གང་ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Interrogative reference" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཡང [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Emphatic particle strengthening negation" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སླད་དུ་སྟེ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Connects the explanation to the question" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; referring to the proposition or concept being questioned; functions as the Patient in the questioning scene]
- ཅིའི་ : why [Interrogative pronoun in genitive case; from `ཅི་`: what; used to form "for what reason"; part of the questioning process]
- ཕྱིར་ : for the sake of [Postposition indicating purpose/reason; combines with `ཅིའི་` to mean "why"; part of adverbial phrase in questioning]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional verb form from `ཟེར་`: to say/ask; marks a rhetorical question formula; completes the questioning process]
- གང་ : whatever [Relative/interrogative pronoun; introduces the relative clause; functions as an adverbial modifier intensifying the negation]
- ལན་ཅིག་ : once [Adverbial modifier; `ལན་`: occasion + `ཅིག་`: one; part of the Buddhist technical term]
- ཕྱིར་འོང་བ་ : returning [Verbal noun; `ཕྱིར་`: back + `འོང་བ་`: to come; technical Buddhist term for "once-returner"; part of adverbial phrase]
- ཉིད་དུ་ : itself/state of [Abstract nominalizer + terminative case; indicates the essential nature/state; completes the Buddhist technical term]
- ཞུགས་པའི་ : entering [Verbal noun in genitive case; from `འཇུག་པ་`: to enter; describes the process of entering the spiritual state; functions as Process]
- ཆོས་ : dharma [Noun; refers to phenomena, qualities, or teachings; the central element being negated; functions as Center in UCCA structure]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies the dharma being discussed; part of the Patient in the answer scene]
- གང་ཡང་ : whatsoever [Indefinite pronoun + emphatic particle; `གང་`: whatever + `ཡང་`: even/also; strengthens the following negation]
- མ་མཆིས་པའི་ : does not exist [Negative verbal form in genitive case; honorific form of `མེད་པ་`: non-existence; primary negating Process in the answer scene]
- སླད་དུ་ : because [Postposition indicating reason/purpose; links the explanation to the question; functions as Relator]
- སྟེ། : that is [Connective particle; marks the completion of an explanation; completes the Relator that connects explanation to question]

ucca_formatted:
དེས་ན་ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བ་ཞེས་བགྱིའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connecting the statement to previous context" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བགྱིའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "Main predicate indicating declaration or definition" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བ་ཞེས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The term being defined" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལན་ཅིག [Type: Quantifier | Desc: "Specifies the number of times the return occurs" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཕྱིར་འོང་བ [Type: Center | Desc: "The core concept of returning that is being quantified" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཞེས [Type: Function | Desc: "Quotative marker connecting the term to the declaration" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེས་ན་ : therefore [Instrumental case of དེ་ (that) + causal connective; functions as a Linker connecting this statement to previous context; indicates a logical conclusion]

- ལན་ཅིག་ : once [Numeral + adverbial particle; literally "one time"; functions as a Quantifier specifying the frequency of return]

- ཕྱིར་འོང་བ་ : one who returns [Directional particle ཕྱིར་ (back, again) + འོང་ (to come) + nominalizing particle བ་; the core concept being defined; functions as the Center of the Patient participant]

- ཞེས་ : called/known as [Quotative particle; connects the defined term to the declaration; functions as a Function word linking the term to the verb]

- བགྱིའོ : is designated/termed [Honorific form of བྱེད་པ་ (to do/make) + final particle འོ; present tense; functions as the main Process/predicate of the sentence that establishes the definition]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་གལ་ཏེ་ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བ་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བའི་འབྲས་བུ་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་པར་གྱུར་ན། དེ་ཉིད་དེའི་བདག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "root scene" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "addressee of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གལ་ཏེ་ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བ་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བའི་འབྲས་བུ་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་པར་གྱུར་ན། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "conditional clause" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གལ་ཏེ [Type: Linker | Desc: "conditional linker" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བ་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བའི་འབྲས་བུ་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་པར་གྱུར་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "conditional thought process" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བ [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "person experiencing the thinking" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བའི་འབྲས་བུ་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་པར་གྱུར [Type: Scene | Desc: "thinking process and content" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── བདག་གིས་ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བའི་འབྲས་བུ་ཐོབ་བོ [Type: Center | Desc: "content of thought" | Implicit: ""]
                    ├── བདག་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "person claiming attainment" | Implicit: ""]
                    ├── ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བའི་འབྲས་བུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "object being attained" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── ཐོབ་བོ [Type: Process | Desc: "process of attainment" | Implicit: ""]
                └── སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་པར་གྱུར [Type: Process | Desc: "process of thinking" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་ཉིད་དེའི་བདག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་ལགས་སོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "consequence scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ཉིད [Type: Participant-Actor | Desc: "thing becoming self-grasping" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེའི་བདག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "resultant state of self-grasping" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེའི [Type: Participant-Possessor | Desc: "possessor of self-grasping" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འགྱུར [Type: Process | Desc: "process of becoming" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ལགས་སོ [Type: Function | Desc: "honorific marker" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [honorific address for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), `འདས་` (transcended); functions as addressee/recipient of the statement]

- གལ་ཏེ་ : if [conditional marker; introduces a hypothetical scenario; functions as conditional linker in the sentence structure]

- ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བ་ : Once-returner [Buddhist technical term (sakṛdāgāmin); a noble person who will only be reborn once more before attaining liberation; functions as the experiencer of the thought process]

- འདི་སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking thus [quotative construction; `འདི་` (this) + `སྙམ་དུ་` (thinking that); introduces the content of thought]

- བདག་གིས་ : I [instrumental/agentive case of `བདག་` (self/I); the person claiming attainment; functions as agent in the thought content]

- ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བའི་ : of the Once-returner [genitive case of `ལན་ཅིག་ཕྱིར་འོང་བ་`; modifies the following noun]

- འབྲས་བུ་ : fruit/result [Buddhist technical term for spiritual attainment; the specific spiritual accomplishment being claimed; functions as patient in the thought content]

- ཐོབ་བོ་ : have attained [perfect form of `ཐོབ་` (to obtain/attain) + final particle `བོ་`; indicates completion; functions as the process of attainment in the thought]

- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking that [quotative marker; closes the quoted thought]

- སེམས་པར་ : would think [verbal noun from `སེམས་` (to think) + terminative particle `པར་`; describes the mental action]

- གྱུར་ན། : were to become [conditional form of `འགྱུར་` (to become/change); completes the conditional clause]

- དེ་ཉིད་ : that very [emphatic demonstrative; refers back to the Once-returner; functions as the actor in the consequence scene]

- དེའི་ : their [genitive case of `དེ་` (that); possessive marker; the possessor of the self-concept]

- བདག་ཏུ་ : as self [noun `བདག་` (self) + terminative particle `ཏུ་`; indicates transformation or identification; the concept being grasped]

- འཛིན་པར་ : grasping [verbal noun from `འཛིན་` (to grasp/hold) + terminative particle `པར་`; the action of clinging to a concept of self]

- འགྱུར་ : would become [future/present form of `འགྱུར་` (to become/change); the process of transformation in the consequence]

- ལགས་སོ། : is so [honorific affirmative final particle; indicates respectful assertion to a superior]

ucca_formatted:
སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འཛིན་པ་དང༌སྲོག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing parallel scenes of different forms of grasping" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འཛིན་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing grasping at sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཛིན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of grasping or clinging to the concept of sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object being grasped at - the concept of sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
        └── implicit practitioner [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "Implicit shared experiencer who is doing the grasping" | Implicit: "The practitioner who is doing the grasping is implied but not explicitly stated"]
    ├── སྲོག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene describing grasping at life-force" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཛིན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of grasping or clinging to the concept of life-force" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྲོག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object being grasped at - the concept of life-force" | Implicit: ""]
        └── implicit practitioner [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "Implicit shared experiencer who is doing the grasping" | Implicit: "The practitioner who is doing the grasping is implied but not explicitly stated"]
    ├── གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་ལགས་སོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Third scene describing the causal process of becoming one who grasps at personhood" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར [Type: Process-State Change | Desc: "The process of transformation/becoming that results from grasping at personhood" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་ཟག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object being grasped at - the concept of personhood" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལགས་སོ [Type: Function | Desc: "Formal verb ending indicating certainty" | Implicit: ""]
        └── implicit practitioner [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "Implicit shared experiencer who is doing the grasping" | Implicit: "The practitioner who is doing the grasping is implied but not explicitly stated"]
    ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector linking the parallel scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── during practice/attainment [Type: Time | Desc: "Implicit time context indicating these forms of grasping occur during Buddhist practice and stages of attainment" | Implicit: "The time context of Buddhist practice and stages of attainment is implied but not explicitly stated"]
    └── shared implicit practitioner [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "Shared implicit experiencer across all three scenes representing the practitioner who engages in these forms of grasping" | Implicit: "The shared practitioner who engages in these forms of grasping is implied but not explicitly stated"]
glossary:
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Noun; refers to conscious beings within Buddhist cosmology; functions as the object/Patient being grasped at in the first scene]
- དུ་ : as [Terminative case particle indicating transformation or designation; shows how the object is being conceptualized by the experiencer]
- འཛིན་པ་ : grasping [Verbal noun from `འཛིན་` (to hold, grasp, cling to); refers to the cognitive process of clinging to concepts; functions as the main Process in each parallel scene]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction linking parallel scenes/concepts; connects the three types of grasping as related but distinct mental activities]
- སྲོག་ : life-force [Noun referring to the vital essence or life-energy; in Buddhist philosophy often related to the concept of jīva; functions as the object/Patient in the second scene]
- ཏུ་ : as [Terminative case particle similar to དུ་; indicates conceptualization of the object]
- གང་ཟག་ : person [Noun referring to individual personhood or personal identity; in Buddhist contexts refers to the conventional sense of self; functions as object/Patient in the third scene]
- འཛིན་པར་ : to grasp at [Verbal noun `འཛིན་པ་` + terminative particle `ར་`; shows directional intention toward the mental activity]
- འགྱུར་ : becomes/will become [Verb indicating transformation or change of state; shows the resultant condition of the grasping activity; functions as part of the Process-State Change]
- ལགས་སོ : is/are [Formal verb ending indicating certainty or affirmation; polite declarative form asserting the truth of the statement; adds epistemic certainty to the entire parallel structure]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the Buddha's address to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who is speaking (the Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of speaking performed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient of the Buddha's speech (Subhuti)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Demonstrative reference to the question that follows" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་ [Type: Process | Desc: "The questioning process directed at Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [Subhuti] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit agent (Subhuti) who is being asked to consider the question" | Implicit: "The implicit agent who is being asked to consider the question"]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Bhagavān [Honorific title for the Buddha, lit. "the Blessed One"; the one who has conquered (བཅོམ་) defilements, possesses (ལྡན་) qualities, and has gone beyond (འདས་) saṃsāra; functions as the Agent/Speaker in this scene]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates the Buddha is the agent performing the action of speaking]
- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། : said [Honorific verb (past tense) from བཀའ་སྩལ་བ་: to speak, pronounce; honorific form used specifically for the Buddha's speech; functions as the main Process in the scene]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of one of the Buddha's chief disciples; functions as the Recipient of the Buddha's speech]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers forward to the question that follows; functions as an Elaborator that introduces the upcoming question]
- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [Interrogative phrase; ཇི་: how/what + སྙམ་: to think + དུ་: complementizer; introduces a question seeking Subhuti's opinion; part of the questioning Process]
- སེམས་ : do you think [Present tense verb from སེམས་པ་: to think, contemplate; completes the question formula "what do you think?"; directs Subhuti to consider the question that would follow]

ucca_formatted:
ཕྱིར་མི་འོང་བ་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་ཕྱིར་མི་འོང་བའི་འབྲས་བུ་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire questioning about the non-returner's thoughts" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཕྱིར་མི་འོང་བ [Type: State | Desc: "The state of being a non-returner, not the agent of thinking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས་སྙམ་མམ [Type: Process | Desc: "The questioning process about whether thinking occurs" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner of thinking, introducing the content of thought" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བདག་གིས་ཕྱིར་མི་འོང་བའི་འབྲས་བུ་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The elaboration of the prideful self-identification with attainment" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདག་གིས་ཕྱིར་མི་འོང་བའི་འབྲས་བུ་ཐོབ་བོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The inner scene depicting the claimed attainment" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བདག་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent (self) claiming to have attained the fruit" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཐོབ་བོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of attaining the spiritual fruit" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཕྱིར་མི་འོང་བའི་འབྲས་བུ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept being discussed - the spiritual attainment" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སྙམ་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Marker of the quoted thought content" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཕྱིར་མི་འོང་བ་ : Non-returner [Noun compound: `ཕྱིར་` (back/again) + `མི་` (negation) + `འོང་བ་` (to come); reference to an advanced spiritual practitioner who will not be reborn in the desire realm; functions as a state rather than agent in this context]

- འདི་སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking thus [Adverbial phrase: `འདི་` (this) + `སྙམ་དུ་` (thinking that); introduces quoted content of thought; functions as a manner adverbial indicating how the thinking occurs]

- བདག་གིས་ : I, myself [Instrumental/agentive case of `བདག་` (self/I); indicates the agent claiming attainment; functions as the participant-agent in the embedded scene]

- ཕྱིར་མི་འོང་བའི་ : of the non-returner [Genitive case of `ཕྱིར་མི་འོང་བ་` (non-returner); modifies the following noun; part of the central concept being discussed]

- འབྲས་བུ་ : fruit, result [Noun: spiritual attainment/fruit; here refers specifically to the spiritual state or attainment of being a non-returner; part of the central concept in the embedded scene]

- ཐོབ་བོ་ : have attained [Verb: `ཐོབ་` (to attain/obtain) + final particle `བོ་` marking statement completion; the process of attainment in the embedded scene]

- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking that [Quotative marker: introduces quoted speech/thought; marks the end of the quoted content; functions as an adverbial marker]

- སེམས་ : thinks [Verb: to think/consider; the main process verb of the outer scene; part of the questioning process]

- སྙམ་མམ : do (you) think? [Interrogative form: `སྙམ་` (to think) + interrogative particle `མམ`; forms the questioning aspect of the main process; indicates this is a question]

རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of Subhuti's reply" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker/agent who is replying" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསོལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The speech act of replying" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Direct-Speech | Desc: "The content of what Subhuti said" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The person being directly addressed in the speech" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ནི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The referent being discussed or denied" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Negation-State | Desc: "The negated state being expressed" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མ་ [Type: Negation | Desc: "The negation marker in the verb" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; the disciple of Buddha who is speaking; functions as the Agent/Speaker in this sentence]
- གྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates that Subhuti is the one performing the action of speaking]
- གསོལ་པ། : said/replied [Perfect tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, to speak respectfully; here marking the speech act directed toward the Buddha; functions as the main Process/Verb]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); functions as the Addressee of the speech]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to a previously mentioned proposition or statement; functions as Patient/Topic being discussed]
- ནི་ : indeed [Topic marker; emphasizes the demonstrative pronoun; helps mark "that" as the specific subject being negated]
- མ་ : not [Negative prefix; attached to verb to create negation; primary marker of the negative statement]
- ལགས་སོ། : is [Honorific form of the verb "to be" (`ཡིན་`); with final particle `སོ` marking completion; functions as the main verb being negated]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། གང་ཕྱིར་མི་འོང་བ་ཉིད་དུ་ཞུགས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མ་མཆིས་པའི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The thing being questioned about" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "The questioning process" | Implicit: ""]
    └── གང་ཕྱིར་མི་འོང་བ་ཉིད་དུ་ཞུགས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མ་མཆིས་པའི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Answer scene explaining the reason" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་ཕྱིར [Type: Relator | Desc: "Causal connector establishing reason" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མི་འོང་བ་ཉིད་དུ་ཞུགས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་དེ [Type: Center | Desc: "The core entity being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མི་འོང་བ་ཉིད་དུ [Type: State | Desc: "The state of being a non-returner (anagami)" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཞུགས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of attaining the state" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གང་ཡང་མ་མཆིས་པའི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Explanation of ultimate truth about non-existence" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གང་ཡང [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Emphasis on complete absence" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མ་མཆིས་པའི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ [Type: Purpose | Desc: "Purpose indicating the ultimate reason" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; used here as a reference to the previous statement; functions as the Patient (thing being questioned about) in the question scene]
- ཅིའི་ : for what [Interrogative pronoun ཅི་ 'what' + genitive case marker འི་; asking about the reason; part of the questioning process]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the sake of [Purposive/causal connector; links to the reason being asked about; part of the questioning process]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional form of ཟེར་བ་: 'to say/ask'; marks a rhetorical question; completes the questioning process]
- གང་ཕྱིར་ : because [Causal connector; གང་ 'which' + ཕྱིར་ 'reason/cause'; functions as a Relator establishing the cause in the answer scene]
- མི་འོང་བ་ : non-returning [Negative prefix མི་ + འོང་བ་ 'to come/return'; referring to the Buddhist concept of anāgāmin (non-returner); part of the state description]
- ཉིད་དུ་ : as the very state of [Abstract nominalizer ཉིད་ + terminative case དུ་; emphasizes the essential nature of non-returning; completes the state description]
- ཞུགས་པའི་ : entering into [Past/perfect form of འཇུག་པ་ 'to enter' + genitive case འི་; describes the process of attaining the spiritual state; functions as Process modifier]
- ཆོས་ : dharma [Noun: fundamental Buddhist teaching/phenomena; the subject being discussed; core of the Patient participant]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies the particular dharma being discussed; completes the Patient participant]
- གང་ཡང་ : anything whatsoever [གང་ 'which/whatever' + ཡང་ 'even/also'; emphatic universal quantifier; emphasizes complete absence]
- མ་མཆིས་པའི་ : does not exist [Negative prefix མ་ + མཆིས་པ་ 'to exist' (honorific) + genitive འི་; negates existence; forms part of the ultimate explanation]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the reason that [Purposive/causal connector; indicates the purpose or reason; part of the explanation]
- སྟེ། : that is to say [Connective particle; provides additional explanation; concludes the statement]

ucca_formatted:
དེའི་ཕྱིར་ཕྱིར་མི་འོང་བ་ཞེས་བགྱིའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing the designation of Non-returners" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེའི་ཕྱིར [Type: Linker | Desc: "Causal marker connecting this statement to previous context, indicating reason for the designation" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [One who has abandoned all afflictions in the desire realm] [Type: Participant | Desc: "Implicit reference to the practitioner who is being designated as a Non-returner" | Implicit: "Reference to the practitioner who is being designated as a Non-returner"]
    ├── ཕྱིར་མི་འོང་བ [Type: Participant | Desc: "The spiritual designation 'Non-returner' (Anagamin) - one who will not return to the desire realm" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཞེས [Type: Relator | Desc: "Quotative marker connecting the designation to the process of naming" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བགྱིའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of designating or naming" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེའི་ : therefore [Genitive of `དེ་`: that; here functioning as a causal connector joining this statement to previous context; serves as part of the causal linker in the semantic structure]
- ཕྱིར : because of, for that reason [Postposition indicating cause or reason; combines with དེའི་ to form the complete causal phrase "therefore/for that reason"; part of the linker connecting to previous context]
- ཕྱིར་མི་འོང་བ : Non-returner [Compound term: `ཕྱིར་`: back/again + `མི་`: negation marker + `འོང་བ`: to come; technical Buddhist term (Sanskrit: anāgāmin) referring to a spiritual practitioner who will not be reborn in the desire realm; functions as a key participant being designated in the scene]
- ཞེས : thus, as [Quotative marker connecting the designation "Non-returner" to the act of naming; serves as a relator in the semantic structure]
- བགྱིའོ : is designated/called [Honorific form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do/make, with final particle `འོ`; marks the statement as declarative; functions as the main process in the scene of designation]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the Buddha's speech event and question to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent of the speech act, Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The speech act of the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Center | Desc: "The content of Buddha's speech, asking Subhuti to consider something" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The person being addressed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས [Type: Process | Desc: "The cognitive process Subhuti is being asked to engage in" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner adverbial modifying how Subhuti should think or consider" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner adverbial expression" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The demonstrative pronoun referring to what Subhuti is being asked to consider" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Bhagavan [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to the Buddha as the agent of the speech act]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates Buddha is the agent performing the action]
- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ་ : proclaimed [Perfective of `བཀའ་སྩལ་བ་`: to speak, proclaim (honorific); the speech act performed by the Buddha as the main process of the scene]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; the direct recipient of the Buddha's speech; functions as addressee]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to what Subhuti is being asked to consider; functions as the patient/object of contemplation]
- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [Interrogative adverbial phrase; `ཇི་` (what/how) + `སྙམ་` (to think) + `དུ་` (manner particle); modifies how Subhuti should engage in contemplation]
- སེམས། : consider [Present tense of `སེམས་པ་`: to think, consider; the cognitive process Subhuti is being directed to engage in; functions as the main verb of the embedded question]

ucca_formatted:
དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཉིད་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire questioning statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent (Arhat) who is the subject of the question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས་སྙམ་མམ [Type: Process-Interrogative | Desc: "The questioning verb form indicating the interrogative nature of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཉིད་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Embedded scene representing the reported speech/thought" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborator introducing the content of thinking rather than modifying how thinking occurs" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདག་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent within the reported speech who claims to have attained Arhatship" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The state or person referenced in the achievement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཐོབ་བོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of attaining/achieving within the reported speech" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྙམ་དུ [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connector linking the embedded thought to the main thinking process" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཉིད [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Emphasizer that transforms 'arhat' into 'arhatship' (the state of being an arhat)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── self-pride/arrogance [Type: Center | Desc: "Implicit content representing the concept of pride/arrogance being questioned" | Implicit: "Concept of pride/arrogance (མངོན་པའི་ང་རྒྱལ) being questioned"]
    └── མམ [Type: Ground | Desc: "Questioning marker that grounds the utterance as an interrogative" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : an Arhat [Noun; `དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་`: one who has destroyed the enemy (of afflictions); refers to the fully enlightened practitioner who is the subject of this question; functions as Agent in the main sentence]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; indicates the thought that follows; introduces the content of what might be thought]

- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking [Terminative case of `སྙམ་པ་`: to think; introduces reported speech/thought; serves as an elaborator introducing the content of thinking]

- བདག་གིས་ : I [Instrumental/ergative of `བདག་`: self, I; the first-person agent within the reported speech claiming attainment; functions as Agent in the embedded thought]

- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : Arhatship [Noun; `དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་`: state of an Arhat; here referring to the spiritual state being attained rather than the person; functions as Patient in the embedded clause]

- ཉིད་ : itself/the very state [Emphasizer; transforms 'arhat' into 'arhatship'; emphasizes the exact state of achievement being claimed]

- ཐོབ་བོ་ : have attained [Perfect tense of `ཐོབ་པ་`: to obtain, attain; the declarative verb with final particle བོ་ indicating completion; the process of attaining within the reported speech]

- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking thus [Terminative case of `སྙམ་པ་`: to think; connects the embedded thought back to the main clause; functions as a connector linking the reported thought to the main verb]

- སེམས་ : thinks [Present tense of `སེམས་པ་`: to think; the main verb of the sentence; part of the questioning process in the main clause]

- སྙམ་ : think [Present tense of `སྙམ་པ་`: to think; complements the main verb; reinforces the questioning about thought process]

- མམ : ? [Interrogative particle; transforms the statement into a question; grounds the utterance as an interrogative]

རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Agent who performs the action of replying" | Implicit: ""]
    └── གསོལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "Main verbal process of the root scene" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Embedded scene representing the content of what was said" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Addressee of the embedded statement" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ [Type: Center | Desc: "Central referent in the embedded scene" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མ་ལགས་སོ [Type: Negation | Desc: "Negation of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
                └── [concept of self-attainment or self-importance being negated] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit philosophical concept being negated" | Implicit: "attainment/self-importance"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhuti asked [Ergative case of `རབ་འབྱོར་`: Subhuti, a disciple of Buddha; here functioning as the Agent who initiates the speech act; marked with ergative case particle to show he is performing the action]

- གསོལ་པ། : replied [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, to say respectfully; here indicates a respectful verbal response directed to the Buddha; functions as the main Process of the scene]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; composed of `བཅོམ་` (conquered, overcome), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); here functioning as the Recipient addressed in the statement]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to a previously mentioned concept or proposition; functions as the central referent of the embedded statement]

- ནི་ : indeed [Topic marker; emphasizes the preceding term; helping to structure the discourse by highlighting what is being negated]

- མ་ལགས་སོ། : is not [Negated form of `ལགས་`: to be (honorific); composed of the negative prefix `མ་` and honorific verb `ལགས་` with final particle `སོ`; negates an implicit concept of self-attainment or self-importance discussed in the preceding context]

ucca_formatted: དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། གང་དག་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཞེས་བགྱི་བའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མ་མཆིས་པའི་སླད་དུའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Complete passage explaining why there is no dharma called 'Arhat'" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : This [Demonstrative pronoun; points to the preceding statement or question; functions as the Topic in this interrogative structure]
- ཅིའི་ : for what reason [Interrogative pronoun in genitive case; from `ཅི་`: what; introduces the rhetorical question]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the sake of [Postposition indicating purpose or reason; forms a question phrase with `ཅིའི་`]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional marker for rhetorical questions; signals that an explanation will follow]
- གང་དག་ : those which [Relative pronoun; introduces the nominal clause that follows; refers to the dharmas/qualities mentioned]
- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : Arhat [Noun; from `དགྲ་`: enemy + `བཅོམ་པ་`: conquered; literally "one who has conquered enemies (passions)"; the subject being discussed]
- ཞེས་ : called [Quotative particle; marks the preceding as a designation or label]
- བགྱི་བའི་ : named/designated [Verbal noun in genitive form; from `བགྱི་བ་`: to do, to call; connects the label "Arhat" to "dharma"]
- ཆོས་ : dharma [Noun; refers to qualities, phenomena, or teachings; the concept being negated]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the dharmas associated with Arhatship]
- གང་ཡང་ : whatsoever [Indefinite pronoun + emphatic particle; emphasizes the comprehensive nature of the negation]
- མ་མཆིས་པའི་ : does not exist [Negative prefix + honorific verb for "to exist" + genitive particle; indicates the non-existence of the dharma called "Arhat"]
- སླད་དུའོ། : it is because [Postposition + final particle; concludes the explanation with the reason]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་གལ་ཏེ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཉིད་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་པར་གྱུར་ན། དེ་ཉིད་དེའི་བདག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "The complete statement addressed to the Buddha about an arhat's potential self-grasping" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Direct address to the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གལ་ཏེ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཉིད་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་པར་གྱུར་ན [Type: Scene | Desc: "The hypothetical scenario of an arhat thinking they have attained arhatship" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གལ་ཏེ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conditional marker introducing the hypothetical scenario" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The arhat who is the subject of the hypothetical scenario" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་པར་གྱུར་ན [Type: Condition | Desc: "Conditional marker indicating the hypothetical nature of the thinking" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཉིད་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ [Type: State | Desc: "The content of what the arhat is thinking" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བདག་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The arhat referring to themselves in their thought" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཉིད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The state of being an arhat that is attained" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཐོབ་བོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of attaining arhatship" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཉིད་དེའི་བདག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་ལགས་སོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The consequence of the arhat thinking they have attained arhatship" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ཉིད [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Refers to the act of thinking described in the previous clause" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འགྱུར་ལགས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of becoming or constituting" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཛིན་པར [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of grasping or clinging" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེའི་བདག་ཏུ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Specifies that the grasping is towards a self and whose self it is" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བདག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object of grasping, specifically a self or identity" | Implicit: ""]
    └── the arhat would not be an arhat [Type: Implicit Result | Desc: "The implied consequence that self-grasping contradicts the state of arhatship" | Implicit: "This is the implied consequence that self-grasping contradicts the state of arhatship"]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; vocative case; functions as the addressee of the statement]
- གལ་ཏེ་ : if [Conditional conjunction introducing a hypothetical scenario]
- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : arhat [Nominative case; from `དགྲ་`: enemy + `བཅོམ་པ་`: conquered; one who has conquered the enemies of afflictions; functions as the agent/subject of the conditional clause]
- འདི་སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking thus [Adverbial phrase; `འདི་`: this + `སྙམ་དུ་`: thinking that; introduces the content of thought]
- བདག་གིས་ : I [Ergative case; `བདག་`: self/I; emphasizes the arhat as agent referring to themselves in their thought]
- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཉིད་ : arhatship [Nominative case; `དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་`: arhat + `ཉིད་`: abstract noun suffix indicating the state or quality; functions as the patient/object that is attained]
- ཐོབ་བོ་ : have attained [Perfect tense verb; `ཐོབ་`: to attain/gain + `བོ་`: sentence-final particle indicating completion; describes the process of attaining]
- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking that [Quotative marker closing the thought; indicates reported speech or thought]
- སེམས་པར་ : were to think [Verbal noun; `སེམས་པ་`: to think + `-ར་`: terminative case; functions as the main verb of the conditional clause]
- གྱུར་ན། : if it happens [Conditional marker; `གྱུར་`: to become/happen + `ན་`: if; marks the end of the conditional clause]
- དེ་ཉིད་ : that very (thinking) [Emphatic demonstrative; `དེ་`: that + `ཉིད་`: exactly/precisely; refers back to the act of thinking mentioned previously]
- དེའི་ : their [Genitive case; `དེ་`: that/them + `-འི་`: genitive marker; refers to the arhat]
- བདག་ཏུ་ : as a self [Terminative case; `བདག་`: self + `-ཏུ་`: terminative particle; functions as the patient/object of grasping]
- འཛིན་པར་ : grasping/clinging [Verbal noun; `འཛིན་པ་`: to grasp/hold + `-ར་`: terminative case; describes the process of clinging to a concept]
- འགྱུར་ : would become [Future/present tense verb; to become/transform; indicates the resultant state]
- ལགས་སོ། ། : it is [Honorific copula + final particle; polite form of assertion used when addressing the Buddha]

ucca_formatted:
སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འཛིན་པ་དང༌། སྲོག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [one] [Type: Implicit Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The implicit experiencer who does the grasping/experiencing" | Implicit: "The implicit experiencer who does the grasping/experiencing"]
    ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འཛིན་པ་དང༌། སྲོག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The three types of grasping that elaborate on the main scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འཛིན་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The first type of grasping - at sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཛིན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of grasping or clinging in the first scene" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སེམས་ཅན་དུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object being grasped in the first scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction linking the first and second types of grasping" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྲོག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The second type of grasping - at life force" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཛིན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of grasping or clinging in the second scene" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྲོག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object being grasped in the second scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction linking the second and third types of grasping" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The third type of grasping - at persons" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཛིན་པར་ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of grasping or clinging in the third scene" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གང་ཟག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object being grasped in the third scene" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [one] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit agent who does the grasping at persons" | Implicit: "The implicit agent who does the grasping at persons"]
    ├── འགྱུར་ལགས་སོ [Type: State | Desc: "The state of becoming or turning into these forms of grasping" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ། ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Punctuation marks" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [state of attachment] [Type: Implicit Participant-State | Desc: "The implicit resultant state of self-grasping or identity formation" | Implicit: "The implicit resultant state of self-grasping or identity formation"]
glossary:
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Nominative of `སེམས་ཅན་`: living being, creature; object being grasped in the first scene; functions as Patient in the semantic structure]
- དུ་ : as [Terminative particle: indicates transformation or characterization; marks the object of grasping as specifically sentient beings; indicates direction of mental grasping]
- འཛིན་པ་ : grasping [Nominalized form of `འཛིན་`: to hold, grasp, cling to; the cognitive process of reifying or mentally constructing the concept; primary Process in first scene]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction: links the first type of grasping with the second type; coordinating conjunction in the semantic structure]
- སྲོག་ : life-force [Nominative of `སྲོག་`: life, vital energy, prāṇa; object being grasped in the second scene; functions as Patient in the semantic structure]
- ཏུ་ : as [Terminative particle: indicates transformation or characterization; marks the object of grasping as specifically life-force; indicates direction of mental grasping]
- འཛིན་པ་ : grasping [Nominalized form of `འཛིན་`: to hold, grasp, cling to; the cognitive process of reifying or mentally constructing the concept; primary Process in second scene]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction: links the second type of grasping with the third type; coordinating conjunction in the semantic structure]
- གང་ཟག་ : person [Nominative of `གང་ཟག་`: individual, personhood, pudgala; object being grasped in the third scene; functions as Patient in the semantic structure]
- ཏུ་ : as [Terminative particle: indicates transformation or characterization; marks the object of grasping as specifically a person; indicates direction of mental grasping]
- འཛིན་པར་ : grasping [Terminative form of the nominalized `འཛིན་པ་`: to hold, grasp, cling to; the cognitive process of reifying or mentally constructing the concept; primary Process in third scene]
- འགྱུར་ : become [Present/future of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform into; indicates that these three forms of grasping arise or develop; main verb indicating the State of becoming]
- ལགས་སོ : is [Honorific final particle: polite form of assertion, combining honorific copula `ལགས་` with the final particle `སོ`; completes the formal statement with respectful tone; marks the affirmation of the entire preceding statement]
- ། ། : [Sentence-final punctuation marks indicating the end of a complete thought or section]

བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་བདག་ནི་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱིས་ཉོན་མོངས་པ་མེད་པར་གནས་པ་རྣམས་ཀྱི་མཆོག་ཏུ་བསྟན་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The main scene of the utterance where the speaker (Subhuti) explains how he was declared by the Buddha." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Addressee | Desc: "The one being addressed in this statement (the Buddha)." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བདག [Type: Participant-Theme | Desc: "The speaker (Subhuti) who is the subject of the Buddha's declaration." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who performed the action of declaring the speaker as foremost." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བསྟན་ཏེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of declaring or designating performed by the Buddha." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ནི [Type: Linker | Desc: "A particle that marks the topic of the sentence." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཉོན་མོངས་པ་མེད་པར་གནས་པ་རྣམས་ཀྱི [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The group among whom the speaker is declared to be foremost." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གནས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of dwelling or abiding." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཉོན་མོངས་པ་མེད་པར [Type: State | Desc: "The state of being without afflictions or defilements." | Implicit: ""]
        └── མེད་པར [Type: Circumstance | Desc: "Implicit circumstance representing the state of meditation achieved by arhats liberated from both aspects of afflictions." | Implicit: "This represents the state of meditation achieved by arhats liberated from afflictions"]
    └── མཆོག་ཏུ [Type: State | Desc: "The state of being foremost or supreme among those who dwell without afflictions." | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས : Blessed One [honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); here functioning as the addressee of the statement]
- བདག : I [first person pronoun; here referring to the speaker (Subhuti) who is the subject of the Buddha's declaration; functions as the theme/topic of the sentence]
- ནི : indeed [topic marker particle; marks the speaker (བདག) as the topic of discussion in this statement]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathagata [epithet of the Buddha meaning "thus-gone one" or "one who has thus come/gone"; first in a series of Buddha's titles; functions as part of agent description]
- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : Arhat [epithet meaning "foe-destroyer" or "one who has destroyed the enemy of afflictions"; second in a series of Buddha's titles]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [adverbial phrase meaning "completely" or "authentically"; modifies "fully enlightened"]
- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [genitive form of `རྫོགས་པ་`: to complete or perfect; connects to "Buddha"]
- སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱིས : by the Buddha [instrumental case of `སངས་རྒྱས་`: Buddha, the awakened one; marks the agent who performed the declaration]
- ཉོན་མོངས་པ་ : afflictions [referring to mental defilements or kleshas; root of the compound describing the meditators]
- མེད་པར : without [negative existential + terminative case; literally "in the absence of" or "in the state of not having"; describes the state of meditation]
- གནས་པ་ : those who abide [nominalizer of the verb `གནས་`: to dwell, abide, remain; refers to meditators dwelling in a state]
- རྣམས་ཀྱི : of those [genitive plural marker; connects the group of meditators to "supreme"]
- མཆོག་ཏུ : as foremost [terminative case of `མཆོག`: supreme, foremost, highest; describes the state declared]
- བསྟན་ཏེ : was declared [past tense of `སྟོན་`: to show, teach, demonstrate; followed by the continuative particle `ཏེ`; the main verb showing the Buddha's action of designation]

        └── ཀྱང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connects the first statement to the contrasting second statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་བདག་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་ནི་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པའོ་སྙམ་དུ་མི་སེམས་ལགས་སོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene explaining the speaker's lack of pride in Arhatship" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The Buddha being addressed in the second statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདག [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The speaker in the second statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མི་སེམས་ལགས་སོ [Type: Negated Process | Desc: "The negated mental process of not thinking or considering oneself as an Arhat" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial expression introducing the thought" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བདག་ནི་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པའོ་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The content of the thought that is being negated" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific address for the Buddha; vocative case; direct address to the Buddha as recipient of the speaker's statement]
- བདག་ : I [First person pronoun; speaker as experiencer/agent; formal register used when addressing the Buddha]
- འདོད་ཆགས་ : desire [Nominal compound; refers specifically to attachment/passion/craving in Buddhist context]
- དང་ : and [Conjunction particle; connects 'desire' with 'free from']
- བྲལ་བ་ : free from [Verbal noun from `འབྲལ་བ`: to separate/be free from; describes the speaker's state of having eliminated desire]
- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : Arhat [Buddhist technical term; literally "foe-destroyer"; one who has eliminated all defilements; the core state being described]
- ལགས་ : am [Honorific form of the verb "to be"; formal affirmative statement marker]
- ཀྱང༌ : although [Adversative particle; connects the first statement to the contrasting second statement]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Second occurrence; same as above, marking the beginning of the second statement]
- བདག་ : I [Second occurrence; first person pronoun; speaker as experiencer]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the thought that follows]
- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking [Verbal noun + particle; introduces the content of a thought; "in the manner of thinking"]
- བདག་ : I [Third occurrence; first person pronoun within the quoted thought]
- ནི་ : as for [Topic marker; emphasizes the subject of the thought]
- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པའོ་ : am an Arhat [Nominal term + final particle; statement of identity within the quoted thought]
- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking [Second occurrence; closing the quoted thought]
- མི་ : not [Negation prefix; negates the following verb]
- སེམས་ : think [Present tense verb; refers to the mental act of considering oneself]
- ལགས་སོ : am [Honorific form of verb "to be" + final particle; formal statement marker closing the entire utterance]

ucca_formatted: བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་གལ་ཏེ་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཉིད་ཐོབ་བོ་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་པར་གྱུར་ན། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་བདག་ལ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་རབ་འབྱོར་ནི་ཉོན་མོངས་པ་མེད་པར་གནས་པ་རྣམས་ཀྱི་མཆོག་ཡིན་ཏེ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node representing the entire text" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Vocative case of `བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་`: Buddha; honorific address for the Buddha; functions as the Addressee in the discourse]
- གལ་ཏེ་ : if [Conditional particle; introduces a hypothetical situation; marks the beginning of a condition clause]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the following thought; functions as a reference pointer]
- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking [Quotative marker from `སྙམ་པ་`: to think; introduces the content of thought; functions as a Process marker]
- བདག་གིས་ : I [Ergative of `བདག་`: self, I; the agent performing the action; functions as the Agent/Experiencer]
- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : arhatship [Nominalized form of `དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་`: one who has destroyed enemies (kleśas); refers to the state of having overcome all defilements; functions as the Patient/Theme]
- ཉིད་ : itself [Emphatic particle; intensifies the preceding noun; emphasizes the state of arhatship]
- ཐོབ་བོ་ : have attained [Perfect form of `ཐོབ་པ་`: to attain, obtain; with final particle `བོ་` indicating completion; functions as the main Process]
- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking [Repeated quotative marker; closes the quoted thought; indicates mental activity]
- སེམས་པར་ : were to think [Terminative form of `སེམས་པ་`: to think; indicates active contemplation; functions as the main Process]
- གྱུར་ན། : if became [Conditional form of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform; marks the end of the conditional clause; functions as a State change marker]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [Ergative of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Thus-Gone One, epithet of Buddha; the agent of the following statement; functions as the Speaker/Authority]
- བདག་ལ་ : to me [Dative of `བདག་`: self, I; recipient of the Buddha's statement; functions as the Recipient/Addressee]
- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་ : son of noble family [Vocative compound; respectful address; `རིགས་`: lineage, family + genitive particle + `བུ་`: son; functions as a Modifier of the addressee]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; the disciple being addressed; functions as the Addressee]
- ནི་ : indeed [Topic marker; emphasizes the following statement about Subhuti; functions as a Focus marker]
- ཉོན་མོངས་པ་ : afflictions [Noun form of mental defilements or kleśas; refers to negative mental states; functions as the Attribute]
- མེད་པར་ : without [Negative existential + terminative case; absence of afflictions; functions as a Negation marker]
- གནས་པ་ : abiding [Nominalized form of `གནས་པ་`: to dwell, remain; those who abide in a state; functions as a State descriptor]
- རྣམས་ཀྱི་ : among [Plural marker + genitive case; indicates a group from which a selection is made; functions as a Quantifier]
- མཆོག་ : foremost [Superlative noun; highest, supreme; indicates highest status; functions as the Center/Attribute]
- ཡིན་ཏེ། : is [Copula `ཡིན་` + connective particle `ཏེ་`; links subject to predicate with implication of further explanation to follow; functions as a Connector]

ཅི་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པས་ན་ཉོན་མོངས་པ་མེད་པར་གནས་པ་ཞེས་ལུང་མི་སྟོན་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཅི་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པས་ན་ཉོན་མོངས་པ་མེད་པར་གནས་པ [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Main clause with cause-effect relationship" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཅི་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པས [Type: Scene | Desc: "Causal clause" | Implicit: "from the ultimate perspective"]
            ├── Subhuti [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implied agent who does not abide" | Implicit: "Implied agent who does not abide"]
            ├── མི་གནས་པས [Type: Process | Desc: "Action of not abiding" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཅི་ལ་ཡང [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "Nothing in which one abides" | Implicit: ""]
            └── Ultimate Truth [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Philosophical context of non-abiding" | Implicit: "Philosophical context of non-abiding"]
        ├── ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Logical connector showing causation" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཉོན་མོངས་པ་མེད་པར་གནས་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Effect clause, purpose of non-abiding" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── Subhuti [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implied agent who abides without afflictions" | Implicit: "Implied agent who abides without afflictions"]
            ├── གནས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "Action of abiding" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཉོན་མོངས་པ་མེད་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner of abiding" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཉོན་མོངས་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Objects being negated" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཞེས [Type: Linker | Desc: "Marker of reported speech" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལུང་མི་སྟོན [Type: Process | Desc: "Main action of not prophesying" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── Buddha [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implied agent who does not prophesy" | Implicit: "Implied agent who does not prophesy"]
    └── ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Ground | Desc: "Polite assertion marker" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཅི་ལ་ཡང་ : in nothing whatsoever [Interrogative/Indefinite pronoun `ཅི་` with postposition `ལ་` and emphatic particle `ཡང་`; literally "in what also"; functions as the Location participant indicating the absence of any object of abiding in the causal clause]

- མི་ : not [Negative prefix; negates the following verb]

- གནས་པས : because of not abiding [Verbal noun from `གནས་` (to abide, remain, dwell) with causal connective suffix `-པས`; serves as the main Process in the causal clause]

- ན : therefore [Causal connective particle; links the cause (non-abiding) with its effect (abiding without afflictions)]

- ཉོན་མོངས་པ་ : afflictions [Nominal form of `ཉོན་མོངས་` (kleśa); refers to mental disturbances or defilements; functions as the Patient that is negated in the effect clause]

- མེད་པར : without [Negative existential verb `མེད་` with adverbial suffix `-པར`; modifies the manner of abiding]

- གནས་པ : abiding [Verbal noun from `གནས་` (to abide, remain, dwell); serves as the main Process in the effect clause]

- ཞེས : thus [Quotative marker; indicates reported speech or designation]

- ལུང་ : prophecy [Noun meaning "scripture, prophecy, authorization"; object of the negated action]

- མི་ : not [Negative prefix; negates the following verb]

- སྟོན : give [Present tense of `སྟོན་` (to show, teach, give); main verb of the sentence; Buddha is the implied Agent]

- ལགས་སོ། : it is [Polite assertion marker; composed of `ལགས་` (honorific copula) and final particle `སོ`; indicates respectful completion of statement]

- ། ། : [Sentence-final punctuation]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire utterance" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene of the Buddha speaking" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Agent who is speaking (the Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Content of the Buddha's speech, which is a question to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Recipient of the question (Subhuti)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The subject matter being asked about" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Linguistic-Act | Desc: "The question being posed to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
            └── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent of the thinking process (Subhuti is the one who should think)" | Implicit: "The agent of thinking (Subhuti) is implied but not explicitly stated in this phrase"]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་`: conquered (the four māras), `ལྡན་`: possessing (the qualities of enlightenment), `འདས་`: transcended (saṃsāra); functions as the Agent of the speaking action]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker indicating the doer of the action; attached to བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ to show the Buddha is the one performing the speaking action]

- བཀའ་ : speech [Honorific term for 'word' or 'teaching'; specifically referring to the Buddha's authoritative speech; part of the Process element in the semantic structure]

- སྩལ་པ། : proclaimed [Past tense of `སྩལ་བ་`: to give, bestow, pronounce (honorific); here indicating the Buddha's act of speaking; completes the Process element]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of one of Buddha's chief disciples; functions as the Recipient of the Buddha's question and the implicit Agent of the thinking process]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun referring to the subject matter being discussed; serves as the Patient in the semantic structure]

- ཇི་ : what [Interrogative particle forming part of the question structure; begins the interrogative phrase]

- སྙམ་ : think [Present tense of `སྙམ་པ་`: to think, consider; here part of the idiomatic question structure asking for Subhuti's opinion]

- དུ་ : as [Purpose or manner particle connecting to the verb; creates the adverbial phrase "thinking as what/how"]

- སེམས། : do you think? [Present tense of `སེམས་པ་`: to think; here completing the question structure; the implied subject is རབ་འབྱོར་ (Subhuti)]

    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who obtained/took the dharma" | Implicit: ""]

        └── གང་བླངས་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration on how the dharma relates to the action" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བླངས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of obtaining" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་མར་མེ་མཛད་ལས [Type: Participant-Source | Desc: "The source from whom the dharma was obtained" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་ཡང་ཡོད་སྙམ་མམ [Type: State-Interrogative | Desc: "The questioning aspect of whether any dharma exists" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── you (implicit) [Type: Implicit Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The implicit addressee who is being asked" | Implicit: "The implicit addressee who is being asked"]
        └── གང་ཡང་ཡོད [Type: State | Desc: "The state of existence being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
            └── not (implicit) [Type: Implicit Negation | Desc: "Implicit negation indicating the rhetorical nature suggesting nothing was actually obtained in an ultimate sense" | Implicit: "Implicit negation indicating the rhetorical nature suggesting nothing was actually obtained in an ultimate sense"]
    └── previously (implicit) [Type: Time | Desc: "Implicit temporal reference indicating the event happened in the past" | Implicit: "Implicit temporal reference indicating the event happened in the past"]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Instrumental/Agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Tathagata, "Thus-Gone One"; here functioning as the Agent who supposedly obtained dharma; indicates the subject of the rhetorical question]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : the Tathagata [Nominative form of "Thus-Gone One"; part of the longer epithet for Buddha Dipankara; functions as part of the Source description]

- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : Arhat [Nominative form of "Foe-Destroyer"; title indicating one who has conquered the enemies of afflictions; part of Buddha Dipankara's full epithet]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [Adverbial form meaning "completely, genuinely, perfectly"; modifies "fully enlightened"]

- རྫོགས་པའི་ : completed [Genitive form of `རྫོགས་པ་`: complete, perfect; connects to "Buddha" in the epithet; indicates complete enlightenment]

- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Nominative form meaning "Awakened One"; main title in the epithet]

- མར་མེ་མཛད་ : Dipankara [Proper name meaning "Light-Maker" or "Lamp-Bearer"; specific identity of the Buddha referred to as the Source]

- ལས་ : from [Ablative particle indicating "from, out of"; marks the Source from whom dharma was supposedly obtained]

- གང་ : whatever [Interrogative/relative pronoun meaning "whatever, whichever"; refers to dharma that might have been obtained]

- བླངས་པའི་ : was taken [Genitive of past form of `ལེན་པ་`: to take, receive, obtain; refers to the Process of obtaining dharma in the past]

- ཆོས་ : dharma [Nominative form meaning "teaching, phenomenon, dharma"; the Patient/object that was supposedly obtained]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun indicating "that specific"; refers to the previously mentioned dharma]

- གང་ཡང་ : any whatsoever [Indefinite pronoun construction meaning "anything at all"; part of the rhetorical questioning]

- ཡོད་ : exists [Present form of the verb "to exist"; part of the State being questioned, with implicit negation suggesting nothing actually exists]

- སྙམ་མམ : do you think? [Interrogative form of `སྙམ་པ་`: to think, consider; marks this as a rhetorical question directed at an implicit addressee]

རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing Subhuti's negative response to the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent (Subhuti) who is speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསོལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of speaking (in honorific form)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Adlocutive-Honorific | Desc: "Honorific address to the Buddha as recipient of the speech" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The content of Subhuti's response to Buddha's question about obtaining dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ [Type: Center | Desc: "Demonstrative pronoun referring to the question about obtaining dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ནི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Topic marker indicating the focus of the negative statement" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མ་ལགས་སོ [Type: Negation | Desc: "Explicit negative response indicating no dharma was obtained" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhūti [Agentive case of `རབ་འབྱོར་`: name of one of Buddha's main disciples; the instrumental-agentive suffix `-གྱིས་` marks him as the speaker/agent of the speech act]

- གསོལ་པ། : respectfully said [Honorific verb for `ཟེར་བ་`: to say, speak; perfect/past tense form; honorific speech verb used when addressing the Buddha]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Vocative address; honorific title for the Buddha meaning "the transcendent destroyer (of delusions)" or "Bhagavan"; functions as the addressee of Subhūti's statement]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun referring to a previously discussed topic or question posed by the Buddha about dharma attainment; functions as the core subject of the negation]

- ནི་ : indeed [Topic marker highlighting the focus of the negative statement; emphasizes what follows as the main point]

- མ་ལགས་སོ། : is not [Negation; honorific negative form of `ཡིན་`: to be; `མ་` is the negative prefix, `ལགས་` is the honorific verb stem, and `སོ` is the final particle marking statement completion; conveys Subhūti's definitive negative response]
