དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་མར་མེ་མཛད་ལས་གང་བླངས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་ཡོང་ཡེ་མ་མཆིས་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire statement about the Tathagata not obtaining any dharma from Buddha Dipankara." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who did not obtain any dharma." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་ཡང་ཡོང་ཡེ་མ་མཆིས་ལགས་སོ [Type: State | Desc: "The negative statement indicating the non-existence of dharma, not an action but a state of non-existence." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma that is described as non-existent." | Implicit: ""]
        └── གང་བླངས་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the dharma, specifying it as something that was (supposedly) obtained." | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་མར་མེ་མཛད་ལས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the source from whom no dharma was obtained." | Implicit: ""]
        └── མར་མེ་མཛད [Type: Participant-Source | Desc: "The specific Buddha who is the source from whom no dharma was obtained." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "First epithet describing Buddha Dipankara." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Second epithet describing Buddha Dipankara." | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Third epithet describing Buddha Dipankara." | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : The Tathagata [Ergative/Agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Tathagata, "Thus-Gone One"; refers to the Buddha speaking, functioning as the main Agent in the sentence who did not obtain any dharma]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathagata ["Thus-Gone One"; first honorific epithet describing Buddha Dipankara; functions as an Elaborator that adds specificity to the identity of Dipankara]

- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : Arhat ["Foe-destroyer"; second honorific epithet describing Buddha Dipankara; qualifies Dipankara as one who has destroyed all mental afflictions]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [Adverbial form of `ཡང་དག་པ་`: perfect, complete; modifies `རྫོགས་པའི་` to emphasize the complete nature of Buddha Dipankara's enlightenment]

- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive form of `རྫོགས་པ་`: to complete, perfect; links the quality of completeness to `སངས་རྒྱས`]

- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Sanskrit: buddha; "Awakened One"; third honorific epithet describing Dipankara; one who has fully awakened to the nature of reality]

- མར་མེ་མཛད་ : Dipankara [Sanskrit: Dīpaṃkara; literally "Lamp-maker"; name of a specific Buddha who functions as the Source participant in the sentence]

- ལས་ : from [Ablative particle indicating source or origin; marks Dipankara as the source from whom no dharma was obtained]

- གང་ : which [Interrogative pronoun used as a relative pronoun; introduces the relative clause describing what was supposedly obtained]

- བླངས་པའི་ : obtained [Genitive of the past form of `ལེན་པ་`: to take, receive, obtain; describes the action that did not actually occur; part of the Elaborator that modifies the dharma]

- ཆོས་ : dharma [Sanskrit: dharma; teaching, doctrine, phenomenon; the Patient participant that is described as non-existent]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun referring to the dharma mentioned; specifies which dharma is being discussed]

- གང་ཡང་ : whatsoever [Combination of `གང་`: which + `ཡང་`: even, also; intensifies the negation to mean "nothing whatsoever"]

- ཡོང་ : totally [Emphasizes the completeness of the negation; works with other negation particles to strengthen the statement]

- ཡེ་ : at all [Adverb intensifying the negation; emphasizes the absolute nature of the non-existence]

- མ་མཆིས་ : does not exist [Honorific negative past of `ཡོད་པ་`: to exist; forms the main State predicate indicating non-existence]

- ལགས་སོ : it is [Honorific final particle marking a polite statement; completes the sentence with formal register appropriate when discussing Buddhas]

བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་འདི་སྐད་དུ་བདག་གིས་ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས་སྒྲུབ་བོ་ཞེས་ཟེར་ན་དེ་ནི་མི་བདེན་པར་སྨྲའོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root of the graph containing the entire passage with the Buddha's teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene of the Buddha speaking" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the speaker" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of speaking" | Implicit: ""]
        └── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Addressee | Desc: "Subhuti as the person being addressed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་འདི་སྐད་དུ་བདག་གིས་ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས་སྒྲུབ་བོ་ཞེས་ཟེར་ན་དེ་ནི་མི་བདེན་པར་སྨྲའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Content of the Buddha's speech about bodhisattvas making claims" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The hypothetical bodhisattva being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདི་སྐད་དུ་བདག་གིས་ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས་སྒྲུབ་བོ་ཞེས་ཟེར་ན་དེ་ནི་མི་བདེན་པར་སྨྲའོ། ། [Type: Conditional Scene | Desc: "Conditional relationship between the bodhisattva's claim and the conclusion" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འདི་སྐད་དུ་བདག་གིས་ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས་སྒྲུབ་བོ་ཞེས་ཟེར་ན [Type: Condition | Desc: "The conditional part expressing what the bodhisattva might claim" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཟེར་ན [Type: Conditional | Desc: "Marker establishing the conditional relationship" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── བདག་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The bodhisattva referring to themselves in their statement" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས་སྒྲུབ་བོ་ཞེས [Type: Process | Desc: "The bodhisattva's claim about accomplishing buddha-fields, showing attachment to ultimate reality" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The buddha-fields being purified, specifically referring to the spiritual practice of purifying buddha-fields" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེ་ནི་མི་བདེན་པར་སྨྲའོ། ། [Type: Consequence | Desc: "The consequence that follows from the condition" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── དེ་ནི [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "Reference back to the bodhisattva who makes the claim" | Implicit: ""]
                └── མི་བདེན་པར་སྨྲའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The act of speaking falsely" | Implicit: ""]
                    ├── སྨྲའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of speaking" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── མི་བདེན་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner of speaking, indicating falsehood" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : The Blessed One [honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to the Buddha as one who has conquered defilements, possesses qualities, and transcended suffering; functions as the Agent/speaker in this passage]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates the Buddha is the one performing the action of teaching]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། : proclaimed [honorific verb `བཀའ་སྩལ་` (to speak, proclaim) in past tense; used for speech acts by highly respected figures; functions as the main Process in the first Scene]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name of the Buddha's disciple; one of the chief interlocutors in Prajnaparamita literature; functions as the Addressee of the Buddha's teaching]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [compound of `བྱང་ཆུབ་` (awakening, enlightenment) and `སེམས་དཔའ་` (hero, brave one); refers to one who seeks enlightenment for the benefit of all beings; functions as the hypothetical Agent in the conditional statement]

- གང་ལ་ལ་ : any [indefinite pronoun; indicates an unspecified member of a class; here refers to any possible bodhisattva]

- ཞིག་ : a [indefinite article marker; completes the indefinite reference with `གང་ལ་ལ་`]

- འདི་སྐད་དུ་ : thus, in this way [demonstrative adverbial introducing direct speech; `འདི་` (this) and `སྐད་` (words, speech) with connective particle `དུ་`; introduces the content of what the hypothetical bodhisattva might say]

- བདག་གིས་ : I, myself [first-person pronoun `བདག་` with instrumental case marker `གིས་`; represents the bodhisattva referring to themselves as the Agent of the action]

- ཞིང་ : buddha-field [refers to a purified realm or field of activity of a buddha; in this context specifically refers to the spiritual realms that bodhisattvas aspire to establish]

- བཀོད་པ་ : arrangement, design [from `བཀོད་` (to arrange, establish, design); refers to the creation or arrangement of buddha-fields]

- རྣམས་ : plural marker [indicates multiple buddha-field arrangements]

- སྒྲུབ་བོ་ : accomplish, establish [from `སྒྲུབ་` (to accomplish, establish, achieve) with the final particle `བོ་` indicating definitive statement; here indicates the bodhisattva's claim of personal agency in establishing buddha-fields]

- ཞེས་ : saying that [quotative marker; indicates the end of the quoted speech]

- ཟེར་ན་ : if says [conditional form of `ཟེར་` (to say); establishes the hypothetical nature of the bodhisattva's statement]

- དེ་ : that one [demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the hypothetical bodhisattva making the claim]

- ནི་ : topic marker [emphasizes the subject being discussed]

- མི་བདེན་པར་ : falsely, untruthfully [negative prefix `མི་` with `བདེན་པ་` (truth) and adverbial marker `ར་`; indicates manner of speaking that lacks truth]

- སྨྲའོ། : speaks [from `སྨྲ་` (to speak) with final particle `འོ་` indicating statement completion; completes the Buddha's judgment about such a bodhisattva]

- ། : sentence marker [Tibetan punctuation mark]

glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; pointing to a previously mentioned concept; functions as the Patient being questioned in the semantic structure]
- ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ : for what reason [Interrogative; compound of `ཅི་` (what) + genitive particle + `ཕྱིར་` (reason); marks this as a rhetorical question introducing an explanation]
- ཞེ་ན། : if asked [Conditional conjunction; literary form that concludes a rhetorical question; signals that what follows is the answer to the posed question]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Proper name; vocative case; the disciple being addressed by the Buddha; functioning as the Addressee in this discourse]
- ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་ : field arrangements [Compound term; `ཞིང་` (field/buddha-field) + `བཀོད་པ་` (arrangement/display); technical Buddhist term referring to the display or arrangement of buddha-fields]
- རྣམས་ : plural [Plural marker; indicates multiple field arrangements; extends the scope of the term to all such arrangements]
- ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་ : field arrangements [Repetition of the compound term; here functioning as part of the definitional structure; emphasized as the topic being defined]
- རྣམས་ : plural [Second plural marker; completes the repetition of the term]
- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative particle; marks the preceding term as being cited or defined]
- བྱ་བ་ : called [Verbal noun from `བྱེད་` (to do); here means "that which is called/named"; part of the definitional phrase]
- ནི། : is [Topic marker; highlights the term being defined and separates it from its definition]
- བཀོད་པ་ : arrangements [Noun; the displays or arrangements being discussed; the Patient in the philosophical statement]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative + plural; refers specifically to the previously mentioned arrangements; establishes the reference for what follows]
- མེད་པར་ : as non-existent [Negative existential + terminative case; from `མེད་` (not exist) + `པར་` (as); indicates the state of non-existence attributed to the arrangements]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་ : the Tathāgata [Buddhist technical term; literally "thus-gone one"; title of the Buddha; functions as the authoritative Speaker in this context]
- གསུངས་པའི་ : has taught [Past tense of `གསུང་` (to speak/teach) + genitive particle; indicates the Buddha's authoritative pronouncement; the Process of teaching]
- ཕྱིར་ : because [Conjunction; marks causal relationship; connects the previous statement to the explanation]
- ཏེ། : indeed [Final particle; emphasizes and concludes the explanation; marks the end of this section of discourse]

        └── [conventionally] [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Implicit adverbial modifying how things are called" | Implicit: "Implicit adverbial indicating conventional existence only"]

glossary:
- དེས་ན་ : therefore [Causal connector; compound of དེ་ (that) + instrumental case marker + ན་ (then/when); serves as a linker connecting this conclusion to previous context]
- ཞིང་ : field [Noun; refers specifically to buddha-fields or pure realms (Sanskrit: kṣetra); the realms or domains established by buddhas]
- བཀོད་པ་ : arrangement [Noun from verb བཀོད་པ་ (to arrange, establish, display); refers to the layouts or arrangements of these buddha-fields]
- རྣམས་ : plural marker [Plural particle; indicates multiple buddha-fields; functions as an elaborator of the central entity]
- ཞེས་ : thus/called [Quotative particle; links the term being defined to its designation; introduces the name or label]
- བྱའོ : is called [Final verb; composed of བྱ་ (to do/call) + འོ (final particle); completes the process of naming or calling; conveys conventional designation]
- ། : sentence-final marker [Tibetan punctuation mark equivalent to a period]

    ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who should generate the non-abiding mind" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས་པ་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱ་སྟེ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of generating a specific type of mind" | Implicit: ""]

        └── བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱ [Type: Process-Action | Desc: "The instruction to generate or produce the specified type of mind" | Implicit: ""]
    └── འདི་ལྟར་མི་གནས་པར [Type: Adverbial-Manner | Desc: "Describes the essential quality of the mind to be generated" | Implicit: ""]

            └── [not abiding in or clinging to any phenomena as truly existent] [Type: Implicit-Content | Desc: "Implicit meaning that the non-abiding refers specifically to not clinging to any phenomena as truly existing" | Implicit: "This refers to not clinging to any phenomena as truly existing, which is a key philosophical concept in Buddhist teachings on emptiness and non-attachment"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Proper name; the disciple being addressed; functions as Recipient of the instruction in the discourse]

- དེ་ལྟ་བས་ན། : therefore [Causal connector; literally "by/from looking at it that way"; links previous teachings to the current instruction; establishes logical consequence]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [Compound noun; `བྱང་ཆུབ་`: enlightenment + `སེམས་དཔའ་`: hero of mind/courageous being; refers to one who seeks enlightenment for the benefit of all beings]

- སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོས་ : great being [Instrumental case of `སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ`: great hero of mind; here functioning as Agent who performs the action of generating the mind]

- འདི་ལྟར་ : in this way [Demonstrative + manner particle; literally "like this"; indicates the specific manner in which the mind should be generated]

- མི་གནས་པར་ : non-abiding [Negative prefix `མི་` + verbal noun `གནས་པ་`: to abide/dwell + terminative particle `ར`; describes the state of not clinging to phenomena as truly existent]

- སེམས་པ་ : mind [Verbal noun from `སེམས་`: to think/mind; here refers to the specific type of consciousness or attitude to be cultivated]

- བསྐྱེད་པར་ : should generate [Future/imperative form of `སྐྱེད་`: to generate/produce + terminative particle `ར`; indicates the action that should be performed]

- བྱ་སྟེ། : should do [Future form of `བྱེད་`: to do/make + connective particle `སྟེ་`; completes the instruction and connects to what follows]

ཅི་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར་སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The full sentence representing the instruction to generate bodhicitta in a non-abiding manner" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Bodhisattva] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent - Bodhisattva | Desc: "The implied agent (bodhisattva) who should generate the mind/bodhicitta" | Implicit: "The implied agent (bodhisattva) who should generate the mind/bodhicitta"]
    ├── སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of generating the mind/bodhicitta" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས [Type: Participant-Patient - Bodhicitta | Desc: "The awakening mind or bodhicitta that should be generated" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅི་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "The manner in which one should generate the mind/bodhicitta" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཅི་ལ་ཡང [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "The location/object in which one should not abide" | Implicit: ""]
                └── [forms, sounds, and phenomena] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit elaboration of what 'anything' refers to, based on commentary" | Implicit: "Implicit elaboration of what 'anything' refers to, based on commentary"]
            ├── གནས་པར [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of abiding or dwelling in" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མི [Type: Function | Desc: "Negation particle modifying the process of abiding" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Sentence-final punctuation mark" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཅི་ལ་ : in anything [Locative case of `ཅི་`: what, anything; here referring to all phenomena (forms, sounds, etc.); functions as part of Adverbial structure indicating the location where non-abiding occurs]
- ཡང་ : even/also [Emphasizing particle; intensifies the scope of "anything" to mean "absolutely nothing at all"; part of the compound expression]
- མི་ : not [Negation particle; negates the process of abiding; grammatically modifies the following verb]
- གནས་པར་ : abiding [Terminative form of `གནས་པ་`: to abide, dwell, remain; the process of clinging to or fixating on phenomena; functions as a Process within the Adverbial structure]
- སེམས་ : mind/bodhicitta [Nominative case; refers specifically to the awakening mind or bodhicitta; functions as the Patient or object being generated]
- བསྐྱེད་པར་ : to generate [Terminative form of `བསྐྱེད་པ་`: to generate, produce, develop; part of the main verb phrase indicating the action to be performed]
- བྱའོ : should be done [Future/imperative form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do; functions as the main verbal predicate indicating necessity or instruction; completes the Process element]
- ། : [Sentence-final punctuation mark; indicates completion of the thought]

གཟུགས་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར་སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The entire scene of generating bodhicitta without abiding in form" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [bodhisattva] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent (bodhisattva)" | Implicit: "The implicit agent (bodhisattva) who should generate bodhicitta"]
    ├── སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of generating bodhicitta" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The bodhicitta (enlightened mind) that is to be generated" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Function | Desc: "Verbal function indicating the necessity to generate" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མི་གནས་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "The manner of generation - without abiding or clinging to inherent existence" | Implicit: "without clinging to true existence"]
    ├── གཟུགས་ལ [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "The object in which one should not abide" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གཟུགས [Type: Center | Desc: "The phenomenon of form" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ལ [Type: Function | Desc: "Locative case marker" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཡང [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Emphasizes that one should not abide in form (among other things one should not abide in)" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- གཟུགས་ : form [Noun: form, rūpa, visible matter; here referring to physical phenomena or objects of visual perception; functions as the object in which one should not abide]
- ལ་ : in/at/to [Locative case marker; indicates relationship with form; marks གཟུགས་ as the location or reference point]
- ཡང་ : also/even [Emphatic particle; indicates form is one of multiple phenomena in which one should not abide; functions as an elaborator in the sentence]
- མི་ : not [Negation prefix; combines with གནས་པར་ to form a negative verbal construction]
- གནས་པར་ : abiding [Verbal noun from གནས་ "to dwell, abide, exist" with terminative case marker; here meaning "without clinging to" or "without attachment to"; functions adverbially]
- སེམས་ : mind/bodhicitta [Noun: mind, consciousness; in this context specifically means bodhicitta (enlightened mind/attitude); functions as the patient/object being generated]
- བསྐྱེད་པར་ : to generate [Verbal noun from སྐྱེད་ "to generate, produce" with terminative case marker; indicates the action to be performed]
- བྱའོ : should do [Future/imperative form of བྱེད་ "to do" with final particle འོ་; indicates necessity or instruction; completes the verbal construction "should generate"]

        ├── རེག་བྱ [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "Conceptual location (touch) in which one should not abide" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "Conceptual location (phenomena) in which one should not abide" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector linking the list of phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Emphatic connector indicating 'even' phenomena should not be abided in" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- སྒྲ་ : sound [noun; refers to auditory sensory objects; one of the sense objects in which one should not abide when generating bodhicitta; functions as conceptual location in the semantic structure]
- དང་ : and [conjunction particle; connects items in a list of sense objects; functions as a linker between the enumerated phenomena]
- དྲི་ : smell [noun; refers to olfactory sensory objects; one of the sense objects in which one should not abide; functions as conceptual location]
- དང་ : and [conjunction particle; connects items in the list]
- རོ་ : taste [noun; refers to gustatory sensory objects; one of the sense objects in which one should not abide; functions as conceptual location]
- དང་ : and [conjunction particle; connects items in the list]
- རེག་བྱ་ : touch [noun; literally "that which is touched"; refers to tactile sensory objects; one of the sense objects in which one should not abide; functions as conceptual location]
- དང་ : and [conjunction particle; connects items in the list]
- ཆོས་ : phenomena [noun; refers to mental objects or dharmas; the most subtle of the sense objects; functions as conceptual location]
- ལ་ : in/on/with regard to [locative case particle; indicates the relationship with the phenomena listed; marks the objects in which one should not abide]
- ཡང་ : even/also [emphatic particle; emphasizes that one should not abide even in mental phenomena; functions as an emphatic linker]
- མི་ : not [negation particle; negates the verb "གནས་པ" (to abide); creates the concept of non-abiding]
- གནས་པར་ : abiding [verbal noun from "གནས་" (to dwell, abide, remain); with negation indicates the state of non-attachment to sense objects; functions as an adverbial describing the manner of generating bodhicitta]
- སེམས་ : mind/bodhicitta [noun; here specifically refers to bodhicitta or awakening mind; the enlightened attitude to be generated; functions as the patient of the action]
- བསྐྱེད་པར་ : generate/develop [verbal noun from "སྐྱེད་" (to generate, produce); indicates the action of cultivating bodhicitta; part of the main process]
- བྱའོ : should do [future form of "བྱེད་" (to do) with final particle "འོ"; indicates instruction or injunction; completes the main process "generate bodhicitta"]

glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར : Subhuti [proper name; one of Buddha's chief disciples who was renowned for his understanding of emptiness; functions as addressee/recipient of the Buddha's teaching]

- འདི་ལྟ་སྟེ་ : thus [adverbial phrase introducing an example; lit. "it is like this"; serves as elaborator connecting to the example that follows]

- དཔེར་ན། : for example [adverbial phrase; from `དཔེ་`: example + locative particle `ར་` + `ན་`: when/if; introduces an illustrative example]

- སྐྱེས་བུ་ : person [noun; from `སྐྱེ་`: to be born + `བུ་`: being/person; refers to a hypothetical person in this example; functions as agent]

- ཞིག : a certain [indefinite article; indicates one unspecified person]

- ལུས་ : body [noun; physical form; the patient that undergoes transformation in this example]

- འདི་ལྟ་བུར་ : like this [adverbial phrase; `འདི་`: this + `ལྟ་བུ་`: like/similar + `ར་`: terminative case marker; modifies the transformation]

- གྱུར་ཏེ། : were to become [verb; past tense of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to change/transform + connective `ཏེ་`; indicates transformation process]

- འདི་ལྟ་སྟེ་ : that is to say [adverbial phrase; elaborator introducing specific details about the transformation]

- རིའི་ : of mountains [genitive form of `རི་`: mountain; modifies "king"]

- རྒྱལ་པོ་ : king [noun; ruler; here referring to Mount Meru as king of mountains]

- རི་རབ་ : Mount Meru [proper noun; the sacred mountain at center of Buddhist cosmology]

- ཙམ་དུ་ : as large as [adverbial phrase; `ཙམ་`: extent/measurement + `དུ་`: terminative case marker; indicates size comparison]

- གྱུར་ན། : if became [verb; conditional form of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to change/transform + conditional marker `ན་`; establishes hypothetical condition]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name; repeated address to emphasize the question directed at him]

- འདི་ : this [demonstrative pronoun; refers to the example just given]

- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [interrogative phrase; `ཇི་`: what + `སྙམ་`: to think + `དུ་`: quotative marker; introduces a question about opinion]

- སེམས། : do you think [verb; present tense of `སེམས་པ་`: to think; rhetorical question marker]

- ལུས་ : body [noun; referring back to the hypothetical transformed body]

- དེ་ : that [demonstrative pronoun; specifies the previously mentioned body]

- ཆེ་བ་ : large [adjective; from `ཆེན་པོ་`: big/great; describes the size attribute being questioned]

- ཡིན་ : is [verb; copula connecting subject and attribute]

- སྙམ་མམ། : do you think? [interrogative marker; `སྙམ་`: to think + interrogative particle `འམ་`; closes the rhetorical question]

                └── [conventionally speaking] [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Implicit philosophical qualification that the body's greatness exists only conventionally but not ultimately" | Implicit: "Philosophical qualification that the body's greatness exists only conventionally but not ultimately"]
        └── [conventionally speaking] [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Implicit philosophical qualification that the body's greatness exists only conventionally but not ultimately" | Implicit: "Philosophical qualification that the body's greatness exists only conventionally but not ultimately"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhuti asked [Agentive case marker `གྱིས་` attached to `རབ་འབྱོར་`; proper name of one of Buddha's main disciples; functioning as the Agent/speaker in this utterance]
- གསོལ་པ། : submitted/stated [verbal noun from `གསོལ་བ་`; honorific form of "to speak/ask"; marks the process of formal address to the Buddha; functions as the main Process in the scene]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [honorific title of the Buddha; vocative form addressing the Buddha directly; functions as the Recipient of Subhuti's statement]
- ལུས་ : body [noun `ལུས་`; refers to the physical form; here referring to a specific body previously discussed in context; functions as the Patient being described]
- དེ་ : that [demonstrative pronoun; specifies which body is being referred to; modifies 'body' to indicate a specific previously mentioned body]
- ཆེ་བ་ : great [adjective from `ཆེ་བ་`; describing the size or significance; functions as the main Attribute being ascribed to the body]
- ལགས་སོ། : is [polite existential verb `ལགས་` + final particle `སོ`; honorific form of "is" used when addressing superiors; completes the statement with formal, respectful tone]

བདེ་བར་གཤེགས་པ་ལུས་དེ་ཆེ་བ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire statement about the Sugata's body" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བདེ་བར་གཤེགས་པ་ལུས་དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The entity being described (the body)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལུས [Type: Center | Desc: "The core noun referring to the physical form" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདེ་བར་གཤེགས་པ [Type: Elaborator-Possessor | Desc: "The Sugata/Tathagata who possesses the body" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Demonstrative indicating the specific body being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆེ་བ [Type: State | Desc: "The quality of greatness/size attributed to the body" | Implicit: ""]

    ├── ལགས [Type: Function | Desc: "Verb function indicating attribution of the state to the participant" | Implicit: ""]
    └── སོ། ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Sentence-final marker" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བདེ་བར་ : in bliss, happily [Adverbial form from root `བདེ་བ་` meaning "happiness, bliss"; modifies `གཤེགས་པ་`, indicating the manner of going; part of epithet for the Buddha]
- གཤེགས་པ་ : one who has gone, departed [Nominalized form of `གཤེགས་` meaning "to go, depart"; here referring to the Buddha who has "gone to bliss"; functions as part of compound epithet]
- ལུས་ : body [Noun, referring to the physical form; here specifically the Buddha's body as the core subject being described; functions as the Center of the main Participant]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; indicates the specific body being discussed; serves as a deictic marker]
- ཆེ་བ་ : great, large [Nominalized adjective from `ཆེ་` meaning "big, great"; functions as the main State being attributed to the body; describes the Buddha's body as physically large or metaphorically significant]
- ལགས་ : is [Honorific copula verb; links the subject (Buddha's body) to the attribute (greatness); functions as attributive verb]
- སོ། ། : [Final particle marking end of statement; indicates declarative mode with slight emphasis; equivalent to a period]

        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent (the Buddha/Tathagata) who made the declaration" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object being described as non-existent" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དངོས་པོ་མ་མཆིས་པར [Type: Attribute | Desc: "The philosophical concept of non-substantiality or lack of inherent existence" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [ultimate emptiness] [Type: Implicit | Desc: "The implicit Buddhist philosophical concept of emptiness (śūnyatā) underlying the statement about non-existence" | Implicit: "The implicit Buddhist philosophical concept of emptiness (śūnyatā) underlying the statement about non-existence"]
        ├── གསུངས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of teaching or declaring by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སླད་དུ་སྟེ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Causal connector that establishes the relationship between the question and answer" | Implicit: ""]
        └──  [Type: Relator | Desc: "An explicit relation node connecting Scene 2 (the answer) back to Scene 1 (the question)" | Implicit: "An explicit relation connecting the answer back to the question"]
            └── དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Rhetorical question structure asking for the reason" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The demonstrative pronoun referring to the previous statement" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Interrogative adverbial phrase forming the rhetorical question" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the previous statement or teaching; functions as Patient in the rhetorical question structure]
- ཅིའི་ : for what [Interrogative pronoun in genitive case; from `ཅི་`: what; introduces the reason being questioned]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the purpose of [Postpositional phrase indicating purpose or reason; connects to the interrogative to form "for what reason"]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional particle used to form rhetorical questions; marks the end of the question "why is this so?"]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [Agentive/instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "thus-gone one," epithet of the Buddha; functions as the Agent who makes the declaration]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the object or concept being described as non-existent; functions as Patient in the statement]
- དངོས་པོ་ : substantiality [Noun; refers to inherent existence or substantiality; part of a philosophical concept in Buddhism]
- མ་མཆིས་པར་ : as not existing [Negative form of `མཆིས་པ་`: to exist; combined with negative prefix `མ་`; indicates the non-existence of inherent nature]
- གསུངས་པའི་ : taught/declared [Past tense of `གསུང་བ་`: to speak/teach (honorific); with genitive particle; describes the Buddha's act of teaching]
- སླད་དུ་ : because of [Causal connector indicating the reason or purpose; links the answer to the question]
- སྟེ། : that is to say [Explanatory particle that concludes the response; clarifies that what follows explains the preceding question]

དེས་ན་ལུས་དེ་ཆེ་བ་ཞེས་བགྱིའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root Scene representing the entire statement about conventional designation of the body" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connective element linking this statement to previous context" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལུས་དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The body being described conventionally" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [attribute relation] [Type: Attribute | Desc: "Explicit relation showing that 'greatness' is an attribute of the body" | Implicit: "Relation showing that 'greatness' is an attribute of the body"]
            └── ཆེ་བ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Descriptive elaboration of the body's conventional attribute of size" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆེ་བ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Descriptive elaboration of the body's conventional attribute of size" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཞེས [Type: Function | Desc: "Functional element connecting the description to the speech act" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བགྱིའོ [Type: Speech-Act | Desc: "Verb indicating conventional designation or naming process" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [conventional designation (not ultimate reality)] [Type: Implicit-Content | Desc: "Implicit philosophical context of conventional designation (ཀུན་རྫོབ) versus ultimate reality (དོན་དམ་པ)" | Implicit: "Philosophical context of conventional designation versus ultimate reality"]
glossary:
- དེས་ན : therefore [Instrumental case 'དེས' from 'དེ' (that) + connecting particle 'ན'; functions as a connective element linking this statement to previous context; establishes logical consequence]

- ལུས་ : body [Noun, base form of 'ལུས་' (physical body); serves as the Patient (object being described) in this sentence; the entity being conventionally designated]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies the particular body being referenced; helps establish the specific referent under discussion]

- ཆེ་བ་ : great/large [Adjective from 'ཆེ་བ་' (great, large); functions as an attribute describing the conventional quality of the body; elaborates the size characteristic]

- ཞེས་ : thus/as [Quotative particle; marks the preceding phrase as what is being conventionally designated; connects the description to the speech act of designation]

- བགྱིའོ : is designated/called [Honorific verb form (present/future) of 'བྱེད་པ་' (to do, make) + final particle 'འོ'; indicates the conventional naming or designation process; functions as the main speech act verb indicating designation rather than ultimate reality]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་དངོས་པོ་མ་མཆིས་པས་དེས་ན་ལུས་ཞེས་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node containing the entire sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་དངོས་པོ་མ་མཆིས་པས [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing the non-existence" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The subject being described as non-existent" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དངོས་པོ་མ་མཆིས་པས [Type: Attribute | Desc: "The intrinsic quality of non-existence attributed to the subject" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དངོས་པོ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The concept of inherent existence that is negated" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Causal linker establishing the logical consequence relationship" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ལུས་ཞེས་བྱའོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene about the conventional designation" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── that [thing/body] which is non-existent [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implicit subject which lacks inherent existence but receives conventional designation" | Implicit: "The subject from the first scene that lacks inherent existence"]
            ├── བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of naming or designating" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ལུས་ཞེས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The conventional designation applied to the non-existent subject" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ལུས་ཞེས་བྱའོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene about the conventional designation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── that [thing/body] which is non-existent [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implicit subject which lacks inherent existence but receives conventional designation" | Implicit: "The subject from the first scene that lacks inherent existence"]
        ├── བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of naming or designating" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ལུས་ཞེས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The conventional designation applied to the non-existent subject" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the subject being described as non-existent; functions as Patient in the semantic structure]
- དངོས་པོ་ : inherent existence [Noun; refers to intrinsic, independent reality; the concept that is being negated; functions as Patient in the attribute]
- མ་ : not [Negative prefix; negates the following verb]
- མཆིས་པས་ : because it does not exist [Verbal noun with causal particle; from `མཆིས་པ་`: to exist (honorific); here with causal suffix `-པས་` indicating "because of"; forms the attribute describing the subject's quality of non-existence]
- དེས་ན་ : therefore [Causal connector; composed of instrumental `དེས་` and locative/temporal particle `ན་`; establishes logical consequence; functions as a linker between the two scenes]
- ལུས་ : body [Noun; conventional designation given to the subject despite its lack of inherent existence; functions as the elaborator in the naming process]
- ཞེས་ : thus/called [Quotative particle; marks the preceding term as a designation or label]
- བྱའོ། ། : it is called [Verb `བྱ་` (to call, name) with the final particle `འོ` marking statement conclusion; functions as the Process of naming/designating in the second scene]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of the Buddha asking Subhuti a question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Speaker | Desc: "The Buddha as the speaker of the utterance" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The person being addressed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    └── འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The content of Buddha's question to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The demonstrative pronoun referring to what follows in the Buddha's question" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [implicit: the Ganges river sands] [Type: Center | Desc: "Implicit referent of 'this', which the commentaries indicate refers to the Ganges river sands in the next part of the discourse" | Implicit: "the Ganges river sands mentioned in the commentaries"]
        ├── སེམས [Type: Process | Desc: "The mental process of thinking" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Interrogative phrase that modifies how the thinking process occurs" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [implicit: to demonstrate Dharma's superiority] [Type: Purpose | Desc: "Implicit purpose of the Buddha's question to demonstrate the superiority of the Dharma and to collect merit" | Implicit: "to demonstrate the superiority of the Dharma and to collect merit"]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ : By the Blessed One [Agentive case of `བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་`: "the Blessed One," epithet of the Buddha; here functioning as the Agent/Speaker who initiates the speech act; an honorific term for the Buddha who has conquered (བཅོམ་) delusions and possesses (ལྡན་) transcendent qualities]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། : proclaimed [Past tense of honorific verb `སྩལ་`: "to bestow, grant, give"; combined with བཀའ་ "word, speech" to form "spoke, proclaimed"; functions as the main Process of utterance in the scene; honorific form indicating the Buddha's speech]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; one of the Buddha's chief disciples known for his understanding of emptiness (śūnyatā); functions as the Recipient/Addressee of the Buddha's speech]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to what follows in the discourse (implicitly referring to the Ganges river sands mentioned in commentaries); functions as the Patient/Object of contemplation]

- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [Interrogative phrase; `ཇི་`: "how, what"; `སྙམ་`: "to think, consider"; `དུ་`: purposive/complementizer particle; modifies the manner of thinking; introduces a rhetorical question]

- སེམས། : you think? [Present tense of `སེམས་`: "to think, contemplate"; the main cognitive Process being questioned; marks this as an interrogative requesting Subhuti's opinion or understanding]

ucca_formatted:
གང་གཱའི་ཀླུང་གི་བྱེ་མ་ཇི་སྙེད་པ་གང་གཱའི་ཀླུང་ཡང་དེ་སྙེད་ཁོ་ནར་གྱུར་ན་དེ་དག་གི་བྱེ་མ་གང་ཡིན་པ་དེ་དག་མང་བ་ཡིན་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "root node representing the entire conditional question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་གཱའི་ཀླུང་གི་བྱེ་མ་ཇི་སྙེད་པ་གང་གཱའི་ཀླུང་ཡང་དེ་སྙེད་ཁོ་ནར་གྱུར་ན [Type: Scene | Desc: "hypothetical condition scene establishing the scenario" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་གཱའི་ཀླུང་གི་བྱེ་མ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "the sand particles of the Ganges river mentioned in the first part" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གི [Type: Relator | Desc: "relator linking the Ganges river and its sand particles" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཇི་སྙེད་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "question word that elaborates on the sand particles, asking about their quantity" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་གཱའི་ཀླུང་ཡང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "the Ganges rivers that would hypothetically exist in the same quantity as the sand particles" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་སྙེད་ཁོ་ནར [Type: Elaborator-Comparative | Desc: "comparative elaborator referring back to the amount established in node 5, setting up equivalence" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གྱུར་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "process indicating the hypothetical transformation or state" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་དག་གི་བྱེ་མ་གང་ཡིན་པ་དེ་དག་མང་བ་ཡིན་སྙམ་མམ [Type: Scene | Desc: "questioning scene about the quantity of sand particles in the hypothetical scenario" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་དག་གི་བྱེ་མ་གང་ཡིན་པ་དེ་དག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "the sand particles being questioned about in the second part of the conditional statement" | Implicit: "rivers"]
        ├── མང་བ་ཡིན [Type: State | Desc: "state describing the potential quantity of sand particles being questioned about" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྙམ་མམ [Type: Mental Process | Desc: "mental process representing the cognitive act of thinking or considering, marking this as a question about the addressee's opinion" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [Subhuti] [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "implicit experiencer (Subhuti/རབ་འབྱོར) who is being questioned by the Buddha in this passage" | Implicit: "Subhuti"]
    └── ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "conditional linker connecting the hypothetical scenario with the question that follows, establishing cause-effect relationship" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- གང་གཱའི་ : Ganges [Genitive of གང་གཱ: the Ganges river; functions as a possessive modifier of the following noun]
- ཀླུང་གི་ : river's [Genitive of ཀླུང་: river, stream; serves as possessive marker linking the river to its sand]
- བྱེ་མ་ : sand particles [Noun: བྱེ་མ་: sand; refers to the countless grains of sand that serve as a metaphor for an enormous quantity]
- ཇི་སྙེད་པ་ : as many as there are [Question phrase: ཇི་སྙེད་པ་: however many, as many as; introduces the comparative quantification]
- གང་གཱའི་ : Ganges [Genitive of གང་གཱ: repeating the reference to the Ganges river; here functioning as a modifier]
- ཀླུང་ : rivers [Noun: ཀླུང་: river, stream; refers to hypothetical multiple Ganges rivers equal in number to sand particles]
- ཡང་ : also/even [Emphatic particle: ཡང་: also, even; emphasizes the comparison between sand particles and rivers]
- དེ་སྙེད་ : that many [Demonstrative + quantity: དེ་: that + སྙེད་: amount; refers back to the previously mentioned quantity]
- ཁོ་ནར་ : exactly [Emphatic particle: ཁོ་ན: only, exactly + terminative marker ར་; emphasizes the precise equivalence]
- གྱུར་ན་ : if became [Conditional form of འགྱུར་བ་: to become, transform; establishes the hypothetical scenario]
- དེ་དག་གི་ : of those [Genitive of demonstrative plural: དེ་དག་: those + genitive marker གི་; refers to the hypothetical multiple Ganges rivers]
- བྱེ་མ་ : sand particles [Noun: བྱེ་མ་: sand; refers to the sand particles of the hypothetical multiple Ganges rivers]
- གང་ཡིན་པ་ : which are [Relative clause marker: གང་: which + ཡིན་པ་: are; introduces a relative clause specifying the sand particles]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural: དེ་དག་: those; refers to the sand particles of all hypothetical Ganges rivers]
- མང་བ་ : many/numerous [Adjective: མང་བ་: many, numerous; describes the quantity being questioned]
- ཡིན་ : are [Verb: ཡིན་: to be; equates the subject with being numerous]
- སྙམ་མམ། : do you think? [Verb + question marker: སྙམ་: to think + མམ་: question particle; directs the question to the implicit addressee (Subhuti)]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་གང་གཱའི་ཀླུང་དེ་དག་ཉིད་ཀྱང་མང་ལགས་ན། དེ་དག་གིས་བྱེ་མ་ལྟ་སྨོས་ཀྱང་ཅི་འཚལ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of Subhuti's statement to the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསོལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The speech act" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The Buddha, who is being addressed" | Implicit: ""]
    └── གང་གཱའི་ཀླུང་དེ་དག་ཉིད་ཀྱང་མང་ལགས་ན། དེ་དག་གིས་བྱེ་མ་ལྟ་སྨོས་ཀྱང་ཅི་འཚལ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The content of Subhuti's statement, containing a logical comparison" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་གཱའི་ཀླུང་དེ་དག་ཉིད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The first element in the comparison (the rivers)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མང་ལགས [Type: Attribute | Desc: "The quality of numerousness attributed to the Ganges rivers" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ན། [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connecting the first part of the conditional statement to the rhetorical question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་དག་གིས་བྱེ་མ་ལྟ་སྨོས་ཀྱང་ཅི་འཚལ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The rhetorical question portion of Subhuti's statement" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་དག་གིས་བྱེ་མ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The second element in the comparison (the sands of those rivers)" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ལྟ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the comparative relationship" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྨོས [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of mentioning or speaking about" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཀྱང [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Emphasizes the action of mentioning" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཅི་འཚལ [Type: Rhetorical | Desc: "Rhetorical question implying there is no need to mention" | Implicit: ""]
        └──  [Type: Comparison | Desc: "Explicit comparative relationship between the Ganges rivers and their sands" | Implicit: "Implied comparison between the numerousness of the rivers and the even greater number of their sands"]
            ├── གང་གཱའི་ཀླུང་དེ་དག་ཉིད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The first element in the comparison (the rivers)" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེ་དག་གིས་བྱེ་མ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The second element in the comparison (the sands of those rivers)" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས : by Subhuti [Ergative/Instrumental case of རབ་འབྱོར་: "Subhuti"; indicating the agent/speaker of the statement; functions as the Agent participant in the scene]
- གསོལ་པ། : said/requested [Perfect tense of གསོལ་བ་: "to request, say, speak"; indicating the speech act directed toward the Buddha; functions as the Process in the scene]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས : Bhagavan/Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; vocative case; indicating the recipient of Subhuti's statement; functions as the Recipient participant]
- གང་གཱའི་ཀླུང་ : Ganges rivers [Genitive case connecting གང་གཱ་: "Ganges" with ཀླུང་: "river"; referring to the famous rivers as an example; first element in the comparison]
- དེ་དག་ཉིད་ : themselves [དེ་དག་: "those" + ཉིད་: emphatic particle; emphasizing the rivers themselves; part of the Patient participant in the first scene]
- ཀྱང་ : even/also [Emphatic connective particle; highlighting that even the rivers themselves are numerous; intensifies the attribute]
- མང་ལགས་ : are many [མང་: "many" + ལགས་: honorific copula; describing the numerousness of the rivers; functions as an Attribute]
- ན། : if/since [Conditional or causal connective; linking the fact of numerous rivers to the following rhetorical question; functions as a logical connector]
- དེ་དག་གིས་ : of those [Genitive case of དེ་དག་: "those"; referring back to the Ganges rivers; possessive marker indicating the sands belong to those rivers]
- བྱེ་མ་ : sand [Noun; referring to the countless grains of sand in the Ganges rivers; second element in the comparison; part of the Patient participant]
- ལྟ་ : like/regarding [Comparative particle; elaborating on the comparative relationship between the rivers and their sands; functions as an Elaborator]
- སྨོས་ : mention [Imperative form of སྨོས་པ་: "to mention, speak of"; the action of referring to something in speech; functions as the Process]
- ཀྱང་ : even/also [Emphatic particle; intensifying the rhetorical nature of the question; functions as an Adverbial modifier]
- ཅི་འཚལ : what need? [ཅི་: interrogative "what" + འཚལ་: "need, require" (honorific); rhetorical question implying there is no need to mention; functions as the Rhetorical element concluding the statement]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་ཁྱོད་མོས་པར་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the Buddha's speech act to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the speaker and agent of the speech act" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ [Type: Process-Speech | Desc: "The instructional speech act performed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Recipient of the Buddha's instruction, corefers with 'ཁྱོད' (you)" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཁྱོད་མོས་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Embedded scene representing the instruction given to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཁྱོད [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The addressee of the instruction, corefers with 'རབ་འབྱོར' (Subhuti)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མོས་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Process-Mental | Desc: "The mental process of developing conviction or understanding that Subhuti is instructed to undertake" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [implicit] [Type: Purpose | Desc: "Implicit purpose of generating faith/conviction based on commentary: to understand the teaching" | Implicit: "Implicit purpose of generating faith/conviction based on commentary"]
        └── [coreference] [Type: Coreference | Desc: "Explicit marking that 'ཁྱོད' (you) refers to 'རབ་འབྱོར' (Subhuti)" | Implicit: "Explicit marking of coreference"]
            ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Recipient of the Buddha's instruction, corefers with 'ཁྱོད' (you)" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཁྱོད [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The addressee of the instruction, corefers with 'རབ་འབྱོར' (Subhuti)" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས : Bhagavān [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་པ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་པ་` (possessing), and `འདས་པ་` (transcended); refers to one who has conquered defilements, possesses qualities, and has gone beyond suffering; functions as the Agent of the speech act]
- ཀྱིས : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates that the Buddha is performing the action of speaking; marks the Agent of the speech act]
- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ : proclaimed [Perfect/past tense of `བཀའ་སྩལ་བ་`: to speak, proclaim (honorific); the Buddha's authoritative speech act directed to Subhuti; functions as the main Process in the scene]
- རབ་འབྱོར : Subhuti [Proper name; one of Buddha's chief disciples known for his understanding of emptiness; functions as the Recipient of the Buddha's instruction and corefers with 'ཁྱོད']
- ཁྱོད : you [Second person singular pronoun; refers directly to Subhuti as the Experiencer who is to develop conviction; corefers with 'རབ་འབྱོར']
- མོས་པར : with conviction [Terminative case of `མོས་པ་`: faith, conviction, understanding; the mental state Subhuti is instructed to develop; part of the mental Process that constitutes the instruction]
- བྱའོ : should do [Future/imperative form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do, make; combined with 'མོས་པར' forms the instruction 'develop conviction'; carries imperative force indicating the Buddha's instruction]

ucca_formatted:
ཁྱོད་ཀྱིས་ཁོང་དུ་ཆུད་པར་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the complete instruction from Buddha to Subhūti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཁྱོད་ཀྱིས་ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who should perform the comprehension, referring to Subhūti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཁོང་དུ་ཆུད་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The full verbal process of comprehension or internalization, including the modal aspect ('should')" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཁོང་དུ་ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Specifies how the comprehension should occur - internally, deeply, or thoroughly" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དོན་དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implicit object of comprehension, referring to the specific teaching or principle (དོན་དེ) mentioned in the commentary" | Implicit: "This is implied from the commentary context"]
glossary:
- ཁྱོད་ཀྱིས་ : You should [Instrumental/agentive case of `ཁྱོད་`: you; indicates the agent who is to perform the action; refers to Subhūti as the addressee; functions as the Agent in the sentence]

- ཁོང་དུ་ : deeply within [Terminative case marker `དུ་` with `ཁོང་`: inside, internal; indicates the manner or direction of comprehension; suggests thorough internalization rather than superficial understanding]

- ཆུད་པར་ : comprehend [Terminative form of `ཆུད་པ་`: to understand, comprehend, penetrate; indicates the process of gaining deep understanding; forms part of the verbal complex]

- བྱའོ། ། : should do [Future/imperative form of `བྱེད་`: to do, make; combined with final particle `འོ`; indicates instruction or command; completes the verbal phrase "should comprehend deeply"]

ucca_formatted:
གང་གཱའི་ཀླུང་དེ་དག་གི་བྱེ་མ་ཇི་སྙེད་པ་དེ་སྙེད་ཀྱི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ན་སྐྱེས་པའམ། བུད་མེད་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་གིས་རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན་གྱིས་རབ་ཏུ་གང་བར་བྱས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing the hypothetical action of filling world-systems with precious substances" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྐྱེས་པའམ། བུད་མེད་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent performing the action of filling" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྐྱེས་པའམ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "First option specifying the agent could be a man" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བུད་མེད་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་གིས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Second option specifying the agent could be a woman with instrumental case marker" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་གཱའི་ཀླུང་དེ་དག་གི་བྱེ་མ་ཇི་སྙེད་པ་དེ་སྙེད་ཀྱི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ན [Type: Quantifier | Desc: "Quantification structure comparing world-systems to grains of sand" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་གཱའི་ཀླུང་དེ་དག་གི་བྱེ་མ་ཇི་སྙེད་པ་དེ་སྙེད་ཀྱི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Comparative element specifying the quantity as equal to grains of sand in the Ganges" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ན [Type: Center | Desc: "The locational center - world-systems - that are being counted" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་ཏུ་གང་བར་བྱས་ཏེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of filling completely" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་ཏུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial modifier indicating the completeness of the filling action" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གང་བར་བྱས [Type: Center | Desc: "The core action of filling" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Instrument | Desc: "The instrument used to perform the filling action, marked by instrumental case" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རིན་པོ་ཆེ [Type: Center | Desc: "The core concept of precious substances" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སྣ་བདུན [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Quantifier specifying seven types of precious substances" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཏེ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connective particle linking this clause to what follows in the broader discourse, indicating a conditional or sequential relationship" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- གང་གཱའི་ : of the Ganges [Genitive compound; `གངྒཱ་`: Ganges river; specifies the location of the rivers being referenced; functions as a modifier in the quantification structure]
- ཀླུང་ : rivers [Noun; `ཀླུང་`: river, stream; refers to the Ganges rivers as the location of the sand being counted; part of the comparative element in the quantification]
- དེ་དག་གི་ : of those [Genitive of demonstrative plural `དེ་དག་`: those; marks possession relation between the rivers and their sand; specifies the particular rivers being referenced]
- བྱེ་མ་ : sand [Noun; `བྱེ་མ་`: sand, grains of sand; the object being used for comparative quantification; functions as the base for numerical comparison]
- ཇི་སྙེད་པ་ : however many [Correlative quantifier; `ཇི་སྙེད་`: however many, as many as; introduces the first part of a correlative quantification; establishes the basis for comparison]
- དེ་སྙེད་ཀྱི་ : that many [Correlative quantifier with genitive; `དེ་སྙེད་`: that many, as many as; completes the correlative structure; modifies the world-systems]
- འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ : of world [Genitive of `འཇིག་རྟེན་`: world, sphere of existence; modifies "realms"; indicates the type of realms being discussed]
- ཁམས་ : realms [Noun; `ཁམས་`: realm, element, dhātu; refers to the world-systems that are being counted; functions as the center of the locational phrase]
- ན་ : in [Locative particle; indicates location within the world-systems; marks the world-systems as the container for the hypothetical action]
- སྐྱེས་པའམ་ : men or [Disjunctive compound; `སྐྱེས་པ་`: man, male + connective `འམ་`; presents the first option for possible agents; part of an elaborative structure specifying potential actors]
- བུད་མེད་ : women [Noun; `བུད་མེད་`: woman, female; second option for possible agents; completes the presentation of possible human agents]
- ལ་ལ་ཞིག་ : some [Indefinite marker; `ལ་ལ་ཞིག་`: some, certain ones; indicates an unspecified subset of men or women; modifies the potential agents]
- གིས་ : by [Instrumental/agentive case marker; marks the preceding nouns as the agents performing the action; connects the agent to the main verb]
- རིན་པོ་ཆེ་ : precious substances [Noun phrase; `རིན་པོ་ཆེ་`: precious thing, jewel, ratna; the main material used for filling; functions as the core concept in the instrumental phrase]
- སྣ་བདུན་ : seven types [Quantifier phrase; `སྣ་`: type, kind + `བདུན་`: seven; specifies the variety of precious substances; functions as a quantifier modifying "precious substances"]
- གྱིས་ : with [Instrumental case marker; indicates that the seven types of precious substances are the means of filling; marks the instrument used in the action]
- རབ་ཏུ་ : completely [Adverbial modifier; `རབ་ཏུ་`: thoroughly, completely; intensifies the verb "fill"; indicates the thoroughness of the filling action]
- གང་བར་ : filled [Verb complement; `གང་བ་`: to fill, become full + dative-locative marker `ར་`; core action being described; indicates the state to be achieved]
- བྱས་ : did, made [Verb; `བྱེད་པ་`: to do, make; light verb completing the verbal phrase with གང་བར་; indicates the act of causing the filling]
- ཏེ་ : and then [Connective particle; links this clause to what follows in the broader discourse; indicates a sequential or conditional relationship to what follows]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་རྣམས་ལ་སྦྱིན་པ་བྱིན་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། སྐྱེས་པའམ་བུད་མེད་དེ་གཞི་དེ་ལས་བསོད་ནམས་མང་དུ་བསྐྱེད་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node representing the entire passage" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་རྣམས་ལ་སྦྱིན་པ་བྱིན་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing the act of giving to enlightened beings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་རྣམས་ལ [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Recipients of the offerings who are worthy addressees of devotional acts" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྦྱིན་པ་བྱིན [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of giving offerings" | Implicit: ""]
        └── someone [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent who gives the offerings" | Implicit: "Implied agent who performs the action of giving"]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene of Buddha asking Subhuti a question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The person being addressed (Subhuti)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Interrogative Process | Desc: "The interrogative process of asking Subhuti his opinion" | Implicit: ""]
    └── སྐྱེས་པའམ་བུད་མེད་དེ་གཞི་དེ་ལས་བསོད་ནམས་མང་དུ་བསྐྱེད་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the hypothetical generation of merit" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྐྱེས་པ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Male agent who could potentially generate merit" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསོད་ནམས་མང་དུ་བསྐྱེད [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of generating merit" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསོད་ནམས་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The merit that would be generated" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མང་དུ [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Quantity modifier indicating abundant merit" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གཞི་དེ་ལས [Type: Participant-Source | Desc: "The causal source from which merit is generated" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བུད་མེད་དེ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Female agent who could potentially generate merit" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འམ [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connector indicating alternative between man and woman" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathāgata [Compound noun from `དེ་བཞིན་`: "thus" + `གཤེགས་པ་`: "gone"; honorific title for Buddha meaning "thus-gone one"; functions as first part of extended compound term for enlightened beings]

- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : Arhat [Compound noun from `དགྲ་`: "enemy" + `བཅོམ་པ་`: "conquered"; one who has conquered the enemies of delusion; second title in the compound description of enlightened beings]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [Adverbial phrase from `ཡང་དག་པ་`: "correct, perfect" + `-ར`: adverbial suffix; modifies "complete" to emphasize complete perfection]

- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive of `རྫོགས་པ་`: "complete, perfect"; connects "complete" to "Buddha" in this compound title]

- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Compound noun from `སངས་`: "awakened, purified" + `རྒྱས་`: "expanded"; one who has awakened from ignorance; main noun in the compound phrase identifying recipients]

- རྣམས་ལ་ : to [Plural marker `རྣམས་` + dative case marker `ལ་`; indicates the recipients of the offering; marks the Participant-Addressee in UCCA structure]

- སྦྱིན་པ་ : offering [Noun from `སྦྱིན་`: "to give"; refers to the act or object of giving; functions as direct object of the verb]

- བྱིན་ན་ : if given [Conditional form of `སྦྱིན་`: "to give"; establishes the hypothetical condition for the following question; functions as Process element in UCCA structure]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; the disciple being addressed by Buddha; functions as Participant-Agent in second scene]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the question about to be asked; part of the interrogative process]

- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [Interrogative phrase from `ཇི་`: "what" + `སྙམ་`: "think" + `དུ་`: complementizer; introduces the question; part of the Interrogative Process]

- སེམས་ : do you think [Present of `སེམས་`: "to think"; completing the question phrase; completes the Interrogative Process]

- སྐྱེས་པའམ་ : man or [Noun `སྐྱེས་པ་`: "man" + disjunctive particle `འམ་`: "or"; introduces the first potential merit-generator; functions as Participant-Agent]

- བུད་མེད་དེ་ : that woman [Noun `བུད་མེད་`: "woman" + demonstrative `དེ་`: "that"; the second potential merit-generator; functions as alternative Participant-Agent]

- གཞི་དེ་ལས་ : from that basis [Noun `གཞི་`: "basis, foundation" + demonstrative `དེ་`: "that" + ablative `ལས་`: "from"; refers to the act of giving described earlier; functions as Participant-Source]

- བསོད་ནམས་ : merit [Compound noun from `བསོད་`: "good fortune" + `ནམས་`: "sky/extent"; spiritual benefit accumulated from virtuous actions; functions as Participant-Patient]

- མང་དུ་ : abundantly [Adjective `མང་`: "many" + adverbial particle `དུ་`; modifies the generation of merit; functions as Quantity modifier]

- བསྐྱེད་ : generate [Future of `སྐྱེ་`: "to be born, arise"; refers to producing merit; functions as Process element]

- སྙམ་མམ་ : do you think? [Verb `སྙམ་`: "to think" + interrogative particle `འམ་`; completes the question; reinforces the interrogative nature]

རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མང་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root containing two parallel scenes of dialogue" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene representing Subhuti's speech act" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant | Desc: "Agent participant who performs the speaking action" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གསོལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of speaking performed by Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མང་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene representing the content of Subhuti's speech" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant | Desc: "Addressee participant in Subhuti's statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མང་ལགས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of affirming/stating in Subhuti's speech" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [merits/teachings] [Type: Participant | Desc: "Patient participant that is the subject of being 'many'" | Implicit: "Implicit reference to the merits or teachings being discussed"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper noun; name of one of Buddha's chief disciples; functions as the Agent in the first scene according to semantic structure]
- གྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker connecting to the verb; shows Subhuti as the one performing the action of speaking]
- གསོལ་པ། : said/spoke [Perfect form of `གསོལ་བ`: to request, speak, say; here marking a formal statement or request; functions as the main Process in the first scene]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Bhagavan/Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; vocative form addressing the Buddha directly; serves as the Addressee participant in the second scene]
- མང་ : many [Adjective meaning numerous, abundant; here referring implicitly to merits or teachings previously discussed; forms part of the verbal statement]
- ལགས་སོ། : are indeed [Polite existential/equative verb with final particle; formal affirmation; functions as the main Process in the second scene, connecting the implicit subject to the quality of being "many"]

བདེ་བར་གཤེགས་པ་མང་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire statement about the presence of many Tathagatas" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བདེ་བར་གཤེགས་པ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Tathagatas/Sugatas (Buddhas) who are the main participants in this statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མང [Type: State | Desc: "Quantitative state attribute describing the number of Tathagatas" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལགས་སོ [Type: Function | Desc: "Copula verb functioning as 'are' in the formal statement" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [in sacred spaces/teaching locations] [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "Implicit location where the Tathagatas are present" | Implicit: "Location where the Tathagatas are present, as indicated in the commentaries about sacred teaching spaces"]
glossary:
- བདེ་བར་ : peacefully, in bliss [Adverbial form of `བདེ་བ་`: happiness, bliss; describes the manner of going/passing; modifies གཤེགས་པ་; part of the epithet for Buddhas]
- གཤེགས་པ་ : gone, passed [Nominalized verb from `གཤེགས་`: to go, depart, pass away; honorific term used specifically for enlightened beings; forms the Agent/Participant in the scene]
- མང་ : many [Quantifier; state attribute indicating plurality; describes the number of Tathagatas present]
- ལགས་སོ : are [Formal/honorific copula verb + final particle; present tense; functions as the linking verb connecting the subject (Tathagatas) with their attribute (many); indicates a formal, respectful statement]

སྐྱེས་པའམ་བུད་མེད་དེ་གཞི་དེ་ལས་བསོད་ནམས་མང་དུ་བསྐྱེད་པ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing the generation of merit" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྐྱེས་པའམ་བུད་མེད་དེ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Agent who generates merit" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྐྱེས་པ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "First alternative agent" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འམ [Type: Connector | Desc: "Conjunction indicating alternative relationship between man and woman" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བུད་མེད [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Second alternative agent" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གཞི་དེ་ལས [Type: Participant-Adverbial | Desc: "Causal adverbial indicating the source or basis for merit generation" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བསོད་ནམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The merit being generated, implicitly understood to be immeasurable and incalculable in quantity" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བསྐྱེད་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of generating or producing merit" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མང་དུ [Type: Manner | Desc: "Adverbial manner modifying how the merit is generated" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Formal/respectful sentence-final marker indicating completion of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- སྐྱེས་པའམ་ : a man or [Alternative conjunction of `སྐྱེས་པ`: man, male person; used to introduce the first alternative agent who generates merit; functions as part of the Agent participant in the sentence]
- བུད་མེད་ : woman [from `བུད་མེད`: woman, female person; the second alternative agent who generates merit; completing the paired Agent construction with སྐྱེས་པ]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to and emphasizes the person (man or woman) as the specific agent being discussed]
- གཞི་ : basis [from `གཞི་`: foundation, basis, ground; the source or foundation from which merit is generated]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies which particular basis is being referenced]
- ལས་ : from [Ablative case marker; indicates the source or origin from which the merit arises]
- བསོད་ནམས་ : merit [from `བསོད་ནམས་`: merit, positive karma, spiritual benefit; the object or result being generated by the agent]
- མང་དུ་ : abundantly [Adverbial form of `མང་པོ་`: many, much, abundant; modifies how the merit is generated - in large quantity]
- བསྐྱེད་པ་ : generates [Future/causative form of `སྐྱེ་`: to give rise to, produce, generate; the main process or action of the sentence]
- ལགས་སོ། ། : is [Honorific copula with final particle; formal/respectful sentence-final marker indicating the completion of the statement]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་གང་གིས་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་དེ་སྙེད་རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན་གྱིས་རབ་ཏུ་གང་བར་བྱས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire utterance" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha who is speaking" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཀྱིས [Type: Function | Desc: "Ergative case marker indicating the agent of the speech act" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of speaking/proclaiming by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The person being addressed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་གིས་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་དེ་སྙེད་རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན་གྱིས་རབ་ཏུ་གང་བར་བྱས་ཏེ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Hypothetical scene describing someone filling world systems with precious substances" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The hypothetical person performing the action of filling" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The world systems being filled with precious substances" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་སྙེད [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Quantifier indicating a specific large number of world systems" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་བར་བྱས [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of filling the world systems" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རབ་ཏུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial modifier indicating the completeness of the filling" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཏེ [Type: Function | Desc: "Connective particle linking this action to what follows" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Instrument | Desc: "The materials used to fill the world systems" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན [Type: Center | Desc: "The seven types of precious materials" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གྱིས [Type: Function | Desc: "Instrumental case marker indicating the means of filling" | Implicit: ""]
        └── would generate merit [Type: Implicit Scene | Desc: "Implicit outcome of the hypothetical scenario regarding merit generation" | Implicit: "Implied outcome of the hypothetical scenario regarding merit generation"]
            ├── merit from such offering [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "The merit that would be generated from filling worlds with precious substances" | Implicit: "The merit that would be generated from filling worlds with precious substances"]
            └── would be produced [Type: Implicit Process | Desc: "The implicit process of merit generation being discussed in the teaching" | Implicit: "The implied process of merit generation being discussed in the teaching"]
    └── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Sentence-ending punctuation" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : The Blessed One [Honorific term for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་`: conquered, `ལྡན་`: possessing, `འདས་`: transcended; refers to one who has conquered defilements, possesses qualities, and transcended samsara; functions as the Agent/Speaker in this utterance]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [Ergative case marker indicating the agent of the speech act; marks the Buddha as the speaker of the teaching]
- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། : proclaimed [Honorific past tense of `སྩལ་བ་`: to grant, bestow, speak; formal term for Buddha's teachings; functions as the main Process/verb of the first clause]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of the Buddha's disciple; one of the principal interlocutors in Prajñāpāramitā literature; functions as the Recipient/addressee of the Buddha's teaching]
- གང་གིས་ : whoever/if someone [Relative pronoun `གང་`: who/which + ergative marker `གིས་`; introduces a hypothetical agent in the conditional clause; functions as Agent of the hypothetical scene]
- འཇིག་རྟེན་ : world [From `འཇིག་`: destruction + `རྟེན་`: support; referring to the impermanent cosmos; functions as Patient/object being filled in the hypothetical scenario]
- གྱི་ : of [Genitive particle connecting `འཇིག་རྟེན་` and `ཁམས་`; indicates possession]
- ཁམས་ : realms/systems [Sanskrit: dhātu; referring to world-systems or elemental realms; part of the Patient/object being filled]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun pointing to `ཁམས་`; specifies particular realms]
- སྙེད་ : as many/numerous [Quantifier indicating an extremely large number; elaborates on the extent of world systems]
- རིན་པོ་ཆེ་ : precious substances [Compound noun meaning valuable materials; base of the Instrument used in the filling]
- སྣ་ : types/kinds [Classifier for varieties or categories]
- བདུན་ : seven [Cardinal number modifying `སྣ་`; specifies exactly seven types]
- གྱིས་ : with/by means of [Instrumental case marker indicating the means of filling; marks `རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན་` as the Instrument]
- རབ་ཏུ་ : completely/thoroughly [Adverbial intensifier from `རབ་`: supreme + `ཏུ་`: adverbial marker; intensifies the completeness of the action]
- གང་བར་ : filled [Verb `གང་བ་`: to fill, become full + terminative particle `-ར་`; the main Process in the hypothetical scene]
- བྱས་ : made/did [Past form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do, make; auxiliary verb completing the action]
- ཏེ། : and then [Connective particle linking the hypothetical condition to an implied consequence; indicates the sentence continues with a result not shown in this excerpt]

    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་རྣམས་ལ་སྦྱིན་པ་བྱིན་པ་བས [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing the act of giving offerings to Buddhas" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་རྣམས་ལ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The Tathagatas who are the object of the offerings" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སྦྱིན་པ་བྱིན་པ་བས [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of giving offerings to the Buddhas" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་གིས་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ལས་ཐ་ན་ཚིག་བཞི་པའི་ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་ཙམ་བཟུང་ནས། གཞན་དག་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ་བཤད་དེ་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ་བསྟན་ན [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene describing the act of memorizing and teaching the Dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The person who memorizes and teaches the Dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ལས [Type: Participant-Source | Desc: "The source text from which a portion is taken" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཐ་ན་ཚིག་བཞི་པའི་ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་ཙམ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The specific portion of text that is memorized" | Implicit: ""]
