    ├── དེ་ཉིད་གཞི་དེ་ལས་བསོད་ནམས་ཆེས་མང་དུ་གྲངས་མེད་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་བསྐྱེད་དོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Third scene describing the generation of merit" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ཉིད་གཞི་དེ་ལས [Type: Participant-Source | Desc: "The source or basis from which merit arises" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཆེས་མང་དུ་གྲངས་མེད་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The merit that is generated" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བསྐྱེད་དོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of generating merit" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བས [Type: Contrastive | Desc: "Contrastive relation between giving offerings to Buddhas and teaching the Dharma" | Implicit: ""]
    └── therefore [Type: Causal | Desc: "Causal relation between teaching the Dharma and generating merit" | Implicit: "The implicit causal relationship between teaching Dharma and generating merit"]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathāgata [honorific title for Buddha meaning "Thus-Gone One"; compound from དེ་བཞིན་ (thus) + གཤེགས་པ་ (gone); functions as part of a complex nominal participant in the first scene]
- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : Arhat [title meaning "Foe-destroyer"; compound of དགྲ་ (enemy) + བཅོམ་པ་ (conquered); a Buddha who has conquered the enemy of delusions; part of the string of epithets]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [adverbial phrase from ཡང་དག་པ་ (perfect, complete, authentic); modifies the following "completely enlightened"]
- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [genitive of རྫོགས་པ་ (complete, perfect); connects to སངས་རྒྱས་ to form "completely enlightened Buddha"]
- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [compound of སངས་ (purified) + རྒྱས་ (developed); "Awakened One"; the culmination of the string of honorific titles]
- རྣམས་ : plural marker [indicates multiple Buddhas are being referenced; part of the Patient participant in the first scene]
- ལ་ : to [dative case marker; connects the Buddhas as recipients of offerings]
- སྦྱིན་པ་ : offerings [noun from སྦྱིན་པ་ (to give, offering, generosity); the object being given to the Buddhas]
- བྱིན་པ་ : having given [past tense of སྦྱིན་པ་ (to give); forms the main verb of the first scene]
- བས : than [comparative particle; establishes the contrast between giving to Buddhas and teaching Dharma]
- གང་གིས་ : whoever [relative pronoun in instrumental case; identifies the hypothetical person who memorizes and teaches; functions as the Agent in the second scene]
- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : of Dharma [genitive of ཆོས་ (Dharma, teaching, phenomenon); connects to རྣམ་གྲངས་]
- རྣམ་གྲངས་ : discourse [classification, enumeration; refers to a specific type of teaching or text]
- འདི་ : this [demonstrative pronoun; specifies a particular discourse being referenced]
- ལས་ : from [ablative case marker; indicates the source from which a portion is taken]
- ཐ་ན་ : even [adverbial phrase indicating the minimum extent; emphasizes the small portion that follows]
- ཚིག་བཞི་པའི་ : of four lines [genitive of ཚིག་བཞི་པ་ (four lines); specifies the type of verse]
- ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་ : verse [locative of ཚིགས་བཅད་ (verse, stanza); a metrical composition]
- ཙམ་ : merely [restrictive particle; emphasizes the minimal nature of the verse]
- བཟུང་ནས་ : having memorized [verbal connective from འཛིན་པ་ (to hold, grasp, memorize); indicates memorization as preparatory action]
- གཞན་དག་ : others [plural of གཞན་ (other); the recipients of the teaching; functions as Recipient in the second scene]
- ལ་ : to [dative case marker; connects to the recipients of teaching]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : correctly [adverbial phrase from ཡང་དག་པ་ (correct, authentic); modifies the manner of explanation]
- རབ་ཏུ་ : thoroughly [intensive adverb; intensifies the action of explanation]
- བཤད་ : explain [past stem of འཆད་པ་ (to explain); first teaching verb]
- དེ་ : and [connective particle; joins the two teaching verbs]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : correctly [repeated adverbial phrase; modifies the manner of teaching]
- རབ་ཏུ་ : thoroughly [repeated intensive adverb; intensifies the action of teaching]
- བསྟན་ན་ : if teaches [conditional form of སྟོན་པ་ (to show, teach); establishes the condition for merit generation]
- དེ་ཉིད་ : that very person [demonstrative + emphatic; refers back to the hypothetical teacher]
- གཞི་དེ་ལས་ : from that basis [ablative case; indicates the source from which merit arises]
- བསོད་ནམས་ : merit [spiritual credit, positive karma; the result that is generated]
- ཆེས་ : far [adverb of degree; intensifies the quantity of merit]
- མང་དུ་ : more abundant [adverbial phrase from མང་པོ་ (many, abundant); describes the quantity of merit]
- གྲངས་མེད་ : incalculable [compound of གྲངས་ (number) + མེད་ (without); beyond counting]
- དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་ : immeasurable [compound of དཔག་ (measure) + མེད་པ་ (without); beyond measure]
- བསྐྱེད་དོ : generates [present tense of སྐྱེད་པ་ (to generate, produce) + final particle; main verb of the third scene]

ཡང་རབ་འབྱོར་ས་ཕྱོགས་གང་ན་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ལས་ཐ་ན་ཚིག་བཞི་པའི་ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་ཙམ་འདོན་ཏམ་སྟོན་པའི་ས་ཕྱོགས་དེ་ནི་ལྷ་དང་མི་དང་ལྷ་མ་ཡིན་དུ་བཅས་པའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་མཆོད་རྟེན་དུ་གྱུར་པ་ཡིན་ན་སུ་ཞིག་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ལེན་པ་དང༌། འབྲི་བ་དང༌། འཛིན་པ་དང་། འཆང་བ་དང༌། ཀློག་པ་དང༌། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ་དང༌། ཚུལ་བཞིན་དུ་ཡིད་ལ་བྱེད་པ་དེ་ངོ་མཚར་རབ་དང་ལྡན་པར་གྱུར་པ་ལྟ་ཅི་སྨོས་ཏེ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire text" | Implicit: ""]

    ├── ས་ཕྱོགས་གང་ན་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ལས་ཐ་ན་ཚིག་བཞི་པའི་ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་ཙམ་འདོན་ཏམ་སྟོན་པའི་ས་ཕྱོགས་དེ་ནི་ལྷ་དང་མི་དང་ལྷ་མ་ཡིན་དུ་བཅས་པའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་མཆོད་རྟེན་དུ་གྱུར་པ་ཡིན་ན [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Conditional scene about the place becoming a shrine" | Implicit: ""]

                └── ས་ཕྱོགས [Type: Center | Desc: "The location where the dharma is taught" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ལྷ་དང་མི་དང་ལྷ་མ་ཡིན་དུ་བཅས་པའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་མཆོད་རྟེན་དུ་གྱུར་པ་ཡིན [Type: State | Desc: "The state of the place becoming a shrine" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── མཆོད་རྟེན [Type: Center | Desc: "The sacred object of veneration" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ལྷ་དང་མི་དང་ལྷ་མ་ཡིན་དུ་བཅས་པའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Specifies who venerates the shrine" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྟོན་པ [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit presence of a teacher or Buddha who dwells in the place where dharma is taught" | Implicit: "The implicit presence of a teacher or Buddha who dwells in the place where dharma is taught"]
            └── ན [Type: Function | Desc: "Conditional marker connecting the two scenes" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ན [Type: Function | Desc: "Conditional marker for the overall parallel scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    └── སུ་ཞིག་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ལེན་པ་དང༌། འབྲི་བ་དང༌། འཛིན་པ་དང་། འཆང་བ་དང༌། ཀློག་པ་དང༌། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ་དང༌། ཚུལ་བཞིན་དུ་ཡིད་ལ་བྱེད་པ་དེ་ངོ་མཚར་རབ་དང་ལྡན་པར་གྱུར་པ་ལྟ་ཅི་སྨོས་ཏེ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Rhetorical question about practitioners engaging with the dharma text" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལྟ་ཅི་སྨོས་ཏེ་ [Type: Function | Desc: "Rhetorical device emphasizing the obviousness of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་ཟག [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The person who engages with the dharma text through various activities" | Implicit: "The person who engages with the dharma text through various activities"]
        ├── སུ་ཞིག་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ལེན་པ་དང༌། འབྲི་བ་དང༌། འཛིན་པ་དང་། འཆང་བ་དང༌། ཀློག་པ་དང༌། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ་དང༌། ཚུལ་བཞིན་དུ་ཡིད་ལ་བྱེད་པ་དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The person engaging with the dharma text and the activities performed" | Implicit: ""]

            ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The text that is the object of the various activities" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ལེན་པ་དང༌ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of taking up or receiving the words of the text" | Implicit: ""]

            └── ཚུལ་བཞིན་དུ་ཡིད་ལ་བྱེད་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of properly reflecting on or putting into practice the text" | Implicit: ""]

            └── གྱུར་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The process of transformation into the state of wonder" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ངོ་མཚར་རབ་དང་ལྡན་པར [Type: Center | Desc: "The state of being endowed with wonder due to engaging with the difficult practice" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཡང་ : Furthermore [Particle; functions as a linker connecting this statement to previous discourse]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; the direct addressee of the Buddha's discourse; functions as the recipient of the teaching]
- ས་ཕྱོགས་ : place [Noun; a physical location; functions as the center or main subject of the conditional clause]
- གང་ན་ : wherever [Relative-locative construction; from `གང་` (which) + `ན` (in/at); indicates the location where a particular activity takes place]
- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : of Dharma [Genitive of `ཆོས་` (Dharma, Buddhist teachings); modifies `རྣམ་གྲངས་`]
- རྣམ་གྲངས་ : discourse [Noun; from `རྣམ་པ་` (type) + `གྲངས་` (enumeration); referring to an enumerated exposition of the Dharma; functions as part of the object being taught]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies that the discourse being discussed is the present one]
- ལས་ : from [Ablative particle; indicates source or origin; here shows that what follows is derived from this discourse]
- ཐ་ན་ : even [Limitative particle; emphasizes the minimal nature of what follows; "even just"]
- ཚིག་ : words [Noun; verbal expressions; forms part of compound with the following]
- བཞི་པའི་ : of four [Genitive of `བཞི་པ་` (fourth); modifies `ཚིག་` to indicate "four-line"]
- ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་ : verse [Term for a metrical verse composition; from `ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་` (to arrange in metric form)]
- ཙམ་ : merely [Limitative particle; indicates that "even just" a single four-line verse is significant]
- འདོན་ : recite [Verb; to orally recite or speak aloud; one of the two possible activities with the text]
- ཏམ་ : or [Disjunctive particle; connects alternative actions]
- སྟོན་པའི་ : teaching [Genitive of `སྟོན་པ་` (to teach, explain); modifies `ས་ཕྱོགས་` to describe the place where teaching occurs]
- ས་ཕྱོགས་ : place [Noun; repetition of the earlier term to form a correlative construction]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the previously mentioned place]
- ནི་ : indeed [Topic marker; emphasizes what is being said about the place]
- ལྷ་ : gods [Noun; celestial beings in Buddhist cosmology; first in a list of beings who venerate the place]
- དང་ : and [Conjunction particle; connects items in a list]
- མི་ : humans [Noun; human beings; second in the list of beings]
- དང་ : and [Conjunction particle; connects items in a list]
- ལྷ་མ་ཡིན་ : demigods [Noun; asuras in Buddhist cosmology; third in the list of beings]
- དུ་བཅས་པའི་ : including [Terminative + verbal adjective; "together with"; indicates the comprehensive nature of the list]
- འཇིག་རྟེན་ : world [Noun; the mundane world or universe; the beings that populate the cosmos]
- གྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; connects `འཇིག་རྟེན་` with `མཆོད་རྟེན་`]
- མཆོད་རྟེན་ : shrine [Noun; a sacred monument or stupa; object of veneration]
- དུ་ : as [Terminative particle; indicates transformation or becoming]
- གྱུར་པ་ : becomes [Verbal noun from `འགྱུར་བ་` (to become); indicates the transformation of the place into a shrine]
- ཡིན་ : is [Copula verb; completes the statement about the place becoming a shrine]
- ན་ : if [Conditional particle; introduces the condition (if the place becomes a shrine)]
- སུ་ཞིག་ : whoever [Interrogative pronoun; used rhetorically to introduce someone who engages with the text]
- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : of Dharma [Genitive of `ཆོས་` (Dharma); modifies `རྣམ་གྲངས་`]
- རྣམ་གྲངས་ : discourse [Noun; same term as above, referring to the Buddhist teaching]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies this particular discourse]
- ལེན་པ་ : receives [Verbal noun from `ལེན་པ་` (to take, receive); first in a list of activities with the text]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction particle; connects items in the list of activities]
- འབྲི་བ་ : writes [Verbal noun from `འབྲི་བ་` (to write); second in the list of activities]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction particle; connects items in the list]
- འཛིན་པ་ : memorizes [Verbal noun from `འཛིན་པ་` (to hold, grasp mentally); third in the list]
- དང་ : and [Conjunction particle; connects items in the list]
- འཆང་བ་ : possesses [Verbal noun from `འཆང་བ་` (to hold, possess physically); fourth in the list]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction particle; connects items in the list]
- ཀློག་པ་ : reads [Verbal noun from `ཀློག་པ་` (to read aloud); fifth in the list]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction particle; connects items in the list]
- ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ་ : comprehends completely [Verbal phrase; from `ཀུན་` (all) + `ཆུབ་པ་` (to understand) + `བྱེད་པ་` (to do); sixth activity]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction particle; connects the final item in the list]
- ཚུལ་བཞིན་དུ་ : properly [Adverbial phrase; from `ཚུལ་བཞིན་` (proper manner) + `དུ་` (adverbial marker); modifies the following verb]
- ཡིད་ལ་བྱེད་པ་ : contemplates [Verbal phrase; from `ཡིད་` (mind) + `ལ་` (in) + `བྱེད་པ་` (to do); seventh and final activity]
- དེ་ : that person [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to whoever performs these activities]
- ངོ་མཚར་ : wonder [Noun; amazement, marvel; describes the state of the practitioner]
- རབ་ : great [Intensifier; indicates the high degree of wonder]
- དང་ : with [Conjunction particle; connects `ངོ་མཚར་རབ་` with `ལྡན་པར་`]
- ལྡན་པར་ : endowed [Verbal adjective from `ལྡན་པ་` (to possess); describes the state of having wonder]
- གྱུར་པ་ : becomes [Verbal noun from `འགྱུར་བ་` (to become); indicates transformation into this state]
- ལྟ་ཅི་སྨོས་ཏེ་ : needless to mention [Rhetorical phrase; indicates that something is so obvious it doesn't need stating; functions as an emphatic rhetorical device]

ucca_formatted:
ས་ཕྱོགས་དེ་ན་སྟོན་པའམ། བླ་མ་ལྟ་བུ་གང་ཡང་རུང་བར་གནས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The complete scene describing where either a Buddha/teacher or a spiritual master is residing." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ས་ཕྱོགས་དེ་ན [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "The location where the spiritual being is residing." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྟོན་པའམ། བླ་མ་ལྟ་བུ་གང་ཡང་རུང་བར [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Alternative entities who could be residing at the location - either a Buddha/teacher or a spiritual master, not both simultaneously." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྟོན་པའམ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Specifically refers to a Buddha or teacher who performs the activities of a teacher (སྟོན་པའི་མཛད་པ་མཛད་པ), equivalent to སངས་རྒྱས (Buddha) as clarified in the commentary." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འམ [Type: Connector | Desc: "A disjunctive connector indicating an alternative relationship between 'སྟོན་པའམ' (teacher/Buddha) and 'བླ་མ་ལྟ་བུ' (spiritual master)." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བླ་མ་ལྟ་བུ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Refers specifically to noble spiritual masters such as Manjushri (འཕགས་པ་འཇམ་པའི་དབྱངས་) or other noble beings who fulfill the function of teaching the dharma." | Implicit: ""]
            └── ལྟ་བུ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Modifier indicating similarity or kind." | Implicit: ""]
        └── གང་ཡང་རུང་བར [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Indicates that any one of the mentioned types of spiritual masters could be residing at the location, expressing that these are alternatives rather than simultaneous presences." | Implicit: ""]
    └── གནས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of residing or dwelling at the location." | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ས་ཕྱོགས་ : location [Compound noun: `ས་` (earth/place) + `ཕྱོགས་` (direction/area); refers to a physical place or area; functions as part of the locative phrase in the sentence]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies the particular location being referred to; acts as a determiner within the locative phrase]
- ན : at/in [Locative case particle; indicates the place where something is located or occurs; completes the locative phrase "at that place"]
- སྟོན་པའམ : a Buddha/teacher or [Noun with disjunctive particle: `སྟོན་པ་` (teacher/Buddha) + `འམ` (or); specifically refers to a Buddha who performs teaching activities (སྟོན་པའི་མཛད་པ་མཛད་པ); first alternative of the agent in the sentence]
- བླ་མ་ : spiritual master [Noun: spiritual guide/lama; refers specifically to noble spiritual masters such as Manjushri or other noble beings who teach dharma; second alternative of the agent]
- ལྟ་བུ་ : like/similar to [Comparative particle: indicates similarity or type; modifies "བླ་མ་" to indicate a certain type or category of spiritual master]
- གང་ཡང་རུང་བར : whichever is suitable/either one [Adverbial phrase: `གང་` (which) + `ཡང་` (even/also) + `རུང་བ` (suitable/acceptable) + `-ར` (terminative case); indicates that any one of the mentioned types (Buddha/teacher or spiritual master) could be residing, expressing alternatives rather than simultaneous presence]
- གནས་སོ : resides/dwells [Verb with final particle: `གནས་` (to dwell/reside) + `སོ` (sentence-final particle indicating completion); the main action of the sentence describing where the spiritual being is located]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ་དང༌། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing the entire parallel scene structure of the Buddha speaking and Subhuti responding" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing the Buddha's speech act" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent - the Buddha (Bhagavan) as the speaker in the first scene" | Implicit: "The Blessed One (Buddha) as the speaker is implied but not explicitly stated in this clause"]
        ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of the Buddha speaking or pronouncing teachings" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborator referring to the content of what was previously spoken" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་ཏོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene describing Subhuti's response to the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Speaker | Desc: "The speaker in the second scene - Venerable Subhuti addressing the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient of Subhuti's address - the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསོལ་ཏོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of Subhuti speaking or making a request to the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདི་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborator introducing the content of what Subhuti is about to say" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Linker connecting the two speech events that form a formal dialogue exchange in the sutra" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་ : thus [Adverbial phrase; `དེ་` (that) + `སྐད་` (speech/words) + `ཅེས་` (quotative marker); refers to the preceding teachings that were spoken; functions as an Elaborator indicating previously spoken content]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ་ : proclaimed [Past tense of `བཀའ་སྩལ་བ་`: to proclaim, pronounce (honorific); refers to the Buddha's authoritative pronouncement of teachings; functions as the main Process in the first scene]

- དང༌ : and [Conjunction; connects the two speech events in the sutra; functions as a Linker establishing temporal sequence and relationship between the Buddha's speech and Subhuti's response]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; `བཅོམ་` (conquered) + `ལྡན་` (possessing) + `འདས་` (transcended); refers to the Buddha who has conquered defilements and transcended samsara; functions as the Recipient of Subhuti's address]

- ལ་ : to [Dative case marker; indicates the direction of Subhuti's address; marks the Buddha as the recipient of the subsequent speech]

- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : Venerable [Honorific title; `ཚེ་` (life) + `དང་` (and) + `ལྡན་པ་` (possessing); literally "endowed with life," a formal title for respected monastics; part of the Agent identification in the second scene]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; name of the disciple of Buddha who is the speaker in the second scene; functions as the main Agent/Speaker in the second scene]

- གྱིས་ : by [Instrumental/agentive case marker; marks Subhuti as the active agent performing the action of speaking; indicates who is performing the speech act]

- འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་ : as follows [Adverbial phrase; `འདི་` (this) + `སྐད་` (speech/words) + `ཅེས་` (quotative marker); introduces the content that will follow in the next section; functions as an Elaborator for the upcoming speech]

- གསོལ་ཏོ : requested [Past tense verb with final particle; from `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, beseech (honorific); indicates Subhuti's respectful address to the Buddha; functions as the main Process in the second scene]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདིའི་མིང་ཅི་ལགས [Type: Scene | Desc: "root scene representing the question about the name of the discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "the Buddha who is being addressed in this question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདིའི་མིང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "the subject being inquired about" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མིང [Type: Center | Desc: "the central concept of what is being asked about" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདིའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "specifies which name is being referred to" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས [Type: Center | Desc: "the central concept being elaborated upon" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདིའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "specifies which discourse is being referred to" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཅི [Type: Participant-Attribute | Desc: "interrogative asking about the attribute (name) of the discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལགས [Type: State | Desc: "copular verb connecting the name and the interrogative" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Subhūti] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "the person asking the question, as indicated in the commentary" | Implicit: "རབ་འབྱོར"]
    └── [for the benefit of beings] [Type: Purpose | Desc: "the purpose of asking for the name is to benefit beings through hearing the name" | Implicit: "འགྲོ་བའི་དོན་དུ"]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to the Buddha as the addressee in this question; functions as the Participant-Addressee in the semantic structure]

- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : of the Dharma [Genitive of `ཆོས་`: dharma, teachings, phenomena; links 'dharma' to 'discourse'; functions as part of a compound noun phrase]

- རྣམ་གྲངས་ : discourse [compound of `རྣམ་` (complete) and `གྲངས་` (enumeration); refers to a specific teaching exposition or discourse; central part of the compound object being inquired about]

- འདིའི་ : this [Genitive of `འདི་`: this, this one; specifies which discourse is being referred to; functions as an Elaborator narrowing the reference]

- མིང་ : name [root word meaning 'name, title'; the central concept being inquired about; functions as the center of the Patient in the question]

- ཅི་ : what [interrogative pronoun; asks about the attribute (name) of the discourse; functions as the interrogative marker in the question]

- ལགས་ : is [polite copula verb; connects the subject (name of discourse) with the interrogative; functions as the State element in the semantic structure; indicates formal, respectful speech]

ucca_formatted:
འདི་ཇི་ལྟར་གཟུང་བར་བགྱི། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the question about how to maintain the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི [Type: Participant-Patient-Teaching | Desc: "The teaching or dharma that is to be held or maintained" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཇི་ལྟར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Interrogative adverb asking about the manner of holding/maintaining" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གཟུང་བར་བགྱི [Type: Process-Interrogative | Desc: "Questioning verb phrase about the proper way to maintain or preserve the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [implied questioner] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent-Questioner | Desc: "Implied agent (likely Rabyor) who is asking about how to maintain the teaching" | Implicit: "The person asking the question, likely Rabyor"]
glossary:
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the teaching or dharma that is being discussed; functions as the Patient in the sentence - the thing that is to be held/maintained]
- ཇི་ལྟར་ : how [Interrogative adverb; literally "in what manner"; introduces the question about the method or approach; functions as an Adverbial modifier indicating the manner of the action]
- གཟུང་བར་ : to hold/maintain [Purposive form of `འཛིན་པ་` (to grasp, hold); here refers to properly maintaining or preserving the teaching; forms part of the main verbal process]
- བགྱི : shall (I) do [Honorific form of `བྱེད་པ་` (to do), in interrogative context; first person implied from context; completes the verbal phrase "how shall I maintain"; functions as the main Process verb with implied first-person Agent (questioner)]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་པ་དང༌། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "This dialogue is part of the Perfection of Wisdom (ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ) teachings on emptiness (སྟོང་པ་ཉིད་)." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་པ་དང༌ [Type: Scene | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "References previous discourse about emptiness teachings, referring to what was spoken before" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསོལ་པ [Type: Process | Implicit: ""]
        └──  [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "This refers to Subhuti (རབ་འབྱོར), who is making the request" | Implicit: "Subhuti"]
    ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Honorific title" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Content | Desc: "Refers to the content of what the Buddha is about to say" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཀའ་སྩལ [Type: Process | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཏོ། ། [Type: Ground | Desc: "Sentence-final marker that grounds the utterance in the discourse" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་ : thus saying [Quotative phrase; `དེ་སྐད་`: "thus, in that way" + `ཅེས་`: quotative marker; references previously spoken discourse about emptiness; functions as an Adverbial modifier indicating how something was spoken]

- གསོལ་པ་ : requested [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, beseech, supplicate; indicates a formal request made to the Buddha; functions as the main Process in the first scene]

- དང༌། : and [Conjunction particle; connects two scenes in the narrative; serves as a Linker between Subhuti's request and the Buddha's response]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་`: conquered + `ལྡན་`: possessing + `འདས་`: transcended; refers to the Buddha who has conquered the afflictions and transcended samsara; functions as the Agent of the second scene]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates that the Buddha is the Agent performing the action of teaching]

- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : Venerable [Honorific title; literally "possessing life/longevity"; composed of `ཚེ་`: life + `དང་`: and + `ལྡན་པ་`: possessing; a respectful form of address for ordained monks; functions as an Elaborator of Subhuti's name]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; name of one of Buddha's chief disciples known for his understanding of emptiness; functions as the Recipient of the Buddha's teaching]

- ལ་ : to [Dative case marker; indicates that Subhuti is the one to whom the Buddha is speaking]

- འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་ : these words [Quotative phrase; `འདི་སྐད་`: "these words, in this way" + `ཅེས་`: quotative marker; refers to the content of what follows in the discourse; functions as Content indicator for what the Buddha is about to say]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་ : pronounced [Honorific past tense verb; from `བཀའ་`: word/speech (honorific) + `སྩལ་`: to give/bestow (honorific); indicates the Buddha's authoritative teaching; functions as the main Process of the second scene]

- ཏོ། ། : [Final sentence marker; indicates completion of the statement; grounds the utterance in the discourse context]

རབ་འབྱོར་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདིའི་མིང་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་སྟེ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire sentence about naming the discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ [Type: Vocative-Addressee | Desc: "The addressee (Subhuti) being directly addressed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདིའི་མིང་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The discourse's name that is being referred to" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདིའི་ [Type: Center | Desc: "Specifies which discourse is being named" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མིང་ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept of 'name' that is being elaborated upon" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The specific name 'Perfection of Wisdom' that elaborates what the discourse is called" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཞེས་ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Connects the name to the act of naming" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བྱ་སྟེ་ [Type: State | Desc: "Indicates the state of being named rather than an active process" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative case; proper name of the Buddha's disciple; functions as direct addressee in the discourse; vocative-addressee in the sentence structure]
- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : of the Dharma [Genitive of `ཆོས་`: dharma, teaching, phenomenon; here indicating possession of the discourse by the Buddhist teachings; modifies རྣམ་གྲངས་]
- རྣམ་གྲངས་ : discourse [Noun; from `རྣམ་`: complete + `གྲངས་`: enumeration; refers to an exposition or systematic explanation of Buddhist doctrine; part of the compound referring to the text being named]
- འདིའི་ : this [Genitive of `འདི་`: this, demonstrative pronoun; specifies that it's this particular discourse being referenced; functions as a deictic marker]
- མིང་ : name [Noun; refers to the designation or title; central concept being elaborated upon with the specific name that follows]
- ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ : of wisdom [Genitive of `ཤེས་རབ་`: wisdom, prajñā; philosophical concept of transcendent understanding; modifies the following term as part of the title]
- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ : to the other shore [Terminative case of `ཕ་རོལ་`: other side, beyond; metaphorically refers to transcendence or reaching enlightenment; directional component of the title]
- ཕྱིན་པ་ : perfection [Noun from `ཕྱིན་`: to go, reach + nominalizer `པ་`; refers to complete mastery or transcendence; pāramitā in Sanskrit; forms the complete title "Perfection of Wisdom"]
- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative particle; connects the name to the verb indicating naming; functions as a relator between the title and the act of designation]
- བྱ་སྟེ་ : is called [Verbal phrase from `བྱ་`: to do, to call (future/modal form of བྱེད་) + continuative particle `སྟེ་`; indicates a state of being named rather than an active process; completes the statement about naming]

འདི་དེ་ལྟར་ཟུངས་ཤིག ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire instruction to hold the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཟུངས་ཤིག [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of holding or grasping (remembering) the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི [Type: Participant-Center | Desc: "The central object being referenced - the name of the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [Perfection of Wisdom teaching] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The implicit content of what 'this' refers to - the name of the Perfection of Wisdom teaching" | Implicit: "The content of what 'this' refers to"]
    ├── དེ་ལྟར [Type: Manner | Desc: "Specifies the manner in which the teaching should be held/remembered" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Subhuti] [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The implicit addressee (Subhuti) who is being instructed" | Implicit: "The addressee who is being instructed"]
    └── [Buddha] [Type: Participant-Speaker | Desc: "The implicit speaker (Buddha) who is giving the instruction" | Implicit: "The speaker who is giving the instruction"]
glossary:
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun, proximal; refers to the Perfection of Wisdom teaching being discussed; functions as the direct object/patient of the verb]
- དེ་ལྟར་ : in that way [Adverbial phrase; composed of དེ་ (that) + ལྟར་ (like, as); indicates the manner in which the teaching should be remembered or held; serves as a manner adverbial]
- ཟུངས་ : hold [Imperative form of འཛིན་པ་ (to hold, grasp, remember); here commanding the addressee to remember or maintain the teaching; functions as the main process/predicate of the sentence]
- ཤིག : ! [Imperative particle that emphasizes the command; strengthens the imperative force of ཟུངས་; indicates direct instruction from the Buddha to Subhuti]

དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་གང་གསུངས་པ་དེ་ཉིད་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་མེད་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "root" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Ground | Desc: "rhetorical question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར [Type: Relator | Desc: "question marker" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཞེ་ན། [Type: Function | Desc: "question ending" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་གང་གསུངས་པ་དེ་ཉིད་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་མེད་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Process | Desc: "answer explanation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant | Desc: "addressee" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་གང་གསུངས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "teaching process" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant | Desc: "teacher" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ [Type: Center | Desc: "teaching subject" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "modifier" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གང་གསུངས་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "relative clause" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ཉིད་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་མེད་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: State | Desc: "paradoxical statement" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་མེད་པའི [Type: Center | Desc: "negation of perfection" | Implicit: ""]
        └── all dharmas are empty [Type: State | Desc: "implicit ultimate meaning" | Implicit: "This is the implicit ultimate meaning that is not stated directly in the text but is understood in Buddhist philosophy - that the perfection of wisdom is empty of inherent existence"]
glossary:
- དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ : why is that [Interrogative phrase; combination of `དེ་` (that) and `ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་` (for what reason); functions as a rhetorical question marker initiating the discourse]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional particle marking the end of a question; derived from `ཞེས་` (quotative) + `ན་` (conditional); marks the completion of the rhetorical question structure]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative case; proper name of the Buddha's disciple being addressed; functions as the addressee of the explanation]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [Instrumental/agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་` (Thus-Gone One, epithet of Buddha); acts as the agent/teacher in this discourse]
- ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ : of wisdom [Genitive case of `ཤེས་རབ་` (wisdom, prajñā); modifies "perfection" to specify which perfection is being discussed]
- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་ : perfection [Nominalized form from `ཕ་རོལ་` (other shore) + `ཏུ་` (directional) + `ཕྱིན་པ་` (gone); refers to transcendent perfection or pāramitā; the subject being taught]
- གང་གསུངས་པ་ : which was taught [Relative clause marker `གང་` + past form of `གསུང་བ་` (to speak honorifically); relates the Tathagata's action to the perfection of wisdom]
- དེ་ཉིད་ : that very [Emphatic demonstrative; `དེ་` (that) + `ཉིད་` (very, itself); identifies the specific teaching being referenced]
- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་མེད་པའི་ : is not a perfection [Negation of `ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་` using `མེད་པ་` (non-existence) + genitive particle; expresses the paradoxical nature of perfection of wisdom]
- ཕྱིར་ཏེ། : because [Causal conjunction; `ཕྱིར་` (for the sake of, because) + `ཏེ་` (connective particle); indicates that what follows will explain the reason for the paradoxical statement]

དེས་ན་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་ཞེས་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "root" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "the concept being referenced" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཤེས་རབ [Type: Center | Desc: "the core concept being described" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "elaborates on how wisdom is perfected or transcended" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཞེས་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "the naming action" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "connecting to previous context" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [Buddha/Tathagata] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "the Buddha who designates this term, as indicated in the commentaries" | Implicit: "The Buddha who designates this term, as indicated in the commentaries"]
glossary:
- དེས་ : Therefore [Instrumental of `དེ་`: that; functions as a logical connector indicating a conclusion based on previous statements; part of the linker phrase connecting to previous context]
- ན་ : then [Conditional/temporal marker; here used to complete the logical connector `དེས་ན་`: "therefore, thus"; works with the instrumental to form a linking phrase]
- ཤེས་རབ་ : wisdom [Noun; prajñā in Sanskrit; the core concept being described in this passage; functions as the central subject of the compound term]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; connects `ཤེས་རབ་` with `ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ`; indicates possession or relationship]
- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ : to the other shore [Terminative case of `ཕ་རོལ་`: other side, far shore; metaphorically refers to transcendence or going beyond ordinary understanding]
- ཕྱིན་པ་ : gone/perfected [Past participle of `འགྲོ་བ་`: to go; in this context means "transcended" or "perfected"; completes the concept of prajñāpāramitā]
- ཞེས་ : thus/called [Quotative particle; introduces a designation or name; connects the concept to the naming process]
- བྱའོ : is called [Future of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do, make; with final particle `འོ་`; indicates the naming or designation action performed by the implied Buddha/Tathagata]
- ། ། : [End marks; indicate the conclusion of the statement]

རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the Buddha asking Subhuti to consider something" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The person being addressed and asked to consider something" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས [Type: Process | Desc: "The mental process of thinking or considering that Subhuti is being asked to engage in" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Interrogative expression that clarifies the nature of the thinking being requested, marking this as a question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Points to what follows in the text, functioning as an adverbial modifier rather than a direct object" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Buddha (implied speaker)] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implied speaker asking the question to Subhuti" | Implicit: "The Buddha who is asking the question to Subhuti"]
    └── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Interrogative expression that clarifies the nature of the thinking being requested, marking this as a question" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper noun; name of the Buddha's disciple who is the addressee; functions as the Recipient of the question in this scene]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; here functioning as an adverbial pointing to what follows rather than a direct object; indicates the content to be considered]
- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [Interrogative expression; literally "in what manner of thinking"; marks this utterance as a question; functions as an elaborator of the main verb]
- སེམས : think [Present tense verb; from the root `སེམས་པ་`: to think/consider; here indicates the mental process Subhuti is being asked to engage in; functions as the main Process in the scene]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་ཡོད་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene representing the question about existence of dharma taught by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཡོད [Type: Process | Desc: "The main predicate of existence that is being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྙམ་མམ [Type: Function | Desc: "Question particle functioning as an interrogative marker" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [addressee] [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Implicit addressee of the question (Subhuti)" | Implicit: "Implicit addressee of the question (Subhuti)"]
    ├── ཆོས་དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma being described and questioned about" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who taught the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གསུངས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of teaching/speaking performed by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    └── གང་ཡང [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Quantifier indicating 'any' dharma, associated with the question" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
# Tibetan Text Gloss

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Agentive/Instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "Thus-Gone One", Buddha; acting as the Agent who performed the teaching; functions as the source/origin of the dharma being discussed]

- གསུངས་པའི་ : taught [Past tense of `གསུང་`: to speak/teach honorifically + nominalizing particle འི་ connecting it to 'dharma'; describes the Process of teaching performed by the Tathagata; modifies the dharma that follows]

- ཆོས་ : dharma [Root word `ཆོས་`: dharma, teaching, phenomenon; the Patient/object that is taught by the Tathagata; central subject whose existence is being questioned]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun specifying the particular dharma; helps identify the specific teaching being referenced; modifies ཆོས་ to form the complete Patient]

- གང་ཡང་ : any whatsoever [Quantifier combining `གང་`: what/which + `ཡང་`: also/even; creates universal negation context; indicates the comprehensive scope of the question about existence]

- ཡོད་ : exists [Present tense of `ཡོད་`: to exist/be; functions as the main Process predicate that is being questioned; central to the ontological inquiry]

- སྙམ་མམ་ : do you think? [Quotative verb `སྙམ་`: to think + interrogative particle `འམ་`; creates the question format directed at an implicit addressee (Subhuti); marks the entire preceding statement as being questioned]

རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གང་གསུངས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མ་མཆིས་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The root scene representing Subhuti's response to the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent (Subhuti) performing the action of speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསོལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of Subhuti speaking/replying" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གང་གསུངས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མ་མཆིས་ལགས་སོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The scene representing the statement context" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Vocative/address form elaborating on the speech context" | Implicit: ""]

            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གང་གསུངས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration on what is being negated in the philosophical statement" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent (Tathagata) who spoke the dharmas" | Implicit: ""]

            └── དོན་དམ་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Qualification that the non-existence is in the ultimate sense" | Implicit: "This adverbial is implied from the context though not explicitly in the text"]

glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhuti [Agentive case of `རབ་འབྱོར་`: name of the Buddha's disciple; functions as the Agent who is speaking in this scene]

- གསོལ་པ། : replied [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, speak, reply; here indicating Subhuti's act of speaking to the Buddha; functions as the main Process of this scene]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Bhagavan [Honorific address for the Buddha; functions as a vocative address or elaboration of the speech context]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "Thus-Gone One," epithet of the Buddha; functions as the Agent who spoke the dharmas]

- གང་ : which [Relative pronoun connecting to the dharmas that were spoken; part of the relative clause structure]

- གསུངས་པའི་ : spoken [Past tense of `གསུང་བ་`: to speak (honorific); with genitive particle connecting to "dharmas"; functions as the Process performed by the Tathagata]

- ཆོས་ : dharmas [Base form of `ཆོས་`: dharma, phenomena, teachings; the philosophical concept being discussed; object of the speaking]

- དེ་ : those [Demonstrative pronoun referring back to the dharmas mentioned; functions to specify the dharmas that were spoken]

- གང་ཡང་ : whatsoever [Emphatic construction: `གང་`: what + `ཡང་`: even, any; intensifies the negation that follows]

- མ་མཆིས་ : do not exist [Negation `མ་` + honorific verb `མཆིས་`: to exist; the philosophical assertion of non-existence; functions as the Process-Negation in the statement]

- ལགས་སོ། : it is [Polite assertive final particle `ལགས་` + `སོ`: final particle; completes the sentence with respectful affirmation]

བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the Buddha's speech and question" | Implicit: ""]

        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who is speaking (the Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]

    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The question posed by the Buddha to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient of the Buddha's question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི [Type: Reference | Desc: "Demonstrative pronoun referring to the forthcoming question about the nature of reality" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the nature of the question being asked, prompting reflection" | Implicit: ""]

    ├── [the nature of reality and emptiness] [Type: Implicit Participant-Focus | Desc: "The philosophical concept being queried - specifically, the nature of reality and emptiness" | Implicit: "The philosophical concept being queried"]

glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : The Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to the Buddha as one who has conquered afflictions, possesses all qualities, and transcended samsara; functions as the Agent of the speech act]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker indicating the agent of the action; marks the Buddha as the performer of the speech act]

- བཀའ་ : speech [Honorific term for 'word' or 'teaching'; specifically refers to the authoritative utterances of the Buddha; part of the Process of speaking]

- སྩལ་པ། : pronounced [Past tense of `སྩལ་བ་`: to give, bestow, pronounce (honorific); indicates the Buddha's act of speaking; functions as the main Process in the first scene]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of one of Buddha's chief disciples, known for understanding emptiness; functions as the Recipient of the Buddha's question]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers forward to the forthcoming question about the nature of reality; functions as a Reference connecting to the implicit philosophical concept]

- ཇི་ : what [Interrogative particle; introduces a question about manner or quality; part of the question construction]

- སྙམ་ : think [Present tense of `སྙམ་པ་`: to think, consider, reflect; indicates the cognitive process Subhuti is asked to engage in]

- དུ་ : as [Terminative particle; indicates the manner of thinking; connects the cognitive process with its content]

- སེམས། : do you think? [Present tense of `སེམས་པ་`: to think, ponder; the main Process of the second scene; forms a rhetorical question inviting Subhuti to reflect on the nature of reality and emptiness]

སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ན་སའི་རྡུལ་ཇི་སྙེད་ཡོད་པ་དེ་མང་བ་ཡིན་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The root scene containing the entire question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [speaker] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit speaker asking the question" | Implicit: "The implicit speaker asking the question"]
    ├── སྙམ་མམ [Type: Function | Desc: "Question marker indicating an interrogative sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ན་སའི་རྡུལ་ཇི་སྙེད་ཡོད་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The complete patient expression referring to the dust particles in the world system" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ན [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "The location where the dust particles exist" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སའི་རྡུལ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dust particles that are being quantified" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཇི་སྙེད [Type: Quantifier | Desc: "Quantifier describing the quantity of dust particles" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡོད་པ [Type: State | Desc: "Existential state describing that the particles exist" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་མང་བ་ཡིན [Type: State | Desc: "The state expressing that the particles are numerous" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Reference | Desc: "Referential element pointing back to the previously mentioned dust particles" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མང་བ་ཡིན [Type: State | Desc: "The state of being numerous" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [addressee] [Type: Implicit Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The implicit addressee to whom the question is directed (Subhuti)" | Implicit: "The implicit addressee to whom the question is directed (Subhuti)"]
glossary:
- སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་ : of the trichiliocosm [Genitive of `སྟོང་གསུམ་`: three thousand; specifically refers to a Buddhist cosmological concept of a large world system containing thousands of world systems; functions as a possessive modifier of the following noun]

- སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་ : great thousand [Genitive of `སྟོང་ཆེན་པོ་`: great thousand; part of the technical Buddhist cosmological term referring to the vast universe; modifies the following 'world system']

- འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ : of the world [Genitive of `འཇིག་རྟེན་`: world, cosmos; literally "the destructible basis"; modifies the following 'realm']

- ཁམས་ : realm [Root noun `ཁམས་`: realm, element, world system; refers to a Buddhist cosmological domain or sphere of existence; serves as the container location in the sentence]

- ན་ : in, within [Locative particle indicating location; connects the realm to what exists within it]

- སའི་ : of earth [Genitive of `ས་`: earth, ground, soil; modifies the following 'particles']

- རྡུལ་ : particles [Root noun `རྡུལ་`: dust, particle, atom; refers to the smallest units of matter; the main patient being quantified in the sentence]

- ཇི་སྙེད་ : however many [Interrogative quantifier; indicates an unspecified but presumably large quantity; modifies 'particles']

- ཡོད་པ་ : that exist [Nominalized existential verb `ཡོད་`: to exist, to be present; indicates the presence of the particles; part of the relative clause describing the particles]

- དེ་ : those [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the aforementioned particles; functions as the subject of the final clause]

- མང་བ་ : numerous [Nominalized adjective `མང་`: many, numerous; describes the quantity of particles as being a large number]

- ཡིན་ : are [Copula verb equating the subject with the predicate; connects 'those' with 'numerous']

- སྙམ་མམ : do you think? [Interrogative form of `སྙམ་`: to think, consider; indicates this is a question asking about the addressee's opinion; functions as the main question marker]

glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhuti [Ergative case of `རབ་འབྱོར་`: Subhuti, one of Buddha's chief disciples; here acting as the Agent/speaker in the utterance; ergative marker indicates he is performing the action of addressing]

- གསོལ་པ། : addressed [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, address, speak to; here indicates the speech act where Subhuti is addressing Buddha; functions as the main Process in this scene]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); here functioning as the Recipient of Subhuti's statement]

- སའི་ : earth's [Genitive case of `ས་`: earth, ground; connects 'earth' to 'particles'; part of the compound noun phrase that forms the central topic]

- རྡུལ་ : particles [Root form of `རྡུལ་`: particle, atom, dust; combined with 'earth's' to form the compound 'particles of earth' that is the main subject being discussed]

- དེ་ : those [Demonstrative pronoun; here referring specifically to the previously mentioned earth particles; helps to form the central concept being discussed]

- མང་ : many [Adjective meaning 'numerous, abundant'; quantifies the earth particles; forms part of the adverbial description]

- ལགས་སོ། ། : are [Honorific copula verb `ལགས་` with the final particle `སོ`; polite form of 'is/are' used when addressing Buddha; completes the statement about the abundance of earth particles]

glossary:
- བདེ་བར་ : happily [Adverbial of `བདེ་བ་`: happiness, bliss; here modifying the verb "gone" to indicate the manner of departure; functions as a modifier within the Participant structure]
- གཤེགས་པ་ : gone ones [Nominalization of `གཤེགས་`: to go, depart; honorific term referring to Buddhas who have "gone to bliss" or attained enlightenment; primary component of the Buddhist technical term for Tathagatas/Sugatas]
- མང་ : many [Adjective meaning numerous, abundant; serves as the main predicate in this sentence indicating the quantity of Buddhas; functions as the core of the Process structure]
- ལགས་སོ : are [Final verb `ལགས་` (honorific form of "to be") + sentence-final particle `སོ`; indicates an emphatic statement of existence with honorific connotation; marks the Ground element completing the declarative statement]

- དེ་ : Why [Demonstrative pronoun; functioning as an interrogative marker that begins the rhetorical question structure]
- ཅིའི་ : for what [Interrogative pronoun in genitive case; asks for the reason or purpose]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the sake of [Postpositional phrase marking purpose; indicates the explanation that follows]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional clause marker; marks rhetorical question, functions as a discourse marker introducing the explanation]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : The Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; functions as the main agent in the first part of the explanation]
- སའི་ : of earth [Genitive case of `ས་`: earth, ground; modifies རྡུལ་ (particles)]
- རྡུལ་ : particles [Noun; refers to physical particles, here representing conventional phenomena]
- གང་ : whatever [Relative pronoun; introducing a defining clause]
- ལགས་པ་ : are [Honorific copula in nominalizing form; links the subject with its description]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; referring back to the particles of earth mentioned]
- རྡུལ་ : particles [Noun; repeated to emphasize the subject of discussion]
- མ་མཆིས་པར་ : not existing [Negated honorific verb `མཆིས་` with adverbial marker; indicating the ultimate non-existence of particles]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Agentive/instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "thus-gone one," epithet of the Buddha; functions as the primary agent of the teaching]
- གསུངས་ : taught [Past tense verb; indicates the Buddha's authoritative explanation]
- པའི་ : that which is [Nominalizer with genitive particle; connects the Buddha's teaching to its purpose]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the sake of [Postpositional phrase marking purpose; indicates the reason for the teaching]
- སྟེ། : that is to say [Explanatory particle; concludes the explanation and implies further understanding]

དེས་ན་སའི་རྡུལ་ཞེས་བགྱིའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing the naming/defining of earth particles" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Causal connective linking previous reasoning to the current statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བགྱིའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of naming or designating" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སའི་རྡུལ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The term being defined or explained in this statement" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [exists conventionally but not ultimately] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit philosophical characterization of earth particles as conventionally existent but ultimately non-existent" | Implicit: "Philosophical context about the conventional but not ultimate existence of earth particles"]
    ├── ཞེས [Type: Relator | Desc: "Connects between the term being defined and the process of naming" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [Tathagata/Buddha] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit agent (Buddha/Tathagata) who makes this statement" | Implicit: "The speaker/agent is implied to be the Buddha or Tathagata"]
glossary:
- དེས་ན་ : therefore [Instrumental + ablative particle: combination of `དེས་` (by that) and `ན་` (then, if); causal connective linking previous reasoning to the current statement; functions as a Linker in the sentence structure]

- སའི་ : of earth [Genitive of `ས་`: earth, ground; indicates possessive relationship; part of the compound term being defined]

- རྡུལ་ : particles [From `རྡུལ་`: particle, atom, dust; the object being named or defined; functions as the Patient in the naming process; implicitly characterized as existing conventionally but not ultimately]

- ཞེས་ : thus called [Quotative particle: introduces quoted speech or designations; connects the term being defined with the act of naming; serves as a Relator in the sentence structure]

- བགྱིའོ : is designated [Honorific form of `བྱེད་པ་` (to do, make) + final particle `འོ་`; marks the statement as declarative; functions as the main Process in the sentence with an implicit agent (Buddha/Tathagata) who makes this designation]

འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་གང་ལགས་པ་དེ་དག་ཁམས་མ་མཆིས་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པའི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene expressing the Tathagata's teaching about worldly elements" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་གང་ལགས་པ་དེ་དག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The worldly elements that are the subject of the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས [Type: Center | Desc: "Core concept of worldly elements/realms" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གང་ལགས་པ་དེ་དག [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Qualifier specifying which worldly elements" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཁམས་མ་མཆིས་པར [Type: Result | Desc: "The result or characterization that the elements are actually non-elements" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Tathagata who taught this characterization" | Implicit: ""]
    └── གསུངས་པའི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Functional element connecting the teaching with its purpose" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསུངས་པའི་ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of teaching by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སླད་དུ་སྟེ། [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connector indicating causality or purpose" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ : of the world [Genitive of `འཇིག་རྟེན་`: world, worldly existence; functions as possessive modifier of the following term; part of the Patient that is the subject of the teaching]

- ཁམས་ : elements [Noun: `ཁམས་`: element, realm, constituent; refers to the fundamental constituents of phenomenal existence; core concept within the Patient participant]

- གང་ལགས་པ་ : which are [Relative clause marker; `གང་`: which + `ལགས་པ་`: honorific copula; introduces a qualification or specification of the worldly elements; functions as an Elaborator in the semantic structure]

- དེ་དག : those [Demonstrative plural: `དེ་`: that + `དག`: plural marker; specifies the previously mentioned worldly elements; completes the Patient participant phrase]

- ཁམས་ : elements [Noun: `ཁམས་`: element, realm; repetition of the earlier term to emphasize what is being negated; part of the Result phrase]

- མ་མཆིས་པར : are not [Negation of honorific existential verb; `མ་`: negative prefix + `མཆིས་པ`: honorific verb "to exist/be" + `པར`: complementizer; expresses the non-existence of the elements; constitutes the Result component]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས : by the Tathagata [Agentive/Instrumental of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Tathagata, "Thus-Gone One"; Agent who performs the teaching; represents the Buddha in his transcendent aspect]

- གསུངས་པའི་ : taught [Genitive of past form of `གསུང་བ་`: honorific "to speak, teach"; the Process performed by the Tathagata; connects the agent to the purpose]

- སླད་དུ་ : for the purpose of [Purposive conjunction: `སླད་དུ་`: for the sake of, for the purpose of; indicates the causal relationship or purpose; functions as a Connector]

- སྟེ། : that is to say [Explanatory particle marking the end of a clause; signals that what precedes explains or elaborates on what came before; part of the connector indicating causality]

དེས་ན་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ཞེས་བགྱིའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of the sentence explaining why something is called a world-system" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Relator | Desc: "Establishes causal relationship between implied absence of inherent existence and conventional designation" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [conventional vs. ultimate reality] [Type: State | Desc: "Represents the philosophical distinction between conventional designation and ultimate reality" | Implicit: "Represents the philosophical distinction between conventional designation and ultimate reality"]
    ├── [The Tathagata] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implied agent (Buddha/Tathagata) who has taught this concept" | Implicit: "The implied agent (Buddha/Tathagata) who has taught this concept"]
    ├── འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ [Type: Participant-Center | Desc: "The central concept being designated conventionally" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཞེས [Type: Function | Desc: "Function word indicating designation or naming" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བགྱིའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of conventionally designating or naming the world-system" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [conventionally] [Type: Implicit Adverbial | Desc: "Implied concept of 'ཐ་སྙད་དུ' (conventionally) which is implicit in the context" | Implicit: "Implied concept of 'ཐ་སྙད་དུ' (conventionally) which is implicit in the context"]
    └── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Sentence-final punctuation" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེས་ན : Therefore [Instrumental of `དེ་` + particle `ན`: because of that; here establishing a causal relationship between the implied absence of inherent existence and the conventional designation that follows; functions as a Relator connecting previous context to the current statement]

- འཇིག་རྟེན་ : world [Compound noun: `འཇིག་` (to perish) + `རྟེན་` (support); literally "that which is impermanent and supports beings"; the phenomenal world in Buddhist philosophy; serves as the core of the central concept being designated]

- གྱི་ : of [Genitive particle: connecting `འཇིག་རྟེན་` with `ཁམས་`; establishes possessive relationship between "world" and "realm/system"]

- ཁམས་ : realm/system [Noun: element, realm, dhātu; here referring to a cosmological system or realm of existence; together with "world" forms the central concept that is being conventionally designated]

- ཞེས་ : called/named [Quotative particle: marks the preceding term as being designated or named; here functioning to indicate that "world-system" is a conventional designation]

- བགྱིའོ : is designated [Honorific form of `བྱེད་པ་` (to do/make) + final particle `འོ་`; present tense honorific verb meaning "is called/named/designated"; represents the process of conventional naming with an implicit agent (Buddha/Tathagata)]

- ། : [Sentence-final punctuation mark indicating the end of the statement]

བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node containing the entire utterance" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing the Buddha's speech act" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who is speaking (the Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of speaking/proclaiming" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene describing the question posed to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The person being directly addressed with the question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི [Type: Addressee | Desc: "The content of the question being asked to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of thinking/considering" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [Subhuti] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit Participant-Agent: རབ་འབྱོར" | Implicit: "Implicit agent who is doing the thinking (Subhuti)"]
    └── ། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Punctuation mark connecting the discourse elements" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to the Buddha who has conquered defilements, possesses qualities, and transcended samsara; functions as the Agent of the speech act]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker indicating the doer of the action; connects the Buddha as the speaker to the act of speaking]

- བཀའ་ : speech [honorific term for words or teachings of the Buddha; formal proclamation with religious authority]

- སྩལ་པ : proclaimed [past tense of `སྩལ་བ་`: to give, bestow, proclaim (honorific); indicates the completed act of the Buddha speaking; functions as the main Process of the first scene]

- ། : [sentence-ending punctuation mark separating discourse elements]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name of the Buddha's disciple being addressed; positioned as the direct Addressee of the Buddha's question]

- འདི་ : this [demonstrative pronoun referring to what follows; indicates the content of the question being directed to Subhuti]

- ཇི་ : how [interrogative particle marking a question; introduces the inquiry about Subhuti's thoughts]

- སྙམ་ : think [present tense of `སྙམ་པ་`: to think, consider; the cognitive process being requested of Subhuti]

- དུ་ : as/that [nominalizing particle connecting the manner of thinking]

- སེམས : do you consider [present tense of `སེམས་པ་`: to think, consider; functions as the main Process of the question, with Subhuti as the implicit Agent who is being asked to contemplate]

- ། : [sentence-ending punctuation mark]

སྐྱེས་བུ་ཆེན་པོའི་མཚན་སུམ་ཅུ་རྩ་གཉིས་པོ་དེ་དག་གིས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་སུ་བལྟ་བར་བྱ་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the questioning of perception of the Tathagata through physical marks" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit addressee of the question (Subhuti, as mentioned in the commentaries)" | Implicit: "Implicit addressee inferred from context"]
    ├── བལྟ་བར་བྱ་ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of viewing or perceiving" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྙམ་མམ [Type: Process | Desc: "The questioning/interrogative aspect of the sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The entity being viewed/perceived" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སུ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relator indicating the resultative state of perception ('as a Tathagata')" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྐྱེས་བུ་ཆེན་པོའི་མཚན་སུམ་ཅུ་རྩ་གཉིས་པོ་དེ་དག་གིས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The instrumental means by which the Buddha might be perceived" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སུམ་ཅུ་རྩ་གཉིས [Type: Quantity | Desc: "The number of marks" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སྐྱེས་བུ་ཆེན་པོའི་མཚན [Type: Center | Desc: "The marks that are being counted" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit speaker/questioner (the Buddha asking Subhuti)" | Implicit: "Implicit speaker inferred from context"]
glossary:
- སྐྱེས་བུ་ : great being [Nominative of `སྐྱེས་བུ་`: person, being; refers to the Buddha or enlightened being, functioning as part of the possessor of the marks]
- ཆེན་པོའི་ : great [Genitive of `ཆེན་པོ་`: great, large; modifies 'being' and together forms 'mahāpuruṣa' or 'great being'; functions as qualifier]
- མཚན་ : marks [Nominative of `མཚན་`: mark, sign, characteristic; refers to the physical characteristics of a Buddha]
- སུམ་ཅུ་ : thirty [Cardinal number: thirty; quantifies the number of marks]
- རྩ་གཉིས་ : two [Cardinal compound: and two; completes the number thirty-two]
- པོ་ : the [Nominalizer: marks and makes the preceding term definite]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural: those specific ones; emphasizes the marks]
- གིས་ : by means of [Instrumental case marker: indicates the means by which an action is performed]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathāgata [Term for the Buddha: literally "Thus-Gone One"; the entity being perceived, functions as Patient in semantic structure]
- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : Arhat [Epithet of Buddha: "Foe-Destroyer"; one who has destroyed the enemy of afflictions]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [Adverbial form: perfectly, completely; modifies the completeness of enlightenment]
- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive of `རྫོགས་པ་`: to complete, perfect; describes the Buddha's enlightenment]
- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Nominative: Awakened One; the fully enlightened state]
- སུ་ : as [Relator particle: indicates resultative state of perception ('as a Buddha')]
- བལྟ་བར་ : to view [Verbal noun of `ལྟ་བ་`: to look, view; with terminative case particle `-ར་`; the act of perceiving]
- བྱ་ : should do [Future/imperative form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do; indicates obligation or necessity]
- སྙམ་ : think [Verb: to think, wonder; introduces the questioning aspect]
- མམ : or not? [Interrogative particle: makes the sentence a question; indicates doubt]

glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhuti [Ergative case of `རབ་འབྱོར་`: name of the Buddha's disciple; marks Subhuti as the agent/speaker of the utterance; functions as the main Participant in the speech act]

- གསོལ་པ། : replied [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, to speak (honorific); here indicating the speech act of Subhuti making a respectful reply; functions as the main Process in the first scene]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; vocative form addressing the Buddha directly; functions as the Addressee Participant in the content scene]

- དེ་ནི་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun `དེ་` with focus particle `ནི་`; refers back to a previous proposition or statement about viewing the Tathagata by marks; functions as a Center element connecting this statement to previous discourse]

- མ་ལགས་སོ། : is not [Negation marker `མ་` + honorific verb `ལགས་` (to be) + final particle `སོ`; expresses respectful negation or disagreement with the previously mentioned proposition; functions as the State element expressing Subhuti's disagreement]

དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། སྐྱེས་བུ་ཆེན་པོའི་མཚན་སུམ་ཅུ་རྩ་གཉིས་གང་དག་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པ་དེ་དག་མཚན་མ་མཆིས་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པའི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root" | Implicit: ""]

        ├── སྐྱེས་བུ་ཆེན་པོའི་མཚན་སུམ་ཅུ་རྩ་གཉིས་གང་དག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The thirty-two marks that are the topic of discussion" | Implicit: ""]

            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who did the speaking (the Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། : Why is that? [Rhetorical question formula; literal components: དེ་ (that), ཅི་ (what/why), སླད་དུ་ (for the purpose of), ཞེ་ན (if one asks); functions as a context-setting question introducing the explanation that follows]

- སྐྱེས་བུ་ཆེན་པོའི་ : of the Great Being [Genitive case of སྐྱེས་བུ་ཆེན་པོ་ (Great Being/mahāpuruṣa); possessive relation indicating the thirty-two marks belong to the Great Being/Buddha]

- མཚན་ : marks [Root noun: མཚན་ (sign, characteristic, mark); refers to the physical characteristics or signs of enlightenment; central concept in this passage]

- སུམ་ཅུ་རྩ་གཉིས་ : thirty-two [Cardinal number; quantifies the exact number of marks being discussed]

- གང་དག་ : which [Plural relative pronoun; connects the marks to the following clause]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathāgata [Agentive/instrumental case of དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ (Thus-Gone One/Buddha); identifies the agent who performed the action of speaking]

- གསུངས་པ་ : spoken [Past tense of གསུང་ (to speak, honorific); the process of teaching or explaining]

- དེ་དག་ : those [Plural demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the thirty-two marks]

- མཚན་མ་མཆིས་པར་ : as having no characteristics [Adverbial clause; མཚན་མ་ (characteristic, sign), མཆིས་པ་ (to exist, honorific), with negative prefix མ་ and terminative particle ར་; describes how the Buddha spoke of the marks - as lacking inherent nature]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathāgata [Agentive/instrumental case of དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ (Thus-Gone One/Buddha); identifies the agent who performed the action of speaking in the second instance]

- གསུངས་པའི་ : having spoken [Past tense of གསུང་ (to speak, honorific) with genitive particle འི་; indicates the reason or purpose]

- སླད་དུ་ : for the purpose of [Purposive conjunction; indicates that what follows is the reason or purpose]

- སྟེ། : that is to say [Final particle; marks the completion of the explanation, functioning as a connector]

            ├── མཚན [Type: Center | Desc: "The main term referring to the marks or signs" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྐྱེས་བུ་ཆེན་པོའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on whose marks they are" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སུམ་ཅུ་རྩ་གཉིས [Type: Quantifier | Desc: "Specifies the exact quantity of the marks" | Implicit: ""]
        └── རྣམས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Plural marker for the marks" | Implicit: ""]

        └── འོ [Type: Function | Desc: "The sentence-final particle indicating statement completion" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེས་ན་ : Therefore [Causal connector; instrumental case of `དེ་` (that) + connector `ན`; establishes logical consequence; functions as a Linker in the sentence structure]
- སྐྱེས་བུ་ : being [Noun; from `སྐྱེ་བ་`: to be born; here referring to an enlightened being or buddha; forms part of the compound term]
- ཆེན་པོའི་ : great [Genitive of `ཆེན་པོ་`: great, magnificent; modifies 'being' to create the compound 'great being' (mahāpuruṣa); possessive marker connecting to the following term]
- མཚན་ : marks [Noun; sign, characteristic, mark; referring specifically to the auspicious physical characteristics of a buddha; functions as the Center of the phrase]
- སུམ་ཅུ་ : thirty [Cardinal number; part of the compound numerical expression]
- རྩ་ : and [Conjunction; literally "root"; used in numerical compounds]
- གཉིས་ : two [Cardinal number; completes the numerical expression "thirty-two"]
- རྣམས་ : plural marker [Plural particle; marks the preceding noun phrase as plural, referring to all thirty-two marks collectively]
- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative particle; indicates conventional designation or naming]
- བགྱིའོ : are called [Honorific verb `བགྱི་བ་` (to do, to call) + final particle `འོ`; the process of conventional naming or designation; completes the sentence with formal/honorific tone]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས : The Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ`: to conquer, `ལྡན`: possessing, `འདས`: transcended; functions as the Agent or speaker in the discourse]

- སྐྱེས་པའམ : man or [Disjunctive form of `སྐྱེས་པ་`: man, male; with disjunctive particle `འམ`; part of the hypothetical Agent in the conditional statement]

- བུད་མེད : woman [Term for female; part of the hypothetical Agent in the conditional clause]

- གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག : anyone [Indefinite pronoun indicating 'whoever, anyone'; serves as part of the hypothetical Agent]

- གིས : by [Instrumental case marker indicating the agent; marks the hypothetical person performing the offering]

- ལུས : bodies [Noun meaning 'body, physical form'; functions as the Patient or object being offered in the scenario]

- གང་གཱའི : of the Ganges [Genitive case of `གང་གཱ`: Ganges river; part of the quantification expression]

- ཀླུང་གི : of the river [Genitive case of `ཀླུང་`: river; part of the quantification expression]

- བྱེ་མ་སྙེད : as many as sands [Comparative quantity expression: `བྱེ་མ`: sand, `སྙེད`: as many as; quantifies the immeasurable number of bodies]

- ཡོངས་སུ་གཏོང་བ : completely giving away [Verbal expression: `ཡོངས་སུ`: completely, `གཏོང་བ`: to give, offer; describes the Process of offering or sacrificing]

- བས : than [Comparative particle indicating 'compared to'; connects the first scenario (offering bodies) to the second (teaching dharma)]

- གང་གིས : whoever [Relative pronoun with instrumental case; refers to the Agent of the second scenario]

- ཆོས་ཀྱི : of the Dharma [Genitive case of `ཆོས`: Dharma, teaching; indicates the teaching belongs to Buddhist doctrine]

- རྣམ་གྲངས : discourse [Term for a 'discourse' or 'enumeration of teachings'; refers to the text being discussed]

- འདི་ལས : from this [Ablative case: `འདི`: this, `ལས`: from; indicates source]

- ཐ་ན : even [Adverb meaning 'even, at least'; emphasizes the minimal quantity that follows]

- ཚིག་བཞི་པའི : of four lines [Genitive form of `ཚིག་བཞི་པ`: four-line, quatrain; describes the minimal teaching]

- ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ : verse [Term for 'verse, stanza'; the form of teaching being referenced]

- ཙམ : merely [Restrictive particle meaning 'merely, just'; emphasizes the minimal nature of the teaching]

- བཟུང་སྟེ : having taken [Gerundive form of `འཛིན་`: to grasp, hold; with conjunction `སྟེ`; indicates the Process of memorizing or retaining]

- གཞན་དག་ལ : to others [Dative case: `གཞན་དག`: others, `ལ`: to; marks the Recipients of the teaching]

- ཡང་དག་པར : correctly [Adverbial phrase meaning 'correctly, properly'; describes how the teaching should be shared]

- བསྟན་ན : if teaches [Conditional form of `སྟོན་`: to show, teach; introduces the condition for the merit generation]

- དེ་ཉིད : that very person [Emphatic pronoun: `དེ`: that, `ཉིད`: self; refers back to the person teaching dharma]

- གཞི་དེ་ལས : than that basis [Comparative expression: `གཞི`: basis, foundation, `དེ`: that, `ལས`: from/than; refers to the comparison with the first scenario]

- བསོད་ནམས : merit [Buddhist concept of positive karmic energy or spiritual credit; the beneficial result being generated]

- ཆེས་མང་དུ : far more [Comparative expression: `ཆེས`: extremely, `མང་དུ`: abundantly; indicates superior quantity]

- གྲངས་མེད : innumerable [Compound adjective: `གྲངས`: number, `མེད`: without; describes the uncountable merit]

- དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ : immeasurable [Compound adjective: `དཔག་ཏུ`: to measure, `མེད་པ`: without; emphasizes limitless quantity]

- བསྐྱེད་དོ : will generate [Future/present tense of `སྐྱེད་`: to generate, produce; with final particle `དོ`; the Process of creating the superior merit]
