དེ་ནས་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ཆོས་ཀྱི་ཤུགས་ཀྱིས་མཆི་མ་ཕྱུང་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene depicting Subhūti shedding tears due to the power of Dharma" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ནས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Temporal adverbial indicating sequence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who performs the action of shedding tears" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མཆི་མ་ཕྱུང་སྟེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of shedding tears" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མཆི་མ [Type: Object-Patient | Desc: "The direct object affected by the process of shedding" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ངོ་མཚར་སྐྱེས་པ [Type: State-Result | Desc: "The emotional state that resulted from hearing the profound Dharma" | Implicit: "Emotional state implied but not explicitly stated"]
    ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་ཤུགས་ཀྱིས [Type: Cause | Desc: "The causal force behind Subhūti's emotional response" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The teachings or doctrine that has the power" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཤུགས [Type: State | Desc: "The power or force attributed to the Dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཆོས་ཟབ་མོ་ཐོས་པ [Type: Implicit | Desc: "Implicit content: the unstated but contextually important concept that the emotional response was due to hearing the profound teaching" | Implicit: "Content implied but not explicitly stated in the text"]
    └── སྟེ [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connector indicating continuation of narrative" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ནས་ : then [Temporal adverbial; `དེ་` (that) + `ནས་` (from, after); indicates sequential action or time transition; functions as a scene-setting temporal marker showing narrative progression]

- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : the venerable [Honorific title; compound of `ཚེ་` (life) + `དང་` (and) + `ལྡན་པ་` (possessing); literally "endowed with life" but used as a standard honorific title for respected Buddhist monastics; functions as part of the agent description]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Proper name; name of a prominent disciple of the Buddha known for his understanding of emptiness; acts as the primary agent in the sentence who performs the action]

- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : of the Dharma [Genitive case; `ཆོས་` (Dharma, teaching) + `ཀྱི་` (genitive particle); refers to the Buddha's teachings or spiritual truth; functions as the possessor in relation to "power"]

- ཤུགས་ཀྱིས་ : through the power [Instrumental case; `ཤུགས་` (power, force) + `ཀྱིས་` (instrumental particle); indicates the means or cause by which the action occurs; functions as the causal element triggering the emotional response]

- མཆི་མ་ : tears [Noun; refers to the liquid produced when crying; functions as the direct object that is affected by the action of "shedding"]

- ཕྱུང་སྟེ། : shed and... [Perfective verb + connector; `ཕྱུང་` (past tense of `འབྱིན་པ་`: to emit, produce, shed) + `སྟེ་` (continuative connector); indicates the action is completed but the narrative continues; implies an emotional state of being moved or astonished that follows from this action]

དེས་མཆི་མ་ཕྱིས་ནས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the sequential actions of wiping tears and speaking to Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent performing both actions (wiping tears and speaking)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཕྱིས [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of wiping tears" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མཆི་མ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The tears that were being wiped away, shed due to being moved by the profound teaching of emptiness" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [emotional context] [Type: Implicit | Desc: "Implicit emotional context indicating tears were shed due to being moved by the profound teaching of emptiness" | Implicit: "Emotional context indicating tears were shed due to being moved by the profound teaching of emptiness"]
    ├── གསོལ་ཏོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of speaking to the Buddha after wiping tears" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The Buddha as recipient of the speech" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Elaborator-Quote_Introducer | Desc: "Quote introducer that precedes what was actually said to the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [sequential relation] [Type: Sequential | Desc: "Sequential relationship between wiping tears and speaking to the Buddha" | Implicit: "Sequential relationship between wiping tears and speaking to the Buddha"]
        └── ནས [Type: Temporal | Desc: "Temporal connector indicating that speaking occurred after wiping tears" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེས་ : by him/her/that one [Ergative of `དེ་`: that; the agent performing both actions of wiping tears and speaking; functions as the main Agent in the scene]
- མཆི་མ་ : tears [Noun: tears; the object being wiped away; the Patient in the wiping action]
- ཕྱིས་ : wiped [Past tense of `འཕྱི་བ་`: to wipe; the main Process of the first action; indicates the physical action of removing tears]
- ནས་ : after [Temporal connector: after, having; indicates the sequential relationship between wiping tears and the subsequent speech]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (overcome), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); functions as the Recipient of the speech]
- ལ་ : to [Dative case marker: to, towards; marks the Buddha as the recipient of the address]
- འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་ : thus, as follows [Quote introducer: literally "these words"; introduces the direct speech that follows; functions as a Quote Introducer in the scene]
- གསོལ་ཏོ : spoke respectfully [Honorific past tense verb: to address, beseech; indicates the reverent speech directed to Buddha; the main Process of the second action]
- ། : [Shad: Tibetan punctuation mark indicating end of a clause]

ucca_formatted:
ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ཇི་སྙེད་པས་གསུངས་པ་ནི། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ངོ་མཚར་ལགས་སོ། །བདེ་བར་གཤེགས་པ་ངོ་མཚར་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing three scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ཇི་སྙེད་པས་གསུངས་པ་ནི། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing how the teaching was spoken by Tathagatas" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma discourse that is being taught" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས [Type: Center | Desc: "The center of the patient noun phrase" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Demonstrative specifying the particular discourse" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ཇི་སྙེད་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Tathagatas who taught the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ [Type: Center | Desc: "The center of the agent noun phrase" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཇི་སྙེད་པས [Type: Elaborator-Extent | Desc: "Quantifier indicating the extent or number of Tathagatas" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསུངས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of teaching/speaking the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ནི [Type: Linker | Desc: "Topic marker connecting to the following scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ངོ་མཚར་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene expressing wonder to the Bhagavan, related to scene 3" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The Buddha being addressed in exclamation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ངོ་མཚར་ལགས་སོ [Type: State | Desc: "The state of being wondrous" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [The teaching (dharma)] [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implicit object that is considered wondrous - the teaching" | Implicit: "The teaching of dharma that is being discussed"]
        └── [Subhuti] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit speaker - Subhuti - who is exclaiming about the wonderful teaching" | Implicit: "The speaker Subhuti who is making the exclamation"]
    └── བདེ་བར་གཤེགས་པ་ངོ་མཚར་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene expressing wonder to the Sugata, related to scene 2" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདེ་བར་གཤེགས་པ [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Another epithet of the Buddha being addressed in exclamation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ངོ་མཚར་ལགས་སོ [Type: State | Desc: "The state of being wondrous" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [The teaching (dharma)] [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implicit object that is considered wondrous - the teaching" | Implicit: "The teaching of dharma that is being discussed"]
        └── [Subhuti] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit speaker - Subhuti - who is exclaiming about the wonderful teaching" | Implicit: "The speaker Subhuti who is making the exclamation"]
glossary:
- ཆོས་ཀྱི་: of Dharma [Genitive case of `ཆོས་`: Dharma, teaching, phenomena, doctrine; specifically indicating the possession relationship between Dharma and enumeration; functions as possessive modifier within Patient role]
- རྣམ་གྲངས་: enumeration [From `རྣམ་གྲངས་`: enumeration, discourse, exposition; referring to a specific collection or exposition of teachings; center of the Patient noun phrase]
- འདི་: this [Demonstrative pronoun; specifying the particular discourse being referenced; functioning as an Elaborator for the Patient]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་: Tathāgata [Epithet of Buddha meaning "One who has thus gone"; the center of the Agent noun phrase; those who have attained enlightenment]
- ཇི་སྙེད་པས་: as many as, however many [Instrumental case of `ཇི་སྙེད་པ་`: quantifier indicating extent or number; indicates the collective action of multiple Tathāgatas; functions as Elaborator indicating extent]
- གསུངས་པ་: was spoken [Past tense of `གསུང་བ་`: to speak, teach, expound; specifically referring to Buddha's teachings; functions as the main Process of the first scene]
- ནི།: as for [Topic marker; connects the first statement to the following exclamations; functions as a Linker between scenes]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་: Bhagavān [Epithet of Buddha meaning "Blessed One" or "Lord"; addressed directly in exclamation; functions as Addressee in the second scene]
- ངོ་མཚར་: wonderful [From `ངོ་མཚར་བ་`: to be wonderful, marvelous, amazing; expresses astonishment at the teaching; forms part of the State description]
- ལགས་སོ།: it is [Honorific copula with final particle; expressing polite affirmation; completes the exclamatory sentence; part of the State description]
- བདེ་བར་གཤེགས་པ་: Sugata [Epithet of Buddha meaning "Well-Gone One"; addressed directly in second exclamation; functions as Addressee in the third scene]
- ངོ་མཚར་ལགས་སོ།: it is wonderful [Complete exclamatory phrase expressing wonder; honorific form used to show respect; forms the State description in the final scene]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་བདག་གིས་ཡེ་ཤེས་སྐྱེས་ཚུན་ཆད་བདག་གིས་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་སྔོན་ནམ་ཡང་མ་ཐོས་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of Subhuti addressing the Buddha about never having heard this teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Addressee | Desc: "The Buddha being addressed by Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བདག་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Subhuti as the speaker and agent who has not heard the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཡེ་ཤེས་སྐྱེས་ཚུན་ཆད [Type: Time | Desc: "Temporal expression indicating the time period since wisdom arose in Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྐྱེས [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of wisdom arising" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡེ་ཤེས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The wisdom that arose in Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མ་ཐོས [Type: Process | Desc: "The main process of not hearing the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལགས་སོ [Type: Function | Desc: "Honorific verb ending marking the statement" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་སྔོན་ནམ་ཡང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The teaching that has not been heard before" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Specifies which dharma teaching is being referred to" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྔོན [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Temporal adverbial indicating the past" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ནམ་ཡང [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Temporal adverbial modifying the process of hearing" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Vocative form of Buddha's epithet; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); here functions as the addressee of Subhuti's statement]

- བདག་གིས་ : I [Ergative case of `བདག་`, first-person honorific pronoun used by Subhuti referring to himself; functions as the agent/speaker in this statement]

- ཡེ་ཤེས་ : wisdom [Noun; primordial wisdom or transcendent knowledge; the object that arose within Subhuti]

- སྐྱེས་ : arose [Past tense of `སྐྱེ་` (to arise, be born); describing the process of wisdom manifesting]

- ཚུན་ཆད་ : since [Temporal marker indicating "from that point until now"; establishes the time frame from when wisdom arose until the present]

- བདག་གིས་ : I [Repeated ergative case of `བདག་`; reinforcing Subhuti as the subject who has not heard the teaching]

- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : Dharma's [Genitive case of `ཆོས་` (teaching, doctrine); modifies "enumeration" to indicate teachings of the Buddha]

- རྣམ་གྲངས་ : enumeration [Noun; refers to a specific category or exposition of teachings; part of the compound phrase referring to this particular discourse]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun indicating the specific teaching being discussed]

- སྔོན་ : before [Temporal adverb indicating past time; modifies the expression of never having heard]

- ནམ་ཡང་ : ever [Temporal adverbial; emphasizes "at no time"; intensifies the negation]

- མ་ : not [Negative prefix for the verb; negates the action of hearing]

- ཐོས་ : heard [Past tense of `ཐོས་པ་` (to hear); the main process being negated]

- ལགས་སོ : is [Honorific final particle functioning as copula; indicates respectful completion of statement to the Buddha]

དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མདོ་སྡེ་བཤད་པ་འདི་ལ་གང་དག་ཡང་དག་པར་འདུ་ཤེས་བསྐྱེད་པར་འགྱུར་བའི་སེམས་ཅན་དེ་དག་ནི་ངོ་མཚར་རབ་དང་ལྡན་པར་འགྱུར་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node containing the entire text" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "A rhetorical question serving as introduction" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The referent being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "The questioning process" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མདོ་སྡེ་བཤད་པ་འདི་ལ་གང་དག་ཡང་དག་པར་འདུ་ཤེས་བསྐྱེད་པར་འགྱུར་བའི་སེམས་ཅན་དེ་དག་ནི་ངོ་མཚར་རབ་དང་ལྡན་པར་འགྱུར་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The main explanation scene answering the question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་དེ་དག [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agents who generate correct perception and experience the result" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཡང་དག་པར་འདུ་ཤེས་བསྐྱེད་པར་འགྱུར་བའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The main process of generating correct perception without attachment to truth" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡང་དག་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner of perception (without attachment to truth)" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདུ་ཤེས་བསྐྱེད་པར་འགྱུར་བའི [Type: Center | Desc: "Core action of generating perception" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མདོ་སྡེ་བཤད་པ་འདི་ལ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "The context or condition in which the perception is generated" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The teacher of the sutra" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མདོ་སྡེ་བཤད་པ་འདི་ལ [Type: Center | Desc: "The sutra that is the object of perception" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ངོ་མཚར་རབ་དང་ལྡན་པར་འགྱུར་ལགས་སོ [Type: State | Desc: "The resulting state of those who generate correct perception" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ངོ་མཚར་རབ་དང་ལྡན་པར [Type: Center | Desc: "The quality of being endowed with wonder" | Implicit: ""]
                └── རབ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Intensifier describing the extent of wonder" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འགྱུར་ལགས་སོ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Grammatical marker indicating future tense and respectful speech" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun: that thing or matter; refers to the preceding discussion or claim; functions as Patient in the rhetorical question]
- ཅིའི་ : what [Interrogative pronoun in genitive case; from `ཅི་`: what; used to ask for the reason or purpose]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the purpose of [Postposition: for the sake of, for the purpose of; indicates purpose or reason]
- ཞེ་ན། : if asked [Conditional verbal particle: if one asks, if it is asked; introduces a rhetorical question]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་`: conquered (the defilements), `ལྡན་`: possessing (qualities), `འདས་`: transcended (samsara); functions as Agent who taught the sutra]
- མདོ་སྡེ་ : sutra [Noun: a discourse or teaching of the Buddha; from Sanskrit 'sūtra'; functions as the object being explained]
- བཤད་པ་ : explanation [Verbal noun from `བཤད་`: to explain, elucidate; refers to the Buddha's exposition of the teaching]
- འདི་ལ་ : regarding this [Demonstrative + la-case marker: concerning this particular explanation; marks the topic or object of perception]
- གང་དག་ : whoever [Relative pronoun: those who, whoever; introduces the category of beings referenced]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : correctly [Adverb: truly, properly, genuinely; modifies how the perception is generated, without attachment to a fixed truth]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Noun: conception, recognition, discrimination; one of the five skandhas; the mental faculty that recognizes characteristics of phenomena]
- བསྐྱེད་པར་ : generate [Verb in purposive form: to produce, give rise to; describes the action of creating the correct perception]
- འགྱུར་བའི་ : will become [Future tense verb + genitive particle: will transform into; connects the agents to their action of generating perception]
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Noun: living creatures with consciousness; all beings in samsara capable of experiencing suffering and enlightenment; functions as the main Agent]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural: those specific ones; refers back to the beings who generate correct perception]
- ནི་ : as for [Topic marker: highlighting or emphasizing what follows; marks the topic of the sentence]
- ངོ་མཚར་ : wonder [Noun: amazement, marvel; extraordinary quality or state; describes the resulting state of the beings]
- རབ་ : supreme [Intensifier: extremely, supremely, most; modifies the extent of wonder the beings will possess]
- དང་ : and [Conjunction: connects 'wonder' with 'possessing']
- ལྡན་པར་ : endowed with [Verbal adjective: possessing, having; describes the state of having wonder]
- འགྱུར་ : will become [Future tense verb: will transform into; indicates the future resulting state]
- ལགས་སོ། ། : it is [Honorific final verb + sentence-ending particle: respectfully stating a fact; polite assertion marker used when addressing someone of higher status]

    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question scene asking for an explanation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The thing being questioned about" | Implicit: ""]

                    └── འདུ་ཤེས་པ་གང་ལགས་པ་དེ་ཉིད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The perception that is being defined" | Implicit: ""]

                        └── [for transcending conceptual thinking] [Type: Purpose | Desc: "Implicit purpose of non-perception: to transcend conceptual thinking and attachment to phenomena" | Implicit: "Implicit purpose of non-perception: to transcend conceptual thinking and attachment to phenomena"]
                ├── སླད་དུ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relates the purpose of the explanation about perception and non-perception" | Implicit: ""]

        ├── འདུ་ཤེས་མ་མཆིས་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration explaining the paradoxical nature of true perception" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདུ་ཤེས་མ་མཆིས་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The state of having no perception or conceptualization" | Implicit: ""]

        └── སྟེ [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connects the explanation to the broader philosophical context" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to "the thing being questioned about" in the upcoming explanation; functions as Patient in the question scene]
- ཅིའི་ : why [Interrogative pronoun in genitive case; from `ཅི་`: what/why; introduces the reason or purpose being questioned]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the sake of, because of [Purposive particle; indicates the questioning is about purpose or reason; part of the questioning process]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional questioning marker; from `ཞེས་`: thus + `ན་`: if; concludes the rhetorical question formula]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; from `བཅོམ་`: conquered + `ལྡན་`: possessing + `འདས་`: transcended; functions as the Agent who defines true perception]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : truly, correctly [Adverbial qualifier from `ཡང་དག་པ་`: authentic, genuine, correct; qualifies how the perception takes place; serves as Elaborator to the perception process]
- འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ : perception [Verbal noun from `འདུ་ཤེས་`: to perceive, conceptualize; the cognitive process being discussed; forms part of the Patient in the philosophical explanation]
- གང་ : which, whatever [Relative pronoun; connects the concept of perception to its qualification; part of the complex nominal phrase defining perception]
- ལགས་པ་ : is [Honorific copula in nominalizing form; formal equivalent of `ཡིན་པ་`; connects the concept to its definition]
- དེ་ཉིད་ : that very [Emphatic demonstrative; `དེ་`: that + `ཉིད་`: self/very; specifically identifies the perception being discussed as the object of explanation]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Noun referring to the conceptual faculty; here used in contrast to its absence; functions as part of the Patient in the paradoxical explanation]
- མ་མཆིས་པའི་ : non-existence of [Negated honorific verb `མཆིས་`: to exist + genitive marker; the paradoxical absence of perception; forms the core of the philosophical point being made]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the purpose of [Purposive marker; indicates the philosophical reason for the paradox of perception and non-perception; functions as a Relator]
- སྟེ། : that is to say [Explanatory marker; connects this explanation to the broader philosophical context; acts as a Connector indicating further elaboration follows]

དེས་ན་ཡང་དག་པར་འདུ་ཤེས་ཞེས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire statement about the Tathagata's teaching on correct perception" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Discourse connector linking this statement to prior context" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent performing the action of speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསུངས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main verbal process of speaking or teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡང་དག་པར་འདུ་ཤེས་ཞེས [Type: Content | Desc: "The content of what was spoken by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [which is itself non-perception] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration that correct perception is paradoxically a non-perception or transcends ordinary conceptualization" | Implicit: "Elaboration that correct perception is paradoxically a non-perception or transcends ordinary conceptualization"]
    └── ཡང་དག་པར་འདུ་ཤེས་ཞེས [Type: Content | Desc: "The content of what was spoken by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [which is itself non-perception] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration that correct perception is paradoxically a non-perception or transcends ordinary conceptualization" | Implicit: "Elaboration that correct perception is paradoxically a non-perception or transcends ordinary conceptualization"]
glossary:
- དེས་ན་ : Therefore [Instrumental + locative particles: from `དེ་` (that) + -ས (instrumental) + -ན (locative); functions as discourse connector linking this statement to prior context]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly/correctly [Terminative case (-ར) of `ཡང་དག་པ`: genuine, authentic, correct; adverbial modifier indicating the manner of perception]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Noun: from `འདུ་` (to gather) + `ཤེས་` (to know); refers to mental perception or cognition; the object being discussed]
- ཞེས་ : thus/called [Quotative particle: marks the preceding content as what was taught; introducing what the Tathagata said]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [Instrumental case (-ས) of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ`: "thus-gone one", epithet of Buddha; functions as the agent performing the action of speaking]
- གསུངས་སོ : proclaimed [Past tense of `གསུང་` (to speak honorifically) + final particle སོ; main verbal process of teaching or proclaiming]
- ། : [Sentence-ending mark]

བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་བདག་ནི་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་བཤད་པ་ལ་རྟོག་ཅིང་མོས་པ་ནི། བདག་ལ་ངོ་མཚར་མ་ལགས་ཀྱི། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The complete utterance expressing the speaker's attitude toward understanding the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The Buddha being directly addressed by the speaker in vocative case" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བདག [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker who is contemplating and having faith in the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་བཤད་པ་ལ་རྟོག་ཅིང་མོས་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The scene describing the speaker's understanding of and faith in the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་བཤད་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The teaching that is the object of contemplation and faith" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི [Type: Center | Desc: "The core referent of the teaching being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བཤད་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of the teaching being explained" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relational marker connecting the teaching to the contemplation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རྟོག་ཅིང [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of contemplating or analyzing the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མོས་པ [Type: State | Desc: "The state of having faith in or being devoted to the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བདག་ལ་ངོ་མཚར་མ་ལགས་ཀྱི [Type: Scene | Desc: "The scene expressing that the speaker does not find their understanding amazing, in contrast to future beings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདག་ལ [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The speaker as experiencer of the non-amazement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ངོ་མཚར་མ་ལགས [Type: State | Desc: "The state of not being amazing or surprising" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཀྱི [Type: Function | Desc: "A connective particle suggesting contrast with an implied future statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [future beings who will understand] [Type: Implicit Future Beings | Desc: "Implicit reference to future beings who will understand the teaching despite difficulties" | Implicit: "Implied reference to future beings who will understand the teaching despite difficulties"]
        └── [contrast with future beings' understanding] [Type: Contrast-Future | Desc: "Implicit contrast between the speaker's understanding and the more difficult understanding of future beings" | Implicit: "Implied contrast between the speaker's understanding and the more difficult understanding of future beings"]
    ├── ནི [Type: Function-Focus Marker | Desc: "A topic marker emphasizing the speaker in this context" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Vocative form addressing the Buddha; honorific term composed of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); direct addressee in the utterance]
- བདག་ : I [First person singular pronoun; the speaker identifying themselves; functions as the Agent who is contemplating the teaching]
- ནི་ : as for [Topic marker; emphasizing the speaker as the main subject of discussion; establishes contrast with implied future beings]
- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : of the Dharma [Genitive case of `ཆོས་` (Dharma, teaching); modifies `རྣམ་གྲངས་`; indicates the teaching belongs to the Buddhist doctrine]
- རྣམ་གྲངས་ : exposition [Noun meaning enumeration, classification, or exposition; refers to a systematic explanation of doctrine; part of the compound object being contemplated]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies the particular teaching being referenced; indicates immediacy]
- བཤད་པ་ : explained [Nominalizer of `བཤད་` (to explain); refers to the teaching being expounded; functions as Process in the semantic structure]
- ལ་ : regarding [Dative-locative particle; connects the teaching to the acts of contemplation and faith; serves as a Relator]
- རྟོག་ཅིང་ : contemplating and [Continuative form of `རྟོག་པ་` (to analyze, investigate); indicates the cognitive process of analyzing the teaching; connected to the next verb]
- མོས་པ་ : having faith [Nominalizer of `མོས་པ་` (to have faith, be devoted to); describes the speaker's devotional attitude toward the teaching; represents a State]
- ནི་ : indeed [Focus particle; emphasizes the entire preceding clause about contemplation and faith]
- བདག་ : me [First person singular pronoun; repetition identifies the speaker again; functions as Experiencer of the non-amazement]
- ལ་ : to [Dative-locative particle; indicates the speaker is the recipient of the experience]
- ངོ་མཚར་ : amazing [Noun meaning wonder, amazement; object of negation]
- མ་ལགས་ : is not [Negative honorific form of the existential verb; negates the amazement; indicates respect while speaking to the Buddha]
- ཀྱི་ : but [Connective particle suggesting contrast; introduces an implied contrast with future beings who will understand despite difficulties]

        ├── སླད་མའི་ཚེ [Type: Ground | Desc: "The future time period when the described events will occur." | Implicit: ""]

    ├── སེམས་ཅན་གང་དག་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ལེན་པ་དང༌། འབྲི་བ་དང༌། འཛིན་པ་དང༌། འཆང་བ་དང༌། ཀློག་པ་དང༌། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ་དེ་དག [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agents who perform the various actions related to the Dharma discourse." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་གང་དག [Type: Center | Desc: "The core referent - sentient beings who engage with the Dharma." | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ལེན་པ་དང༌། འབྲི་བ་དང༌། འཛིན་པ་དང༌། འཆང་བ་དང༌། ཀློག་པ་དང༌། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "A set of related actions performed by the sentient beings regarding the Dharma discourse." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object that is being received, written, held, etc. - the Dharma discourse." | Implicit: ""]

    └── ནི [Type: Connector | Desc: "A topic marker connecting the subject to the predicate." | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས : Blessed One [honorific title for the Buddha; literally "one who has conquered (བཅོམ) and possesses (ལྡན) transcendence (འདས)"; functions as the direct addressee in this statement]

- སླད་མའི་ : future [genitive form of སླད་མ (later, future); modifies "time" and "era"; indicates the temporal setting when future events will occur]

- ཚེ : time [temporal noun referring to a future period; functions as part of the temporal adverbial phrase that sets the scene]

- སླད་མའི་ : future [second occurrence, genitive form; modifies "era" specifically]

- དུས : era [temporal noun referring to a specific time period; forms part of the temporal setting]

- ལྔ་བརྒྱའི་ : of five hundred [genitive form of ལྔ་བརྒྱ (five hundred); specifies the duration of the era; refers to the traditional Buddhist timeframe]

- ཐ་མ་ : final period [refers to the end period of the five hundred years; specifically indicates the era of dharma decline]

- ལ : in/during [locative particle marking time; completes the temporal adverbial phrase]

- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [refers to conscious beings capable of engaging with the Dharma; functions as the main agent of the sentence]

- གང་དག : those who [relative pronoun identifying specific beings; connects sentient beings to their actions]

- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : Dharma's [genitive form of ཆོས་ (Dharma, teachings); modifies "discourse"; indicates the teachings belong to the Buddhist doctrine]

- རྣམ་གྲངས་ : discourse [literally "enumeration"; refers to a specific systematic exposition of the Dharma; functions as the patient/object being acted upon]

- འདི : this [demonstrative pronoun; specifies the particular discourse being referenced; indicates immediacy]

- ལེན་པ་ : receive [verbal noun from ལེན་པ (to take, receive); first in a series of actions performed in relation to the Dharma text]

- དང༌ : and [conjunction linking parallel actions; creates a list structure of related activities]

- འབྲི་བ་ : write down [verbal noun from འབྲི་བ (to write); describes the action of transcribing the Dharma discourse]

- དང༌ : and [conjunction linking parallel actions]

- འཛིན་པ་ : hold/maintain [verbal noun from འཛིན་པ (to hold, grasp); refers to mentally retaining the teachings]

- དང༌ : and [conjunction linking parallel actions]

- འཆང་བ་ : keep/preserve [verbal noun from འཆང་བ (to possess, maintain); indicates safeguarding the physical text or teachings]

- དང༌ : and [conjunction linking parallel actions]

- ཀློག་པ་ : read [verbal noun from ཀློག་པ (to read); describes the action of reading the text]

- དང༌ : and [conjunction linking parallel actions]

- ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་ : completely [adverbial form of ཀུན་ཆུབ་པ (complete, thorough); modifies the following verb]

- བྱེད་པ་ : master/comprehend [verbal noun from བྱེད་པ (to do, make); here indicates fully comprehending the Dharma discourse]

- དེ་དག : those [demonstrative pronoun referring back to the sentient beings mentioned earlier; functions as the topic of the concluding statement]

- ནི : [topic marker highlighting the subject; connects the doers to their resultant state]

- ངོ་མཚར་ : wonder/marvel [noun referring to an extraordinary quality; describes the resultant state of the practitioners]

- རབ་ : supreme [intensive modifier; emphasizes the exceptional degree of wonder]

- དང་ : with [conjunction indicating possession of a quality]

- ལྡན་པར་ : endowed with [verbal noun from ལྡན་པ (to possess); indicates the state of having the quality of wonder]

- འགྱུར་ : will become [future tense verb; indicates the transformation that will occur]

- ལགས་སོ : is/are [polite assertive verb; final particle indicating respect and certainty; concludes the statement]

ཡང་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་དག་ནི་བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་པར་མི་འགྱུར་ཞིང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The root scene representing the entire statement about future practitioners not developing conception of self" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཡང་ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Discourse connector linking this statement to previous context" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker or addressee in this context" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་དག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Refers specifically to future practitioners who will study these teachings" | Implicit: "future practitioners"]
    ├── ནི [Type: Center | Desc: "Topic marker highlighting དེ་དག (those) as the topic of discussion" | Implicit: "topic marker"]
    └── བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་པར་མི་འགྱུར་ཞིང༌། [Type: State | Desc: "Represents the negative state of not having a conception of self rather than an active process" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདག་ཏུ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Object of the conception, forming part of the conceptual unit 'conception of self'" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Center | Desc: "The center element of the conceptual unit 'conception of self'" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འཇུག་པར་མི་འགྱུར་ཞིང༌ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Negated modal expression indicating that the conception of self will not occur or arise" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཡང་ : Further [Continuative particle; connects this statement to previous context; functions as a discourse connector linking to earlier content]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Bhagavān [Honorific title for Buddha; literal meaning "Blessed One who has conquered (afflictions)"; here functioning as the addressee or speaker of the teaching]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural pronoun; refers specifically to future practitioners who will study these teachings; functions as the topic/patient of the sentence]
- ནི་ : indeed [Topic marker; highlights དེ་དག་ (those) as the main subject under discussion; delimits the topic]
- བདག་ཏུ་ : as self [Terminative case of བདག་ (self, ego, I); the object of misconception; indicates the content of the conception that is being negated]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : conception [Noun from འདུ་ (gather) + ཤེས་ (know); Sanskrit: saṃjñā; mental perception or labeling; the center element of the conceptual unit 'conception of self']
- འཇུག་པར་ : engaging in [Future/purposive form of འཇུག་པ་ (to enter, engage, flow); indicates the potential arising or occurrence of the conception]
- མི་འགྱུར་ : will not become [Negated future of འགྱུར་བ་ (to become, transform); indicates the negative state that the conception of self will not arise]
- ཞིང་ : and [Conjunction particle; connects this clause to what follows; indicates that more content follows this statement]

glossary:
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Terminative case with དུ་; from `སེམས་ཅན་`: conscious living entity; functions as the target/goal of perception in the first parallel scene]
- དུ་ : as [Terminative case marker; connects noun to verb indicating "perceiving as"]
- འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ : perception [Verbal noun from `འདུ་ཤེས་`: to perceive, conceptualize; the process of mentally designating or labeling phenomena]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction linking parallel items in a list; connects the three types of perception]
- སྲོག་ : life [Terminative case with ཏུ་; from `སྲོག་`: life-force, vitality; functions as the target/goal of perception in the second parallel scene]
- ཏུ་ : as [Terminative case marker; connects noun to verb indicating "perceiving as"]
- འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ : perception [Verbal noun from `འདུ་ཤེས་`: to perceive, conceptualize; the process of mentally designating or labeling phenomena]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction linking parallel items in a list; connects the three types of perception]
- གང་ཟག་ : person [Terminative case with ཏུ་; from `གང་ཟག་`: individual, person; functions as the target/goal of perception in the third parallel scene]
- ཏུ་ : as [Terminative case marker; connects noun to verb indicating "perceiving as"]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Verbal noun from `འདུ་ཤེས་`: to perceive, conceptualize; the process of mentally designating or labeling phenomena]
- འཇུག་པར་ : arising [Terminative case of `འཇུག་པ་`: to enter, engage, arise; here referring to the process of perceptions coming into being or manifesting]
- མི་ : not [Negation particle; negates the following verb]
- འགྱུར་ : will become [Future form of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform; indicates that the perceptions will not come into being]
- ལགས་སོ། : is, indeed [Polite sentence-final particle indicating a definitive statement; confirms the truth of the preceding statement with respectful emphasis]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་དང༌། སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་དང༌། སྲོག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་གང་ལགས་པ་དེ་ཉིད་འདུ་ཤེས་ཐམས་ཅད་དང་བྲལ་བའི་སླད་དུའོ།། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing the entire text" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of asking" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Questioning adverbial" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་དང༌། སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་དང༌། སྲོག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་གང་ལགས་པ་དེ་ཉིད་འདུ་ཤེས་ཐམས་ཅད་དང་བྲལ་བའི་སླད་དུའོ།། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Answer scene describing perceptions and freedom from perceptions" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Attributor | Desc: "Buddha as the source or attributor of the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་དང༌། སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་དང༌། སྲོག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་གང་ལགས་པ [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "List of different types of perceptions" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing perception of self" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── བདག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object of perception - self" | Implicit: ""]
                └── འདུ་ཤེས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of perception" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction linking perceptions" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing perception of sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object of perception - sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
                └── འདུ་ཤེས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of perception" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction linking perceptions" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྲོག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing perception of life" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── སྲོག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object of perception - life" | Implicit: ""]
                └── འདུ་ཤེས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of perception" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction linking perceptions" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing perception of personhood" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── གང་ཟག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object of perception - person" | Implicit: ""]
                └── འདུ་ཤེས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of perception" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གང་ལགས་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborating on the nature of perceptions" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ཉིད [Type: Center | Desc: "Referring to the previously mentioned perceptions" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདུ་ཤེས་ཐམས་ཅད་དང་བྲལ་བའི [Type: Scene | Desc: "State of being free from all perceptions" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འདུ་ཤེས་ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object from which one is free - all perceptions" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Linking perceptions to the state of freedom" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བྲལ་བའི [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of being free from perceptions" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སླད་དུའོ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Indicating the purpose or reason" | Implicit: ""]
    └──  [Type: Connector | Desc: "Implicit connector linking the question and answer" | Implicit: "Connection between question and answer"]
glossary:
- དེ་ : Why [Demonstrative pronoun; functions as a reference to the preceding statement that needs explanation]
- ཅིའི་ : for what [Interrogative pronoun in genitive case (`ཅི་`); forms part of the rhetorical question marker]
- སླད་དུ་ : purpose, reason [Purposive case marker; indicates 'for the purpose of what' in this context]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional form of `ཞེ་` (to say); introduces a rhetorical question and signals an explanation will follow]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Epithet for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), `འདས་` (transcended); functions as Participant-Attributor in the semantic structure]
- བདག་ཏུ་ : as a self [Terminative case of `བདག་` (self); indicates perceiving something "as having selfhood"; functions as Patient in the perception scene]
- འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ : perception [Verbal noun from `འདུ་ཤེས་` (to perceive, recognize); describes the cognitive process of imputing existence]
- དང༌། : and [Conjunction; connects items in the list of perceptions]
- སེམས་ཅན་དུ་ : as sentient beings [Terminative case of `སེམས་ཅན་` (sentient being); functions as Patient in the perception scene]
- འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ : perception [Verbal noun from `འདུ་ཤེས་` (to perceive, recognize); describes the act of recognizing something as a sentient being]
- དང༌། : and [Conjunction; connects items in the list of perceptions]
- སྲོག་ཏུ་ : as life [Terminative case of `སྲོག་` (life, vitality); functions as Patient in the perception scene]
- འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ : perception [Verbal noun from `འདུ་ཤེས་` (to perceive, recognize); describes the act of recognizing something as having life]
- དང༌། : and [Conjunction; connects items in the list of perceptions]
- གང་ཟག་ཏུ་ : as a person [Terminative case of `གང་ཟག་` (person, individual); functions as Patient in the perception scene]
- འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ : perception [Verbal noun from `འདུ་ཤེས་` (to perceive, recognize); describes the act of recognizing something as a person]
- གང་ : which [Relative pronoun; refers to all previously mentioned types of perception]
- ལགས་པ་ : is [Honorific copula in verbal noun form; elaborates on the nature of the perceptions]
- དེ་ཉིད་ : that very [Emphatic demonstrative; refers back to the four types of perception mentioned]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perceptions [Noun; object from which one is freed]
- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Universal quantifier; indicates the totality of perceptions]
- དང་ : and [Conjunction; connects perceptions to the state of freedom]
- བྲལ་བའི་ : being free from [Verbal adjective from `བྲལ་` (to be separated, free from); indicates the state of freedom from all perceptions]
- སླད་དུའོ།། : is for the purpose of [Purposive case marker with final particle; concludes the sentence by stating the purpose]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། སངས་རྒྱས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་རྣམས་ནི་འདུ་ཤེས་ཐམས་ཅད་དང་བྲལ་བའི་སླད་དུའོ།། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root Scene" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question Scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Subject of question" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན [Type: Function | Desc: "Interrogative connector" | Implicit: ""]
    └── སངས་རྒྱས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་རྣམས་ནི་འདུ་ཤེས་ཐམས་ཅད་དང་བྲལ་བའི་སླད་དུའོ།། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Answer Scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སངས་རྒྱས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་རྣམས་ནི [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The ones who are free from conceptions" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདུ་ཤེས་ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "What the Buddhas are free from" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Qualifier of conceptions" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྲལ་བ [Type: Process | Desc: "The state of transcendence from conceptions" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དང [Type: Relator | Desc: "Connector" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; referring to a previously discussed point or teaching; functions as the subject or topic of the question]
- ཅིའི་ : why [Interrogative pronoun in genitive case; from `ཅི་`: what; used to form the interrogative "for what reason"; part of an interrogative construction]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the sake of [Postposition indicating purpose; "for the purpose of"; introduces the reason for something]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Final interrogative particle; marks a rhetorical question; functions as a discourse connector between the question and answer]
- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Noun; from `སངས་`: purified/cleared away + `རྒྱས་`: developed/expanded; refers to an enlightened being who has cleared away obscurations and developed wisdom]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Bhagavan [Epithet of Buddha; from `བཅོམ་`: conquered + `ལྡན་`: possessing + `འདས་`: transcended; "one who has conquered afflictions, possesses qualities, and transcended samsara"]
- རྣམས་ : plural marker [Nominal plural suffix; indicates multiple Buddhas or Bhagavans]
- ནི་ : as for [Topic marker; emphasizing the Buddhas as the subject being discussed; sets up contrast or focus]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : conceptualization [Noun; from `འདུ་`: to gather + `ཤེས་`: to know; technical term for "perception" or "conception"; one of the five aggregates]
- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Universal quantifier; "every" or "all without exception"; modifies conceptions to indicate their totality]
- དང་ : with [Conjunction; connecting the conceptions with the state of being free from them]
- བྲལ་བའི་ : being free from [Verbal noun in genitive case; from `བྲལ་`: to separate/free from; indicates the state of having transcended all conceptualizations]
- སླད་དུའོ།། : because [Final causal marker with sentence-ending particle; indicates the reason or purpose; provides the explanation for the question]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་པ་དང༌། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing parallel scenes connected by a linker" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་པ་དང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing someone speaking" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── Subhuti [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent - Subhuti | Desc: "The implicit speaker, identified as Subhuti from context and commentaries" | Implicit: "The implicit speaker, identified as Subhuti from context and commentaries"]
        ├── གསོལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of speaking/requesting" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Content | Desc: "Content referring to what was previously spoken" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དང༌། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connects the two scenes temporally and logically" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene describing the Buddha's response" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the agent/speaker" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient of the Buddha's speech" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of the Buddha speaking" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Introduces the content of the Buddha's speech" | Implicit: ""]
        └── after Subhuti's statement [Type: Implicit Time-Reference | Desc: "Implicit temporal reference indicating this happens after Subhuti spoke" | Implicit: "The temporal sequence indicating this happens after Subhuti spoke"]
glossary:
- དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་ : thus [Demonstrative pronoun + quotative marker; literally "like that said"; refers back to the previous statement made; functions as Content in the semantic structure]

- གསོལ་པ་ : requested/spoke [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, petition, speak respectfully; honorific speech verb indicating Subhuti's respectful address to the Buddha; functions as Process in the first scene]

- དང༌། : and then [Connective particle; serves as a temporal and logical linker between the two scenes; indicates the sequential relationship between Subhuti's speech and Buddha's response]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific epithet for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to one who has conquered passions, possesses qualities, and transcended suffering; functions as Agent in the second scene]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates Buddha as the agent/doer of the action; marks the subject of the transitive verb `བཀའ་སྩལ་`]

- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : venerable [Honorific title; literally "endowed with life"; conventional address for respected monks; functions as part of the description of the recipient]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; name of the disciple of Buddha who is the recipient of the teaching; functions as the Recipient in the second scene]

- ལ་ : to [Dative case marker; indicates Subhuti as the recipient of Buddha's speech]

- འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་ : thus [Demonstrative pronoun + quotative marker; literally "like this"; introduces the content of what Buddha is about to say; functions as Elaborator introducing Buddha's speech]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། : proclaimed [Past tense of `བཀའ་སྩལ་བ་`: to speak, proclaim (honorific); highest honorific speech verb reserved for Buddha or highest beings; the final `ཏོ` is a sentence-final particle indicating completion; functions as Process in the second scene]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ནོ། །དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ཏེ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing two parallel affirmation scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ནོ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First affirmation scene where Buddha addresses Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Addressee | Desc: "Subhuti who is being directly addressed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Center | Desc: "Deictic element referring to what was previously discussed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་ནོ [Type: Adverbial-Affirmation | Desc: "Affirmative expression indicating Buddha's agreement or confirmation" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [Buddha/Bhagavan] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha who is speaking and affirming, as indicated in the commentary" | Implicit: "The Buddha who is speaking and affirming, as indicated in the commentary"]
    └── དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second affirmation scene repeating the confirmation for emphasis" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Deictic-Reference | Desc: "Referential element pointing back to what was previously discussed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་ཏེ [Type: Adverbial-Affirmation | Desc: "Second affirmative expression, repeating the confirmation for emphasis" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [Buddha/Bhagavan] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha continuing to speak in the second affirmation" | Implicit: "The Buddha continuing to speak in the second affirmation"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper noun; vocative case; name of the disciple being directly addressed by the Buddha; functions as the Addressee in this discourse]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers deictically to what was previously discussed in the discourse; serves as a reference point in the Buddha's affirmation]

- དེ་བཞིན་ : thus, in that way [Adverbial phrase from `དེ་` (that) + `བཞིན་` (like, manner); indicates agreement or confirmation of what was previously stated]

- ནོ་ : is [Final particle marking assertion or declaration; completes the first affirmative statement]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; beginning the second affirmation; refers again to the previously discussed content]

- དེ་བཞིན་ : thus, in that way [Adverbial phrase repeating the confirmation for emphasis; maintains continuity with the first affirmation]

- ཏེ་ : indeed [Final particle indicating emphasis or elaboration; completes the second affirmative statement]

སེམས་ཅན་གང་དག་མདོ་སྡེ་འདི་བཤད་པ་ལ་མི་སྐྲག་ཅིང་མི་དངངས་ལ་ཀུན་ཏུ་དངངས་པར་མི་འགྱུར་བ་དེ་དག་ནི་ངོ་མཚར་རབ་དང་ལྡན་པར་འགྱུར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས་ཅན་གང་དག་མདོ་སྡེ་འདི་བཤད་པ་ལ་མི་སྐྲག་ཅིང་མི་དངངས་ལ་ཀུན་ཏུ་དངངས་པར་མི་འགྱུར་བ་དེ་དག་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing sentient beings who aren't frightened by the teachings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་གང་དག [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Agent who experiences the non-frightened state" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མདོ་སྡེ་འདི་བཤད་པ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the teaching of the sutra" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མདོ་སྡེ་འདི་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The sutra that is taught" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བཤད་པ་ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མི་སྐྲག་ཅིང་མི་དངངས་ལ་ཀུན་ཏུ་དངངས་པར་མི་འགྱུར་བ་ [Type: State | Desc: "Mental state of not being frightened in various ways" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མི་སྐྲག་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First aspect of the non-frightened state" | Implicit: ""]
                └── མི་སྐྲག་ [Type: State | Desc: "State of not being frightened" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཅིང་ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector between the first and second aspects" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མི་དངངས་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second aspect of the non-frightened state" | Implicit: ""]
                └── མི་དངངས་ [Type: State | Desc: "State of not being afraid" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཀུན་ཏུ་དངངས་པར་མི་འགྱུར་བ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Third aspect of the non-frightened state" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཀུན་ཏུ་ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial modifying the extent of terror" | Implicit: ""]
                └── དངངས་པར་མི་འགྱུར་བ་ [Type: State | Desc: "State of not becoming terrified" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་དག་ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Refers back to the described sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ངོ་མཚར་རབ་དང་ལྡན་པར་འགྱུར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the result of not being frightened by the teachings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ནི [Type: Relator | Desc: "Focus marker connecting the description to the statement about possessing wonder" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ངོ་མཚར་རབ་དང་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The wonder that is possessed" | Implicit: ""]
            └── རབ་ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Modifier indicating the high degree of wonder" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལྡན་པར་འགྱུར་ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of possessing wonder" | Implicit: ""]
        └── རོ། ། [Type: Connector | Desc: "Sentence-final particle indicating completion" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Noun; beings with consciousness who are subject to suffering in saṃsāra; functions as the Agent in this sentence]
- གང་དག : those who [Relative pronoun; indicates a specific subset of sentient beings being referenced; specifies the Agent]
- མདོ་སྡེ་ : sūtra [Noun; a scriptural text containing Buddhist teachings; functions as the Patient in the embedded scene]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative adjective; specifies the particular sūtra being referenced; part of the Patient]
- བཤད་པ་ : teaching [Verbal noun from √བཤད; 'to explain, teach'; refers to the exposition of the sūtra; functions as a Process]
- ལ་ : regarding [Locative/objective case marker; connects the sentient beings to their reaction toward the teaching]
- མི་སྐྲག་ : are not frightened [Negative prefix མི་ + √སྐྲག 'to be frightened'; describes the first aspect of their fearless mental state]
- ཅིང་ : and [Conjunction particle; connects the first and second aspects of the mental state]
- མི་དངངས་ : are not afraid [Negative prefix མི་ + √དངངས 'to be afraid'; describes the second aspect of their fearless mental state]
- ལ་ : and [Conjunction particle; connects to the third aspect]
- ཀུན་ཏུ་ : completely [Adverb; intensifier indicating the thoroughness or pervasiveness of the action; functions as an Adverbial modifier]
- དངངས་པར་ : terrified [√དངངས 'to be terrified' + nominalizer པར; the state of terror that is negated]
- མི་འགྱུར་བ་ : do not become [Negative prefix མི་ + √འགྱུར 'to become, change' + nominalizer བ; completes the third aspect of the fearless state]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the described sentient beings]
- ནི་ : indeed [Focus particle; highlights what follows as important]
- ངོ་མཚར་ : wonder [Noun; state of amazement or marvel; functions as the Patient in the result clause]
- རབ་ : great [Intensifier; modifies 'wonder' to indicate its exceptional quality]
- དང་ : with [Conjunction; connects the wonder to the state of possession]
- ལྡན་པར་ : possessed of [√ལྡན 'to possess' + nominalizer པར; indicates the state of having the quality of wonder]
- འགྱུར་རོ། : will become [√འགྱུར 'to become' + final particle རོ; indicates the resultant state; functions as the Process in the result clause]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་དམ་པ་འདི་ནི་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་ཏེ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Discourse justifying the supreme status of the perfection of wisdom teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Rhetorical question introducing the reason that follows" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The referent being questioned about" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Rhetorical device introducing the reason that follows" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར [Type: Interrogative | Desc: "Interrogative element asking for the reason" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "Process element indicating the act of questioning" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་དམ་པ་འདི་ནི་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Answer providing the reason for why the teaching is called supreme" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The addressee of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་དམ་པ་འདི་ནི [Type: Participant-Topic | Desc: "The topic of discussion rather than a patient receiving an action" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ [Type: Center | Desc: "The core concept being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དམ་པ་འདི་ནི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Qualifier-Supreme: emphasizes that this teaching is superior to all others" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit reference to all Buddhas who have taught this perfection of wisdom, not just the current speaker" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གསུངས་ཏེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of teaching or proclaiming" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the previously discussed teaching or concept; functions as the Patient/referent being questioned about]
- ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ : why [Interrogative phrase; combines `ཅི་` (what) + genitive particle `འི་` + `ཕྱིར་` (for the sake of); forms part of the rhetorical question formula introducing a reason]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional clause marker; from verb `ཟེར་` (to say); completes the rhetorical question formula "if one asks why that is so"]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; vocative case; the direct addressee/recipient of Buddha's teaching]
- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ : to the other shore [Locative phrase; `ཕ་རོལ་` (other side/shore) + directional marker `ཏུ་`; part of the technical term for "perfection"]
- ཕྱིན་པ་ : perfection [Nominalized verb; from `ཕྱིན་` (to go/reach); combined with previous term forms `ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་` (pāramitā, "perfection"); the central topic being discussed]
- དམ་པ་ : supreme [Adjective; qualifying the perfection of wisdom as highest or most excellent; emphasizes its superior status]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative; specifies this particular perfection of wisdom teaching]
- ནི་ : indeed [Topic marker; emphasizes the subject of the sentence]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Agentive/instrumental case; `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་` (Thus-Gone One, epithet of Buddha) + instrumental particle `ས་`; the agent who performed the teaching]
- གསུངས་ཏེ། : was taught [Past tense verb + connective particle; from `གསུང་` (honorific: to speak/teach); indicates the process of authoritative proclamation with `ཏེ་` linking to a continuation]

ucca_formatted:
ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་དམ་པ་གང་དག་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པ་དེ་སངས་རྒྱས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་ཚད་མེད་པ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས་ཀྱང་གསུངས་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The main scene that describes the teaching of the perfection of wisdom by both the Tathagata and innumerable Buddhas" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་དམ་པ་གང་དག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The teachings or perfections that are being taught" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who teaches the perfections" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསུངས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of teaching performed by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ [Type: Connector | Desc: "Demonstrative pronoun referring back to the perfections of wisdom mentioned earlier, connecting the two teaching events" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སངས་རྒྱས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་ཚད་མེད་པ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The second set of agents who also taught the perfections" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སངས་རྒྱས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Center | Desc: "The main referent - Buddhas" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Describes the Buddhas as innumerable" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཚད་མེད་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Further qualifies the Buddhas as immeasurable" | Implicit: ""]
        └── རྣམས་ཀྱིས [Type: Function | Desc: "Plural marker and instrumental case marker" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཀྱང་གསུངས་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Causal adverbial phrase indicating the reason for the teaching and the relationship between the two teaching events" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཀྱང [Type: Adverbial-Modifier | Desc: "Adverbial particle meaning 'also' or 'too' that emphasizes the Buddhas also taught the same perfection" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསུངས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of teaching performed by the innumerable Buddhas" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Causal adverbial indicating 'because' or 'for the reason that'" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [implicit: this explains why the perfection is supreme] [Type: Purpose | Desc: "Implicit purpose relation capturing that the overall statement explains why the perfection of wisdom is considered supreme (དམ་པ)" | Implicit: "This explains why the perfection of wisdom is considered supreme"]
glossary:
- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ : to the other shore [Terminative case marker `ཏུ` with `ཕ་རོལ`: the other side, far shore; refers to transcendental perfection, paramita; functions as part of the Patient/object of teaching]

- ཕྱིན་པ་ : perfection [Nominalized form of `ཕྱིན་`: to go, reach; here means "that which has gone beyond" (paramita); core component of the Patient/object in the sentence structure]

- དམ་པ་ : supreme [Adjective modifying `ཕྱིན་པ་`: holy, supreme, excellent; qualifies the perfections as being of the highest order]

- གང་དག : whichever [Relative pronoun: those which, whichever ones; connects to the perfections and sets up the relative clause]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས : by the Tathagata [Instrumental/agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ`: "thus-gone one"; Buddha epithet literally meaning "one who has gone in such a way"; functions as the first Agent in the sentence]

- གསུངས་པ : taught [Past tense of `གསུང་`: to speak, teach, proclaim (honorific); describes the action performed by the Tathagata; functions as the main Process in the first clause]

- དེ : those [Demonstrative pronoun referring back to the previously mentioned perfections; serves as a connector between the two clauses]

- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Compound of `སངས་`: purified, cleared away and `རྒྱས་`: developed, expanded; "awakened one"; first part of the second Agent]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Bhagavan [Epithet meaning "blessed one," "lord," or "conqueror"; compound of `བཅོམ་`: conquered, `ལྡན་`: possessing, and `འདས་`: transcended; honorific title for Buddha; second part of the Agent]

- དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་ : innumerable [Negated nominalization of `དཔག་`: to measure, fathom; literally "immeasurable"; elaborates on the quantity of Buddhas]

- ཚད་མེད་པ་ : immeasurable [Negated nominalization of `ཚད་`: measure, limit; further qualifies the Buddhas as beyond measure or limitless]

- རྣམས་ཀྱིས་ : by [Plural marker `རྣམས་` with instrumental/agentive case marker `ཀྱིས་`; marks the entire preceding phrase as the Agent performing the action]

- ཀྱང་ : also [Emphatic particle indicating "also" or "too"; emphasizes that the innumerable Buddhas taught the same perfections]

- གསུངས་པའི་ : having taught [Past tense of `གསུང་`: to speak, teach (honorific) with genitive particle `འི་`; connects the action to the reason]

- ཕྱིར་ཏེ། : because [Causal conjunction: `ཕྱིར་`: for the purpose of, because of; `ཏེ་`: sentence-final particle marking explanation; indicates that this statement provides the reason for an implied conclusion about the supreme nature of the perfections]

དེས་ན་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་དམ་པ་ཞེས་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene showing what is called the supreme perfection of wisdom" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Causal linker showing the reason why this teaching is called the supreme perfection of wisdom" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [This teaching/doctrine] [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implicit referent (this teaching/doctrine) that is being called the supreme perfection of wisdom" | Implicit: "The implicit referent (this teaching/doctrine) that is being called the supreme perfection of wisdom"]
    ├── ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་དམ་པ [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "What the teaching is being called or addressed as" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དམ་པ [Type: Elaborator-Attribute | Desc: "Attribute qualifying the perfection of wisdom as supreme" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཞེས་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of naming or designating" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེས་ན་: therefore [Ergative (དེ) + continuative particle (ན); causative connector meaning 'because of that', 'for that reason'; functions as a causal linker showing why this teaching is called supreme]

- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་: to the other shore [Terminative case (ཏུ) of ཕ་རོལ་ "other side/shore"; etymologically related to the Sanskrit pāramitā; indicates the transcendent nature of the wisdom being described]

- ཕྱིན་པ་: gone/reached [Perfect form of འགྲོ་བ་ "to go"; here meaning "having gone beyond" or "transcended"; forms part of the technical term for perfection of wisdom]

- དམ་པ་: supreme [Attributive adjective from དམ་པ་ "excellent, holy, supreme"; modifies ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་ as an elaborator-attribute indicating highest quality]

- ཞེས་: thus/called [Quotative particle indicating reported speech or designation; connects the designation to the verb]

- བྱའོ: is called [Future form of བྱེད་པ་ "to do/make" functioning as "to call/name"; with final particle འོ marking statement completion; functions as the main process of naming/designating]

ཡང་རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་བཟོད་པའི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་གང་ཡིན་པ་དེ་ཉིད་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་མེད་དོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire philosophical statement about perfection of patience" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཡང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Discourse connector linking this statement to previous context" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Addressee of the Buddha's teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as agent who realizes the perfection of patience" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་ཡིན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "Relational process identifying the referent of the philosophical statement" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བཟོད་པའི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The philosophical concept of perfection of patience" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [ultimately cannot be observed due to emptiness of the three spheres] [Type: Implicit Process | Desc: "Implicit philosophical concept of non-apprehension (མི་དམིགས་པ) where the three spheres of patience (doer, object, action) are ultimately unobservable" | Implicit: "ultimately cannot be observed due to emptiness of the three spheres"]
    ├── དེ་ཉིད [Type: Participant-Topic | Desc: "Refers to the topic under discussion - the perfection of patience" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་མེད་དོ [Type: Negation | Desc: "Negation of the existence of perfection at the ultimate level" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཡང་ : moreover [Adverb; functions as a discourse connector linking this statement to previous context]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper noun; name of the Buddha's disciple being addressed; functions as the recipient of the Buddha's teaching]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Instrumental of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ`; Buddha/Thus-Gone One; acting as the agent who realizes the perfection of patience]
- བཟོད་པའི་ : of patience [Genitive of `བཟོད་པ`; patience, tolerance, endurance; modifies the following term to create the compound "perfection of patience"]
- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ : to the other shore [Terminative case marker; literally "to the other side"; part of the term for "perfection/paramita"]
- ཕྱིན་པ་ : gone/perfection [Verbal noun of `ཕྱིན`; to go, reach; when combined with ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ forms "paramita" or "perfection"]
- གང་ཡིན་པ་ : that which is [Relative clause marker; `གང`= whatever, `ཡིན་པ`= is; establishes a relational process identifying the referent]
- དེ་ཉིད་ : that very [Emphatic demonstrative pronoun; `དེ` = that, `ཉིད` = itself; refers to the topic under discussion - the perfection of patience]
- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ : to the other shore [Terminative case marker; literally "to the other side"; part of the term for "perfection/paramita"]
- ཕྱིན་པ་ : perfection [Verbal noun of `ཕྱིན`; to go, reach; when combined with ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ forms "paramita" or "perfection"]
- མེད་དོ : does not exist [Negative existential verb + final particle; `མེད` = does not exist, `དོ` = sentence-final declarative particle; negates the existence of perfection at the ultimate level]
- ། : [Sentence-ending marker]
