དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་གང་གི་ཚེ་ཀ་ལིང་ཀའི་རྒྱལ་པོས། ངའི་ཡན་ལག་དང་ཉིང་ལག་རྣམས་བཅད་པར་གྱུར་པ་དེའི་ཚེ་ང་ལ་བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་སམ། སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་སམ། སྲོག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་སམ། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་ཀྱང་མ་བྱུང་ཞིང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the explanation about the absence of self-conception" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Rhetorical question introducing the explanation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of questioning" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The subject of the question" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་གང་གི་ཚེ་ཀ་ལིང་ཀའི་རྒྱལ་པོས། ངའི་ཡན་ལག་དང་ཉིང་ལག་རྣམས་བཅད་པར་གྱུར་པ་དེའི་ཚེ་ང་ལ་བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་སམ། སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་སམ། སྲོག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་སམ། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་ཀྱང་མ་བྱུང་ཞིང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The Buddha's explanation to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The disciple addressed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་གི་ཚེ་ཀ་ལིང་ཀའི་རྒྱལ་པོས། ངའི་ཡན་ལག་དང་ཉིང་ལག་རྣམས་བཅད་པར་གྱུར་པ་དེའི་ཚེ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Temporal frame describing when the Buddha's limbs were cut off" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གང་གི་ཚེ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Temporal adverbial marking the beginning of the temporal frame" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཀ་ལིང་ཀའི་རྒྱལ་པོས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who cut off the Buddha's limbs" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ངའི་ཡན་ལག་དང་ཉིང་ལག་རྣམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The Buddha's limbs that were cut off" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ངའི [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Possessive referring to the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བཅད་པར་གྱུར་པ [Type: State | Desc: "State of the limbs having been cut off rather than the active process" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེའི་ཚེ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Temporal adverbial marking the conclusion of the temporal frame" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ང་ལ་བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་སམ། སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་སམ། སྲོག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་སམ། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་ཀྱང་མ་བྱུང་ཞིང༌། [Type: State | Desc: "The Buddha's mental state of absence of self-conception" | Implicit: ""]
            ├──  [Type: Participant-implicit | Desc: "Implicit concept representing the absence of self-clinging during suffering" | Implicit: "Absence of Self-Conception"]
            ├── ང་ལ་བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་སམ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the absence of self-perception" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ང་ལ [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The experiencer (Buddha) who did not have the perception" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── བདག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The concept of self that was not perceived" | Implicit: ""]
                └── འདུ་ཤེས་སམ [Type: Process | Desc: "The cognitive process of perception that did not occur" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་སམ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the absence of perception as a sentient being" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The concept of sentient being that was not perceived" | Implicit: ""]
                └── འདུ་ཤེས་སམ [Type: Process | Desc: "The cognitive process of perception that did not occur" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྲོག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་སམ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the absence of perception as a life force" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── སྲོག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The concept of life force that was not perceived" | Implicit: ""]
                └── འདུ་ཤེས་སམ [Type: Process | Desc: "The cognitive process of perception that did not occur" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་ཀྱང་མ་བྱུང་ཞིང༌ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the absence of perception as a person" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── གང་ཟག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The concept of person that was not perceived" | Implicit: ""]
                └── འདུ་ཤེས་ཀྱང་མ་བྱུང་ཞིང [Type: Process | Desc: "The cognitive process of perception that did not occur, with emphasis (ཀྱང) and continuation marker (ཞིང)" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཞིང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction linking to the next clause (not shown in the current text)" | Implicit: ""]
        └──  [Type: Relator | Desc: "Temporal relation between 'when' and 'at that time'" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གང་གི་ཚེ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Temporal adverbial marking the beginning of the temporal frame" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེའི་ཚེ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Temporal adverbial marking the conclusion of the temporal frame" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [demonstrative pronoun; points to the previous statement or concept; functions as the subject of the rhetorical question]
- ཅིའི་ : for what [interrogative + genitive case; from `ཅི`: what; used to form the question "why"]
- ཕྱིར་ : reason [noun; for the sake of, because of; forms part of the rhetorical question structure]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [conditional form of `ཞེས`: to say, speak; marks a rhetorical question "why is that?"]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [name of Buddha's disciple; vocative case; the recipient addressed by the Buddha]
- གང་གི་ཚེ་ : when [temporal conjunction; literally "at which time"; marks the beginning of a temporal frame]
- ཀ་ལིང་ཀའི་ : of Kalinga [genitive case of `ཀ་ལིང་ཀ`: name of a kingdom; indicates possession or association]
- རྒྱལ་པོས། : by the king [instrumental case of `རྒྱལ་པོ`: king; identifies the agent who performed the cutting]
- ངའི་ : my [genitive case of `ང`: I; refers to the Buddha's possessive relation to the limbs]
- ཡན་ལག་ : limbs [noun; major limbs such as arms and legs]
- དང་ : and [conjunction; connects the two types of body parts]
- ཉིང་ལག་ : minor limbs [noun; smaller extremities like fingers and toes]
- རྣམས་ : plural marker [suffix indicating multiple items; applies to both types of limbs]
- བཅད་པར་ : were cut [past form of `གཅོད་པ`: to cut; with terminative particle `-པར་`; indicates the action done to the limbs]
- གྱུར་པ་ : became [past form of `འགྱུར་བ`: to become, transform; indicates the completion of the cutting]
- དེའི་ཚེ་ : at that time [temporal adverbial; `དེ`: that + genitive + `ཚེ`: time; concludes the temporal frame]
- ང་ལ་ : in me [dative/locative case of `ང`: I; indicates where the perceptions did or did not arise]
- བདག་ཏུ་ : as a self [terminative case of `བདག`: self; indicates the type of perception that did not arise]
- འདུ་ཤེས་སམ། : perception or [interrogative form of `འདུ་ཤེས`: perception, conception; with disjunctive particle `-སམ`]
- སེམས་ཅན་དུ་ : as a sentient being [terminative case of `སེམས་ཅན`: sentient being; another perception type that did not arise]
- འདུ་ཤེས་སམ། : perception or [repeated structure for parallel construction]
- སྲོག་ཏུ་ : as a life force [terminative case of `སྲོག`: life, life-force; another perception type that did not arise]
- འདུ་ཤེས་སམ། : perception or [repeated structure for parallel construction]
- གང་ཟག་ཏུ་ : as a person [terminative case of `གང་ཟག`: person; the final perception type that did not arise]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ཀྱང་ : perception even [noun + emphatic particle `ཀྱང`: even, also; emphasizes the absence of all types of self-perception]
- མ་བྱུང་ཞིང༌། : did not arise [negative prefix `མ་` + `བྱུང`: arose + continuative particle `ཞིང`; indicates the complete absence of self-perception with continuation to following clause]

ང་ལ་འདུ་ཤེས་ཅི་ཡང་མེད་ལ་འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་པར་གྱུར་པ་ཡང་མ་ཡིན་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ང་ལ [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The experiencer of the perception states" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདུ་ཤེས་ཅི་ཡང་མེད་ལ [Type: Process-Negation | Desc: "Negation of having any perception" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདུ་ཤེས་ཅི་ཡང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object of negation" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལ [Type: Linker-Contrastive | Desc: "Contrastive connector between the two negated concepts" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་པར་གྱུར་པ་ཡང་མ་ཡིན [Type: Process-Negation | Desc: "Negation of being without perception" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The state of non-perception that is being negated" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ [Type: Relator-Causal | Desc: "Causal connector indicating the reason for the preceding statements" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ། ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Punctuation marks" | Implicit: ""]
    └──  [Type: Contrast | Desc: "Contrast relation between the two philosophical positions being negated" | Implicit: "Contrast between two philosophical states"]
        ├── འདུ་ཤེས་ཅི་ཡང་མེད་ལ [Type: Process-Negation | Desc: "Negation of having any perception" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདུ་ཤེས་ཅི་ཡང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object of negation" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་པར་གྱུར་པ་ཡང་མ་ཡིན [Type: Process-Negation | Desc: "Negation of being without perception" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The state of non-perception that is being negated" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ང་ལ་ : for me [Dative of `ང་`: I, me; the experiencer in this philosophical statement; functions as the Experiencer of the perceptual states being discussed]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Noun: concept, perception, recognition; in Buddhist context refers to the mental faculty that recognizes and categorizes objects; the Patient that is subject to negation]
- ཅི་ཡང་ : anything whatsoever [Indefinite pronoun: anything at all; intensifies the negation; part of the first negated philosophical position]
- མེད་ : does not exist [Negative existential verb; negates the existence of any perception; forms the first negative assertion]
- ལ་ : and [Conjunction: functioning as a contrastive connector between two philosophical positions being negated]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Noun: concept, perception, recognition; repeated to introduce the second negated position]
- མེད་པར་ : without [Negative existential + nominalizer: the state of non-perception; forms the Patient of the second negated position]
- གྱུར་པ་ : becoming [Verb + nominalizer from `འགྱུར་`: to become, transform; indicates a state transformation]
- ཡང་ : also [Emphatic particle: also, even; emphasizes the second negation]
- མ་ཡིན་ : is not [Negative copula: negates the second philosophical position]
- པའི་ : [Nominalizer + genitive: connects the entire preceding statement to the reason marker]
- ཕྱིར་ : because [Causal marker: indicates that what preceded is the reason; functions as a Relator showing causality]
- རོ : [Final particle: marks the end of a statement with certainty; completes the causal assertion]
- ། ། : [Punctuation marks: indicate the end of the sentence]

དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་གལ་ཏེ་དེའི་ཚེ་ང་ལ་བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་བྱུང་ན། དེའི་ཚེ་གནོད་སེམས་ཀྱི་འདུ་ཤེས་ཀྱང་འབྱུང་ལ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing the entire text" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The subject being questioned about" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "The questioning process" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གལ་ཏེ་དེའི་ཚེ་ང་ལ་བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་བྱུང་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Conditional scene about self-conception" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The addressee of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གལ་ཏེ [Type: Connector | Desc: "Conditional connector starting the 'if' clause" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེའི་ཚེ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Temporal modifier for when the conception might have occurred" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ང་ལ [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The one experiencing the conception" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object of conception (a self)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདུ་ཤེས [Type: State | Desc: "The mental state of conceiving" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བྱུང་ན [Type: Connector | Desc: "Conditional connector completing the 'if...then' structure" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེའི་ཚེ་གནོད་སེམས་ཀྱི་འདུ་ཤེས་ཀྱང་འབྱུང་ལ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Consequence scene about arising of malice" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེའི་ཚེ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Temporal modifier for when malice would have arisen" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གནོད་སེམས་ཀྱི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The type of conception (malice)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདུ་ཤེས [Type: State | Desc: "The mental state of conceiving malice" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཀྱང [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Emphasizes that malice conception follows from self conception" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འབྱུང་ལ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of arising" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the previously mentioned point or subject; functions as Patient (the subject being questioned about) in the question scene]
- ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ : for what reason [Interrogative; composed of `ཅི་` (what) + genitive particle `འི་` + `ཕྱིར་` (for the sake of); introduces the rhetorical question]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Final interrogative particle; completes the question phrase "Why is that?"; marks the end of the question scene]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; vocative case; the direct addressee of the Buddha's statement; functions as Recipient in the conditional scene]
- གལ་ཏེ་ : if [Conditional conjunction; initiates the conditional clause; functions as a logical connector]
- དེའི་ཚེ་ : at that time [Temporal adverbial; `དེ་` (that) + genitive `འི་` + `ཚེ་` (time); specifies when the conception might have occurred]
- ང་ལ་ : in me [First-person pronoun `ང་` (I) + dative-locative particle `ལ་`; indicates the experiencer of the conception]
- བདག་ཏུ་ : as a self [Terminative case of `བདག་` (self); indicates the object of conception; the concept being criticized in Buddhist philosophy]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : conception [Noun; from Sanskrit `saṃjñā`; refers to perception or mental formulation; functions as a State in the UCCA structure]
- བྱུང་ན། : had arisen [Past tense of `འབྱུང་བ་` (to arise, occur) + conditional particle `ན་`; completes the 'if' clause; indicates hypothetical past occurrence]
- དེའི་ཚེ་ : at that time [Temporal adverbial; `དེ་` (that) + genitive `འི་` + `ཚེ་` (time); indicates when the consequence would occur]
- གནོད་སེམས་ཀྱི་ : of malice [Genitive form; `གནོད་སེམས་` (malice, harmful intent) + genitive particle `ཀྱི་`; specifies the type of conception]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : conception [Noun; from Sanskrit `saṃjñā`; second occurrence of this term; refers to the mental state of malicious perception]
- ཀྱང་ : also [Emphatic particle; indicates addition and emphasis; connects the result to the condition]
- འབྱུང་ལ། : would arise [Present tense of `འབྱུང་བ་` (to arise, occur) + continuative particle `ལ་`; indicates the inevitable consequence; functions as Process in the consequence scene]

    ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་དང༌། སྲོག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་བྱུང་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "A" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་དང༌། སྲོག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས [Type: State | Desc: "P" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "H" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── འདུ་ཤེས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "P" | Implicit: ""]
                └── སེམས་ཅན་དུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "A" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "L" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྲོག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "H" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── འདུ་ཤེས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "P" | Implicit: ""]
                └── སྲོག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "A" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "L" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Scene | Desc: "H" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Process | Desc: "P" | Implicit: ""]
                └── གང་ཟག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "A" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བྱུང་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "L" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེའི་ཚེ་གནོད་སེམས་ཀྱི་འདུ་ཤེས་ཀྱང་འབྱུང་བའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "H" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེའི་ཚེ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "D" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གནོད་སེམས་ཀྱི་འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "A" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Center | Desc: "C" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གནོད་སེམས་ཀྱི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "E" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཀྱང [Type: Linker | Desc: "L" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འབྱུང་བའི་ཕྱིར་རོ [Type: Center | Desc: "C" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འབྱུང་ [Type: Center | Desc: "C" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བའི་ཕྱིར་རོ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "E" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- སེམས་ཅན་དུ་ : as sentient beings [Terminative case of `སེམས་ཅན་`: sentient being; indicates the object of perception; functions as Patient participant in the semantic structure]
- འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ : perceiving [Verbal noun from `འདུ་ཤེས་`: to perceive, recognize, identify; functions as the Process element in the conceptualization scene]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction linking parallel clauses; connects three types of perceptions in a series]
- སྲོག་ཏུ་ : as life [Terminative case of `སྲོག་`: life, living entity; object of perception; functions as Patient participant]
- འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ : perceiving [Verbal noun from `འདུ་ཤེས་`: to perceive, recognize, identify; functions as the Process element in the second perception scene]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction linking parallel clauses; connects the second and third types of perceptions]
- གང་ཟག་ཏུ་ : as persons [Terminative case of `གང་ཟག་`: person, individual; object of perception; functions as Patient participant]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perceiving [Verbal noun from `འདུ་ཤེས་`: to perceive, recognize, identify; functions as the Process element in the third perception scene]
- བྱུང་ན། : if arises [Conditional form of `འབྱུང་བ་`: to arise, occur; links the conditional protasis to the apodosis; introduces the consequence that follows]
- དེའི་ཚེ་ : at that time [Temporal adverbial; `དེ་`: that + genitive + `ཚེ་`: time; functions as a temporal Adverbial modifier in the main clause]
- གནོད་སེམས་ཀྱི་ : of malice [Genitive of `གནོད་སེམས་`: harmful thought, malice; modifies `འདུ་ཤེས་`; functions as an Elaborator of the perception]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Noun: perception, recognition; the mental process of identifying something; functions as the Center of the Patient participant]
- ཀྱང་ : also [Emphatic particle indicating addition; highlights that malicious perception inevitably follows the other perceptions]
- འབྱུང་ : arises [Present tense of `འབྱུང་བ་`: to arise, occur; the main verb of the consequence clause; functions as the Center of the predicate]
- བའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། : because [Composed of nominalizer `བ་` + genitive + `ཕྱིར་`: for the sake of + final particle `རོ`; indicates reason/cause; functions as an Elaborator explaining why this occurs]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་ངས་མངོན་པར་ཤེས་ཏེ། འདས་པའི་དུས་ན། ང་ཚེ་རབས་ལྔ་བརྒྱར་བཟོད་པ་སྨྲ་བ་ཞེས་བྱ་བའི་དྲང་སྲོང་དུ་གྱུར་པ་དེའི་ཚེ་ན་ཡང༌། ང་ལ་བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་མ་བྱུང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire statement about past lives and absence of self-perception" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The addressee of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ངས་ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མངོན་པར་ཤེས་ཏེ [Type: State | Desc: "Mental state of knowing or understanding rather than a dynamic process" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདས་པའི་དུས་ན། ང་ཚེ་རབས་ལྔ་བརྒྱར་བཟོད་པ་སྨྲ་བ་ཞེས་བྱ་བའི་དྲང་སྲོང་དུ་གྱུར་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the speaker's past lives as a sage" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདས་པའི་དུས་ན [Type: Ground | Desc: "Temporal setting of the scene" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ང་ཚེ་རབས་ལྔ་བརྒྱར་བཟོད་པ་སྨྲ་བ་ཞེས་བྱ་བའི་དྲང་སྲོང་དུ་གྱུར་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Subscene describing the transformation into a sage" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ང [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The experiencer who became the sage" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གྱུར་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The transformation or becoming process rather than a static state" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དྲང་སྲོང་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The role or entity the speaker transformed into" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བཟོད་པ་སྨྲ་བ་ཞེས་བྱ་བའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Description or name of the sage" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཚེ་རབས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The span of time over which the speaker was the sage" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ལྔ་བརྒྱ [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Numeric quantity modifying lifetimes" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ར [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relational marker connecting lifetimes to the transformation" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཏེ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector linking the knowing to what is known" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ང་ལ་བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་མ་བྱུང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing the absence of self-perception as consequence of the past life experiences" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེའི་ཚེ་ན་ཡང༌། ང་ལ་བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་མ་བྱུང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the absence of self-perception during that time" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེའི་ཚེ་ན [Type: Ground | Desc: "Temporal reference pointing to the time as the sage" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Emphasizes the concurrent condition" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ང་ལ [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The experiencer in whom perception did not arise" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བདག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "The notion/perception that modifies how the experience happens" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བྱུང [Type: State-of-Affairs | Desc: "The arising or occurrence of perception, rather than an active process" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མ [Type: Function | Desc: "Negation marker" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བདག་མེད་པ [Type: Implicit | Desc: "Implicit philosophical concept of selflessness underlying the entire passage and central to understanding patience/forbearance" | Implicit: "Philosophical concept of selflessness central to Buddhist teachings"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name of the direct disciple of Buddha being addressed; functions as the Recipient of the statement]
- ངས་ : I [Ergative case of `ང་`: I, me; the Buddha as the Agent or speaker]
- མངོན་པར་ཤེས་ཏེ། : clearly know [from `མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་`: to know clearly, have supernatural knowledge; represents the Buddha's mental state of certainty about past lives]
- འདས་པའི་ : past [Genitive form of `འདས་པ་`: gone beyond, past; establishes the temporal setting]
- དུས་ན། : in time [Locative of `དུས་`: time; sets the temporal ground for the following scene]
- ང་ : I [First person pronoun; functioning as the Experiencer who underwent the transformation]
- ཚེ་རབས་ : lifetimes [compound of `ཚེ་`: life and `རབས་`: succession; the duration over which reincarnation occurred]
- ལྔ་བརྒྱར་ : for five hundred [Terminative case marker `-ར་` applied to `ལྔ་བརྒྱ་`: five hundred; quantifies the number of lifetimes]
- བཟོད་པ་ : patience [from `བཟོད་པ་`: patience, forbearance; key quality attributed to the sage]
- སྨྲ་བ་ : who speaks [from `སྨྲ་བ་`: to speak, proclaim; describes the sage as one who proclaims patience]
- ཞེས་བྱ་བའི་ : named [from `ཞེས་བྱ་བ་`: called, named; Genitive form connecting the name to the sage]
- དྲང་སྲོང་ : sage [Sanskrit: ṛṣi; the role or spiritual status the Buddha had in previous lives]
- དུ་ : as [Terminative particle indicating transformation into the sage]
- གྱུར་པ་ : became [Past tense of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform; the process of transformation]
- དེའི་ : that [Genitive of `དེ་`: that; refers to the previously mentioned time period]
- ཚེ་ན་ : at that time [Locative of `ཚེ་`: time; temporal reference to the time as a sage]
- ཡང༌། : even/also [Emphatic particle highlighting the following statement; reinforces the continuity of no-self perception]
- ང་ལ་ : to me [Dative of `ང་`: I, me; the Experiencer in whom perception did not arise]
- བདག་ཏུ་ : as self [Terminative of `བདག་`: self; indicates the type of perception that did not occur]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Sanskrit: saṃjñā; the mental classification or recognition that did not arise]
- མ་ : not [Negative particle modifying the verb]
- བྱུང༌། : arose [Past tense of `འབྱུང་བ་`: to arise, emerge; indicates the non-occurrence of self-perception]

སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་དང༌། སྲོག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་མ་བྱུང་ངོ་། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene containing the perceptions that did not arise" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [The one who did not have these perceptions] [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The implicit experiencer (Buddha) who did not have these perceptions" | Implicit: "The Buddha as the implicit experiencer who did not have these perceptions"]
    ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་དང༌། སྲོག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས་ [Type: Center | Desc: "Core content representing the three types of perceptions" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Scene | Desc: "First type of perception" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of perceiving" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སེམས་ཅན་དུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object of perception - sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector between first and second perception" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྲོག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second type of perception" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of perceiving" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྲོག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object of perception - life-force" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector between second and third perception" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Scene | Desc: "Third type of perception" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of perceiving" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གང་ཟག་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object of perception - persons" | Implicit: ""]
    └── མ་བྱུང་ངོ་། ། [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Negation that modifies all three perceptions" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མ་ [Type: Negator | Desc: "Explicit negation marker" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Substantive noun; object of perception; functions as Patient in semantic structure]
- དུ་ : as [Terminative case marker; indicates "in the form of" or "as"; connects the object with the perception]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Verbal noun from `འདུ་ཤེས་པ་`: to perceive, conceive, recognize; functions as Process element indicating cognitive activity]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction particle; links coordinate elements in the list of perceptions]
- སྲོག་ : life-force [Substantive noun referring to vitality or animate essence; object of perception; functions as Patient]
- ཏུ་ : as [Terminative case marker; variant of དུ་; indicates "in the form of"]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Verbal noun as above; repeated for each type of perception in the parallel structure]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction particle; links to the final element in the list]
- གང་ཟག་ : person [Substantive noun referring to individual beings or personhood; object of perception; functions as Patient]
- ཏུ་ : as [Terminative case marker; indicates "in the form of"]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Verbal noun as above; the third instance in parallel structure]
- མ་ : not [Negative prefix attached to the verb; negates all three perceptions collectively]
- བྱུང་ : arose [Past tense of `འབྱུང་བ་`: to arise, occur, happen; indicates the perceptions did not manifest]
- ངོ་། ། : [Final particle indicating statement completion with emphasis; consists of statement particle ངོ་ and the double shad (།།) punctuation marking end of sentence]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་ལྟ་བས་ན། བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོས་འདུ་ཤེས་ཐམས་ཅད་རྣམ་པར་སྤངས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing the instruction to abandon all conceptualizations" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Recipient of the teaching/instruction" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ལྟ་བས་ན། [Type: Elaborator-Reason | Desc: "Causal connector indicating the reason for the instruction" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Agent who performs the abandoning action" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རྣམ་པར་སྤངས་ཏེ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of completely abandoning conceptualizations" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [implicit: བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱའོ] [Type: Purpose | Desc: "Implicit purpose of abandoning conceptualizations - to generate the awakening mind" | Implicit: "The unstated purpose of abandoning conceptualizations is to generate the awakening mind"]
    ├── བདག་ལ་སོགས་པར་འདུ་ཤེས་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Type of conceptualization to be abandoned - notions of self" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྡུག་བསྔལ་རྣམ་པ་གསུམ་གྱི་འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Type of conceptualization to be abandoned - notions of suffering" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Modifier indicating that all conceptualizations should be abandoned" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; the direct addressee; functions as the recipient of the teaching]
- དེ་ལྟ་བས་ན། : therefore [Causal connector; literally "because of viewing it that way"; introduces the logical conclusion; functions as a reason marker]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : awakening [Sanskrit: bodhi; enlightenment, awakened state; part of the compound term for bodhisattva]
- སེམས་དཔའ་ : hero of mind [Sanskrit: sattva; brave/heroic being committed to awakening; part of the term for bodhisattva]
- སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོས་ : great being [Instrumental case of `སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ`; refers to a high-level bodhisattva; functions as the agent performing the abandoning action]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : conceptualizations [Sanskrit: saṃjñā; mental imputations, perceptions, conceptions; objects to be abandoned]
- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Universal quantifier; modifies འདུ་ཤེས་; indicates the comprehensive nature of what must be abandoned]
- རྣམ་པར་ : completely [Adverbial intensifier; from `རྣམ་པ`: type, kind, manner; intensifies the thoroughness of abandonment]
- སྤངས་ཏེ། : having abandoned [Past tense of `སྤོང་`: to abandon, reject, eliminate; with connective particle `ཏེ`; functions as the main process in the sentence]

ucca_formatted:
བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the full sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [One] [Type: Participant | Desc: "Implicit agent (bodhisattva) who should generate the mind of enlightenment" | Implicit: "Implicit agent (bodhisattva/practitioner) who should generate the mind of enlightenment"]
    ├── སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The core action of generating the mind (bodhicitta) with modal auxiliary" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར [Type: Center | Desc: "The core action of generating the mind (bodhicitta)" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སེམས [Type: Participant | Desc: "The mind or bodhicitta that is to be generated" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བྱའོ [Type: Function | Desc: "Modal auxiliary indicating that one should perform the action" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "The goal towards which the mind is to be generated" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept of enlightenment towards which the mind is directed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བླ་ན་མེད་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Quality describing enlightenment as unsurpassed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཡང་དག་པར [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Quality describing enlightenment as perfect or genuine" | Implicit: ""]
        └── རྫོགས་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Quality describing enlightenment as complete" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Punctuation mark at the end of the sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [having abandoned all conceptions] [Type: State | Desc: "Implicit prerequisite state of having abandoned all conceptions before generating bodhicitta" | Implicit: "Implicit prerequisite state of having abandoned all conceptions before generating bodhicitta"]
glossary:
- བླ་ན་ : unsurpassed [Negative of `བླ་`: higher, superior; indicates the highest level with nothing above it; functions as part of a compound attribute describing enlightenment]
- མེད་པ་ : without [Negative existential verb form of `མེད་`: to not exist; creates the compound meaning "unsurpassed" with བླ་ན་; qualifier of enlightenment]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly/genuinely [Adverbial form of `ཡང་དག་པ་`: true, genuine, authentic; indicates the genuine and correct nature of the enlightenment; functions as an elaborator of བྱང་ཆུབ་]
- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive form of `རྫོགས་པ་`: to complete, perfect, fulfill; here indicates the complete nature of enlightenment; connects the attributes to the noun བྱང་ཆུབ་]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Sanskrit: bodhi; the state of awakening or enlightenment that is the goal of Buddhist practice; central concept towards which the mind is directed]
- ཏུ་ : towards [Terminative particle indicating direction or purpose; shows that enlightenment is the goal towards which the mind generation is directed]
- སེམས་ : mind [Here refers specifically to bodhicitta or "enlightenment mind"; the participant that is to be generated; object of the action བསྐྱེད་པ་]
- བསྐྱེད་པར་ : to generate [Terminative form of `བསྐྱེད་པ་`: to generate, produce, give rise to; the core action of cultivating or developing the enlightenment mind]
- བྱའོ : should do [Future/imperative auxiliary verb `བྱ་` (to do) with the final particle `འོ་`; indicates obligation or exhortation to perform the action; modal function indicating that one should generate bodhicitta]
- ། : [Tibetan sentence-ending punctuation mark, equivalent to a period]

གཟུགས་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར་སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱའོ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The main scene describing how to generate bodhicitta" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Bodhisattva/practitioner] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit agent who is generating bodhicitta, which is the Bodhisattva/practitioner" | Implicit: "The practitioner who is being instructed"]
    ├── སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Process-Goal | Desc: "The main process which is also the goal - generating bodhicitta" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སེམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The patient of the process, the bodhicitta that is being generated" | Implicit: ""]
    └── གཟུགས་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར [Type: Condition | Desc: "The condition for generating bodhicitta - not abiding in form" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མི་གནས་པར [Type: Process-State | Desc: "The state of non-attachment or non-abiding" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གཟུགས་ལ [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "The location or object in which one should not abide - form" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཡང [Type: Linker | Desc: "A linker indicating that form is one of a series of things one should not abide in" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡང [Type: Linker | Desc: "A linker indicating that form is one of a series of things one should not abide in" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- གཟུགས་ལ་ : in form [Locative case of `གཟུགས་`: form, physical matter; one of the five skandhas or aggregates; functions as the object or location in which one should not abide]
- ཡང་ : also [Particle indicating 'also' or 'even'; here implies that form is one of several things one should not abide in; functions as a linker indicating that form is one of a series in this instruction]
- མི་ : not [Negation particle; negates the following verb]
- གནས་པར་ : abiding [Terminative form of `གནས་པ་`: to abide, dwell, remain; here describes the state of non-attachment or non-abiding; forms part of the condition for generating bodhicitta]
- སེམས་ : mind/bodhicitta [Root noun `སེམས་`: mind; here specifically refers to bodhicitta (the awakening mind or aspiration for enlightenment); functions as the patient or object being generated]
- བསྐྱེད་པར་ : to generate [Terminative form of `བསྐྱེད་པ་`: to generate, produce, cultivate; refers to the act of arousing or generating bodhicitta; part of the main process]
- བྱའོ : should do [Future form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do, make; with the final particle `འོ` marking the end of a statement; functions as the main verb indicating what the practitioner should do]

    ├── [Bodhisattva] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implied agent (bodhisattva) who should generate bodhicitta" | Implicit: "Implied agent who should generate bodhicitta"]
    ├── སེམས་བསྐྱེད་ [Type: Process | Desc: "The core process of generating bodhicitta" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བྱའོ [Type: Modal | Desc: "Modal auxiliary indicating obligation" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མི་གནས་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial that modifies how bodhicitta should be generated" | Implicit: ""]
    └── སྒྲ་དང་དྲི་དང་རོ་དང༌། རེག་བྱ་ལ་ཡང་ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial elements listing sensory objects in which one should not abide" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྒྲ་ལ [Type: State | Desc: "State representing the sensory object of sound" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྒྲ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The sensory object of sound" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དྲི་ལ [Type: State | Desc: "State representing the sensory object of smell" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དྲི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The sensory object of smell" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རོ་ལ [Type: State | Desc: "State representing the sensory object of taste" | Implicit: ""]
            └── རོ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The sensory object of taste" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རེག་བྱ་ལ [Type: State | Desc: "State representing the sensory object of touch" | Implicit: ""]
            └── རེག་བྱ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The sensory object of touch" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction connecting the sensory objects" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction connecting the sensory objects" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction connecting the sensory objects" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
# Word-by-Word Disambiguated Gloss

- སྒྲ་ : sound [Noun: raw phonetic phenomena; functions as a Participant-Patient in a list of sensory objects]
- དང་ : and [Conjunction: linking particle connecting items in a list; functions as a Linker between sensory objects]
- དྲི་ : smell [Noun: olfactory phenomena; functions as a Participant-Patient in a list of sensory objects]
- དང་ : and [Conjunction: linking particle connecting items in a list; functions as a Linker between sensory objects]
- རོ་ : taste [Noun: gustatory phenomena; functions as a Participant-Patient in a list of sensory objects]
- དང༌། : and [Conjunction: linking particle concluding a list; functions as a Linker between sensory objects]
- རེག་བྱ་ : touch [Noun: tactile phenomena; from `རེག་པ་`: to touch + `བྱ་`: object; functions as a Participant-Patient in a list of sensory objects]
- ལ་ : in, on, to [Locative particle: indicating relation to the preceding sensory objects; marks the objects that should not be abided in]
- ཡང་ : also, even [Emphatic particle: extending the scope of non-abiding; emphasizes that all sensory objects are included]
- མི་ : not [Negative prefix: negates the following verb; indicates the action that should not be performed]
- གནས་པར་ : abiding [Verbal noun: from `གནས་`: to dwell, abide + `-པར`: adverbial suffix; describes the manner of generating bodhicitta as without fixation on sensory objects; functions as an Adverbial modifier]
- སེམས་ : mind, bodhicitta [Noun: specifically referring to the enlightened mind or bodhicitta; object of the verb 'to generate'; functions as the core Process in the sentence]
- བསྐྱེད་པར་ : to generate [Verbal noun: future tense of `སྐྱེད་`: to produce, generate + `-པར`: adverbial suffix; the main action to be performed; part of the core Process]
- བྱའོ། : one should do [Verb: `བྱ་`: to do + `-འོ`: final particle indicating completion; denotes obligation or necessity; functions as a Modal auxiliary indicating the imperative nature]

glossary:
- ཆོས་ལ་ : in dharma [Locative case of `ཆོས་`: dharma, phenomena, teachings; here referring to conceptual frameworks or phenomena as objects of potential attachment; functions as Patient in the non-abiding process]

- ཡང་ : also/even [Adverbial particle indicating inclusion or emphasis; here emphasizing that one should not abide in dharma in addition to other things previously mentioned; serves as adverbial modifier]

- མི་གནས་པར་ : without abiding [Negated verb `གནས་པ་` with terminative particle; literally "not dwelling in" or "not fixating on"; indicates the mental state of non-attachment or non-fixation; forms the process component of an adverbial phrase]

- སེམས་ : mind/bodhicitta [Noun; here specifically referring to bodhicitta or enlightened mind/attitude rather than ordinary consciousness; functions as Patient of the generating process]

- བསྐྱེད་པར་ : to generate [Terminative form of the verb `སྐྱེད་པ་`: to generate, produce, cultivate; indicates the action of developing bodhicitta; part of main verbal predicate]

- བྱའོ : should do [Future/imperative form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do, with final particle `འོ་`; indicates obligation or exhortation; serves as main verb indicating what the implicit agent (bodhisattva) should do]

- ། : [sentence-ending mark]

    ├── [bodhisattva practitioner] [Type: Implicit Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The implied practitioner who is generating bodhicitta without abiding in extreme views" | Implicit: "The implied practitioner who is generating bodhicitta without abiding in extreme views"]
    ├── སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of generating bodhicitta" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སེམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The bodhicitta (enlightened mind) that is being generated" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་མེད་པ་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner in which bodhicitta should be generated - without abiding in non-phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མི་གནས་པར [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of not abiding or not clinging to views" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་མེད་པ་ལ [Type: Participant-Scene | Desc: "The abstract concept in which one should not abide" | Implicit: ""]

        └── ཡང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Emphasizes that one should not abide even in the concept of non-existence" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཆོས་མེད་པ་ལ [Type: Participant-Scene | Desc: "The abstract concept in which one should not abide" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཆོས་མེད་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The philosophical concept of absence of dharmas or non-existence" | Implicit: ""]

    └── [for attaining complete enlightenment] [Type: Implicit Purpose | Desc: "The implied purpose of generating bodhicitta without abiding is to attain complete enlightenment" | Implicit: "The implied purpose of generating bodhicitta without abiding is to attain complete enlightenment"]
        └── སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of generating bodhicitta" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སེམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The bodhicitta (enlightened mind) that is being generated" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཆོས་ : phenomena [noun from √ཆོས་: dharma, phenomena, teaching; here referring to "phenomena" as objects of conceptual clinging; functions as a component of the adverbial modifier describing what not to abide in]
- མེད་པ་ : absence [verbal negation from √མེད་: non-existence, absence; here indicating the philosophical concept of non-existence or emptiness of phenomena; forms part of the abstract concept in which one should not abide]
- ལ་ : in [locative case marker; indicates the abstract location or domain in which one should not abide; connects the concept of "absence of phenomena" to the action of "not abiding"]
- ཡང་ : even [emphatic particle; emphasizes that one should not abide even in the concept of non-existence; functions as a linker that highlights the extremity to avoid]
- མི་ : not [negation particle; works with གནས་པར་ to form the negative verbal construction; indicates the prohibition against abiding]
- གནས་པར་ : abiding [verbal noun from √གནས་: to abide, dwell, remain; here in the terminative case indicating "without abiding"; describes the manner in which bodhicitta should be generated]
- སེམས་ : mind [noun; specifically referring to bodhicitta or enlightened mind/intention; functions as the patient or object being generated in the main process]
- བསྐྱེད་པར་ : generate [verbal noun from √སྐྱེད་: to generate, produce, give rise to; in terminative case indicating "in order to generate"; forms part of the main verbal action]
- བྱའོ : should do [future tense verb from √བྱེད་: to do, make; with final particle འོ indicating completion and mild imperative force; forms the main verbal action together with བསྐྱེད་པར་]
- ། : [sentence-ending punctuation mark indicating the completion of the statement]

ཅི་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར་སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of instruction about generating non-abiding bodhicitta" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── Bodhisattva (implicit) [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent - Bodhisattva | Desc: "The implicit practitioner/bodhisattva who should generate bodhicitta" | Implicit: "Bodhisattva"]
    ├── སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Process-Mental | Desc: "The mental act of generating the enlightenment mind" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སེམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The enlightenment mind or mind of awakening (bodhicitta) aimed at supreme enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The enlightenment mind or mind of awakening (bodhicitta) aimed at supreme enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཅི་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར [Type: Manner | Desc: "How bodhicitta should be generated - by abandoning all conceptual notions or perceptions" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མི་གནས་པར [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of not abiding or not clinging to any conceptual object" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཅི་ལ [Type: Participant-Location-Abstract | Desc: "Refers to any conceptual object or phenomenon in which one might abide" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Emphatic particle linking and emphasizing the scope of non-abiding" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཅི་ལ་ : in anything [Interrogative pronoun `ཅི་` with locative particle `ལ་`; literally "in what"; indicates abstract location or conceptual object; functions as the abstract location reference in non-abiding]
- ཡང་ : whatsoever [Emphatic particle; intensifies the scope of "anything" to mean "anything at all"; acts as a linker emphasizing complete non-abiding in any phenomenon]
- མི་ : not [Negation particle; negates the verb `གནས་པ་`; indicates the absence of abiding]
- གནས་པར་ : abiding [Terminative form of `གནས་པ་`: to dwell, abide, remain; here indicating the state of non-fixation or non-clinging to concepts; functions as the main process in the adverbial phrase]
- སེམས་ : mind [Noun; refers specifically to bodhicitta or enlightenment mind aimed at supreme awakening; functions as the patient/object being generated]
- བསྐྱེད་པར་ : generate [Terminative form of `བསྐྱེད་པ་`: to generate, produce, give rise to; refers to the mental act of cultivating bodhicitta; part of the main verbal compound]
- བྱའོ : should do [Future/imperative form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do, with the final particle `འོ་`; indicates instruction or exhortation; completes the verbal phrase indicating the practitioner should actively generate bodhicitta]
- ། : [Sentence-ending shad mark]

དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། གནས་པ་གང་ཡིན་པ་དེ་ཉིད་མི་གནས་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The referent being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "The questioning process" | Implicit: ""]
    └── གནས་པ་གང་ཡིན་པ་དེ་ཉིད་མི་གནས་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Answer" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གནས་པ་གང་ཡིན་པ་དེ་ཉིད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Subject of non-abiding" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གནས་པ་གང་ཡིན་པ [Type: State | Desc: "State of abiding" | Implicit: ""]
                └── [IMPLIED: forms and phenomena] [Type: Elaboration | Desc: "Implied context of abiding in conventional phenomena" | Implicit: "Implied context of abiding in conventional phenomena"]
            └── དེ་ཉིད [Type: Center | Desc: "Emphatic reference to the subject" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མི་གནས་པའི [Type: Negation-State | Desc: "Negative state of not abiding" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [IMPLIED: ultimate non-existence] [Type: Elaboration | Desc: "Implied philosophical concept of ultimate non-abiding" | Implicit: "Implied philosophical concept of ultimate non-abiding"]
        ├── ཕྱིར་ཏེ [Type: Connector | Desc: "Causal connector" | Implicit: ""]
        └──  [Type: Contrast | Desc: "Philosophical contrast between abiding and not abiding" | Implicit: "Philosophical contrast between conventional abiding and ultimate non-abiding"]
            ├── གནས་པ་གང་ཡིན་པ [Type: State | Desc: "State of abiding" | Implicit: ""]
                └── [IMPLIED: forms and phenomena] [Type: Elaboration | Desc: "Implied context of abiding in conventional phenomena" | Implicit: "Implied context of abiding in conventional phenomena"]
            └── མི་གནས་པའི [Type: Negation-State | Desc: "Negative state of not abiding" | Implicit: ""]
                └── [IMPLIED: ultimate non-existence] [Type: Elaboration | Desc: "Implied philosophical concept of ultimate non-abiding" | Implicit: "Implied philosophical concept of ultimate non-abiding"]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun, referring to the previously discussed concept; functions as Patient in the sentence, the referent being questioned]
- ཅིའི་ : what/why [Interrogative particle with genitive case `-འི`; from root `ཅི`; used here to introduce a rhetorical question]
- ཕྱིར་ : for what reason [Postposition indicating purpose or reason; combines with `ཅིའི་` to form "why"]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional particle introducing a rhetorical question; signals that what follows is the answer to the question being posed]
- གནས་པ་ : abiding [Nominalized form of `གནས་པ`; to dwell, remain, exist; refers to the conventional existence of phenomena]
- གང་ : whatever [Relative pronoun; modifies "abiding" to indicate "whatever abides" or "that which abides"]
- ཡིན་པ་ : is/being [Nominalized form of the verb `ཡིན`; links the subject to its description, emphasizing identity]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun referring back to "whatever abides"; creates emphasis on the subject]
- ཉིད་ : itself/very [Emphatic particle; intensifies "that" to mean "that very thing" or "precisely that"]
- མི་ : not [Negation particle; modifies the following verb to create its negative form]
- གནས་པའི་ : abiding [Nominalized verb with genitive particle `-འི`; from root `གནས་པ`; here in negated form to indicate "non-abiding" or "not existing"]
- ཕྱིར་ : because [Causal conjunction; indicates that this clause provides the reason for the preceding statement]
- ཏེ། : namely/that is [Terminal particle; indicates that an explanation or elaboration follows]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་བས་ན་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་འདི་སྐད་དུ། བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་གང་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར་སྦྱིན་པ་སྦྱིན་པར་བྱའོ། ། ཞེས་གསུངས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བས་ན [Type: Connector | Desc: "Conclusion marker connecting to previous discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་འདི་སྐད་དུ། བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་གང་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར་སྦྱིན་པ་སྦྱིན་པར་བྱའོ། ། ཞེས་གསུངས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the Buddha's speech" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the speaker/agent" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདི་སྐད་དུ། བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་གང་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར་སྦྱིན་པ་སྦྱིན་པར་བྱའོ། ། ཞེས་གསུངས་སོ། ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of speaking/saying" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འདི་སྐད་དུ [Type: Center | Desc: "Manner of speech introduction" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་གང་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར་སྦྱིན་པ་སྦྱིན་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The content of what was said" | Implicit: ""]
                └── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་གང་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར་སྦྱིན་པ་སྦྱིན་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The content of what was said - instruction to bodhisattvas" | Implicit: ""]
                    ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agents who should practice giving" | Implicit: ""]
                    ├── སྦྱིན་པ་སྦྱིན་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The central action of giving being instructed" | Implicit: ""]
                        └── སྦྱིན་པ [Type: Center | Desc: "The specific concept of giving that is central to the instruction" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── གང་ལ་ཡང་མི་གནས་པར [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Philosophical qualification of how giving should be done" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཞེས་གསུངས་སོ། ། [Type: Ground | Desc: "Closing statement indicating end of quotation" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་བས་ན : Therefore [Connector; combination of དེ་བས་ (because of that) + ན (conditional/causal particle); functions as a discourse connector indicating conclusion from previous arguments]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས : the Tathagata [Ergative of དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་, Sanskrit: tathāgata; literally "thus-gone one," epithet of the Buddha; functions as Agent/subject of the speech act]

- འདི་སྐད་དུ : thus [Terminative case (དུ) of འདི་སྐད་ (these words); introductory phrase for direct quotation; functions as manner marker for speech]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ : bodhisattva [Compound noun from བྱང་ཆུབ་ (awakening, enlightenment) + སེམས་དཔའ་ (brave/heroic mind); practitioner who seeks enlightenment for the benefit of all beings; functions as Agent of the giving practice]

- གང་ལ་ཡང : to anything [Combination of གང་ (any, whatever) + ལ (locative particle) + ཡང་ (also, even); meaning "with respect to anything whatsoever"; functions as philosophical qualification]

- མི་གནས་པར : without abiding [Terminative of མི་གནས་པ་: negation prefix (མི་) + གནས་པ་ (to abide, dwell); philosophical term referring to non-attachment or non-fixation; elaborates on how giving should be performed]

- སྦྱིན་པ : generosity [Nominalized form of སྦྱིན་པ་ (to give); refers to the practice of giving/generosity as a virtue; the central object/concept in the instruction]

- སྦྱིན་པར་བྱའོ : should practice giving [Combination of སྦྱིན་པར་ (terminative of སྦྱིན་པ་) + བྱ་ (to do) + འོ (final particle indicating statement); forms an imperative construction; the central instruction/Process]

- ཞེས : thus [Quotative particle marking end of direct speech; connects quote to reporting verb]

- གསུངས་སོ : spoke [Past tense of གསུང་ (honorific form of "to speak") + སོ (final particle); indicates the Buddha's act of speaking; completes the reporting clause]

- ། : [Tibetan phrase marker/shad; punctuation marking end of clause]

- ། ། : [Double shad; punctuation marking end of section or text]

    ├── སྦྱིན་པ་ཡོངས་སུ་གཏང་བར་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of practicing generosity" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས་ཅན་ཐམས་ཅད་ཀྱི་དོན་གྱི་ཕྱིར [Type: Adverbial-Purpose | Desc: "Purpose of practicing generosity - expressing why the bodhisattva engages in this practice" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སེམས་ཅན་ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Participant-Beneficiary | Desc: "The beneficiaries who benefit from the bodhisattva's practice of generosity" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- ཡང་ : Furthermore [Particle: connective/continuative; used here as a discourse marker linking this teaching to the previous context; functions as a Linker in the semantic structure]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Proper name; vocative form addressing the disciple Subhūti, one of Buddha's chief disciples; functions as the Recipient of this teaching in the discourse]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [Compound noun: `བྱང་ཆུབ་` (enlightenment) + `སེམས་དཔའ་` (hero/warrior of mind); refers to one who seeks enlightenment for the benefit of all beings; functions as the Agent who should practice generosity]

- འདི་ལྟར་ : in this way [Adverbial phrase: `འདི་` (this) + `ལྟར་` (like/manner); indicates the manner or method of practice to follow; functions as an Adverbial modifier describing how the action should be performed]

- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Compound noun: `སེམས་` (mind) + `ཅན་` (possessing); refers to all conscious beings; part of the beneficiary group in the purpose clause]

- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Adjective quantifier: modifies `སེམས་ཅན་` to include all sentient beings without exception; completes the Beneficiary participant role]

- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle: connects `སེམས་ཅན་ཐམས་ཅད་` to `དོན་`, showing possession or relationship; part of the purpose clause construction]

- དོན་ : benefit/welfare [Noun: purpose, meaning, benefit; refers to the well-being or spiritual benefit of sentient beings; object of the purpose clause]

- གྱི་ : of [Genitive particle: connects `དོན་` to the purpose marker `ཕྱིར་`; part of the nested purpose clause construction]

- ཕྱིར་ : for the sake of [Postposition: purpose marker indicating the reason or motivation for the action; completes the Adverbial-Purpose phrase explaining why generosity should be practiced]

- སྦྱིན་པ་ : generosity [Noun: from the verb `སྦྱིན་པ་` (to give); refers to the perfection of giving/generosity, one of the six perfections in Mahayana Buddhism; object of the main verb and core of the Process element]

- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely [Adverbial modifier: `ཡོངས་` (complete) + `སུ་` (terminative particle); emphasizes the thoroughness or completeness of the giving; modifies the verb `གཏང་བར་`]

- གཏང་བར་ : should give/practice [Verbal noun in terminative case: from `གཏོང་བ་` (to give, send, let go); with the terminative marker `-ར་` indicating purpose; forms part of the verbal complex]

- བྱའོ་ : should do [Auxiliary verb: `བྱ་` (to do) + final particle `འོ་` marking statement completion; completes the verbal construction with `གཏང་བར་` to form "should practice giving"; main Process element of the sentence]

- ། : [Sentence-ending marker]

སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་གང་ཡིན་པ་དེ་ཉིད་ཀྱང་འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་པ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "A philosophical statement about the emptiness of the concept of sentient beings, stating that the very perception of something as a sentient being is, ultimately, non-perception" | Implicit: ""]

        └── དོན་དམ་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Implicit philosophical context indicating that from the ultimate truth perspective, perception is empty" | Implicit: "Philosophical context indicating that from the ultimate truth perspective, perception is empty"]
    └── སྟེ། [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connector indicating a causal or explanatory relationship between the parts of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Noun; from `སེམས་` (mind) + `ཅན་` (possessing); refers to any being with consciousness; functions as the object of perception in the statement]
- དུ་ : as [Terminative case particle; indicates 'in the form of' or 'as'; connects the object (sentient beings) to the perception]
- འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ : perception [Verbal noun; from `འདུ་ཤེས་` (to conceive, perceive, recognize) + nominalizing particle `པ་`; the act of mentally grasping phenomena as inherently existent]
- གང་ : whatever [Interrogative pronoun used as relative pronoun; generalizes the preceding perception]
- ཡིན་པ་ : is [Verbal noun; from copula `ཡིན་` (to be) + nominalizing particle `པ་`; completes the relative clause]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the perception mentioned in the first part]
- ཉིད་ : itself [Emphatic particle; intensifies the reference to the perception, suggesting its very essence]
- ཀྱང་ : also/even [Adversative particle; indicates the paradoxical relationship between perception and non-perception]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Noun; from `འདུ་` (to gather) + `ཤེས་` (to know); the conceptual designation or recognition]
- མེད་པ་ : non- [Negative existential; from `མེད་` (does not exist) + nominalizing particle `པ་`; negates the inherent existence of perception]
- སྟེ། : that is [Conjunction particle; concludes the philosophical statement, indicating a causal or explanatory relationship]

དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་སེམས་ཅན་ཐམས་ཅད་ཅེས་གང་དག་གསུངས་པའི་སེམས་ཅན་དེ་དག་ཉིད་ཀྱང་མེད་པའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene describing the Tathagata's statement about sentient beings and their ultimate non-existence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent (Tathagata/Buddha) who is speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསུངས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of speaking or teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    └── སེམས་ཅན་དེ་དག་ཉིད་ཀྱང་མེད་པའོ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The patient of the scene - sentient beings that are said not to exist" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་དེ་དག [Type: Center | Desc: "The core referent - sentient beings that are negated at the ultimate level" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སེམས་ཅན་ཐམས་ཅད་ཅེས་གང་དག [Type: Center | Desc: "Refers to sentient beings as conventionally designated in the Buddha's teaching" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཅེས [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relates the term used by the Buddha to refer to sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── སེམས་ཅན་ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "What the Buddha refers to in his conventional teaching" | Implicit: ""]
                        └── ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Quantifier indicating the totality of sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མེད་པའོ [Type: Negator | Desc: "Negates the existence of sentient beings at the ultimate level" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཀྱང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Contrastive particle connecting the conventional designation with ultimate non-existence" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཉིད [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Emphasizes the identity between the mentioned sentient beings and those that don't exist" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Instrumental/Agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "Thus-Gone One", an epithet of the Buddha; functions as the Agent who is performing the act of teaching]

- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Noun: `སེམས་ཅན་`: literally "mind-possessors"; refers to all conscious beings in samsara; functions as the Patient in the Buddha's statement]

- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Quantifier: indicating totality without exception; modifies sentient beings to indicate "all sentient beings without exception"]

- ཅེས་ : thus, saying [Quotative particle: marks the preceding term as being quoted or referenced; connects what the Buddha designates with how it is designated]

- གང་དག་ : whoever, whichever [Relative pronoun: referring back to the sentient beings; specifies the particular ones the Buddha has spoken of]

- གསུངས་པའི་ : which were taught [Genitive of past tense verb `གསུང་`: to speak, teach (honorific); indicates the Buddha's act of teaching; functions as the Process in the scene]

- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Noun: repeated reference to the same sentient beings mentioned earlier; the core subject being discussed]

- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative pronoun: specifically indicating the aforementioned sentient beings; creates identity between the beings mentioned in the Buddha's teaching and those being negated]

- ཉིད་ : itself, very [Emphasizing particle: intensifies the identity of the sentient beings; emphasizes that the very same beings mentioned are the ones that don't exist ultimately]

- ཀྱང་ : also, even, yet [Contrastive conjunction: creates tension between conventional designation and ultimate reality; indicates a surprising or contrasting relationship]

- མེད་པའོ : do not exist [Negated existential verb `མེད་`: non-existence + final particle `འོ`; negates the ultimate existence of sentient beings; expresses the emptiness (śūnyatā) of sentient beings at the ultimate level]

- ། : [Sentence-final marker]

        ├── ཡང་དག་པར་གསུང་བ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First aspect: speech representing conventional truth" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- དེ་ : Why [Demonstrative pronoun functioning as an interrogative marker; root meaning "that"; serves as part of the interrogative phrase; functions as the basis of the rhetorical question]
- ཅིའི་ : for what reason [Interrogative + genitive case marker; from `ཅི་`: "what"; forms the core of the question "for what reason"; part of the rhetorical question function]
- ཕྱིར་ : because [Postposition indicating reason or purpose; completes the interrogative construction "for what reason"; functions as part of the question marker]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional verbal phrase; from `ཞེ་`: "to say" + conditional marker `ན`; completes the rhetorical question formula; serves as a discourse marker signaling an explanation follows]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Proper name; vocative case; addressee of the statement; functions as the recipient of the following explanation]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : the Tathāgata [Buddhist technical term; `དེ་བཞིན`: "thus" + `གཤེགས་པ`: "one who has gone"; refers to the Buddha; central entity being described in the passage]
- ནི་ : is [Topic marker particle; emphasizes the subject `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ`; establishes the Tathāgata as the topic of the following attributes]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [Adverbial phrase; from `ཡང་དག་པ`: "perfect/genuine" + terminative case marker `ར`; describes the manner of the Buddha's speech; modifies the process of speaking]
- གསུང་བ། : speaks [Verbal noun; honorific form of "to speak"; describes the process of the Buddha's speech; central process in the first aspect of the Buddha's speech]
- བདེན་པར་ : truthfully [Adverbial phrase; from `བདེན་པ`: "truth" + terminative case marker `ར`; describes the Buddha's speech as authentic; modifies the process of speaking]
- གསུང་བ། : speaks [Verbal noun; honorific form of "to speak"; describes the process of the Buddha's speech; central process in the second aspect of the Buddha's speech]
- དེ་བཞིན་ཉིད་དུ་ : in accordance with reality [Adverbial phrase; `དེ་བཞིན་ཉིད`: "suchness/ultimate reality" + locative case marker `དུ`; describes the Buddha's speech as reflecting ultimate truth; modifies the process of speaking]
- གསུང་བ་ : speaks [Verbal noun; honorific form of "to speak"; describes the process of the Buddha's speech; central process in the third aspect of the Buddha's speech]
- སྟེ། : that is [Connector particle; links the preceding qualities of speech; indicates an explanatory elaboration or enumeration; functions as a connector joining the threefold description]

དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ནི་ལོག་པར་གསུང་བ་མ་ཡིན་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The main scene containing the complete statement about the Tathagata not speaking falsely" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ནི [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The subject of the sentence - the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལོག་པར་གསུང་བ་མ་ཡིན་པའི [Type: Center | Desc: "The central proposition of the sentence - that the Tathagata is not one who speaks falsely" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསུང་བ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of speaking" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལོག་པར [Type: Adverbial-Manner | Desc: "The manner in which speaking is done - falsely or incorrectly" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མ་ཡིན་པའི [Type: Adverbial-Negation | Desc: "The negation component indicating that the Tathagata is not one who speaks falsely" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Reason | Desc: "The clause marking this statement as a reason" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Relator | Desc: "The reason marker that indicates this statement is providing a reason or cause" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [IMPLIED] [Type: Implicit | Desc: "The implicit content representing that this statement serves as a reason for something stated previously" | Implicit: "This statement is providing reasoning for something mentioned in a previous statement"]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathagata [Sanskrit term; literally "Thus-gone One"; Buddha epithet referring to one who has realized ultimate reality; functions as the Agent/subject of the sentence]
- ནི་ : as for [Topic marker particle; highlights the Tathagata as the main topic of discussion; emphasizes the subject]
- ལོག་པར་ : falsely [Adverbial form of `ལོག་པ་`: wrong, incorrect, perverted; describes the manner of speaking; modifies the verb `གསུང་བ་`]
- གསུང་བ་ : speaking [Nominalizer of `གསུང་`: to speak, say (honorific); verbal noun indicating the action performed by the Tathagata; forms the Process component]
- མ་ཡིན་པའི་ : is not [Negation; `མ་ཡིན་` is the negative of `ཡིན་`: to be; genitive form connecting to the reason marker; negates the predicate "one who speaks falsely"]
- ཕྱིར་རོ། : because/therefore [Conjunction; `ཕྱིར་`: for the sake of, because; `རོ་`: sentence-final particle indicating completion; marks this statement as providing a reason for a previous assertion]

glossary:
- ཡང་ : furthermore [Linker particle connecting this statement to previous discourse; serves as a discourse connector indicating that this is a continuation or expansion of a previous teaching]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative case; proper name of the Buddha's disciple being addressed; functions as the recipient or addressee of this teaching]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Agentive/instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "thus-gone one," epithet of the Buddha; the primary agent who performs both the realization and teaching actions in this passage]

- ཆོས་ : dharma [Nominative case of `ཆོས་`: phenomena, teaching, qualities; here referring to the objects of Buddha's realization and teaching]

- གང་ཡང་ : any whatsoever [Universal quantifier; modifies `ཆོས་` to indicate "any dharma at all" as the theme of the Buddha's realization]

- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly [Adverbial prefix modifying `རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པ་`; indicates direct, evident, manifest perception or realization]

- རྫོགས་པར་ : completely [Adverbial prefix modifying `སངས་རྒྱས་པ་`; indicates perfection or completion of the enlightenment process]

- སངས་རྒྱས་པ : awakened to [Verbal noun from `སངས་རྒྱས་`: to become enlightened/awakened; represents the process of complete realization with the Tathagata as the implicit agent]

- འམ་ : or [Disjunctive particle connecting the two actions of realization and teaching as alternatives or complements]

- བསྟན་པ་ : taught [Past tense of `སྟོན་པ་`: to teach, explain, demonstrate; represents the process of teaching with the Tathagata as the implicit agent]

- དེ་ལ་ : in that [Locative case referencing the previously mentioned dharmas that are realized and taught by the Buddha; establishes location for the following statements]

- བདེན་པ་ : truth [Nominal form from `བདེན་པ་`: true, truth; the subject of the negation in the first parallel statement]

- ཡང་ : also [Emphatic particle emphasizing the absence of truth; connects the two statements about truth and falsehood]

- མེད་ : does not exist [Negative existential verb; denies the existence of truth in the dharmas realized and taught]

- རྫུན་པ་ : falsehood [Nominal form from `རྫུན་པ་`: false, falsehood; the subject of the negation in the second parallel statement]

- ཡང་ : also [Emphatic particle emphasizing the absence of falsehood; parallels the earlier usage with truth]

- མེད་དོ་ : does not exist [Negative existential verb with final particle; denies the existence of falsehood, completing the parallel structure]

རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ལྟ་སྟེ། དཔེར་ན་མིག་དང་ལྡན་པའི་མི་ཞིག་མུན་པར་ཞུགས་ན་ཅི་ཡང་མི་མཐོང་བ་དེ་བཞིན་དུ་གང་དངོས་པོར་ལྷུང་བས་སྦྱིན་པ་ཡོངས་སུ་གཏོང་བའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་བལྟ་བར་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The root node representing the entire passage" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The addressee of the instruction" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་ལྟ་སྟེ། དཔེར་ན་མིག་དང་ལྡན་པའི་མི་ཞིག་མུན་པར་ཞུགས་ན་ཅི་ཡང་མི་མཐོང་བ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The explanatory analogy used to illustrate the concept" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དཔེར་ན་མིག་དང་ལྡན་པའི་མི་ཞིག་མུན་པར་ཞུགས་ན་ཅི་ཡང་མི་མཐོང་བ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The example scene of a person in darkness" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མིག་དང་ལྡན་པའི་མི་ཞིག [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent in the example scene" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མུན་པར [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "The location where the agent is situated" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཞུགས་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of entering darkness" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཅི་ཡང་མི་མཐོང་བ [Type: State | Desc: "The resultant state of being unable to see" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་དུ [Type: Linker | Desc: "The connector linking the example to its application" | Implicit: ""]
        └── just as the person with eyes cannot see in darkness [Type: Implicit Parallel Scene | Desc: "The implied comparison connecting the example to the bodhisattva" | Implicit: "This references the implied comparison connecting the example to the bodhisattva"]
    └── གང་དངོས་པོར་ལྷུང་བས་སྦྱིན་པ་ཡོངས་སུ་གཏོང་བའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་བལྟ་བར་བྱའོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The instruction to view the bodhisattva in a certain way" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── Subhuti (the listener) [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implied agent who should view the bodhisattva this way" | Implicit: "This refers to the implied agent (Subhuti) who should view the bodhisattva this way"]
        ├── བལྟ་བར་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The instruction to view or understand" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The bodhisattva who is to be viewed in a certain way" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central participant (bodhisattva)" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྦྱིན་པ་ཡོངས་སུ་གཏོང་བའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of giving performed by the bodhisattva" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དངོས་པོར་ལྷུང་བས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "The manner in which the bodhisattva gives - with attachment to phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── the bodhisattva cannot see the true nature of giving due to attachment [Type: Implicit Elaborator | Desc: "The implied explanation of the consequence of giving with attachment" | Implicit: "This explains the implied consequence of giving with attachment"]
        └── in contrast to a bodhisattva who gives without attachment to phenomena [Type: Implicit Contrast | Desc: "The implied contrast between giving with attachment versus giving without attachment" | Implicit: "This represents the implied contrast between giving with attachment versus giving without attachment"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Vocative case; proper name of the Buddha's disciple who is being addressed; functions as the Recipient of the instruction in the discourse structure]

- འདི་ལྟ་སྟེ། : thus, as follows [Presentative construction; from `འདི་ལྟ་`: "like this" + `སྟེ་`: connective particle; introduces the illustrative example that follows; functions as an Elaborator in the discourse]

- དཔེར་ན་ : for example [Adverbial phrase; `དཔེ་`: "example" + locative particle `ར་` + `ན་`: conditional marker; introduces the analogy; marks the beginning of the explanatory example]

- མིག་དང་ལྡན་པའི་ : having eyes [Genitive of `མིག་དང་ལྡན་པ་`: "one who possesses eyes"; `མིག་`: "eye" + `དང་`: "with" + `ལྡན་པ་`: "possessing"; describes the agent in the analogy who has normal vision]

- མི་ཞིག་ : a person [Indefinite noun phrase; `མི་`: "person" + indefinite marker `ཞིག་`; the agent in the example scene who has normal eyesight]

- མུན་པར་ : into darkness [Terminative of `མུན་པ་`: "darkness"; indicates the location or environment where the action takes place; functions as Location participant]

- ཞུགས་ན་ : if enters [Conditional clause; `ཞུགས་`: past of `འཇུག་པ་`: "to enter" + conditional marker `ན་`; describes the process of entering darkness]

- ཅི་ཡང་ : anything [Indefinite pronoun; `ཅི་`: "what" + inclusive particle `ཡང་`; object of the seeing process; indicates totality of what cannot be seen]

- མི་མཐོང་བ་ : does not see [Negated verbal phrase; `མི་`: negative prefix + `མཐོང་བ་`: "to see"; describes the resultant state of inability to perceive objects]

- དེ་བཞིན་དུ་ : likewise, similarly [Adverbial phrase; `དེ་བཞིན་`: "like that" + terminative particle `དུ་`; links the example to its application; functions as a connector between the analogy and the actual teaching]

- གང་ : who [Relative pronoun; introduces the relative clause describing the bodhisattva; marks the beginning of the description of the type of bodhisattva]

- དངོས་པོར་ : to/as things [Terminative of `དངོས་པོ་`: "thing", "entity", "substance"; indicates attachment to the substantial existence of phenomena]

- ལྷུང་བས་ : by falling [Instrumental of `ལྷུང་བ་`: "to fall"; here metaphorically means "being caught in" or "succumbing to"; describes the manner of attachment to phenomena]

- སྦྱིན་པ་ : giving, generosity [Noun; Sanskrit: dāna; one of the six perfections (pāramitā); refers to the act of charity or donation]

- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely, thoroughly [Adverbial phrase; intensifier that indicates the thoroughness of the action]

- གཏོང་བའི་ : who gives [Genitive of `གཏོང་བ་`: "to give", "to send"; describes the action performed by the bodhisattva; functions as an attributive modifier]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [Compound noun; `བྱང་ཆུབ་`: "enlightenment" + `སེམས་དཔའ་`: "hero of mind"; refers to one who has generated the mind of enlightenment; the patient being described]

- བལྟ་བར་ : should view, should understand [Future/imperative form of `ལྟ་བ་`: "to look", "to view" + terminative particle `ར་`; indicates how one should regard the situation]

- བྱའོ། ། : should be done [Future/imperative auxiliary verb `བྱ་`: "to do" + final particle `འོ་`; completes the instruction; marks this as a directive or instruction]
