                └── དངོས༌པོར་མ་ལྷུང་བས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "The manner of giving - without attachment to objects" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── དངོས༌པོར [Type: State | Desc: "The state of objectification or attachment to true existence that is avoided" | Implicit: ""]
    └── as in the simile [Type: Relator | Desc: "Implicit relation connecting the two scenes, with the first scene serving as a simile for the second" | Implicit: "Implicit relation connecting the simile with the main teaching"]
glossary:
- ཡང་ : Furthermore [Connective particle; connects this passage to previous discourse; functions as a Linker in the semantic structure]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative case; addressee of Buddha's teaching; functions as Participant-Agent]
- འདི་ལྟ་སྟེ། : it is thus [Demonstrative phrase introducing an example or illustration; introduces the simile that follows]
- དཔེར་ན། : for example [Adverbial phrase marking the beginning of an illustrative example; part of the Linker introducing the simile]
- ནམ་ལངས་ཏེ་ : when dawn breaks [Temporal clause from `ནམ་ལངས་`: dawn breaking; sets the temporal context for the scene that follows; functions as an Adverbial]
- ཉི་མ་ : the sun [Nominative case; agent of the rising action; symbolically represents the arising of wisdom]
- ཤར་ནས་ : having risen [Terminative case of `ཤར་`: to rise; indicates completed action; metaphorically represents the appearance of wisdom that dispels ignorance]
- མིག་དང་ལྡན་པའི་ : who has eyes [Genitive attributive phrase from `མིག་དང་ལྡན་པ་`: possessing eyes/vision; qualifies the person as one with sight; functions as an Elaborator]
- མིས་ : a person [Ergative case of `མི་`: person, human; indicates the agent who performs the action of seeing; functions as Participant-Agent]
- གཟུགས་ : forms [Object case of `གཟུགས་`: form, visible object; the things that are perceived; functions as Participant-Patient]
- རྣམ་པ་ : types [Elaborator describing the nature of the forms]
- སྣ་ཚོགས་ : various [Attributive adjective qualifying the forms as diverse or manifold; part of the Elaborator]
- དག་ : plural marker [Definitizing plural particle; indicates multiple forms]
- མཐོང་བ་ : sees [Present tense of `མཐོང་`: to see, perceive; the main action performed by the person with eyes; functions as the Process]
- དེ་བཞིན་དུ། : likewise [Comparative adverbial phrase; connects the simile to the main teaching; functions as Linker]
- གང་ : who [Relative pronoun; introduces the relative clause describing the bodhisattva]
- དངོས༌པོར་ : as substantial entities [Terminative case of `དངོས་པོ་`: thing, object, substance; refers to conceptualization of phenomena as inherently existent; part of Adverbial]
- མ་ལྷུང་བས་ : without falling into [Instrumental case of the negative form of `ལྷུང་བ་`: to fall; indicates manner - without falling into reification; functions as Adverbial]
- སྦྱིན་པ་ : generosity [Object case of `སྦྱིན་པ་`: giving, generosity, charity; what is being practiced; functions as Participant-Patient]
- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely [Adverbial qualifier indicating thoroughness or completeness]
- གཏོང་བའི་ : who gives [Genitive of `གཏོང་བ་`: to give, send, abandon; describes the action performed by the bodhisattva; functions as Process]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : awakening [First part of compound; refers to enlightenment or awakening]
- སེམས་དཔའ་ : hero [Second part of compound; together with བྱང་ཆུབ་ forms bodhisattva: one who seeks awakening for the benefit of all beings; central Participant-Agent]
- བལྟ་བར་ : should view [Future/prescriptive form of `ལྟ་བ་`: to look, view, understand; main verb of the instruction; functions as Process]
- བྱའོ། : should do [Final auxiliary verb in honorific imperative form; completes the instruction to view the bodhisattva in a particular way]

glossary:
- ཡང་ : Furthermore [Connective particle; links this passage to the preceding one; functions as a Linker in the discourse structure]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Vocative case; name of the Buddha's disciple being addressed; functions as the Addressee at the beginning of Buddha's statement]
- རིགས་ཀྱི་ : of good family [Genitive case of `རིགས་`: family, lineage; indicates those from noble or suitable spiritual lineage; functions as a qualifier of the participants]
- བུའམ་ : sons or [Disjunctive particle `འམ་` with `བུ་`: son; indicates an inclusive alternative; part of the compound referring to practitioners]
- རིགས་ཀྱི་ : of good family [Genitive case of `རིགས་`: family, lineage; repeats to qualify the second group; functions as a qualifier]
- བུ་མོ་ : daughters [Noun; female practitioners; paired with sons to indicate all disciples regardless of gender]
- གང་དག : whoever [Relative pronoun; qualifies which sons or daughters are being discussed; functions as an Elaborator pointing to specific individuals]
- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : of the Dharma [Genitive case of `ཆོས་`: Dharma, teaching; indicates possession; modifies the discourse being referenced]
- རྣམ་གྲངས་ : discourse [Noun; refers to a formal exposition or enumeration of the Dharma; functions as part of the Patient that practitioners engage with]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers specifically to the present teaching; indicates proximity to the speaker]
- ལེན་པ་ : take up [Verbal noun from `ལེན་`: to take, receive; first in the sequence of actions with the dharma; represents the initial engagement with the teaching]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction; connects items in the list of actions]
- འཛིན་པ་ : retain [Verbal noun from `འཛིན་`: to hold, grasp; second action representing memorization and preservation of the teaching]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction; connects items in the list of actions]
- འཆང་བ་ : keep [Verbal noun from `འཆང་`: to possess, maintain; third action representing continued possession of the teachings]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction; connects items in the list of actions]
- ཀློག་པ་ : read [Verbal noun from `ཀློག་`: to read aloud; fourth action representing textual study of the teaching]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction; connects items in the list of actions]
- ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་ : completely [Adverbial form of `ཀུན་ཆུབ་`: complete, thorough; modifies the following verb to indicate thorough mastery]
- བྱེད་པ་ : accomplish [Verbal noun from `བྱེད་`: to do, make; fifth action representing full comprehension and realization of the teaching]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction; connects items in the list of actions]
- གཞན་དག་ : others [Plural form of `གཞན་`: other; refers to other practitioners; functions as the Recipients of the teaching]
- ལ་ : to [Dative particle; indicates the direction or recipient of the action]
- རྒྱ་ཆེར་ : extensively [Adverbial form of `རྒྱ་ཆེ་`: vast, extensive; describes the manner of teaching as comprehensive]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : correctly [Adverbial form of `ཡང་དག་པ་`: correct, authentic; describes the teaching as accurate and true to the original]
- རབ་ཏུ་ : thoroughly [Adverbial intensifier; emphasizes the completeness of the action]
- སྟོན་པ་ : teach [Verbal noun from `སྟོན་`: to show, teach; sixth action representing transmission of the teaching to others]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural pronoun; refers back to the practitioners who perform the six actions]

        └── དེ་ཉིད་གཞི་དེ་ལས་བསོད་ནམས་ཆེས་མང་དུ་གྲངས་མེད་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་བསྐྱེད་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The result scene describing the generation of merit." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་ཉིད [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who generates the merit, referring back to the person mentioned in the condition." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བསོད་ནམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The patient that is being generated - merit." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆེས་མང་དུ་གྲངས་མེད་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial phrase quantifying the extent of the merit generated." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གཞི་དེ་ལས [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relator indicating the comparative basis for the merit." | Implicit: ""]
            └── བསྐྱེད་ན། [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of generating merit, expressed as a condition." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་གིས་ཡི་གེར་བྲིས་ནས་ལེན་པ་དང༌། འཛིན་པ་དང༌། འཆང་བ་དང༌། ཀློག་པ་དང༌། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ་དང༌། གཞན་དག་ལ་རྒྱ་ཆེར་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ་སྟོན་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The second scene describing the increasingly meritorious activities related to the teaching." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who performs the various activities with the teaching." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཡི་གེར་བྲིས་ནས [Type: Process | Desc: "The first process in the sequence of increasingly meritorious activities." | Implicit: ""]
        └── ལེན་པ་དང༌། འཛིན་པ་དང༌། འཆང་བ་དང༌། ཀློག་པ་དང༌། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ་དང༌། གཞན་དག་ལ་རྒྱ་ཆེར་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ་སྟོན་པ [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "A sequence of parallel processes representing increasingly meritorious activities." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ལེན་པ་དང༌། [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of taking up the teaching." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཛིན་པ་དང༌། [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of holding the teaching." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཆང་བ་དང༌། [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of keeping or maintaining the teaching." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཀློག་པ་དང༌། [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of reading the teaching." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ་དང༌། [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of mastering or completely understanding the teaching." | Implicit: ""]
            └── གཞན་དག་ལ་རྒྱ་ཆེར་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ་སྟོན་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The process of teaching the dharma to others, which generates the most merit." | Implicit: ""]
                ├── སྟོན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of teaching or showing." | Implicit: ""]
                ├── གཞན་དག་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipients of the teaching - other people." | Implicit: ""]
                └── རྒྱ་ཆེར་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "The manner in which the teaching is given - extensively and correctly." | Implicit: ""]
    └── ལྟ་ཅི་སྨོས། [Type: Linker | Desc: "A rhetorical question linking the two scenarios and emphasizing that the merit from the activities in scene 2 is even greater than that described in scene 1." | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- གང་གིས་ : whoever [Ergative of `གང་`: who, which; here functioning as the Agent, referring to the person who performs the action]
- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : of the Dharma [Genitive of `ཆོས་`: Dharma, teaching, phenomenon; indicates possession, modifying `རྣམ་གྲངས་`]
- རྣམ་གྲངས་ : discourse [Noun: enumeration, exposition, discourse; here referring to a specific Buddhist teaching or text]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun indicating proximity; functions as a Patient in the semantic structure]
- ཐོས་ནས་ : having heard [Continuative of `ཐོས་`: to hear; indicates sequential action—hearing occurs before not rejecting]
- མི་སྤོང་ན། : if does not reject [Conditional negative of `སྤོང་`: to abandon, reject; forms the protasis of the conditional statement]
- དེ་ཉིད་ : that very person [Emphatic demonstrative: `དེ་`: that + `ཉིད་`: self; refers back to the agent mentioned previously]
- གཞི་དེ་ལས་ : from that basis [Ablative construction: `གཞི་`: basis, foundation + `དེ་`: that + `ལས་`: from; indicates comparison basis]
- བསོད་ནམས་ : merit [Noun: positive karmic energy, merit; functions as the Patient that is being generated]
- ཆེས་ : far [Adverb: very, exceedingly; modifies the quantity of merit]
- མང་དུ་ : abundantly [Adverbial phrase: `མང་`: many + terminative `དུ་`; describes the quantitative extent]
- གྲངས་མེད་ : incalculable [Adjective: countless, numberless; describes the extent of merit generated]
- དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་ : immeasurable [Adjectival phrase: `དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་`: immeasurable, infinite; further emphasizes the vastness of merit]
- བསྐྱེད་ན། : if generates [Conditional of `སྐྱེད་`: to generate, produce; forms the apodosis of the conditional statement]
- གང་གིས་ : whoever [Ergative of `གང་`: who; refers to the Agent performing the subsequent actions with the teaching]
- ཡི་གེར་ : in writing [Terminative of `ཡི་གེ་`: letter, writing; indicates the form in which the teaching is preserved]
- བྲིས་ནས་ : having written [Continuative of `འབྲི་`: to write; sequential action that precedes the following activities]
- ལེན་པ་དང༌། : takes up and [Verbal noun of `ལེན་`: to take, receive + conjunction `དང་`; first in the series of meritorious actions]
- འཛིན་པ་དང༌། : holds and [Verbal noun of `འཛིན་`: to hold, grasp + conjunction `དང་`; second in the series of meritorious actions]
- འཆང་བ་དང༌། : maintains and [Verbal noun of `འཆང་`: to keep, maintain + conjunction `དང་`; third in the series of meritorious actions]
- ཀློག་པ་དང༌། : reads and [Verbal noun of `ཀློག་`: to read + conjunction `དང་`; fourth in the series of meritorious actions]
- ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ་དང༌། : masters completely and [Verbal construction: `ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་`: completely + `བྱེད་`: to do, make; fifth in the series, indicating full comprehension]
- གཞན་དག་ལ་ : to others [Dative of `གཞན་དག་`: others; indicates the Recipients of the teaching]
- རྒྱ་ཆེར་ : extensively [Adverb: widely, extensively; describes the manner of teaching]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : correctly [Adverb: correctly, properly; further describes the quality of teaching]
- རབ་ཏུ་ : thoroughly [Adverb: very, thoroughly; intensifies the manner of teaching]
- སྟོན་པ་ : teaches [Verbal noun of `སྟོན་`: to show, teach; culminating action with the highest merit]
- ལྟ་ཅི་སྨོས། : what need is there to mention? [Rhetorical question: `ལྟ་`: to view + `ཅི་`: what + `སྨོས་`: to mention; emphasizes that the merit from these activities is even greater]

ཡང་རབ་འབྱོར་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ནི་བསམ་གྱིས་མི་ཁྱབ་ཅིང༌། མཚུངས་པ་མེད་དེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing the qualities of the dharma discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཡང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Discourse connector linking this statement to previous content" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The person being addressed (Subhuti)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ནི [Type: Center | Desc: "The central entity being described by the qualities that follow" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་ [Type: Elaborator-Attributive | Desc: "Specifies what kind of discourse this is (a dharma discourse)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བསམ་གྱིས་མི་ཁྱབ་ཅིང༌། མཚུངས་པ་མེད་དེ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "The two qualities attributed to the dharma discourse" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསམ་གྱིས་མི་ཁྱབ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First quality of the dharma discourse" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བསམ་གྱིས་མི་ཁྱབ་ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Description of the dharma discourse as beyond conceptual thinking" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མཚུངས་པ་མེད་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second quality of the dharma discourse" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མཚུངས་པ་མེད་ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Description of the dharma discourse as having no equal" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཅིང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector linking the two parallel qualities" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Sentence-final particle indicating assertion" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [is] [Type: Process-Result | Desc: "Implicit relation indicating the qualities are direct attributes of the dharma discourse" | Implicit: "The implied copular connecting the dharma discourse to its qualities"]
    └── [Buddha] [Type: Addresser | Desc: "The Buddha as the implicit speaker making this statement to Subhuti" | Implicit: "The Buddha as the speaker addressing Subhuti"]
glossary:
- ཡང་ : furthermore [Adverb/connector; connects this statement to the previous discourse; functions as a discourse linker joining this explanation to what came before]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative case; name of the Buddha's disciple being addressed; functions as the recipient of this teaching]
- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : of the Dharma [Genitive case of `ཆོས་`: dharma, teaching, phenomenon; indicates possession, specifying what kind of discourse follows]
- རྣམ་གྲངས་ : discourse [Noun; from `རྣམ་པ་`: aspect and `གྲངས་`: enumeration; refers to a systematic exposition of doctrine]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; identifies the specific discourse being referenced; functions as a deictic marker]
- ནི་ : is [Topic marker; emphasizes what follows as the main subject; establishes the discourse as the theme of discussion]
- བསམ་གྱིས་ : by thought [Instrumental case of `བསམ་པ་`: thought, conception; indicates the means by which the discourse cannot be encompassed]
- མི་ : not [Negation particle; combines with the following verb to indicate impossibility]
- ཁྱབ་ : encompassed [Verb; from `ཁྱབ་པ་`: to pervade, cover, encompass; here indicating that the discourse cannot be fully grasped by conceptual thinking]
- ཅིང༌ : and [Conjunction; connects the two qualities attributed to the discourse; links parallel structures]
- མཚུངས་པ་ : equal [Noun from `མཚུངས་པ་`: to be equal, similar; the quality of comparability]
- མེད་ : without [Negation; from `མེད་པ་`: to not exist; indicates the absence of any equal or comparable teaching]
- དེ། : indeed [Final particle; marks the end of a statement with emphasis; indicates assertion or certainty about what has been stated]

འདིའི་རྣམ་པར་སྨིན་པ་ཡང་བསམ་གྱིས་མི་ཁྱབ་པ་ཉིད་དུ་རིག་པར་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root - Main scene" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདིའི་རྣམ་པར་སྨིན་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The karmic ripening effect that is the subject of understanding" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདིའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Specifies which ripening effect is being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཡང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connects this statement to previous discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བསམ་གྱིས་མི་ཁྱབ་པ་ཉིད་དུ [Type: Attribute | Desc: "Qualitative attribute describing the nature of the ripening effect" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བསམ་གྱིས་མི་ཁྱབ་པ [Type: Adjectival | Desc: "Core descriptive qualifier of the inconceivable nature" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རིག་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action - the act of understanding or realizing" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Buddhist practitioner/disciple] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit agent is the Buddhist practitioner or disciple who has entered the supreme vehicle and is to understand the inconceivable nature" | Implicit: "The implicit agent is the Buddhist practitioner or disciple who has entered the supreme vehicle and is to understand the inconceivable nature"]
    └── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Sentence-final punctuation" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- འདིའི་ : of this [Genitive of `འདི་`: this; here referring to a previously discussed concept, likely a spiritual practice or virtue; functions as a specifier of the ripening effect being discussed]
- རྣམ་པར་ : fully [Adverbial prefix `རྣམ་པར་`: completely, thoroughly; intensifies the concept of ripening/maturation; part of a compound with སྨིན་པ]
- སྨིན་པ་ : ripening effect [Noun from `སྨིན་`: to ripen, mature; in Buddhist context refers to karmic maturation or fruition; the patient/object that is to be understood as inconceivable]
- ཡང་ : also, moreover [Connector particle: links this statement to previous discourse; suggests this understanding is additional to previously mentioned points]
- བསམ་གྱིས་ : by thought [Instrumental of `བསམ་པ་`: thought, thinking; means by which something is conceived or comprehended; forms part of a common Buddhist term]
- མི་ : not [Negation particle: negates the following verb; indicates impossibility]
- ཁྱབ་པ་ : encompassable [Verbal noun from `ཁྱབ་`: to pervade, encompass; that which cannot be encompassed by conceptual thought]
- ཉིད་དུ་ : as being [Abstract nominalizer `ཉིད་` + terminative case `དུ་`: indicates essential nature; emphasizes the definitive quality of inconceivability]
- རིག་པར་ : to understand [Purposive/terminative of `རིག་པ་`: to know, understand; the cognitive process directed at the ripening effect]
- བྱའོ : should be done [Future tense of `བྱེད་`: to do + final particle `འོ་`; indicates prescription or instruction; completes the verbal phrase "should be understood"]
- ། : [Sentence-final punctuation mark indicating the completion of a statement]

ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ནི་ཐེག་པ་མཆོག་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པའི་སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་ཀྱི་དོན་དང༌། ཐེག་པ་ཕུལ་དུ་ཕྱིན་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པའི་སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་ཀྱི་དོན་གྱི་ཕྱིར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire sentence about the dharma discourse being taught" | Implicit: ""]

    ├── གསུངས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of teaching/expressing the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཐེག་པ་མཆོག་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པའི་སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་ཀྱི་དོན་དང༌། ཐེག་པ་ཕུལ་དུ་ཕྱིན་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པའི་སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་ཀྱི་དོན་གྱི་ཕྱིར [Type: Purpose | Desc: "The purpose for which the teaching was given" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཐེག་པ་མཆོག་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པའི་སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་ཀྱི་དོན [Type: Scene | Desc: "First recipient group and purpose" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དོན [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The benefit/purpose for the first group of beings" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཐེག་པ་མཆོག་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པའི་སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The first group of recipients - bodhisattvas on the Mahayana path" | Implicit: "bodhisattvas, Mahayana"]
        ├── ཐེག་པ་ཕུལ་དུ་ཕྱིན་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པའི་སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་ཀྱི་དོན་གྱི་ཕྱིར [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second recipient group and purpose" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཐེག་པ་ཕུལ་དུ་ཕྱིན་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པའི་སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The second group of recipients - also bodhisattvas on the Mahayana path" | Implicit: "bodhisattvas, another name for Mahayana"]
            └── དོན་གྱི་ཕྱིར [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The benefit/purpose for the second group of beings" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector between the two recipient groups" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Speaker | Desc: "The speaker/teacher of the dharma discourse" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : of the Dharma [Genitive case of `ཆོས་`: dharma, teaching, phenomenon; refers to the Buddha's teachings; functions as a possessive modifier in the UCCA structure]
- རྣམ་གྲངས་ : discourse [from `རྣམ་གྲངས་`: enumeration, discourse, exposition; refers to a specific teaching or exposition of dharma; central entity in the sentence per UCCA]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies the particular discourse being referenced; part of the central participant]
- ནི་ : is [Topic marker; highlights the subject of the sentence; indicates what follows is about this specific discourse]
- ཐེག་པ་ : vehicle [from `ཐེག་པ་`: vehicle, path, method; refers to a Buddhist path of practice; part of recipient description]
- མཆོག་ : supreme [from `མཆོག་`: supreme, highest, excellent; refers to Mahayana as the supreme vehicle; modifier for the preceding noun]
- ལ་ : in, on [Locative case marker; indicates relationship to the path; connects beings to the vehicle they follow]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly, genuinely [from `ཡང་དག་པ་`: authentic, correct, genuine; adverbial form; describes how beings have entered the path]
- ཞུགས་པའི་ : who have entered [Past/perfect form of `འཇུག་པ་`: to enter, engage; genitive form; describes beings who have committed to the path]
- སེམས་ཅན་ : beings [from `སེམས་ཅན་`: sentient being; refers to those who practice Buddhism; recipient participants in the UCCA structure]
- རྣམས་ : plural marker [Pluralizes the preceding noun; indicates multiple beings]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive marker; connects beings to their benefit]
- དོན་ : benefit, purpose [from `དོན་`: meaning, purpose, benefit; what the teaching aims to achieve; goal in UCCA structure]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction; connects the two groups of recipients; linker in UCCA structure]
- ཐེག་པ་ : vehicle [from `ཐེག་པ་`: vehicle, path, method; second reference to Buddhist path]
- ཕུལ་དུ་ཕྱིན་པ་ : consummate, excellent [from `ཕུལ་དུ་ཕྱིན་པ་`: supreme, excellent, consummate; another description of Mahayana; modifier showing quality]
- ལ་ : in, on [Locative case marker; indicates relationship to the path; connects beings to the vehicle they follow]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly, genuinely [from `ཡང་དག་པ་`: authentic, correct, genuine; adverbial form; describes how beings have entered the path]
- ཞུགས་པའི་ : who have entered [Past/perfect form of `འཇུག་པ་`: to enter, engage; genitive form; describes beings who have committed to the path]
- སེམས་ཅན་ : beings [from `སེམས་ཅན་`: sentient being; refers to the second group of practitioners; recipient in UCCA structure]
- རྣམས་ : plural marker [Pluralizes the preceding noun; indicates multiple beings]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive marker; connects beings to their benefit]
- དོན་ : benefit, purpose [from `དོན་`: meaning, purpose, benefit; what the teaching aims to achieve; goal in UCCA structure]
- གྱི་ཕྱིར་ : for the sake of [Purposive construction `གྱི་ཕྱིར་`: for, in order to; indicates the motivation behind the teaching; marks purpose in UCCA]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [Instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Thus-Gone One, Buddha; indicates who performed the action; speaker/agent in UCCA]
- གསུངས་སོ། : taught, expressed [Past tense of `གསུང་བ་`: to speak, teach (honorific); with final particle indicating completion; main process/action in UCCA]

source: གང་དག་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ལེན་པ་དང༌། འཛིན་པ་དང༌། འཆང་བ་དང༌། ཀློག་པ་དང༌། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ་དང༌། གཞན་དག་ལ་རྒྱ་ཆེར་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ་སྟོན་པ་དེ་དག་ནི་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་མཁྱེན། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གཟིགས་ཏེ།
ucca_formatted:
གང་དག་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ལེན་པ་དང༌། འཛིན་པ་དང༌། འཆང་བ་དང༌། ཀློག་པ་དང༌། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ་དང༌། གཞན་དག་ལ་རྒྱ་ཆེར་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ་སྟོན་པ་དེ་དག་ནི་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་མཁྱེན། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གཟིགས་ཏེ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node representing the entire text" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་དག་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་ལེན་པ་དང༌། འཛིན་པ་དང༌། འཆང་བ་དང༌། ཀློག་པ་དང༌། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ་དང༌། གཞན་དག་ལ་རྒྱ་ཆེར་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ་སྟོན་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First main scene describing people engaging with the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་དག [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The people who engage with the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma discourse that is the object of various activities" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ལེན་པ་དང༌། འཛིན་པ་དང༌། འཆང་བ་དང༌། ཀློག་པ་དང༌། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ་དང༌། གཞན་དག་ལ་རྒྱ་ཆེར་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ་སྟོན་པ [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Parallel processes related to engaging with the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ལེན་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene of receiving the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ལེན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of receiving" | Implicit: ""]
                └── [the dharma discourse] [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "Implicit reference to the dharma discourse being received" | Implicit: "Implicit reference to the dharma discourse being received"]
            ├── འཛིན་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene of holding the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── འཛིན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of holding" | Implicit: ""]
                └── [the dharma discourse] [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "Implicit reference to the dharma discourse being held" | Implicit: "Implicit reference to the dharma discourse being held"]
            ├── འཆང་བ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene of retaining the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── འཆང་བ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of retaining" | Implicit: ""]
                └── [the dharma discourse] [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "Implicit reference to the dharma discourse being retained" | Implicit: "Implicit reference to the dharma discourse being retained"]
            ├── ཀློག་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene of reading the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཀློག་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of reading" | Implicit: ""]
                └── [the dharma discourse] [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "Implicit reference to the dharma discourse being read" | Implicit: "Implicit reference to the dharma discourse being read"]
            ├── ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene of mastering the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of mastering" | Implicit: ""]
                └── [the dharma discourse] [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "Implicit reference to the dharma discourse being mastered" | Implicit: "Implicit reference to the dharma discourse being mastered"]
            ├── གཞན་དག་ལ་རྒྱ་ཆེར་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ་སྟོན་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene of teaching the dharma to others" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── སྟོན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of teaching" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── གཞན་དག་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipients of the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── རྒྱ་ཆེར་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial phrase qualifying how the teaching is done" | Implicit: ""]
                └── [the dharma discourse] [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "Implicit reference to the dharma discourse being taught" | Implicit: "Implicit reference to the dharma discourse being taught"]
            └── དང༌། [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connector joining the parallel processes in a cohesive sequence" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་དག་ནི་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་མཁྱེན། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གཟིགས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second main scene describing the Tathagata's knowledge" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་དག་ནི [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Reference back to the people who engage with the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་མཁྱེན [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Scene of the Tathagata's knowing" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མཁྱེན [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of knowing" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The one who knows" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── [deeply, with insight into their future merit] [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Implicit qualifier of the Tathagata's knowing" | Implicit: "Implicit qualifier of the Tathagata's knowing"]
            └── [they will attain immeasurable merit and buddhahood] [Type: Implicit Purpose | Desc: "Implicit content about the consequence of the Tathagata's knowing" | Implicit: "Implicit content about the consequence of the Tathagata's knowing"]
        └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གཟིགས་ཏེ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Scene of the Tathagata's seeing" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གཟིགས་ཏེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of seeing" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The one who sees" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── [with profound vision of their spiritual potential] [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Implicit qualifier of the Tathagata's seeing" | Implicit: "Implicit qualifier of the Tathagata's seeing"]
            └── [they will attain immeasurable merit and buddhahood] [Type: Implicit Purpose | Desc: "Implicit content about the consequence of the Tathagata's seeing" | Implicit: "Implicit content about the consequence of the Tathagata's seeing"]
glossary:
- གང་དག : whoever [Plural marker `དག` with interrogative pronoun `གང`; refers to specific people who engage with the dharma; functions as Agent participant in the first main scene]

- ཆོས་ཀྱི : of the Dharma [Genitive case of `ཆོས`; dharma/teaching; indicates possession relationship with the following term; part of the Patient participant]

- རྣམ་གྲངས་ : discourse [From `རྣམ་` (complete) + `གྲངས་` (count/enumeration); refers to an exposition or enumerated teaching of Dharma; part of the Patient participant]

- འདི : this [Demonstrative pronoun; specifically pointing to the present discourse; completes the Patient participant phrase]

- ལེན་པ་ : receive [Verbal noun from `ལེན་`; to take, accept, receive; first in series of processes performed on the dharma discourse]

- དང༌། : and [Conjunction particle; connects parallel actions in a series]

- འཛིན་པ་ : hold [Verbal noun from `འཛིན་`; to grasp, hold, maintain; second process related to the dharma]

- དང༌། : and [Conjunction particle; connects parallel actions]

- འཆང་བ་ : retain [Verbal noun from `འཆང་`; to possess, keep, retain; third process related to the dharma]

- དང༌། : and [Conjunction particle; connects parallel actions]

- ཀློག་པ་ : read [Verbal noun from `ཀློག་`; to read aloud, recite; fourth process related to the dharma]

- དང༌། : and [Conjunction particle; connects parallel actions]

- ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་ : thoroughly [Adverbial form of `ཀུན་ཆུབ་པ་`; completely, thoroughly; modifies the following verb]

- བྱེད་པ་ : master [Verbal noun from `བྱེད་`; to do, make; here indicates complete mastery or comprehension of the dharma]

- དང༌། : and [Conjunction particle; connects the final action in the series]

- གཞན་དག་ : others [Plural form of `གཞན་`; other people; functions as Recipient participant in the teaching scene]

- ལ་ : to [Dative/Locative particle; indicates the recipient of the action]

- རྒྱ་ཆེར་ : extensively [Adverb from `རྒྱ་ཆེ་བ་`; vast, extensive; qualifies how the teaching is done]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [Adverb from `ཡང་དག་པ་`; correct, perfect, authentic; further qualifies the teaching]

- རབ་ཏུ་ : thoroughly [Adverb from `རབ་`; supreme, excellent; intensifies the following verb]

- སྟོན་པ་ : teach [Verbal noun from `སྟོན་`; to show, demonstrate, teach; final process in relation to the dharma]

- དེ་དག་ : those [Plural demonstrative pronoun; refers back to all people who engage with the dharma as described above]

- ནི་ : indeed [Topic marker particle; emphasizes and highlights the subject]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Instrumental/Agentive of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`; literally "Thus-Gone One," epithet for Buddha; functions as Agent in the second scene]

- མཁྱེན། : knows [Honorific verb form for knowing; indicates the Buddha's omniscient knowledge of these practitioners]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Instrumental/Agentive case repeated for emphasis; Agent of the second parallel process]

- གཟིགས་ཏེ། : sees [Honorific verb form for seeing + connective particle; indicates the Buddha's direct perception of these practitioners and their future spiritual attainments]

ucca_formatted:
སེམས་ཅན་དེ་དག་ཐམས་ཅད་ནི་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་དང་ལྡན་པར་འགྱུར་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire sentence about sentient beings becoming endowed with immeasurable merit" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས་ཅན་དེ་དག་ཐམས་ཅད་ནི [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The experiencer who becomes endowed with merit" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན [Type: Center | Desc: "The core concept of sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་དག་ཐམས་ཅད་ནི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Specifies which sentient beings are being referred to" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལྡན་པར་འགྱུར་ [Type: State-Change | Desc: "Indicates the transformation or change of state of becoming endowed with merit" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The merit accumulation that the sentient beings become endowed with" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསོད་ནམས [Type: Center | Desc: "The core concept of merit" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Specifies the merit as an accumulation" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་དང་ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Qualifies the merit accumulation as being immeasurable" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Noun: `སེམས་ཅན་`: living beings with consciousness; refers to all beings capable of experience; functions as the primary Experiencer in the sentence]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative pronoun: `དེ་དག་`: those, them; specifies which sentient beings are being referred to; part of the elaboration of the main participant]
- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Universal quantifier: `ཐམས་ཅད་`: all, entire, complete; encompasses the totality of the sentient beings mentioned; completes the elaboration of the participant]

- བསོད་ནམས་ : merit [Noun: `བསོད་ནམས་`: positive karma, virtue, merit; the positive spiritual energy accumulated through virtuous actions; the core concept of what the beings become endowed with]

- ལྡན་པར་ : endowed with [Verbal noun: `ལྡན་པ་`: to possess, be endowed with; with terminative particle `ར་`; indicates the state of having or possessing the merit]

glossary:
- བསོད་ནམས་ : merit [Root noun: `བསོད་ནམས་`: positive karmic energy or virtue; refers to positive spiritual energy accumulated through virtuous actions; functions as the core subject of what is being accumulated]

- ཕུང་པོ་ : accumulation [Root noun: `ཕུང་པོ་`: heap, aggregate, skandha; here refers to a vast collection or accumulation of merit; forms the core concept with བསོད་ནམས་]
- བསམ་གྱིས་ : by thought [Instrumental of `བསམ་པ་`: to think, imagine; used as part of a fixed expression with མི་ཁྱབ་པ་]

- མཚུངས་པ་ : equal [Verbal noun from `མཚུངས་`: to be equal, similar; here describes the incomparable nature of the merit]
- མེད་པ་ : without [Negation of existence; `མེད་`: to not exist; with མཚུངས་པ་ forms "without equal" or "incomparable"]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction connecting to the next attribute]
- གཞལ་དུ་ : to measure [Purposive/directional form of `གཞལ་བ་`: to measure, to weigh; used with the negative མེད་པ་]
- མེད་པ་ : not possible [Negative existential; with གཞལ་དུ་ forms "immeasurable" or "unable to be measured"]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction connecting to the final attribute]
- ཚད་ : measure [Root noun: `ཚད་`: limit, measurement; used with མེད་པ་]
- མེད་པ་ : without [Negative existential; with ཚད་ forms "limitless" or "without measure"]
- དང་ : with [Associative particle connecting all the qualities to ལྡན་པར་]
- ལྡན་པར་ : endowed with [Terminative of `ལྡན་པ་`: to possess, be endowed with; describes the state of possessing the previously mentioned qualities]
- འགྱུར་ : will become [Future/present form of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform; indicates the process of becoming endowed with merit]
- ཏེ : and so [Continuative particle indicating that this statement relates to something else; connects this sentence to a broader context]

glossary:
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Noun; root `སེམས་ཅན་`: sentient being, any being with mind/consciousness; functions as the Patient in the sentence who will carry the enlightenment]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative pronoun; `དེ་`: that + `དག་`: plural marker; specifies particular sentient beings being referenced]
- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Universal quantifier; `ཐམས་ཅད་`: all, every, complete set; indicates totality of the sentient beings referred to]
- ངའི་ : my [First-person genitive/possessive; `ང་`: I + `འི་`: genitive case marker; identifies the speaker (Buddha) as the possessor of the enlightenment]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Noun; `བྱང་ཆུབ་`: bodhi, awakening, enlightenment; the object being carried, represents the spiritual goal/achievement]
- ཕྲག་པ་ : shoulders [Noun; `ཕྲག་པ་`: shoulder; functions as the location where the enlightenment will be placed/carried]
- ལ་ : on/upon [Locative case marker; indicates location or direction; shows where the enlightenment will be carried]
- ཐོགས་པར་ : will carry/bear [Verb; root `ཐོགས་`: to carry, bear, hold + `པར་`: complementizer; describes the future action of carrying enlightenment as a burden]
- འགྱུར་རོ : will become [Verb + final particle; `འགྱུར་`: become/transform + `རོ`: sentence-final particle indicating completion/certainty; marks the future state change]

        ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The discourse that cannot be comprehended" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept of the discourse" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Specifier indicating this particular discourse" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མཉན་པར་མི་ནུས་ཏེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of being unable to listen/comprehend" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; referring to a previous statement or topic; functions as the Patient element in the questioning scene]
- ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ : for what reason [Interrogative compound; `ཅི་` (what) + genitive particle `འི་` + `ཕྱིར་` (for the sake of); forms part of the process element in the questioning structure]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional marker; from `ཞེས་` (quotative) + `ན་` (if); concludes the interrogative phrase; marks this as a rhetorical question introducing an explanation]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; vocative case; the disciple being addressed by the Buddha; functions as Address element in the explanatory scene]
- དམན་པ་ : inferior [Adjective from `དམན་` (low, lesser); refers to lesser or inferior views or paths; object of inclination in the following compound]
- ལ་ : to, towards [Locative/directional particle; connects `དམན་པ་` with `མོས་པ་`; indicates the direction of inclination]
- མོས་པ་ : inclined [Verbal noun from `མོས་` (to be inclined towards, have faith in); describes the mental attitude of the subjects]
- རྣམས་ : plural [Plural marker; indicates multiple beings with inferior inclinations]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [Ergative/instrumental case particle; marks the agent performing the action]
- ཆོས་ : dharma [Noun; teaching, phenomenon, doctrine; root of the compound object]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; connects `ཆོས་` with `རྣམ་གྲངས་`]
- རྣམ་གྲངས་ : discourse [Noun; enumeration, exposition, discourse; refers to a systematic explanation of doctrine]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative adjective; specifies this particular teaching being discussed; elaborator of the patient element]
- མཉན་པར་ : to listen to, comprehend [Verbal noun from `མཉན་` (to listen) + terminative particle `པར་`; indicates purpose; the process that cannot be performed]
- མི་ : not [Negative particle; negates the following verb]
- ནུས་ : able [Verb; to be able, capable; indicates inability when combined with the negative particle]
- ཏེ། : and, so [Continuative particle; indicates that more explanation will follow; ends the sentence but connects it to what follows]

glossary:
# Word-by-Word Glossary

- བདག་ཏུ་ : as a self [Terminative case marker `ཏུ་` attached to `བདག་`: self, I, ego; indicates the conceptual framework through which reality is mistakenly viewed; functions as an Elaborator specifying the type of view]
- ལྟ་བ་ : view [Nominalized form of `ལྟ་`: to look, to view; here refers to philosophical perspective or conceptual framework; forms part of the Center of the statement]
- རྣམས་ : plural marker [Plural marker indicating multiple holders of the view; extends the noun phrase to refer to all those who hold this view]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker indicating agency; shows that these view-holders are being discussed as potential agents who cannot understand the teaching; completes the Adverbial phrase]
- མ་ཡིན : is not [Negation particle `མ་` + copula `ཡིན`; negates an implicit understanding that such people can comprehend the dharma teaching; functions as the State in the semantic structure]
- །: full stop [Punctuation marking the end of the first statement]

- སེམས་ཅན་དུ་ : as sentient beings [Terminative case marker `དུ་` attached to `སེམས་ཅན་`: sentient being, living creature; indicates another mistaken framework for viewing reality; functions as an Elaborator specifying the type of view]
- ལྟ་བ་ : view [Nominalized form of `ལྟ་`: to look, to view; same as above, refers to philosophical perspective; forms part of the Center of the statement]
- རྣམས་ : plural marker [Plural marker indicating multiple holders of the view; extends the reference to all those holding this perspective]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker indicating agency; shows that these view-holders are being discussed as potential agents; completes the Adverbial phrase]
- མ་ཡིན : is not [Negation particle `མ་` + copula `ཡིན`; negates an implicit understanding that such people can comprehend the dharma teaching; functions as the State in the semantic structure]
- །: full stop [Punctuation marking the end of the second statement]

- སྲོག་ཏུ་ : as a life-force [Terminative case marker `ཏུ་` attached to `སྲོག་`: life, vitality, life-force; indicates a third mistaken framework for viewing reality; functions as an Elaborator specifying the type of view]
- ལྟ་བ་ : view [Nominalized form of `ལྟ་`: to look, to view; same as above, refers to philosophical perspective; forms part of the Center of the statement]
- རྣམས་ : plural marker [Plural marker indicating multiple holders of the view; extends the reference to all those holding this perspective]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker indicating agency; shows that these view-holders are being discussed as potential agents; completes the Adverbial phrase]
- མ་ཡིན : is not [Negation particle `མ་` + copula `ཡིན`; negates an implicit understanding that such people can comprehend the dharma teaching; functions as the State in the semantic structure]
- ཞིང༌ : and, moreover [Conjunction particle connecting this statement to what follows in the text; indicates that these three negative statements are part of a larger discourse; functions as a Linker in the semantic structure]
- །: full stop [Punctuation marking the end of the third statement]

གང་ཟག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས་མཉན་པ་དང༌། བླང་བ་དང༌། གཟུང་བ་དང༌། བཀླག་པ་དང༌། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་མི་ནུས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene of the entire statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་ཟག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བ་རྣམས་ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who cannot perform the actions" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་ཟག་ [Type: Center | Desc: "The object of view (personhood)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཏུ་ [Type: Function | Desc: "Relational marker" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མི་ནུས་ཏེ། [Type: Process | Desc: "Main process - inability to perform actions" | Implicit: ""]
    └── མཉན་པ་དང༌། བླང་བ་དང༌། གཟུང་བ་དང༌། བཀླག་པ་དང༌། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་ [Type: Center | Desc: "Parallel scenes of actions that cannot be performed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མཉན་པ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Action of listening" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མཉན་པ་ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of listening" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── those who view personhood [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent - same as main agent" | Implicit: "those who view personhood"]
            └── profound Dharma discourse [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "Implicit object of listening" | Implicit: "profound Dharma discourse"]
        ├── བླང་བ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Action of taking up" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བླང་བ་ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of taking up" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── those who view personhood [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent - same as main agent" | Implicit: "those who view personhood"]
            └── profound Dharma discourse [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "Implicit object of taking up" | Implicit: "profound Dharma discourse"]
        ├── གཟུང་བ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Action of grasping" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གཟུང་བ་ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of grasping" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── those who view personhood [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent - same as main agent" | Implicit: "those who view personhood"]
            └── profound Dharma discourse [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "Implicit object of grasping" | Implicit: "profound Dharma discourse"]
        ├── བཀླག་པ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Action of reading" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བཀླག་པ་ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of reading" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── those who view personhood [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent - same as main agent" | Implicit: "those who view personhood"]
            └── profound Dharma discourse [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "Implicit object of reading" | Implicit: "profound Dharma discourse"]
        └── ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Action of comprehending" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of comprehending" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── those who view personhood [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent - same as main agent" | Implicit: "those who view personhood"]
            └── profound Dharma discourse [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "Implicit object of comprehending" | Implicit: "profound Dharma discourse"]
glossary:
- གང་ཟག་ : personhood [noun, refers to the concept of personal identity or self; functions as the object of view in the UCCA structure]
- ཏུ་ : as [terminative case particle; indicates transformation or identification; functions as a relational marker connecting 'personhood' with 'view']
- ལྟ་བ་ : view [verbal noun from `ལྟ་`: to look, view, regard; here referring to the philosophical stance or perspective that reifies personhood]
- རྣམས་ : those [plural marker; indicates multiple individuals holding this view]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [instrumental case particle; marks the agent performing the action; connects the subject to the verbs that follow]
- མཉན་པ་ : listen [verbal noun from `ཉན་`: to hear, listen; refers to the act of listening to teachings; functions as a process with an implied object of "profound Dharma discourse"]
- དང༌། : and [conjunction; connects parallel actions in the list]
- བླང་བ་ : take up [verbal noun from `ལེན་`: to take, accept; refers to adopting or accepting teachings; functions as a process with implied Buddhist teachings as the patient]
- དང༌། : and [conjunction; connects parallel actions in the list]
- གཟུང་བ་ : grasp [verbal noun from `འཛིན་`: to hold, grasp; refers to mentally retaining teachings; functions as a process with implied Buddhist teachings as the patient]
- དང༌། : and [conjunction; connects parallel actions in the list]
- བཀླག་པ་ : read [verbal noun from `ཀློག་`: to read; refers to studying written teachings; functions as a process with implied Buddhist texts as the patient]
- དང༌། : and [conjunction; connects parallel actions in the list]
- ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་ : comprehensively [adverbial form of `ཀུན་ཆུབ་`: to understand completely; indicates the thoroughness of the understanding]
- བྱེད་ : do [present tense verb; here functioning as part of the compound verb "to comprehend completely"]
- མི་ : not [negative particle; negates the following verb]
- ནུས་ : able [verb; indicates capability or capacity; functions as the main process of the sentence denoting inability]
- ཏེ། : thus/for [conjunction; indicates that an explanation or reason follows]

དེ་ནི་གནས་མེད་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ [Type: Participant-Center | Desc: "Reference to the subject/topic being discussed (teaching or individuals mentioned previously)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ནི་ [Type: Function | Desc: "Topic marker indicating what is being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཕྱིར་ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Indicates the reason or causal relationship" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གནས་མེད་པའི་ [Type: State | Desc: "State of having no basis or opportunity for certain individuals to understand or accept the teaching" | Implicit: "Absence of opportunity or basis for certain individuals to understand or accept the teaching"]
        ├── གནས་ [Type: Center | Desc: "The concept of basis or opportunity that is lacking" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མེད་པའི་ [Type: Function | Desc: "Negation indicating absence of the basis/opportunity" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རོ། ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Sentence-final particle indicating completion of statement" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun referring to the subject/topic being discussed; the teaching or individuals mentioned previously; functions as the main Participant in the sentence]
- ནི་ : as for [Topic marker indicating what is being discussed; emphasizes the subject 'that' as the focus of the statement]
- གནས་ : basis [Noun meaning foundation, basis, place, opportunity; here refers to the basis or opportunity for understanding]
- མེད་པའི་ : does not exist [Negation of 'གནས་' (basis); genitive form of 'མེད་པ་' (non-existence); indicates the complete absence of opportunity or basis for certain individuals to understand or accept the teaching]
- ཕྱིར་ : because [Postposition indicating reason or cause; links the non-existence of basis to the conclusion being drawn]
- རོ། ། : indeed. [Sentence-final particle marking the completion of statement with emphasis; indicates definitive conclusion]

ཡང་རབ་འབྱོར་ས་ཕྱོགས་གང་ན་མདོ་སྡེ་འདི་སྟོན་པའི་ས་ཕྱོགས་དེ་ལྷ་དང་། མི་དང་། ལྷ་མ་ཡིན་དུ་བཅས་པའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱིས་མཆོད་པ་བྱ་བར་འོས་པར་འགྱུར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཡང་ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Discourse connector indicating addition or continuation" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Addressee of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ས་ཕྱོགས་གང་ན་མདོ་སྡེ་འདི་སྟོན་པའི་ས་ཕྱོགས་དེ [Type: Location | Desc: "Location that becomes like a sacred shrine (མཆོད་རྟེན) when the sutra is taught there" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ས་ཕྱོགས་གང་ན [Type: Center | Desc: "The central referent of the location being described" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མདོ་སྡེ་འདི་ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The sutra that is taught at the location" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སྟོན་པའི་ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Process qualifying the location as one where the sutra is taught" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མཆོད་པ་བྱ་བར་འོས་པར་འགྱུར་རོ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process describing that the place becomes worthy of three types of veneration: offerings/honoring (མཆོད་པ), prostration/paying homage (ཕྱག་བྱ་བ), and circumambulation (བསྐོར་བར་བྱ་བ)" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ལྷ་དང་། མི་དང་། ལྷ་མ་ཡིན་དུ་བཅས་པའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Beings who perform the honoring of the place" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཇིག་རྟེན་ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept of 'world' or 'worldly beings'" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལྷ་དང་ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "One category of beings who honor the place" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མི་དང་ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Second category of beings who honor the place" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ལྷ་མ་ཡིན་དུ་བཅས་པའི་ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Third category of beings who honor the place" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཡང་ : furthermore [Discourse connector; functioning as a linking adverb to continue from previous statements; introduces a new point about the holiness of places where the sutra is taught]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative case; name of Buddha's disciple being addressed; acts as the recipient/addressee of the teaching]

- ས་ཕྱོགས་ : place [Nominative of `ས་ཕྱོགས་`: location, spot, area; refers to the physical location that becomes sacred]

- གང་ན་ : wherever [Locative interrogative pronoun functioning as a relative pronoun; connects the condition to the main clause]

- མདོ་སྡེ་ : sutra [Nominative of `མདོ་སྡེ་`: discourse, scripture; specifically refers to this Diamond Sutra text]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun qualifying `མདོ་སྡེ་`; indicates the specific sutra being discussed]

- སྟོན་པའི་ : is taught [Genitive of `སྟོན་པ་`: to teach, explain, demonstrate; here functioning as a verbal modifier of `ས་ཕྱོགས་`]

- ས་ཕྱོགས་ : place [Nominative, repeated from above; the head noun that is qualified by the preceding relative clause]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the place that was just specified]

- ལྷ་ : gods [Genitive in series; celestial beings at the highest level of the three realms; one category of beings who will honor the place]

- དང་ : and [Conjunction connecting items in a list]

- མི་ : humans [Genitive in series; beings of the human realm; second category of beings who will honor the place]

- དང་ : and [Conjunction connecting items in a list]

- ལྷ་མ་ཡིན་ : asuras [Genitive; lit. "non-gods"; demi-gods or titans; the third category of beings who will honor the place]

- དུ་བཅས་པའི་ : including [Terminative case (`དུ་`) with inclusive verb (`བཅས་པ་`) in genitive; indicates completion of the list of beings]

- འཇིག་རྟེན་ : world [Genitive; `འཇིག་རྟེན་`: the transient world or its inhabitants; refers collectively to all the worldly beings]

- གྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates the agent performing the action of honoring]

- མཆོད་པ་ : veneration [Nominative of `མཆོད་པ་`: to make offerings, worship; the act of showing reverence]

- བྱ་བར་ : to be done [Future/purposive form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do, perform; with terminative case marker (`བར་`); indicates the purpose]

- འོས་པར་ : worthy [Terminative of `འོས་པ་`: fitting, worthy, deserving; indicates the place becomes deserving of veneration]

- འགྱུར་རོ : will become [Future tense of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform; with final particle (`རོ`); indicates the definite future result]

ucca_formatted:
ས་ཕྱོགས་དེ་ཕྱག་བྱ་བར་འོས་པ་དང༌། བསྐོར་བ་བྱ་བར་འོས་པར་འགྱུར་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "main_scene" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ས་ཕྱོགས་དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "place_that_becomes_worthy" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འགྱུར་ཏེ [Type: State-of-Affairs | Desc: "state_of_becoming" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཕྱག་བྱ་བར་འོས་པ་དང༌། བསྐོར་བ་བྱ་བར་འོས་པར [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "parallel_worthiness" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཕྱག་བྱ་བར་འོས་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "prostration_worthiness" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཕྱག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "act_of_prostration" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བྱ་བར་འོས་པ [Type: State | Desc: "state_of_worthiness" | Implicit: ""]
            └── gods, humans, and demigods [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "implicit_agents_of_prostration" | Implicit: "Clarifies the implicit agents who would perform the prostration, as understood in Buddhist context"]
        ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "conjunction" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བསྐོར་བ་བྱ་བར་འོས་པར [Type: Scene | Desc: "circumambulation_worthiness" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བསྐོར་བ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "act_of_circumambulation" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བྱ་བར་འོས་པར [Type: State | Desc: "state_of_worthiness" | Implicit: ""]
            └── gods, humans, and demigods [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "implicit_agents_of_circumambulation" | Implicit: "Clarifies the implicit agents who would perform the circumambulation, as understood in Buddhist context"]
    └── like a sacred monument [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "implicit_comparison_to_stupa" | Implicit: "Clarifies that the place becomes like a sacred monument (stupa), which is not explicitly stated in the text"]
glossary:
- ས་ཕྱོགས་ : that place [Compound of `ས་`: earth/ground and `ཕྱོགས་`: direction/place; referring to a specific sacred location; functions as the Patient (the entity undergoing change) in the main scene]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun marking a specific place; functions as a specifier identifying the particular place being discussed]
- ཕྱག་ : prostration [Noun referring to the Buddhist devotional practice of full-body prostration; the Patient of the first parallel scene describing an action that would be performed by implicit agents (gods, humans, and demigods)]
- བྱ་བར་ : to be done [Future/purposive form of `བྱེད་`: to do/perform; indicates the purpose or intention; part of the verbal construction expressing worthiness]
- འོས་པ་ : worthy of [Adjective from `འོས་`: to be worthy/fitting; indicates the place deserves this particular ritual action; forms part of the State description]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction linking the two parallel scenes of worthiness (prostration and circumambulation)]
- བསྐོར་བ་ : circumambulation [Verbal noun from `སྐོར་`: to circle/revolve; referring to the ritual practice of walking clockwise around a sacred object; Patient of the second parallel scene]
- བྱ་བར་ : to be done [Future/purposive form of `བྱེད་`: to do/perform; identical construction as in the first scene but applied to circumambulation]
- འོས་པར་ : worthy of [Adjective from `འོས་`: to be worthy/fitting; in terminative case indicating the resulting state; forms part of the State description in the second parallel scene]
- འགྱུར་ཏེ : becomes [Verb `འགྱུར་`: to become/transform + connective particle `ཏེ`; indicates the place undergoes a transformation in status; the main verb expressing the State-of-Affairs of the entire sentence]

ས་ཕྱོགས་དེ་མཆོད་རྟེན་ལྟ་བུར་འགྱུར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing transformation of a place" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ས་ཕྱོགས་དེ་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The location undergoing transformation" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འགྱུར་རོ [Type: State-Change | Desc: "Process of transformation rather than action" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མཆོད་རྟེན་ལྟ་བུར་ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner of transformation with simile structure" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མཆོད་རྟེན་ [Type: Center | Desc: "The reference object in the simile" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ལྟ་བུར་ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Simile marker indicating resemblance rather than literal transformation" | Implicit: ""]
    └── worthy of veneration [Type: Contextual-Consequence | Desc: "Implicit consequence of the transformation - the place becomes worthy of veneration by gods and humans, comparable to a stupa" | Implicit: "Implicit consequence of the transformation - the place becomes worthy of veneration by gods and humans, comparable to a stupa"]
glossary:
- ས་ཕྱོགས་ : location [Compound noun: `ས་` (earth, ground, place) + `ཕྱོགས་` (direction, region, area); refers to a specific physical location; functions as the Patient undergoing transformation in the sentence]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun indicating a specific location previously mentioned; acts as a determiner specifying which location is being referenced]

- མཆོད་རྟེན་ : stupa [Compound noun: `མཆོད་` (offering, worship) + `རྟེན་` (support, container); refers to a Buddhist religious monument containing relics; serves as the reference object in the simile]

- ལྟ་བུར་ : like, resembling [Compound: `ལྟ་བུ་` (similar to, like) + locative particle `-ར་`; marks a simile structure rather than literal transformation; functions as an Elaborator in the adverbial phrase]

- འགྱུར་རོ : becomes, transforms [Verb `འགྱུར་` (to change, transform, become) + final particle `-རོ་` marking statement completion; indicates a state change process rather than an action; the verb that establishes the main process of the sentence]

- ། : [sentence-ending marker]

    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The addressee of this teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ། རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་གང་དག་འདི་ལྟ་བུའི་མདོ་སྡེའི་ཚིག་འདི་དག་ལེན་པ་དང༌། འཛིན་པ་དང༌། འཆང་བ་དང༌། ཀློག་པ་དང༌། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ་དེ་དག་ནི་ [Type: Center | Desc: "The main content of the passage containing the parallel scenes" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ། རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་གང་དག་འདི་ལྟ་བུའི་མདོ་སྡེའི་ཚིག་འདི་དག་ལེན་པ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing agents performing an action on a patient" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ། རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་གང་དག་ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agents who perform the actions" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འདི་ལྟ་བུའི་མདོ་སྡེའི་ཚིག་འདི་དག་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object upon which the action is performed" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ལེན་པ་ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action performed by the agent on the patient" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཛིན་པ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene describing the action of holding performed by the same agent on the same patient" | Implicit: ""]

            ├── ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ་ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of fully understanding" | Implicit: ""]
            └── such words of this kind of sutra [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "Implicit reference to the same patient from 3.1.2" | Implicit: "Implied reference to the sutra words mentioned earlier"]
        ├── དང༌ [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connector joining the parallel scenes" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་དག་ནི་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Reference back to the agents who perform the actions" | Implicit: ""]
    └── མནར་བར་འགྱུར་ [Type: Process-Result | Desc: "The resulting suffering that will be experienced by those who perform the actions" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཡང་ : moreover [Connective particle; additionally, furthermore; functions as a discourse linker connecting this statement to previous content]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; Buddha's disciple who is being addressed; functions as the recipient of this teaching]
- རིགས་ཀྱི་ : of noble [Genitive of `རིགས་`: family, lineage, class; indicating membership in a good or noble lineage; modifies the following nouns]
- བུའམ་ : sons or [Noun `བུ་`: son + disjunctive particle `འམ་`; indicating alternative options; functions as part of the agent description]
- རིགས་ཀྱི་ : of noble [Genitive of `རིགས་`: family, lineage, class; indicating membership in a good or noble lineage; modifies the following noun]
- བུ་མོ་ : daughters [Noun: female offspring, young woman; part of the compound term for female disciples of good families]
- གང་དག་ : whoever [Relative pronoun; those who, whichever ones; introduces the agents who will perform the subsequent actions]
- འདི་ལྟ་བུའི་ : such, of this kind [Demonstrative `འདི་`: this + `ལྟ་བུ་`: like, similar + genitive particle; qualifies the type of sutra; functions as an attributive modifier]
- མདོ་སྡེའི་ : of the sutra [Genitive of `མདོ་སྡེ་`: sutra, discourse of the Buddha; the textual category being referenced; functions as possessor]
- ཚིག་ : words [Noun: word, phrase, speech; the actual content of the teaching; functions as the patient upon which actions are performed]
- འདི་དག་ : these [Demonstrative `འདི་`: this + plural marker `དག་`; these specific words being referenced; specifies the patient]
- ལེན་པ་ : receive [Verbal noun from `ལེན་`: to take, receive, accept; the first action performed on the sutra words; functions as a process]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction: connecting the parallel actions; links the sequence of verbal activities]
- འཛིན་པ་ : hold [Verbal noun from `འཛིན་`: to grasp, hold, maintain; the second action performed on the sutra words; functions as a process]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction: connecting the parallel actions; links the sequence of verbal activities]
- འཆང་བ་ : retain [Verbal noun from `འཆང་`: to possess, keep, maintain; the third action performed on the sutra words; functions as a process]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction: connecting the parallel actions; links the sequence of verbal activities]
- ཀློག་པ་ : read [Verbal noun from `ཀློག་`: to read aloud, recite; the fourth action performed on the sutra words; functions as a process]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction: connecting the parallel actions; links the sequence of verbal activities]
- ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་ : completely [Adverbial form of `ཀུན་ཆུབ་`: complete, perfect, thorough; indicates the comprehensive nature of understanding; modifies the following verb]
- བྱེད་པ་ : understand [Verbal noun from `བྱེད་`: to do, make, perform; here meaning to thoroughly comprehend; the fifth action performed on the sutra words; functions as a process]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative `དེ་`: that + plural marker `དག་`; referring back to the noble sons and daughters mentioned earlier; functions as the topic]
- ནི་ : indeed [Topic marker; emphasizes the subject and marks what follows as applying to them]
- མནར་བར་ : tormented [Verbal noun from `མནར་`: to torment, afflict, suffer + terminative particle `བར་`; indicates the negative result; functions as the process-result]
- འགྱུར་ : will become [Verb: to become, transform; future tense marker; completes the statement of the negative consequence; functions as part of the process-result]

ཤིན་ཏུ་མནར་བར་འགྱུར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing future torment/suffering" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [practitioners of dharma] [Type: Implicit Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "Those who experience the torment - practitioners who have accumulated negative karma" | Implicit: "Those who experience the torment - practitioners who have accumulated negative karma"]
    ├── འགྱུར་རོ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of becoming/transforming into a state" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཤིན་ཏུ་མནར་བར [Type: Result | Desc: "The resulting state of torment/suffering as outcome of karmic processes" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཤིན་ཏུ [Type: Intensifier | Desc: "Intensifies the degree of suffering/torment" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མནར་བར [Type: Center | Desc: "Core concept of torment or suffering" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [previous negative karma] [Type: Implicit Cause | Desc: "Previous negative karma that causes the suffering/torment" | Implicit: "Previous negative karma that causes the suffering/torment"]
    └── [purification of karma] [Type: Implicit Purpose | Desc: "The suffering serves to purify negative karma, ultimately leading to enlightenment" | Implicit: "The suffering serves to purify negative karma, ultimately leading to enlightenment"]
glossary:
- ཤིན་ཏུ་ : exceedingly [Adverb functioning as an intensifier; modifies `མནར་བར་`; intensifies the degree of suffering/torment; serves as a qualifier indicating extreme intensity]
- མནར་བར་ : to be tormented [Terminative case of `མནར་བ་`: to suffer, be tormented; the core concept describing the state of suffering experienced; functions as the result or endpoint of the process]
- འགྱུར་རོ : will become [Future tense of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform; `རོ` is the sentence-final particle indicating declarative statement; functions as the main process verb indicating transformation into a state; implies certainty about future consequence]
- ། : [Sentence-ending shad punctuation mark]
