glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; referring to the preceding statement; functions as part of the question phrase]
- ཅིའི་ : for what [Interrogative + genitive particle; from `ཅི་`: what; used to form "why" question; part of Adverbial interrogative phrase]
- ཕྱིར་ : reason [Noun; reason, purpose; combined with previous words forms "why"; functions as Adverbial modifier]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional verb; from `ཞེ་`: to say/ask + conditional particle `ན`; marks rhetorical question; functions as Process element in interrogative construction]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper noun; name of the Buddha's disciple being addressed; functions as Recipient participant in discourse]
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Noun; from `སེམས་`: mind + `ཅན་`: possessing; beings with consciousness; functions as Agent participant]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural; those specific beings; specifies which sentient beings are being discussed]
- ནི་ : as for [Topic marker; highlighting the sentient beings as the topic of discussion]
- ཚེ་རབས་ : lifetimes [Noun; from `ཚེ་`: life + `རབས་`: succession; refers to series of lives; part of temporal qualification]
- སྔ་མའི་ : previous [Adjective + genitive; from `སྔ་མ་`: previous, former; qualifies lifetimes; temporal qualifier]
- མི་དགེ་བའི་ : non-virtuous [Negative prefix `མི་` + `དགེ་བ་`: virtue + genitive; morally negative actions; describes the nature of actions]
- ལས་ : karma/actions [Noun; deeds that produce future results; object of the action of committing]
- ངན་སོང་དུ་ : into lower realms [Noun + terminative case; from `ངན་སོང་`: lower realms of rebirth + `དུ་`: into; indicates destination]
- སྐྱེ་བར་ : to be born [Verbal noun + terminative; from `སྐྱེ་བ་`: birth, rebirth; resultant action of karma]
- འགྱུར་བ་ : which would lead to [Verb + nominalizer; from `འགྱུར་`: to become, transform; describes consequence]
- གང་དག་ : whichever [Relative pronoun; refers to specific types of negative karma]
- བྱས་པ་ : committed [Past form of verb `བྱེད་པ་`: to do/commit + nominalizer; action of committing karma]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural; referring back to the negative karma previously mentioned]
- ཚེ་ : life [Noun; period of existence]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative; referring to current, present]
- ཉིད་ : very/itself [Emphatic particle; emphasizes "this very life"]
- ལ་ : in [Locative particle; indicates temporal location]
- མནར་བས། : through suffering [Verb `མནར་བ་`: to suffer, be tormented + instrumental case; indicates suffering as causal mechanism]
- བྱང་བར་ : purified [Verbal noun + terminative; from `བྱང་བ་`: to be cleansed/purified; process of purification]
- འགྱུར་ : will become [Verb; indicates future change or transformation]
- ཏེ། : and/thus [Connective particle; links to implied future result]

ucca_formatted:
སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཀྱང་ཐོབ་པར་འགྱུར་རོ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of obtaining Buddha's enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── Practitioners who uphold and practice this sutra [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent: Practitioners | Desc: "The implicit agents who will obtain enlightenment" | Implicit: "The practitioners who will obtain enlightenment are not explicitly mentioned in the text"]
    ├── ཐོབ་པར་འགྱུར་རོ [Type: Process-Future | Desc: "The future-oriented process of obtaining enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་བྱང་ཆུབ [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The enlightenment that will be obtained" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཀྱི [Type: Relator | Desc: "Possessive marker relating Buddha to enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཀྱང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Emphasizes the remarkable nature of obtaining Buddha's enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── quickly/soon [Type: Implicit Temporal-Modifier | Desc: "Implies the enlightenment will be attained quickly" | Implicit: "The temporal aspect of when enlightenment will be attained is implied but not stated"]
    └── because of purification of previous negative karma [Type: Implicit Causal-Relation | Desc: "Explains the cause of attaining enlightenment: experiencing suffering purifies negative karma" | Implicit: "The causal relationship between purification of karma and attaining enlightenment is implied but not explicitly stated"]
glossary:
- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Noun, `སངས་རྒྱས་`: "awakened one"; the fully enlightened one; functions as part of Goal/Object in the sentence structure]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive case marker connecting `སངས་རྒྱས་` with `བྱང་ཆུབ་`; indicates possession or relationship; marks "Buddha" as possessor of "enlightenment"]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Noun, `བྱང་ཆུབ་`: "awakening, bodhi"; the complete enlightenment state of a Buddha; functions as the Goal/Object that will be obtained]
- ཀྱང་ : also, even [Emphatic particle; highlights the remarkable nature of obtaining Buddha's enlightenment; implies this is an extraordinary achievement]
- ཐོབ་པར་ : obtain, attain [Verb stem `ཐོབ་` (to obtain) + purposive/terminative particle `པར་`; indicates the action of attaining or gaining enlightenment; functions as the main Process in the sentence]
- འགྱུར་རོ : will become [Future tense marker `འགྱུར་` + final particle `རོ`; indicates the future-oriented nature of the statement; completes the verbal phrase "will attain"]
- ། : [Tibetan sentence-ending marker, equivalent to a period]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་ངས་མངོན་པར་ཤེས་ཏེ། འདས་པའི་དུས་བསྐལ་པ་གྲངས་མེད་པའི་ཡང་ཆེས་གྲངས་མེད་པ་ན། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་མར་མེ་མཛད་ཀྱི་སྔ་རོལ་གྱི་ཡང་ཆེས་སྔ་རོལ་ན་སངས་རྒྱས་བྱེ་བ་ཁྲག་ཁྲིག་འབུམ་ཕྲག་བརྒྱད་ཅུ་རྩ་བཞི་དག་བྱུང་བ་ངས་མཉེས་པར་བྱས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The root node encompassing the Buddha's recollection of past eons and his interactions with previous Buddhas." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ངས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The narrator (Buddha) who is speaking." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The person being addressed by the Buddha." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མངོན་པར་ཤེས་ཏེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of the Buddha's perfect knowing or supernatural cognition." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདས་པའི་དུས་བསྐལ་པ་གྲངས་མེད་པའི་ཡང་ཆེས་གྲངས་མེད་པ་ན། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་མར་མེ་མཛད་ཀྱི་སྔ་རོལ་གྱི་ཡང་ཆེས་སྔ་རོལ་ན་སངས་རྒྱས་བྱེ་བ་ཁྲག་ཁྲིག་འབུམ་ཕྲག་བརྒྱད་ཅུ་རྩ་བཞི་དག་བྱུང་བ [Type: Scene | Desc: "A subscene describing the temporal context and the appearance of numerous Buddhas in the distant past." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདས་པའི་དུས་བསྐལ་པ་གྲངས་མེད་པའི་ཡང་ཆེས་གྲངས་མེད་པ་ན [Type: Time | Desc: "The temporal setting describing a vastly distant time in the past." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འདས་པའི་དུས [Type: Center | Desc: "The core temporal reference indicating the past." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བསྐལ་པ་གྲངས་མེད་པའི [Type: Center | Desc: "The core phrase referring to countless eons." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡང [Type: Linker | Desc: "A connective particle linking to further temporal qualifier." | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཆེས་གྲངས་མེད་པ་ན [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Further qualification of the immeasurable time period." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་མར་མེ་མཛད་ཀྱི་སྔ་རོལ་གྱི་ཡང་ཆེས་སྔ་རོལ་ན [Type: Time | Desc: "A temporal reference point using Buddha Dipankara as a marker." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་མར་མེ་མཛད [Type: Center | Desc: "The reference to Buddha Dipankara with his full honorific titles." | Implicit: ""]
                ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "An honorific title for Buddha Dipankara meaning 'Thus-Gone One'." | Implicit: ""]
                ├── དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "An honorific title for Buddha Dipankara meaning 'Foe-Destroyer'." | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "An honorific title indicating complete awakening." | Implicit: ""]
                └── མར་མེ་མཛད [Type: Center | Desc: "The name of the specific Buddha being referenced." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྔ་རོལ [Type: Center | Desc: "The core temporal reference indicating 'before'." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡང [Type: Linker | Desc: "A connective particle linking to further temporal qualification." | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཆེས་སྔ་རོལ་ན [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Further qualification of the temporal reference, emphasizing it was even earlier." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སངས་རྒྱས་བྱེ་བ་ཁྲག་ཁྲིག་འབུམ་ཕྲག་བརྒྱད་ཅུ་རྩ་བཞི་དག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The numerous Buddhas who appeared in that distant past." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སངས་རྒྱས [Type: Center | Desc: "The core reference to Buddhas." | Implicit: ""]
            └── བྱེ་བ་ཁྲག་ཁྲིག་འབུམ་ཕྲག་བརྒྱད་ཅུ་རྩ་བཞི་དག [Type: Quantity | Desc: "The numerical quantity of Buddhas." | Implicit: ""]
                └── དག [Type: Function | Desc: "A grammatical particle indicating plurality." | Implicit: ""]
        └── བྱུང་བ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of appearing or arising, connected to the numerous Buddhas." | Implicit: ""]
    └── ངས་མཉེས་པར་བྱས་ཏེ [Type: Scene | Desc: "A subscene describing the Buddha's action of pleasing the numerous Buddhas." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ངས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The narrator (Buddha) as the agent who pleased the Buddhas." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── those Buddhas [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implicit patient, referring to the numerous Buddhas who were pleased." | Implicit: "The referent to the Buddhas previously mentioned who were pleased by the Buddha"]
        ├── མཉེས་པར་བྱས་ཏེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of pleasing or worshipping the Buddhas." | Implicit: ""]
        └── never displeasing them [Type: Implicit-Adverbial | Desc: "An implicit component indicating that the Buddha not only pleased but also never displeased those Buddhas." | Implicit: "This indicates the additional understanding that the Buddha not only pleased but also never displeased those Buddhas"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative of the proper name `རབ་འབྱོར་`: a chief disciple of the Buddha; functioning as the recipient or addressee of the Buddha's speech]

- ངས་ : I [Ergative of `ང་`: first person singular pronoun; indicates the Buddha as the Agent/speaker who is performing the action of knowing and pleasing]

- མངོན་པར་ཤེས་ཏེ། : have supernaturally perceived [Terminative form of `མངོན་པར་ཤེས་པ་`: to directly perceive through supernatural knowledge; indicates the Buddha's special cognitive ability to know past events; functions as the main Process of the first part of the sentence]

- འདས་པའི་ : past [Genitive of `འདས་པ་`: gone beyond, past; modifies the following time reference; indicates temporal setting]

- དུས་ : time [Root noun meaning period or time; core temporal reference]

- བསྐལ་པ་ : eons [Root noun meaning kalpa, cosmic age; a vast unit of time measurement in Buddhist cosmology]

- གྲངས་མེད་པའི་ : countless [Genitive of `གྲངས་མེད་པ་`: innumerable, limitless; modifies the eons; indicates an immeasurable quantity]

- ཡང་ : even [Emphatic particle connecting to the next phrase; intensifies the following descriptor]

- ཆེས་ : extremely [Adverb intensifying the following phrase; heightens the sense of immeasurability]

- གྲངས་མེད་པ་ན། : beyond counting [Locative of `གྲངས་མེད་པ་`: immeasurable; here indicating location in time "when"; completes the temporal setting]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathagata [Honorific title for a Buddha meaning "Thus-Gone"; first of several epithets describing Buddha Dipankara]

- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : Arhat [Honorific title meaning "Foe-Destroyer"; second epithet for Buddha Dipankara, indicating one who has destroyed the enemies of afflictions]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [Adverbial phrase meaning "completely" or "perfectly"; modifies the following epithet]

- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive of `རྫོགས་པ་`: complete, perfect; modifies "Buddha"]

- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Root noun meaning "Awakened One"; the main title indicating complete enlightenment]

- མར་མེ་མཛད་ : Dipankara [Proper name meaning "Lamp-Bearer"; the specific Buddha being referenced as a temporal marker]

- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle connecting Dipankara to the temporal reference that follows]

- སྔ་རོལ་ : before [Noun indicating "time before"; establishes temporal relation to Buddha Dipankara]

- གྱི་ : of [Genitive particle connecting to the next phrase]

- ཡང་ : even [Emphatic particle intensifying the temporal distance]

- ཆེས་ : far [Adverb intensifying the following temporal marker]

- སྔ་རོལ་ན་ : much earlier [Locative of `སྔ་རོལ་`: before; indicates "at a time even earlier"; completes the second temporal reference point]

- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddhas [Root noun meaning "Awakened Ones"; the beings who appeared in that distant past; functions as Patient in the sentence structure]

- བྱེ་བ་ : ten million [Number indicating 10,000,000; part of a complex numerical expression]

- ཁྲག་ཁྲིག་ : trillion [Number indicating a trillion; part of the numerical expression]

- འབུམ་ཕྲག་ : hundred thousand [Number indicating 100,000; part of the numerical expression]

- བརྒྱད་ཅུ་ : eighty [Number indicating 80; part of the numerical expression]

- རྩ་བཞི་ : four [Compound number indicating 84; completes the numerical expression]

- དག་ : plural [Pluralizing particle indicating multiple Buddhas; makes explicit the plurality already implied by the numbers]

- བྱུང་བ་ : appeared [Past form of `འབྱུང་བ་`: to arise, appear; indicates the arising/manifestation of the Buddhas; functions as the Process of the subscene]

- ངས་ : I [Ergative of `ང་`: first person singular pronoun; repeated reference to the Buddha as the Agent who pleased the past Buddhas]

- མཉེས་པར་ : pleased [Purposive form of `མཉེས་པ་`: to please, delight; indicates the Buddha made the past Buddhas happy through service]

- བྱས་ཏེ། : did [Past form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do; with the terminative particle indicating completion of one action before another; functions as Process indicating the Buddha's active service to the past Buddhas]

ucca_formatted:
མ་མཉེས་པར་མ་བྱས་ནས་ཐུགས་འབྱུང་བར་མ་བྱས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མ་མཉེས་པར་མ་བྱས་ནས [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene - not displeasing" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [practitioner/speaker] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit subject who did not displease the Buddhas" | Implicit: "The speaker or practitioner who is the agent of the action"]
        ├── མ་མཉེས་པར [Type: State | Desc: "State of not being pleased" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མ་བྱས་ནས [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of not causing displeasure" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [Buddhas] [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "The Buddhas who were not displeased" | Implicit: "The Buddhas who are the recipients of the action"]
    └── ཐུགས་འབྱུང་བར་མ་བྱས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene - not causing mental disturbance" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཐུགས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The mind that would experience disturbance" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [Buddhas] [Type: Implicit Participant-Possessor | Desc: "The Buddhas whose mind/heart is referenced" | Implicit: "The Buddhas who possess the mind/heart mentioned"]
        ├── འབྱུང་བར [Type: Process-State | Desc: "The process of mental displeasure arising" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མ་བྱས་ཏེ། [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of not causing mental disturbance" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- མ་མཉེས་པར་ : without displeasing [Negative prefix `མ་` + verbal root `མཉེས་` (to please) + connective particle `པར` (in order to); the negative state of not causing displeasure to the Buddhas; functions as an adverbial state modifier in the first scene]
- མ་བྱས་ནས་ : not having caused [Negative prefix `མ་` + `བྱས་` (past of `བྱེད་` to do/make) + `ནས་` (having done); indicates the completed action of not causing the negative state; functions as the main process verb of the first scene]
- ཐུགས་ : mind/heart [Honorific term for mind/consciousness; refers specifically to the Buddha's mind; functions as the patient/affected entity in the second scene]
- འབྱུང་བར་ : arising/occurring [Verbal noun from `འབྱུང་` (to arise/emerge) + connective particle `བར`; indicates the potential state of disturbance; functions as process-state in the second scene]
- མ་བྱས་ཏེ། : not having caused [Negative prefix `མ་` + `བྱས་` (past of `བྱེད་` to do/make) + connector `ཏེ།` (and/then); indicates not causing mental disturbance; functions as the main process verb of the second scene with `ཏེ།` connecting to a subsequent clause]

source: རབ་འབྱོར་སངས་རྒྱས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་དག་ངས་མཉེས་པར་བྱས་ནས་ཐུགས་འབྱུང་བར་མ་བྱས་པ་གང་ཡིན་པ་དང༌། ཕྱི་མའི་དུས་ལྔ་བརྒྱའི་ཐ་མར་གྱུར་པ་ན། མདོ་སྡེ་འདི་ལེན་པ་དང༌། འདྲི་བ་དང༌། འཛིན་པ་དང་འཆང་བ་དང༌། ཀློག་པ་དང༌། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ་གང་ཡིན་པ་ལས། རབ་འབྱོར་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་འདི་ལ་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་སྔ་མས་བརྒྱའི་ཆར་ཡང་ཉེ་བར་མི་འགྲོ།
ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་སངས་རྒྱས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་དག་ངས་མཉེས་པར་བྱས་ནས་ཐུགས་འབྱུང་བར་མ་བྱས་པ་གང་ཡིན་པ་དང༌། ཕྱི་མའི་དུས་ལྔ་བརྒྱའི་ཐ་མར་གྱུར་པ་ན། མདོ་སྡེ་འདི་ལེན་པ་དང༌། འདྲི་བ་དང༌། འཛིན་པ་དང་འཆང་བ་དང༌། ཀློག་པ་དང༌། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ་གང་ཡིན་པ་ལས། རབ་འབྱོར་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་འདི་ལ་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་སྔ་མས་བརྒྱའི་ཆར་ཡང་ཉེ་བར་མི་འགྲོ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing the full text" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་སངས་རྒྱས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་དག་ངས་མཉེས་པར་བྱས་ནས་ཐུགས་འབྱུང་བར་མ་བྱས་པ་གང་ཡིན་པ་དང༌ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing pleasing the Buddhas" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Subhuti as the recipient of the discourse" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སངས་རྒྱས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་དག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The Buddhas who are being pleased" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ངས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker/agent who pleased the Buddhas" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མཉེས་པར་བྱས་ནས་ཐུགས་འབྱུང་བར་མ་བྱས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The processes of pleasing and not displeasing the Buddhas" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མཉེས་པར་བྱས [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of pleasing the Buddhas" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ནས [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector between the two contrasting actions" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཐུགས་འབྱུང་བར་མ་བྱས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of not displeasing the Buddhas" | Implicit: ""]
            └──  [Type: Contrast | Desc: "Contrast relation between pleasing and not displeasing" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── མཉེས་པར་བྱས [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of pleasing the Buddhas" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཐུགས་འབྱུང་བར་མ་བྱས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of not displeasing the Buddhas" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གང་ཡིན་པ་དང༌ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration of the previous actions" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཕྱི་མའི་དུས་ལྔ་བརྒྱའི་ཐ་མར་གྱུར་པ་ན། མདོ་སྡེ་འདི་ལེན་པ་དང༌། འདྲི་བ་དང༌། འཛིན་པ་དང་འཆང་བ་དང༌། ཀློག་པ་དང༌། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ་གང་ཡིན་པ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene describing future engagement with the sutra" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཕྱི་མའི་དུས་ལྔ་བརྒྱའི་ཐ་མར་གྱུར་པ་ན [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Temporal setting for the future activities" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མདོ་སྡེ་འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The sutra that will be engaged with" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལེན་པ་དང༌། འདྲི་བ་དང༌། འཛིན་པ་དང་འཆང་བ་དང༌། ཀློག་པ་དང༌། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The various ways of engaging with the sutra" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ལེན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of taking up the sutra" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector between activities" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འདྲི་བ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of writing down the sutra" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector between activities" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཛིན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of holding the sutra" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector between activities" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཆང་བ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of maintaining the sutra" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector between activities" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཀློག་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of reciting the sutra" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector between activities" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of mastering the sutra" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── practitioners/those who engage with the sutra [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit practitioners who engage with the sutra" | Implicit: "Implied practitioners who will engage with the sutra in the future"]
        └── གང་ཡིན་པ་ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration of the previous actions" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལས [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relator between the actions and resulting comparison" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་འདི་ལ་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་སྔ་མས་བརྒྱའི་ཆར་ཡང་ཉེ་བར་མི་འགྲོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Combined scene comparing the heaps of merit" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Subhuti as the recipient of the discourse" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་འདི [Type: Center | Desc: "The current heap of merit being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་སྔ་མས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The former heap of merit acting as the agent in comparison" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བརྒྱའི་ཆར [Type: Quantity | Desc: "The fractional quantity in the comparison" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཉེ་བར་མི་འགྲོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of not approaching/comparing" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡང [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Emphasis on the comparative statement" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name; vocative case; referring to the Buddha's disciple who is being addressed directly; functions as the primary recipient of the discourse]

- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddhas [plural noun; from `སངས་རྒྱས་`: buddha, awakened one; referring to the fully enlightened beings who are objects of reverence; functions as patient in the semantic structure]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed Ones [honorific title; from `བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་`: Bhagavan, Buddha; referring to the Buddhas with all their qualities; expands on the previous term]

- དེ་དག་ : those [demonstrative pronoun; plural marker; specifying the aforementioned Buddhas]

- ངས་ : by me [ergative/instrumental of `ང་`: I; the speaker as agent; here identified as Buddha Shakyamuni addressing Subhuti]

- མཉེས་པར་ : pleased [adverbial form; from `མཉེས་པ་`: to please, delight; expressing the positive reaction elicited from the Buddhas]

- བྱས་ : did [past tense verb; from `བྱེད་`: to do, make; indicating completed action]

- ནས་ : and then [connective particle; linking sequential actions; connecting the positive action with the following negative one]

- ཐུགས་འབྱུང་བར་ : displeased [adverbial form; from `ཐུགས་འབྱུང་`: mental disappointment; honorific form referring to the Buddhas' minds]

- མ་བྱས་པ་ : did not do [negated past tense verb; from `བྱེད་`: to do, make; the speaker did not cause displeasure]

- གང་ཡིན་པ་ : whoever/whatever [relative clause marker; indicating attribution of qualities to preceding content]

- དང༌ : and [conjunction; connecting the first clause with the next parallel clause]

- ཕྱི་མའི་ : later [genitive of `ཕྱི་མ་`: later, future; modifying `དུས་` (time)]

- དུས་ : time [noun; referring to a specific period]

- ལྔ་བརྒྱའི་ : of five hundred [genitive numeral; modifying years or time periods]

- ཐ་མར་ : at the end [terminative case; from `ཐ་མ་`: end, final; specifying the conclusion of the period]

- གྱུར་པ་ : becomes [verbal noun; from `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform; describing the future state]

- ན : when [locative particle; setting the temporal context for what follows]

- མདོ་སྡེ་ : sutra [noun; Buddhist scriptural text; object of the following verbs]

- འདི་ : this [demonstrative pronoun; referring to the present text being taught]

- ལེན་པ་ : take up [verbal noun; from `ལེན་པ་`: to take, receive; first of several ways to engage with the text]

- དང༌ : and [conjunction; connecting items in a list]

- འདྲི་བ་ : write down [verbal noun; from `འདྲི་བ་`: to write; second way to engage with the text]

- དང༌ : and [conjunction; connecting items in a list]

- འཛིན་པ་ : hold [verbal noun; from `འཛིན་པ་`: to hold, grasp; third way to engage with the text]

- དང : and [conjunction; connecting items in a list]

- འཆང་བ་ : maintain [verbal noun; from `འཆང་བ་`: to bear, carry; fourth way to engage with the text]

- དང༌ : and [conjunction; connecting items in a list]

- ཀློག་པ་ : recite [verbal noun; from `ཀློག་པ་`: to read aloud; fifth way to engage with the text]

- དང༌ : and [conjunction; connecting items in a list]

- ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་ : thoroughly [adverbial form; from `ཀུན་`: all, complete; intensifying the following verb]

- བྱེད་པ་ : do/master [verbal noun; from `བྱེད་པ་`: to do, perform; sixth way to engage with the text]

- གང་ཡིན་པ་ : whoever/whatever [relative clause marker; referring to those who engage with the text]

- ལས : from/than [ablative particle; establishing a comparative relationship]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name; vocative case; addressing the disciple again]

- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ : of merit [genitive of `བསོད་ནམས་`: merit, positive karma; qualifying the following term]

- ཕུང་པོ་ : heap [noun; referring to a collection or accumulation; technical Buddhist term]

- འདི་ : this [demonstrative pronoun; indicating the merit discussed in present context (of future practitioners)]

- ལ་ : to [dative particle; indicating direction of comparison]

- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ : of merit [genitive of `བསོད་ནམས་`: merit, positive karma; qualifying the following term]

- ཕུང་པོ་ : heap [noun; referring to a collection or accumulation; technical Buddhist term]

- སྔ་མས་ : former [instrumental of `སྔ་མ་`: former, previous; referring to the merit mentioned first (from pleasing Buddhas)]

- བརྒྱའི་ : of a hundred [genitive numeral; establishing ratio for comparison]

- ཆར་ : part [terminative case of `ཆ་`: part, portion; establishing the fractional comparison]

- ཡང་ : even [adverb; emphatic marker intensifying the comparison]

- ཉེ་བར་ : near/comparable [adverbial form; from `ཉེ་བ་`: near, close; expressing degree of proximity in comparison]

- མི་འགྲོ : does not approach [negated present verb; from `འགྲོ་བ་`: to go, approach; indicating the former merit doesn't compare to even 1/100th of the latter]

སྟོང་གི་ཆ་དང༌། འབུམ་གྱི་ཆ་དང༌། གྲངས་དང་ཚད་དང་བགྲང་བ་དང༌། དཔེ་དང་ཟླ་དང་རྒྱུར་ཡང་མི་བཟོད་དོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene describing incomparability" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:

- དཔེ་ : example/simile [Noun: `དཔེ་`: example, illustration; refers to exemplification as basis for comparison; sixth method in the series]
- དང་ : and [Conjunction: linking particle connecting items in a list; joins different methods of comparison]

glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་: Subhuti [Vocative form; name of Buddha's disciple who is being addressed; functions as Recipient of Buddha's speech]
- གལ་ཏེ་: if [Conditional connector; introduces a hypothetical situation; establishes cause-effect relationship]
- དེའི་ཚེ་: at that time [Temporal adverbial; `དེ་` (that) + genitive + `ཚེ་` (time); specifies when the hypothetical situation would occur]
- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་: sons of good family or [Disjunctive compound; `རིགས་` (lineage/family) + genitive + `བུ་` (son) + disjunctive `འམ་`; refers to male Buddhist practitioners of noble birth]
- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་: daughters of good family [Compound noun; `རིགས་` (lineage/family) + genitive + `བུ་མོ་` (daughter); refers to female Buddhist practitioners of noble birth]
- གང་དག་: whoever [Plural indefinite pronoun; refers to the aforementioned sons and daughters collectively; marks them as Agents]
- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་: of merit [Genitive form; `བསོད་ནམས་` (merit, positive karma) + genitive particle `ཀྱི་`; indicates possession]
- ཕུང་པོ་: heap [Noun; collection or accumulation; here referring to accumulation of merit]
- ཇི་སྙེད་: as much as [Quantifier adverb; indicates the vast extent of merit being accumulated]
- རབ་ཏུ་: thoroughly [Intensive adverb; intensifies the following verb]
- འཛིན་པར་: would hold [Terminative form of `འཛིན་པ་` (to hold, grasp, maintain); indicates the effort of accumulating]
- འགྱུར་བའི་: would become [Future form of `འགྱུར་བ་` (to become, transform) + genitive; connects to the next phrase]
- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་: sons of good family or [Repeated from above; referencing the same group]
- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་: daughters of good family [Repeated from above; referencing the same group]
- དེ་དག་: those [Demonstrative plural pronoun; refers back to the sons and daughters mentioned]
- གི་: of [Genitive particle; connects possessor to possessed]
- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་: of merit [Genitive form; repeated from above]
- ཕུང་པོ་: heap [Noun; repeated from above; the Patient that would be explained]
- ངས་: I [Ergative first-person pronoun; referring to Buddha as the speaker and Agent]
- བརྗོད་ན།: if I were to explain [Conditional form of `རྗོད་པ་` (to explain, express) + conditional marker `ན`; establishes the hypothetical explanation]
- སེམས་ཅན་: sentient beings [Compound noun; `སེམས་` (mind) + `ཅན་` (possessing); refers to all conscious beings; functions as Experiencer]
- རྣམས་: all [Plural marker; indicates multiple sentient beings]
- མྱོ་མྱོ་པོར་: confused [Adverbial form; describes a state of mental bewilderment; indicates transformation]
- འགྱུར་: would become [Future/modal verb; indicates transformation]
- ཞིང་: and [Clausal connector; joins two parallel results]
- སེམས་: mind [Noun; refers to consciousness; functions as Patient]
- འཁྲུགས་པར་: disturbed [Terminative form of `འཁྲུག་པ་` (to be disturbed, agitated); indicates resulting mental state]
- འགྱུར་རོ།: would become [Future/modal verb + final particle; indicates definite transformation and concludes the statement]

glossary:
- ཡང་ : furthermore [continuative/additive particle; connecting this statement to previous discourse; functions as a discourse linker in the semantic structure]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name; vocative case; the direct addressee/recipient of Buddha's teaching; functions as the recipient participant in the discourse]
- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : of the Dharma [genitive case of `ཆོས་`: Dharma, teaching, phenomenon; specifying the type of discourse as being related to Buddha's teachings; functions as an attribute of the following term]
- རྣམ་གྲངས་ : discourse [from `རྣམ་གྲངས་`: enumeration, exposition, discourse; refers to a specific teaching or textual exposition; part of the patient participant in the sentence]
- འདི་ : this [demonstrative pronoun; refers specifically to the discourse being discussed; completes the patient participant]
- བསམ་གྱིས་ : by thought [instrumental case of `བསམ་པ་`: thought, thinking; indicates the means by which something cannot be encompassed; functions as an adverbial modifier of manner]
- མི་ : not [negative particle; negates the following verb; part of the process component]
- ཁྱབ་ : encompassed [from `ཁྱབ་པ་`: to pervade, encompass, comprehend; indicates that the discourse cannot be fully comprehended by conceptual thinking; forms the main verb of the process]
- སྟེ། : is [final particle indicating statement continuation; marks that more explanation will follow; functions as a discourse connector]

glossary:
- འདིའི་ : of this [Genitive case marker `-འི་` attached to demonstrative `འདི་`; indicates possession or attribution; functioning as possessive determiner in the sentence]
- རྣམ་པར་སྨིན་པ་ : karmic ripening [Noun compound from `རྣམ་པར་` (completely) + `སྨིན་པ་` (to ripen); refers to the maturation of karmic results; functions as the primary subject of the sentence]
- ཡང་ : also/too [Emphatic particle; adds emphasis and indicates this ripening belongs to a broader category of similar phenomena; serves as a connector in the semantic structure]
- བསམ་གྱིས་ : by thought [Instrumental case of `བསམ་པ་` (thought, thinking); indicates the means by which something cannot be encompassed; part of the idiomatic expression for "inconceivable"]
- མི་ : not [Negation particle; negates the following verb; essential part of the expression for "inconceivable"]
- ཁྱབ་པ་ : encompassed [Verbal noun from `ཁྱབ་` (to pervade, encompass); what cannot be done by thought; forms core of state concept "inconceivable"]
- ཉིད་དུ་ : as being [Nominalizer `ཉིད་` (essence, -ness) + terminative case marker `-དུ`; converts the quality into an abstract state and indicates manner; marks the state as definitive]
- རིག་པར་ : to understand/realize [Terminative case of `རིག་པ་` (to know, understand); indicates what action should be taken; represents the main process in the sentence]
- བྱའོ : should be done [Future/imperative form of `བྱེད་` (to do) + final particle `འོ`; indicates obligation or necessity; completes the verbal phrase "should be realized"]
- ། : [Tibetan sentence-ending punctuation mark; equivalent to a period]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ནས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of Subhuti addressing the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ནས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Temporal adverbial indicating sequence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient of the speech" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent performing the speech act" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ [Type: Elaborator-Attribute | Desc: "Honorific epithet for Subhuti, standard in Buddhist discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Center | Desc: "Indicator of the content of speech" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [implied question about how to abide in the Bodhisattva vehicle] [Type: Parallel Scene | Desc: "Implicit content of Subhuti's question about how Bodhisattvas should abide in the vehicle" | Implicit: "Implicit content of Subhuti's question about how Bodhisattvas should abide in the vehicle"]
    ├── གསོལ་ཏོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The speech act process" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [connection to the question about how to abide in the Bodhisattva vehicle] [Type: Parallel Scene | Desc: "Connection to the full semantic structure including the implied question" | Implicit: "Connection to the full semantic structure including the implied question"]
glossary:
- དེ་ནས་ : Then [Adverbial conjunction; temporal marker indicating sequence of events; connects this event to previous narrative; functions as a temporal adverbial in the sentence structure]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ་ : to the Blessed One [Dative case of `བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་`: "Bhagavan" or "Buddha"; honorific title for Buddha Shakyamuni; literally "the one who has conquered and possesses (the qualities)"; recipient of Subhuti's address]

- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : the venerable [Honorific epithet; literally "endowed with life/longevity"; standard honorific title for monks in Buddhist discourse; attributes respect to the speaker]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; one of Buddha's chief disciples known for his understanding of emptiness (śūnyatā); the agent/speaker in this discourse]

- གྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates that Subhuti is the agent performing the action of addressing/speaking; marks the grammatical agent]

- འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་ : thus [Quotative marker; literally "these words"; introduces direct speech or quotation; indicates that what follows is the content of Subhuti's address]

- གསོལ་ཏོ། ། : addressed/requested [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, ask, address; honorific verb for speaking to someone of higher status; the main verb of the sentence indicating Subhuti's speech act to the Buddha]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས་ཇི་ལྟར་གནས་པར་བགྱི། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question about proper abiding for bodhisattvas" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The Bhagavan/Blessed One being addressed with the question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Topic | Desc: "The individuals about whom the question is being asked" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ [Type: Center | Desc: "The path or vehicle of bodhisattvas" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of properly entering or engaging with" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཡང་དག་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner in which one has entered" | Implicit: ""]
        └── རྣམས་ཀྱིས [Type: Function | Desc: "Plural marker with instrumental case marker applying to the entire phrase" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཇི་ལྟར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Interrogative adverb indicating manner" | Implicit: ""]
    └── གནས་པར [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action in question - how to abide or conduct oneself" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བགྱི [Type: Function | Desc: "Auxiliary verb forming the complete verbal phrase with གནས་པར" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific vocative form; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); epithet of the Buddha; functions as the addressee of the question]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Sanskrit: bodhi; awakening or enlightenment; part of compound term referring to the bodhisattva vehicle]

- སེམས་དཔའི་ : of bodhisattvas [Genitive of `སེམས་དཔའ་`: heroic mind, bodhisattva; beings who seek enlightenment for the benefit of all; modifies "vehicle"]

- ཐེག་པ་ : vehicle [Sanskrit: yāna; path or spiritual vehicle; refers to the spiritual approach or methodology]

- ལ་ : in, on [Locative particle; indicates relationship with the vehicle; marks the object of engagement]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : properly, authentically [Adverbial form; genuinely, correctly; describes the manner of entering the path]

- ཞུགས་པ་ : who have entered [Nominalizer of `འཇུག་`: to enter, engage; those who have committed to or embarked upon; functions as a verbal noun]

- རྣམས་ : plural marker [Indicates multiple individuals; those who have entered]

- ཀྱིས་ : by, through [Instrumental case marker; indicates agency of those who have entered the path; marks the questioner]

- ཇི་ལྟར་ : how [Interrogative adverb; in what manner; introduces the main question]

- གནས་པར་ : to abide, dwell [Verbal noun from `གནས་`: to stay, remain, dwell; with terminative particle `པར་`; the main action being questioned]

- བགྱི། : should do [Honorific future/present form of `བྱེད་`: to do; forms honorific verbal construction with `གནས་པར་`; indicates formal question]

ucca_formatted:
ཇི་ལྟར་བསྒྲུབ་པར་བགྱི། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question about proper practice/abiding in the Bodhisattva path" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Bodhisattva practitioner] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "A Bodhisattva or one who has entered the Bodhisattva vehicle" | Implicit: "The agent who would be practicing"]
    ├── བསྒྲུབ་པར་བགྱི [Type: Process | Desc: "Combined concept of practice/accomplishment and abiding/dwelling in accordance with the Bodhisattva path" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཇི་ལྟར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Interrogative adverb asking about the manner of practice" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [practice in accordance with the Bodhisattva path] [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "The practice and abiding in accordance with the Bodhisattva path that is to be accomplished" | Implicit: "The object of practice that is implied but not explicitly stated"]
glossary:
- ཇི་ལྟར་ : how [Interrogative adverb; asks about the manner or method; functions as an adverbial modifier questioning the way something should be done]
- བསྒྲུབ་པར་ : to accomplish/practice [Future/purposive form of སྒྲུབ་པ་: to accomplish, practice, establish; here indicating the action to be performed according to proper method; functions as the main process]
- བགྱི། : shall I do [First person honorific future form of བྱེད་པ་: to do; expressing respectful inquiry about proper action; functions as the main verb completing the question]

ucca_formatted:
ཇི་ལྟར་སེམས་རབ་ཏུ་གཟུང་བར་བགྱི། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire sentence as a scene of spiritual practice" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Bodhisattva practitioner] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implied subject (I) who is specifically a bodhisattva practitioner on the path" | Implicit: "The implied subject (I) who is specifically a bodhisattva practitioner on the path"]
    ├── གཟུང་བར་བགྱི [Type: Action | Desc: "Deliberate spiritual action of holding or grasping the mind in meditation practice" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས [Type: Center | Desc: "The enlightened mind or bodhicitta that is central to the Buddhist practice being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་ཏུ [Type: Elaborator-Intensity | Desc: "Intensifies the act of grasping/holding the mind, indicating the thorough and complete nature of the mental discipline" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཇི་ལྟར [Type: Elaborator-Manner | Desc: "Interrogative marker questioning the method of spiritual practice for proper mind training" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཇི་ལྟར་ : how [Interrogative adverb; questions the manner or method; introduces the question about methodology of spiritual practice; functions as an Elaborator of Manner in the sentence]
- སེམས་ : mind [Noun; refers specifically to bodhicitta or the enlightened mind that is the object of meditation; functions as the Central participant being acted upon in the spiritual practice]
- རབ་ཏུ་ : thoroughly [Adverbial intensifier; from `རབ་`: supreme + locative particle `ཏུ་`; intensifies the action that follows; indicates the complete and thorough nature of the mental discipline required]
- གཟུང་བར་ : to hold/grasp [Verbal noun; future form of `འཛིན་པ་` (to hold/grasp) + terminative particle `བར་`; indicates the meditative action of stabilizing the mind in contemplation]
- བགྱི། : should I do [First person future/interrogative form of `བྱེད་པ་` (to do); polite form indicating the speaker's intended action and seeking guidance; completes the question "How should I thoroughly hold the mind?"]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་པ་དང༌། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing parallel scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་པ་དང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing the request" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Subhuti as the implied speaker making the request" | Implicit: "Implied speaker not explicitly mentioned in this scene"]
        ├── གསོལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of making a request" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner adverbial describing how the request was made" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པས་ཇི་ལྟར་གནས་པར་བྱ [Type: Center | Desc: "Content of what was asked per the commentary" | Implicit: "Content referenced by 'thus' but stated earlier in the text"]
    ├── དང༌། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connects the two scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene describing the Buddha's response" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the agent of the response" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient of the Buddha's words" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Honorific title modifying Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of giving a teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདི་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner adverbial describing how the Buddha spoke" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཇི་ལྟར་སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བགྱི [Type: Center | Desc: "The content of what the Buddha is about to say per commentary" | Implicit: "Content that follows in the next section"]
glossary:
- དེ་སྐད་ : thus [Demonstrative + sound/speech; refers to the preceding request or statement that was made; functions as an Adverbial modifier indicating the manner of speech]
- ཅེས་ : saying/called [Quotative particle marking reported speech; connects the demonstrative to the verb; indicates the end of quoted content]
- གསོལ་པ་ : requested/spoke [Honorific verb for "to ask/request"; past tense form of `གསོལ་བ་`; indicates respectful speech directed to the Buddha; functions as the main Process in the first scene]
- དང༌། : and [Conjunction particle; links the two parallel scenes in the text; serves as a temporal sequence marker between request and response]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Epithet for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to one who has conquered defilements and transcended suffering; functions as the Agent in the second scene]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental particle indicating agency; marks Buddha as the speaker/agent of the following speech act]
- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : venerable [Honorific title; literally "endowed with life"; a respectful form of address for monks; functions as an Elaborator modifying Subhuti]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of one of Buddha's chief disciples; known for his understanding of emptiness; functions as the Recipient of Buddha's teaching]
- ལ་ : to [Dative particle marking the recipient; indicates that Subhuti is the one being addressed]
- འདི་སྐད་ : these words [Demonstrative + word/speech; literally "this speech"; refers forward to the content that follows; functions as an Adverbial indicating the manner of speech]
- ཅེས་ : saying/called [Quotative particle marking reported speech; indicates the beginning of quoted content to follow]
- བཀའ་ : word/teaching [Honorific term for speech/teaching, specifically of the Buddha; the root noun of the verbal phrase]
- སྩལ་ཏོ : proclaimed [Honorific past tense verb for "to give/bestow"; `ཏོ་` is the final particle marking completion of statement; indicates the Buddha's authoritative teaching; functions as the Process in the second scene]
- ། ། : [Final double shad punctuation mark indicating the end of a section or paragraph]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ལ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པས་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་སེམས་ཅན་ཐམས་ཅད་ཕུང་པོ་ལྷག་མ་མེད་པའི་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པའི་དབྱིངས་སུ་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire passage" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The addressee of the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who is engaged in the path" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པས [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of engaging in the path" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The path in which the bodhisattva is engaged" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་ལ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "The contextual setting" | Implicit: ""]
    └── འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བདག་གིས་སེམས་ཅན་ཐམས་ཅད་ཕུང་པོ་ལྷག་མ་མེད་པའི་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པའི་དབྱིངས་སུ་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདའོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The thought process and resolution of the bodhisattva" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: State-of-Mind | Desc: "The mental state or contemplation of the bodhisattva" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བདག་གིས་སེམས་ཅན་ཐམས་ཅད་ཕུང་པོ་ལྷག་མ་མེད་པའི་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པའི་དབྱིངས་སུ་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདའོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The content of the bodhisattva's resolution" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བདག་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The bodhisattva as agent in their own resolution" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སེམས་ཅན་ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Those who are to be led to nirvana" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of leading beings to nirvana" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཕུང་པོ་ལྷག་མ་མེད་པའི་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པའི་དབྱིངས་སུ [Type: Destination | Desc: "The state or realm of complete nirvana that is the goal" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཕུང་པོ་ལྷག་མ་མེད་པའི [Type: State | Desc: "The qualification of nirvana as being complete or without remainder" | Implicit: ""]
                └── མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པའི་དབྱིངས་སུ [Type: Center | Desc: "The realm or sphere of nirvana" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སེམས་ཅན་འགའ་ཡང་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདའ་བར་གྱུར་པ་མེད་དོ [Type: Implicit-Contrast | Desc: "The implicit paradoxical aspect that while the bodhisattva resolves to lead beings to nirvana, ultimately no being attains nirvana from the perspective of emptiness" | Implicit: "This represents the implicit paradoxical teaching that while bodhisattvas vow to liberate all beings, from the perspective of emptiness, there are no beings to be liberated"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; primary recipient addressed in this teaching; functions as the addressee/vocative in the discourse structure]
- འདི་ལ་ : in this context [Locative of `འདི་`: this; establishes the contextual setting for what follows; functions as an adverbial modifier]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ : of the bodhisattva [Genitive of `བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་`: awakening-being; one who seeks enlightenment for the benefit of all beings; functions as the agent/subject of the sentence]
- ཐེག་པ་ : vehicle [Noun: path, vehicle, yana; refers to the spiritual approach or system of practice; functions as the object of engagement]
- ལ་ : in, on [Locative particle marking the relationship to the vehicle/path; indicates the domain of activity]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : correctly, properly [Adverbial form of `ཡང་དག་པ་`: authentic, genuine, correct; indicates the proper manner of engagement with the path]
- ཞུགས་པས་ : having entered [Past participle of `འཇུག་པ་`: to enter, engage; indicates the completed action of engaging with the path; functions as the causal connector to what follows]
- འདི་སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking thus [Adverbial phrase; `འདི་`: this + `སྙམ་`: to think + `དུ་`: quotative particle; marks the beginning of the bodhisattva's thought; functions as the state-of-mind indicator]
- བདག་གིས་ : I [Instrumental/agentive of `བདག་`: self, I; marks the bodhisattva as the agent who will perform the action; functions as the subject of the resolution]
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Compound noun: `སེམས་`: mind + `ཅན་`: possessor; beings who possess consciousness; functions as the patient/object of the liberation act]
- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Universal quantifier: all, every, entirety; modifies sentient beings to indicate the comprehensive scope of the bodhisattva's intention]
- ཕུང་པོ་ : aggregates [Noun: skandha, heap, collection; the five components that constitute the person; part of the description of complete nirvana]
- ལྷག་མ་མེད་པའི་ : without remainder [Negative compound: `ལྷག་མ་`: remainder + `མེད་པའི་`: without; describes the complete state of nirvana where no aggregates remain; functions as qualifier of nirvana]
- མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པའི་ : of nirvana [Genitive of `མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པ་`: beyond sorrow, nirvana; the state of liberation from suffering; functions as part of the destination description]
- དབྱིངས་སུ་ : into the realm [Terminative of `དབྱིངས་`: realm, sphere, dhatu; indicates the destination or goal state; functions as the locative endpoint]
- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely [Adverb: thoroughly, entirely; intensifies the action of liberation; functions as modifier of the main verb]
- མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདའོ : will lead beyond suffering [Future form of `མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདའ་བ་`: to pass beyond sorrow, attain nirvana; the main verb indicating the bodhisattva's intended action; functions as the primary process in the resolution]

དེ་ལྟར་སེམས་ཅན་ཚད་མེད་པ་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་ཀྱང༌། སེམས་ཅན་གང་ཡང་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པར་གྱུར་པ་མེད་དོ་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire instruction about contemplating sentient beings' liberation" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ལྟར་སེམས་ཅན་ཚད་མེད་པ་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་ཀྱང༌། སེམས་ཅན་གང་ཡང་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པར་གྱུར་པ་མེད་དོ [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Parallel scenes presenting the paradoxical statements about liberation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ལྟར་སེམས་ཅན་ཚད་མེད་པ་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene stating that countless beings have been liberated" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སེམས་ཅན་ཚད་མེད་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The patients (sentient beings) who are said to have been liberated" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of liberation mentioned in the first statement" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེ་ལྟར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial modifying how the liberation occurred" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་གང་ཡང་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པར་གྱུར་པ་མེད་དོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene contradicting the first, stating no beings have been liberated" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སེམས་ཅན་གང་ཡང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The patients (sentient beings) referred to in the second statement" | Implicit: ""]
                └── གང་ཡང [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Quantifier emphasizing that not even a single being has been liberated" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པར་གྱུར་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of liberation referred to in the negative assertion" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མེད་དོ [Type: Negation | Desc: "Negative assertion that completes the second statement" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཀྱང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Adversative linker connecting the contradictory statements about liberation" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས་བསྐྱེད་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The mental process of generating a specific thought that is instructed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [bodhisattva/meditator] [Type: Implicit Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The implicit experiencer (bodhisattva) who should generate the thought" | Implicit: "The implicit experiencer (bodhisattva) who should generate the thought"]
        └── དེ་ལྟར་སེམས་ཅན་ཚད་མེད་པ་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་ཀྱང༌། སེམས་ཅན་གང་ཡང་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པར་གྱུར་པ་མེད་དོ [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Parallel scenes presenting the paradoxical statements about liberation" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་ལྟར་སེམས་ཅན་ཚད་མེད་པ་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene stating that countless beings have been liberated" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── སེམས་ཅན་ཚད་མེད་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The patients (sentient beings) who are said to have been liberated" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of liberation mentioned in the first statement" | Implicit: ""]
                └── དེ་ལྟར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial modifying how the liberation occurred" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སེམས་ཅན་གང་ཡང་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པར་གྱུར་པ་མེད་དོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene contradicting the first, stating no beings have been liberated" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── སེམས་ཅན་གང་ཡང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The patients (sentient beings) referred to in the second statement" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── གང་ཡང [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Quantifier emphasizing that not even a single being has been liberated" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པར་གྱུར་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of liberation referred to in the negative assertion" | Implicit: ""]
                └── མེད་དོ [Type: Negation | Desc: "Negative assertion that completes the second statement" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཀྱང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Adversative linker connecting the contradictory statements about liberation" | Implicit: ""]
    └── སྙམ་དུ [Type: Center | Desc: "Connector between the thought content and the instruction to generate that thought" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ལྟར་ : in this way [Adverbial, from `དེ་`: that + `ལྟར་`: like, as; here functioning as an adverbial modifier indicating the manner in which liberation occurs]

- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Noun, literally "possessor of mind"; functions as the Patient participant in the first statement about liberation]

- ཚད་མེད་པ་ : immeasurable, countless [Adjective modifying `སེམས་ཅན་`, from `ཚད་`: measure + `མེད་པ་`: without; describes the unlimited quantity of beings]

- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely, thoroughly [Adverb intensifying the process of liberation, indicates completeness of the action]

- མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་ : have passed beyond suffering [Verbal phrase, refers to nirvana or liberation; from `མྱ་ངན་`: suffering + `ལས་`: from + `འདས་`: to go beyond; functions as the main Process in the first statement]

- ཀྱང༌ : although, however [Adversative conjunction linking the two contradictory statements about liberation, indicating contrast]

- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Noun, repeated from first clause but now functioning as Patient in the second contradictory statement]

- གང་ཡང་ : any whatsoever [Indefinite pronoun + emphatic particle functioning as a Quantifier; emphasizes that not even a single being is liberated]

- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely, thoroughly [Adverb, same as above, intensifying the process of liberation in the second statement]

- མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདས་པར་ : as having passed beyond suffering [Verbal phrase nominalized by the particle པར་, functions as the Process in the second statement]

- གྱུར་པ་ : having become [Verbal auxiliary expressing perfect aspect; from `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform; completes the verbal phrase about liberation]

- མེད་དོ་ : do not exist [Negation marker + final particle; from `མེད་`: not exist + `དོ་`: sentence-final assertion marker; functions as the Negation that completes the second statement]

- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking [Complementizer linking the paradoxical content with the instruction to generate this thought; literally "thinking thus"]

- སེམས་ : mind, thought [Noun, `སེམས་`: mind, heart; here the object of generation in the instruction]

- བསྐྱེད་པར་ : to generate, produce [Verbal noun in purposive case; from `སྐྱེད་པ་`: to generate, produce; indicates the Process of mental generation]

- བྱའོ་ : one should do [Future/imperative form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do + sentence-final particle `འོ་`; completes the instruction to generate this specific thought]

དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་གལ་ཏེ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་ན་དེ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཞེས་མི་བྱ་ལ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node containing the entire text" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question that introduces the explanation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The subject being questioned about" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "The questioning process" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་གལ་ཏེ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་ན་དེ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཞེས་མི་བྱ་ལ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Elaboration answering the question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The addressee of the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གལ་ཏེ་...ན [Type: Condition | Desc: "Conditional relationship marker indicating a hypothetical situation and its consequence" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་ན་དེ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཞེས་མི་བྱ་ལ། [Type: Conditional Scenes | Desc: "The conditional relationship between protasis and apodosis" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག [Type: Scene | Desc: "The condition (protasis) - the perception of beings by a bodhisattva" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who is perceiving" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག [Type: Process | Desc: "The mental process of perceiving beings as having self-nature or inherent existence" | Implicit: "The original just says 'perceives', but the Buddhist context implies perceiving beings as having inherent existence"]
                └── སེམས་ཅན་དུ [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The conceptual target or direction of perception - seeing others as inherently existent beings" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཞེས་མི་བྱ་ལ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The result (apodosis) - the consequence of perceiving beings" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The person referred to (the one who perceives beings)" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── མི་བྱ [Type: Process | Desc: "The negative designation process" | Implicit: ""]
                └── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཞེས [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The designation that should not be applied" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; functions as the subject being questioned about in the opening rhetorical question]
- ཅིའི་ : for what [Interrogative pronoun in genitive case; from `ཅི་`: what; introduces the purpose or reason for inquiry]
- ཕྱིར་ : reason [Noun meaning "reason, purpose"; combined with ཅིའི་ forms the expression "for what reason"]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Final question particle; from `ཞེ་`: to say, speak; marks the end of a rhetorical question meaning "if one asks"]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; vocative case; the direct addressee of the Buddha's teaching; functions as recipient of the discourse]
- གལ་ཏེ་ : if [Conditional conjunction; introduces the protasis (condition clause) of the conditional statement]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [Compound noun; from `བྱང་ཆུབ་`: awakening/enlightenment + `སེམས་དཔའ་`: brave mind/hero; refers to one who seeks enlightenment for the benefit of all beings; functions as the agent in the conditional clause]
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Compound noun; from `སེམས་`: mind + `ཅན་`: possessing; refers to conscious beings in samsara; serves as the conceptual object of perception]
- དུ་ : as [Terminative particle; indicates transformation or categorization; marks how the bodhisattva perceives others]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Verbal noun; from `འདུ་`: to gather + `ཤེས་`: to know; refers to the mental aggregate of recognition or discrimination; indicates conceptual identification]
- འཇུག་ན : if engages in [Conditional verb; from `འཇུག་`: to engage, enter + conditional particle `ན`; denotes the mental action of applying a perception]
- དེ་ : that person [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the hypothetical bodhisattva mentioned earlier; functions as the patient in the apodosis]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [Compound noun; same as above; here represents the designation that would be inappropriate]
- ཞེས་ : called/named [Quotative particle; marks the preceding term as a designation or label]
- མི་བྱ་ : is not considered [Negative verb; from negation prefix `མི་` + `བྱ་`: to do, make; indicates the invalidity of applying the designation]
- ལ། : moreover [Continuative particle; indicates that more discourse is to follow; marks a pause before additional explanation]

གང་ཟག་གི་བར་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་ན་ཡང༌། དེ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཞེས་མི་བྱ་བའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire statement about perception and bodhisattva definition" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་ཟག་གི་བར་དུ་འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་ན་ཡང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Conditional scene about perception of persons" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [practitioner/bodhisattva] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit practitioner who perceives persons as inherently existing" | Implicit: "The implicit practitioner who perceives persons as inherently existing"]
        ├── འདུ་ཤེས་འཇུག་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of engaging in perception with conditional marker" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་ཟག་གི་བར་དུ [Type: Concept-Content | Desc: "The conceptual content of the perception - persons/sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡང༌ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Concessive adverbial modifying the conditional statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཞེས་མི་བྱ་བའི [Type: Scene | Desc: "Consequence scene stating negative attribution" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Refers to the practitioner mentioned in the conditional statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མི་བྱ་བའི [Type: Negative-Process | Desc: "Negative process indicating the person is not called/named something" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ [Type: Participant-Attribute | Desc: "The attribute or title that is not applied to the person" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཞེས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Quotative marker that introduces the term being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Causal-Connector | Desc: "Causal connector establishing the relationship between the two scenes" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- གང་ཟག་ : person [Noun; root: `གང་ཟག་`; referring to sentient beings; functions as the Content of perception]
- གི་ : of [Genitive particle; connects `གང་ཟག་` to `བར་`; indicates possessive relationship]
- བར་དུ་ : as [Terminative case; literally "until/between"; here used to indicate perception of something "as" something else]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Noun; root: `འདུ་ཤེས་`; technical Buddhist term for discriminative perception or recognition; functions as part of the Process]
- འཇུག་ན : if engages [Verb + conditional particle; root: `འཇུག་པ་`: to engage, enter; conditional marker `ན`; the main Process of the conditional clause]
- ཡང༌ : even [Concessive adverbial; indicates "even if" or "although"; modifies the entire conditional statement]
- དེ་ : that person [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the implicit practitioner mentioned in the first clause; functions as Patient in the consequence scene]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Noun; root: `བྱང་ཆུབ་`; Sanskrit bodhi; complete awakening; part of the compound term]
- སེམས་དཔའ་ : hero/warrior [Noun; root: `སེམས་དཔའ་`; Sanskrit sattva; courageous being; together with `བྱང་ཆུབ་` forms "bodhisattva"]
- ཞེས་ : called/named [Quotative marker; introduces the term or designation being discussed]
- མི་བྱ་བའི་ : is not [Negative verb + nominalizer; root: `བྱེད་པ་`: to do/make; with negative prefix `མི་`; indicates "is not designated as"; functions as Negative-Process]
- ཕྱིར་ : because [Causal marker; indicates the reason or purpose; connects the two scenes logically]
- རོ། ： is [Final particle; statement marker indicating assertion or declaration]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མེད་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Root node representing the entire rhetorical question and answer structure" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Rhetorical question part of the structure" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The subject of the rhetorical question" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "The questioning process itself" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མེད་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The answer part explaining the absence of dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The person being addressed by Buddha in this explanation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བའི་ཆོས་དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma concept that is being negated" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་དེ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept of dharma that is being negated" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The specific description of the dharma being referenced" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The destination or goal of the entering action" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of correctly entering" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཞེས་བྱ་བའི [Type: Elaborator-Function | Desc: "Function word that introduces the quoted concept" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་ཡང་མེད་པའི [Type: Process-Negation | Desc: "The negative assertion about the non-existence of the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཕྱིར་རོ [Type: Connector-Causal | Desc: "Causal connector indicating this is the reason for the previous statement" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [demonstrative pronoun; functions as the subject of the rhetorical question; referring to a preceding statement]
- ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ : why [interrogative phrase; literally "for what reason"; introduces the rhetorical question]
- ཞེ་ན། : if (you) ask [conditional verbal phrase; marks the end of a rhetorical question; signals that an explanation will follow]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name; vocative case; the disciple being addressed by the Buddha]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [noun; from Sanskrit bodhicitta; refers to awakened mind/consciousness]
- སེམས་དཔའི་ : of the bodhisattva [genitive case of `སེམས་དཔའ་`: heroic mind; one who seeks enlightenment for the benefit of all beings]
- ཐེག་པ་ : vehicle [noun; from `ཐེག་པ་`: yana; refers to a Buddhist path or method of practice]
- ལ་ : in/on/to [locative particle; indicates location or direction; here marks the goal/destination]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : correctly/perfectly [adverbial phrase; indicates the manner of entering; with complete authenticity]
- ཞུགས་པ་ : entering/engaging [verbal noun from `འཇུག་པ་`: to enter; describes the action of engaging with the path]
- ཞེས་ : called/termed [quotative particle; introduces a named concept or cited phrase]
- བྱ་བའི་ : called/named [genitive form of `བྱ་བ་`: action, deed; here functions to complete the quotative construction]
- ཆོས་ : dharma [noun; refers to doctrine, phenomena, or teaching; here refers to a specific concept or phenomenon]
- དེ་ : that [demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the previously described concept]
- གང་ཡང་ : any whatsoever [indefinite pronoun with emphatic particle; strengthens the negation]
- མེད་པའི་ : does not exist [negative existential verb with genitive particle; negates the existence of the previously mentioned dharma]
- ཕྱིར་ : because [causal connector; indicates that this clause provides the reason for the preceding rhetorical question]
- རོ། ། : is [sentence-final particle indicating the completion of the statement with a factual/declarative tone]

རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene representing the Buddha questioning Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The person being addressed and asked to think" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི [Type: Center | Desc: "The central referent of the question that Subhuti is being asked to contemplate" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of thinking that Subhuti is being asked to perform" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on how the thinking should occur, questioning the manner of thinking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Buddha (implicit speaker)] [Type: Participant-Speaker | Desc: "The Buddha as the implicit speaker addressing Subhuti in this interrogative construction" | Implicit: "The Buddha as the implicit speaker addressing Subhuti"]
    ├── [interrogative function] [Type: Function | Desc: "Marks the rhetorical question function of the entire sentence posed by the Buddha to prompt contemplation" | Implicit: "Marks the rhetorical question function"]
    └── [whether there was any dharma attained from Buddha Dipankara] [Type: Implicit Content | Desc: "The implicit philosophical question about whether the Buddha actually attained any dharma from Buddha Dipankara" | Implicit: "The implicit philosophical question about whether the Buddha actually attained any dharma from Buddha Dipankara"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper noun; name of one of Buddha's main disciples; functions as the addressee/recipient of the Buddha's question in this discourse]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; indicating the subject matter being discussed; serves as the central referent of the contemplation being requested]
- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [Interrogative phrase; literally "in what manner of thinking"; functions as an adverbial elaborator indicating how Subhuti should direct his contemplation]
- སེམས : think [Verb, present tense of སེམས་པ་: to think, contemplate; here functioning as the main process or action that Subhuti is being asked to perform]

དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་མར་མེ་མཛད་ལས་གང་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ཆོས་གང་ཡང་ཡོད་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the Buddha's question about receiving dharma from Dipankara Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── Subhuti (implied) [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The person being addressed (Subhuti) who is implied in the questioning context" | Implicit: "Subhuti"]
    ├── སྙམ་མམ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central questioning element of the sentence indicating 'does one think/wonder'" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Tathagata (Buddha) who is asking the question and was previously the recipient of teachings" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་མར་མེ་མཛད་ལས་གང་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ཆོས་གང་ཡང་ཡོད [Type: Scene | Desc: "Embedded scene describing the potential dharma received from Dipankara Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་མར་མེ་མཛད [Type: Participant-Source | Desc: "Dipankara Buddha who is the potential source of dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལས [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relator indicating the relationship between Dipankara Buddha and the dharma potentially received" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma or teaching that might have been received" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གང་ཡང [Type: Function | Desc: "Interrogative function indicating 'any' or 'whatever' dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཡོད [Type: Center | Desc: "The existential core of the question - whether such dharma exists or not" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the process of enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of becoming fully enlightened" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The state of supreme enlightenment that was attained" | Implicit: ""]
    └── in the past (implied) [Type: Time | Desc: "The temporal context indicating this refers to a past event when the Buddha met Dipankara Buddha" | Implicit: "in the past"]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས : by the Tathagata [Instrumental/Agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Thus-Gone One, Tathagata; here referring to Shakyamuni Buddha as the speaker asking the question; functions as the Agent in the sentence]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : the Tathagata [Nominative of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Thus-Gone One; here specifically referring to a previous Buddha as the source of potential teachings]

- མར་མེ་མཛད་ : Dipankara ["Lamp-maker"; proper name of a previous Buddha who lived long before Shakyamuni; serves as the specific identification of the source Buddha]

- ལས་ : from [Ablative particle indicating source or origin; links Dipankara Buddha as the source from which dharma might have been received]

- གང་ : any [Interrogative pronoun serving as a qualifier; used here to question whether "any" dharma at all was received]

- བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ : unsurpassable [Compound from `བླ་`: above + `ན`: locative + `མེད་པ`: without; "that which has nothing above it"; describes the supreme quality of enlightenment]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfect, authentic [Adverbial form of `ཡང་དག་པ་`: authentic, genuine, correct; modifies the completeness of enlightenment]

- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive/Attributive of `རྫོགས་པ་`: to complete, perfect; qualifying the type of enlightenment as fully developed]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Sanskrit: bodhi; the awakened state of a Buddha; functions as the Goal or target state of the enlightenment process]

- ཏུ་ : into, as [Terminative particle indicating transformation or direction; shows the movement toward the state of enlightenment]

- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly [Adverbial form of `མངོན་པ་`: manifest, evident; describes how the enlightenment was fully realized]

- རྫོགས་པར་ : completely [Adverbial form of `རྫོགས་པ་`: complete, perfect; emphasizes the thoroughness of the enlightenment process]

- སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ : became enlightened [Genitive/Attributive of `སངས་རྒྱས་པ་`: to become a Buddha; the verbal process of attaining Buddhahood]

- ཆོས་ : dharma [Teaching, doctrine, phenomenon; the potential object that might have been received from Dipankara Buddha; functions as the Patient in the embedded scene]

- གང་ཡང་ : any whatsoever [Compound of `གང་`: which + `ཡང་`: even, also; an emphatic interrogative indicating "any at all"; intensifies the questioning]

- ཡོད་ : exists [Present tense of `ཡོད་པ་`: to exist, have; the existential core of the question regarding whether dharma was received]

- སྙམ་མམ : do (you) think? [Interrogative form of `སྙམ་པ་`: to think, wonder; the questioning verb directed at Subhuti, forming the central interrogative core of the sentence]
