དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ་དང༌།བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ་ཚེ་དང༌ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root of the graph representing the entire passage" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ་དང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene depicting the Buddha's speech" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the speaker in the first scene" | Implicit: "The Buddha as speaker is implied but not explicitly mentioned in this clause"]
        ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of speaking or teaching by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Content | Desc: "The content of what was spoken by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དང༌ [Type: Time | Desc: "Temporal marker indicating when this speech occurred" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དང༌། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector between the two scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ་ཚེ་དང༌ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene depicting Subhuti addressing the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཚེ་དང༌ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Subhuti as the speaker in the second scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The Buddha as the recipient of Subhuti's speech" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསོལ་ཏོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of addressing or asking by Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Content | Desc: "Introduction to the content of what Subhuti said" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [Question about whether there was any dharma that was truly obtained from Dipankara Buddha] [Type: Content-Implicit | Desc: "The implicit content of Subhuti's question about the Buddha's previous teachings" | Implicit: "The implicit content of Subhuti's question about the Buddha's previous teachings"]
glossary:
- དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་ : thus [Adverbial phrase; `དེ་` (that) + `སྐད་` (speech) + `ཅེས་` (quotative marker); refers to what was previously spoken; functions as Content marker introducing the Buddha's speech]
- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ་ : taught [Past tense of `བཀའ་སྩལ་བ་`: to teach, pronounce, proclaim; honorific speech verb used for the Buddha's teachings; serves as the main Process of the first scene]
- དང༌། : and then [Connective particle; temporal marker + clause connector; links the two scenes chronologically; indicates sequence between the Buddha's teaching and Subhuti's response]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; `བཅོམ་` (conquered) + `ལྡན་` (possessing) + `འདས་` (transcended); refers to the Buddha as one who has conquered the afflictions and transcended samsara; functions as Recipient in the second scene]
- ལ་ : to [Dative case marker; indicates the recipient of speech; connects the Buddha as the one being addressed by Subhuti]
- ཚེ་དང༌ལྡན་པ་ : the Venerable [Honorific title; `ཚེ་` (life) + `དང༌` (and) + `ལྡན་པ་` (possessing); literally "endowed with life"; respectful address for monks; part of Agent designation for Subhuti]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; one of Buddha's chief disciples known for his understanding of emptiness; functions as the main Agent in the second scene]
- གྱིས་ : by [Instrumental/agentive case marker; indicates Subhuti as the performer of the action; marks the Agent of the speaking verb]
- འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་ : as follows [Adverbial phrase; `འདི་` (this) + `སྐད་` (speech) + `ཅེས་` (quotative marker); introduces the content of what will be said; serves as Content marker for Subhuti's speech]
- གསོལ་ཏོ། ། : addressed/said [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, say, address; honorific verb used when addressing the Buddha; the main Process of the second scene; the final particle `ཏོ། །` marks the end of the statement]

བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་མར་མེ་མཛད་ལས་གང་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མ་མཆིས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The main scene representing the Buddha's statement about non-reception of dharma" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The main entity (Buddha) who is making the statement" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration/apposition of the Blessed One as the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མ་མཆིས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main predicate asserting non-existence/non-obtainment of dharma" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma that is the object of non-existence/non-obtainment" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གང་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relative clause describing the dharma in question" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བླ་ན་མེད་པ [Type: State | Desc: "Quality of the enlightenment being unsurpassed" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི [Type: State | Desc: "Quality of the enlightenment being perfect and complete" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of attaining complete enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་མར་མེ་མཛད་ལས [Type: Participant-Source | Desc: "The source from which no dharma was obtained" | Implicit: ""]
    └── IMPLICIT-INTERROGATIVE [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Implicit interrogative frame indicating the Buddha is questioning whether any dharma was received" | Implicit: "Implicit interrogative frame indicating the Buddha is questioning whether any dharma was received"]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : The Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of བཅོམ་ "conquered" (the four māras/obstructions), ལྡན་ "possessing" (the qualities of enlightenment), and འདས་ "transcended" (saṃsāra); functions as the main Agent in the statement]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathāgata [Ergative/Agentive case of དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་, "Thus-Gone One," an epithet of the Buddha; elaborating apposition to བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་; indicating the agent who is making the assertion]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : the Tathāgata [Another epithet for a Buddha, literally "Thus-Gone One"; here referring specifically to Buddha Dīpaṃkara mentioned next; functions as part of the Source from which no dharma was obtained]

- མར་མེ་མཛད་ : Dīpaṃkara [Proper name of a previous Buddha, literally "Lamp-maker"; modifies the preceding དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ to specify which Tathāgata is meant; part of the Source participant]

- ལས་ : from [Ablative particle indicating source/origin; connects to the verb མ་མཆིས་སོ་ to indicate "did not receive from"; marks Dīpaṃkara as the Source participant]

- གང་ : which/what [Interrogative/relative pronoun; begins the relative clause describing the dharma that was not obtained; connecting to the Patient participant]

- བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ : unsurpassed [Adjectival phrase: བླ་ན་ "above" + མེད་པ་ "without", meaning "nothing higher"; qualifies the enlightenment as supreme; part of the description of the dharma not received]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfect, authentic [Adverbial expression meaning "truly, correctly, authentically"; modifies རྫོགས་པའི་ to emphasize the completeness is genuine; part of the quality description]

- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive form of རྫོགས་པ་ "complete, perfect"; connects to བྱང་ཆུབ་ "enlightenment"; part of the compound describing the quality of enlightenment]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Sanskrit bodhi; the state of awakening or understanding; object of the perfection and the attainment; central concept in the relative clause]

- ཏུ་ : as, into [Terminative particle indicating transformation or result; connects to སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ to show the process of becoming enlightened]

- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly [Adverbial expression meaning "evidently, manifestly, clearly"; modifies རྫོགས་པར་ to emphasize the completeness is visible/manifest]

- རྫོགས་པར་ : completely [Terminative form of རྫོགས་པ་ "complete"; adverbially modifies སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ to describe how the awakening occurred]

- སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ : became awakened to [Genitive form of སངས་རྒྱས་པ་ "became Buddha/awakened"; connects to ཆོས་ to indicate the dharma related to the Buddha's enlightenment; main verb in the relative clause]

- ཆོས་ : dharma [Sanskrit dharma; refers to teaching, phenomenon, or truth; the Patient participant - the object that was not obtained]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the previously described dharma; part of the Patient participant]

- གང་ཡང་ : any whatsoever [གང་ "what/which" + ཡང་ "even, also"; emphasizes the complete absence of any dharma; part of the Patient participant]

- མ་མཆིས་སོ། : did not exist/was not obtained [Negative (མ་) + honorific verb མཆིས་ "to exist/to have" + final particle སོ་; the main Process of the sentence, indicating the Buddha did not obtain any dharma from Dīpaṃkara]

དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་པ་དང༌། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing the entire passage with two main scenes connected by a linker" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་པ་དང༌། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing Subhuti's speech act" | Implicit: "[Subhuti]"]
        ├── གསོལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The speech act process of requesting/saying" | Implicit: ""]

            └── [referring to previous speech] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Indicates that 'དེ་སྐད་ཅེས' refers to previous speech content that establishes context for the dialogue" | Implicit: "Reference to previous speech content that establishes context for the dialogue"]
        └── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker (Subhuti) who is making the request or statement in this scene" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དང༌། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction connecting the two scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene describing the Buddha's speech act" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent performing the speaking action in the second scene" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སངས་རྒྱས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Clarifies that 'བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་' (Bhagavan/Blessed One) refers to the Buddha" | Implicit: "Clarifies that 'བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་' (Bhagavan/Blessed One) refers to the Buddha"]
        ├── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient of the Buddha's speech" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Honorific title that represents the respectful form of address used for Subhuti, carrying cultural significance in this Buddhist dialogue" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The speech act process performed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདི་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The content of what was spoken by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [Buddha's upcoming speech] [Type: Implicit Speech Content | Desc: "Represents the actual content of the Buddha's speech that will follow in the text" | Implicit: "Represents the actual content of the Buddha's speech that will follow in the text"]
glossary:
- དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་ : thus, in this way [Adverbial phrase; `དེ་སྐད་` = "those words/that manner" + `ཅེས་` = quotative particle; refers to the preceding speech that establishes context for this dialogue; functions as Patient/content of what was spoken]

- གསོལ་པ་ : having requested/spoken [Verbal noun of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, speak (honorific); indicates the completed action of Subhuti's speech; functions as the main Process in the first scene]

- དང༌། : and [Conjunction; links the two scenes - Subhuti's speech and Buddha's response; serves as the Linker between parallel events]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers specifically to the Buddha; functions as the Agent of the second scene]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates that Buddha is the Agent performing the action of speaking; marks the ergative case]

- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : Venerable [Honorific title; literally "endowed with life"; respectful form of address used for senior monks; functions as an Elaborator describing Subhuti]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; one of Buddha's chief disciples known for understanding emptiness; functions as the Recipient of Buddha's speech]

- ལ་ : to [Dative case marker; indicates Subhuti as the recipient of Buddha's speech; marks the indirect object relationship]

- འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་ : as follows [Adverbial phrase; `འདི་སྐད་` = "these words/this manner" + `ཅེས་` = quotative particle; introduces Buddha's upcoming speech; functions as Patient/content marker]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། : proclaimed [Honorific verb for "spoke/said"; `བཀའ་` = "speech/word" (honorific) + `སྩལ་` = "bestowed"; indicates the Buddha's authoritative speech; functions as the main Process in the second scene]

- ། : [Sentence-final shad punctuation mark indicating end of statement]

རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ནོ། །དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ཏེ། [Type: Linkers | Desc: "Root node representing connected dialogue sequences" | Implicit: ""]

        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The person being addressed (Subhuti)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The subject of confirmation (the previously discussed point)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་བཞིན་ནོ [Type: Process-Affirmation | Desc: "Affirmative response confirming the absence of attained dharma" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene showing Buddha's reinforcing confirmation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [The Blessed One] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implied speaker (The Blessed One/Buddha) making the second confirmation" | Implicit: "The implied speaker (The Blessed One/Buddha) making the second confirmation"]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The subject of confirmation (the previously discussed point)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་བཞིན་ཏེ [Type: Process-Affirmation | Desc: "Buddha's emphatic affirmation reinforcing the truth of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper noun; name of one of Buddha's chief disciples; functions as the addressed Recipient in this dialogue]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the previously discussed point about the absence of attained dharma; functions as the Patient or subject being confirmed]
- དེ་བཞིན་ : thus/just so [Adverbial phrase from `དེ་` (that) + `བཞིན་` (like, manner); indicates affirmation or agreement with what was previously stated; functions as the Process element]
- ནོ : is [Final particle marking statement; makes the statement definite, equivalent to "it is so"; completes the affirmative response]
- ། : [Sentence-ending mark in Tibetan punctuation]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers again to the same point being discussed; functions as Patient in the second statement]
- དེ་བཞིན་ : thus/just so [Adverbial phrase expressing agreement; Buddha's emphatic confirmation of Subhuti's understanding; reinforces the truth of the previous statement]
- ཏེ : indeed [Connective particle indicating emphasis or continuation; adds force to Buddha's confirmation; completes the affirmative response]
- ། : [Sentence-ending mark in Tibetan punctuation]

དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་མར་མེ་མཛད་ལས་གང་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མེད་དོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire statement about the Tathagata not attaining any dharma" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The main agent of the scene, referring to the Tathagata/Buddha who did not attain any dharma" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The main process in the scene describing the attainment of enlightenment that is being negated" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་ཡང་མེད་དོ [Type: Adverbial-Negation | Desc: "The negation component that asserts the non-existence of any dharma that was attained" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཆོས་དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The patient/object that is being negated - the dharma that was supposedly attained" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་མར་མེ་མཛད་ལས [Type: Participant-Source | Desc: "The source from which the Tathagata did not receive any dharma, referring to Buddha Dipankara" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ [Type: State | Desc: "The state of enlightenment that is referenced in the context of the process" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : The Tathāgata [Agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Thus-Gone One, epithet of the Buddha; functions as the main agent in the sentence who did not receive any dharma]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : the Tathāgata [Nominative case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Thus-Gone One; here referring specifically to Buddha Dipankara as the source]

- མར་མེ་མཛད་ : Dīpaṃkara [Proper name, literally "Lamp-Maker"; the specific Buddha from whom nothing was attained]

- ལས་ : from [Ablative particle indicating source; marks Buddha Dipankara as the source from which no dharma was obtained]

- གང་ : any [Interrogative pronoun functioning as an indefinite; refers to "any dharma" that might have been attained]

- བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ : unsurpassed [Compound adjective, literally "without superior"; qualifies the enlightenment as the highest possible form]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfect, authentic [Adverbial phrase qualifying the completeness of enlightenment; indicates the genuine nature of awakening]

- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Adjectival form of `རྫོགས་པ་`: to complete, perfect; describes the enlightenment as fully realized]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment, awakening [Sanskrit: bodhi; the state of awakening that is mentioned as the context]

- ཏུ་ : as, into [Terminative particle indicating transformation or state; marks the type of enlightenment being discussed]

- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly [Adverbial form; indicates the visible, manifest nature of the awakening]

- རྫོགས་པར་ : completely [Adverbial form of `རྫོགས་པ་`: to complete; describes how thoroughly the awakening was realized]

- སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ : awakened, buddha-ed [Verbal noun form of `སངས་རྒྱས་`: to become a Buddha; the main process being negated in the sentence]

- ཆོས་ : dharma [Sanskrit: dharma; the teaching, phenomenon, or quality that is the object of the negation]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the dharma that was supposedly attained]

- གང་ཡང་ : any whatsoever [Emphatic form of གང་; strengthens the negation to mean "not any at all"]

- མེད་དོ : does not exist [Negative existential verb with final particle; the main negation asserting that no dharma was attained]

glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative of proper name; addressee of Buddha's teaching; functions as Recipient in the semantic structure]

- གལ་ཏེ་ : if [Conditional conjunction; introduces a hypothetical situation; functions as Conditional-Linker establishing the hypothetical nature]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [Ergative of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Thus-Gone One, Buddha; agent who performs the awakening; functions as Agent in the conditional clause]

- གང་ : which [Relative pronoun connecting to ཆོས་, referring to dharmas; introduces the object of awakening]

- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly [Adverbial prefix indicating complete manifestation; modifies the process of awakening]

- རྫོགས་པར་ : perfectly [Adverbial indicating completeness; modifies the process of awakening]

- སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ : awakened to [Genitive of `སངས་རྒྱས་པ་`: to become enlightened; the process of becoming fully awakened; functions as Process]

- ཆོས་ : dharma [Noun: teaching, phenomenon, truth; object of enlightenment; functions as Patient in the structure]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun qualifying ཆོས་; specifies the dharmas being discussed]

- འགའ་ཞིག་ : any [Indefinite pronoun; indicating any instance of dharma; qualifies the hypothetical existence]

- ཡོད་པར་ : existed [Terminative of `ཡོད་པ་`: to exist; hypothetical state of existence being considered; functions as State]

- གྱུར་ན་ : were to become [Conditional form of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become; completes the conditional clause; indicates the hypothetical situation]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : the Tathagata [Nominal phrase: Thus-Gone One, Buddha; identifies the specific Buddha making the prediction]

- མར་མེ་མཛད་ཀྱིས་ : Dipamkara [Instrumental of proper name: "Lamp Bearer"; the Buddha who made the prediction; functions as Agent in the consequence clause]

- ང་ལ་ : to me [Dative of `ང་`: I; the speaker (Buddha Shakyamuni) as recipient of prediction; functions as Recipient]

- བྲམ་ཟེའི་ : brahmin's [Genitive of `བྲམ་ཟེ་`: brahmin; modifies ཁྱེའུ་; part of the address in the prediction]

- ཁྱེའུ་ : youth [Noun: boy, young man; part of the form of address in the prediction]

- ཁྱོད་ : you [Second person pronoun; refers to the recipient (Buddha's former self) of the prediction; functions as Patient in the reported speech]

- མ་འོངས་པའི་ : future [Genitive of `མ་འོངས་པ་`: that which has not come; temporal specification; functions as Adverbial modifier]

- དུས་ན་ : in time [Locative of `དུས་`: time; completes the temporal phrase; functions as Adverbial]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : the Tathagata [Nominal phrase: Thus-Gone One; part of the Buddha's future title; functions as part of Goal]

- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : Arhat [Nominal phrase: Foe-Destroyer; part of the Buddha's future title; functions as part of Goal]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [Adverbial phrase: truly, correctly; qualifies the awakening; functions as part of Goal]

- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive of `རྫོགས་པ་`: complete; qualifies the awakening; functions as part of Goal]

- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Noun: Awakened One; central term in the title; functions as part of Goal]

- ཤཱཀྱ་ཐུབ་པ་ : Shakyamuni [Nominal phrase: Sage of the Shakyas; name identifying the specific Buddha; functions as part of Goal]

- ཞེས་ : called [Quotative particle; marks the end of the prediction content; functions as Relator connecting reported speech]

- བྱ་བར་ : will be [Terminative of `བྱ་བ་`: to be called; indicates what one will be called; part of future prediction]

- འགྱུར་རོ་ : will become [Future form of `འགྱུར་བ་` with declarative particle: to become; indicates future transformation; functions as Process]

- ཞེས་ : saying [Quotative particle; introduces quoted prediction; functions as Relator]

- ལུང་ : prophecy [Noun: prediction, scripture, instruction; the prophetic statement being discussed; object of the negation]

- མི་ : not [Negative particle; negates the making of prediction; key to understanding the conditional argument]

- སྟོན་པ་ : teach [Verb: to show, teach, reveal; negated action; functions as State]

- ཞིག་ན་ : would have been [Particle + conditional: indicating the hypothetical result; completes the consequence clause of the condition]

རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ལྟར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གང་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མེད་པས [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of the discourse" | Implicit: ""]

        ├── བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The goal of attainment" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner of attainment" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སངས་རྒྱས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]

        ├── གང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Reference pronoun" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཡང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Emphatic particle" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མེད་པས [Type: Process | Desc: "Negation verb" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [since/because] [Type: Linker | Desc: "Implicit causal connector" | Implicit: "causal relationship between non-existence of dharma and Buddha's enlightenment"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Vocative case; proper name of the Buddha's disciple being addressed; functions as the recipient of this teaching]
- འདི་ལྟར་ : thus [Adverbial; literally "like this"; indicates the manner of what follows; introduces the explanation]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathāgata [Agentive/ergative case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "Thus-Gone One", epithet of the Buddha; acts as the main agent of the sentence]
- གང་ : whatever [Interrogative/relative pronoun; here functioning as a reference marker that links to the dharma being discussed]
- བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ : unsurpassed [Attributive of `བླ་ན་མེད་པ་`: without superior, supreme; describes the enlightenment as having no higher state]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfect [Adverbial from `ཡང་དག་པ་`: genuine, authentic, correct; indicates the complete and genuine nature of enlightenment]
- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive of `རྫོགས་པ་`: to complete, perfect; modifies enlightenment, indicating its completeness]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་ : into enlightenment [Terminative case of `བྱང་ཆུབ་`: bodhi, awakening; indicates the goal toward which the Buddha's realization is directed]
- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly [Adverbial from `མངོན་པ་`: evident, manifest; describes the manner of the Buddha's realization]
- རྫོགས་པར་ : completely [Adverbial from `རྫོགས་པ་`: to complete, perfect; indicates the thoroughness of awakening]
- སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ : awakened to [Genitive of `སངས་རྒྱས་པ་`: to become a Buddha, to awaken; the process of enlightenment itself]
- ཆོས་ : dharma [Noun: teaching, phenomenon, truth; refers to the content of enlightenment]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers specifically to the dharma mentioned]
- གང་ཡང་ : any whatsoever [Combination of interrogative pronoun `གང་` and emphatic particle `ཡང་`; emphasizes the absence of any dharma]
- མེད་པས་ : because there is none [Causal form of `མེད་པ་`: non-existence; indicates the reason or logical basis; the final `-ས་` creates a causal relationship]

དེའི་ཕྱིར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་མར་མེ་མཛད་ཀྱིས་ང་ལ་བྲམ་ཟེའི་ཁྱེའུ་ཁྱོད་མ་འོངས་པའི་དུས་ན་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་ཤཱཀྱ་ཐུབ་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བར་འགྱུར་རོ་ཞེས་ལུང་བསྟན་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire prophecy narrative" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེའི་ཕྱིར [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connective phrase linking to previous context" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་མར་མེ་མཛད་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who gives the prophecy" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལུང་བསྟན་ཏོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of prophesying" | Implicit: ""]

    ├── བྲམ་ཟེའི་ཁྱེའུ་ཁྱོད་མ་འོངས་པའི་དུས་ན་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་ཤཱཀྱ་ཐུབ་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བར་འགྱུར་རོ་ཞེས [Type: Scene | Desc: "The quoted content of the prophecy" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྲམ་ཟེའི་ཁྱེའུ་ཁྱོད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The addressee of the prophecy (the young brahmin who will become Shakyamuni)" | Implicit: ""]
            └──  [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relation indicating that 'to me' and 'you, young brahmin' refer to the same person" | Implicit: "Reference linking"]
                └── ང་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient of the prophecy (the speaker, later Shakyamuni)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མ་འོངས་པའི་དུས་ན [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Temporal modifier indicating when the prophecy will be fulfilled" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་ཤཱཀྱ་ཐུབ་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བར་འགྱུར་རོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The core prophecy about becoming Buddha Shakyamuni" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འགྱུར་རོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of becoming or transformation" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་ཤཱཀྱ་ཐུབ་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བར [Type: State | Desc: "The future state of being that is prophesied" | Implicit: ""]

                └── ཤཱཀྱ་ཐུབ་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བར [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Specification of the Buddha's name" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཞེས [Type: State | Desc: "Quotative marker that connects the prophecy content to the reporting verb" | Implicit: ""]
    └──  [Type: Parallel | Desc: "Parallel relation connecting 'to me' and 'you, young brahmin' as referring to the same entity" | Implicit: "Connection between the recipient and addressee"]
        ├── ང་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient of the prophecy (the speaker, later Shakyamuni)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བྲམ་ཟེའི་ཁྱེའུ་ཁྱོད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The addressee of the prophecy (the young brahmin who will become Shakyamuni)" | Implicit: ""]
            └──  [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relation indicating that 'to me' and 'you, young brahmin' refer to the same person" | Implicit: "Reference linking"]

glossary:
- དེའི་ཕྱིར་ : therefore [Causal connective; composed of `དེ་` (that) + genitive particle `འི་` + directional `ཕྱིར་` (for); functions as a Linker connecting this narrative to previous context]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathāgata [Honorific title for Buddha; literally "Thus-Gone One"; functions as part of the Agent who delivers the prophecy]
- མར་མེ་མཛད་ : Dīpaṃkara [Proper name meaning "Lamp-maker"; the specific Buddha who delivers the prophecy; functions as part of the Agent]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates that Dīpaṃkara is the Agent performing the prophesying action]
- ང་ལ་ : to me [Dative case; `ང་` (I/me) + dative marker `ལ་`; functions as the Recipient of the prophecy; refers to the speaker who later becomes Buddha Śākyamuni]
- བྲམ་ཟེའི་ : brahmin's [Genitive case of `བྲམ་ཟེ་` (brahmin); modifies `ཁྱེའུ་` (boy); part of how the Buddha addresses his previous incarnation]
- ཁྱེའུ་ : boy [Noun referring to a young male; here specifically referring to the young incarnation of the speaker]
- ཁྱོད་ : you [Second person singular pronoun; referring to the brahmin boy; functions as the addressee of the prophecy who is the same person as "me" in the narrative frame]
- མ་འོངས་པའི་ : future [Negated perfect of `འོང་` (to come) + genitive particle; literally "not-come"; modifies "time"]
- དུས་ན་ : in time [Temporal noun `དུས་` (time) + locative particle `ན་`; functions as a Temporal modifier indicating when the prophecy will be fulfilled]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathāgata [Honorific title; "Thus-Gone One"; first in a series of epithets describing the future Buddha status]
- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : Arhat [Title meaning "Foe-destroyer"; second epithet elaborating Buddha's qualities as one who has vanquished the enemies of delusion]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [Adverbial phrase meaning "completely" or "thoroughly"; modifies the following "complete"]
- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Perfect form of `རྫོགས་` (to complete) + genitive particle; modifies "Buddha"; describes the state of perfect enlightenment]
- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Noun meaning "Awakened One"; the culminating title in the series of epithets]
- ཤཱཀྱ་ཐུབ་པ་ : Śākyamuni ["Sage of the Śākyas"; proper name identifying which specific Buddha is prophesied]
- ཞེས་ : called [Quotative particle; connects the name to the verb "become"]
- བྱ་བར་ : named [Future of `བྱེད་` (to do/call) + terminative particle; "to be called"]
- འགྱུར་རོ་ : will become [Future tense of `འགྱུར་` (to become/transform) + final particle; main verb of the prophecy indicating transformation into future state]
- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative particle marking the end of the direct speech/prophecy]
- ལུང་བསྟན་ཏོ : prophesied [Past tense of `ལུང་སྟོན་` (to prophesy) + final particle; the main Process verb of the entire passage]
- ། : [Sentence-final punctuation mark]

དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ཞེས་པ་ནི། ཡང་དག་པའི་དེ་བཞིན་ཉིད་ཀྱི་ཚིག་བླ་དྭགས་ཡིན་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Root | Desc: "The entire text containing a philosophical explanation about the term Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "A rhetorical question asking for the reason behind a previous statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The demonstrative pronoun referring to a previous statement or concept" | Implicit: ""]

    └── རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ཞེས་པ་ནི། ཡང་དག་པའི་དེ་བཞིན་ཉིད་ཀྱི་ཚིག་བླ་དྭགས་ཡིན་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The answer explaining the meaning of the term 'Tathagata'" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient of the explanation, the disciple Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ཞེས་པ་ནི [Type: Center | Desc: "The central topic being defined in this statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཡང་དག་པའི་དེ་བཞིན་ཉིད་ཀྱི་ཚིག་བླ་དྭགས་ཡིན་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ [Type: Definition | Desc: "The definition or explanation of what 'Tathagata' means, including the causal marker" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡང་དག་པའི་དེ་བཞིན་ཉིད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The core philosophical concept being referred to" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཡང་དག་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Modifier specifying the nature of 'suchness' as true or authentic" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཚིག་བླ་དྭགས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The term indicating that 'Tathagata' is a designation for the concept" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཡིན་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ [Type: Relator | Desc: "The causal marker indicating the reason for the statement" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [Buddha] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implied speaker (Buddha) who is explaining the meaning of 'Tathagata' to Subhuti" | Implicit: "Clarifies implied or contextually understood content that is not explicitly stated in the original text but necessary for comprehension"]
glossary:
- དེ་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to a previously mentioned statement or concept; functions as Patient in the semantic structure]
- ཅིའི་ : what's [Interrogative genitive case of `ཅི་`: what; used to form the interrogative phrase "for what reason"; part of the questioning process]
- ཕྱིར་ : reason [Noun: reason, cause; used with interrogative to ask "why"; forms part of the rhetorical question structure]
- ཞེ་ན : if asked [Conditional particle indicating a hypothetical statement; marks a rhetorical question "if one asks why"; concludes the question phrase]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; the disciple of Buddha who is the recipient of this teaching; functions as Recipient in the semantic structure]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathagata [Buddhist technical term; literally "thus-gone one", an epithet for Buddha; the central topic being defined in this statement]
- ཞེས་པ་ : is called [Quotative marker; indicating that the preceding term is being discussed or defined; used to introduce a definition]
- ནི : indeed [Topic marker; emphasizes and highlights the preceding term as the main topic of discussion]
- ཡང་དག་པའི་ : authentic/true [Genitive of `ཡང་དག་པ`: authentic, genuine, correct; modifies "suchness"; describes the nature of suchness as authentic]
- དེ་བཞིན་ཉིད་ : suchness [Buddhist technical term; `དེ་བཞིན`: thus, in that way + `ཉིད`: -ness; refers to ultimate reality or true nature of phenomena; core philosophical concept]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; connects "authentic suchness" with "designation"]
- ཚིག་ : term [Noun: word, term, expression; refers to the verbal designation or label]
- བླ་དྭགས་ : designation [Noun: label, designation; indicates that "Tathagata" is a verbal designation for the concept of authentic suchness]
- ཡིན་པའི་ : being [Genitive of the verb `ཡིན་`: to be; connects the statement to its causal explanation]
- ཕྱིར་རོ : because it is [Causal marker `ཕྱིར་` + final particle `རོ`; indicates the reason for the statement; concludes the explanation with emphasis]

ཡང་རབ་འབྱོར་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་འདི་སྐད་དུ། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱིས་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་སོ་ཞེས་ཟེར་ན། དེ་ལོག་པར་སྨྲ་བ་ཡིན་ནོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The complete discourse where Buddha explains to Subhuti about incorrect assertions regarding enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]

        ├── ན། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connects the condition to the consequence" | Implicit: ""]

            ├── གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The hypothetical person making the statement" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཟེར [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of speaking or claiming" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདི་སྐད་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Indicates how the statement is made" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱིས་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་སོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The content of the hypothetical statement, which is being presented as a conventional truth (ཀུན་རྫོབ) rather than an ultimate truth (དོན་དམ་པ), reflecting the distinction crucial to understanding why such a statement would be considered 'speaking falsely' when taken as an ultimate truth" | Implicit: "[statement from conventional perspective]"]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Center | Desc: "The central concept representing 'ཡང་དག་པའི་དེ་བཞིན་ཉིད' (true suchness itself) rather than a conventional agent" | Implicit: ""]

    └── དེ་ལོག་པར་སྨྲ་བ་ཡིན་ནོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The scene describing the consequence of making such a claim" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Refers to the hypothetical person making the claim" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྨྲ་བ་ཡིན་ནོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of speaking falsely" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལོག་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "How the speaking is being done - incorrectly or falsely" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [2.3 ལས་འབྲས་བུར་གྱུར་པ] [Type: Relator | Desc: "An implicit causal relation showing that this statement is a direct consequence of misunderstanding the nature of enlightenment as described in node 2.3" | Implicit: "An implicit causal relation showing that this statement is a direct consequence of misunderstanding the nature of enlightenment as described in node 2.3"]
glossary:
- ཡང་ : moreover [connective particle; indicates additional content; functions as a discourse marker signaling a new topic or point]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name; vocative case; addressee of Buddha's teaching; functions as Participant-Agent in the discourse]
- གང་ : whoever [indefinite pronoun; refers to a hypothetical person; introduces the conditional clause]
- ལ་ལ་ : some [indefinite quantifier; combines with གང་ to mean "anyone" or "whoever"]
- ཞིག་ : a/any [indefinite article; completes the indefinite construction]
- འདི་སྐད་དུ་ : in these words [demonstrative + manner adverbial; literally "in this speech"; introduces direct quotation]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathagata [epithet of Buddha; literally "thus-gone one"; first in a series of Buddha's titles; represents the true nature of reality (suchness) rather than a conventional agent]
- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : Arhat [epithet of Buddha; literally "foe-destroyer"; one who has conquered all defilements]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [adverbial phrase; modifies the completeness of the enlightenment; indicates complete accuracy or perfection]
- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [adjective in genitive form; from རྫོགས་པ་ (to complete); qualifies the type of enlightenment]
- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [noun; literally "awakened one"; here part of the formal title sequence]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [instrumental case marker; indicates agency; conventionally suggests Buddha as agent though in ultimate truth no agency exists]
- བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ : unsurpassable [adjective; literally "without superior"; qualifies the enlightenment as the highest possible state]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [adverbial; second occurrence; emphasizes the completeness of the enlightenment]
- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [adjective in genitive form; second occurrence; further qualifying the enlightenment]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [noun; Sanskrit: bodhi; the awakened state that is supposedly attained; functions as Participant-Goal]
- ཏུ་ : as/into [terminative case marker; indicates transformation or result]
- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly [adverbial; indicates clear manifestation or actualization]
- རྫོགས་པར་ : completely [adverbial; third occurrence of this root; emphasizes thoroughness of awakening]
- སངས་རྒྱས་སོ་ : became enlightened [verb + final particle; literally "awakened"; conventionally describes a process but ultimately represents a state of being with no actual attainment]
- ཞེས་ : that [quotative marker; indicates end of quoted speech]
- ཟེར་ན། : if [someone] says [conditional verb + conditional particle; establishes the hypothetical situation]
- དེ་ : that person [demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the hypothetical speaker; functions as Participant-Agent]
- ལོག་པར་ : falsely/incorrectly [adverbial; from ལོག་པ་ (wrong, inverted); describes the nature of the speech as mistaken from ultimate perspective]
- སྨྲ་བ་ : speaking [verbal noun; act of speech; combines with following verb to indicate "is speaking falsely"]
- ཡིན་ནོ། : is [copula + final particle; completes the declarative statement with emphasis]

དེ་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཞེས་བརྗོད་དོ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire scene of the Tathagata designating bodhisattvas" | Implicit: ""]

        └── དེ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བརྗོད་དོ་ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of designation or reference" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [designation/naming] [Type: Center | Desc: "Implicit content indicating the specific type of speech act (designation/naming)" | Implicit: "Implicit content indicating the specific type of speech act"]
    ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The conceptual target of the designation act" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཞེས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on how the bodhisattva is being referred to" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Links this statement to the broader discourse context" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [demonstrative pronoun; functions as a discourse linker connecting this statement to the broader context; elaborates on the Tathagata as the main agent]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [instrumental/agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ`; literally "Thus-Gone One", an epithet of the Buddha; functions as the main agent performing the act of designation]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [compound noun from `བྱང` (purified) + `ཆུབ` (comprehension); bodhi; first part of the compound term for bodhisattva; represents the goal pursued by the bodhisattva]

- སེམས་དཔའ་ : heroic-minded being [compound noun from `སེམས` (mind) + `དཔའ` (hero/brave); second part of the compound term for bodhisattva; functions as the conceptual target of the designation]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [compound noun from `བྱང` (purified) + `ཆུབ` (comprehension); bodhi; first part of the repeated compound term; part of the quoted designation]

- སེམས་དཔའ་ : heroic-minded being [compound noun from `སེམས` (mind) + `དཔའ` (hero/brave); second part of the repeated compound term; part of the quoted designation]

- ཞེས་ : thus/called [quotative particle; indicates that what precedes is being quoted or named; marks the term used in the designation]

- བརྗོད་དོ་ : designates/calls [present/future form of `རྗོད་པ` (to speak/express) + final particle `དོ`; the process of designation or naming; main verb of the sentence with sentence-final particle]

དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གང་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མེད་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire passage" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Rhetorical question opening the passage" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The subject of the questioning" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "The interrogative process" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གང་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མེད་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The main explanation scene providing the answer" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The addressee of the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent/doer (Buddha/Tathagata)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི [Type: Process-Achievement | Desc: "The achievement process of becoming fully awakened/enlightened" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Result | Desc: "The result of the Buddha's achievement" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བླ་ན་མེད་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Qualifier describing the enlightenment as unsurpassable" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Qualifier describing the enlightenment as perfectly complete" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ [Type: Center | Desc: "The core concept of enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མེད་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ [Type: Elaborator-Reason | Desc: "The explanation/reason for the previous statement" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma/teaching that is the object of negation" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གང་ཡང [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Emphasizing the totality of the negation" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མེད་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ [Type: Center | Desc: "The negation that serves as the core of the reason" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [implicit: ultimate truth] [Type: Ground-Truth | Desc: "The implicit ultimate philosophical truth being communicated - that in the ultimate sense, there is no dharma that was attained" | Implicit: "the ultimate philosophical truth that in the ultimate sense, dharmas are empty of inherent existence"]
glossary:
- དེ་ : this [demonstrative pronoun; refers to the preceding statement or concept being questioned; functions as the subject of the interrogative phrase]
- ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ : for what reason [interrogative phrase; `ཅི་` (what) + genitive particle `འི་` + `ཕྱིར་` (for the sake of); introduces the rhetorical question]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [conditional clause marker; marks the end of a rhetorical question; signals that an explanation follows]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name; vocative case; addressee of the Buddha's teaching; functions as recipient of the discourse]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [agentive/instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Thus-Gone One, epithet of the Buddha; the agent who attained enlightenment]
- གང་ : which [relative pronoun; connecting to the dharma/teaching mentioned later; relates to what follows]
- བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ : unsurpassable [compound adjective; `བླ་ན་` (above) + `མེད་པ་` (without); qualifying enlightenment as having nothing superior to it]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [adverbial phrase; `ཡང་དག་པ་` (authentic, genuine) + terminative particle `ར་`; describing the complete nature of enlightenment]
- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [adjective + genitive particle; `རྫོགས་པ་` (complete, perfect) + `འི་`; qualifying the enlightenment as fully perfected]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་ : into enlightenment [noun + terminative particle; `བྱང་ཆུབ་` (enlightenment, bodhi) + `ཏུ་`; the state into which the Buddha awakened]
- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly [adverbial phrase; `མངོན་པ་` (evident, manifest) + terminative particle `ར་`; describes the manner of enlightenment]
- རྫོགས་པར་ : completely [adverbial phrase; `རྫོགས་པ་` (complete) + terminative particle `ར་`; emphasizes the thoroughness of enlightenment]
- སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ : became awakened to [verbal phrase + genitive particle; `སངས་རྒྱས་པ་` (to become a Buddha, to awaken) + `འི་`; the Buddha's achievement process]
- ཆོས་ : dharma [noun; teaching, phenomenon, reality; the supposed object of attainment]
- དེ་ : that [demonstrative pronoun; referring to the dharma just mentioned]
- གང་ཡང་ : whatsoever [emphatic construction; `གང་` (which, whatever) + `ཡང་` (even, also); emphasizes the totality of the negation]
- མེད་པའི་ : does not exist [negative existential verb + genitive particle; `མེད་པ་` (non-existence) + `འི་`; negates the existence of any attained dharma]
- ཕྱིར་རོ། : because [reason marker + final particle; `ཕྱིར་` (for the sake of, because) + `རོ།` (sentence-final particle); concludes the explanation with the underlying reason]

རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ཆོས་གང་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའམ། བསྟན་པ་དེ་ལ་བདེན་པའང་མེད། རྫུན་པ་ཡང་མེད་དོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire utterance." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The addressee of the utterance." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who has realized and taught the dharma." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་གང་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའམ། བསྟན་པ་ [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Two parallel scenes describing what the Tathagata has realized and taught." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་གང་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the dharmas that the Tathagata has realized." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་གང་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharmas that are the object of awakening." | Implicit: ""]
            └── མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of becoming fully awakened to the dharmas." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསྟན་པ་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharmas that have been taught by the Tathagata." | Implicit: ""]
        └── འམ། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction linking the two alternative conditions." | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་ལ་བདེན་པའང་མེད། རྫུན་པ་ཡང་མེད་དོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Parallel scenes describing the non-dual nature of dharmas as neither true nor false." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ལ་ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relator connecting these statements to the previous content about dharmas." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདེན་པའང་མེད [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene stating the absence of truth in the dharmas." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བདེན་པའང་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The concept of truth that is negated." | Implicit: ""]
            └── མེད [Type: State | Desc: "State of non-existence applied to truth." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རྫུན་པ་ཡང་མེད་དོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene stating the absence of falsehood in the dharmas." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རྫུན་པ་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The concept of falsehood that is negated." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡང་ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector indicating addition to the previous negation." | Implicit: ""]
            └── མེད་དོ། ། [Type: State | Desc: "State of non-existence applied to falsehood." | Implicit: ""]
        └── [བདེན་རྫུན་གཉིས་མེད] [Type: Implicit | Desc: "Implicit philosophical concept of non-duality underlying the parallel negations." | Implicit: "Represents the implicit philosophical concept of non-duality that underlies the parallel negations"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative form; name of the disciple being addressed; functions as the Recipient of the discourse according to the semantic structure]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Thus-Gone One, epithet of Buddha; acts as the Agent who has realized and taught the dharma]

- ཆོས་ : dharmas [Plural form; refers to phenomena or teachings; functions as the Patient that is the object of the Buddha's awakening]

- གང་ : whatever [Relative pronoun; qualifies the dharmas that are the object of awakening]

- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly [Adverbial prefix indicating complete or perfect manifestation]

- རྫོགས་པར་ : completely [Adverbial form of `རྫོགས་པ་`: complete, perfect; modifies the awakening process]

- སངས་རྒྱས་པའམ། : has awakened to [Perfective form of `སངས་རྒྱས་`: to become awakened or enlightened; combined with disjunctive particle `འམ་` indicating an alternative condition]

- བསྟན་པ་ : taught [Past form of `སྟོན་པ་`: to teach, show, demonstrate; refers to dharmas taught by the Tathagata; functions as a Patient in parallel with the previous scene]

- དེ་ལ་ : regarding that [Demonstrative pronoun `དེ་` with allative particle `ལ་`; connects the following statements to the previously mentioned dharmas]

- བདེན་པའང་ : truth also [Noun `བདེན་པ་`: truth, reality + emphatic particle `འང་`; functions as the Patient that is being negated]

- མེད། : is not [Negative existential verb; negates the existence of truth in the dharmas]

- རྫུན་པ་ : falsehood [Noun meaning falsity, deception; functions as the Patient in the parallel negation]

- ཡང་ : also [Connective particle indicating addition to the previous negation]

- མེད་དོ། : is not [Negative existential verb with final particle `དོ་`; negates the existence of falsehood with sentence-final emphasis, completing the parallel structure of non-duality]

དེ་བས་ན་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་ཞེས་གསུངས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing the Tathagata's statement about dharmas" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connects this statement to previous reasoning" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [because of the previously stated reasons] [Type: Reason | Desc: "Implicit reason connecting the linker to the conclusion" | Implicit: "Implicit reason connecting the linker to the conclusion"]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant | Desc: "Agent performing the action of speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསུངས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "Main action of speaking/teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [at that time] [Type: Time | Desc: "Temporal aspect of the teaching as indicated by perfective verb form" | Implicit: "Temporal aspect of the teaching as indicated by perfective verb form"]
    ├── ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་ཞེས [Type: Participant | Desc: "Content of what was spoken by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Center | Desc: "Central concept being discussed - all dharmas" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་ཞེས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration on how all dharmas are characterized" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Tibetan sentence-final punctuation" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་བས་ན་ : therefore [Connective phrase; combination of `དེ་` (that) + `བས་` (comparative/ablative particle) + `ན་` (conditional particle); expresses logical conclusion from previous reasoning; functions as a Linker connecting the statement to previous discourse]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [Ergative of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "thus-gone one", Sanskrit tathāgata, epithet for the Buddha; agent/doer performing the action of speaking; marked by ergative case showing the Tathagata as the Agent of the utterance]

- ཆོས་ : dharmas [Root noun: phenomena, teachings, qualities; refers to all phenomena or elements of existence; part of the content/direct object of what was spoken]

- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Quantifier modifying `ཆོས་`; indicates totality without exception; central concept being discussed in the utterance]

- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Root noun: awakened one; the enlightened being; functions as possessor in the phrase]

- ཀྱི་ : 's [Genitive particle showing possession; connects Buddha to dharmas; indicates that dharmas belong to or have the nature of Buddha]

- ཆོས་ : dharmas [Root noun appearing second time; here refers to the qualities or teachings of the Buddha specifically; part of the elaboration on how all dharmas are characterized]

- ཞེས་ : thus/saying [Quotative particle marking the end of reported speech; connects the quoted content to the verb of speaking]

- གསུངས་སོ : proclaimed [Past tense of `གསུང་བ་`: to speak/teach (honorific); with final particle `སོ་` marking statement completion; main process/action of the sentence; indicates the teaching occurred at a specific time in the past]

- ། : [Tibetan sentence-final punctuation mark (shad); marks the completion of the statement]

རབ་འབྱོར་ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་ཅེས་བྱ་བ་ནི། དེ་དག་ཐམས་ཅད་ཆོས་མེད་པ་ཡིན་ཏེ། [Type: ParallelScene | Desc: "Root node representing the parallel philosophical statements about phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Addressee | Desc: "Person being addressed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་ཅེས་བྱ་བ་ནི། [Type: Center | Desc: "First part of the parallel philosophical statement about phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Center | Desc: "The subject being discussed - all phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅེས་བྱ་བ་ནི། [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration indicating reference to the term 'all phenomena'" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་དག་ཐམས་ཅད་ཆོས་མེད་པ་ཡིན་ཏེ། [Type: Argument | Desc: "Second part of the parallel philosophical statement about the nature of phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་དག་ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Refers back to the same entities as 'all phenomena', establishing parallelism" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་མེད་པ [Type: Center | Desc: "The core philosophical assertion about the nature of phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
            └── emptiness (śūnyatā) [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit philosophical concept of emptiness (śūnyatā) underlying the statement" | Implicit: "emptiness (śūnyatā)"]
        ├── ཡིན་ཏེ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Copula connecting the subject with the assertion" | Implicit: ""]
        └── emptiness (śūnyatā) [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit philosophical concept of emptiness (śūnyatā) underlying the statement" | Implicit: "emptiness (śūnyatā)"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Proper noun; name of a prominent disciple of Buddha; functions as the Addressee in this discourse]
- ཆོས་ : phenomena [Noun; `ཆོས་`: dharma/phenomena; refers to all experiential objects and mental constructs in Buddhist philosophy; Subject of the statement]
- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Adjective; qualifying `ཆོས་` to mean "all phenomena" without exception; universal quantifier]
- ཅེས་ : thus [Quotative particle; marks the preceding term as being referenced or quoted]
- བྱ་བ་ : called [Verbal noun from `བྱེད་`: to do/make; here functions to indicate naming or designation]
- ནི། : as for [Topic marker; highlights the preceding phrase as the topic of discussion]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the previously mentioned phenomena]
- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Adjective; emphasizes the totality of the phenomena being referenced]
- ཆོས་ : dharmic nature [Noun; `ཆོས་`: here referring to inherent qualities or characteristics]
- མེད་པ་ : without [Negative existential; indicating absence or non-existence of inherent nature]
- ཡིན་ཏེ། : are indeed [Copula `ཡིན་` with continuative particle `ཏེ་`; affirms the statement with an implication that more explanation follows]

ucca_formatted:
དེས་ན་ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་ཞེས་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "root" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connects to a conclusive logical relationship" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས་ཞེས་བྱའོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "main predication" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "the subject of the predication" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས [Type: Center | Desc: "the head noun" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "specifies the scope/quantity of phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་ཆོས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "the complement of the predication" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཀྱི [Type: Relator | Desc: "genitive marker" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སངས་རྒྱས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "possessor" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཆོས [Type: Center | Desc: "the head noun being possessed" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཞེས་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "the predicate relating the two participants" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ། ། [Type: Punctuation | Desc: "sentence-final punctuation" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེས་ན་ : therefore [Adverbial phrase; `དེས་` is instrumental case of `དེ་` (that/it) + `ན་` (locative particle used as conditional marker); functioning as a logical connector indicating conclusion based on previous statements]

- ཆོས་ : phenomena [Noun; root word meaning "dharma", "phenomena", or "qualities"; here referring to all existent things as the subject of the predication]

- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Adjective/quantifier; modifies `ཆོས་` to indicate totality without exception; functions as an elaborator specifying the scope]

- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Noun; compound of `སངས་` (purified/awakened) + `རྒྱས་` (developed/expanded); functions as the agent/possessor in the genitive construction]

- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; connects `སངས་རྒྱས་` (Buddha) with `ཆོས་` (dharma); indicates possession or attribution]

- ཆོས་ : dharma [Noun; same root as earlier but with different contextual meaning; here referring specifically to the qualities or teachings of the Buddha as the possessed entity]

- ཞེས་ : called [Quotative particle; marks the preceding phrase as what something is called or designated; introduces the verb]

- བྱའོ : is designated [Verb; future/present form of `བྱེད་` (to do/make) + final particle `འོ་`; functions as the main process verb that relates the subject and complement]

- ། ། : [Final punctuation marking the end of the sentence]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ལྟ་སྟེ་དཔེར་ན། སྐྱེས་བུ་ཞིག་མིའི་ལུས་དང་ལྡན་ཞིང་ལུས་ཆེན་པོར་གྱུར་པ་བཞིན་ནོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire simile" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The addressee of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་ལྟ་སྟེ་དཔེར་ན [Type: Relator | Desc: "Introduces the simile or example that follows" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྐྱེས་བུ་ཞིག [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The person who is the subject of the simile" | Implicit: ""]
    └── མིའི་ལུས་དང་ལྡན་ཞིང་ལུས་ཆེན་པོར་གྱུར་པ་བཞིན་ནོ། ། [Type: Elaborated Scene | Desc: "The main content of the simile with sequential elaboration" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མིའི་ལུས་དང་ལྡན་ཞིང [Type: Scene | Desc: "First part of the elaborated scene describing possession of a human body" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ལྡན [Type: State | Desc: "The state of possessing, with an Adverbial relation to the person who possesses" | Implicit: ""]
                └── སྐྱེས་བུ་ཞིག [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The person who is the subject of the simile" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མིའི་ལུས་དང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The human body that is possessed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལུས་ཆེན་པོར་གྱུར་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second part of the elaborated scene describing the great body, elaborating on the first part" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གྱུར་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of becoming or having" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ལུས་ཆེན་པོར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The great body that has been attained" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ལུས [Type: Center | Desc: "The core concept of body" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཆེན་པོར [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Describes the body as great or large" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── encompassing all sentient beings [Type: Implicit | Desc: "Implicit philosophical meaning of 'great body' as encompassing all sentient beings" | Implicit: "Implicit philosophical meaning of 'great body' as encompassing all sentient beings"]
                └── encompassing all sentient beings [Type: Implicit | Desc: "Implicit philosophical meaning of 'great body' as encompassing all sentient beings" | Implicit: "Implicit philosophical meaning of 'great body' as encompassing all sentient beings"]
        └── བཞིན་ནོ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Completes the simile structure by indicating similarity" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར : Subhūti [Proper name; the disciple being addressed; functions as the recipient of the teaching in this discourse]
- འདི་ལྟ་སྟེ་ : thus [Demonstrative construction; composed of `འདི་` (this) + `ལྟ་` (like/as) + `སྟེ་` (connector); introduces an example or illustration; acts as a relator connecting the addressee to the simile]
- དཔེར་ན། : for example [Terminative case of `དཔེ་` (example) + `ན` (locative particle); signals that a simile or example follows; serves to transition from general statement to specific illustration]
- སྐྱེས་བུ་ : person [Noun; `སྐྱེས་བུ་`: man, person, individual; acts as the agent or main subject of the simile]
- ཞིག : a certain [Indefinite article; marks the preceding noun as indefinite; indicates a generic or hypothetical person rather than a specific one]
- མིའི་ : human [Genitive of `མི་`: human, man; indicates possession or attribution of human qualities; functions as an attribute of the subsequent noun]
- ལུས་ : body [Noun; `ལུས་`: physical form or body; serves as the patient or object that is possessed]
- དང་ : and [Conjunction; connects phrases; here linking the possession of a human body to what follows]
- ལྡན་ : possessing [Verb; `ལྡན་པ་`: to possess, have, be endowed with; describes the state of the person having a human body]
- ཞིང་ : and [Connective; joins clauses while implying continuation; connects the first attribute (having a human body) to the second (having a great body)]
- ལུས་ : body [Noun; `ལུས་`: physical form or body; repeated from earlier, now as the subject of transformation]
- ཆེན་པོར་ : great [Terminative case of `ཆེན་པོ་`: great, large; describes the body as expansive; implicitly referring to a body that encompasses all sentient beings in Buddhist philosophy]
- གྱུར་པ་ : having become [Perfect form of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform; indicates the process of transformation has been completed; the body has attained greatness]
- བཞིན་ : like [Comparative particle; indicates similarity; completes the simile structure]
- ནོ། ། : (sentence final particle) [Sentence-final particle; indicates the completion of the statement or quotation; adds emphasis to the preceding simile]

        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient of Rabyor's statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་སྐྱེས་བུ་མིའི་ལུས་དང་ལྡན་ཞིང་ལུས་ཆེན་པོ་ཞེས་གང་གསུངས་པ་དེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The first proposition about having a body" | Implicit: ""]

                ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who spoke about having a body" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── གསུངས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of speaking/teaching" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── སྐྱེས་བུ་མིའི་ལུས་དང་ལྡན་ཞིང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The first aspect of what was taught - having a human body" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── དང་ལྡན་ཞིང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connection between having a body and the body being great" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ལུས་ཆེན་པོ་ཞེས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The second aspect of what was taught - having a great body" | Implicit: ""]
                └── from the conventional perspective [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit indication that the statement about having a body is from the conventional perspective" | Implicit: "from the conventional perspective"]
            └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ལུས་མ་མཆིས་པར་གསུངས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The contrasting proposition about not having a body" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who spoke about not having a body" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── གསུངས་ཏེ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of speaking/teaching" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : Venerable [Compound epithet from `ཚེ་`: life + `དང་ལྡན་པ་`: possessing; an honorific title for senior disciples; functions as part of the Agent addressing the Buddha]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of the Buddha's disciple; the Agent who makes the request in this dialogue]
- གྱིས་ : by [Ergative particle marking `རབ་འབྱོར་` as the Agent performing the action of requesting]
- གསོལ་པ། : requested [Perfect tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, ask; indicates the formal speech action directed to the Buddha]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; functions as the Recipient of Subhuti's statement]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [Ergative of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "Thus-Gone One", epithet of the Buddha; Agent who made the statements about form]
- སྐྱེས་བུ་ : person [Noun referring to a sentient being; part of the compound describing what the Tathagata possesses]
- མིའི་ : human [Genitive of `མི་`: human being; modifies `ལུས་` to specify human form]
- ལུས་ : body [Noun meaning physical form; the Patient in the first proposition]
- དང་ལྡན་ : possessing [Verbal phrase from `དང་`: with + `ལྡན་པ་`: to possess; linking the Tathagata to having a physical form]
- ཞིང་ : and [Connective particle joining two related clauses; functions as a Linker between having a body and the body being great]
- ལུས་ : body [Second mention of body; Patient in the second aspect of the teaching]
- ཆེན་པོ་ : great [Adjective modifying `ལུས་`; describes the magnitude of the body from conventional perspective]
- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative particle marking reported speech; indicates these are the Buddha's words being referenced]
- གང་ : what [Interrogative pronoun; refers to the statement that follows]
- གསུངས་པ་ : taught [Past tense of `གསུང་བ་`: to speak, teach; the Process performed by the Tathagata]
- དེ། : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the aforementioned teaching about form]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [Second mention; Agent of the contrasting statement]
- ལུས་ : body [Third mention; the object being negated in the contrasting statement]
- མ་མཆིས་པར་ : non-existent [Negative of `མཆིས་པ་`: to exist (honorific); describes the ultimate state of formlessness]
- གསུངས་ཏེ། : taught [Past tense of `གསུང་བ་`: to speak, teach, with continuative particle `ཏེ་`; indicates the Process in the contrasting statement and that more will follow]

དེས་ན་ལུས་དང་ལྡན་ཞིང་ལུས་ཆེན་པོ་ཞེས་བགྱིའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "root" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "links the philosophical conclusion to its premise" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལུས་དང་ལྡན་ཞིང་ལུས་ཆེན་པོ་ཞེས་བགྱིའོ [Type: Parallel Scenes-Assertion | Desc: "primary philosophical assertion about embodiment" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལུས་དང་ལྡན [Type: Scene | Desc: "first assertion about the bodhisattva's embodiment" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── [bodhisattva] [Type: Implicit Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "the bodhisattva who experiences possessing a body" | Implicit: "bodhisattva"]
            ├── ལྡན [Type: State | Desc: "state of possessing rather than action" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ལུས་དང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "the body that is possessed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཞིང [Type: Linker | Desc: "links the two parallel assertions" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ལུས་ཆེན་པོ་ཞེས་བགྱིའོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "second assertion about designation of the body" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── [Tathagata] [Type: Implicit Participant-Speaker | Desc: "the implicit speaker who designates or names" | Implicit: "Tathagata"]
            ├── བགྱིའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "speech act of designation or attribution" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ལུས་ཆེན་པོ་ཞེས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "the designation given to the bodhisattva's embodiment" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ལུས [Type: Center | Desc: "the core concept of body/embodiment" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཆེན་པོ་ཞེས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "qualifier describing the extent or significance of the body" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── [encompassing all sentient beings] [Type: Contextual | Desc: "philosophical context that 'great body' refers to encompassing the bodies of all sentient beings" | Implicit: "encompassing all sentient beings"]
    ├── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "sentence-final punctuation" | Implicit: ""]
    └──  [Type: Implicit Ground | Desc: "implicit philosophical grounding" | Implicit: "philosophical grounding"]
        └── [emptiness/śūnyatā] [Type: Implicit Concept | Desc: "underlying philosophical concept of emptiness essential to understanding the passage" | Implicit: "emptiness/śūnyatā"]
glossary:
- དེས་ན་ : therefore [Causal connector; composed of `དེ་` (that) with instrumental case `ས་` and connector `ན་`; functions as a linker that connects the philosophical conclusion to its previously stated premise]

- ལུས་ : body [Noun; refers to physical embodiment; in this context, functions as the patient/object that is possessed by the implied bodhisattva]

- དང་ : and, with [Associative particle; connects nominal elements; here indicates possession/association relationship]

- ལྡན་ : possessing [Verbal root meaning 'to possess, have, be endowed with'; functions as a stative verb rather than an action verb]

- ཞིང་ : and, moreover [Clausal connector; links parallel assertions; used here to connect two related statements about embodiment]

- ལུས་ : body [Noun; repeated reference to physical embodiment; serves as the center of the second assertion]

- ཆེན་པོ་ : great [Adjective modifying `ལུས་`; indicates magnitude or significance; contextually implies encompassing all sentient beings]

- ཞེས་ : thus, called [Quotative particle; marks the preceding phrase as a designation or name]

- བགྱིའོ : it is called, designated [Honorific verb form of `བྱེད་པ་` (to do, make) with final particle `འོ་`; here functioning as a speech act of designation by the implied Tathagata]

- ། : [Sentence-final punctuation mark denoting the end of the statement]

བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ནོ། །དེ་བཞིན་ཏེ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing two parallel scenes: Buddha's speech and Subhuti's response" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene depicting Buddha's speech act" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Buddha as the agent of the speech act" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of Buddha speaking/replying" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ནོ། །དེ་བཞིན་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene depicting the Buddha's affirmative statement to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Subhuti is actively involved in the discourse as an agent, not merely a recipient" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [says] [Type: Process | Desc: "The implicit speech act where Buddha is directly addressing Subhuti" | Implicit: "The implicit speech act where Buddha is directly addressing Subhuti"]
        ├── དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ནོ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "An affirmative adverbial response meaning 'it is so/thus'" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The referent being affirmed" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེ་བཞིན་ནོ [Type: State | Desc: "The state of being thus/so" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་བཞིན་ཏེ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "An elaborating adverbial phrase reinforcing the prior affirmation" | Implicit: ""]
            └── it [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implicit referent being affirmed in the second phrase" | Implicit: "The implicit referent being affirmed in the second phrase"]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : The Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to Buddha as the one who has conquered afflictions, possesses all positive qualities, and transcended suffering; functions as the Agent of the speech act]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates Buddha as the agent who performs the action of speaking; marks the grammatical Agent]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། : spoke [Honorific past tense of `གསུང་བ་` (to speak); literally "bestowed words"; the Process component of the scene depicting Buddha's formal pronouncement; honorific speech act reserved for exalted beings]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; one of Buddha's chief disciples known for his understanding of emptiness; functions as an active participant in the discourse rather than merely a passive recipient]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the preceding statement or teaching; functions as the Patient (the referent being affirmed) in the semantic structure]

- དེ་བཞིན་ནོ། : is thus [Affirmative statement; `དེ་བཞིན་` (thus, in that way) + `ནོ` (final particle indicating completion of statement); expresses agreement or confirmation; functions as an adverbial response indicating "it is so/thus"]

- དེ་བཞིན་ཏེ། : it is exactly so [Elaborating phrase; `དེ་བཞིན་` (thus, in that way) + `ཏེ` (connective particle indicating continuation); reinforces the previous affirmation; functions as an adverbial phrase that strengthens the preceding confirmation]
