        ├── བདག་གིས་སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་ཡོངས་སུ་མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདའོ་ཞེས [Type: Scene | Desc: "The content of what the bodhisattva is saying" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བདག་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who will perform the liberation" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The beings who will be liberated" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡོངས་སུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner in which the liberation will occur" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of liberating from suffering" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཞེས [Type: Function | Desc: "Marks the end of the quoted speech" | Implicit: ""]
        └── prideful view [Type: Ground | Desc: "Implicit content representing the incorrect view or pride" | Implicit: "Represents the incorrect view or pride (མངོན་པའི་ང་རྒྱལ) mentioned in the commentary"]
    ├── if... then [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conditional relationship connecting the two scenes" | Implicit: "Implicit conditional relationship connecting the two scenes"]
    └── དེ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཞེས་མི་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Consequence stating that such a person is not a true bodhisattva" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The person referred to in the first scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མི་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The negated process of designating or naming" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཞེས [Type: Participant-Attribute | Desc: "The attribute or designation that is being negated for the subject" | Implicit: ""]
        └── from the perspective of ultimate truth [Type: Ground | Desc: "Implicit content representing the concept of 'ultimate truth'" | Implicit: "Represents the concept of 'ultimate truth' (ཡང་དག་པའི་དོན) mentioned in the commentary"]
glossary:
# Tibetan Word-by-Word Glossary

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [Compound noun from `བྱང་ཆུབ་` (enlightenment) + `སེམས་དཔའ་` (hero/warrior of mind); one who seeks enlightenment for the benefit of all beings; functions as Agent in the conditional clause]

- གང་ : whoever [Relative pronoun indicating 'any person who'; functions as a qualifier of the preceding bodhisattva]

- འདི་སྐད་དུ་ : in these words [Adverbial phrase from `འདི་` (this) + `སྐད་` (speech) + `-དུ་` (terminative case marker); introduces direct quotation; functions as Elaborator introducing quoted speech]

- བདག་གིས་ : I [Ergative form of `བདག་` (self/I); marks the speaker as Agent performing the action in the quoted speech]

- སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་ : sentient beings [Plural form of `སེམས་ཅན་` (sentient being); the Patient/recipients of the liberation action]

- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely [Adverbial modifier indicating thoroughness or completeness; modifies the following verb]

- མྱ་ངན་ལས་འདའོ་ : will liberate from suffering [Verb phrase from `མྱ་ངན་` (suffering) + `ལས་` (from) + `འདའ་` (to transcend/liberate) + `-འོ་` (final particle); expressing intention to cause beings to transcend suffering; functions as the main Process in the quoted speech]

- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative marker indicating end of direct speech; connects the quote to the main verb]

- ཟེར་ན : if says [Conditional form of `ཟེར་` (to say/speak); creates the condition for the following consequence; functions as the Process in the conditional clause]

- དེ་ : that person [Demonstrative pronoun referring back to the subject of the conditional clause; functions as Patient in the consequence clause]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཞེས་ : as a bodhisattva [Quotative construction with `བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་` (bodhisattva) + `ཞེས་` (called/named); the designation being negated; functions as Attribute in the consequence clause]

- མི་བྱའོ། ། : is not to be designated [Negated future form of `བྱེད་` (to do/make) with final particle `-འོ་`; indicates that the subject should not be considered or named as stated; functions as the Process in the consequence clause]

དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཞེས་བྱ་བའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་ཡོད་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node containing the entire text" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Introducing phrase that sets up the philosophical inquiry" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Function | Desc: "Demonstrative pronoun referring to previous statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར [Type: Function | Desc: "Interrogative marker indicating reason" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "Verbal marker that completes the rhetorical question" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཞེས་བྱ་བའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་ཡོད་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The philosophical question about the existence of bodhisattva dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The addressee of the question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཞེས་བྱ་བའི་ཆོས་དེ [Type: Content | Desc: "The conceptual content being questioned for its existence" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་དེ [Type: Center | Desc: "The core concept (dharma) being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཞེས་བྱ་བའི [Type: Relator | Desc: "Phrase relating the dharma to the concept of bodhisattva" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་ཡང [Type: Quantifier | Desc: "Quantifies the existence (or non-existence) of the dharma in question" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡོད་སྙམ་མམ [Type: State-Question | Desc: "Interrogative existential state regarding the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡོད [Type: State | Desc: "Existential state being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྙམ་མམ [Type: Process | Desc: "Cognitive process of questioning/contemplating" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : why [Demonstrative pronoun; literally 'that'; functions as part of the opening rhetorical question formula; refers to a previous statement]
- ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ : for what reason [Interrogative phrase; 'ཅི་' (what) + genitive particle 'འི' + 'ཕྱིར་' (for the sake of); marks a causal interrogative]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional verb form; from '་ཞེས་' (to say, quote) + conditional particle 'ན'; completes the rhetorical question formula "Why is that?"]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; vocative case; addressee of the Buddha's question; functions as recipient participant in the discourse]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Sanskrit 'bodhi'; refers to awakened state; forms part of the compound term for bodhisattva]
- སེམས་དཔའ་ : being/hero [Sanskrit 'sattva'; one who has the intention/mind (སེམས་) for enlightenment; forms latter part of the bodhisattva compound]
- ཞེས་ : called [Quotative particle; indicates that the preceding term is being named or labeled; introduces the concept being discussed]
- བྱ་བའི་ : that which is named [Verbal noun from 'བྱེད་' (to do/make) + genitive particle 'འི'; denotes the act of designation]
- ཆོས་ : dharma [Sanskrit 'dharma'; here refers to the concept, phenomenon, or teaching; the core subject being examined]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies the particular dharma (concept of bodhisattva) being discussed]
- གང་ཡང་ : any whatsoever [Indefinite pronoun 'གང་' (whatever/whichever) + emphatic particle 'ཡང་' (even/also); quantifies the possible existence]
- ཡོད་ : exists [Existential verb; present tense of 'to be/exist'; the state being questioned]
- སྙམ་ : think [Cognitive verb; indicates mental contemplation or consideration; forms part of the question construction]
- མམ། : or not? [Interrogative disjunctive particle; turns the statement into a yes/no question; indicates skepticism about the existence]

རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing Subhuti's response to the Blessed One" | Implicit: ""]

    ├── དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "The responsive content of Subhuti's reply" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ནི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The referent that Subhuti is negating" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [concept of inherently existing bodhisattva] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit referent to the concept of an inherently existing bodhisattva being discussed" | Implicit: "Implicit referent to the concept of an inherently existing bodhisattva being discussed"]
        └── མ་ལགས་སོ [Type: State | Desc: "The negation part of Subhuti's statement" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [ongoing dialogue] [Type: Time | Desc: "Indicates this is part of an ongoing dialogue about emptiness" | Implicit: "Indicates this is part of an ongoing dialogue about emptiness"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhuti replied [Ergative case of `རབ་འབྱོར་` (Subhuti), the disciple's name; marks him as the Agent/Speaker in this dialogical scene; functioning as the speaker of the utterance]

- གསོལ་པ། : submitted [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, submit, speak respectfully; here indicating a respectful response to the Buddha; functions as the main Process/speech act in the scene]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered, transcended), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (gone beyond); addressee/Recipient of Subhuti's statement]

- དེ་ནི་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun `དེ་` with topic marker `ནི་`; refers to a concept previously discussed (the concept of an inherently existing bodhisattva); functions as Patient in the negation]

- མ་ལགས་སོ། : is not [Negation marker `མ་` + honorific verb `ལགས་` (to be) + final particle `སོ་`; polite negative existential statement; indicates the negation of the previous concept; functions as the State in the semantic structure]

བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བས་ན། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་ནི་སེམས་ཅན་མེད་པ། སྲོག་མེད་པ། གང་ཟག་མེད་པའོ། །ཞེས་གསུངས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire text" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Opening speech attribution" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker - Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The speaking action" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བས་ན། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་ནི་སེམས་ཅན་མེད་པ། སྲོག་མེད་པ། གང་ཟག་མེད་པའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The content of Buddha's speech" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The addressed disciple" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བས་ན། [Type: Connector | Desc: "Logical connector indicating causality" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The subject of the teaching (Buddha referred to by another title)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསུངས [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་ནི་སེམས་ཅན་མེད་པ། སྲོག་མེད་པ། གང་ཟག་མེད་པའོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "The content of the Buddha's teaching about emptiness" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་ནི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The subject of the emptiness teaching" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སེམས་ཅན་མེད་པ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First aspect of emptiness: absence of inherent sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
                └── སེམས་ཅན་མེད་པ། [Type: State | Desc: "State of being without sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྲོག་མེད་པ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second aspect of emptiness: absence of inherent life" | Implicit: ""]
                └── སྲོག་མེད་པ། [Type: State | Desc: "State of being without life" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གང་ཟག་མེད་པའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Third aspect of emptiness: absence of inherent personhood" | Implicit: ""]
                └── གང་ཟག་མེད་པའོ། ། [Type: State | Desc: "State of being without personality" | Implicit: ""]
            └── emptiness [Type: Center | Desc: "Implicit concept of emptiness that unifies the three parallel statements" | Implicit: "Implicit concept of emptiness that unifies the three parallel statements"]
    └── ཞེས་གསུངས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Closing speech attribution that completes the utterance structure" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཞེས [Type: Connector | Desc: "Quotative marker connecting the speech content to the reporting verb" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གསུངས་སོ། ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of speaking that concludes the speech" | Implicit: ""]
            └── he (Buddha) [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit reference to Buddha as the speaker" | Implicit: "Implicit reference to Buddha as the speaker"]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : The Blessed One [Honorific title of the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to the Buddha as one who has conquered the afflictions, possesses all qualities, and has transcended suffering; functions as the Agent/Speaker in the discourse]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker indicating the agent/doer of the action; connects the Buddha to the act of speaking]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། : spoke [Honorific past tense verb for `speaking/teaching`; literally "bestowed speech"; indicates formal religious discourse by a high teacher; functions as the main Process in the opening speech attribution]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of one of Buddha's chief disciples; recipient of the teaching; addressed directly by the Buddha; functions as Recipient of the teaching]

- དེ་བས་ན། : therefore [Logical connector indicating causality/conclusion; from `དེ་` (that) + `བས་` (comparative) + `ན་` (conditional); introduces the conclusion based on previous discussion; serves as a discourse connector]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [Instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`, another title for the Buddha meaning "Thus-Gone One"; refers to one who has realized suchness; Agent of the teaching being reported]

- ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་ : all phenomena [Compound of `ཆོས་` (phenomena/dharmas) and `ཐམས་ཅད་` (all/every); the subject being described in the teaching; Patient in the emptiness teaching]

- ནི་ : (topic marker) [Emphasizes the preceding term as the topic; highlights "all phenomena" as the central subject of the teaching]

- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Compound of `སེམས་` (mind) and `ཅན་` (possessor); refers to beings with consciousness; first element in the emptiness teaching]

- མེད་པ། : without [Negation of existence; from `མེད་` (not exist) + `པ་` (nominalizer); indicates the absence or emptiness of inherent sentient beings; creates a State description]

- སྲོག་ : life [Refers to life-force or vitality; second element in the emptiness teaching]

- མེད་པ། : without [Negation of existence; indicates the absence or emptiness of inherent life; creates a State description]

- གང་ཟག་ : person [Refers to individual personality or personhood; from Sanskrit 'pudgala'; third element in the emptiness teaching]

- མེད་པའོ། : are without [Negation of existence plus sentence-final particle `འོ་`; concludes the three-part statement on emptiness with emphatic force]

- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative marker indicating the end of quoted speech; connects the content of Buddha's teaching to the reporting verb]

- གསུངས་སོ། : proclaimed [Past tense honorific verb for speaking/teaching + sentence-final particle `སོ་`; concludes the entire passage; Process that completes the speech frame]

ཡང་རབ་འབྱོར་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་གང་ཞིག་འདི་སྐད་དུ། བདག་གིས་ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས་བསྒྲུབ་བོ་ཞེས་ཟེར་ན། དེ་ཡང་དེ་བཞིན་དུ་བརྗོད་པར་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node representing the entire passage with parallel scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཡང་ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector linking this passage to previous discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་གང་ཞིག་འདི་སྐད་དུ། བདག་གིས་ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས་བསྒྲུབ་བོ་ཞེས་ཟེར་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First main scene describing a hypothetical bodhisattva's statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ [Type: Addressee | Desc: "The person being addressed by the Buddha in the discourse" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་གང་ཞིག [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The bodhisattva who is speaking with conceptual attachment" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [with conceptual attachment] [Type: Ground | Desc: "Implicit content indicating the bodhisattva has wrong view/conceptual attachment" | Implicit: "Clarifies implied or contextually understood content that is not explicitly stated in the original text but necessary for comprehension; empty string  if content is explicitly stated"]
        └── འདི་སྐད་དུ། བདག་གིས་ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས་བསྒྲུབ་བོ་ཞེས་ཟེར་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The scene of the bodhisattva's statement" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཟེར་ན། [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of speaking/saying" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བདག་གིས་ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས་བསྒྲུབ་བོ་ཞེས [Type: Center-Content | Desc: "The quoted content of what the bodhisattva says" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── བདག་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent ('I') within the quote who will accomplish" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས་བསྒྲུབ་བོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of accomplishing the field arrays" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The field arrays that the bodhisattva claims to accomplish" | Implicit: ""]
                        └── [which are ultimately empty of inherent existence] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit content explaining the philosophical point that field arrays are empty" | Implicit: "Clarifies implied or contextually understood content that is not explicitly stated in the original text but necessary for comprehension; empty string  if content is explicitly stated"]
            └── འདི་སྐད་དུ། ... ཞེས [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relational element connecting the quote to the speaking process" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་ཡང་དེ་བཞིན་དུ་བརྗོད་པར་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second main scene describing how to respond to such a bodhisattva" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ཡང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Referring to the bodhisattva who made the claim" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བརྗོད་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of speaking about the bodhisattva" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner of speaking, referring to previous instructions" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [should not be called a bodhisattva] [Type: Negation | Desc: "Implicit content indicating the rejection of the bodhisattva's claim" | Implicit: "Clarifies implied or contextually understood content that is not explicitly stated in the original text but necessary for comprehension; empty string  if content is explicitly stated"]
glossary:
- ཡང་ : Furthermore [continuative particle; links to previous discourse; functions as a Linker connecting this passage to the previous discussion]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [proper name; vocative form; the direct addressee of the Buddha's teaching in this discourse]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [compound noun; `བྱང་ཆུབ་`: enlightenment + `སེམས་དཔའ་`: hero/warrior of mind; refers to one who seeks enlightenment for the benefit of all beings; functions as the main Agent in this hypothetical scene]

- གང་ཞིག : whoever [indefinite pronoun; marks the beginning of a conditional clause; refers to any hypothetical bodhisattva with conceptual attachment]

- འདི་སྐད་དུ། : in these words [demonstrative + `སྐད་`: speech + terminative particle; introduces direct speech; functions as a Relator connecting to the quoted content]

- བདག་གིས་ : I [ergative form of `བདག་`: self/I; marks the Agent within the quoted statement; indicates the one who claims to accomplish]

- ཞིང་ : field [noun; Buddhist technical term referring to a buddha-field or realm; used as object of accomplishment]

- བཀོད་པ་ : arrangements/arrays [noun from `འགོད་པ་`: to arrange/establish; refers to the organization or features of buddha-fields]

- རྣམས་ : plural marker [pluralizes `ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་`; indicates multiple field arrangements]

- བསྒྲུབ་བོ་ : will accomplish [future tense of `སྒྲུབ་པ་`: to accomplish/achieve + final particle `བོ་`; indicates intention or claim to create buddha-fields; functions as the main Process in the quoted speech]

- ཞེས་ : thus/saying [quotative marker; closes the direct speech; part of the quoted speech framework]

- ཟེར་ན། : if says [verb `ཟེར་བ་`: to say + conditional particle `ན་`; establishes the hypothetical scenario; functions as the Process of speaking]

- དེ་ཡང་ : that one also [demonstrative pronoun + connective particle; refers back to the hypothetical bodhisattva mentioned earlier; functions as Patient in the response scene]

- དེ་བཞིན་དུ་ : likewise/similarly [adverbial phrase; refers to the manner of response, indicating the same treatment as previously instructed; modifies how one should speak about such a person]

- བརྗོད་པར་བྱའོ། ། : should be described [future form of `རྗོད་པ་`: to speak/describe + auxiliary verb `བྱེད་` + final particle `འོ་`; indicates how one should respond to the hypothetical bodhisattva; implies the response should reject the bodhisattva's claim]

དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས་ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནི། དེ་དག་བཀོད་པ་མེད་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question scene that initiates the discourse" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of questioning" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The referent being questioned about" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཞེ་ན [Type: Function | Desc: "Functional marker indicating a question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├──  [Type: Linker | Desc: "Implicit linker connecting the question to its answer" | Implicit: "Implied connection between question and answer"]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས་ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནི། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene presenting the statement about field arrangements" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The addressee of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The subject being defined (field arrangements)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས [Type: Center | Desc: "The term used in definition (field arrangements)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནི [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of naming or designation" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་དག་བཀོད་པ་མེད་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene providing explanation for the statement in scene 2" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who taught (the Tathagata/Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསུངས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of teaching or explaining" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་དག་བཀོད་པ་མེད་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The content of what was taught" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་དག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Reference to the field arrangements" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བཀོད་པ་མེད་པར [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Philosophical concept about the non-existence of arrangements" | Implicit: ""]
                └── བཀོད་པ་མེད་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial phrase indicating the manner of existence (lack of inherent existence)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཕྱིར་ཏེ [Type: Function | Desc: "Functional marker indicating reason or explanation" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; serves as the referent being questioned about in the opening question]
- ཅིའི་ : what [Interrogative pronoun in genitive case; from `ཅི་`: what; used to ask the reason or purpose]
- ཕྱིར་ : for [Postposition indicating purpose or reason; here marking the interrogative clause]
- ཞེ་ན། : if asked/if one asks [Conditional marker from `ཞེ་`: to say + conditional particle `ན`; functions as a question marker completing the rhetorical question "Why is this so?"]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Proper name; vocative case; the direct addressee of Buddha's teaching]
- ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་ : field arrangements [Compound noun from `ཞིང་`: field/buddha-field + `བཀོད་པ་`: arrangement/display; refers to the arrangements of buddha-fields]
- རྣམས་ : plural [Plural marker; indicates multiple field arrangements]
- ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་ : field arrangements [Repetition of the same compound noun for emphasis in the definition]
- རྣམས་ : plural [Plural marker; indicates multiple field arrangements]
- ཞེས་ : called/termed as [Quotative marker; indicates that the preceding term is being defined or designated]
- བྱ་བ་ : to be called [Verbal noun from `བྱ་`: to do/to call; forms part of the naming construction]
- ནི། : as for [Topic marker; highlights the subject of the definition]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural; refers back to the field arrangements mentioned earlier]
- བཀོད་པ་ : arrangement [Noun; arrangement or display; part of philosophical concept]
- མེད་པར་ : without/as non-existent [Negation of existence + terminative case; from `མེད་`: non-existent + `པར་`: adverbial marker; indicates the manner of existence]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathāgata [Instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "Thus-Gone One," an epithet of Buddha; the agent who taught]
- གསུངས་པའི་ : taught/explained [Past tense of `གསུང་`: to speak/teach (honorific) + genitive particle; process of Buddha's explanation]
- ཕྱིར་ : because [Postposition indicating reason; connects the explanation to the earlier statement]
- ཏེ། : that is [Connective particle; completes the causal explanation]

    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Reason | Desc: "Causal connective indicating the reason for the statement that follows" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་རྣམས [Type: Center | Desc: "The core nominal concept being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
        └── རྣམས [Type: Quantifier | Desc: "Plural marker indicating multiple instances" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཞེས་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "Complete verb construction indicating naming or designation" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེས་ན : therefore [Causal connective; instrumental (དེས་) of demonstrative (དེ་) + connective particle (ན); indicates logical consequence based on previous statements; functions as a Reason marker in the sentence structure]
- ཞིང་བཀོད་པ་ : buddha-field arrangement [Compound noun: ཞིང་ "field/realm" + བཀོད་པ་ "arrangement/display"; refers to the purified realm or field created by a buddha; forms the core nominal concept being discussed]
- རྣམས : plural [Plural marker; indicates multiple instances of buddha-field arrangements; functions as a Quantifier]
- ཞེས་ : thus/so called [Quotative particle; marks the preceding term as being named or designated; part of the naming construction]
- བྱའོ : is called [Final verb; form of བྱེད་པ་ "to do/make" used in naming constructions; combined with ཞེས་ forms a Process indicating "is called/named"; the particle འོ marks sentence completion]

        ├── འདི་སྐད་དུ། ཆོས་རྣམས་ནི་བདག་མེད་པ་ཆོས་རྣམས་ནི་བདག་མེད་པའོ་ཞེས [Type: Scene | Desc: "The content of the bodhisattva's conviction" | Implicit: ""]

        └── དེ་ནི [Type: Function | Desc: "Reference to the bodhisattva with the realization" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱིས། བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་ཞེས་བརྗོད་དོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the Buddha's declaration" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent Complex | Desc: "Complex of epithets describing the Buddha as agent" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "First epithet of the Buddha - 'Thus-gone One'" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Second epithet of the Buddha - 'Foe-destroyer'" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Third epithet of the Buddha - 'Perfectly Complete Buddha'" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཀྱིས [Type: Function | Desc: "Instrumental case marker indicating agency" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བརྗོད་དོ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of designation or calling" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་ཞེས [Type: Participant-Patient Complex | Desc: "The designation given by the Buddha, reflecting realization of both types of selflessness" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ [Type: Center | Desc: "First part of designation reflecting first type of selflessness" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ [Type: Center | Desc: "Second part of designation reflecting second type of selflessness" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཞེས [Type: Function | Desc: "Quotative marker" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; the Buddha's disciple who is being addressed; functions as Recipient in the discourse structure]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [Compound term: བྱང་ཆུབ་ (enlightenment) + སེམས་དཔའ་ (hero/warrior of mind); one who aspires to enlightenment for the benefit of all beings; functions as the main Agent in the first part]

- གང་ཞིག་ : whichever, whoever [Relative pronoun; forms part of the Agent phrase, indicating "any bodhisattva who..."; specifies which type of bodhisattva is being discussed]

- འདི་སྐད་དུ། : thus, in these words [Introducer of quoted speech; འདི་ (this) + སྐད་ (speech) + དུ (terminative case); functions as a Linker introducing the content that follows]

- ཆོས་རྣམས་ : phenomena, dharmas [Plural of ཆོས་ (phenomenon, dharma); ཆོས་ (phenomenon) + རྣམས་ (plural marker); the objects that are described as lacking self; functions as Patient]

- ནི་ : as for, regarding [Topic marker; emphasizes the preceding noun as the subject of discussion; highlights "phenomena" as the topic]

- བདག་མེད་པ་ : lacking self [Compound: བདག་ (self) + མེད་པ་ (non-existence); describes the first type of selflessness (of persons); functions as a State]

- ཆོས་རྣམས་ : phenomena, dharmas [Plural of ཆོས་ (phenomenon, dharma); repeated to emphasize the second type of selflessness; functions as Patient]

- ནི་ : as for, regarding [Topic marker; emphasizes the preceding noun; marks the second instance as a distinct topic]

- བདག་མེད་པའོ་ : lacking self [Compound: བདག་ (self) + མེད་པ་ (non-existence) + འོ (final particle); describes the second type of selflessness (of phenomena); functions as a State with finality]

- ཞེས་ : saying that [Quotative marker; concludes the quoted speech; marks the end of the bodhisattva's statement]

- མོས་པ་ : has faith in, is convinced of [Verbal noun from མོས་པ་ (to have conviction/faith); indicates the bodhisattva's conviction in the statement; functions as the main Process in this section]

- དེ་ནི། : that one [Demonstrative pronoun + topic marker; refers back to the bodhisattva described; functions as a reference to the specified bodhisattva]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathagata, Thus-Gone One [Epithet of Buddha; དེ་བཞིན་ (thus) + གཤེགས་པ་ (gone); first of several titles; part of the Agent complex]

- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : Arhat, Foe-Destroyer [Epithet of Buddha; དགྲ་ (enemy) + བཅོམ་པ་ (conquered); second title; part of the Agent complex]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly, completely [Adverbial phrase; ཡང་དག་པ་ (perfect, complete) + ར (terminative); modifies the following term; part of the Agent complex]

- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete, perfect [Verbal adjective from རྫོགས་པ་ (to complete) + འི་ (genitive); modifies སངས་རྒྱས་; part of the Agent complex]

- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Compound: སངས་ (purified/removed) + རྒྱས་ (developed/expanded); one who has removed obscurations and developed wisdom; central term in the Agent complex]

- ཀྱིས། : by, through [Instrumental case marker; indicates that the Buddha is the doer of the action; marks agency in the sentence]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [Compound term: བྱང་ཆུབ་ (enlightenment) + སེམས་དཔའ་ (hero/warrior of mind); first part of the designation given by the Buddha; part of the Patient complex]

- སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་ : great being, mahasattva [Compound: སེམས་དཔའ་ (being) + ཆེན་པོ་ (great); second part of the designation, recognizing realization of the second type of selflessness; part of the Patient complex]

- ཞེས་ : as, called [Quotative marker; indicates that what precedes is a designation or title; marks the quotation in the Buddha's statement]

- བརྗོད་དོ། : declares, proclaims [Verb: བརྗོད་ (to speak/declare) + དོ (final particle); indicates the Buddha's authoritative declaration; the main Process of the final scene]

རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ་ཤའི་སྤྱན་མངའ་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root Scene" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The person being addressed" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས [Type: Scene | Desc: "Questioning scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object of contemplation" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས [Type: Function-State | Desc: "State of contemplation rather than action" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ་ཤའི་སྤྱན་མངའ་སྙམ་མམ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question about Tathagata's eyes" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ [Type: Participant-Possessor | Desc: "The possessor of the eyes" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལ [Type: Function | Desc: "Relational marker" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཤའི་སྤྱན [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The eyes that are possessed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མངའ [Type: State | Desc: "State of possession" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྙམ [Type: Function-Epistemic | Desc: "Epistemic function indicating thought or belief" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མམ [Type: Function-Center | Desc: "Question marker indicating interrogative nature" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [implicit: when asked] [Type: Time | Desc: "Implicit temporal context of questioning" | Implicit: "ཞེས་དྲིས་པ་ན"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper noun; name of Buddha's disciple; functions as the Recipient-Participant being addressed in this discourse]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; referring to the question that follows; functions as the Patient-Participant or object of contemplation]
- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [Interrogative phrase; `ཇི་` (what) + `སྙམ་` (think) + `དུ་` (adverbial particle); forms part of a standard questioning formula in sutras]
- སེམས : think [Present tense verb; to think, contemplate; functions as the State verb in this questioning scene rather than an action]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : the Tathagata [Buddhist term; lit. "Thus-Gone One," epithet for Buddha; functions as the Possessor-Participant in the sentence]
- ལ་ : to [Dative particle; indicating relationship; connects the possessor (Tathagata) with what is potentially possessed (eyes)]
- ཤའི་ : of flesh [Genitive of `ཤ་`: flesh, meat; modifies `སྤྱན་`; specifies the physical nature of the eyes being discussed]
- སྤྱན་ : eyes [Honorific noun; respectful term for eyes when referring to exalted beings; functions as the Patient-Participant that is possessed]
- མངའ་ : have/possess [Honorific verb; to have, possess (when referring to exalted beings); functions as the main State verb of possession]
- སྙམ་ : think [Quotative verb; indicating that this is the content of what is being asked; serves an Epistemic function indicating thought or contemplation]
- མམ : or not? [Question particle; transforms the statement into a yes/no question; functions as the Center marking the interrogative nature of the utterance]

རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་དེ་ལྟར་ལགས་ཏེ། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ་ཤའི་སྤྱན་མངའོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node representing the entire sentence consisting of two main scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene of Subhuti speaking" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who is speaking (Subhuti)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གསོལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of speaking/replying" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་དེ་ལྟར་ལགས་ཏེ། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ་ཤའི་སྤྱན་མངའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene containing Subhuti's statement to the Blessed One" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The addressee of Subhuti's statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་དེ་ལྟར་ལགས་ཏེ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Affirmation phrase that modifies the subsequent statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ [Type: Participant-Possessor | Desc: "The possessor of the fleshly eyes (Tathagata)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཤའི་སྤྱན་མངའོ [Type: Possession | Desc: "Expression indicating possession of fleshly eyes by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཤའི་སྤྱན [Type: Participant-Possessed | Desc: "The object being possessed (fleshly eyes)" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མངའོ [Type: State | Desc: "State indicating possession rather than an active process" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhuti [Ergative case of `རབ་འབྱོར་`: name of a disciple of Buddha; here functioning as the Agent/speaker in the sentence]
- གསོལ་པ། : replied [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, to say respectfully; here indicating Subhuti's speech act as the Process in the first scene]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; functions as the Recipient/addressee of Subhuti's statement]
- དེ་དེ་ལྟར་ལགས་ཏེ། : it is thus indeed [Affirmative construction: `དེ་` (that) + `དེ་ལྟར་` (in that way) + `ལགས་` (honorific 'to be') + `ཏེ་` (connective particle); functions as an adverbial phrase affirming agreement with a previous statement]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : the Tathagata [Epithet for Buddha meaning 'thus-gone one'; serves as the Possessor in the possession relationship]
- ལ་ : to, in [Dative/locative case marker; here indicating the relationship between possessor and possessed]
- ཤའི་ : of flesh [Genitive of `ཤ་`: flesh; modifies `སྤྱན་` and forms part of the possessed entity]
- སྤྱན་ : eyes [Honorific term for 'eyes'; the possessed object in the semantic structure]
- མངའོ། : has, possesses [From `མངའ་བ་`: honorific verb for 'to have/possess'; marks the State of possession rather than an active process]

བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the Buddha speaking to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the agent of the speech act" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of speaking/declaring" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Split scene representing the address to Subhuti and the question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Subhuti as the addressee of the Buddha's question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Demonstrative referring to the content of the question" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The actual question content posed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Function-Interrogative | Desc: "Interrogative expression marking the contemplative inquiry" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [སྤྱན་ལྔ་མངའ་བའི་སྐོར] [Type: Participant-Implicit | Desc: "Implicit content of the Buddha's question about divine vision/eyes" | Implicit: "Implicit content of the Buddha's question about divine vision/eyes"]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ : The Blessed One [Agentive/Instrumental case of `བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་`: "Bhagavān," epithet of the Buddha; literally "the one who has conquered (negative forces) and possesses (positive qualities)"; functions as the Agent/Speaker in this utterance]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། : pronounced/spoke [Perfect tense of `བཀའ་སྩལ་བ་`: "to speak, pronounce, declare" (honorific); refers to the Buddha's formal act of teaching or questioning; marks the end of the narrative introduction and beginning of direct speech]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative case, name of the Buddha's disciple; functions as the Addressee of the Buddha's question; positioned at the beginning of the direct speech to establish the dialogue partner]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun functioning as a Patient/Theme; refers forward to the content of the Buddha's question; serves as a discourse marker introducing the question]

- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [Interrogative adverbial construction from `ཇི་`: "how, what" + `སྙམ་`: "to think" + `དུ་`: purposive particle; signals a contemplative inquiry inviting reflection rather than factual information]

- སེམས། : do you think? [Present tense of `སེམས་པ་`: "to think, consider"; completes the interrogative construction; forms part of the standard Tibetan formula for introducing philosophical questions in Buddhist dialogues]

དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ་ལྷའི་སྤྱན་མངའ་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire questioning process" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Subhuti] [Type: Participant-Speaker | Desc: "The implicit speaker asking the question (Subhuti)" | Implicit: "The implicit speaker asking the question (Subhuti)"]
    ├── སྙམ་མམ [Type: Process-Mental | Desc: "Mental process of questioning/contemplating" | Implicit: ""]

        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The one who possesses the divine eye" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མངའ [Type: Process-Possessive | Desc: "Process of possessing or having" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལྷའི་སྤྱན [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The divine eye that is possessed" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ལྷའི [Type: Attribute-Possessive | Desc: "Specifies the type of eye (divine/of devas)" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྤྱན [Type: Center | Desc: "The core entity being modified (eye/vision)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལ [Type: Function | Desc: "Relator marking the possessor" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [Buddha/Bhagavan] [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The implicit addressee of the question (Buddha/Bhagavan)" | Implicit: "The implicit addressee of the question (Buddha/Bhagavan)"]
    └── མམ [Type: Function | Desc: "Question marker function word" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathagata [Compound term; literally "Thus-Gone One"; refers to the Buddha as one who has gone to/realized suchness; functions as the Experiencer in the embedded scene]
- ལ་ : to/with regard to [Dative-locative particle; marks དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ as the possessor; functions as a relator marking the relationship]
- ལྷའི་ : divine/of gods [Genitive of `ལྷ`; gods/devas; modifies སྤྱན་ as a possessive attribute indicating celestial origin]
- སྤྱན་ : eye [Honorific term for eye/vision; the object being possessed; the center entity being modified by the divine attribute]
- མངའ་ : possesses/has [Present tense of `མངའ་བ`; to possess/have (honorific); indicates the possessive relationship between the Tathagata and the divine eye]
- སྙམ་ : think/consider [Verb indicating mental process; represents the act of questioning or contemplating; from `སྙམ་པ`; to think/consider]
- མམ་ : or?/is it so? [Interrogative particle; marks the sentence as a question; functions as a question marker]

glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhuti [Ergative case of `རབ་འབྱོར་`: the arhat Subhuti, one of Buddha's main disciples; functions as the Agent/Speaker in this discourse]
- གསོལ་པ། : said [Perfective form of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, speak, say; indicates a formal statement or address to a superior; functions as the main Process/verbal action]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Bhagavan [Vocative form addressing `བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་`: "Blessed One," honorific title for Buddha; serves as Recipient of the speech]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun referring back to a previous statement; functions as a referential element]
- དེ་ལྟར་ : thus [Adverbial phrase `དེ་` + `ལྟར་`: in that way, in that manner; indicates affirmation of a previously stated proposition]
- ལགས་ཏེ། : it is [Honorific copula verb `ལགས་` + connective particle `ཏེ་`: formal way of stating "it is so"; marks the State of affirmation]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : the Tathagata [Compound term: `དེ་བཞིན་` "thus" + `གཤེགས་པ་` "one who has gone"; epithet for Buddha meaning "Thus-Gone One"; functions as the Possessor in this sentence]
- ལ་ : to/in [Dative-locative particle marking the possessor; indicates relationship or attribution]
- ལྷའི་ : divine [Genitive of `ལྷ་`: deity, god; indicates the celestial or superhuman quality of the eye; modifies `སྤྱན་`]
- སྤྱན་ : eye [Honorific form of `མིག་`: eye; refers specifically to the divine eye, one of Buddha's special faculties that can see the rebirth of beings; functions as the Attribute being possessed]
- མངའོ། : possesses [Honorific verb `མངའ་` + final particle `འོ་`: has, possesses; indicates the State of having the divine eye; completes the predication]

glossary:
# Tibetan Text Word-by-Word Glossary

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས : The Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to the Buddha as the main agent of the speaking process]

- ཀྱིས : by [Instrumental case marker indicating the agent performing the action; connects the Buddha to the action of speaking]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ : spoke/proclaimed [Honorific verb for speaking; past tense of `བཀའ་སྩལ་བ་`; indicates the formal speech or proclamation by the Buddha; functions as the main process in the scene]

- རབ་འབྱོར : Subhuti [Proper name of the Buddha's disciple; vocative form indicating the recipient of the Buddha's speech]

- འདི : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the topic that will be presented for contemplation; functions as the patient/object of the contemplation]

- ཇི : how [Interrogative particle marking the beginning of a question; part of the compound interrogative expression]

- སྙམ་དུ : think [Verbal noun with terminative particle; from `སྙམ་པ་` (to think/consider); forms part of the idiomatic expression for "what do you think?"]

- སེམས : do you think [Present tense verb; from `སེམས་པ་` (to think/contemplate); completes the interrogative construction; directed at the implicit agent (Subhuti)]

    ├── སྙམ་མམ [Type: Interrogative | Desc: "Interrogative particle transforming the statement into a question" | Implicit: "you as the addressee in the interrogative"]

        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The possessor (Tathagata) who has or may have the eye of wisdom" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་སྤྱན་མངའ [Type: Possession | Desc: "The possession relationship indicating that the Tathagata has the eye of wisdom" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་སྤྱན [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object being possessed - the eye of wisdom" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [Subhuti] [Type: Implicit Addressee | Desc: "The implicit addressee (Subhuti) to whom the question is directed" | Implicit: "Subhuti as the addressee"]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathagata [Sanskrit term transliterated into Tibetan as "de bzhin gshegs pa"; literally "one who has thus gone" or "one who has thus come"; refers to the Buddha or buddhas in general; functions as the Experiencer in the possession relationship]

- ལ་ : to, in relation to [Dative-locative particle marking the possessor in this construction; indicates reference to the Tathagata as the one who possesses]

- ཤེས་རབ་ : wisdom [Sanskrit prajñā; transcendent, discriminating awareness; specifically referring to the Buddha's special insight that perceives emptiness and reality as it is; serves as a modifier in a genitive relationship]

- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle connecting "wisdom" with "eye"; indicates that the eye belongs to or is characterized by wisdom]

- སྤྱན་ : eye [Honorific term for eye (མིག); here refers to spiritual vision or insight rather than a physical eye; the object being possessed in this construction]

- མངའ་ : possess, have [Honorific verb meaning "to have" or "to possess"; indicates the relationship between the Tathagata and the wisdom eye]

- སྙམ་ : think, wonder [Verb indicating internal questioning or consideration; marks this as a contemplative question rather than a direct inquiry]

- མམ་ : or? [Interrogative particle that transforms the statement into a question; indicates uncertainty and invites confirmation; directed at Subhuti as the implicit addressee]

glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས : by Subhuti [Ergative case marker གྱིས; proper name of the Buddha's disciple; functions as the Agent/speaker in this utterance]
- གསོལ་པ། : said/spoke [Past tense of གསོལ་བ: to request, speak, ask; here indicates formal speech to a superior; serves as the main Process/verb of the utterance]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས : Bhagavan/Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; vocative case; functions as the Recipient of Subhuti's speech]
- དེ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the previous statement by the Buddha; serves as an adverbial modifier]
- དེ་ལྟར་ : in that way/thus [Adverbial phrase from དེ་ + ལྟར་: "like that"; refers to the manner in which the Buddha's preceding teaching is true]
- ལགས་ཏེ། : it is so [Honorific copula ལགས + connective particle ཏེ; formal affirmation of agreement; functions as the Process in Subhuti's affirming statement; implies agreement with the Buddha's teaching about the five eyes]

        ├── སྤྱན [Type: Center | Desc: "The core entity - the eye/vision" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathagata [Sanskrit term transliterated in Tibetan; literally "the thus-gone one"; refers to Buddha or one who has attained Buddhahood; functions as Agent/possessor in the sentence]
- ལ་ : to, in [Dative-locative particle; here marking the possessor in a possession construction; indicates Tathagata as the locus of possession]
- ཤེས་རབ་ : wisdom [Compound noun; `ཤེས་` (to know) + `རབ་` (supreme); refers specifically to transcendent wisdom or prajñā; functions as attribute specifying type of eye]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle connecting `ཤེས་རབ་` and `སྤྱན་`; indicates attributive relationship]
- སྤྱན་ : eye [Honorific term for eye/vision; core entity being possessed; one of five types of vision attributed to buddhas]
- མངའོ། : possesses [Honorific verb `མངའ་` (to possess, have) + final particle `འོ་`; indicates possession rather than general state; completes the sentence structure]

glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound from `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to one who has conquered defilements, possesses qualities, and transcended samsara; functions as the Agent of the speech act]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates that the Buddha is the agent performing the action]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། : proclaimed [Honorific past tense of `གསུང་བ་`: to speak; honorific term used exclusively for the Buddha's speech; indicates the completed process of speaking]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; one of the Buddha's chief disciples, known for his understanding of emptiness; functions as the Recipient of the question]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the matter at hand that is about to be discussed; functions as the Patient/object of thought]

- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [Interrogative adverbial phrase; `ཇི་` (how) + `སྙམ་` (to think) + `དུ་` (complementizer); introduces a question about Subhuti's opinion; elaborates on the questioning process]

- སེམས། : think [Present tense verb; the mental act of considering or reflecting; serves as the main interrogative process of the sentence, asking Subhuti to engage in reflection]

དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ་ཆོས་ཀྱི་སྤྱན་མངའ་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Question | Desc: "Root question about whether the Tathagata possesses the dharma eye" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Subhuti] [Type: Implicit Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The person (Subhuti) being addressed by this question" | Implicit: "The person (Subhuti) being addressed by this question"]
    ├── སྙམ་མམ [Type: Process | Desc: "The questioning process with the interrogative marker མམ" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ་ཆོས་ཀྱི་སྤྱན་མངའ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The proposition being questioned about the Tathagata's possession of the dharma eye" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The Tathagata as the possessor of the dharma eye" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཆོས་ཀྱི་སྤྱན་མངའ [Type: State | Desc: "The state of possessing the dharma eye" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མངའ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of possession" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཆོས་ཀྱི་སྤྱན [Type: Participant-Attribute | Desc: "The dharma eye as a specific attribute/quality of the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── སྤྱན [Type: Center | Desc: "The head noun (eye) in the compound" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཆོས་ཀྱི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The modifier specifying which type of eye (dharma)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [present moment] [Type: Time | Desc: "The present context in which the questioning occurs" | Implicit: "The present context in which the questioning occurs"]
    └── [philosophical context of Buddha's omniscient vision] [Type: Implicit Context | Desc: "The broader philosophical context regarding Buddha's five types of eyes and omniscient qualities" | Implicit: "The broader philosophical context regarding Buddha's five types of eyes and omniscient qualities"]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathagata [Sanskrit term transliterated into Tibetan; compound noun meaning "thus-gone one" or "one who has thus come/gone"; refers to the Buddha as one who has attained complete enlightenment; functions as Experiencer in the semantic structure]

- ལ་ : to, in [Dative particle marking the possessor in this construction; indicates the relationship between the Tathagata and the dharma eye; connects the experiencer to the attribute being possessed]

- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : dharma's [Genitive form of `ཆོས་`: dharma, teaching, phenomenon; modifies `སྤྱན་` to form the compound "dharma eye"; functions as an Elaborator specifying the type of eye/vision]

- སྤྱན་ : eye [Honorific form of `མིག་`: eye; refers to special spiritual vision or perception; central noun in the attribute compound "dharma eye"; represents one of the five types of Buddha's special vision]

- མངའ་ : possess [Honorific verb for "to have/possess"; indicates the state of possession by the Tathagata; functions as the main Process in the proposition being questioned]

- སྙམ་ : think [Verb indicating mental activity, here functioning to introduce the question; carries the sense of "do you think that...?"; signals that what precedes it is the content of the question]

- མམ་ : or? [Interrogative particle transforming the statement into a question; equivalent to a question mark in English; indicates this is a yes/no question being posed to Subhuti]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་དེ་ལྟར་ལགས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing Subhūti's speech and its content" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Speech act scene of Subhūti speaking" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker, Subhūti, who is performing the speech act" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གསོལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of speaking or stating" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་དེ་ལྟར་ལགས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Content of Subhūti's speech affirming the Buddha's teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The Buddha, who is being addressed and whose teaching is being affirmed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Center | Desc: "Reference to the Buddha's previous teaching that is being affirmed" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་ལྟར་ལགས་ཏེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of affirming or acknowledging the Buddha's teaching" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་ལྟར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner adverbial modifying how something is affirmed" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [teaching about the five eyes] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit content about what is being affirmed - specifically the Buddha's teaching about the five eyes" | Implicit: "Reference to the Buddha's previous teaching about the five eyes that Subhūti is affirming"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhūti said [Agentive/Ergative case marker གྱིས་ attached to རབ་འབྱོར་ (Subhūti); indicates Subhūti as the Agent/speaker performing the speech act]

- གསོལ་པ། : spoke [Past tense of གསོལ་བ་: to request, speak respectfully; here indicating the respectful speech directed to the Buddha; functions as the main Process/verb of the speaking scene]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; vocative case (unmarked); direct address to the Buddha as the Recipient of Subhūti's speech]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the Buddha's previous teaching that Subhūti is about to affirm; functions as the Center/topic of affirmation]

- དེ་ལྟར་ : just so [Manner adverbial; composed of དེ་ (that) + ལྟར་ (like, as); modifies the following verb to indicate complete agreement with the Buddha's statement]

- ལགས་ཏེ། : it is [Honorific form of ཡིན་ (to be) + connective particle ཏེ་; honorific verb affirming the truth of the Buddha's teaching; indicates agreement while expressing respect to the Buddha; the particle ཏེ་ suggests there may be further elaboration to follow]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ་ཆོས་ཀྱི་སྤྱན་མངའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the Tathagata possessing the dharma eye" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The Tathagata as the possessor of the dharma eye" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མངའོ [Type: Process-Possessive | Desc: "Process of possessing or having the dharma eye" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་སྤྱན [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma eye that is possessed by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྤྱན [Type: Center | Desc: "The core concept of 'eye' or vision" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཆོས་ཀྱི [Type: Elaborator-Attribute | Desc: "Attribute specifying what kind of eye - the dharma eye" | Implicit: ""]
    └── one of the five special eyes [Type: Implicit-Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit information about the dharma eye being one of five special types of vision" | Implicit: "Clarifies that the dharma eye is one of five special types of vision"]
        └── for perceiving conventional truths [Type: Adverbial-Function | Desc: "The function of the dharma eye to perceive conventional truths and phenomena" | Implicit: "Explains the specific function of the dharma eye"]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathagata [Sanskrit title meaning "Thus-Gone One"; refers to the Buddha; serves as the Experiencer/possessor in the sentence]
- ལ་ : to, in [Dative-Locative particle marking དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ as the possessor; indicates relationship between the Tathagata and what is possessed]
- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : of dharma [Genitive form of ཆོས་ "dharma, teaching, phenomena"; functions as an attribute specifying the type of eye/vision]
- སྤྱན་ : eye [Honorific form of མིག་ "eye"; here refers to one of the five special types of vision possessed by realized beings; functions as the Patient/possessed object]
- མངའོ : possesses [Honorific verb form of ཡོད་པ་ "to have/possess"; present tense with final particle འོ་ indicating a complete statement; functions as the possessive Process in the sentence]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the Buddha's speech and question to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene of the Buddha speaking" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the speaker/agent" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of speaking/saying" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene of the Buddha asking Subhuti to contemplate" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Subhuti as the person being directly addressed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The matter being questioned/discussed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of thinking/contemplating" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Interrogative modifier elaborating on the nature of thinking" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [IMPLIED: Buddha's vision] [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implied object of contemplation about Buddha's visual perception" | Implicit: "The implied object of contemplation about Buddha's visual perception"]
    ├── ། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Punctuation mark" | Implicit: ""]
    └──  [Type: Relator | Desc: "Sequential and causal connection between the Buddha's speaking and the question to Subhuti" | Implicit: "Sequential and causal connection between scenes"]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to one who has conquered the defilements, possesses all qualities, and has gone beyond suffering; functions as the Agent/Speaker in this utterance]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental particle marking the agent of the action; indicates that the Buddha is performing the action of speaking]

- བཀའ་ : word [Honorific term for speech/teaching; specifically refers to the Buddha's authoritative pronouncements]  

- སྩལ་པ། : spoke, proclaimed [Perfect tense of `སྩོལ་བ་`: to bestow, grant, give; used honorifically to indicate the Buddha delivering a teaching; functions as the main Process in the first scene]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of one of Buddha's chief disciples known for his understanding of emptiness; functions as the Addressee of the Buddha's question]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun referring to the matter about to be discussed; functions as the Patient/topic being questioned]

- ཇི་ : what, how [Interrogative particle introducing a question about manner or way]

- སྙམ་ : think [Present tense of `སྙམ་པ་`: to think, consider; refers to the contemplative process Subhuti is being asked to engage in]

- དུ་ : as, in what way [Terminative particle connecting to the verb of thinking; indicates the manner of contemplation]

- སེམས། : do you think? [Present tense of `སེམས་པ་`: to think, contemplate; represents the main Process in the second scene of contemplation that Subhuti is being directed to undertake]

ucca_formatted:
[Buddha] [Type: Implicit Questioner | Desc: "The Buddha who is asking the question to Subhuti" | Implicit: "The Buddha is implied as the person asking the question"]
    └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་སྤྱན་མངའ་སྙམ་མམ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of questioning" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [Subhuti] [Type: Participant-Speaker | Desc: "Implicit participant Subhuti who is being questioned" | Implicit: "Subhuti is the implicit person being questioned"]
        ├── སྙམ་མམ [Type: Interrogative-Process | Desc: "Questioning process that indicates asking for thoughts/opinion" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་སྤྱན་མངའ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Content of what is being questioned about" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ [Type: Participant-Possessor | Desc: "Entity that possesses the Buddha's eyes" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མངའ [Type: Possessive-State | Desc: "Possessive state indicating ownership or having" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་སྤྱན [Type: Participant-Possessed | Desc: "The entity that is possessed by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Indicates ownership of the eyes" | Implicit: ""]
                └── སྤྱན [Type: Center | Desc: "The main entity being discussed (Buddha's eyes)" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathagata [Sanskrit term meaning "thus-gone one"; an epithet for the Buddha; functions as the possessor in this context according to the semantic structure]
- ལ་ : to, for [Dative-locative particle indicating the relationship or connection; here marking the Tathagata as the possessor]
- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [The enlightened one; from `སངས་` (purified) + `རྒྱས་` (developed); functions as the agent/owner of the eyes]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle showing possession; connects Buddha to eyes]
- སྤྱན་ : eyes [Honorific term for eyes (respectful form of `མིག་`); refers specifically to the Buddha's special vision or insight; central entity being discussed]
- མངའ་ : possess, have [Honorific verb for possession; indicates the state of having or possessing the Buddha's eyes]
- སྙམ་ : think, consider [Verb indicating thought or consideration; marks this as reported speech or a question about someone's thoughts]
- མམ་ : or? [Interrogative particle indicating a yes/no question; transforms the statement into a question]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་དེ་ལྟར་ལགས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing Subhūti's statement of agreement to Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene showing Subhūti speaking" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker, Subhūti, as agent" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གསོལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་དེ་ལྟར་ལགས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene containing Subhūti's agreement with Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Buddha as the addressee of Subhūti's statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་དེ་ལྟར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Demonstrative reference to Buddha's previous statements about his five types of eyes/vision" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལགས [Type: State | Desc: "The verb indicating Subhūti's agreement with Buddha's statement" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཏེ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Discourse connector linking Subhūti's agreement with implied additional content" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Buddha possesses the five types of eyes] [Type: Implicit Center-State | Desc: "Implicit content affirming Buddha's possession of the five types of eyes/vision that Subhūti is agreeing with" | Implicit: "Buddha possesses the five types of eyes"]
    └── [specifically the physical eye, divine eye, wisdom eye, dharma eye, and buddha eye] [Type: Implicit Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit elaboration on the specific five types of eyes/vision that Buddha possesses" | Implicit: "specifically the physical eye, divine eye, wisdom eye, dharma eye, and buddha eye"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhūti [Ergative/Instrumental case of རབ་འབྱོར་ (Subhūti); name of the Buddha's disciple who is speaking; functions as the Agent/speaker in this dialogue]
- གསོལ་པ། : said [Perfect tense of √གསོལ་ (to request, say, speak); indicates that Subhūti is addressing the Buddha formally; functions as the main verb of the speaking action]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Bhagavān [Vocative/honorific title for the Buddha; literally "Blessed One" or "Transcendent Destroyer"; functions as the Addressee of Subhūti's statement]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the Buddha's previous statement about the five types of eyes; functions as a reference marker]
- དེ་ལྟར་ : thus [Adverbial phrase composed of དེ་ (that) + ལྟར་ (like, as); means "in that way" or "just so"; refers back to Buddha's explanation of the five eyes; functions as an Adverbial modifier]
- ལགས་ : is [Honorific form of the copula verb ཡིན་ (to be); indicates agreement with Buddha's previous statement; functions as the State verb in this context]
- ཏེ། : indeed [Connective particle; links the current statement with an implied continuation; indicates that Subhūti acknowledges Buddha's statement and implies further discussion; functions as a discourse connector]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ་སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་སྤྱན་མངའོ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the possession relationship" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ལ [Type: Participant-Possessor | Desc: "The entity (Tathagata) that possesses the Buddha-eyes" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི་སྤྱན [Type: Participant-Possession | Desc: "The object (Buddha-eyes) possessed by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སངས་རྒྱས་ཀྱི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Specifies the type of eyes as belonging to or characteristic of a Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [to perceive all phenomena] [Type: Implicit-Function | Desc: "The implicit function of Buddha-eyes to clearly and completely perceive all aspects of reality" | Implicit: "The implicit function of Buddha-eyes to clearly and completely perceive all aspects of reality"]
    └── མངའོ [Type: Possession-State | Desc: "The state of possession indicating that the Tathagata has Buddha-eyes" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathagata [Compound term; literally "thus-gone one"; technical Buddhist term referring to a Buddha; functions as the possessor in this sentence]
- ལ་ : to, in [Locative/dative particle; here indicating the person who possesses something; marks དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ as the possessor]
- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Noun; literally "awakened one"; here functioning as a qualifier specifying the type of wisdom eyes]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; connecting སངས་རྒྱས་ with སྤྱན་; indicates that the eyes belong to or are characteristic of a Buddha]
- སྤྱན་ : eyes [Honorific noun for "eyes"; specifically refers to the special wisdom eyes or vision of enlightened beings; the object being possessed]
- མངའོ་ : possesses [Honorific verb "to have/possess" + final particle; indicates that the Tathagata possesses the Buddha-eyes with their special perceptual abilities]

བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱི་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the Buddha's statement and question to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]

        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱི [Type: Participant-Speaker | Desc: "The Buddha as the speaker of the utterance" | Implicit: ""]

        ├── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Interrogative-Process | Desc: "The questioning process specifically used by the Buddha to prompt reflection from Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        └──  [Type: Elaboration | Desc: "Implicit elaboration connecting to the Sanskrit text showing this scene is the beginning of a broader teaching about the Buddha's omniscience regarding beings' mental states and the extended metaphor about Ganges river sands" | Implicit: "This scene is the beginning of a broader teaching about the Buddha's omniscience regarding beings' mental states and the extended metaphor about Ganges river sands"]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : The Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered [the four maras]), `ལྡན་` (possessing [the qualities of enlightenment]), and `འདས་` (transcended [suffering]); functions as the Speaker participant in the discourse]

- ཀྱི་ : 's [Genitive particle connecting the Buddha to his speech; indicates possession or attribution]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། : proclaimed [Honorific past tense verb for `speaking/saying`; from `བཀའ་` (word/speech of the Buddha) and `སྩལ་` (to bestow/grant); marks the formal opening of the Buddha's discourse as a Process]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Name of the disciple being addressed; one of the Buddha's chief disciples known for his understanding of emptiness; functions as the direct Addressee of the Buddha's question]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun referring to the forthcoming question; serves as a Patient participant in the speech act]

- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [Interrogative phrase; `ཇི་` (what/how) combined with `སྙམ་` (to think/consider); introduces a reflective question designed to prompt contemplation]

- སེམས། : you think? [Present tense verb meaning "to think"; completes the interrogative phrase; creates the questioning process that initiates the teaching dialogue]

གངྒཱའི་ཀླུང་གི་བྱེ་མ་ཇི་སྙེད་པ་གངྒཱའི་ཀླུང་ཡང་དེ་སྙེད་ཁོ་ནར་གྱུར་ལ། དེ་དག་གི་བྱེ་མ་དེ་སྙེད་ཀྱི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་སུ་གྱུར་ན། འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་དེ་དག་མང་བ་ཡིན་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire Buddha's question to Subhuti about the number of world systems" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གངྒཱའི་ཀླུང་གི་བྱེ་མ་ཇི་སྙེད་པ་གངྒཱའི་ཀླུང་ཡང་དེ་སྙེད་ཁོ་ནར་གྱུར་ལ། དེ་དག་གི་བྱེ་མ་དེ་སྙེད་ཀྱི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་སུ་གྱུར་ན། [Type: Conditional | Desc: "Conditional premise setting up the hypothetical scenario for Buddha's question to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གངྒཱའི་ཀླུང་གི་བྱེ་མ་ཇི་སྙེད་པ་གངྒཱའི་ཀླུང་ཡང་དེ་སྙེད་ཁོ་ནར་གྱུར་ལ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First hypothetical scenario about Ganges rivers becoming as numerous as grains of sand" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གངྒཱའི་ཀླུང་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The Ganges river that is multiplied in the hypothetical scenario" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གངྒཱའི་ཀླུང་གི་བྱེ་མ་ཇི་སྙེད་པ [Type: Quantifier | Desc: "Quantifier expressing the number of sand grains in the Ganges used as basis for comparison" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཇི་སྙེད་པ [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Quantity expression indicating the numerosity of sand grains" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་སྙེད་ཁོ་ནར་གྱུར [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of transformation or becoming indicating the hypothetical multiplication of Ganges rivers" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ལ། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction linking the first hypothetical condition to the second" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་དག་གི་བྱེ་མ་དེ་སྙེད་ཀྱི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་སུ་གྱུར་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second hypothetical scenario about world systems becoming as numerous as all the sand grains" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The world systems that are multiplied in the second hypothetical scenario" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་དག་གི་བྱེ་མ་དེ་སྙེད [Type: Quantifier | Desc: "Quantifier expressing the number derived from all sand grains in the multiplied rivers" | Implicit: ""]
                └── དེ་སྙེད [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Quantity expression referring to the numerosity of sand grains in all the rivers" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གྱུར་ན། [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of transformation indicating the hypothetical multiplication of world systems" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ན། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conditional marker linking the hypothetical premises to the question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་དེ་དག་མང་བ་ཡིན་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Buddha's question to Subhuti about whether the hypothetical world systems would be considered many" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── Subhuti [Type: Implicit Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The implicit experiencer Subhuti (རབ་འབྱོར) who is being addressed by Buddha with this question" | Implicit: "The experiencer is Subhuti who is being addressed but not explicitly mentioned in the text"]
        ├── སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of thinking or considering that Subhuti is being asked to engage in" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་དེ་དག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The world systems that are the subject of Buddha's question about quantity" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མང་བ་ཡིན [Type: State | Desc: "State of being numerous that Buddha is asking Subhuti to consider" | Implicit: ""]
    └── Buddha [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit agent Buddha (བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས) who is posing this question to Subhuti" | Implicit: "The speaker Buddha is implied but not explicitly mentioned in the text"]
glossary:
- གངྒཱའི་ : of the Ganges [Genitive of `གངྒཱ`: the Ganges river (Sanskrit loanword); indicates possession or relation; functions as a modifier of the following noun]
- ཀླུང་ : river [Noun: river, stream; specifically refers to the Ganges river as the patient/subject in the hypothetical scenario]
- གི་ : of [Genitive particle: connecting "river" with "sand"; indicates possessive relationship]
- བྱེ་མ་ : sand [Noun: sand, grains of sand; used as basis for quantification in the hypothetical scenario]
- ཇི་སྙེད་པ་ : as many as [Correlative quantity expression: however many, as many as; indicates the vast quantity of sand grains being used as a comparative measure]
- གངྒཱའི་ : of the Ganges [Genitive of `གངྒཱ`: repeated reference to the Ganges; modifies the second instance of "river"]
- ཀླུང་ : river [Noun: river, stream; refers back to the Ganges river, now as the patient that undergoes multiplication]
- ཡང་ : also [Particle: also, even, too; emphasizes the transition from counting sand to counting rivers]
- དེ་སྙེད་ : that many [Demonstrative quantifier: that many, that amount; refers back to the quantity of sand grains]
- ཁོ་ནར་ : exactly, precisely [Emphatic particle: only, precisely; emphasizes the exact correspondence of quantities]
- གྱུར་ : became [Verb (past of `འགྱུར་བ`): to become, transform; indicates the hypothetical transformation process]
- ལ། : and [Conjunction: linking particle connecting the first hypothetical scenario to the second]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural: those, those ones; refers to the multiplied Ganges rivers]
- གི་ : of [Genitive particle: connecting "those" (rivers) with their "sand"]
- བྱེ་མ་ : sand [Noun: sand, grains of sand; now referring to all the sand in all the hypothetical rivers]
- དེ་སྙེད་ : that many [Demonstrative quantifier: that many, that amount; refers to the quantity derived from all sand grains in the multiplied rivers]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle: connecting the quantifier to "world systems"]
- འཇིག་རྟེན་ : world [Noun: world, universe; forms part of the compound term for "world systems"]
- གྱི་ : of [Genitive particle: connecting "world" with "realm"]
- ཁམས་ : realm, system [Noun: realm, element, system; second part of the compound term for "world systems" as the patient in the second hypothetical scenario]
- སུ་ : into [Terminative particle: into, as; indicates transformation into the state described]
- གྱུར་ན། : if became [Conditional verb form (past of `འགྱུར་བ`) + conditional particle: if (they) were to become; indicates the conditional premise]
- འཇིག་རྟེན་ : world [Noun: world, universe; repeated reference in Buddha's question]
- གྱི་ : of [Genitive particle: connecting "world" with "realm"]
- ཁམས་ : realm, system [Noun: realm, element, system; second reference to "world systems" as the subject of Buddha's question]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural: those, those ones; refers to the hypothetical world systems]
- མང་བ་ : many [Adjective: many, numerous; the state Buddha is asking Subhuti to consider]
- ཡིན་ : are [Verb: to be; copula connecting "world systems" with the quality "many"]
- སྙམ་ : think [Verb: to think, consider; the cognitive process Buddha is asking Subhuti to engage in]
- མམ། : or not? [Interrogative particle: or not?; creates a yes/no question directed to the implicit addressee Subhuti]
