རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་དེ་ལྟར་ལགས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the full exchange" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker/agent who is replying" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསོལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The speech act of replying" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་དེ་ལྟར་ལགས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The content of what Subhuti said" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The addressee of Subhuti's statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་དེ་ལྟར་ལགས་ཏེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The confirmation process expressed by Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེ་དེ་ལྟར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial construction indicating the manner of confirmation" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [previous statement] [Type: Time | Desc: "Implicit reference to Buddha's previous statement that Subhuti is confirming" | Implicit: "Reference to Buddha's previous statement that Subhuti is confirming"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhuti [Ergative case of `རབ་འབྱོར་`: Subhuti, name of Buddha's disciple; indicates Subhuti as the Agent/speaker performing the action of speaking; functioning as the primary agent in this discourse scene]

- གསོལ་པ། : replied [Perfect tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, reply, speak; indicating a completed verbal action of formal speech directed to the Buddha; functions as the main Process in the scene]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; vocative case addressing the Buddha directly; recipient of Subhuti's speech; functioning as the addressee in this communicative exchange]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun referring to what the Buddha previously stated; creates cohesion with prior discourse; part of an adverbial construction confirming agreement]

- དེ་ལྟར་ : in that way [Adverbial compound `དེ་` (that) + `ལྟར་` (like, as); means "just so" or "exactly like that"; expresses manner of agreement with Buddha's previous statement]

- ལགས་ཏེ། : it is [Honorific copula `ལགས་` + connective particle `ཏེ་`; polite form of "is" used when addressing the Buddha; confirms agreement while indicating more will follow; marks completion of Subhuti's affirmation]

འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་དེ་དག་མང་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the statement about world systems" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [implicit: The Blessed One said] [Type: Center | Desc: "Implicit speaker of the statement (Buddha/Blessed One)" | Implicit: "བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་གསུངས་པ"]
    ├── འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་དེ་དག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The world systems being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept of world systems" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་དག [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Specifier indicating which world systems" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མང་ལགས [Type: Process | Desc: "Process asserting the numerousness of the world systems" | Implicit: ""]
    └── སོ། ། [Type: Ground | Desc: "Sentence-final particle that grounds the assertion in discourse" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- འཇིག་རྟེན་ : world [Noun; compound of `འཇིག་` (to destroy) + `རྟེན་` (support); refers to the phenomenal world or mundane existence; functions as part of the main patient/topic of the utterance]
- གྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; links 'world' with 'systems'; shows possessive relationship]
- ཁམས་ : systems/realms [Noun; refers to elemental constituents or dimensional realms; here meaning world-systems or universes in Buddhist cosmology; central component of the patient/topic]
- དེ་དག : those [Demonstrative plural; specifies which world systems are being discussed; elaborates on the main nominal phrase]
- མང་ : many [Adjective serving as stative verb; indicates numerousness or abundance; functions as the main predicate/process]
- ལགས་ : are [Honorific copula verb; indicates existence in formal/respectful speech; part of the predicate asserting the numerousness]
- སོ། ། : [Final particle; marks the end of an assertive statement; grounds the utterance in discourse; equivalent to a period in English]

            └── བསམ་པ་ཐ་དད་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Qualification describing the diverse nature of the minds" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་དེ་དག་ན [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "Location where the sentient beings exist" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་ཇི་སྙེད་ཡོད་པ [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The beings whose minds are known by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་དག་གི [Type: Relator | Desc: "Possessive marker connecting the sentient beings to their mind streams" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ངས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the knower/agent" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཤེས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of knowing" | Implicit: ""]
            └── རབ་ཏུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial modifier indicating the completeness of knowing" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ : The Blessed One [Ergative case of `བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་`: "Bhagavan" or "Blessed One"; a title for the Buddha; functions as the Agent/Speaker in this statement]
- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། : proclaimed [Past tense of `བཀའ་སྩལ་བ་`: "to speak, proclaim" (honorific); indicates the Buddha's speech act as the main Process in the first scene]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative form addressing `རབ་འབྱོར་`: "Subhuti"; name of the disciple being addressed; functions as the Recipient of the Buddha's statement]
- འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ : of the world [Genitive of `འཇིག་རྟེན་`: "world, worldly existence"; indicates possession; part of the locational phrase]
- ཁམས་ : realms [From `ཁམས་`: "realm, sphere, element"; describes the cosmic domains or planes of existence]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural marker; specifies particular realms being discussed]
- ན་ : in [Locative particle; indicates location "within" the realms; completes the Location phrase]
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Compound of `སེམས་` (mind) + `ཅན་` (possessing); refers to conscious beings; functions as the Experiencer whose minds are known]
- ཇི་སྙེད་ : however many [Correlative adverb meaning "as many as"; quantifies the sentient beings in all realms]
- ཡོད་པ་ : exist [Present participle of `ཡོད་`: "to exist"; describes the beings that exist]
- དེ་དག་གི་ : of those [Genitive of demonstrative plural `དེ་དག་`; connects the beings to their mind streams; functions as Relator]
- བསམ་པ་ : thoughts [From `བསམ་པ་`: "thought, intention, mentality"; refers to mental dispositions]
- ཐ་དད་པའི་ : diverse [Genitive/attributive of `ཐ་དད་པ་`: "different, distinct"; qualifies the thoughts as varied]
- སེམས་ཀྱི་ : of mind [Genitive of `སེམས་`: "mind, consciousness"; indicates possession]
- རྒྱུན་ : continuums [From `རྒྱུན་`: "continuum, stream, flow"; refers to the ongoing flow of consciousness; the central State concept known by the Buddha]
- ངས་ : I [Ergative of `ང་`: "I" (first-person pronoun); refers to the Buddha as the Agent/knower]
- རབ་ཏུ་ : thoroughly [Adverbial modifier from `རབ་ཏུ་`: "extremely, completely"; intensifies the knowing process]
- ཤེས་སོ། : know [Present tense of `ཤེས་`: "to know, understand"; with sentence-final particle `སོ`; indicates the Buddha's complete knowledge; functions as the main Process]

དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་སེམས་ཀྱི་རྒྱུན་སེམས་ཀྱི་རྒྱུན་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནི། དེ་རྒྱུན་མེད་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་སེམས་ཀྱི་རྒྱུན་སེམས་ཀྱི་རྒྱུན་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནི། [Type: Scene | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཀྱི་རྒྱུན་སེམས་ཀྱི་རྒྱུན [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Elaborator of 3.4" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནི [Type: Connector | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་རྒྱུན་མེད་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Center | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསུངས་པའི [Type: Process | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རྒྱུན་མེད་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Elaborated by 2.2" | Implicit: ""]
        └── (དོན་དམ་པར) [Type: Implicit Contextual Modifier | Desc: "Implicit philosophical context" | Implicit: "Implicit philosophical context that explains the nature of the teaching"]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; functioning as Patient in the question structure]
- ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ : for what reason [Interrogative phrase; `ཅི་` (what) + genitive particle `འི་` + `ཕྱིར་` (for the sake of); functions as the Process component of the questioning]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional marker indicating a rhetorical question; concludes the interrogative phrase "Why is that?"]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; the Buddha's disciple being addressed; functions as Recipient of the teaching]
- སེམས་ཀྱི་ : of mind [Genitive of `སེམས་`: mind, consciousness; modifier of the following term]
- རྒྱུན་ : continuum [Noun: stream, continuity, flow; refers to the notion of mental continuum]
- སེམས་ཀྱི་རྒྱུན་ : mind-continuum [Repetition for emphasis; the Patient in the scene; the concept being discussed]
- ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ : so-called [Quotative construction; `ཞེས་` (thus) + `བྱ་བ་` (called); marks the preceding term as being named or labeled]
- ནི། : as for [Topic marker; highlighting the subject of discussion]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun referring to the mind-continuum; functions as Center of the explanation]
- རྒྱུན་མེད་པར་ : as non-continuous [Negative compound: `རྒྱུན་` (continuum) + `མེད་པ་` (non-existent) + terminative particle `ར་`; functions as an Adverbial modifier describing how the Tathagata taught about mind]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Agentive/instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "Thus-Gone One" (epithet of Buddha); functions as Agent who performs the teaching]
- གསུངས་པའི་ : was taught [Past tense of `གསུང་` (to speak, teach) + nominalizing particle `པ་` + genitive particle `འི་`; the Process component]
- ཕྱིར་ཏེ། : because [Causal conjunction; `ཕྱིར་` (for the sake of) + connective particle `ཏེ་`; indicates reason or cause]

དེས་ན་སེམས་ཀྱི་རྒྱུན་ཞེས་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of the statement about mental continuum" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector linking this statement to previous context about ultimate non-existence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས་ཀྱི་རྒྱུན [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The term being defined in this statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས [Type: Center | Desc: "Core concept being elaborated upon" | Implicit: ""]
        └── རྒྱུན [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the temporal nature of mind as a sequence of moments" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཞེས་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of naming or designating the conventional term" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Implicit Speaker/Teacher] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit Buddha/teacher who is designating the conventional term" | Implicit: "The Buddha/teacher who is designating the conventional term"]
    └──  [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connection between the linker 'therefore' and the conclusion being stated" | Implicit: "Connection between the linker and conclusion"]
        └── དེས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector linking this statement to previous context about ultimate non-existence" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེས་ན : therefore [Instrumental case particle `དེ` + ergative marker `ས` + connecting particle `ན`; transitions from previous context about ultimate non-existence to present conclusion; functions as a discourse linker connecting previous arguments to the current statement]

- སེམས་ཀྱི་ : of mind [Genitive case of `སེམས`: mind, consciousness; indicates possessive relationship; the core concept being discussed in this philosophical context]

- རྒྱུན་ : continuum [Noun: `རྒྱུན`: stream, continuity, sequence; elaborates on the temporal nature of mind as a flowing sequence of moments rather than a static entity]

- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative marker indicating the preceding term is being named or designated]

- བྱའོ : is called [Future/present form of `བྱེད`: to do, make, call; with final particle `འོ` marking statement completion; indicates the process of naming or designating the conventional term]

- ། : [Sentence-ending punctuation mark (shad)]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་འདས་པའི་སེམས་ཀྱང་དམིགས་སུ་མེད། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing two scenes: a question and its answer" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question scene asking for the reason" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The topic being inquired about" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "Questioning process" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་འདས་པའི་སེམས་ཀྱང་དམིགས་སུ་མེད། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Answer scene explaining that past mind cannot be apprehended" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The person being directly addressed in this teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདས་པའི་སེམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The mind of the past that cannot be apprehended" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདས་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Modifier specifying the temporal quality of the mind" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཀྱང [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial modifier emphasizing that even the past mind cannot be apprehended" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དམིགས་སུ་མེད [Type: Process-Negation | Desc: "Negation of the possibility of apprehending the past mind in ultimate reality" | Implicit: ""]
        └── in ultimate reality [Type: Implicit Elaborator-Setting | Desc: "Implicit philosophical context in which the past mind cannot be apprehended" | Implicit: "The philosophical context of ultimate reality is implied but not explicitly stated in the text"]
glossary:
- དེ་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the preceding discourse or teaching; functions as the Patient (the topic being inquired about) in the question scene]
- ཅིའི་ : what's [Interrogative + genitive particle; from `ཅི་`: what; used to form a question about reason/purpose; part of the questioning process]
- ཕྱིར་ : reason [Noun meaning 'reason' or 'purpose'; forms question phrase "for what reason"; part of the questioning process]
- ཞེ་ན། : if asked [Conditional form of `ཞེས་`: to say/ask; completes the formulaic question phrase "if one asks why"; concludes the questioning process]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Proper name; direct addressee of the Buddha's teaching; functions as the Addressee in the answer scene]
- འདས་པའི་ : past [Genitive of `འདས་པ་`: gone beyond, past; temporal modifier specifying the quality of mind being discussed; elaborates on the Patient]
- སེམས་ : mind [Noun: mind, consciousness; the object that cannot be apprehended; functions as the Patient in the answer scene]
- ཀྱང་ : even [Emphatic particle: also, even, too; emphasizes that even the past mind cannot be apprehended; functions as an Adverbial modifier]
- དམིགས་སུ་ : as object of perception [Terminative case of `དམིགས་པ་`: to perceive, apprehend; indicates the inability to apprehend mind as an object; part of the negated Process]
- མེད། : does not exist [Negative existential verb; negates the possibility of apprehending past mind in ultimate reality; forms the Process-Negation with དམིགས་སུ་]

མ་འོངས་པའི་སེམས་ཀྱང་དམིགས་སུ་མེད། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing the unobservability of future mind" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མ་འོངས་པའི་སེམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The entity (future mind) that is described as unobservable" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མ་འོངས་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Temporal attribute specifying the mind is future" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དམིགས་སུ་མེད [Type: State | Desc: "The stative predicate describing that the future mind cannot be observed or apprehended" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཀྱང [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connects this statement to previous discourse about past and present mind also being unobservable" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཀྱང [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connects this statement to previous discourse about past and present mind also being unobservable" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [implicit: དོན་དམ་པར] [Type: Contextual | Desc: "Implicit philosophical context that this statement is from the perspective of ultimate truth" | Implicit: "Philosophical context that this statement is from the perspective of ultimate truth"]
glossary:
- མ་འོངས་པའི་ : future [Genitive of `མ་འོངས་པ་`: that which has not come; modifies 'mind' as a temporal attribute indicating the mind's future aspect; functions as an Elaborator describing the Patient in the sentence]

- སེམས་ : mind [Root noun `སེམས་`: mind, consciousness; here refers to the mental continuum in its future state; functions as the Patient of the state described in the sentence]

- ཀྱང་ : also/even [Connector particle; links this statement to previous discourse about past and present mind also being unobservable; indicates that this quality applies to future mind in addition to other temporal states]

- དམིགས་སུ་ : as an object of observation [Terminative case of `དམིགས་པ་`: to observe, apprehend, focus on; indicates the manner in which something cannot be done; part of the stative predicate]

- མེད། : does not exist [Negative existential verb; indicates the non-existence or impossibility of observing/apprehending the future mind; functions as the main State predicate in the sentence; implies from context that this is from the perspective of ultimate truth]

ucca_formatted:
ད་ལྟར་བྱུང་བའི་སེམས་ཀྱང་དམིགས་སུ་མེད་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ད་ལྟར་བྱུང་བའི་སེམས་ཀྱང་ [Type: Participant-Topic | Desc: "Topic of the discourse" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ད་ལྟར་ [Type: Time | Desc: "Temporal specification" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱུང་བའི་ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of arising" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སེམས་ [Type: Center | Desc: "Core concept being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དམིགས་སུ་མེད་པ [Type: Process-Adverbial | Desc: "The philosophical claim about non-findability of mind" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འི་ཕྱིར་ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Causal relation marker" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དམིགས་སུ་མེད་པ [Type: Process-Adverbial | Desc: "The philosophical claim about non-findability of mind" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རོ། ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Sentence-final particle" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དོན་དམ་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Implicit philosophical context" | Implicit: "Implicit philosophical context"]
glossary:
- ད་ལྟར་ : at present [temporal adverb marking present time; serves as temporal specification in the sentence, establishing the timeframe for the following philosophical assertion]

- བྱུང་བའི་ : that arises [past/perfect form of `འབྱུང་བ`: to arise, occur, happen; with genitive particle འི་; describes the process of arising or manifestation of the mind; functions as a process modifier to སེམས་]

- སེམས་ : mind [noun: consciousness, mind, citta; the core concept being discussed in this philosophical statement; functions as the main topic of the discourse]

- ཀྱང་ : also/even [emphasizing particle: also, too, even; adds emphasis to the mind as the topic, suggesting this point extends previous discussion; functions as a topic marker]

- དམིགས་སུ་ : as an object [terminative case of `དམིགས་པ`: to apprehend, perceive, objectify; here used in a philosophical context to refer to finding or identifying something as a discrete entity]

- མེད་པའི་ : is not/does not exist [negative existential `མེད་པ་`: non-existence, absence; with genitive particle འི་; negates the possibility of the mind being found or objectified; forms the main philosophical claim]

- ཕྱིར་ : because [nominalizer functioning as a causal conjunction: for the reason that, because; marks the preceding clause as the reason for an implicit conclusion; functions as a relator]

- རོ། ། : [sentence-final particle marking the statement as declarative or emphatic; indicates completion of the philosophical assertion with certainty]

རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire utterance" | Implicit: ""]

    ├── སེམས [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action/process of thinking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Demonstrative adverbial modifier indicating the topic of thought" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Interrogative adverbial phrase indicating this is a question" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [Buddha] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit agent who is asking the question" | Implicit: "The speaker who is asking the question, identified as Buddha in the commentary"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative case; proper name of Buddha's disciple; addressed as the recipient of the question; functions as the Participant-Recipient in the semantic structure]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; indicates the topic or subject matter being discussed; functions as an Adverbial modifier pointing to what should be contemplated]
- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [Interrogative adverbial compound; `ཇི་` (how/what) + `སྙམ་` (to think) + `དུ་` (adverbial particle); marks this as a question prompting reflection; functions as an Adverbial that establishes the interrogative nature]
- སེམས : think [Present tense verb; root meaning is "to think/consider/contemplate"; the main process of the sentence representing the mental action requested of the recipient; functions as the main Process in the semantic structure]

ucca_formatted:
གང་གིས་སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་འདི་རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན་གྱིས་རབ་ཏུ་གང་བར་བྱས་ཏེ་སྦྱིན་པ་བྱིན་ན། རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་དེ་གཞི་དེ་ལས་བསོད་ནམས་མང་དུ་བསྐྱེད་དམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Conditional comparative question about merit generation" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་གིས་སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་འདི་རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན་གྱིས་རབ་ཏུ་གང་བར་བྱས་ཏེ་སྦྱིན་པ་བྱིན་ན [Type: Scene | Desc: "Conditional scene describing hypothetical generous act" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་གིས [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Hypothetical person being addressed in the question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The world system that would be filled with precious substances" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The precious substances used to fill the world system" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བདུན [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Number of precious substances" | Implicit: ""]
            └── gold, silver, etc. [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit specification of the seven precious substances" | Implicit: "Implicit specification of the seven precious substances"]
        ├── རབ་ཏུ་གང་བར་བྱས་ཏེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of filling the world system with precious substances" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྦྱིན་པ་བྱིན [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of giving away the precious substances as gifts" | Implicit: ""]
            └── to others [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Implicit recipients of the gifts" | Implicit: "Implicit recipients of the gifts"]
        └── ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conditional marker linking the hypothetical situation to the result" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་དེ་གཞི་དེ་ལས་བསོད་ནམས་མང་དུ་བསྐྱེད་དམ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question about merit generation result of the generous act" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་དེ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The person who would generate merit" | Implicit: ""]
            └── those who engage in giving [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit clarification of who the sons or daughters of good family are" | Implicit: "Implicit clarification of who the sons or daughters of good family are"]
        ├── བསོད་ནམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The merit that would be generated" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསྐྱེད [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of generating merit" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མང་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "The extent of merit generation" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གཞི་དེ་ལས [Type: Adverbial-Cause | Desc: "The causal basis for the merit generation" | Implicit: ""]
    └── If-then relation [Type: Relator | Desc: "Explicit relation showing the conditional structure between the two scenes" | Implicit: "Explicit relation showing the conditional structure between the two scenes"]
glossary:
- གང་གིས་ : whoever [Instrumental-Agentive particle; serves as the agent marker for the hypothetical generous person being addressed in the question]
- སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་ : of the trichiliocosm [Genitive of `སྟོང་གསུམ་`: system of one billion world systems; refers to a vast cosmological unit in Buddhist cosmology]
- སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་ : great thousand [Genitive of `སྟོང་ཆེན་པོ་`: great thousand; part of the description of the vastness of the world system]
- འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ : of the world [Genitive of `འཇིག་རྟེན་`: world, universe, samsara; refers to the conditioned existence]
- ཁམས་ : realm [Root form: realm, element, constituent; here refers to the world system that would be filled]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; identifies the specific world system being referenced]
- རིན་པོ་ཆེ་ : precious substances [Root form: precious, valuable, jewel; refers to valuable materials used to fill the world]
- སྣ་བདུན་ : seven kinds of [Compound of `སྣ་`: type, kind + `བདུན་`: seven; refers to the traditional seven precious substances (gold, silver, lapis lazuli, crystal, coral, pearl, and agate)]
- གྱིས་ : with [Instrumental case marker; indicates the means by which the world system is filled]
- རབ་ཏུ་ : completely [Adverbial intensifier; emphasizes the thoroughness of the filling action]
- གང་བར་ : to fill [Verbal noun from `གང་བ་`: to fill, be full; describes the action of filling the world system]
- བྱས་ཏེ་ : having done [Perfect form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do + connecting particle; links the filling action to the giving]
- སྦྱིན་པ་ : giving, generosity [Verbal noun from `སྦྱིན་པ་`: to give; refers to the act of charitable giving]
- བྱིན་ : were to give [Past tense of `སྦྱིན་པ་`: to give; the action of making the generous gift]
- ན། : if [Conditional particle; marks the hypothetical scenario and links it to the question that follows]
- རིགས་ཀྱི་ : of good family [Genitive of `རིགས་`: family, lineage, caste; refers to those of noble birth or spiritual aptitude]
- བུའམ་ : son or [Disjunctive compound of `བུ་`: son + disjunctive particle `འམ་`; refers to male spiritual practitioners]
- རིགས་ཀྱི་ : of good family [Genitive of `རིགས་`: family, lineage, caste; qualifying the daughter]
- བུ་མོ་ : daughter [Root form: daughter, girl; refers to female spiritual practitioners]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the person who performs the generous action]
- གཞི་ : basis [Root form: foundation, basis, ground; refers to the causal basis of merit generation]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the previously mentioned act of giving]
- ལས་ : from [Ablative particle; indicates the source or cause of the merit]
- བསོད་ནམས་ : merit [Root form: merit, positive karma; the spiritual benefit accruing from virtuous actions]
- མང་དུ་ : abundantly [Adverbial form of `མང་པོ་`: many, much + particle; describes the extent of merit generation]
- བསྐྱེད་དམ། : would generate? [Future/present form of `སྐྱེད་པ་`: to generate, produce + interrogative particle; asks whether merit would be produced by the generous act]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མང་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing Subhuti's statement to the Blessed One" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker, Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of speaking/saying" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་མང་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The content of what Subhuti said to the Blessed One" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The Blessed One who is being addressed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མང་ [Type: State | Desc: "The state of being many or abundant, referring to the merit" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Process scene indicating the state of the merit" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ལགས་ [Type: Process | Desc: "The verb indicating state of being" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སོ། ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Sentence-final particles indicating completion of statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [merit] [Type: Participant | Desc: "The implied merit (བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་) that is being described as abundant" | Implicit: "Implied merit (བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་) that is being described as abundant"]
        └──  [Type: State-of | Desc: "Relationship showing that the abundance quality applies to the merit" | Implicit: "Relationship between merit and its abundant quality"]
            ├── མང་ [Type: State | Desc: "The state of being many or abundant, referring to the merit" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [merit] [Type: Participant | Desc: "The implied merit (བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་) that is being described as abundant" | Implicit: "Implied merit (བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་) that is being described as abundant"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper noun; name of one of Buddha's main disciples; functions as the agent/speaker in this utterance]
- གྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates that the preceding noun is performing the action]
- གསོལ་པ། : said/spoke [Perfective form of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, speak, say; here indicating Subhuti's act of speaking to the Buddha; functions as the main process verb]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་པ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); functions as recipient of the speech]
- མང་ : many/abundant [Adjective describing quantity; in this context refers to the implied merit (བསོད་ནམས་) which is abundant; functions as a state descriptor]
- ལགས་ : is [Honorific copula verb; equating the merit with being abundant; functions as process verb in a state-of-being construction]
- སོ། ། : [Final particles; `སོ་` is a declarative sentence-final particle, and `།` is the Tibetan sentence-ending mark (shad); marks completion of statement]

ucca_formatted:
བདེ་བར་གཤེགས་པ་མང་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire statement about the Tathagatas" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བདེ་བར་གཤེགས་པ [Type: Participant-Center | Desc: "The central entity being described (Tathagatas/Sugatas)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལགས་སོ [Type: State | Desc: "Copula verb indicating state of existence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མང [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Quantifier describing the number of Tathagatas" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [It is so (एवमेतत्)] [Type: Elaborator-Implicit | Desc: "Implicit affirmation" | Implicit: "Implicit affirmation reflecting the Sanskrit confirmation 'एवमेतत्'"]
glossary:
- བདེ་བར་ : happily, well [Terminative of `བདེ་བ`: happiness, well-being; adverbial modifier describing the manner of going; indicates the peaceful, blissful state]
- གཤེགས་པ་ : gone, departed [Noun derived from verb `གཤེགས`: to go, depart; honorific term referring to enlightened beings who have "gone to bliss"; functions as the head noun in the compound "Those who have gone to bliss"]
- མང་ : many [Quantifier indicating plurality; describes the number of Tathagatas/Sugatas]
- ལགས་སོ : are, exist [Honorific copula (`ལགས`) with final particle (`སོ`); polite existential verb affirming the statement; functions as the main predicate of the sentence]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ནོ། །དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene representing the Buddha's speech to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Agent who is performing the speech act" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The speech act performed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Addressee | Desc: "The person being addressed by the Buddha in the entire discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ནོ། །དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ཏེ། [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration of the Buddha's speech confirming Subhuti's understanding" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ནོ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First confirmation statement by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The matter being confirmed in the first statement" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེ་བཞིན་ནོ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Affirmative response confirming the matter" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second confirmation statement by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The matter being confirmed in the second statement" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེ་བཞིན་ཏེ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Second affirmative response reinforcing the confirmation" | Implicit: ""]
        └──  [Type: Linker | Desc: "Linker connecting the two confirmation statements as related affirmations" | Implicit: "Connection between the two confirmation statements"]
    └── [accumulation of merit] [Type: Implicit-Center | Desc: "Implicit topic of discussion about the accumulation of merit" | Implicit: "The implicit topic of discussion about the accumulation of merit"]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [honorific title of the Buddha; compound of བཅོམ་ (conquered), ལྡན་ (possessing), and འདས་ (transcended); refers to the Buddha who has conquered defilements, possesses qualities, and transcended samsara; functions as the Agent of the speech act]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker indicating the doer of the action; attaches to བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ to indicate Buddha as the agent performing the speech act]
- བཀའ་ : speech [honorific term for 'word' or 'speech'; specifically refers to the Buddha's authoritative teachings; part of the verbal phrase]
- སྩལ་པ། : proclaimed [past tense of སྩལ་བ་: to bestow, grant, give; honorific verb indicating the Buddha's act of speaking; together with བཀའ་ forms the Process of the main scene]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name of the Buddha's disciple; one of the foremost disciples known for his understanding of emptiness; serves as the Addressee in this discourse]
- དེ་ : that [demonstrative pronoun referring to the matter previously discussed (likely about merit accumulation); functions as the Patient in the first confirmation statement]
- དེ་བཞིན་ : is thus [literally "like that"; an affirmative expression indicating agreement; functions as an Adverbial confirming the truth of the matter]
- ནོ། : indeed [final particle marking the end of a statement with emphasis; reinforces the affirmation]
- དེ་ : that [second instance of the demonstrative pronoun; again refers to the matter being discussed; functions as Patient in the second confirmation statement]
- དེ་བཞིན་ : is thus [second affirmative expression; repeats and reinforces the previous confirmation; functions as an Adverbial]
- ཏེ། : because [connective particle introducing a cause or elaboration; links this confirmation to what follows in the discourse]

ucca_formatted:
རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་དེ་གཞི་དེ་ལས་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་མང་དུ་བསྐྱེད་དོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing the generation of merit" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་དེ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent performing the action of generating merit" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བསྐྱེད་དོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of generating or producing merit" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མང་དུ [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Quantifier for how abundantly the merit is generated" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The merit accumulation that is generated" | Implicit: ""]
        └── existing conventionally but empty of inherent existence [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit elaboration indicating the merit accumulation exists conventionally but is empty of inherent existence" | Implicit: "Conventional Existence"]
    ├── གཞི་དེ་ལས [Type: Participant-Origin | Desc: "The source or basis from which the merit accumulation arises" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Sentence ending punctuation mark" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རིགས་ཀྱི་ : of the noble [Genitive particle ཀྱི་ connecting རིགས་ (noble family, lineage, class) to བུ་; indicates possessive relationship; functions as attributive modifier]

- བུའམ་ : son or [བུ་ (son, child, practitioner) + འམ་ (disjunctive particle indicating alternatives); here refers to a spiritual practitioner from a noble family; functions as part of the Agent]

- རིགས་ཀྱི་ : of the noble [Genitive particle ཀྱི་ connecting རིགས་ (noble family, lineage, class) to བུ་མོ་; repeats the attributive modifier for the second term]

- བུ་མོ་ : daughter [refers to female spiritual practitioner from a noble family; functions as alternative Agent with བུ་]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies the particular noble son or daughter being referenced; completes the Agent phrase]

- གཞི་ : basis [Root noun meaning foundation, basis, source; here refers to the fundamental source from which merit arises; functions as Origin]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies the particular basis being referenced]

- ལས་ : from [Ablative particle indicating origin or source; shows the basis as the starting point for the generation of merit]

- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ : of merit [Genitive particle ཀྱི་ connecting བསོད་ནམས་ (merit, positive karma) to ཕུང་པོ་; indicates possessive relationship; functions as attributive modifier]

- ཕུང་པོ་ : accumulation [Literally "heap" or "aggregate"; here refers to a collection or mass of merit; functions as Patient in the sentence]

- མང་དུ་ : abundantly [Adverbial form of མང་ (many, much) + དུ་ (adverbial particle); quantifies the extent of merit generation; functions as Quantity modifier]

- བསྐྱེད་དོ། : generates [Future/perfect form of སྐྱེད་པ་ (to generate, produce, cultivate) + sentence-final particle དོ་; main verb indicating the action performed by the Agent; functions as Process]

- ། : [Sentence ending punctuation mark equivalent to a period]

ཡང་རབ་འབྱོར་གལ་ཏེ་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོར་གྱུར་པ་ན། བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ཞེས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་མི་གསུང་ངོ་། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཡང་ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Discourse connector linking to previous content" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Person being addressed in the discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    └── གལ་ཏེ་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོར་གྱུར་པ་ན། བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ཞེས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་མི་གསུང་ངོ་། ། [Type: Condition-Result | Desc: "Conditional relationship between the condition and result" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གལ་ཏེ་ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conditional marker establishing the protasis" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོར་གྱུར་པ་ན [Type: Scene | Desc: "Condition scene - if merit heap truly exists inherently" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Entity undergoing the process of becoming" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོར་གྱུར་པ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of inherently becoming a heap of merit with true existence" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ཞེས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་མི་གསུང་ངོ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Result scene - the Tathagata's response to the condition" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Agent who would not speak" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མི་གསུང་ངོ་ [Type: Process | Desc: "Negated action of speaking" | Implicit: ""]
                └── [from the perspective of ultimate truth] [Type: Implicit | Desc: "Implicit philosophical context that in ultimate reality, merit heaps have no inherent existence" | Implicit: "Implicit philosophical context that in ultimate reality, merit heaps have no inherent existence"]
            ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ཞེས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The quoted speech content that would not be spoken" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ [Type: Center | Desc: "First part of what would not be spoken" | Implicit: ""]
                └── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ [Type: Center | Desc: "Second repetition of the merit heap phrase" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཞེས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Marker indicating quoted content" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཡང་ : Furthermore [adverbial particle; functions as a linker connecting this to previous discourse; introduces a new but related point]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name; vocative case; the disciple being directly addressed by Buddha]

- གལ་ཏེ་ : if [conditional marker; introduces a hypothetical situation; establishes the protasis of the conditional statement]

- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ : of merit [genitive case of `བསོད་ནམས་`: merit, positive karma; modifies "heap" to specify what kind of accumulation]

- ཕུང་པོ་ : heap [nominal; refers to an accumulation or aggregate; here referring to collections of merit; functions as Patient in the conditional clause]

- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ : of merit [genitive case of `བསོད་ནམས་`: merit, positive karma; repeated modifier]

- ཕུང་པོར་ : as heap [terminative case of `ཕུང་པོ་`: heap, aggregate; indicates transformation or designation]

- གྱུར་པ་ : became [verbal phrase from `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform; past tense; indicates the hypothetical process of becoming/existing inherently]

- ན : if, when [conditional particle; completes the protasis; marks the end of the "if" clause]

- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ : of merit [genitive case of `བསོད་ནམས་`: merit, positive karma; first instance in the quoted content]

- ཕུང་པོ་ : heap [nominal; first mention in the quoted content that would not be spoken]

- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ : of merit [genitive case of `བསོད་ནམས་`: merit, positive karma; second instance in the quoted content]

- ཕུང་པོ་ : heap [nominal; second mention in the quoted content; repetition emphasizing the concept being rejected]

- ཞེས་ : thus [quotative marker; indicates the end of the quoted speech content]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : the Tathagata [honorific term for Buddha; literally "the Thus-Gone One"; agent who performs the action of not speaking]

- མི་ : not [negation prefix; negates the following verb]

- གསུང་ངོ་ : would speak [honorific verb for "to speak"; `གསུང་` is the honorific form of `ལབ་` (to speak); `ངོ་` is the final particle indicating statement; together indicating the Buddha would not make such a pronouncement from the perspective of ultimate truth]

- ། ། : [sentence-final punctuation marks indicating the end of a complete thought]

རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Interrogative scene where Subhuti is asked for his thoughts" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The person being addressed and asked to think" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས [Type: Process | Desc: "The cognitive process of thinking" | Implicit: ""]
    └── འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the nature and content of the thinking process" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Center | Desc: "Interrogative phrase forming the core of what is being asked" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདི [Type: Ground | Desc: "Referential element pointing to the subject matter being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper noun; name of Buddha's disciple who is being directly addressed; functions as the Participant-Agent in this discourse]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; pointing to the subject matter about to be discussed; serves as Ground element providing reference context]
- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [Interrogative phrase; `ཇི་` (what/how) + `སྙམ་` (to think) + `དུ་` (complementizer particle); forms the core interrogative structure]
- སེམས : think [Present tense verb; root meaning: to think, consider, reflect; here functioning as the main Process of the scene, asking Subhuti to engage in mental reflection]

ucca_formatted:
གཟུགས་ཀྱི་སྐུ་ཡོངས་སུ་གྲུབ་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་བལྟ་བར་བྱ་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the full philosophical question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── the questioner (Buddha) [Type: Implicit Participant-Speaker | Desc: "The implicit speaker posing the philosophical question" | Implicit: "The speaker who is posing the philosophical question"]
    ├── སྙམ་མམ [Type: Function | Desc: "Interrogative marker indicating the questioning nature of the statement" | Implicit: "You"]
    ├── གཟུགས་ཀྱི་སྐུ་ཡོངས་སུ་གྲུབ་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་བལྟ་བར་བྱ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central proposition being questioned in the text" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "The one who is being viewed or experienced" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བལྟ་བར་བྱ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of viewing or perceiving" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གཟུགས་ཀྱི་སྐུ་ཡོངས་སུ་གྲུབ་པས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the means or method of viewing" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གཟུགས་ཀྱི་སྐུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The physical form or body being referenced" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཡོངས་སུ་གྲུབ་པས [Type: State | Desc: "Describes the state of completion or perfection" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Punctuation mark" | Implicit: ""]
    └── philosophical context of ultimate vs conventional truth [Type: Implicit Ground | Desc: "The implicit philosophical context about Buddha nature and form" | Implicit: "The philosophical context about Buddha nature and form"]
glossary:
- གཟུགས་ཀྱི་ : of form [Genitive of `གཟུགས་`: form, physical appearance; here refers to the physical or material form; functions as a possessor modifier of `སྐུ་`]
- སྐུ་ : body [Honorific noun for 'body'; specifically refers to the enlightened form or body of a Buddha; part of the compound "physical form-body" that is the Patient in the semantic structure]
- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely [Adverbial intensifier; modifies `གྲུབ་པས་`; indicates thoroughness or completeness]
- གྲུབ་པས་ : through perfection/completion [Instrumental of `གྲུབ་པ་`: to accomplish, complete; here indicates the means or manner "by means of the perfection/completion"; describes the state of the form-body]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་ : as the Tathagata [Terminative of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Tathagata, "Thus-Gone One", epithet of Buddha; functions as the Experiencer participant in this construction]
- བལྟ་བར་ : to view [Terminative of `བལྟ་བ་`: to look, to view; indicating the purpose "in order to view"; functions as the Process element in the semantic structure]
- བྱ་ : should do [Future form of `བྱེད་`: to do; auxiliary verb completing the construction "should be viewed"; indicates prescription]
- སྙམ་མམ : do you think? [Interrogative form of `སྙམ་`: to think; interrogative marker `-འམ་` suggests a rhetorical question; serves as the questioning function addressing an implicit audience]
- ། : [Punctuation mark signifying the end of the sentence]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing Subhuti's response to the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker who is responding" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསོལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The speech act of responding" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The content of Subhuti's response" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The Buddha being addressed in the response" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ནི [Type: Center | Desc: "The core element that is being negated in the statement" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [physical form constituting a Tathagata] [Type: Implicit | Desc: "The unstated proposition being negated regarding whether the physical form (གཟུགས་ཀྱི་སྐུ) should be regarded as a Tathagata" | Implicit: "The unstated proposition being negated regarding whether the physical form (གཟུགས་ཀྱི་སྐུ) should be regarded as a Tathagata"]
        ├── མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Adverbial-Negation | Desc: "The negation of the proposition" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [equivalent to Sanskrit 'नो हीदं भगवन्'] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Added to explain the meaning of the response in the context of Sanskrit translation 'indeed not, Blessed One'" | Implicit: "Added to explain the meaning of the response in the context of Sanskrit translation 'indeed not, Blessed One'"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhuti [Ergative case marker གྱིས་ added to རབ་འབྱོར་: the name of Buddha's disciple; marks Subhuti as the Agent/speaker in this exchange; functions as the main Participant-Agent in this scene]

- གསོལ་པ། : replied [Past tense of གསོལ་བ་: to request, say, reply; here indicates a formal response to the Buddha's question; functions as the main Process (speech act) in this scene]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of བཅོམ་: conquered + ལྡན་: possessing + འདས་: transcended; functions as the Participant-Recipient being addressed]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the previously discussed proposition about whether physical form constitutes a Tathagata; functions as the Center element being negated]

- ནི་ : indeed [Topic marker emphasizing what follows; highlights the statement being negated; part of the Center element with དེ་]

- མ་ལགས་སོ། ། : is not [Negation (མ་) of the honorific verb ལགས་: to be, with final particle སོ་; polite negation directed to the Buddha; functions as the Adverbial-Negation of the proposition]

ucca_formatted:
གཟུགས་ཀྱི་སྐུ་ཡོངས་སུ་གྲུབ་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་བལྟ་བར་མི་བགྱི་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The main scene describing how one should not perceive the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── One (the implied viewer/perceiver) [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit agent who would be doing the viewing/perceiving" | Implicit: "The implicit agent who would be doing the viewing/perceiving"]
    ├── བལྟ་བར་མི་བགྱི་ལགས་སོ [Type: Process-Negative | Desc: "The main negative process of not viewing/perceiving" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བལྟ་བར་བགྱི་ལགས་སོ [Type: Process-Core | Desc: "The core process of viewing/perceiving" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མི [Type: Function-Negation | Desc: "The negation marker that negates the process" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The Tathagata as the object being perceived" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གཟུགས་ཀྱི་སྐུ་ཡོངས་སུ་གྲུབ་པས [Type: Participant-Adverbial | Desc: "The means or causal relation by which one might incorrectly perceive the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གཟུགས་ཀྱི་སྐུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The physical form/body that is being perfected" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡོངས་སུ་གྲུབ་པས [Type: State | Desc: "The state of complete perfection" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡོངས་སུ [Type: Elaborator-Manner | Desc: "Intensifier indicating completeness" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གྲུབ་པས [Type: State-Core | Desc: "The core state of being perfected or accomplished" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Punctuation mark" | Implicit: ""]
    └── from the perspective of ultimate truth (དོན་དམ་པ) [Type: Implicit Context | Desc: "The implicit philosophical context of ultimate truth that frames this statement" | Implicit: "The implicit philosophical context of ultimate truth that frames this statement"]
glossary:
- གཟུགས་ཀྱི་: of form [Genitive case marker `ཀྱི་` connecting `གཟུགས་` (form, rūpa) to `སྐུ་` (body); indicates the physical form aspect of Buddha; functions as qualifier in the adverbial phrase]

- སྐུ་: body/embodiment [Noun: `སྐུ་` is an honorific term for body or embodiment; specifically refers to the physical manifestation or formal body of a Buddha; part of the patient element in the adverbial phrase]

- ཡོངས་སུ་: completely/thoroughly [Adverbial intensifier: indicates thoroughness or completeness; modifies `གྲུབ་པས་`; functions as an elaborator of manner]

- གྲུབ་པས་: by being perfected/accomplished [Instrumental case of `གྲུབ་པ་`: to be accomplished, perfected; indicates the means or basis; combined with previous terms forms the adverbial phrase explaining the incorrect means of perception]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་: as/to the Tathagata [Terminative case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "Thus-Gone One," epithet of Buddha; patient/object of the perception verb; functions as direct object of the viewing action]

- བལྟ་བར་: to view/perceive [Terminative form of `བལྟ་བ་`: to look at, view, perceive; forms the core verbal action being negated; indicates the process of viewing]

- མི་: not [Negation marker: negates the following verb; functions to transform the statement into a prohibition or negative statement]

- བགྱི་: do/should do [Honorific form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do; here indicates proper conduct; combines with the negation marker to form the prohibition]

- ལགས་སོ: it is so [Polite assertive marker: `ལགས་` (polite copula) + `སོ་` (final particle); indicates formal statement of fact or doctrinal truth; serves as sentence-final marker]

- །: [Punctuation: shad, marks end of sentence or clause]

        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་གཟུགས་ཀྱི་སྐུ་ཡོངས་སུ་གྲུབ་པ [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The form body being addressed or discussed" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Possessor | Desc: "The possessor of the form body" | Implicit: ""]

                ├── གཟུགས་ཀྱི་སྐུ [Type: Center | Desc: "The core concept of the form body" | Implicit: ""]

        └── ཞེས [Type: Function | Desc: "Function word indicating citation or designation" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་ཡོངས་སུ་གྲུབ་པ་མ་མཆིས་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པའི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the Buddha's teaching about the form body" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ཡོངས་སུ་གྲུབ་པ་མ་མཆིས་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The content of what was taught" | Implicit: ""]

            └── ཡོངས་སུ་གྲུབ་པ་མ་མཆིས་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial phrase modifying how the Buddha spoke about the form body" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent performing the action of teaching" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- དེ་ : That [demonstrative pronoun; refers to a previously mentioned concept; functions as a Center element in the relator phrase]
- ཅིའི་ : for what [interrogative pronoun in genitive case; from `ཅི་`: what; introduces the reason being questioned]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the purpose of [postposition indicating purpose; forms part of the question phrase]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [conditional verb; from `ཞེ་བ་`: to ask, say; functions as a Function word indicating a question is being posed]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [honorific title for the Buddha; literally "who has conquered and possesses (qualities)"; functions as Participant-Possessor of the form body]
- གཟུགས་ཀྱི་ : of form [genitive case of `གཟུགས་`: form, rūpa; indicates possession in relation to སྐུ་]
- སྐུ་ : body [honorific term for 'body'; specifically refers to the Buddha's embodiment; forms the core concept being discussed]
- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely [adverbial modifier; indicates thoroughness or completeness]
- གྲུབ་པ་ : accomplished [verbal noun from `འགྲུབ་པ་`: to accomplish, complete; functions as Elaborator describing the nature of the form body]
- ཞེས་ : thus [quotative particle; indicates citation or designation]
- བགྱི་བ་ : called [honorific verb meaning "to do, to call"; functions as the Process of naming or designating]
- ནི། : as for [topic marker; highlighting what follows]
- དེ་ : that [demonstrative pronoun; referring back to the form body mentioned earlier]
- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely [adverbial modifier; indicates thoroughness or completeness]
- གྲུབ་པ་ : accomplished [verbal noun from `འགྲུབ་པ་`: to accomplish, complete]
- མ་མཆིས་པར་ : not existing [negated verbal noun in terminative case; from honorific `མཆིས་པ་`: to exist; functions as an Adverbial phrase modifying the Buddha's speech]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [instrumental case; honorific title for the Buddha meaning "Thus-Gone One"; functions as the Participant-Agent performing the action of teaching]
- གསུངས་པའི་ : taught [past tense of honorific `གསུང་བ་`: to speak, teach; with genitive particle; functions as the Process of teaching]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the purpose of [postposition indicating purpose]
- སྟེ། : that is [connective particle; concludes the explanation]

དེས་ན་གཟུགས་ཀྱི་སྐུ་ཡོངས་སུ་གྲུབ་པ་ཞེས་བགྱིའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Discourse | Desc: "Logical connector that relates this statement to previous discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གཟུགས་ཀྱི་སྐུ་ཡོངས་སུ་གྲུབ་པ [Type: Center | Desc: "The core concept being named or referenced in the statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གཟུགས་ཀྱི་སྐུ [Type: Center | Desc: "The Buddhist technical term for the physical manifestation of a buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡོངས་སུ་གྲུབ་པ [Type: Attribute | Desc: "Qualification of the nature of the form body" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཞེས་བགྱིའོ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Quotative construction indicating designation or naming rather than a dynamic action" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [ཀུན་རྫོབ་ཏུ] [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Implicit content indicating the conventional nature of the form body's existence" | Implicit: "Clarifies that the form body exists conventionally rather than ultimately"]
glossary:
- དེས་ན་ : Therefore [Instrumental case of `དེ་` with connective particle `ན`; functions as a logical connector relating this statement to previous discourse, showing a conclusive relationship]

- གཟུགས་ཀྱི་ : of form [Genitive case of `གཟུགས་`: form, appearance, visible matter; here modifying `སྐུ་` to indicate a specific type of buddha body composed of visible form]

- སྐུ་ : body [Honorific term for body, specifically referring to a buddha's physical manifestation; technical Buddhist term for one aspect of a buddha's embodiment]

- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely [Adverbial phrase from `ཡོངས་` (all, complete) and locative particle `སུ`; intensifier indicating thoroughness or perfection]

- གྲུབ་པ་ : accomplished [Completed form of `འགྲུབ་པ་`: to accomplish, achieve, establish; here referring to the established or manifested nature of the form body]

- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative marker indicating that what precedes is being named or designated; introduces the designation or term being applied]

- བགྱིའོ : is called [Honorific future/present form of `བྱེད་པ་` (to do) with final particle `འོ`; indicates naming or designation rather than action; completes the quotative construction]

- ། : [Sentence-ending shad punctuation mark]

བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node containing the entire discourse event" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Speech act of the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker (Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The speech act" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Content of Buddha's speech (question to Subhuti)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Addressee of Buddha's question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས [Type: Process | Desc: "Mental process (thinking/considering)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི [Type: Center | Desc: "Demonstrative pointing to the content of the question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Manner | Desc: "Part of interrogative construction indicating manner of thinking" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [about viewing the Tathagata by perfect marks] [Type: Center | Desc: "Implicit content of Buddha's question as indicated in commentaries" | Implicit: "Implied content of Buddha's question based on context"]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་`: conquered, `ལྡན་`: possessing, `འདས་`: transcended; refers to one who has conquered defilements, possesses qualities, and transcended samsara; functions as Agent of speech act]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker indicating agency; marks Buddha as the speaker/agent of the utterance]

- བཀའ་ : word/speech [Honorific term for Buddha's speech; sacred utterance with authority]

- སྩལ་པ། : proclaimed [Past tense of `སྩལ་བ་`: to bestow, grant, proclaim; honorific verb indicating Buddha's act of speaking; functions as the Process in the speech act scene]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of Buddha's disciple; one of the foremost disciples known for understanding emptiness; functions as Recipient of Buddha's question]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun pointing to the content of the question; serves as Center pointing to what follows]

- ཇི་ : what/how [Interrogative particle initiating a question; forms part of the interrogative construction]

- སྙམ་ : think [Present tense of `སྙམ་པ་`: to think, consider; indicates mental activity]

- དུ་ : as/in what way [Terminative particle completing the interrogative construction with ཇི་སྙམ་]

- སེམས། : do you think? [Present tense of `སེམས་པ་`: to think, consider; functions as the main Process of the mental action Buddha is asking Subhuti to perform]

མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་བལྟ་བར་བྱ་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the question about viewing the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [You/Subhuti] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent of the thinking/questioning process (Subhuti who is being asked)" | Implicit: "The addressee (Subhuti) who is being asked the question"]
    ├── སྙམ་མམ [Type: Process | Desc: "Main process representing the questioning/wondering aspect" | Implicit: ""]
    └── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་བལྟ་བར་བྱ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Embedded scene containing the proposition being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [one/someone] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent who would do the viewing" | Implicit: "The unspecified person who would do the viewing"]
        ├── བལྟ་བར་བྱ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of viewing within the embedded scene" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object being viewed (the Tathagata)" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Means or method of viewing the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- མཚན་ : marks, signs [Noun/Root: མཚན་ - mark, sign, characteristic; here referring to the physical marks or characteristics; functions as part of the instrumental phrase]
- ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་ : through perfect/excellent [Instrumental case of ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་ - perfect, excellent, complete; indicates the means by which one would view the Tathagata; functions as an Elaborator describing the method]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་ : the Tathagata [Terminative case of དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ - Tathagata, Thus-Gone One, Buddha; the object/Patient being viewed; serves as the direct object of viewing]
- བལྟ་བར་ : to view, to see [Terminative of བལྟ་བ་ - to look at, to view; the main action being questioned; functions as the Process component]
- བྱ་ : should do [Final verb: བྱེད་པ་ - to do, make; auxiliary verb indicating obligation; combines with བལྟ་བར་ to form "should view"]
- སྙམ་མམ། : do you think? [Interrogative form of སྙམ་པ་ - to think, wonder; marks the entire preceding clause as being questioned; the main Process of the root scene indicating the questioning aspect]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire dialogue" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker (Subhuti)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The speech act" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The content of Subhuti's response" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ [Type: Addressee | Desc: "The person being addressed (Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ནི་ [Type: Center | Desc: "The focal point of the negation statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "The negation modifying the center" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [implicit: response to question] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit content indicating this is a response to Buddha's previous question" | Implicit: "This is a response to Buddha's previous question about whether one should view the Tathagata by marks"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; the name of a main disciple of Buddha who is known for his understanding of emptiness; functions as the Agent/speaker in this dialogue]

- གྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; attached to རབ་འབྱོར་, indicating that Subhuti is performing the action]

- གསོལ་པ། : replied [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, speak, reply; here indicating Subhuti's speech act of responding to the Buddha; functions as the main Process in this scene]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Bhagavan [Honorific title for Buddha; literally "Blessed One" or "Lord"; functions as the Addressee of Subhuti's speech]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; referring to a statement or proposition mentioned in the previous discourse; functions as the Center or focal point of the negation]

- ནི་ : indeed [Topic marker; emphasizing the demonstrative དེ་; helps establish the topic of the negation]

- མ་ལགས་སོ། : is not [Negation of `ལགས་`: honorific form of "to be"; the final particle སོ indicates completion of statement; this negates the previously mentioned proposition; functions as an Adverbial modifying the demonstrative]

- ། : [Sentence-ending punctuation mark]
