        ├── མཚན [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The marks or characteristics of the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས [Type: State | Desc: "The state or quality of the marks being perfect or excellent" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [because form and its characteristics lack inherent existence] [Type: Ground | Desc: "The implicit philosophical reasoning why one should not view the Tathāgata through perfect marks, related to the illusory nature of form" | Implicit: "The implicit philosophical reasoning why one should not view the Tathāgata through perfect marks, related to the illusory nature of form"]
glossary:
- མཚན་ : marks [noun: `མཚན་`: sign, mark, characteristic; here referring to the physical characteristics (lakṣaṇa) of a Buddha; functions as the Patient in the attribute phrase]
- ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་ : through perfect [instrumental of `ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་`: excellent, perfect, complete; indicates the means by which the incorrect viewing occurs; modifies 'marks' to form 'perfect marks']
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་ : as the Tathāgata [terminative case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: 'Thus-Gone One', epithet of the Buddha; the object/patient of the viewing action]
- བལྟ་བར་ : to view [future/infinitive form of `ལྟ་བ་`: to look, see, view; main verbal action of the sentence]
- མི་ : not [negative particle that negates the following verb]
- བགྱི་ : should do [honorific form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do; combined with the negative particle indicates prohibition]
- ལགས་སོ : is [polite assertive final particle; indicates definite statement with respect]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་གང་གསུངས་པ་དེ། མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་མ་མཆིས་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པའི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root of the UCCA graph representing the entire text." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Opening rhetorical question that introduces the explanation." | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན [Type: Relator | Desc: "Rhetorical question functioning as a discourse marker that introduces the explanation that follows." | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Reference to the previously stated concept or proposition." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་གང་གསུངས་པ་དེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First part of the explanation describing the Tathagata's teaching about perfect marks." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha (Tathagata) as the agent who is speaking about perfect marks." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསུངས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of the Tathagata teaching or speaking about the perfect marks." | Implicit: ""]
        └── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་གང་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The perfect marks that are being taught about by the Tathagata." | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེ [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connector between the first statement and the second statement, linking the apparent contradiction between conventional description and ultimate reality." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་མ་མཆིས་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པའི་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second part of the explanation describing the ultimate non-existence of perfect marks." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha (Tathagata) as the agent who is teaching about the ultimate non-existence of perfect marks." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསུངས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of the Tathagata teaching about the non-existence of perfect marks." | Implicit: ""]
        └── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་མ་མཆིས་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The statement that perfect marks do not ultimately exist." | Implicit: ""]
            └── དོན་དམ་པར་མ་མཆིས་པ [Type: State | Desc: "Implicit philosophical state indicating that perfect marks do not exist in ultimate reality, though they are conventionally described." | Implicit: "This is an implicit philosophical state indicating that the perfect marks have no ultimate existence"]
    └── contrast between scenes [Type: Contrastive | Desc: "Represents the philosophical contrast between scenes 2 and 3: the Tathagata speaks of perfect marks, yet these perfect marks do not ultimately exist." | Implicit: "This node represents the implicit contrastive relationship between scenes 2 and 3"]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to previously mentioned concept; functions as Patient in UCCA structure, referring to something previously explained]
- ཅིའི་ : for what [Interrogative pronoun in genitive case; from ཅི "what"; introduces the reason or purpose for something]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the sake of, for the reason of [Postposition indicating purpose or reason; extends the interrogative to form a "why" question]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional clause marker; marks a rhetorical question; functions as a discourse marker introducing an explanation]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Agentive/instrumental case of དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ "Thus-Gone One"; an epithet for the Buddha; functions as Agent in UCCA structure]
- མཚན་ : marks, characteristics [Root noun; referring to the distinctive features or qualities; part of compound with the following term]
- ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་ : perfect, excellent [Adjectival phrase; describes མཚན་ as being "perfect" or "complete"; from ཕུན་སུམ་ "excellent" + ཚོགས་པ་ "complete"]
- གང་ : which [Relative pronoun; connects the marks to the act of teaching]
- གསུངས་པ་ : taught, spoken [Past tense of གསུང་བ་ "to speak/teach"; indicates the Buddha's act of teaching; functions as Process in UCCA structure]
- དེ། : that [Demonstrative pronoun; concludes the first clause and connects to what follows; functions as connector between statements in UCCA]

- མཚན་ : marks, characteristics [Root noun; same as above; referring to the qualities or features discussed]
- ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་ : perfect, excellent [Adjectival phrase; same as above; describes the marks]
- མ་མཆིས་པར་ : do not exist [Negative + མཆིས་པ་ "to exist" + terminative particle; indicates the ultimate non-existence of the perfect marks; functions as Patient in UCCA]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Agentive/instrumental case; same as above; functions as Agent in UCCA structure]
- གསུངས་པའི་ : taught, spoken [Past tense + genitive particle; indicates the Buddha's teaching; functions as Process in UCCA]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the sake of, for the reason of [Postposition indicating purpose; explains why the Buddha taught about perfect marks]
- སྟེ། : that is to say [Connector particle; concludes the explanation; links the apparent contradiction between conventional description and ultimate reality]

ucca_formatted:
དེས་ན་མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་ཞེས་བགྱིའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the statement about perfect characteristics" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Causal connector linking to prior context" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [speaker/author] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent who is performing the naming/calling action" | Implicit: "The speaker or author who is performing the naming action"]
    ├── ཞེས་བགྱིའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "Main verb indicating the process of naming or designating" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ [Type: State | Desc: "The quoted content stating what something is called" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མཚན [Type: Center | Desc: "The main noun referring to characteristics or marks" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ [Type: State | Desc: "Descriptive state of the characteristics, indicating their perfect quality" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Sentence-final punctuation" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེས་ན་ : therefore [Causal connector; composed of `དེ་` (that) + instrumental case marker `-ས` + continuative particle `ན`; indicates a conclusion based on prior reasoning; functions as a Linker connecting this statement to previous context]

- མཚན་ : characteristics [Noun; refers to marks, signs, or characteristics; the central subject being described as perfect; functions as the Center of the quoted content]

- ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་ : perfect [Adjectival phrase; from `ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་` (abundant, excellent, perfect); describes the complete perfection or excellence of the characteristics; functions as a State describing the quality of མཚན་]

- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative particle; marks the preceding phrase as something being named or designated; connects the quoted content to the verb]

- བགྱིའོ : is called [Honorific form of verb `བྱེད་པ་` (to do, to make) in present tense + final particle `འོ`; here indicating the act of naming or designating; the main Process of the sentence performed by an implicit speaker/author]

- ། : [Sentence-final punctuation mark; indicates the end of the statement]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node representing the entire text with two parallel scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene representing the Buddha's speech act" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who performs the speaking action" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of speaking/declaring" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene representing the Buddha's question to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: State-of-mind-experiencer | Desc: "The experiencer who is being asked about his thinking/opinion" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Deictic reference to the forthcoming question/topic that Subhuti is being asked to consider" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས [Type: Process | Desc: "The cognitive process of thinking/considering" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Center | Desc: "Core rhetorical questioning construct forming the center of the question" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Bhagavān/Buddha [Honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); the one who has conquered defilements, possesses qualities, and transcended samsara; functions as Agent in the first scene]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates the Agent who performs the action]
- བཀའ་ : speech [Honorific term for speech or teachings of the Buddha; formal utterance or pronouncement]
- སྩལ་པ། : pronounced/spoke [Past tense of `སྩལ་བ་`: to give, grant, bestow (honorific); here indicates the completed action of speaking; functions as Process in the scene]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Proper name of one of Buddha's chief disciples; the addressee and experiencer in the second scene]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the forthcoming question or topic that Subhūti is being asked to consider; functions as an Elaborator in the sentence]
- ཇི་ : what/how [Interrogative particle; begins the question construction]
- སྙམ་ : think [Present tense of `སྙམ་པ་`: to think, consider; forms part of the interrogative construction]
- དུ་ : as [Terminative case marker; connects to the verb "think"]
- སེམས། : do you think? [Present tense of `སེམས་པ་`: to think, consider; forms the main verb of the question; functions as the Process in the second scene]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་ངས་ཆོས་བསྟན་ཏོ་ཞེས་དགོངས་སོ་སྙམ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་དེ་ལྟར་མི་ལྟ་སྟེ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "The root node representing the entire text, structured as a conditional statement followed by a response" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་ངས་ཆོས་བསྟན་ཏོ་ཞེས་དགོངས་སོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "A hypothetical scenario of what the Tathagata might think" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who is hypothetically thinking" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དགོངས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of thinking/considering by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདི་སྙམ་དུ་ངས་ཆོས་བསྟན་ཏོ་ཞེས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The content of the Tathagata's hypothetical thought" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ངས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The first-person agent within the Tathagata's thought" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The patient/object being taught within the Tathagata's thought" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བསྟན་ཏོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of teaching within the Tathagata's thought" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྙམ་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conditional marker linking the hypothetical scenario to its consequence" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་དེ་ལྟར་མི་ལྟ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Subhuti's response refuting the hypothetical scenario" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The addressee of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Refers to the hypothetical scenario previously described" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་ལྟར་མི་ལྟ་སྟེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The negative process of not viewing/considering the previous scenario as valid" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [Ergative/Instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "thus-gone one", an epithet for the Buddha; functions as the Agent who is hypothetically thinking in this conditional scenario]
- འདི་སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking thus [Combination of `འདི་` (this) + `སྙམ་` (to think) + terminative particle `དུ་`; introduces a quoted thought or speech; marks the beginning of Tathagata's hypothetical contemplation]
- ངས་ : I [Ergative form of `ང་`: I, me; first-person pronoun used by Tathagata within his own hypothetical thought; acts as Agent within the embedded thought]
- ཆོས་ : Dharma [Absolutive case of `ཆོས་`: teaching, doctrine, phenomena; the object/Patient being taught in the quoted thought; refers to the Buddha's teachings]
- བསྟན་ཏོ་ : have taught [Past tense of `སྟོན་པ་`: to teach, show, demonstrate + testimonial final particle `ཏོ་`; the Process within Tathagata's quoted thought; indicates completed action with certainty]
- ཞེས་ : thus, saying [Quotative particle marking the end of quoted speech or thought; connects the quote to the main verb `དགོངས་སོ་`]
- དགོངས་སོ་ : might think [Honorific form of `སེམས་པ་`: to think + final particle `སོ་`; the main Process of the conditional clause; indicates the hypothetical contemplation of the Tathagata]
- སྙམ་ན་ : if one thinks [Conditional form of `སྙམ་པ་`: to think; functions as a Linker connecting the hypothetical premise to its consequence; establishes the conditional relationship]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of the Buddha's disciple who is being addressed; functions as the Addressee in the response scene]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun referring back to the previously described hypothetical scenario; functions as Patient in the response]
- དེ་ལྟར་ : in that way [Adverbial phrase `དེ་` (that) + `ལྟར་` (like, as); modifies the negative viewing process; describes how Subhuti should not consider the proposition]
- མི་ལྟ་སྟེ། : should not view [Negated present form of `ལྟ་བ་`: to view, consider, regard + connective particle `སྟེ་`; the Process in the response scene; indicates Subhuti's correct understanding involves rejecting the hypothetical view]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གང་བསྟན་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་མེད་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Statement | Desc: "The complete philosophical statement about the emptiness of dharma" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གང་བསྟན་པའི་ཆོས་དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma (teaching) that is the subject of negation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent (Buddha) who taught" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསྟན་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས [Type: Center | Desc: "The main concept (dharma/teaching) being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Demonstrative modifying 'dharma'" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་ཡང་མེད་པའི [Type: Reason | Desc: "Philosophical reason for the statement - the non-existence of dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་ཡང [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Emphasizes the complete non-existence" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [IMPLICIT: negation relation] [Type: Negation | Desc: "Represents the negation relationship between 'nothing exists' and 'dharma taught'" | Implicit: "Represents the negation relationship"]
            └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གང་བསྟན་པའི་ཆོས་དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma (teaching) that is the subject of negation" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent (Buddha) who taught" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── བསྟན་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of teaching" | Implicit: ""]

    ├── རོ། ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Grammatical marker indicating end of statement" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [IMPLICIT: དོན་དམ་པར] [Type: Context | Desc: "Implicit contextual information about ultimate truth/reality" | Implicit: "Contextual information about ultimate truth/reality"]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Thus-Gone One, Buddha; functions as the Agent who performs the teaching; honorific term for Buddha]

- གང་ : which [Relative pronoun connecting the taught dharma; introduces relative clause]

- བསྟན་པའི་ : taught [Past tense of `སྟོན་པ་`: to teach, show, demonstrate; genitive/attributive form; Process performed by the Tathagata]

- ཆོས་ : dharma [Nominative case; refers to the Buddha's teachings or phenomena; functions as the Center or main concept being discussed and negated]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun modifying 'dharma'; Elaborator specifying the particular dharma]

- གང་ཡང་ : whatsoever, at all [Emphatic quantifier; intensifies the negation; indicates totality or completeness of non-existence]

- མེད་པའི་ : does not exist [Negation of `ཡོད་པ་`: existence; genitive/attributive form; expresses the philosophical concept of emptiness]

- ཕྱིར་ : because [Causal connector indicating reason; links the non-existence to the main statement]

- རོ། ། : [Final particle marking end of statement; indicates declarative/factual assertion]

glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Proper name: name of a disciple of the Buddha; functions as Participant-Recipient being directly addressed]
- སུ་ཞིག : whoever [Interrogative pronoun functioning as indefinite: any person; serves as Agent in the hypothetical scenario]
- འདི་སྐད་དུ : in these words [Adverbial phrase: `འདི་` (this) + `སྐད་` (speech) + `དུ` (terminative case marker); introduces the content of speech]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས : the Tathāgata [Agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ`: "Thus-Gone One", epithet of the Buddha; Agent of the teaching action]
- ཆོས : Dharma [Patient: the teaching, doctrine; object being taught in the hypothetical statement]
- བསྟན་ཏོ : taught [Past tense of `སྟོན་པ`: to teach, show; Process verb with final particle `ཏོ` marking statement completion]
- ཞེས : saying that [Quotative marker: indicates end of quoted speech; links the statement to the speaker]
- ཟེར་ན : if (someone) says [Conditional form of `ཟེར་བ`: to say, speak; establishes the conditional premise]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Proper name repeated: addressing the same disciple again; functions as Recipient in the consequent]
- དེ་ནི : that person [Demonstrative pronoun: `དེ` (that) + emphatic particle `ནི`; refers back to "whoever" from the antecedent]
- མེད་པ་ : non-existence [Nominalized form of negative existential `མེད་`: not exist; refers to nihilistic view]
- དང : and [Conjunction: connecting two related concepts]
- ལོག་པར : wrongly [Adverbial form of `ལོག་པ`: wrong, incorrect, perverted; describes incorrect understanding]
- ཟིན་པས : because of being caught by/grasping [Causal form of `ཟིན་པ`: to grasp, be caught by; indicates reason for the consequence]
- ང་ལ : to me [First person singular pronoun `ང་` + dative marker `ལ`; refers to the Buddha as Patient of slander]
- སྐུར་བར་ : slander [Terminative case of `སྐུར་བ`: to slander, falsely accuse; the negative action directed at the Buddha]
- འགྱུར་རོ : will become [Future tense of `འགྱུར་བ`: to become, transform; with final particle `རོ` marking conclusion]

            ├── ཆོས་དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma being referenced" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- དེ་ : that [demonstrative pronoun; refers to a previously mentioned statement; serves as the Patient or topic being questioned]
- ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ : for what reason [interrogative; composed of `ཅི་` (what) + genitive particle `འི་` + `ཕྱིར་` (for the sake of); introduces a question seeking explanation]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [conditional clause marker; from `ཞེས་` (quotative) + `ན་` (if); completes the question formula "if one asks why that is so"]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name; vocative form addressing the Buddha's disciple; functions as the Recipient of the teaching]
- ཆོས་ : Dharma [noun; refers to Buddha's teachings, doctrine, phenomena, or reality itself; serves as the Patient object in the teaching process]
- བསྟན་པ་ : teaching [verbal noun from `སྟོན་པ་`: to show, demonstrate, teach; refers to the process of expounding the Dharma]
- ཞེས་ : called [quotative particle; introduces a term or concept being defined]
- བྱ་བ་ : is called [verbal noun from `བྱེད་པ་`: to do, make; combined with ཞེས to form the phrase "that which is called"]
- ནི་ : as for [topic marker; highlights the subject being discussed]
- གང་ : whatever [relative pronoun; introduces a relative clause]
- ཆོས་བསྟན་པ་ : teaching of Dharma [compound noun; repeated from earlier; first instance in the relative clause]
- ཆོས་བསྟན་པ་ : teaching of Dharma [compound noun; repeated for emphasis; second instance in the relative clause]
- ཞེས་བྱ་བར་ : as what is called [quotative + verbal noun + terminative case; marks the concept that might be apprehended]
- དམིགས་པར་ : to be apprehended [verbal noun from `དམིགས་པ་`: to perceive, apprehend + terminative case; describes the mental process of conceptualization]
- འགྱུར་བའི་ : would become [future/potential form of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform + genitive particle; indicates potential objectification]
- ཆོས་ : Dharma [noun; third instance, referring to any phenomenon or teaching]
- དེ་ : that [demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the hypothetical dharma mentioned]
- གང་ཡང་ : whatsoever [relative pronoun + emphatic particle; emphasizes the totality of the negation]
- མེད་པའི་ : does not exist [negative existential verb `མེད་པ་` + genitive particle; central philosophical point about emptiness]
- ཕྱིར་རོ། : because [causal connective + final particle; concludes the explanation and shows that this is the answer to the initial question]

དེ་ནས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of Subhūti addressing the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ནས [Type: Time-Adverbial | Desc: "Temporal adverbial indicating sequence in discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The Buddha as recipient of the address" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Venerable Subhūti with full honorific title as the agent of speech" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་སྐད་ཅེས [Type: Center-State | Desc: "Content of what was said, not a patient being acted upon" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསོལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of respectfully addressing or speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    └── for dispelling doubts [Type: Discourse-Purpose | Desc: "Implicit purpose of Subhūti's speech in continuing teachings on emptiness" | Implicit: "Implicit purpose of Subhūti's speech in continuing teachings on emptiness"]
glossary:
- དེ་ནས་ : Then [Temporal adverbial; composed of དེ་ (that) + ནས་ (from/after); indicates sequence in the narrative; functions as a temporal marker connecting previous discourse to what follows]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ་ : to the Blessed One [Allative/Dative case (-ལ་) of བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་: epithet of the Buddha literally meaning "the Transcendent Destroyer"; recipient of the address in this context; the one being spoken to]

- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : the Venerable [Honorific title; literally "possessor of life" (ཚེ་: life + དང་: and + ལྡན་པ་: possessing); formal address for monks as respected elders; part of the speaker's description]

- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhūti [Ergative case (-གྱིས་) of རབ་འབྱོར་; name of prominent disciple known for his understanding of emptiness; functions as the agent/speaker performing the action of addressing]

- འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་ : thus, as follows [འདི་: this + སྐད་: speech/words + ཅེས་: quotative marker; introduces direct speech; indicates the content that follows is what was actually spoken]

- གསོལ་ཏོ། ། : respectfully addressed [Past tense of གསོལ་བ་: to request, beseech, address respectfully; final verb with sentence-final particle (-ཏོ); indicates speaking to someone of higher status; the specific speech act itself]

            ├── འདི་ལྟ་བུའི་ཆོས་བཤད་པ་འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The teachings that are heard by the sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]

    ├── མངོན་པར་ཡིད་ཆེས་པར་འགྱུར་བ་འབྱུང་བ་ལྟ་མཆིས་ལགས་སམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the potential development of faith by sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འགྱུར་བ་འབྱུང་བ་ལྟ་མཆིས [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of becoming/developing faith" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མངོན་པར་ཡིད་ཆེས་པར [Type: State | Desc: "The state of having manifest faith that sentient beings might develop" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལགས་སམ [Type: Interrogative | Desc: "Question marker indicating this passage is a question" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [implicit sentient beings] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit sentient beings who will develop faith" | Implicit: "The implicit sentient beings who will develop faith"]
    └── [implicit questioner] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit agent (Subhuti) who is asking the question" | Implicit: "The implicit agent (Subhuti) who is asking the question"]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific vocative form addressing the Buddha; functions as the direct Addressee of the question]
- མ་འོངས་པའི་ : future [Genitive form of `མ་འོངས་པ་`: that which has not yet come; establishes temporal setting for the question; functions as a Time modifier]
- དུས་ན། : in time [Locative of `དུས་`: time, period; indicates when the described scenario might occur; completes the temporal setting phrase]
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Nominative of `སེམས་ཅན་`: those possessing mind/consciousness; the beings who will potentially hear the teachings and develop faith; functions as the main Agent]
- གང་དག : whoever, whichever [Relative pronoun qualifying `སེམས་ཅན་`; specifies an unspecified group of sentient beings; functions as a qualifier of the Agent]
- འདི་ལྟ་བུའི་ : such as this [Genitive form combining `འདི་` (this) + `ལྟ་བུ་` (like); modifies `ཆོས་`; qualifies the type of teaching being referenced]
- ཆོས་ : dharma [Nominative of `ཆོས་`: teaching, doctrine, phenomenon; the Buddhist teachings being discussed; functions as the Patient in the hearing action]
- བཤད་པ་ : explained [Nominalized form of `བཤད་`: to explain, expound; qualifies the dharma as something that has been explained; part of the compound object]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies the particular teaching being discussed; functions as a determiner]
- ཐོས་ནས། : having heard [Converb form of `ཐོས་`: to hear + terminative particle `ནས་`; indicates the sequential action that precedes faith development; functions as the Process in the first scene]
- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly [Adverbial form of `མངོན་པ་`: evident, manifest; modifies how the faith appears; emphasizes the clear, evident nature of the faith]
- ཡིད་ཆེས་པར་ : to have faith [Terminative form of `ཡིད་ཆེས་པ་`: to believe, have conviction; the mental state that might develop; functions as the State in the second scene]
- འགྱུར་བ་ : becoming [Nominalized form of `འགྱུར་`: to change, transform; indicates the process of transformation into a state of faith]
- འབྱུང་བ་ : arising [Nominalized form of `འབྱུང་`: to arise, occur; indicates the emergence of the transformation; combines with `འགྱུར་བ་` to express the complete process]
- ལྟ་ : like, as if [Comparative particle; suggests the hypothetical nature of the question]
- མཆིས་ : exist [Honorific form of `ཡོད་`: to have, exist; part of the question formation]
- ལགས་སམ། : is it so? [Interrogative honorific copula (`ལགས་`) + question particle (`སམ་`); marks this as a respectful question addressed to the Buddha; functions as the Interrogative marker]

བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་དག་ནི་སེམས་ཅན་ཡང་མ་ཡིན། སེམས་ཅན་མེད་པ་ཡང་མ་ཡིན་ནོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire passage" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Speech act of the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the speaker" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "Speech process" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Addressee | Desc: "The person being addressed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་དག་ནི་སེམས་ཅན་ཡང་མ་ཡིན། སེམས་ཅན་མེད་པ་ཡང་མ་ཡིན་ནོ། ། [Type: State | Desc: "Philosophical assertion about the nature of beings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ [Type: Determiner | Desc: "Demonstrative referring to beings mentioned earlier" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་ཡང་མ་ཡིན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First negation about beings' ultimate nature" | Implicit: "from ultimate perspective"]
            ├── མ་ཡིན [Type: State | Desc: "Negation referring to ultimate truth perspective" | Implicit: "ultimate truth"]
            └── སེམས་ཅན [Type: Center | Desc: "Core concept being negated in the first part" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཡང [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial particle indicating parallel negation structure" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་མེད་པ་ཡང་མ་ཡིན་ནོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second negation about beings' conventional existence" | Implicit: "from conventional perspective"]
            ├── མ་ཡིན་ནོ [Type: State | Desc: "Negation referring to conventional truth perspective" | Implicit: "conventional truth"]
            ├── སེམས་ཅན་མེད་པ [Type: Center | Desc: "Core concept being negated in the second part" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཡང [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial particle in the second negation" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དག [Type: Topic | Desc: "Plural marker indicating multiple beings" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Bhagavān [Epithet for the Buddha; literally "the Blessed One" or "the Transcendent and Victorious One"; functions as the Agent/Speaker in this discourse]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker indicating the agent of the action; marks the Buddha as the one who performed the speech act]
- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། : proclaimed [Honorific verb for "to speak"; past tense of `སྩལ་བ་`: to bestow, give, grant; indicates the Buddha's authoritative speech; functions as the main Process in the first scene]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Name of the Buddha's disciple; functions as the Addressee of the Buddha's teaching; a major interlocutor in Prajñāpāramitā literature]
- དེ་ : those [Demonstrative pronoun referring to beings or phenomena mentioned earlier in the discourse; functions as a Determiner indicating the topic of discussion]
- དག་ : plural marker [Grammatical particle indicating plurality; modifies "those" to clearly indicate multiple entities are being discussed]
- ནི་ : as for [Topic marker that highlights what follows as the main subject of discussion; sets up the philosophical statement]
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Compound of `སེམས་`: mind and `ཅན་`: possessor; refers to living beings with consciousness; functions as the Center concept in the first negation]
- ཡང་ : also, even [Adverbial particle indicating parallel structure between negations; connects the two philosophical statements]
- མ་ཡིན། : are not [Negation marker with copula; literally "not are"; negates the existence of sentient beings from an ultimate perspective]
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Same term repeated for the second negation; represents the subject of the second philosophical statement]
- མེད་པ་ : non-existent [Negation of existence; from `མེད་`: do not exist; forms part of the Center concept in the second negation referring to the conventional perspective]
- ཡང་ : also, even [Adverbial particle repeating the parallel structure; signals the second part of the philosophical statement]
- མ་ཡིན་ནོ། : are not [Negation marker with final particle `-ནོ་` indicating the end of a statement; negates the non-existence of sentient beings from a conventional perspective]

དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནི། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་དེ་དག་སེམས་ཅན་མེད་པར་གསུངས་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing all elements of the passage" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question scene asking for the reason" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Center | Desc: "Reference point or subject of the question about reason/cause" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of asking why" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནི། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene introducing the concept of sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Addressee of the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Term being introduced" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནི [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relational marker introducing the term or concept" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་དེ་དག་སེམས་ཅན་མེད་པར་གསུངས་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing Buddha's teaching about sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Agent who performs the teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་དག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Reference to the sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་མེད་པར [Type: State | Desc: "State of non-existence of sentient beings in ultimate truth" | Implicit: ""]
            └── (དོན་དམ་པར) [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit content indicating this non-existence refers specifically to ultimate truth, while conventional existence is implied" | Implicit: "This implicit content indicates that the non-existence refers specifically to ultimate truth, while conventional existence is implied"]
        ├── གསུངས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of the Buddha teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཕྱིར་ཏེ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relator indicating the reason or cause" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; serves as referential subject of the question about reason; points to previous statement]
- ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ : for what reason [Interrogative + purposive case; `ཅི་` (what) + purposive case marker `ཕྱིར་`; forming interrogative expression]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Quotative verb `ཞེ་` + conditional particle `ན`; marks rhetorical question; functions as process of asking]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; vocative case; addressee of Buddha's teaching; functions as recipient participant]
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Compound noun; `སེམས་` (mind) + `ཅན་` (possessing); beings with consciousness; the term being defined]
- རྣམས་ : plural [Plural marker; indicates multiple sentient beings]
- ཞེས་ : called, termed [Quotative particle; introduces a term or concept being discussed]
- བྱ་བ་ : to be called [Verbal noun from `བྱེད་` (to do); forms quotative construction with `ཞེས་`]
- ནི། : as for [Topic marker; highlights the preceding term as the topic under discussion]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [Agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`; literally "Thus-Gone One", epithet of Buddha; functions as agent of teaching]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative + plural marker; refers back to the sentient beings mentioned; functions as patient]
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Compound noun; `སེམས་` (mind) + `ཅན་` (possessing); repeated for emphasis in negation]
- མེད་པར་ : as non-existent [Negative existential verb `མེད་` + terminative case; indicates state of ultimate non-existence while implying conventional existence]
- གསུངས་པའི་ : taught [Genitive of past form of honorific verb `གསུང་` (to speak); indicates Buddha's authoritative teaching]
- ཕྱིར་ : because [Purposive/causal marker; indicates reason or cause]
- ཏེ། : that is [Connective particle; links this explanation to the preceding question]

དེ་བས་ན་སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་ཞེས་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the complete sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connects this statement to previous context" | Implicit: ""]

    ├── སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་ཞེས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates what the implicit subjects are called" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [they] [Type: Participant | Desc: "Implicit subject of the verb 'are called'" | Implicit: "Implicit subject of the verb 'are called'"]
    └── [conventionally] [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Implicit adverbial indicating the conventional context as mentioned in the commentary 'ཀུན་རྫོབ་ཏུ'" | Implicit: "Implicit adverbial indicating the conventional context as mentioned in the commentary 'ཀུན་རྫོབ་ཏུ'"]
glossary:
- དེ་བས་ན། : Therefore [Connective adverb; from `དེ་` (that) + `བས་` (comparative marker) + `ན་` (conditional particle); 'because of that'; functions as a Linker that connects this statement to previous context]
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Compound noun; from `སེམས་` (mind) + `ཅན་` (possessing); beings possessing consciousness; functions as part of the Elaborator phrase that describes what the implicit subjects are called]
- རྣམས་ : plural marker [Plural suffix; indicates multiple sentient beings; functions as part of the Elaborator phrase]
- ཞེས་ : thus, so-called [Quotative particle; marks the preceding term as being named or designated; part of the Elaborator phrase indicating how the implicit subjects are labeled]
- བྱའོ། : are called [Final verb; from `བྱ་` (to do, call) + `འོ་` (sentence-final particle); indicates the process of naming or designating; functions as the main Process in the sentence with an implicit subject]

རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire question in a philosophical dialogue context" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The person being addressed (Subhuti)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial modifier indicating 'about this' or 'in this manner'" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Interrogative modifier that establishes the questioning nature of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of thinking/contemplating" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [Buddha] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit speaker (Buddha) who is asking the question" | Implicit: "བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; the disciple of Buddha being directly addressed; functions as the Recipient of the communication in this philosophical dialogue]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; pointing to the topic about to be discussed; serves as an Adverbial modifier indicating the subject matter of contemplation]
- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [Interrogative phrase; `ཇི་` (what) + `སྙམ་` (to think) + `དུ་` (adverbial particle); establishes the questioning nature of the statement; signals the beginning of philosophical inquiry]
- སེམས་ : do you think [Present tense verb; root `སེམས་`: to think, contemplate, consider; main Process of the sentence; directed from the implicit speaker (Buddha) to the explicit recipient (Subhuti)]

དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གང་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་ཡོད་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The root node representing the entire questioning statement made by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Subhuti] [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The implied recipient of the question (Subhuti)" | Implicit: "The implied recipient of the question (Subhuti)"]
    ├── སྙམ་ [Type: Linker | Desc: "The linking interrogative element connecting the question to the recipient" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མམ [Type: Function | Desc: "The questioning particle indicating interrogative nature, not a true process" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་དེ་གང་ཡང་ཡོད་ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central philosophical concept being questioned - whether there is any dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གང་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration describing the dharma that the Tathagata supposedly found in enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of awakening or complete enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The goal of the Buddha's awakening - enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Qualities that describe the nature of the enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས : the Tathagata [Ergative of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ`: lit. "thus-gone one"; honorific title for the Buddha; functioning as the Agent who is the subject of the question]
- གང་ : any [Interrogative pronoun; here used to introduce a relative clause, "that which"; functions as a connector in the elaboration of dharma]
- བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ : unsurpassable [Compound of `བླ་ན`: above + `མེད་པ`: without; describing the quality of enlightenment as having nothing superior to it]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfect [Adverbial form of `ཡང་དག་པ`: correct, authentic, genuine; describing the quality of enlightenment as being authentic and genuine]
- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive of `རྫོགས་པ`: to complete, perfect; describing the quality of enlightenment as being fully complete; connects the qualities to enlightenment]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་ : into enlightenment [Terminative case of `བྱང་ཆུབ`: bodhi, awakening; indicating the goal toward which the Buddha's process was directed]
- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly [Adverbial form of `མངོན་པ`: manifest, evident; describes how the Buddha's enlightenment was actualized]
- རྫོགས་པར་ : completely [Adverbial form of `རྫོགས་པ`: to complete, perfect; indicates the thoroughness of the Buddha's awakening]
- སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ : awakened [Genitive of `སངས་རྒྱས་པ`: to become a Buddha, to awaken; refers to the process of attaining Buddhahood]
- ཆོས་ : dharma [Nominative form; refers to teaching, phenomenon, truth; the object that is being questioned]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies the particular dharma being referred to]
- གང་ཡང་ : any whatsoever [Intensified form of the interrogative `གང`; emphasizes the comprehensive nature of the question - "any at all"]
- ཡོད་ : exists [Present tense of `ཡོད་པ`: to exist, to be; the central point of the philosophical question]
- སྙམ་ : think [Verb indicating mental action; links the question to the implied recipient]
- མམ། : or not? [Interrogative particle; transforms the statement into a question]

glossary:
- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : The Venerable [Honorific title; compound of `ཚེ་` (life) + `དང་` (and) + `ལྡན་པ་` (possessing); formal address for respected monastics; functions as part of the Agent/Speaker identification]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; one of Buddha's chief disciples known for his understanding of emptiness; the main speaker in this passage]

- གྱིས་ : by [Ergative case marker; indicates Subhuti as the agent/performer of the action of speaking]

- གསོལ་པ། : replied [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, say, speak; formal speech directed to someone of higher status; main Process/verb of the first scene]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered) + `ལྡན་` (possessing) + `འདས་` (transcended); functions as the Recipient of Subhuti's speech]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "Thus-Gone One", epithet of Buddha; indicates the agent of the enlightenment process]

- གང་ : which [Relative pronoun; refers to the dharma that was supposedly realized at enlightenment; connects the attainment to what follows]

- བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ : unsurpassable [Compound of `བླ་ན་` (beyond/above) + `མེད་པ་` (without); qualifying the nature of enlightenment as having nothing superior to it]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfect [Adverbial compound meaning "truly/correctly/perfectly"; further qualification of the enlightenment]

- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive of `རྫོགས་པ་`: complete/perfect; modifies enlightenment as being fully realized]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Sanskrit bodhi; the awakened state that is the goal of Buddhist practice; functions as the Goal that was attained]

- ཏུ་ : as, into [Terminative case marker; indicates transformation or result]

- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly [Adverbial form meaning "visibly/clearly"; describes the mode of Buddha's awakening]

- རྫོགས་པར་ : completely [Adverbial form of `རྫོགས་པ་`: complete/perfect; intensifies the completeness of the awakening]

- སངས་རྒྱས་པའི་ : awakened to [Genitive of `སངས་རྒྱས་པ་`: to become a Buddha/to awaken; describes the process of enlightenment]

- ཆོས་ : dharma [Sanskrit dharma; refers to teaching, phenomenon, or reality; the supposed object that was realized]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the previously mentioned dharma]

- གང་ཡང་ : whatsoever [Emphatic construction; intensifies the negation to mean "nothing at all"]

- མ་མཆིས་ : does not exist [Negated honorific form of `ཡོད་པ་`: to exist; the main process/verb of the statement, indicating non-existence]

- ལགས་སོ། ། : it is [Honorific sentence-final particle indicating respectful affirmation; completes Subhuti's statement]

glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : The Blessed One [honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to one who has conquered delusions, possesses qualities, and transcended suffering; functions as the Agent/speaker in this scene]
  
- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker; indicates the doer of the action; connects the Buddha as the agent to the speech act]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། : spoke [honorific verb for 'to speak'; `བཀའ་` (speech/word) + `སྩལ་པ་` (to give); indicates the formal, authoritative nature of the Buddha's speech; functions as the main Process in this scene]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name of the Buddha's disciple; literally "well-developed" or "excellent development"; functions as the Recipient of the Buddha's speech]

- དེ་ : that [demonstrative pronoun; refers to Subhuti's previous statement or understanding; functions as the Patient in the Buddha's confirmation]

- དེ་བཞིན་ : just so [adverbial expression; `དེ་` (that) + `བཞིན་` (like/manner); indicates complete agreement or concurrence with what was previously stated; functions as an Adverbial modifier]

- ནོ། : is [assertive particle; marks the end of a statement with emphasis; confirms the truth of the preceding statement]

- དེ་ : that [demonstrative pronoun; refers again to Subhuti's previous statement; functions as Patient in the second confirmation]

- དེ་བཞིན་ : just so [adverbial expression; `དེ་` (that) + `བཞིན་` (like/manner); reiterates complete agreement; functions as an Adverbial modifier]

- ཏེ། : indeed [conjunction particle; indicates continuation of thought with emphasis; reinforces the Buddha's agreement with Subhuti's understanding]

    ├── དེ་ལ [Type: Context | Desc: "Establishes the philosophical context in which the statement is made" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་ཅུང་ཟད་ཀྱང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The entity (dharma) that is being negated" | Implicit: ""]

    └── ཤིང [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connects the two related negative assertions about dharmas" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ལ་ : in that regard [Locative case marker ལ་ added to དེ་ (that); functions as a contextual marker establishing the philosophical framework for the statement; serves as a Scene Context in the semantic structure]

- ཆོས་ : phenomena [Root noun: ཆོས་ (dharma); refers to phenomena, elements of existence, or mental objects being discussed; functions as the primary Patient (the entity being negated) in the sentence]

- ཅུང་ཟད་ : even slightly [Adverbial phrase: ཅུང་ཟད་ (a little, slightly); functions as an emphatic qualifier strengthening the scope of negation]

- ཀྱང་ : even/also [Emphatic particle: ཀྱང་ (even, also, too); adds emphasis to the negation, implying "not even the slightest phenomena"; completes the emphatic qualification]

- མི་ : not [Negative prefix: མི་; negates the following verb དམིགས་; part of the State expression indicating non-existence]

- དམིགས་ : observed [Verb: དམིགས་པ་ (to observe, perceive, apprehend); in philosophical context refers to mental apprehension of objects; first part of the compound negation]

- ཤིང་ : and [Connective particle: ཤིང་ (and, moreover); connects two related negative assertions about phenomena; functions as a Connector in the semantic structure]

- མེད་ : do not exist [Negative existential verb: མེད་པ་ (to not exist); second part of the compound negation asserting non-existence]

- དེ། : [Final particle marking the end of a statement; indicates a complete thought has been expressed]

        ├── ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial modifier indicating the complete realization nature of enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- དེས་ན་ : Therefore [Connective particle: `དེ` (that) + instrumental case particle + connective particle `ན`; functions as a logical linker concluding from previous discussion; serves as a Linker connecting this statement to preceding context]

- བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ : unsurpassed [Negated noun phrase: `བླ་ན` (above, beyond) + negation `མེད་པ` (without); literally "without anything above it"; describes the supreme quality of enlightenment; functions as an Adverbial modifier]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [Adverbial form: `ཡང་དག་པ` (perfect, genuine, true) + terminative particle `ར`; indicates the authentic and complete nature; functions as an Adverbial modifier]

- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive of `རྫོགས་པ` (to complete, perfect, fulfill); describes the fully realized nature; functions as an Adverbial modifier in relation to enlightenment]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Noun: Sanskrit equivalent bodhi; the awakened state of a Buddha; the core concept being defined; functions as the Center of the nominal phrase]

- ཅེས་ : thus [Quotative marker: introduces the preceding phrase as a designation; links the designation to the verb]

- བྱའོ : is called [Verb: future/present stem of `བྱེད་པ` (to do, make) used as "to call, designate" + final particle `འོ`; indicates the act of naming or designating by an implicit agent (Buddha); functions as the Process in the sentence]

- ། ། : [End of sentence marker: indicates completion of the thought]

    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Addressee | Desc: "Person being directly addressed" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma or phenomenon being described" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ནི [Type: Function | Desc: "Tibetan emphasis particle highlighting what comes before it" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མཉམ་པ་སྟེ [Type: Attribute | Desc: "The inherent quality of equality/sameness attributed to the dharma" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [there is nothing unequal in it] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit elaboration on the equality" | Implicit: "Implicit content elaborating that there is nothing unequal in that dharma"]
    └── དེ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Demonstrative referring to the specific dharma being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཡང་ : furthermore [Continuative particle; connects this statement to previous discourse; serves as a Linker in the semantic structure]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; vocative case - addressing the Buddha's disciple directly; functions as the Addressee in this discourse]
- ཆོས་ : dharma [Noun; refers to phenomena, teachings, or reality itself; here functioning as the Patient/topic under discussion]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies which dharma is being discussed; elaborates on the main topic]
- ནི་ : is [Topic marker; emphasizes what precedes it; functions to highlight the dharma as the central topic]
- མཉམ་པ་ : equal [Adjective from `མཉམ་པ་`: equal, same, uniform; describes the inherent quality of equality in the dharma]
- སྟེ། : indeed [Final particle; indicates that an explanation or elaboration follows; connects this statement to an implicit explanation that there is nothing unequal in this dharma]

དེ་ལ་མི་མཉམ་པ་དང་མཉམ་པ་གང་ཡང་མེད་པས། དེས་ན་བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཅེས་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ལ་མི་མཉམ་པ་དང་མཉམ་པ་གང་ཡང་མེད་པས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing the absence of inequality and equality" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ལ [Type: Context | Desc: "Conceptual context setting up the topic of non-duality" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མི་མཉམ་པ་དང་མཉམ་པ་གང་ཡང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The concepts being negated" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མི་མཉམ་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The concept of inequality" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction linking inequality and equality" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མཉམ་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The concept of equality" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གང་ཡང [Type: Quantifier | Desc: "Quantifier indicating absence of any form of inequality or equality" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མེད་པས [Type: Process-Negation | Desc: "Negation of existence of inequality and equality in ultimate reality" | Implicit: ""]
        └── པས [Type: Function | Desc: "Causal connective" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connective linking the premises to conclusion" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཅེས་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Conclusion naming the enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [all phenomena] [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implicit subject (all phenomena) being designated as unsurpassed perfect enlightenment" | Implicit: "ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད"]
        ├── ཅེས་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of naming or designating" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The name or designation being applied" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བླ་ན་མེད་པ [Type: Attribute | Desc: "Attribute describing enlightenment as having nothing above it" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborator describing the perfection and completeness of enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བྱང་ཆུབ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept being elaborated on" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ལ་ : in that [Locative/Dative of `དེ་`: that; in that (ultimate reality or state); functions as a conceptual context setting up the topic of non-duality]
- མི་མཉམ་པ་ : inequality [Negative prefix `མི་` + `མཉམ་པ་`: equal, same; the concept of inequality or differentiation being negated; functions as part of the patient argument]
- དང་ : and [Conjunction linking inequality and equality; coordinative conjunction joining contrasting concepts]
- མཉམ་པ་ : equality [From `མཉམ་པ་`: equal, same; the concept of equality or sameness being negated; functions as part of the patient argument]
- གང་ཡང་ : any whatsoever [Combination of `གང་`: what/which + intensifier `ཡང་`: also/even; functions as quantifier emphasizing the total absence of both concepts]
- མེད་པས། : do not exist; therefore [Negative existential verb `མེད་པ་` + causal connective `པས`; negating the existence of inequality and equality in ultimate reality, while simultaneously indicating causality]
- དེས་ན་ : therefore [Causal connector formed from `དེས`: by that + `ན`: if/when; functions as a linker connecting the premises to the conclusion]
- བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ : unsurpassed [Literally "without above"; `བླ་ན`: above + negative existential `མེད་པ`: without; attribute describing enlightenment as having nothing superior to it]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfect, authentic [Adverbial form of `ཡང་དག་པ`: correct, authentic, perfect; describes the complete authenticity of enlightenment]
- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive/attributive form of `རྫོགས་པ`: complete, perfect, fulfilled; elaborates on the completeness of enlightenment]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Sanskrit: bodhi; the central concept being described; the state of awakening or perfect knowledge]
- ཅེས་ : thus, as [Quotative particle introducing a designation or name; connects the term to the act of naming]
- བྱའོ། ། : it is called [From verb `བྱེད་པ`: to do, make, call + final particle `འོ`; indicates the process of naming or designating]

ucca_formatted:
བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་དེ་ནི་བདག་མེད་པ་དང༌། སེམས་ཅན་མེད་པ་དང༌། སྲོག་མེད་པ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་མེད་པར་མཉམ་པ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire statement about enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The subject of the sentence, which is enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ [Type: Center | Desc: "The core concept of enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Qualifies the nature of enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མཉམ་པ་སྟེ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relational element connecting enlightenment with the four negations" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བདག་མེད་པ་དང༌། སེམས་ཅན་མེད་པ་དང༌། སྲོག་མེད་པ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་མེད་པར [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "The four aspects of emptiness that characterize enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདག་མེད་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The first aspect of emptiness" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བདག་མེད་པ [Type: Process-Attribute | Desc: "The empty nature of self that characterizes enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector between the first and second negations" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་མེད་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The second aspect of emptiness" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སེམས་ཅན་མེད་པ [Type: Process-Attribute | Desc: "The empty nature of sentient beings that characterizes enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector between the second and third negations" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྲོག་མེད་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The third aspect of emptiness" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྲོག་མེད་པ [Type: Process-Attribute | Desc: "The empty nature of life that characterizes enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector between the third and fourth negations" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་ཟག་མེད་པར [Type: Scene | Desc: "The fourth aspect of emptiness" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གང་ཟག་མེད་པར [Type: Process-Attribute | Desc: "The empty nature of personhood that characterizes enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ultimate reality [Type: Implicit Participant-Ultimate Reality | Desc: "The implicit ultimate nature of reality beyond conceptual constructs" | Implicit: "Refers to the ultimate nature of reality beyond conceptual constructs"]
glossary:
- བླ་ན་མེད་པ་ : unsurpassed [Compound term: `བླ་ན` (above, beyond) + `མེད་པ` (non-existence); means without anything superior or higher; functions as an attributive modifier describing the supreme quality of enlightenment]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfect, authentic [Adverbial phrase from `ཡང་དག་པ་` (perfect, genuine, authentic) + `-ར་` (terminative case marker); indicates the pure, complete, and genuine nature of enlightenment; functions as an adverbial modifier]

- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive form of `རྫོགས་པ་` (complete, perfect, fulfill); indicates the fully realized or consummated state; functions as an attributive modifier connected to བྱང་ཆུབ]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Buddhist technical term (Sanskrit: bodhi); the awakened state of buddhahood; functions as the core concept and main subject of the sentence]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun indicating the specific enlightenment being discussed; functions as a determiner specifying the enlightenment]

- ནི་ : indeed [Topic marker emphasizing the subject `བྱང་ཆུབ་`; indicates that what follows is a statement about the previously mentioned enlightenment]

- བདག་མེད་པ་ : selflessness [Compound term: `བདག་` (self) + `མེད་པ་` (non-existence); the absence of an inherent self; first of four parallel attributes describing enlightenment]

- དང༌ : and [Conjunction connecting the parallel attributes in the sequence; serves as a linker between the different aspects of emptiness]

- སེམས་ཅན་མེད་པ་ : absence of sentient beings [Compound term: `སེམས་ཅན་` (sentient being) + `མེད་པ་` (non-existence); the empty nature of sentient beings; second of four parallel attributes]

- དང༌ : and [Conjunction connecting the parallel attributes in the sequence; serves as a linker between the different aspects of emptiness]

- སྲོག་མེད་པ་ : absence of life-force [Compound term: `སྲོག་` (life, life-force) + `མེད་པ་` (non-existence); the empty nature of the life principle; third of four parallel attributes]

- དང༌ : and [Conjunction connecting the parallel attributes in the sequence; serves as a linker between the different aspects of emptiness]

- གང་ཟག་མེད་པར་ : in the absence of personhood [Compound term: `གང་ཟག་` (person, individual) + `མེད་པར་` (terminative case of non-existence); indicates the absence of inherent personhood; fourth of four parallel attributes]

- མཉམ་པ་ : equality, sameness [Noun meaning equal, same, uniform; indicates that the four aspects of emptiness are unified or equivalent aspects of enlightenment; functions as a relational element]

- སྟེ། : that is [Connective particle indicating an explanation follows or concludes; marks the end of this philosophical statement while implying more elaboration is to come]

[Ultimate Reality (emptiness)] [Type: Center | Desc: "The ultimate reality in which, while conventionally virtuous dharmas lead to enlightenment, ultimately there is no inherently existing dharma" | Implicit: "The ultimate reality in which, while conventionally virtuous dharmas lead to enlightenment, ultimately there is no inherently existing dharma"]
    └── དགེ་བའི་ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་ཀྱིས་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of the enlightenment process" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [Buddha/Tathagata] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha/Tathagata who attains enlightenment" | Implicit: "The Buddha/Tathagata who attains enlightenment"]
        ├── མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of attaining complete enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དགེ་བའི་ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Instrument | Desc: "The means through which enlightenment is attained" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept of dharmas or phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དགེ་བའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Describes the dharmas as virtuous" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཐམས་ཅད་ཀྱིས [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Quantifies that all dharmas are involved with instrumental case marker" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དགེ་བའི་ : virtuous [Genitive of `དགེ་བ་`: virtue, wholesome, positive; functioning as an adjectival modifier to ཆོས་, describing the nature of the dharmas that lead to enlightenment]

- ཆོས་ : dharmas [Root noun: phenomena, teachings, qualities; here referring to wholesome qualities or practices that serve as means toward enlightenment; serves as central concept in the instrumental phrase]

- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Quantifier; modifies ཆོས་ to indicate the totality of virtuous dharmas without exception; part of the instrumental phrase]

- ཀྱིས་ : by means of [Instrumental case marker; indicates that the virtuous dharmas function as the instrument or means through which enlightenment is attained]

- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly [Adverbial modifier from `མངོན་པ་`: manifest, evident; indicates the complete and evident nature of the enlightenment process]

- རྫོགས་པར་ : completely [Adverbial modifier from `རྫོགས་པ་`: complete, perfect; qualifies the enlightenment as being perfect and complete in every aspect]

- སངས་རྒྱས་ : became enlightened [Verb from `སངས་རྒྱས་`: to become awakened/enlightened; indicates the process of attaining Buddhahood; functioning as the main predicate of the sentence]

- སོ : [Final particle marking statement/declaration; indicates completion of the enlightenment process with certainty]

- ། ། : [Sentence ending marker, equivalent to a period]

རབ་འབྱོར་དགེ་བའི་ཆོས་རྣམས་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནི། དེ་དག་ཆོས་མེད་པ་ཉིད་དུ་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The root scene representing the entire statement about virtuous dharmas" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The recipient of the teaching, Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དགེ་བའི་ཆོས་རྣམས་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནི [Type: Participant-Topic | Desc: "The topic of discussion - virtuous dharmas - not something receiving action but the subject being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
        └──  [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Relationship showing that node 6 elaborates specifically on the virtuous dharmas mentioned in node 2" | Implicit: "Relationship showing that node 6 elaborates specifically on the virtuous dharmas mentioned in node 2"]
            └── དེ་དག་ཆོས་མེད་པ་ཉིད་དུ [Type: State-Content | Desc: "The content of what is being taught by the Tathagata regarding the nature of dharmas" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── དེ་དག [Type: Center | Desc: "Reference back to the virtuous dharmas mentioned earlier" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཆོས་མེད་པ་ཉིད་དུ [Type: State | Desc: "The ultimate nature of dharmas as non-existent" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── [ultimately] [Type: Implicit-Context | Desc: "Implicit philosophical context indicating that dharmas are empty ultimately while conventionally existing" | Implicit: "Implicit philosophical context indicating that dharmas are empty ultimately while conventionally existing"]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent performing the teaching, the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསུངས་ཏེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of teaching or explaining by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་དག་ཆོས་མེད་པ་ཉིད་དུ [Type: State-Content | Desc: "The content of what is being taught by the Tathagata regarding the nature of dharmas" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་དག [Type: Center | Desc: "Reference back to the virtuous dharmas mentioned earlier" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཆོས་མེད་པ་ཉིད་དུ [Type: State | Desc: "The ultimate nature of dharmas as non-existent" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [ultimately] [Type: Implicit-Context | Desc: "Implicit philosophical context indicating that dharmas are empty ultimately while conventionally existing" | Implicit: "Implicit philosophical context indicating that dharmas are empty ultimately while conventionally existing"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative case; name of a direct disciple of the Buddha; addressed as the recipient of this teaching; functions as a Participant-Recipient in the semantic structure]
- དགེ་བའི་ : virtuous [Genitive form of `དགེ་བ་`: virtue, goodness; modifies `ཆོས་`; indicates qualities that are positive or wholesome; part of the topic being discussed]
- ཆོས་རྣམས་ : dharmas [Plural of `ཆོས་`: dharma, phenomenon; refers to all virtuous phenomena or elements of experience; the primary topic of discussion in this passage]
- ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ : so-called [Quotative construction; literally "that which is called"; marks the preceding term as being specifically referenced; introduces the topic]
- ནི། : as for [Topic marker; emphasizes that virtuous dharmas are the subject being discussed; sets up the contrast with what follows]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the virtuous dharmas mentioned before; functions as the Center pointing back to the main topic]
- ཆོས་ : dharmas [Nominative; `ཆོས་`: phenomenon, element of reality; refers to the same phenomena mentioned earlier; subject of the predication]
- མེད་པ་ : non-existent [Negative existential; from `མེད་`: not exist; conveys the emptiness or lack of inherent existence of phenomena; key philosophical point]
- ཉིད་དུ་ : as such [Nominalizer with terminative case; indicates the state or essential nature; emphasizes the ultimate non-existence as the true nature of dharmas]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [Agentive/instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "Thus-Gone One," epithet of the Buddha; the authoritative source of the teaching; functions as the Agent]
- གསུངས་ཏེ། : taught [Past tense of `གསུང་`: to speak, teach (honorific); the process of conveying the teaching; ends with a continuative particle `ཏེ་`]

glossary:

- དགེ་བའི་ : virtuous [Genitive of `དགེ་བ་`: virtue, goodness; qualifies the dharmas being referenced; functions as an Elaborator describing the nature of the dharmas]

    ├── རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་གིས་སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ན་རིའི་རྒྱལ་པོ་རི་རབ་དག་ཇི་སྙེད་ཡོད་པ་དེ་ཙམ་གྱི་རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན་གྱི་ཕུང་པོ་མངོན་པར་བསྡུས་ཏེ། སྦྱིན་པ་བྱིན་པ་བས་གང་གིས་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་འདི་ལས་ཐ་ན་ཚིག་བཞི་པའི་ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་གཅིག་ཙམ་བཟུང་ནས་གཞན་དག་ལ་ཡང་བསྟན་ན། [Type: Comparative Scene | Desc: "Comparison between giving jewels and teaching dharma" | Implicit: ""]

            ├── རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་གིས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Conditional elaboration of who might perform the action" | Implicit: ""]

                ├── སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས [Type: Center | Desc: "The cosmological scale being described" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── རིའི་རྒྱལ་པོ་རི་རབ་དག་ཇི་སྙེད་ཡོད་པ [Type: Center | Desc: "The specific measure using Mount Sumeru as reference" | Implicit: ""]
                └── རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན་གྱི་ཕུང་པོ [Type: Center | Desc: "The precious substances being collected" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- ཡང་ : furthermore [Syntactic connector; functions as a discourse marker indicating continuation, linking this passage to previous discussion]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; Buddha's disciple who is being directly addressed as the recipient of this teaching]
- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་ : son of good family or [Compound noun + disjunctive particle `འམ་`; refers to male spiritual practitioners of noble character]
- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་ : daughter of good family [Compound noun; refers to female spiritual practitioners of noble character]
- གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་གིས་ : whoever, anyone [Indefinite pronoun + agentive case marker `གིས་`; introduces hypothetical agent who performs the action]
- སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་ : of the trichiliocosm [Genitive form of `སྟོང་གསུམ་`; refers to a billion-world system in Buddhist cosmology]
- སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་ : great thousand [Genitive form of `སྟོང་ཆེན་པོ་`; part of cosmological description]
- འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ : of the world [Genitive form of `འཇིག་རྟེན་`; world system or universe]
- ཁམས་ན་ : in the realm [Locative particle `ན་` with `ཁམས་`; indicates location within the cosmological setting]
- རིའི་ : of mountains [Genitive form of `རི་`; modifies the following term]
- རྒྱལ་པོ་ : king [Noun; metaphorically referring to the preeminence of Mount Sumeru]
- རི་རབ་ : Mount Sumeru [Proper noun; the central mountain in Buddhist cosmology]
- དག་ : plural marker [Grammatical particle; indicates plurality of Mount Sumerus in the hypothetical scenario]
- ཇི་སྙེད་ : as many as [Correlative adjective; quantifies the number of Mount Sumerus]
- ཡོད་པ་ : existing [Verbal noun from `ཡོད་`; forming attributive clause about the mountains]
- དེ་ཙམ་གྱི་ : that many [Demonstrative + quantifier + genitive; indicates the immense quantity being described]
- རིན་པོ་ཆེ་ : precious substances [Noun; valuable materials in the hypothetical offering]
- སྣ་བདུན་གྱི་ : of seven kinds [Numeral compound + genitive; specifies the seven types of precious substances]
- ཕུང་པོ་ : heap, collection [Noun; describes the accumulated mass of precious substances]
- མངོན་པར་བསྡུས་ཏེ། : having gathered [Verbal phrase with connective `ཏེ་`; describes the action of collecting the precious substances]
- སྦྱིན་པ་ : gift, giving [Verbal noun from `སྦྱིན་`; refers to the act of generosity]
- བྱིན་པ་ : having given [Past verbal form; completes the action of generosity]
- བས་ : than [Comparative particle; establishes comparison between the two scenarios]
- གང་གིས་ : whoever [Relative pronoun + agentive case marker; introduces the agent of the second scenario]
- ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ : of wisdom [Genitive form of `ཤེས་རབ་`; wisdom as in prajñā, the highest form of understanding]
- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ : to the other shore [Adverbial phrase; metaphor for transcendent wisdom]
- ཕྱིན་པ་ : perfection, gone beyond [Verbal noun; combined with previous term forms "perfection of wisdom" (prajñāpāramitā)]
- འདི་ལས་ : from this [Demonstrative + ablative particle; indicates source of the teaching]
- ཐ་ན་ : even, at minimum [Emphatic adverb; emphasizes the minimal quantity that follows]
- ཚིག་བཞི་པའི་ : four-line [Adjectival compound; describes the verse structure]
- ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་ : verse, stanza [Compound noun; refers to metrical composition in Buddhist texts]
- གཅིག་ཙམ་ : just one [Numeral + restrictive particle; emphasizes the minimal quantity]
- བཟུང་ནས་ : having memorized [Verbal form + connective; describes the action of learning and retaining]
- གཞན་དག་ལ་ : to others [Noun + plural marker + dative particle; identifies the recipients of teaching]
- ཡང་ : also [Adverb; indicates additional action]
- བསྟན་ན། : if taught [Conditional form of `སྟོན་`; establishes the condition for the result that follows]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; addressing the disciple again]
- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ : of merit [Genitive form of `བསོད་ནམས་`; the spiritual benefit accumulated]
- ཕུང་པོ་ : heap, collection [Noun; refers to accumulation of merit]
- སྔ་མ་ : former, previous [Adjective; refers to the first scenario of giving material gifts]
- དེས་ : that [Demonstrative + instrumental particle; refers back to the first merit collection]
- བརྒྱའི་ཆར་ : hundredth part [Fractional expression; indicates a small fraction]
- ཡང་ : even [Emphatic particle; intensifies the comparison]
- ཉེ་བར་ : near, close to [Adverb; modifies the following negative verb]
- མི་འགྲོ་བ་ : does not approach [Negative verbal phrase; indicates the vast difference in merit]
- ནས་ : from [Postposition; introduces the range of comparison]
- རྒྱུའི་བར་དུ་ : up to a cause/reason [Terminative expression; indicates the extent of comparison]
- ཡང་ : also [Emphatic particle; reinforces the previous statement]
- མི་བཟོད་དོ། : cannot bear comparison [Negative verbal phrase + final particle; completes the comparison showing the teaching's vastly superior merit]
