རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Addressee | Desc: "The person being addressed in the question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི [Type: Center | Desc: "The central topic of the question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས [Type: Process | Desc: "The complete verbal process of questioning" | Implicit: ""]
    └── Buddha (Tathagata) [Type: Implicit Participant-Speaker | Desc: "The implied speaker of the question (Buddha)" | Implicit: "The implied speaker of the question (Buddha)"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; vocative case; the direct addressee of Buddha's question; functions as the one being questioned]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; referring to the topic about to be discussed; marks the central subject matter of the question]
- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [Interrogative phrase; literally "in what manner of thinking"; introduces a question seeking opinion; forms part of the questioning process]
- སེམས། : do you think? [Present tense verb form of `སེམས་པ་`: to think, consider; completes the question formula "what do you think?"; marks this as a direct question from Buddha to Subhuti]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་ངས་སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་བཀྲོལ་ལོ་ཞེས་དགོངས་སོ་སྙམ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་ལྟར་མི་བལྟའོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "The entire text consisting of two contrasting scenes: a hypothetical thought and an instruction" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་ངས་སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་བཀྲོལ་ལོ་ཞེས་དགོངས་སོ་སྙམ་ན [Type: Scene | Desc: "Hypothetical scenario presenting a conditional thought about the Tathagata's thinking" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [Questioner/Inquirer] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit questioner or person considering this hypothetical thought" | Implicit: "The implicit questioner or person considering this hypothetical thought"]
        ├── སྙམ་ན [Type: Conditional Linker | Desc: "Conditional marker indicating the hypothetical nature of the first scene" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་ངས་སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་བཀྲོལ་ལོ་ཞེས་དགོངས་སོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the Tathagata's hypothetical thought process" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha who is doing the thinking in this hypothetical scenario" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དགོངས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The thinking process of the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདི་སྙམ་དུ་ངས་སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་བཀྲོལ་ལོ་ཞེས [Type: Content of Thought | Desc: "The content of the Tathagata's hypothetical thought" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ངས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Tathagata referring to himself in his thought" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The beings who are supposedly liberated in the Tathagata's thought" | Implicit: ""]
                └── བཀྲོལ་ལོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of liberation in the Tathagata's thought" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་ལྟར་མི་བལྟའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Instruction to Subhuti contrasting with the hypothetical thought" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The disciple Subhuti who is being instructed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [Buddha/Tathagata] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit Buddha who is giving the instruction to Subhuti" | Implicit: "The implicit Buddha who is giving the instruction to Subhuti"]
        ├── མི་བལྟའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The instruction not to view or consider something in a particular way" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་ལྟར [Type: Manner-Reference | Desc: "Reference back to the hypothetical thought presented in the first scene" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "Thus-Gone One", epithet for Buddha; functions as the Agent who would be thinking in this hypothetical scenario]
- འདི་སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking thus [Terminative case construction; literally "thinking this"; introduces quoted thought content; marks the beginning of hypothetical thought process]
- ངས་ : I [Agentive form of `ང་`: "I, me"; self-reference by the Tathagata within the quoted thought; functions as Agent of the liberation process]
- སེམས་ཅན་རྣམས་ : sentient beings [Plural of `སེམས་ཅན་`: "sentient being"; objects of liberation; functions as Patient in the liberation process]
- བཀྲོལ་ལོ་ : have liberated [Perfect tense of `འགྲོལ་བ་`: "to liberate, free, release"; the action claimed in the hypothetical thought; core Process in the embedded scene]
- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative particle marking the end of quoted speech/thought; connects the thought content to the thinking process]
- དགོངས་སོ་ : thinks [Honorific form, final particle `སོ་` indicates completed statement; the Process of the Tathagata's thinking in this hypothetical scenario]
- སྙམ་ན་ : if one thinks [Conditional clause marker; `སྙམ་`: "to think" + `ན་`: "if"; establishes the entire preceding clause as hypothetical]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of Buddha's disciple; vocative case; Recipient of the instruction that follows]
- དེ་ལྟར་ : in that way [Adverbial demonstrative; refers back to the entire hypothetical thought previously described; functions as Manner-Reference]
- མི་བལྟའོ། ། : do not view [Negation marker `མི་` + `བལྟ་བ་`: "to view, consider" + final particle `འོ`; directive Process instructing against holding the previously described view]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གང་བཀྲོལ་བའི་སེམས་ཅན་དེ་དག་གང་ཡང་མེད་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "root" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "rhetorical_question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "the_previous_statement" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "questioning" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གང་བཀྲོལ་བའི་སེམས་ཅན་དེ་དག་གང་ཡང་མེད་པའི་ཕྱིར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "explanation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Addressee | Desc: "person_addressed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གང་བཀྲོལ་བའི་སེམས་ཅན་དེ་དག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "the_topic_of_nonexistence" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སེམས་ཅན་དེ་དག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "beings_referred_to" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གང་བཀྲོལ་བའི [Type: Process | Desc: "liberation_process" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "the_liberator" | Implicit: ""]
                └── བཀྲོལ་བའི [Type: Process | Desc: "act_of_liberation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཕྱིར་རོ [Type: Linker | Desc: "causal_connector" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དོན་དམ་པར [Type: Implicit-Context | Desc: "ultimate_truth_context" | Implicit: "This word is implied by the context but not explicitly in the original text"]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun, refers to the previous statement; functioning as Patient in the rhetorical question per UCCA structure]
- ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ : for what reason [Interrogative + genitive; from `ཅི་`: what + genitive particle `འི་`: for/of; introduces a rhetorical question]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional particle that follows a question; marks a rhetorical question structure equivalent to "Why is that?"]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; the direct addressee of the discourse; vocative case]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Agentive/instrumental of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Thus-Gone One/Buddha; Agent who performs the liberation]
- གང་ : whoever/whatever [Relative pronoun; here linking the beings to the act of liberation]
- བཀྲོལ་བའི་ : liberated [Genitive of `བཀྲོལ་བ་`: to liberate/release; past tense of `འགྲོལ་བ་`; the act of liberation performed by the Tathagata]
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Compound noun; `སེམས་`: mind + `ཅན་`: possessing; beings with consciousness; Patient of the liberation process]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative plural marker; specifying the beings mentioned]
- གང་ཡང་ : any whatsoever [Intensifier + emphasis particle; strengthens the negation that follows]
- མེད་པའི་ : do not exist [Genitive of `མེད་པ་`: non-existence; negation of `ཡོད་པ་`: to exist; indicates ultimate emptiness of inherent existence]
- ཕྱིར་རོ། : because [Causal connector `ཕྱིར་` + final particle `རོ`; marks the end of the explanation and the cause-effect relationship]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་གལ་ཏེ་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་སེམས་ཅན་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་བཀྲོལ་བར་གྱུར་ན། དེ་ཉིད་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་བདག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "root" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གལ་ཏེ་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་སེམས་ཅན་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་བཀྲོལ་བར་གྱུར་ན [Type: Scene | Desc: "conditional scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "person being addressed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གལ་ཏེ [Type: Linker | Desc: "hypothetical condition marker" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "agent of liberation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས་ཅན་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "those who would be liberated" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བཀྲོལ་བར་གྱུར་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "action of liberation in hypothetical condition" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་ཉིད་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་བདག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར [Type: Scene | Desc: "consequence scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ཉིད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "referent to the hypothetical liberated beings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "agent of grasping" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདག་ཏུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "manner of grasping" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར [Type: Process | Desc: "action of grasping" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative form; name of Buddha's disciple who is being addressed; functions as the Addressee in this discourse]
- གལ་ཏེ་ : if [Conditional conjunction; introduces a hypothetical scenario; marks the beginning of the conditional clause]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [Instrumental/Agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "Thus-Gone One," epithet for Buddha; functioning as the Agent of the hypothetical liberation]
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Plural noun; refers to all conscious beings in cyclic existence; functions as the Patient of the hypothetical liberation]
- གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་ : any whatsoever [Indefinite determiner compound; `གང་` (which) + `ལ་ལ་` (some) + `ཞིག་` (indefinite marker); specifies an undefined quantity of sentient beings]
- བཀྲོལ་བར་ : liberate [Terminative case of `བཀྲོལ་བ་`: to free, release, liberate; here indicating the Process of setting free from suffering]
- གྱུར་ན་ : were to [Conditional marker with `གྱུར་` (become, happen); completes the conditional clause; "if it were to happen that"]
- དེ་ཉིད་ : that very one [Emphatic demonstrative; refers back to the hypothetically liberated sentient beings mentioned in the condition; functions as Patient in the consequence]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [Instrumental/Agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`; same Buddha functioning now as Agent of the grasping action in the consequence]
- བདག་ཏུ་ : as a self [Terminative case of `བདག་`: self, I, ego; indicates the manner of grasping - seeing beings as having inherent selfhood]
- འཛིན་པར་ : would grasp [Terminative case of `འཛིན་པ་`: to hold, grasp, conceive; indicates conceptual grasping or attachment to a notion]
- འགྱུར། : would become [Future/present tense marker; completes the consequence clause; indicates the resulting state that would arise from the condition]

ucca_formatted:
སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འཛིན་པ་དང༌། སྲོག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་རོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing three parallel scenes about different forms of conceptual grasping" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་འཛིན་པ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing attachment to the concept of sentient beings" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱིས་པ་སོ་སོའི་སྐྱེ་བོ་ [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit agents who engage in conceptualizing - unenlightened ordinary beings" | Implicit: "The implicit agents who engage in conceptualizing"]
        ├── འཛིན་པ་ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of clinging or attachment to concepts, a form of mental fixation problematic in Buddhist philosophy" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་ [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The concept of 'sentient beings' that is being clung to" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྲོག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene describing attachment to the concept of life-force" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱིས་པ་སོ་སོའི་སྐྱེ་བོ་ [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit agents who engage in conceptualizing - unenlightened ordinary beings" | Implicit: "The implicit agents who engage in conceptualizing"]
        ├── འཛིན་པ་ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of clinging or attachment to concepts, a form of mental fixation problematic in Buddhist philosophy" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སྲོག་ཏུ་ [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The concept of 'life-force' that is being clung to" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་ཟག་ཏུ་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Third scene describing attachment to the concept of persons, with a resultative aspect" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱིས་པ་སོ་སོའི་སྐྱེ་བོ་ [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit agents who engage in conceptualizing - unenlightened ordinary beings" | Implicit: "The implicit agents who engage in conceptualizing"]
        ├── འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་རོ [Type: Process-Resultative | Desc: "The process of attachment with a resultative aspect indicating transformation or future occurrence" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གང་ཟག་ཏུ་ [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The concept of 'person' that is being clung to" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connects all three scenes as parallel conceptualizations or forms of attachment" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བདག་མེད་ཀྱང་བདག་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་ཞེན་པ་ [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "The underlying object of mistaken conceptualization - attachment to notions of self despite the reality of selflessness" | Implicit: "The underlying object of mistaken conceptualization"]
glossary:
- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Noun; used as the object of conceptual fixation; refers to living beings with consciousness; functions as the Goal/object of grasping in the first conceptual scene]
- དུ་ : as [Terminative particle; indicates transformation or identification; marks the way in which the concept is grasped]
- འཛིན་པ་ : grasping [Verbal noun from `འཛིན་`: to hold, grasp, cling; refers to conceptual fixation or attachment; functions as the main Process in the conceptual scene]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction; connects parallel scenes of conceptual grasping; links the three forms of misconception as parallel manifestations]
- སྲོག་ : life-force [Noun; from Sanskrit "jīva"; the concept of an animating life-essence; functions as the Goal/object of grasping in the second conceptual scene]
- ཏུ་ : as [Terminative particle; indicates transformation or identification; marks the way in which the concept is grasped]
- འཛིན་པ་ : grasping [Verbal noun from `འཛིན་`: to hold, grasp, cling; refers to conceptual fixation or attachment; functions as the main Process in the conceptual scene]
- དང༌ : and [Conjunction; connects parallel scenes of conceptual grasping; links the three forms of misconception as parallel manifestations]
- གང་ཟག་ : person [Noun; from Sanskrit "pudgala"; refers to the concept of a discrete individual; functions as the Goal/object of grasping in the third conceptual scene]
- ཏུ་ : as [Terminative particle; indicates transformation or identification; marks the way in which the concept is grasped]
- འཛིན་པར་ : grasping [Verbal noun from `འཛིན་`: to hold, grasp, cling; with terminative particle `-ར་` indicating the resultative aspect; functions as part of the Process in the third scene]
- འགྱུར་རོ : will become [Verb `འགྱུར་`: to become, transform; with final particle `རོ` indicating a definite statement; denotes the resultative aspect of the conceptualization process; completes the Process in the third scene]
- ། ། : [End of sentence marker; indicates completion of the statement about the three forms of misconceptualization]

glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of Buddha's disciple; functions as addressee/recipient of the teaching]
- བདག་ཏུ་ : as self [Terminative case of `བདག་`: self, ego, I; indicates direction or transformation]
- འཛིན་ : grasping [Present tense of `འཛིན་པ་`: to grasp, hold, apprehend; here refers to the conceptual clinging to notion of self; functions as main process in the first scene]
- ཅེས་བྱ་བ་ : what is called [Nominalizer construction from `ཅེས་` + `བྱ་བ་`: 'that which is called'; marks the preceding as a term being defined]
- ནི། : regarding [Topic marker; sets up the topic of discussion]
- འཛིན་པ་ : grasping [Nominalized form of `འཛིན་`: to grasp; the concept being discussed]
- མེད་པར་ : as non-existent [Negation `མེད་` + terminative particle `པར་`: without, as absent; functioning as adverbial modifier describing the Buddha's teaching]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathagata [Agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Thus-Gone One, an epithet of the Buddha; functions as agent of the teaching]
- གསུངས་ : taught [Past tense of `གསུང་བ་`: to speak, teach, explain; represents the process of teaching]
- ན། : although [Conditional connector; establishes contrast between Buddha's teaching and ordinary beings' misconception]
- དེ་ཡང་ : yet that very thing [Demonstrative `དེ་` + emphatic particle `ཡང་`: that very (grasping); functions as patient/object in the final clause]
- བྱིས་པ་ : childish [Adjective meaning childish, immature; describes ordinary beings lacking wisdom]
- སོ་སོའི་ : individual [Genitive of `སོ་སོ་`: separate, individual; modifies ordinary beings]
- སྐྱེ་བོ་ : beings [Common noun: ordinary person, being; refers to unenlightened individuals]
- རྣམས་ : plural [Plural marker; indicates multiple ordinary beings]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; shows possession or agency]
- བཟུང་ : is grasped [Past tense of `འཛིན་`: to grasp; indicates the ordinary beings' action of grasping at self]
- ངོ་། ། : indeed. [Final particle with shad (Tibetan punctuation): emphatic affirmation; marks completed statement with certainty]

glossary:
## Word-by-Word Disambiguated Gloss

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Proper noun, name of the disciple addressed by the Buddha; functions as the addressee in this teaching dialogue]

- བྱིས་པ་ : childish [Noun used attributively; from `བྱིས་པ་`: child/childish/immature; refers to those who have immature understanding of reality; functions as a qualifying descriptor]

- སོ་སོའི་ : individual [Genitive of `སོ་སོ་`: individual/separate/distinct; indicates the particular or distinct nature of ordinary beings; functions as modifier]

- སྐྱེ་བོ་ : beings [Noun from `སྐྱེ་བོ་`: ordinary being/person; refers to ordinary sentient beings as opposed to noble ones; functions as the central patient in this discourse]

- རྣམས་ : plural marker [Plural particle; indicates multiple beings; completes the noun phrase]

- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative particle; marks the preceding phrase as what is being designated; functions as part of the naming/designating process]

- བྱ་བ་ : called [Verb future/present form of `བྱེད་`: to do/make; here used to mean "called" or "designated"; functions as the process of naming]

- ནི། : topic marker [Topic particle; marks the preceding phrase as the topic of discussion; sets up the contrast with what follows]

- དེ་དག་ : those [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the childish ordinary beings mentioned earlier; functions as patient in the Buddha's teaching]

- སྐྱེ་བོ་ : beings [Noun, same as above; repeated here as part of the philosophical statement]

- མེད་པ་ : non-existent [Negative existential; from `མེད་`: to not exist; refers to the ultimate non-existence of such beings; functions as the key philosophical attribute]

- ཉིད་དུ་ : as being precisely [Abstract noun marker `ཉིད་` + terminative `དུ་`; emphasizes the definitive nature of non-existence; functions to establish the philosophical state]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathāgata [Agentive/instrumental of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Thus-Gone One/Buddha; indicates the Buddha as the agent of teaching; functions as the authoritative source]

- གསུངས་ཏེ། : taught [Past tense of `གསུང་`: to speak/teach (honorific); the Buddha's act of teaching; functions as the main process with continuing implication]

        ├── སོ་སོའི་སྐྱེ་བོ [Type: Center | Desc: "Second part of the compound referring to ordinary beings" | Implicit: ""]
        └── རྣམས [Type: Function | Desc: "Pluralizes the beings being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཞེས་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of naming or designating" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [by the Buddha] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit agent who does the naming (Buddha or teaching tradition)" | Implicit: "The implicit agent who does the naming (Buddha or teaching tradition)"]

glossary:
- དེས་ན་: therefore [Function word; combination of དེས་ (instrumental of དེ་: that) and ན་ (conditional particle); links this statement to previous context; serves as a Linker in the semantic structure]
- བྱིས་པ་: childlike [Noun; literally "child" but used metaphorically to describe those who don't understand the true nature of reality; forms the first part of the compound describing ordinary beings]
- སོ་སོའི་: individual [Genitive form of སོ་སོ་: separate, individual; modifies སྐྱེ་བོ་; indicates distinct or separate individuals]
- སྐྱེ་བོ་: beings [Noun; refers to ordinary sentient beings; contrasted with noble ones (འཕགས་པ་) who understand ultimate reality]
- རྣམས་: [plural marker] [Grammatical particle marking plurality; indicates the statement refers to multiple ordinary beings]
- ཞེས་: thus [Quotative particle; introduces what something is called or termed; connects the designation to the naming process]
- བྱའོ: are called [Verb phrase; བྱ་ (to call, name) + འོ (final particle); marks the process of designation; the implied agent is the Buddha or Buddhist teaching tradition]
- །: [sentence terminator] [Punctuation mark indicating the end of the sentence]

glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Proper noun; name of one of Buddha's main disciples who is the direct addressee of this teaching; functions as the Recipient of the questioning process]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the philosophical question about to be posed regarding whether the Tathagata can be perceived through perfect marks; functions as the Patient (object being considered)]

- ཇི་ : what/how [Interrogative particle; introduces the question being asked; part of the interrogative construction that forms the Process element]

- སྙམ་ : think/consider [Verb root meaning "to think"; here used to ask Subhūti what he thinks about the forthcoming question; forms the core of the questioning Process]

- དུ་ : as/in the manner of [Terminative particle; connects to སྙམ་ to create the expression "what do you think"; functions within the state description of the questioning]

- སེམས : do you think [Present tense verb; from root སེམས་པ་ "to think"; here functioning as the main verb directed at Subhūti; completes the questioning Process with the implicit Buddha as the Agent]

མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་བལྟ་བར་བྱ་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire rhetorical question" | Implicit: ""]

    ├── སྙམ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of thinking/considering" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་བལྟ་བར་བྱ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Embedded scene representing the consideration about viewing the Tathāgata" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [one] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent who would be doing the viewing" | Implicit: "Generic agent is implied"]
        ├── བལྟ་བར་བྱ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of viewing" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The entity being viewed (the Tathāgata)" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Instrumental phrase showing the means of viewing" | Implicit: ""]
    └── མམ། [Type: Ground | Desc: "Question particle that grounds the entire scene as a question" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- མཚན་ : marks [Noun - `མཚན་`: mark, sign, characteristic; here refers to the physical marks or characteristics of the Buddha; functions as part of the instrumental phrase]
- ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་ : through perfect/excellent [Instrumental of `ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་`: perfect, excellent, complete; here indicates the means by which one might view the Tathāgata; functions as an Elaborator in semantic structure]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་ : the Tathāgata [Terminative case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Tathāgata, Buddha; literally "Thus-Gone One"; serves as the Patient (the entity being viewed) in the embedded scene]
- བལྟ་བར་ : to view/see [Terminative of `བལྟ་བ་`: to look, view, see; verbal noun form; core Process in the embedded scene]
- བྱ་ : should do [Future form of `བྱེད་`: to do; creates the modal sense of "should view"; completes the verbal phrase with བལྟ་བར་]
- སྙམ་ : think/consider [Present of `སྙམ་པ་`: to think, consider; marks the entire preceding clause as a thought; functions as the main Process of the root scene]
- མམ། : or? [Final question particle `འམ་` with preceding consonant; transforms the statement into a rhetorical question; functions as a Ground element that establishes the interrogative nature of the utterance]

རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The entire utterance where Subhuti responds to the Blessed One" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who is speaking/replying" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསོལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of replying or speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The being addressed by Subhuti's response" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "A reference to the previous statement being responded to" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ནི [Type: Connector | Desc: "A topic marker connecting and emphasizing the preceding element" | Implicit: ""]
    └── མ་ལགས་སོ [Type: Negation | Desc: "The core negation expressing denial of the previous proposition" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhūti [Ergative case of `རབ་འབྱོར་`: Subhūti, a chief disciple of the Buddha; here acting as the agent/speaker in the dialogue; functions as the Agent in the sentence structure]
- གསོལ་པ། : replied [Past tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, to say, to reply; here indicating Subhūti's verbal response to the Buddha; functions as the main Process/verb in the utterance]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; combination of `བཅོམ་པ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); here the addressee of Subhūti's response; vocative case]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun referring to the previous statement or proposition made by the Buddha; functions as a referential element pointing to the content being negated]
- ནི་ : indeed [Topic marker particle emphasizing the preceding demonstrative pronoun; serves to highlight the specific proposition being addressed]
- མ་ལགས་སོ། : is not so [Negated form of `ལགས་` (honorific verb 'to be') with `མ་` negation prefix and `སོ་` final particle; expressing categorical denial or disagreement with the previous statement; functions as the core negation in the response]

མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་བལྟ་བར་མི་བགྱི་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the complete statement about not viewing the Tathagata by characteristics" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [practitioner/one] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit agent representing the practitioner who should not view the Tathagata through characteristics" | Implicit: "The implied practitioner or person who should not view the Tathagata through characteristics"]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object being viewed (the Buddha/Tathagata)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བལྟ་བར་མི་བགྱི [Type: Process | Desc: "Negated process of viewing the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བལྟ་བར་བགྱི [Type: Process | Desc: "Core verbal process of viewing/seeing" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མི་ [Type: Function | Desc: "Negation marker that modifies the process of viewing" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [relation between characteristics and viewing] [Type: Relator | Desc: "Connects the concept of characteristics to the viewing process" | Implicit: "The implicit relationship connecting the concept of characteristics to the viewing process"]
        └── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the means by which the Tathagata should not be viewed" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ལགས་སོ [Type: Function | Desc: "Formal statement completion marker in Tibetan" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་ : by excellent characteristics [Instrumental of `མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་`: perfect/excellent marks or characteristics; functions as means or method, indicating the inappropriate way of viewing the Tathagata; serves as an elaborator in the semantic structure]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་ : the Tathagata [Terminative case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Sanskrit "tathāgata", an epithet of the Buddha meaning "thus-gone" or "thus-come"; functions as the patient/object of viewing; the being who should not be identified merely through physical characteristics]

- བལྟ་བར་ : to view/see [Terminative form of `བལྟ་བ་`: to look at, view, observe; core verbal process in infinitive form; the action being negated in this statement]

- མི་ : not [Negative particle that directly modifies the verb; functions as a negation marker indicating prohibition]

- བགྱི་ : should do [Future/present form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do, perform; formal verb form often used in respectful speech; combines with བལྟ་བར་ and མི་ to form the complete negated process]

- ལགས་སོ : is [Formal statement marker; composed of ལགས་ (polite copula) and སོ (final particle); indicates formal, respectful discourse, typically used in scriptural or formal teachings]

            ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Agent participant representing the Buddha who is speaking" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "Process representing the act of speaking by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        └── རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ནོ། །དེ་དེ་བཞིན་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene depicting Subhuti's response" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to one who has conquered afflictions, possesses excellent qualities, and transcended suffering; functions as Agent in the first scene]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker connecting the Agent (Buddha) to the action; indicates who performed the speech act]
- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ : proclaimed [Honorific verb for 'to speak'; from `བཀའ་` (word, speech) and `སྩལ་` (to grant, bestow); denotes the authoritative speech of the Buddha; functions as Process in the UCCA structure]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of one of Buddha's chief disciples; serves as Agent in the second scene as the responder]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun referring to what was previously stated by the Buddha; component of the affirmation expression]
- དེ་བཞིན་ : thus, just so [Adverbial expression; from `དེ་` (that) and `བཞིན་` (like, in the manner of); indicates agreement or affirmation; functions as part of the Adverbial modifier to an implicit confirmation]
- ནོ : is [Final particle marking affirmation; completes the statement of agreement; marks the end of the first affirmation phrase]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun in the second affirmation; refers to the same content as the first `དེ་`]
- དེ་བཞིན་ : thus, just so [Repeated adverbial expression reinforcing the agreement; creates parallel structure with the first affirmation]
- ཏེ : indeed [Continuative particle indicating emphasis or continuation of thought; marks the second affirmation as reinforcing the first]

མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་བལྟ་བར་མི་བྱ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene containing the instruction about not viewing the Tathagata by physical marks" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [practitioner/listener] [Type: Implicit Addressee | Desc: "The implicit addressee who is being instructed not to view the Tathagata by perfect marks" | Implicit: "The person being instructed"]
    ├── བལྟ་བར་མི་བྱ་སྟེ [Type: Negative Process | Desc: "The main process with negative aspect (prohibition) emphasized" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object that should not be viewed by perfect marks" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མཚན་ [Type: Adverbial-Instrumental | Desc: "The means by which one should not view the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration of the marks as perfect, with instrumental case marker indicating means" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [because a Tathagata should be understood through dharmakāya, not physical characteristics] [Type: Implicit Cause | Desc: "Implicit doctrinal rationale behind the instruction - that the true nature of a Tathagata is to be understood through dharmakāya" | Implicit: "Doctrinal rationale behind the instruction"]
glossary:
- མཚན་ : physical marks [Noun: marks, characteristics, signs; here referring to the physical attributes of the Buddha's body; functions as the instrumental means in this negative instruction]

- ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་ : perfect/excellent [Adjective with instrumental case marker `-ས་`; from `ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་`: perfect, excellent, complete; here qualifying the marks as excellent while the instrumental case indicates "by means of"; acts as an elaborator of the marks]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་ : the Tathagata [Terminative case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: Tathagata, "thus-gone one", epithet of the Buddha; the `-ར་` suffix indicates "toward" or "as"; functions as the patient/object in this instruction]

- བལྟ་བར་ : viewing/regarding [Verbal noun with terminative case; from `བལྟ་བ་`: to view, regard, consider; the `-ར་` suffix indicates purpose; forms part of the main negative process]

- མི་བྱ་ : should not do [Negative present/future verb; `མི་` is the negative prefix + `བྱ་` "to do"; indicates prohibition; forms the core negative process in this instruction]

- སྟེ། : because/for [Connective particle indicating that a reason will follow; marks this statement as the first part of a larger argument; suggests an implicit cause to follow]

        ├── འཁོར་ལོས་སྒྱུར་བའི་རྒྱལ་པོ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The subject of the second scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཡང [Type: Linker | Desc: "Emphasizes the surprising nature of the consequence" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འགྱུར [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of transformation or becoming" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར [Type: Participant-Result | Desc: "The resulting state or outcome that would follow from the conditional premise, not a goal being deliberately pursued" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Vocative; name of the Buddha's disciple being addressed; functions as the recipient of this teaching]

- གལ་ཏེ་ : if [Conditional conjunction; introduces a hypothetical scenario; connects the first scene to the main discourse]

- མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་ : by excellent marks [Instrumental of `མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་`: perfect physical characteristics; refers to the 32 major marks of a Buddha; functions as the means by which someone might incorrectly identify the Tathagata]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་ : as the Tathagata [Terminative of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "thus-gone one," epithet of a Buddha; object that is being perceived in this hypothetical scenario]

- བལྟ་བར་ : to view [Future/purposive of `ལྟ་བ་`: to see, perceive; indicates the action of perceiving or identifying someone as the Tathagata]

- འགྱུར་ན་ : if it were to become [Conditional of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform; combined with `ན་` to form the closing conditional marker of the hypothesis]

- འཁོར་ལོས་སྒྱུར་བའི་ : of a wheel-turning [Genitive of `འཁོར་ལོས་སྒྱུར་བ་`: chakravartin, universal monarch; modifies "king" as a compound]

- རྒྱལ་པོ་ : king [Base form; refers to a universal monarch who possesses the 32 marks similar to a Buddha; functions as the subject of the consequence statement]

- ཡང་ : also/then [Emphatic particle; emphasizes the logical consequence and highlights the surprising nature of what follows]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་ : a Tathagata [Terminative of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "thus-gone one"; the resulting state that would follow from the conditional premise]

- འགྱུར་ཏེ། : would become [Future tense of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform; with final particle `ཏེ` indicating the statement continues or explaining what follows]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་བས་ན་མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་བལྟ་བར་མི་བྱའོ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire proposition about how one should not view the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connects this statement with previous context, indicating logical consequence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── the practitioner/one [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit agent who should not view the Tathagata by perfect characteristics" | Implicit: "The implicit agent who should not view the Tathagata by perfect characteristics"]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The direct object of the viewing action, the Tathagata in the objective case" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བལྟ་བར [Type: Process | Desc: "The main verbal action of viewing or seeing" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Instrumental case showing the means by which one might incorrectly view the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The perfect physical characteristics that should not be used to identify the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    └── མི་བྱའོ [Type: Modal | Desc: "Modal expression indicating prohibition or negative obligation" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
# Tibetan Text Glossary

- དེ་བས་ན་ : therefore [Connector phrase; compound of `དེ་`: that + `བས་`: comparative + `ན་`: conditional marker; expresses logical consequence based on preceding arguments; functions as a discourse linker connecting this statement to previous context]

- མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་ : by means of perfect characteristics [Instrumental case of `མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་`: perfect/excellent physical marks; compound of `མཚན་`: mark/sign + `ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་`: excellent/perfect; serves as means by which the incorrect viewing action might occur]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་ : the Tathagata [Objective case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "Thus-Gone One," epithet of the Buddha; compound of `དེ་བཞིན་`: thus/in that way + `གཤེགས་པ་`: gone/departed; functions as patient/direct object of the viewing action]

- བལྟ་བར་ : to view/perceive [Purposive form of `བལྟ་བ་`: to look at/view; root verb `ལྟ་`: to see/look; denotes the main process/action that is being prohibited; functions as main verbal action]

- མི་བྱའོ : should not do [Negative obligation form; compound of `མི་`: negation marker + `བྱ་`: do/perform + `འོ`: sentence-final emphatic marker; expresses prohibition; functions as modal element indicating negative obligation]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ནས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ་ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་འདི་སྐད་ཅེས་གསོལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of Subhūti addressing the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ནས་ [Type: Time | Desc: "Temporal marker indicating sequence of events" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ་ [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The Buddha as recipient of the address" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Subhūti as the agent performing the speech act" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདི་ [Type: Participant-Patient Demonstrative | Desc: "Demonstrative reference pointing to the content of speech" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྐད་ཅེས་ [Type: Participant-Patient Speech-Marker | Desc: "Manner marker indicating how the speech was delivered" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསོལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Process-Communication | Desc: "Speech act of addressing or requesting" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [implicit content of speech] [Type: Content-Implicit | Desc: "Implicit content of Subhūti's speech responding to Buddha's teachings" | Implicit: "The content of what Subhūti said to the Buddha which is not explicitly stated in this sentence"]
glossary:
- དེ་ནས་ : Then [Temporal adverb; composed of དེ་ (that) and ནས་ (from); marks the sequence of events in the narrative; functions as a temporal marker in the scene structure]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ལ་ : to the Blessed One [Dative/Locative case of བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ (the Buddha); honorific title for Buddha literally meaning 'the transcendent destroyer' (who has destroyed all defilements); functions as the recipient of the address]

- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : the venerable [Epithet; composed of ཚེ་ (life) + དང་ (and) + ལྡན་པ་ (possessing); honorific term for ordained monks meaning 'endowed with life/longevity'; part of the agent identification]

- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhūti [Ergative case of རབ་འབྱོར་; name of one of Buddha's chief disciples renowned for his understanding of emptiness; marked with ergative particle གྱིས་ indicating he is the agent performing the action]

- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; functions as a reference pointing to the content of the forthcoming speech; acts as part of the patient element in the communication structure]

- སྐད་ཅེས་ : thus/in this way [Adverbial phrase; སྐད་ (voice/speech) + ཅེས་ (quotative marker); indicates the manner in which something was said; marks the style of speech]

- གསོལ་ཏོ། ། : addressed/requested [Past tense of གསོལ་བ་ (to request, to address); with final particle ཏོ་ indicating completion of action; marks the communication process of formally addressing the Buddha; sentence-final marker]

ucca_formatted: བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་བདག་གིས་ཇི་ལྟར་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་གསུངས་པའི་དོན་འཚལ་བ་ལྟར་ན། མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་བལྟ་བར་མི་བགྱི་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title of the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); functions as Addressee in the scene]
- བདག་གིས་ : by me [Ergative/instrumental of `བདག་`: I, self; first-person pronoun used when addressing the Buddha; functions as Agent in the scene]
- ཇི་ལྟར་ : according to how [Interrogative adverb used as a relative connector; links the speaker's understanding to Buddha's teaching; functions as manner adverbial]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title repeated; functions as Agent in embedded clause]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [Ergative particle marking the agent `བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་`; indicates who performed the action of teaching]
- གསུངས་པའི་ : taught [Genitive of past tense of honorific verb `གསུང་`: to speak, teach; connects the teaching to its content; functions as Process]
- དོན་ : meaning [Noun: meaning, purpose, significance; object of understanding; functions as Patient]
- འཚལ་བ་ : understand [Verbal noun from `འཚལ་བ་`: to know, understand; indicates the speaker's process of comprehension; functions as Process]
- ལྟར་ན། : according to [Postposition: in accordance with, as per; introduces the consequence or conclusion; functions as Center connecting understanding to conclusion]
- མཚན་ : marks/characteristics [Noun: sign, characteristic, mark; referencing the physical attributes of the Buddha; functions as Instrument in the scene]
- ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་ : excellent/perfect [Instrumental of `ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་`: perfect, excellent, complete; modifies `མཚན་`; functions as Adverbial modifier]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པར་ : the Tathagata [Terminative/allative of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "Thus-Gone One," epithet of the Buddha; object of perception; functions as Patient]
- བལྟ་བར་ : to view/see [Terminative of verbal noun `བལྟ་བ་`: to look at, view; the action being negated; functions as Process]
- མི་བགྱི་ : should not do [Negative prefix `མི་` + honorific future/present `བགྱི་`: to do; negates the action of viewing the Buddha by physical marks; functions as Negated Process]
- ལགས་སོ། : it is [Polite assertive final particle; makes the statement respectful and formal; marks the end of utterance]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ནས་བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་དེའི་ཚེ་ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་འདི་དག་བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing the Buddha speaking verses" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ནས་ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Temporal connector establishing sequence of events" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the direct agent of the speech act" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེའི་ཚེ་ [Type: Time | Desc: "Temporal marker indicating when the teaching was given" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་འདི་དག་ [Type: Center | Desc: "Core content of what was spoken by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [Implicit: teachings on non-conceptual understanding of the Buddha] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit elaboration that these verses contain Buddhist teachings about non-conceptual understanding" | Implicit: "teachings on non-conceptual understanding of the Buddha"]
    └── བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The speech act performed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ནས་ : Then [Temporal adverb; literally "from that"; functions as a sequential connector establishing chronological order in the narrative; serves as a Linker in the semantic structure]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to one who has conquered defilements, possesses qualities, and transcended samsara; functions as the primary Agent of the speech act]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker indicating the doer of the action; attached to `བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་` to mark the Buddha as the speaker/agent]

- དེའི་ : that [Genitive form of demonstrative pronoun `དེ་` (that); connects to `ཚེ་` to create "at that time"; provides specific temporal reference]

- ཚེ་ : time [Temporal noun; when combined with `དེའི་` forms "at that time"; establishes when the Buddha spoke; functions as a Time marker in the semantic structure]

- ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་ : verses [Formal term for metrical verses; literally "broken into sections"; `ཚིགས་སུ་` (into sections) + `བཅད་པ་` (cut, divided); refers to formal poetic teachings; forms part of the Center content of the speech act]

- འདི་དག་ : these [Plural demonstrative pronoun; `འདི་` (this) + `དག་` (plural marker); indicates the verses are specifically identifiable and present; specifies the utterances that follow]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་ཏོ། : proclaimed [Honorific past tense verb for "spoke/taught"; `བཀའ་` (speech/word of Buddha) + `སྩལ་` (bestowed/given); the `ཏོ།` is a sentence-final particle indicating completed action; represents the Process of formal teaching by the Buddha]

- ། : [Sentence-ending shad marker; indicates completion of thought]

ucca_formatted:
གང་དག་ང་ལ་གཟུགས་སུ་མཐོང༌། །གང་དག་ང་ལ་སྒྲར་ཤེས་པ། །ལོག་པའི་ལམ་དུ་ཞུགས་པ་སྟེ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "root" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་དག་ང་ལ་གཟུགས་སུ་མཐོང༌། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "first scene describing those who see Buddha in form" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་དག [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "people who perceive Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ང་ལ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Buddha as object of perception" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གཟུགས་སུ་མཐོང༌ [Type: Process | Desc: "act of seeing Buddha in form" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གཟུགས་སུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "mode of perceiving Buddha through visual form" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མཐོང༌ [Type: Center | Desc: "action of seeing" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་དག་ང་ལ་སྒྲར་ཤེས་པ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "second scene describing those who know Buddha through sound" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་དག [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "people who perceive Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ང་ལ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Buddha as object of knowledge" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སྒྲར་ཤེས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "act of knowing Buddha through sound" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྒྲར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "mode of perceiving Buddha through sound" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཤེས་པ [Type: Center | Desc: "action of knowing" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལོག་པའི་ལམ་དུ་ཞུགས་པ་སྟེ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "consequential scene describing the result of attempting to perceive Buddha through form or sound" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── [those from scenes 1 and 2] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "implicit reference to the agents from the first two scenes who see Buddha in form or know through sound" | Implicit: "Implicit reference to the agents from the first two scenes who see Buddha in form or know through sound"]
        ├── ཞུགས་པ་སྟེ [Type: Process | Desc: "action of entering" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ལོག་པའི་ལམ་དུ [Type: Adverbial-Manner | Desc: "manner of proceeding incorrectly" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ལོག་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "qualifier describing the path as incorrect" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ལམ་དུ [Type: Center | Desc: "way or approach" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [therefore] [Type: Linker | Desc: "implicit causal relation indicating that entering the wrong path is a consequence of perceiving Buddha through form or sound" | Implicit: "Implicit causal relation indicating that entering the wrong path is a consequence of perceiving Buddha through form or sound"]
glossary:
- གང་དག : whoever [Plural relative pronoun; functions as the Agent in the first two scenes, referring to people who perceive the Buddha]
- ང་ལ : to me [Dative/Locative case of `ང་`: I/me; refers to Buddha as the object of perception; functions as the Patient in both scenes]
- གཟུགས་སུ : as form [Terminative case of `གཟུགས་`: form/body; indicates the mode through which Buddha is perceived visually; functions as an Adverbial modifier]
- མཐོང༌ : see [Perfective verb root meaning 'to see/perceive'; the main action in the first scene describing visual perception of Buddha]
- གང་དག : whoever [Same as above, plural relative pronoun functioning as Agent in the second scene]
- ང་ལ : to me [Same as above, Buddha as the object of knowledge in the second scene]
- སྒྲར : as sound [Terminative case of `སྒྲ`: sound/voice; indicates perceiving Buddha through auditory means; functions as an Adverbial modifier]
- ཤེས་པ : know [Nominalizer of verb `ཤེས་`: to know/understand; the main action in the second scene describing auditory perception of Buddha]
- ལོག་པའི་ : wrong [Genitive form of `ལོག་པ`: incorrect/mistaken; qualifies the path as erroneous; elaborates on the manner of proceeding]
- ལམ་དུ : into the path [Terminative case of `ལམ་`: path/way; destination into which the agents enter; functions as part of an Adverbial phrase specifying manner]
- ཞུགས་པ་ : have entered [Nominalizer of verb `འཇུག་`: to enter/engage; the main action in the consequential scene describing the result of perceiving Buddha through form or sound]
- སྟེ : that is [Coordinating particle indicating explanation or specification; connects the consequence to the previous descriptions]

སྐྱེ་བོ་དེ་དག་ང་མི་མཐོང༌། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing how certain people cannot truly see the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྐྱེ་བོ་དེ་དག [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "People who approach the Buddha incorrectly through conventional designations and wrong views" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The Buddha in his true nature (dharmakāya), not merely his conventional form" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མི་མཐོང༌ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of failing to perceive the Buddha's true nature" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [through conventional designations] [Type: Manner | Desc: "The specific way in which these people fail to see the Buddha - through conventional designations and conceptual proliferation rather than seeing the Buddha's true nature (dharmatā)" | Implicit: "The specific way in which these people fail to see the Buddha - through conventional designations and conceptual proliferation rather than seeing the Buddha's true nature (dharmatā)"]
    └── [implicit philosophical context] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The implicit philosophical context that this verse concerns the inability to perceive the Buddha's true nature (dharmakāya) through conventional perceptions of form, sound, etc." | Implicit: "The implicit philosophical context that this verse concerns the inability to perceive the Buddha's true nature (dharmakāya) through conventional perceptions of form, sound, etc."]
glossary:
- སྐྱེ་བོ་ : beings [Noun from `སྐྱེ་བ`: to be born; referring to ordinary sentient beings or people; functions as part of the Agent in the sentence]
- དེ་དག : those [Demonstrative pronoun + plural marker; specifies the particular types of beings; completes the Agent phrase "those beings" who approach the Buddha incorrectly]
- ང : me [Personal pronoun, first person singular; here referring to the Buddha speaking in first person; functions as the Patient/object of perception]
- མི་ : not [Negative particle used with present/future verbs; negates the action of seeing/perceiving]
- མཐོང༌ : see [Present tense verb from root `མཐོང་བ`: to see, perceive; in this context refers to the failure to perceive the Buddha's true nature (dharmakāya) rather than mere physical seeing; functions as the main Process of the sentence]

ucca_formatted:
སངས་རྒྱས་རྣམས་ནི་ཆོས་ཉིད་ལྟ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the philosophical statement about how Buddhas should be viewed" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སངས་རྒྱས་རྣམས [Type: Participant | Desc: "The Buddhas who are to be viewed in relation to dharmatā" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ནི [Type: Function | Desc: "Tibetan topic marker indicating focus on Buddhas" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལྟ [Type: Process-State | Desc: "Philosophical state of understanding rather than physical action of seeing" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་ཉིད [Type: Participant-Center | Desc: "The central concept of dharmatā or the ultimate nature of reality through which Buddhas should be viewed" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཆོས་ཀྱི་སྐུ [Type: Participant-Implicit | Desc: "Implicit concept of dharma-kāya connecting Buddha and dharmatā" | Implicit: "The concept of dharma-kāya that connects Buddha and dharmatā"]
        ├── [relation to Buddha] [Type: Elaborator-Attribute | Desc: "Connection between dharma-kāya and Buddhas" | Implicit: "Connection between dharma-kāya and Buddhas"]
            └── སངས་རྒྱས་རྣམས [Type: Participant | Desc: "The Buddhas who are to be viewed in relation to dharmatā" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [relation to dharmatā] [Type: Elaborator-Attribute | Desc: "Connection between dharma-kāya and dharmatā" | Implicit: "Connection between dharma-kāya and dharmatā"]
            └── ཆོས་ཉིད [Type: Participant-Center | Desc: "The central concept of dharmatā or the ultimate nature of reality through which Buddhas should be viewed" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- སངས་རྒྱས་ : Buddha [Noun base; from `སངས་` (purified/eliminated) and `རྒྱས་` (developed/expanded); refers to awakened beings who have attained complete enlightenment; functions as the primary Participant in the scene]
- རྣམས་ : plural marker [Plural suffix; indicates multiple Buddhas; makes clear this refers to all Buddhas collectively rather than a single Buddha]
- ནི་ : topic marker [Grammatical particle; marks the preceding term as the topic of discussion; emphasizes that Buddhas specifically are the focus of this philosophical statement]
- ཆོས་ཉིད་ : dharmatā [Noun compound; `ཆོས་` (dharma/phenomena) + `ཉིད་` (itself/essence); refers to the ultimate nature of reality or true nature of phenomena; functions as the Participant-Center through which Buddhas should be viewed]
- ལྟ། : view/see [Verbal root; here used in the philosophical sense of understanding or perceiving rather than physical sight; indicates how Buddhas should be understood in relation to dharmatā; functions as the Process-State of the scene]
- །： verse ending marker [Punctuation; indicates the end of a verse line]

ucca_formatted:
འདྲེན་པ་རྣམས་ནི་ཆོས་ཀྱི་སྐུ། །ཆོས་ཉིད་ཤེས་པར་བྱ་མིན་པས། །དེ་ནི་རྣམ་པར་ཤེས་མི་ནུས། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདྲེན་པ་རྣམས་ནི་ཆོས་ཀྱི་སྐུ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene establishing the nature of guides" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདྲེན་པ་རྣམས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The buddhas who act as guides" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ནི [Type: Function | Desc: "Topic marker functioning as equative copula" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཆོས་ཀྱི་སྐུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "What the guides are equated with" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་ཉིད་ཤེས་པར་བྱ་མིན་པས། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene establishing the unknowability of dharmatā" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་ཉིད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The true nature of phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཤེས་པར་བྱ་མིན [Type: Negated-Process | Desc: "The process of knowing that is negated" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── པས [Type: Linker | Desc: "Causal connector" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [ordinary beings] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implied agent who cannot know dharmatā" | Implicit: "The implied agent who cannot know dharmatā"]
    └── དེ་ནི་རྣམ་པར་ཤེས་མི་ནུས། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Third scene stating the consequence of dharmatā's nature" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Reference back to dharmatā" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ནི [Type: Function | Desc: "Topic marker" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རྣམ་པར་ཤེས [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of fully knowing or cognizing" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མི་ནུས [Type: Negated-Process | Desc: "Inability to perform the process" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [ordinary beings] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implied agent who cannot cognize dharmatā" | Implicit: "The implied agent who cannot cognize dharmatā"]
glossary:
- འདྲེན་པ་ : guides [Noun from `འདྲེན་པ`: to lead, guide; here referring to enlightened beings who guide others to liberation; functions as Agent in the first scene]
- རྣམས་ : plural marker [plural suffix indicating multiple guides/buddhas]
- ནི་ : are [topic marker functioning as equative copula; marks the subject and establishes identity relationship]
- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : dharma's [Genitive of `ཆོས`: dharma, phenomena, teaching; possessive marker connecting to the following term]
- སྐུ། : embodiment [Noun `སྐུ`: body, embodiment, kāya; specifically referring to dharmakāya, the ultimate reality body of a buddha; functions as Patient in equative statement]
- ཆོས་ཉིད་ : ultimate reality [Noun `ཆོས་ཉིད`: dharmatā, true nature of phenomena, suchness; the absolute reality beyond conceptualization; functions as Patient in second scene]
- ཤེས་པར་ : to know [Verbal noun from `ཤེས་པ`: to know, understand; with terminative case marker indicating purpose]
- བྱ་ : to be done [Auxiliary verb indicating something that should be done]
- མིན་ : is not [Negative copula negating the preceding verbal construction]
- པས། : because [Instrumental case marker functioning as causal connector between scenes]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun referring back to dharmatā/ultimate reality; functions as Patient in third scene]
- ནི་ : topic marker [Marks the subject of the third scene]
- རྣམ་པར་ : thoroughly [Adverbial modifier intensifying the following verb; indicates completeness]
- ཤེས་ : know [Verb `ཤེས་པ`: to know, understand, cognize; the process of fully knowing]
- མི་ : not [Negative prefix]
- ནུས། : possible [Verb `ནུས་པ`: to be able to, can; indicating inability to perform the process]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene capturing the entire question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Person being directly addressed with the question" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སེམས [Type: Process | Desc: "The cognitive process of thinking/contemplating" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Interrogative phrase indicating manner of thinking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Buddha] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implicit speaker (Buddha) who is asking the question" | Implicit: "Implicit speaker (Buddha) who is asking the question"]
    ├── [interrogative] [Type: Function | Desc: "Indicates that this utterance functions as a question" | Implicit: "Indicates that this utterance functions as a question"]
    └── འདི [Type: Participant-Topic | Desc: "The demonstrative referring to the topic being questioned about" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [whether one should view the Tathāgata through perfect marks] [Type: Elaborator-Implicit | Desc: "Implicit content about viewing the Tathāgata through perfect marks" | Implicit: "Implicit content about viewing the Tathāgata through perfect marks"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Proper name; the direct addressee of Buddha's question; functions as the Participant-Addressee in the sentence]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to the specific topic being questioned about; indicates the immediate subject matter regarding viewing the Tathāgata through perfect marks]
- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [Interrogative adverbial phrase; literally "in what manner of thinking"; introduces the question and marks the interrogative nature of the utterance]
- སེམས། : do you think? [Present tense verb `སེམས་པ་`: to think, contemplate; here functioning as the main Process of the sentence with an interrogative force; marks the end of the question]

ucca_formatted:
མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་སོ་སྙམ་དུ་འཛིན་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་ཁྱོད་ཀྱིས་དེ་ལྟར་བལྟ་བར་མི་བྱ་སྟེ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing two main scenes connected by a conditional relationship" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་སོ་སྙམ་དུ་འཛིན་ན [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing the conditional premise - someone holding a certain view about Buddha's enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── Sentient beings who grasp with true existence [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit people who hold the incorrect view about Buddha's enlightenment" | Implicit: "Sentient beings who grasp with true existence"]
        ├── འཛིན [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of holding or grasping onto a particular view" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་སོ་སྙམ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Embedded scene representing the content of the view being held" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ [Type: Participant-Center | Desc: "The Buddha as the central subject of the proposition" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་སོ་སྙམ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of becoming enlightened as conceived in the view" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ [Type: Participant-Goal | Desc: "The goal or state that was attained - perfect enlightenment" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས [Type: Elaborator-Manner | Desc: "The means or cause of enlightenment as mistakenly conceived - the Buddha's physical perfections" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དུ [Type: Function | Desc: "Grammatical particle connecting the mental activity to its content" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Punctuation mark - shad" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ན [Type: Conditional-Linker | Desc: "Conditional marker establishing the if-then relationship between the two scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་ཁྱོད་ཀྱིས་དེ་ལྟར་བལྟ་བར་མི་བྱ་སྟེ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene describing the instruction to Subhuti not to view things in the manner described in the first scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ཁྱོད་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The addressee of the Buddha's instruction" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བལྟ་བར་མི་བྱ [Type: Process | Desc: "The negated action - should not view or conceive" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ལྟར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Refers back to the incorrect view described in the first scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྟེ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector indicating contrasting information would follow" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Punctuation mark - shad" | Implicit: ""]
        └── Buddha's dharmakaya/emptiness nature [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implicit proper object of view - Buddha's dharmakaya or emptiness nature that should be properly apprehended" | Implicit: "Buddha's dharmakaya/emptiness nature"]
glossary:
- མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་ : by means of perfect physical marks [Instrumental of `མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ་`: perfect/excellent marks/characteristics; indicating the mistaken means by which enlightenment is thought to be achieved; functions as an Elaborator of manner in the semantic structure]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : the Tathagata [Noun phrase, honorific title of Buddha; literally "thus-gone one"; central subject of the proposition; functions as the main Participant-Center of the embedded scene]

- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ : the Arhat [Nominal modifier of Tathagata; "foe-destroyer" or one who has destroyed all enemies of delusion; part of the Buddha's epithets; functions as part of the central participant]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [Adverbial from `ཡང་དག་པ་`: perfect, complete, true; modifies the state of enlightenment; functions as part of the Goal specification]

- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive of `རྫོགས་པ་`: complete, perfect; modifies enlightenment; part of the noun phrase indicating the goal state]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་ : into enlightenment [Terminative case of `བྱང་ཆུབ་`: enlightenment, bodhi; the destination or goal state being attained; functions as the Participant-Goal in the semantic structure]

- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly [Adverbial from `མངོན་པ་`: manifest, evident; describes how the Buddha achieved enlightenment; part of the process description]

- རྫོགས་པར་ : completely [Adverbial from `རྫོགས་པ་`: complete, perfect; intensifies the process of enlightenment; part of the process description]

- སངས་རྒྱས་སོ་ : became enlightened [Verb `སངས་རྒྱས་` (to become enlightened, to become a Buddha) with final particle `སོ་` marking completed action; the primary process being misunderstood in the erroneous view; functions as the main Process in the embedded scene]

- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking [Quotative construction; `སྙམ་`: to think, consider; `དུ་`: complementizer connecting mental activity to its content; marks the content of the mistaken conception; functions as a connector between the mental activity and its content]

- འཛིན་ན་ : if one holds/grasps [Conditional form of `འཛིན་`: to grasp, hold, cling; indicates the action of clinging to a mistaken view; functions as the main Process of the first scene]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of the Buddha's disciple who is being addressed; the addressee of the instruction; functions as part of the Agent in the second scene]

- ཁྱོད་ཀྱིས་ : by you [Agentive/Instrumental of `ཁྱོད་`: you; marks Subhuti as the one who should not hold the wrong view; functions as the Agent in the second scene]

- དེ་ལྟར་ : in that way [Adverbial construction; `དེ་`: that; `ལྟར་`: like, as; refers back to the incorrect view described earlier; functions as the Patient in the second scene]

- བལྟ་བར་ : to view [Terminative of `བལྟ་བ་`: to view, observe, consider; the action being negated; part of the main Process in the second scene]

- མི་བྱ་ : should not do [Negative imperative form of `བྱ་`: to do; negates the action of viewing incorrectly; completes the Process in the second scene]

- སྟེ་ : because [Conjunction indicating that a reason or contrasting information would follow; connects this statement to implied further explanation; functions as a Linker in the semantic structure]

ucca_formatted:
རབ་འབྱོར་མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ་མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པ་མེད་དོ། ། [Type: Scene | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས [Type: Participant-Instrument | Implicit: ""]
        └── [conventional designations, not ultimate reality] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "implicit" | Implicit: "Clarifies that perfect characteristics are merely conventional designations, not ultimate reality"]
    ├── [one] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "implicit" | Implicit: "Implicit agent who is not awakening through characteristics"]
    ├── མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་སངས་རྒྱས་པ [Type: Process | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་བྱང་ཆུབ [Type: Participant-Center | Implicit: ""]
    └── མེད་དོ [Type: State | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར : Subhuti [Vocative case; name of the Buddha's disciple to whom the teaching is addressed; functions as the recipient of the discourse]

- མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པས : by perfect characteristics [Instrumental case of `མཚན་ཕུན་སུམ་ཚོགས་པ`: perfect/excellent marks/characteristics; indicates means or instrument through which the action does not occur; conventional designations, not ultimate reality]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ : Tathagata [Title of the Buddha meaning 'thus-gone one' or 'one who has gone to suchness'; central participant in this semantic structure]

- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ : Arhat [Title meaning 'foe-destroyer'; one who has destroyed the enemies of afflictions; part of the Buddha's epithets]

- ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་ : perfectly complete [Genitive of `ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པ`: completely/perfectly accomplished; modifies བྱང་ཆུབ (enlightenment)]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་ཏུ : into enlightenment [Terminative case of `བྱང་ཆུབ`: enlightenment, bodhi; indicates the goal or state]

- མངོན་པར་རྫོགས་པར་ : manifestly, completely [Adverbial modifier; describes how the Buddha does not awaken; the core process in the UCCA structure]

- སངས་རྒྱས་པ : awakened/became enlightened [Verbal noun from `སངས་རྒྱས`: Buddha, to become enlightened; the main process being negated]

- མེད་དོ : does not exist [Negative existential verb `མེད་` with final particle `དོ`; indicates the state of non-existence; negates the entire preceding proposition]
