རབ་འབྱོར་ཁྱོད་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས། ཆོས་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་རྣམ་པར་བཤིག་པའམ་ཆད་པར་བཏགས་པའོ་སྙམ་དུ་འཛིན་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་དེ་ལྟར་བལྟ་བར་མི་བྱ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The entire passage addressing Subhuti about bodhisattvas' understanding of phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ཁྱོད་འདི་སྙམ་དུ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས། ཆོས་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་རྣམ་པར་བཤིག་པའམ་ཆད་པར་བཏགས་པའོ་སྙམ་དུ་འཛིན་ན། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "The hypothetical scenario of what Subhuti might think about bodhisattvas' view" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ཁྱོད་འདི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Address to Subhuti about what he might think" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The person being addressed (Subhuti)" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཁྱོད [Type: Addressee | Desc: "Direct address to Subhuti (you)" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of thinking or considering" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས། ཆོས་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་རྣམ་པར་བཤིག་པའམ་ཆད་པར་བཏགས་པའོ་སྙམ་དུ་འཛིན་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The content of what Subhuti might think about bodhisattvas' understanding" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept of those who have entered the bodhisattva path" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The phenomena that might be considered as destroyed" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རྣམ་པར་བཤིག་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of destroying or breaking apart phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྙམ་དུ་འཛིན་ན [Type: Ground | Desc: "The conditional ground of holding this view" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆད་པར་བཏགས་པའོ [Type: State | Desc: "The state of labeling phenomena as annihilated" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འམ [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connector between the two concepts of destroying and labeling as annihilated" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་དེ་ལྟར་བལྟ་བར་མི་བྱ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The Buddha's admonition against the previously described view" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The person being addressed (Subhuti)" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Reference to the previously mentioned concept/way of thinking" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ལྟར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner adverbial indicating how something should not be viewed" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བལྟ་བར་མི་བྱ་སྟེ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of not viewing/considering in a certain way" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Buddha] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit speaker (Buddha) giving the instruction" | Implicit: "The implicit speaker (Buddha) giving the instruction"]
    └── [contrast between views] [Type: Contrast | Desc: "Implicit contrast between the hypothetical wrong view and the correct understanding" | Implicit: "Implicit contrast between the hypothetical wrong view and the correct understanding"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name; one of Buddha's chief disciples; functions as addressee/recipient in this discourse]
- ཁྱོད་ : you [second person singular pronoun addressing Subhuti directly; marks him as the recipient of Buddha's instruction]
- འདི་ : this [demonstrative pronoun; refers to the thought or idea that follows; functions as a pointer to the content of Subhuti's potential thinking]
- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking [verbal noun from `སྙམ་པ་`: to think/consider; indicates that what follows is a thought or consideration in Subhuti's mind]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : enlightenment [Sanskrit: bodhi; the state of awakening that is the goal of Buddhist practice; forms compound with the following term]
- སེམས་དཔའི་ : of the hero/warrior [Genitive of `སེམས་དཔའ་`: mind-hero, one who strives for enlightenment for all beings; forms compound with previous term to mean "bodhisattva"]
- ཐེག་པ་ : vehicle [Sanskrit: yāna; refers to the path or spiritual approach; here specifically the Mahayana or "Great Vehicle" of Buddhism]
- ལ་ : in/on/to [Locative particle indicating relationship to the vehicle/path; connects the bodhisattvas to their path]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : correctly/perfectly [Adverbial from `ཡང་དག་པ་`: correct, perfect, authentic; describes the manner of entering the path]
- ཞུགས་པ་ : who have entered [Verbal noun from `འཇུག་པ་`: to enter/engage with; refers to those who have properly embarked on the bodhisattva path]
- རྣམས་ : plural marker [indicates multiple bodhisattvas who have entered the path]
- ཀྱིས། : by/through [Instrumental case marker; indicates that what follows is something done by the bodhisattvas]
- ཆོས་ : phenomena/dharmas [Sanskrit: dharma; refers to all elements of existence, mental and physical; here the objects of potential destruction]
- གང་ལ་ལ་ : any/whatever [indefinite pronoun; indicates unspecified phenomena or elements of reality]
- ཞིག་ : some [indefinite article; further emphasizes the indefinite nature of the phenomena being discussed]
- རྣམ་པར་ : completely [adverbial prefix indicating thoroughness; intensifies the following verb]
- བཤིག་པའམ་ : destroyed [Verbal noun from `འཇིག་པ་`: to destroy/break down + connective `འམ་`; indicates complete dismantling of phenomena]
- ཆད་པར་ : as annihilated [Terminative of `ཆད་པ་`: to be cut off/annihilated; expressing nihilistic view that phenomena cease to exist entirely]
- བཏགས་པའོ་ : are labeled as [Verbal noun from `འདོགས་པ་`: to label/designate/impute + assertive particle `འོ་`; indicates conceptual designation rather than actual reality]
- སྙམ་དུ་ : thinking [verbal noun; closing the thought content, indicating the end of the hypothetical consideration]
- འཛིན་ན། : if you hold/maintain [Conditional form of `འཛིན་པ་`: to hold/grasp/maintain; establishes the conditional premise for Buddha's following instruction]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name repeated; marks a new section of discourse directed to the same recipient]
- དེ་ : that [demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the previously described way of thinking]
- དེ་ལྟར་ : in that way [demonstrative adverb; refers to the manner of thinking just described]
- བལྟ་བར་ : to view/consider [Terminative of `ལྟ་བ་`: to view/look/consider; refers to the conceptual understanding]
- མི་ : not [negative particle; negates the following verb]
- བྱ་ : should do [future/imperative form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do/make; indicates instruction or command]
- སྟེ། : that is to say [connective particle; indicates that further explanation will follow]

ucca_formatted:
བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས། ཆོས་གང་ཡང་རྣམ་པར་བཤིག་པའམ། ཆད་པར་བཏགས་པ་མེད་དོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire statement about bodhisattvas and their relation to phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent performing the action - those who have correctly entered the Bodhisattva vehicle" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The vehicle that is entered - the Bodhisattva vehicle" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པ་རྣམས [Type: State | Desc: "The state of having correctly entered the vehicle, modified from Process to State to reflect a condition rather than an ongoing action" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཡང་དག་པར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Describes the manner in which they have entered - correctly/properly" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་གང་ཡང་རྣམ་པར་བཤིག་པའམ། ཆད་པར་བཏགས་པ་མེད་དོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main process describing what bodhisattvas do not do with respect to phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་གང་ཡང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The phenomena that are not deconstructed or conceptualized as annihilated" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རྣམ་པར་བཤིག་པའམ། ཆད་པར་བཏགས་པ [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "The two parallel processes that bodhisattvas do not engage in with respect to phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རྣམ་པར་བཤིག་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The first scene describing the conceptual process of analytically deconstructing phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
                └── རྣམ་པར་བཤིག་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The mental process of analytically deconstructing phenomena, reflecting the understanding of emptiness without nihilism" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆད་པར་བཏགས་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The second scene describing the conceptual process of labeling phenomena as annihilated" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── བཏགས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The mental process of conceptually imputing or labeling" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཆད་པར [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of mentally labeling as cut off or annihilated, changed from State to Process to reflect active conceptualization" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འམ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conjunction linking the two parallel scenes" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མེད་དོ [Type: Function-Negation | Desc: "Negation that applies to both parallel scenes, with a modified type to clarify its scope applies to both 'analytically deconstructing' and 'conceptualizing as annihilated'" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [the ultimate nature of phenomena] [Type: Implicit Participant-Goal | Desc: "The implicit reference to the ultimate nature of phenomena (ཆོས་ཉིད) that Bodhisattvas realize, which causes them to neither destroy phenomena nor conceptualize them as annihilated" | Implicit: "ཆོས་ཉིད"]
glossary:
- བྱང་ཆུབ་ : awakening [Compound noun from `བྱང་` (purified) + `ཆུབ་` (perfected); refers to enlightenment or Buddha-nature; functions as a qualifier in a compound]
- སེམས་དཔའི་ : hero's [Genitive of `སེམས་དཔའ་`: mind-hero/bodhisattva; one who is committed to attaining awakening for the benefit of all sentient beings; functions as possessive modifier]
- ཐེག་པ་ : vehicle [Noun: path, vehicle (yana); refers to the systematic approach or methodology for spiritual development; functions as Patient in the UCCA structure]
- ལ་ : in/on [Locative particle indicating location or direction; here connects to "vehicle" to show what is entered; functions as adposition]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : correctly/authentically [Adverbial form of `ཡང་དག་པ་`: correct, authentic, perfect; describes the manner of entering the path; functions as an Adverbial modifier]
- ཞུགས་པ་ : who have entered [Verbal noun from `འཇུག་`: to enter, engage in; past tense form indicating those who have committed to/entered; functions as main verb in a subordinate clause]
- རྣམས་ : those [Plural marker: indicates multiple practitioners; functions as nominal pluralizer]
- ཀྱིས། : by [Instrumental case marker: indicates agency, showing who performs the action; marks the Agent of the main clause]
- ཆོས་ : phenomena [Noun: dharmas, phenomena, elements of reality; the objects that are not to be deconstructed; functions as Patient in the main clause]
- གང་ཡང་ : any/whatsoever [Combination of indefinite pronoun `གང་` (whatever) + emphatic particle `ཡང་` (even, also); emphasizes the totality of phenomena; functions as a quantifier]
- རྣམ་པར་ : analytically [Adverbial form from `རྣམ་པ་`: aspect, manner; indicates a thorough, detailed analysis; functions as an Adverbial modifier]
- བཤིག་པའམ། : deconstruct or [Verbal noun from `འཇིག་`: to destroy, deconstruct + disjunctive particle `འམ་`: or; describes the analytical breaking down of phenomena; functions as first part of parallel process]
- ཆད་པར་ : as annihilated [Terminative form of `ཆད་པ་`: cut off, annihilated; refers to nihilistic view that phenomena cease to exist; functions as adverbial describing manner of labeling]
- བཏགས་པ་ : label/conceptualize [Verbal noun from `འདོགས་`: to label, impute; refers to mental process of conceptual designation; functions as second part of parallel process]
- མེད་དོ། : do not [Negation verb `མེད་` (do not exist/have) + sentence-final particle `དོ`; negates both parallel processes; functions as main verb negation of the entire statement]

ucca_formatted:
ཡང་རབ་འབྱོར་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་གང་གིས་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་གངྒཱའི་ཀླུང་གི་བྱེ་མ་སྙེད་དག་རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན་གྱིས་རབ་ཏུ་གང་བར་བྱས་ཏེ་སྦྱིན་པ་བྱིན་པ་བས། བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་གང་གིས་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་བདག་མེད་ཅིང་སྐྱེ་བ་མེད་པ་ལ་བཟོད་པ་ཐོབ་ན། དེ་ཉིད་གཞི་དེ་ལས་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ཆོས་མང་དུ་གྲངས་མེད་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་བསྐྱེད་དོ། ། [Type: Conditional | Desc: "The root node representing the conditional comparison between material giving and dharmic realization." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཡང [Type: Discourse | Desc: "A discourse marker introducing a new topic in the teaching." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The addressee of the Buddha's teaching." | Implicit: ""]

        ├── རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་གང་གིས [Type: Elaborate | Desc: "An elaboration of who might perform this act of generosity." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་གངྒཱའི་ཀླུང་གི་བྱེ་མ་སྙེད་དག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object that would be filled with precious substances." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The worlds or universe systems that would be filled." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གངྒཱའི་ཀླུང་གི་བྱེ་མ་སྙེད་དག [Type: Quantity | Desc: "The quantity of world systems, comparable to grains of sand in the Ganges." | Implicit: ""]
            └── གྱི [Type: Relator | Desc: "A relator connecting world systems to the quantity." | Implicit: ""]

            ├── གང་བར་བྱས [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of filling the world systems." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རབ་ཏུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "An adverbial indicating the thoroughness of the filling." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཏེ [Type: Linker | Desc: "A linker connecting the filling with the giving." | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྦྱིན་པ་བྱིན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of giving the filled world systems as a gift." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The precious substances used to fill the world systems." | Implicit: ""]
        └── གྱིས [Type: Relator | Desc: "A relator indicating the instrument used for filling." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བས [Type: Comparative | Desc: "A comparative marker indicating the comparison between the two scenarios." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་གང་གིས་ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་བདག་མེད་ཅིང་སྐྱེ་བ་མེད་པ་ལ་བཟོད་པ་ཐོབ་ན། དེ་ཉིད་གཞི་དེ་ལས་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ཆོས་མང་དུ་གྲངས་མེད་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་བསྐྱེད་དོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The second part of the conditional, describing the greater merit of dharmic realization." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་གང་གིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The bodhisattva who obtains patient acceptance." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི་བདག་མེད་ཅིང་སྐྱེ་བ་མེད་པ་ལ་བཟོད་པ་ཐོབ [Type: Complex-State | Desc: "The complex state of realization about the dharma discourse being selfless and unborn." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་ཀྱི་རྣམ་གྲངས་འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The dharma discourse that is the object of patient acceptance." | Implicit: ""]
                └── བདག་མེད་ཅིང་སྐྱེ་བ་མེད་པ [Type: Attribute | Desc: "The attributes of the dharma discourse as being selfless and unborn." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བདག་མེད་ཅིང་སྐྱེ་བ་མེད་པ [Type: Attribute | Desc: "The attributes of the dharma discourse as being selfless and unborn." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཀྱི [Type: Relator | Desc: "A relator connecting the dharma discourse to its category." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཅིང [Type: Linker | Desc: "A linker connecting the two attributes of selflessness and non-arising." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ལ [Type: Relator | Desc: "A relator connecting the attributes to the patient acceptance." | Implicit: ""]
            └── བཟོད་པ་ཐོབ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of obtaining patient acceptance of the dharma." | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་ཉིད་གཞི་དེ་ལས་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ཆོས་མང་དུ་གྲངས་མེད་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་བསྐྱེད་དོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of generating immeasurable merit from obtaining patient acceptance." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ཆོས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The heaps of merit that are generated." | Implicit: ""]
                └── མང་དུ་གྲངས་མེད་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ [Type: Elaboration | Desc: "An elaboration on the quantity of merit generated, emphasizing its immeasurable nature." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་ཉིད [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who generates merit, referring back to the bodhisattva." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གཞི་དེ་ལས [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "The basis or source from which the merit is generated." | Implicit: ""]
            └── བསྐྱེད་དོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of generating or producing merit." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ན [Type: Conditional | Desc: "A conditional marker indicating the condition for generating merit." | Implicit: ""]
    └── ། [Type: Function | Desc: "A punctuation mark indicating the end of the statement." | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཡང་ : Furthermore [discourse marker; introduces a new topic or example in Buddha's teaching; functions as a discourse connector]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [proper name; primary disciple of Buddha; addressee of the teaching; functions as Participant-Agent]

- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་ : any son of good family [nominative + disjunctive particle `འམ་`; refers to male spiritual practitioners of good lineage; part of compound subject]

- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་ : or daughter of good family [nominative; refers to female spiritual practitioners of good lineage; part of compound subject]

- གང་གིས་ : whoever [interrogative pronoun + instrumental case; marks the hypothetical agent; functions as relative pronoun introducing the conditional clause]

- འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ : of world [genitive of `འཇིག་རྟེན་`: world, universe; modifies 'systems'; functions as possessive modifier]

- ཁམས་ : systems [noun; refers to realms or domains of existence; object being filled; part of Patient]

- གངྒཱའི་ : of the Ganges [genitive of Sanskrit loanword `གངྒཱ་`: Ganges River; modifies 'sand'; quantifying reference]

- ཀླུང་གི་ : river's [genitive of `ཀླུང་`: river; modifies 'sand'; part of quantifying phrase]

- བྱེ་མ་ : sand [noun; literal sand grains; used as a measure of quantity]

- སྙེད་ : as many as [quantifier; indicates equivalence in number; "as numerous as sand grains"]

- དག་ : plural [plural marker; emphasizes multiple world systems]

- རིན་པོ་ཆེ་ : precious substances [noun; valuable materials; object used for filling]

- སྣ་བདུན་ : seven kinds of [numeral + classifier; refers to traditional seven types of precious materials (gold, silver, etc.)]

- གྱིས་ : with [instrumental case marker; indicates the means by which the filling is accomplished]

- རབ་ཏུ་ : completely [adverb; intensifier indicating thoroughness of the action]

- གང་བར་ : filling [verb stem `གང་བ་`: to fill + terminative case; describes the process of filling completely]

- བྱས་ཏེ་ : having done [past stem of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do + connective particle; links the filling action with the giving action]

- སྦྱིན་པ་ : generosity [noun; refers to the act of charitable giving; first of the six perfections]

- བྱིན་པ་ : gives [past stem of `སྦྱིན་པ་`: to give; completes the charitable action]

- བས། : than [comparative particle; indicates comparison between the two scenarios]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [compound noun; being dedicated to awakening for the benefit of all; agent of the second scenario]

- གང་གིས་ : whoever [interrogative pronoun + instrumental case; refers to the hypothetical bodhisattva; introduces the relative clause]

- ཆོས་ཀྱི་ : of Dharma [genitive of `ཆོས་`: Dharma, teaching; modifies 'discourse'; possessive relationship]

- རྣམ་གྲངས་ : discourse [noun; classified teaching or enumeration of doctrines; object of patient acceptance]

- འདི་ : this [demonstrative pronoun; refers to the immediate teaching being discussed]

- བདག་མེད་ : selflessness [noun; absence of inherent self or identity; key philosophical concept]

- ཅིང་ : and [connective particle; joins the two attributes of the teaching]

- སྐྱེ་བ་མེད་པ་ : non-arising [verbal noun + negation; absence of production or origination; philosophical concept]

- ལ་ : toward [allative case marker; indicates direction of acceptance]

- བཟོད་པ་ : patient acceptance [noun; deep understanding and tolerance; technical term for realization]

- ཐོབ་ : attains [present stem of `ཐོབ་པ་`: to obtain, attain; describes the achievement of understanding]

- ན། : if [conditional particle; marks the protasis of the conditional statement]

- དེ་ཉིད་ : that very person [emphatic demonstrative; refers back to the bodhisattva; Agent of merit generation]

- གཞི་དེ་ : that basis [demonstrative + noun; refers to the foundation of patient acceptance]

- ལས་ : from [ablative case marker; indicates source or origin of merit]

- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ : of merit [genitive of `བསོད་ནམས་`: merit, positive karma; possessive relationship]

- ཕུང་པོ་ : heap [noun; literally "aggregate"; large accumulation]

- ཆེས་ : much [adverb; intensifier indicating great quantity]

- མང་དུ་ : abundantly [adverb; indicates large quantity]

- གྲངས་མེད་ : incalculable [adjective; literally "numberless"; beyond counting]

- དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་ : immeasurable [verbal noun; beyond measurement; emphasizes vastness]

- བསྐྱེད་དོ། : generates [future/present stem of `སྐྱེད་པ་`: to generate, produce + final particle; indicates completion of statement]

    ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object of potential grasping that should not be grasped with true existence" | Implicit: ""]

        ├── མི་ [Type: Negation | Desc: "Negation of the action of grasping" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གཟུང་བར་བྱའོ [Type: Process-Core | Desc: "Core action being negated" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [བདེན་ཞེན་གྱིས] [Type: Implicit-Qualifier | Desc: "Implicit philosophical qualification from commentary explaining the specific type of grasping to be avoided" | Implicit: "Philosophical qualification from commentary explaining the specific type of grasping to be avoided"]
    └── [relation] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit relationship showing Subhuti is being addressed about bodhisattvas" | Implicit: "Relationship showing Subhuti is being addressed about bodhisattvas"]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Person being addressed in the instruction" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Agents who should follow the instruction" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཡང་ : furthermore [Adverbial linker; connects this statement to previous discourse; functions as a discourse connector bridging this instruction with previous teachings]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; the direct addressee of the Buddha's teaching; vocative case indicating the person being directly addressed]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔས་ : bodhisattvas [Instrumental/agentive case of `བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་`: bodhisattva; the spiritual practitioners who are the agents following this instruction; functions as the grammatical subject]

- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ : of merit [Genitive of `བསོད་ནམས་`: merit, positive karma; modifies the following noun as possessive; connects merit to the heap/collection]

- ཕུང་པོ་ : heap [Nominative of `ཕུང་པོ་`: heap, aggregate, skandha; refers to collection or accumulation of merit; functions as the patient/object of the instruction]

- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely [Adverbial modifier; from `ཡོངས་སུ་`: thoroughly, entirely; modifies the manner of the action indicating completeness or totality]

- གཟུང་བར་ : to grasp [Future/purposive form of `འཛིན་པ་`: to hold, grasp, conceptualize; indicates the action being negated; with implicit meaning of grasping with inherent existence]

- མི་ : not [Negative particle; negates the following verb; indicates prohibition of the action]

- བྱའོ : should do [Final verb form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do, perform; here functions as an auxiliary verb completing the verbal phrase "should not grasp"; includes the assertive marker འོ]

- ། : [sentence marker; indicates completion of statement]

ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔས་བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ཡོངས་སུ་གཟུང་བར་མི་བགྱི་ལགས་སམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene representing Subhuti's question to the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་རབ་འབྱོར་ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker who is asking the question" | Implicit: ""]

        ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔས་ [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agents who might or might not grasp merit" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ་ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object that might or might not be grasped" | Implicit: ""]

glossary:
- ཚེ་དང་ལྡན་པ་ : Venerable [Honorific title; compound of `ཚེ་`: life + `དང་`: and + `ལྡན་པ་`: possessing; an epithet for respected monks; functions as part of Agent who is asking the question]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; one of Buddha's chief disciples known for his understanding of emptiness; functions as the main Agent who is asking the question]

- གྱིས་ : by [Ergative particle marking the agent; indicates Subhuti as the performer of the action of asking]

- གསོལ་པ། : asked [Past tense honorific verb for `གསོལ་བ་`: to ask, request; indicates the speech action directed toward a superior; functions as the main Process in this scene]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་`: conquered + `ལྡན་`: possessing + `འདས་`: transcended; refers to the Buddha as the Recipient of the question]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔས་ : should bodhisattvas [Ergative case of `བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་`: bodhisattva; literally "awakening hero"; refers to those on the path to enlightenment; functions as the Agent in the embedded question]

- བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ : of merit [Genitive case of `བསོད་ནམས་`: merit, positive karma; connects merit to the following noun; part of the Patient object in the question]

- ཕུང་པོ་ : heap [Noun meaning "aggregate, collection, skandha"; here refers to accumulation of merit; completes the Patient object that might be grasped]

- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely [Adverbial modifier; compound of `ཡོངས་`: all, entire + `སུ་`: terminative particle; indicates thoroughness of the action; modifies the verb "grasp"]

- གཟུང་བར་ : grasp [Future form of `འཛིན་པ་`: to hold, grasp, cling to; with terminative particle forming a verbal noun; the main Process being questioned]

- མི་ : not [Negation particle; negates the following verb; indicates the negative aspect of the question]

- བགྱི་ : do [Honorific future/present form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do; part of the question about whether something should or should not be done]

- ལགས་སམ། : is it so? [Interrogative marker; combination of honorific copula `ལགས་` + interrogative particle `སམ`; completes the question with a polite, formal tone]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་ཡོངས་སུ་གཟུང་མོད་ཀྱིས། ལོག་པར་མི་བཟུང་སྟེ་ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The entire utterance by the Buddha instructing Subhuti on the proper and improper ways of grasping merit" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha who is speaking and giving instruction" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of speaking or teaching by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The disciple being addressed by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཡོངས་སུ་གཟུང་མོད་ཀྱིས། ལོག་པར་མི་བཟུང་སྟེ [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "The contrasting instructions about proper and improper ways of grasping merit" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཡོངས་སུ་གཟུང་མོད་ཀྱིས [Type: Scene | Desc: "The instruction to conventionally grasp merit completely" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གཟུང [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of grasping or holding onto merit in a conventional sense" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "Subhuti as the implied recipient of the instruction who should grasp merit conventionally" | Implicit: "Subhuti is implied as the one who should grasp merit"]
            └── ཡོངས་སུ [Type: Adverbial-Manner | Desc: "The manner in which merit should be conventionally grasped - completely or fully" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ལོག་པར་མི་བཟུང་སྟེ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The instruction not to grasp merit with mistaken view of inherent existence" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མི་བཟུང [Type: Process | Desc: "The negative instruction not to grasp merit in the wrong way" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ལོག་པར [Type: Adverbial-Manner | Desc: "The manner in which merit should not be grasped - wrongly or incorrectly" | Implicit: ""]
                └── བདེན་ཞེན [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The specific elaboration of what makes the grasping wrong - belief in inherent existence" | Implicit: "This explains what makes the grasping wrong"]
            ├── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implicit object (merit) that should not be grasped with the wrong view" | Implicit: "The merit accumulation that should not be grasped wrongly"]
            └── བདེན་ཞེན [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The specific elaboration of what makes the grasping wrong - belief in inherent existence" | Implicit: "This explains what makes the grasping wrong"]
        └── མོད་ཀྱིས [Type: Linker-Concessive | Desc: "Concessive connector indicating 'although X, not Y' relationship between the two instructions" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བསོད་ནམས་ཀྱི་ཕུང་པོ [Type: Implicit Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implicit object (merit) that is being discussed in the entire discourse as what should be grasped conventionally but not with inherent existence belief" | Implicit: "The merit accumulation that is the subject of discussion"]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ : The Blessed One [Instrumental/Agentive case of `བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་`: "the Transcendent Destroyer"; honorific title for the Buddha; acts as the Agent who is giving instruction in this scene]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། : spoke [Past tense honorific verb `སྩལ་བ་`: "to give, grant, bestow"; with `བཀའ་`: "speech, word"; indicates the Process of the Buddha's authoritative teaching]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of the Buddha's disciple; functions as the Recipient of the Buddha's instruction; addressed directly by the Buddha]

- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely [Adverbial modifier from `ཡོངས་སུ་`: "thoroughly, entirely"; describes the Manner in which merit should be conventionally grasped]

- གཟུང་ : grasp [Future/imperative form of `འཛིན་པ་`: "to hold, grasp, apprehend"; the Process directed at the implicit Patient (merit); indicates conventional acceptance]

- མོད་ཀྱིས། : although [Concessive conjunction creating a contrast between proper and improper ways of grasping; connects the two scenes in the instruction]

- ལོག་པར་ : wrongly [Adverbial form of `ལོག་པ་`: "incorrect, wrong, perverted"; describes the Manner that should be avoided when grasping merit; specifically implying a mistaken view of inherent existence]

- མི་ : not [Negative particle modifying the verb `བཟུང་`; creates the prohibition against grasping incorrectly]

- བཟུང་ : grasp [Future/imperative form of `འཛིན་པ་`: "to hold, grasp, apprehend"; the Process that should not be done with wrong view; directed at the implicit Patient (merit)]

- སྟེ་ : and so [Connective particle indicating conclusion or continuation; links this statement to what follows in the broader discourse]

དེས་ན་ཡོངས་སུ་གཟུང་བ་ཞེས་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire statement about the proper way to grasp merit" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Logical connector indicating a conclusion based on previous statements" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [merit/བསོད་ནམས] [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Implicit participant referring to merit that is being grasped" | Implicit: "This refers to merit (བསོད་ནམས) that is being grasped, which is implicit in the sentence"]
    ├── ཞེས་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "Main process of the statement indicating naming or designation" | Implicit: ""]
    └── ཡོངས་སུ་གཟུང་བ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on what is being referred to or spoken about in the main process" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡོངས་སུ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial modifier indicating the completeness or thoroughness of the grasping" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེས་ན་ : Therefore [Logical connector: `དེ་`: that + instrumental case particle `ས་` + continuation particle `ན་`; indicating a conclusion drawn from previous statements; functions as a Linker connecting this statement to prior reasoning]

- ཡོངས་སུ་ : completely [Adverbial modifier: `ཡོངས་`: all, entire + terminative particle `སུ་`; indicating thoroughness or completeness; modifies the action of grasping, showing the comprehensive nature of the action]

- གཟུང་བ་ : to grasp [Future form of root verb `འཛིན་པ་`: to hold, grasp; here referring to the complete apprehension of merit (བསོད་ནམས) which is implicit in the context; functions as the main action being discussed]

- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative particle indicating that what precedes is being cited or referred to; connects the concept with its designation]

- བྱའོ : it is called [Future form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do, make + final particle `འོ་`; indicating designation or naming; functions as the main Process of making a formal designation]

source: ཡང་རབ་འབྱོར་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་འདི་སྐད་དུ། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་བཞུད་དམ་བྱོན་ཏམ། བཞེངས་སམ། བཞུགས་སམ། མནལ་བར་མཛད་དོ་ཞེས་ཟེར་ན། དེས་ངས་བཤད་པའི་དོན་མི་ཤེས་སོ། །
ucca_formatted:
ཡང་རབ་འབྱོར་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་འདི་སྐད་དུ། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་བཞུད་དམ་བྱོན་ཏམ། བཞེངས་སམ། བཞུགས་སམ། མནལ་བར་མཛད་དོ་ཞེས་ཟེར་ན། དེས་ངས་བཤད་པའི་དོན་མི་ཤེས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main discourse scene containing the Buddha's statement to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཡང་རབ་འབྱོར་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་འདི་སྐད་དུ། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་བཞུད་དམ་བྱོན་ཏམ། བཞེངས་སམ། བཞུགས་སམ། མནལ་བར་མཛད་དོ་ཞེས་ཟེར་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The hypothetical situation described by the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant | Desc: "The addressee of the Buddha's discourse" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག [Type: Participant | Desc: "The hypothetical person who might speak about the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདི་སྐད་དུ། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་བཞུད་དམ་བྱོན་ཏམ། བཞེངས་སམ། བཞུགས་སམ། མནལ་བར་མཛད་དོ་ཞེས་ཟེར་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The reported speech about the Tathagata's activities" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཟེར [Type: Process | Desc: "The speaking action of the hypothetical person" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་བཞུད་དམ་བྱོན་ཏམ། བཞེངས་སམ། བཞུགས་སམ། མནལ་བར་མཛད་དོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "The content of what is being said about the Tathagata's activities" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ [Type: Participant | Desc: "The Tathagata who is the subject of the various activities mentioned" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── མཛད་དོ [Type: Center | Desc: "The general action verb that applies to all the activities" | Implicit: ""]
                └── བཞུད་དམ་བྱོན་ཏམ། བཞེངས་སམ། བཞུགས་སམ། མནལ་བར [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The various activities attributed to the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
                    ├── བཞུད [Type: Process | Desc: "The activity of going (moving away)" | Implicit: ""]
                    ├── བྱོན [Type: Process | Desc: "The activity of coming (moving toward)" | Implicit: ""]
                    ├── བཞེངས [Type: Process | Desc: "The activity of standing" | Implicit: ""]
                    ├── བཞུགས [Type: Process | Desc: "The activity of sitting" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── མནལ་བར [Type: Process | Desc: "The activity of lying down" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conditional marker connecting the hypothetical situation to the conclusion" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེས་ངས་བཤད་པའི་དོན་མི་ཤེས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The conclusion about the person's misunderstanding" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེས [Type: Participant | Desc: "The hypothetical person referenced in the conclusion" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མི་ཤེས་སོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of not understanding" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ངས [Type: Participant | Desc: "The speaker (Buddha) who taught" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བཤད་པའི་དོན [Type: Center | Desc: "The object of misunderstanding" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བཤད་པའི་དོན [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on what is not understood" | Implicit: ""]
                └── དོན [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "The philosophical context of the Buddha's teaching" | Implicit: ""]
                    ├── The Tathagata is beyond conventional activities [Type: Function | Desc: "The implied philosophical context that the Tathagata transcends conventional activities" | Implicit: "The implied philosophical context that the Tathagata transcends conventional activities"]
                    └── The Tathagata's nature is not to be understood in terms of physical movements [Type: Function | Desc: "The implied philosophical context that the Tathagata's true nature cannot be described by physical activities" | Implicit: "The implied philosophical context that the Tathagata's true nature cannot be described by physical activities"]
glossary:
- ཡང་ : furthermore [Continuative particle; signals continuation of discourse; connects this statement to previous teachings; functions as a discourse marker]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; primary addressee of the Buddha's teaching; functions as the recipient of this discourse]
- གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་ : anyone [Indefinite pronoun; refers to a hypothetical person; functions as the subject of the conditional clause]
- འདི་སྐད་དུ། : thus, in this way [Quotative marker; introduces reported speech; indicates the beginning of quoted content]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : the Tathagata [Honorific title for the Buddha; literally "the thus-gone one"; subject of the hypothetical statement]
- བཞུད་དམ་ : goes away [Interrogative form of `བཞུད་`: to go, depart; honorific term for "going"; first in a series of physical activities attributed to the Tathagata]
- བྱོན་ཏམ། : or comes [Interrogative form of `བྱོན་`: to come; honorific term for "coming"; second in the series of physical activities]
- བཞེངས་སམ། : or stands [Interrogative form of `བཞེངས་`: to stand; honorific term for "standing"; third in the series of physical activities]
- བཞུགས་སམ། : or sits [Interrogative form of `བཞུགས་`: to sit; honorific term for "sitting"; fourth in the series of physical activities]
- མནལ་བར་ : or lies down [Terminative form of `མནལ་བ་`: to sleep, lie down; honorific term for "lying down"; final in the series of physical activities]
- མཛད་དོ་ : performs [Declarative form of `མཛད་`: to do, perform; honorific verb applying to all the previously mentioned activities]
- ཞེས་ : saying that [Quotative marker; closes reported speech; indicates end of the quoted content]
- ཟེར་ན། : if (someone) says [Conditional form of `ཟེར་`: to say; introduces the hypothetical situation; connects to the consequence that follows]
- དེས་ : that person [Agentive/instrumental of `དེ་`: that; refers back to the hypothetical person; functions as the subject of the conclusion]
- ངས་ : by me [Agentive of `ང་`: I; refers to the Buddha as speaker; indicates the source of the teaching]
- བཤད་པའི་ : that was explained [Past form of `བཤད་པ་`: to explain; with genitive particle; refers to the Buddha's previous teachings]
- དོན་ : meaning [Noun: meaning, purpose, significance; the philosophical import of the Buddha's teaching; object of what is not understood]
- མི་ཤེས་སོ། ། : does not understand [Negative present of `ཤེས་`: to know, understand; with final particle; indicates the conclusion that such a person fails to comprehend the deeper teaching about the Tathagata's transcendent nature]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནི། གར་ཡང་མ་བཞུད། གང་ནས་ཀྱང་མ་བྱོན་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire passage about the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Questioning scene setting up the explanation" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of questioning why something is the case" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནི། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene introducing the concept of Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The person being addressed - Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བ [Type: Center | Desc: "The main entity under discussion - the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ནི [Type: Function | Desc: "Topic marker indicating what is being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
    └── གར་ཡང་མ་བཞུད། གང་ནས་ཀྱང་མ་བྱོན་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Parallel scenes explaining the nature of Tathagata as not going or coming" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གར་ཡང་མ་བཞུད། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing that the Tathagata does not go anywhere" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གར་ཡང [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "The location to which there is no going" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མ་བཞུད [Type: Process | Desc: "The negated process of going" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── the Tathagata [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implied agent (Tathagata) who does not go anywhere" | Implicit: "the Tathagata"]
            └── ཕར [Type: Participant-Direction | Desc: "The directional aspect of not going outward anywhere" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གང་ནས་ཀྱང་མ་བྱོན་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing that the Tathagata does not come from anywhere" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གང་ནས [Type: Participant-Location | Desc: "The source location from which there is no coming" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཀྱང [Type: Function | Desc: "Emphatic particle emphasizing 'from anywhere whatsoever'" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མ་བྱོན [Type: Process | Desc: "The negated process of coming" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཕྱིར་ཏེ [Type: Function | Desc: "Functional marker indicating cause or reason" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── the Tathagata [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implied agent (Tathagata) who does not come from anywhere" | Implicit: "the Tathagata"]
            └── ཚུར [Type: Participant-Direction | Desc: "The directional aspect of not coming inward from anywhere" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དོན་དམ་པ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Specifies that the Buddha's non-going and non-coming are understood in terms of ultimate reality" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : Why [Demonstrative pronoun functioning as an interrogative marker; root `དེ་`; here introducing a rhetorical question; functions as part of the questioning scene]
- ཅིའི་ : for what reason [Interrogative pronoun in genitive case; root `ཅི་`: what; asks for the reason or cause; forms part of the process of questioning]
- ཕྱིར་ : because [Postposition indicating reason or purpose; root `ཕྱིར་`: for the sake of, because; connects the question to its forthcoming answer; functions as part of the questioning structure]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional verb form; root `ཞེ་`: to speak, say; marks a rhetorical question formula; concludes the questioning scene that sets up the explanation]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; Buddha's disciple being addressed; functions as the recipient participant in the scene]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་ : Tathagata [Buddhist technical term; root `གཤེགས་པ་`: to go, proceed; literally "Thus-gone One," epithet of the Buddha; the central entity under discussion]
- ཞེས་ : called [Quotative marker; indicates that the preceding term is being cited or defined; connects the term to its explanation]
- བྱ་བ་ : is called [Verbal noun; root `བྱ་`: to do, to call; forms part of the naming construction; indicates the definition being discussed]
- ནི། : is [Topic marker; highlights what follows as the main subject being explained; functions to mark the Tathagata concept as the focus]
- གར་ : to where [Interrogative pronoun of place (allative); root `ག་`: where; indicates destination; functions as the location participant negated in the scene]
- ཡང་ : even/also [Emphatic particle; emphasizes "nowhere at all"; intensifies the negation of movement]
- མ་ : not [Negative prefix; negates the verb; indicates the absence of the going process]
- བཞུད། : goes [Verb, honorific form; root `བཞུད་`: to go, depart (honorific); describes movement that is being negated; part of explaining the nature of Tathagata]
- གང་ནས་ : from where [Interrogative pronoun of place (ablative); root `གང་`: what/where + ablative marker `ནས་`; indicates source location; part of explaining the nature of Tathagata]
- ཀྱང་ : even/also [Emphatic particle; emphasizes "from nowhere at all"; intensifies the negation of origin]
- མ་ : not [Negative prefix; negates the verb; indicates the absence of coming]
- བྱོན་ : comes [Verb, honorific form; root `བྱོན་`: to come (honorific); describes the negated process of arrival; part of explaining the nature of Tathagata]
- པའི་ : which is [Nominalizing particle with genitive case; transforms the negated verb phrase into a nominal phrase serving as cause]
- ཕྱིར་ : because [Postposition indicating reason or cause; root `ཕྱིར་`: for the reason of; connects this explanation to the earlier question]
- ཏེ། : and so [Connective particle; root `ཏེ་`: so, and so; concludes the explanation and links to what follows; marks this as the reason for the earlier statement]

དེས་ན་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས་ཞེས་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene depicting the naming of Buddha with three epithets" | Implicit: ""]

    ├── [Buddha] [Type: Implicit-Participant-Patient | Desc: "The implicit entity (Buddha) being referred to by all epithets" | Implicit: "The Buddha who is being referred to by all the epithets"]
    └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ་ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས [Type: Elaborator-Parallel | Desc: "Group of parallel appellations or epithets all referring to Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "First epithet of Buddha, co-elaborator" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Second epithet of Buddha, co-elaborator" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི་སངས་རྒྱས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Third epithet of Buddha, co-elaborator" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཡང་དག་པར་རྫོགས་པའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborator modifying 'Buddha'" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སངས་རྒྱས [Type: Center | Desc: "Central term being elaborated upon" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེས་ན : therefore [Instrumental case of དེ་ (that) + connective particle ན; functions as a logical connector signaling a conclusion; marks the beginning of a conclusive statement]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ : Tathāgata [Compound term: དེ་བཞིན་ (thus, in this way) + གཤེགས་པ (gone, departed); first epithet of Buddha meaning "thus-gone one" or "one who has gone in the same way"; one of three parallel appellations]
- དགྲ་བཅོམ་པ : Arhat [Compound term: དགྲ་ (enemy) + བཅོམ་པ (conqueror); second epithet meaning "foe-destroyer" or "one who has conquered the enemies (of afflictions)"; parallel epithet to Tathāgata]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly [Adverbial phrase: ཡང་དག་པ་ (authentic, genuine, correct) + instrumental/terminative marker ར; modifies རྫོགས་པའི་; indicates complete authenticity or perfection]
- རྫོགས་པའི་ : complete [Genitive form of རྫོགས་པ་ (to complete, perfect); links the quality of completeness to སངས་རྒྱས; part of the compound modifier to Buddha]
- སངས་རྒྱས : Buddha [Compound term: སངས་ (purified, awakened) + རྒྱས་ (flourished, expanded); central term being elaborated upon by the preceding epithets; the awakened one]
- ཞེས་ : called [Quotative particle marking the preceding epithets as designations; connects the epithets to the verb བྱའོ]
- བྱའོ : is designated [Final verb: བྱ་ (to call, to name) + འོ (declarative/final particle); completes the sentence with emphasis; indicates that these are formal designations for Buddha]

ཡང་རབ་འབྱོར་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་གིས། སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ན་སའི་རྡུལ་ཇི་སྙེད་ཡོད་པ་དེ་དག །འདི་ལྟ་སྟེ་དཔེར་ན་རྡུལ་ཕྲ་རབ་ཀྱི་ཚོགས་བཞིན་དུ་ཕྱེ་མར་བྱས་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། རྡུལ་ཕྲ་རབ་ཀྱི་ཚོགས་དེ་མང་བ་ཡིན་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing Buddha's discourse to Subhuti about atoms and dust particles" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཡང [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connector linking this discourse section with previous teachings" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་གིས། སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ན་སའི་རྡུལ་ཇི་སྙེད་ཡོད་པ་དེ་དག །འདི་ལྟ་སྟེ་དཔེར་ན་རྡུལ་ཕྲ་རབ་ཀྱི་ཚོགས་བཞིན་དུ་ཕྱེ་མར་བྱས་ན [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the hypothetical action of reducing worlds to finest particles" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The primary addressee of Buddha's discourse" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་གིས [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Hypothetical noble person being addressed in the discourse" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ན [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The world system containing particles of dust" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སའི་རྡུལ་ཇི་སྙེད་ཡོད་པ་དེ་དག [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The particles of dust that would be reduced to fine particles" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཕྱེ་མར་བྱས་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of reducing to fine particles" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདི་ལྟ་སྟེ་དཔེར་ན་རྡུལ་ཕྲ་རབ་ཀྱི་ཚོགས་བཞིན་དུ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration providing a comparative example" | Implicit: ""]
            └── བཞིན་དུ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Comparative element establishing the metaphor" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་སེམས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene of Buddha asking Subhuti for his thoughts" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Subhuti as the person being addressed with the question" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སེམས [Type: Process | Desc: "The cognitive process of thinking being asked of Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདི་ཇི་སྙམ་དུ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The content of the thought being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── Subhuti [Type: Participant-Experiencer | Desc: "Implicit reference to Subhuti as the experiencer of the thought process" | Implicit: "Implicit reference to Subhuti as the experiencer of the thought process"]
            └── འདི་ཇི་སྙམ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Interrogative expression modifying the thinking process" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རྡུལ་ཕྲ་རབ་ཀྱི་ཚོགས་དེ་མང་བ་ཡིན་སྙམ་མམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene containing the specific question about the quantity of particles" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རྡུལ་ཕྲ་རབ་ཀྱི་ཚོགས་དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The collection of particles being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མང་བ་ཡིན [Type: State | Desc: "The state of being numerous" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སྙམ་མམ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Interrogative marker indicating the question being posed to Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ཡང་ : furthermore [continuative particle; acts as a connector linking this section with previous teachings; introduces a new subtopic within Buddha's discourse]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name; one of Buddha's chief disciples; functions as the addressee of Buddha's discourse]
- རིགས་ཀྱི་ : noble [genitive case of `རིགས་`: lineage, family, class; here referring to well-born individuals of good families; used as a respectful address]
- བུའམ་ : son or [disjunctive form combining `བུ་`: son + འམ་: or; refers to male follower of the Buddhist path]
- རིགས་ཀྱི་ : noble [genitive case of `རིགས་`: lineage, family, class; repeated for the female version of the address]
- བུ་མོ་ : daughter [female disciple or follower of the Buddhist path]
- གང་ལ་ལ་ : any [indefinite pronoun; refers to an unspecified individual from the previously mentioned groups]
- ཞིག་གིས། : by someone [ergative of indefinite marker `ཞིག་`; indicates agency of the hypothetical noble person]
- སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་ : of the trichiliocosm [genitive of `སྟོང་གསུམ་`: three thousand; refers to a vast cosmological system in Buddhist cosmology]
- སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་ : great thousand [genitive of `སྟོང་ཆེན་པོ་`: great thousand; part of the cosmological term for a vast world system]
- འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ : of the world [genitive of `འཇིག་རྟེན་`: world, universe; part of the compound term for world-system]
- ཁམས་ན་ : in the realm [locative of `ཁམས་`: realm, sphere, element; locates the particles within a specific cosmological domain]
- སའི་ : of earth [genitive of `ས་`: earth, ground; specifies the type of particles being discussed]
- རྡུལ་ : particles [from `རྡུལ་`: dust, particle; the basic physical elements being enumerated]
- ཇི་སྙེད་ : as many as [correlative-interrogative; indicates the totality of particles in the realm]
- ཡོད་པ་ : existing [verbal noun from `ཡོད་`: to exist; describes the particles as actually existing entities]
- དེ་དག : those [demonstrative plural; refers back to all the previously mentioned particles]
- འདི་ལྟ་སྟེ་ : that is to say [explicative phrase; introduces an illustrative example]
- དཔེར་ན་ : for example [exemplifying phrase; introduces the metaphor that follows]
- རྡུལ་ཕྲ་རབ་ཀྱི་ : of the finest particles [genitive of `རྡུལ་ཕྲ་རབ་`: extremely fine particles; describes the state after reduction]
- ཚོགས་ : collection [aggregate, assemblage; refers to the mass of particles collectively]
- བཞིན་དུ་ : like [comparative marker; establishes the metaphorical relationship]
- ཕྱེ་མར་ : into powder [terminative of `ཕྱེ་མ་`: powder, fine particles; describes the resulting state]
- བྱས་ན། : if made [conditional of `བྱེད་`: to do, make; sets up the hypothetical scenario]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [proper name; addressee being directly questioned by Buddha]
- འདི་ : this [demonstrative; refers to the question about to be posed]
- ཇི་སྙམ་དུ་ : what do you think [interrogative phrase; invitation for reflection]
- སེམས། : do you think? [present form of `སེམས་པ་`: to think; poses a direct question to Subhuti]
- རྡུལ་ཕྲ་རབ་ཀྱི་ : of the finest particles [genitive of `རྡུལ་ཕྲ་རབ་`: extremely fine particles; refers to the hypothetical result]
- ཚོགས་ : collection [aggregate, assemblage; the entirety of particles as a group]
- དེ་ : that [demonstrative; refers to the previously mentioned collection]
- མང་བ་ : many [adjectival form of `མང་`: numerous, abundant; the property being questioned]
- ཡིན་ : is [copula; equates the collection with the quality of being numerous]
- སྙམ་མམ། : do you think? [interrogative form of `སྙམ་`: to think; final questioning marker directed at Subhuti]

                └── དེ [Type: Participant-Center | Desc: "The center/topic of the affirmation that follows" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་: by Subhūti [Ergative/instrumental case marker གྱིས་ attached to the name རབ་འབྱོར་; indicates the agent/doer of the action; functions as the Speaker/Agent in this dialogue scene]
- གསོལ་པ།: replied [Perfect tense of གསོལ་བ་: to request, speak, reply; here indicates the speech act of responding; functions as the main Process of the scene]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་: Bhagavān [Honorific title for the Buddha; vocative form addressing the Buddha directly; functions as the Recipient of Subhūti's speech]
- དེ་: that [Demonstrative pronoun referring to what was previously stated by the Buddha; functions as the Center/Topic of Subhūti's affirmation]
- དེ་ལྟར་: thus/in that way [Adverbial compound formed from དེ་ (that) + ལྟར་ (like); indicates manner; elaborates on the referent "that" to confirm agreement]
- ལགས་ཏེ།: it is [Honorific copula ལགས་ + connective particle ཏེ་; polite form of "is" used when speaking to someone of higher status; indicates affirmation with what was previously stated]

glossary:
- དེ་ : Why [interrogative pronoun; serves as opening for rhetorical question setting up the explanation]
- ཅིའི་ : for what reason [interrogative pronoun in genitive case from `ཅི་`: what; functioning as interrogative marker in the rhetorical question]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the purpose of [purposive case marker; indicating the reason or purpose being questioned]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [conditional verbal phrase from `ཞེ་`: to say/ask; introduces the rhetorical question format]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [honorific title for the Buddha; functioning as experiencer in the conditional premise]
- གལ་ཏེ་ : if [conditional marker; beginning of conditional premise]
- རྡུལ་ཕྲ་རབ་ : subtle particles [compound noun from `རྡུལ་`: particle + `ཕྲ་རབ་`: extremely fine/subtle; refers to atoms or fundamental particles]
- ཀྱི་ : of [genitive particle; connecting 'subtle particles' with 'collection']
- ཚོགས་ : collection [noun; referring to an aggregate or assemblage]
- ཤིག་ : a [indefinite article; marking the noun phrase as indefinite]
- མཆིས་པར་ : existed [honorific verb in terminative case from `མཆིས་`: to exist/be present; functioning as the main verb of the conditional premise]
- གྱུར་ན། : if it were to be [conditional auxiliary verb phrase; completing the conditional clause]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [honorific title for the Buddha; functioning as agent in the consequence clause]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [instrumental case marker; indicating the agent of the action]
- རྡུལ་ཕྲ་རབ་ : subtle particles [compound noun from `རྡུལ་`: particle + `ཕྲ་རབ་`: extremely fine/subtle; what's being referenced in the teaching]
- ཀྱི་ : of [genitive particle; connecting 'subtle particles' with 'collection']
- ཚོགས་ : collection [noun; referring to an aggregate or assemblage]
- ཞེས་ : called/named [quotative particle; marking the preceding term as what would not be taught]
- བཀའ་ : teaching [honorific noun; referring to Buddha's words/teachings]
- མི་ : not [negative particle; negating the following verb]
- སྩོལ་ : bestow [honorific verb; meaning to give, bestow, or teach]
- བའི་ : which is [nominalizer + genitive particle; connecting the negated action to its purpose]
- སླད་དུའོ། : because of that [purposive case marker + final particle; indicating the reason for the statement and completing the sentence]

        └── གང་ དེ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Connecting terms that link the Buddha's statement to the explanation" | Implicit: ""]

        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པའི [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who understood and taught" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསུངས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཚོགས་མ་མཆིས་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The philosophical concept that aggregates ultimately lack inherent existence" | Implicit: "དོན་དམ་པར་རང་བཞིན་གྱིས་གྲུབ་པ་མེད་པ"]
        └── སླད་དུ་སྟེ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Connecting term indicating the reason" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; 'that' referring to a previous statement; functions as a Patient in the semantic structure]
- ཅིའི་ : for what [Interrogative pronoun in genitive case; from `ཅི་`: what; used here to ask 'for what reason'; part of the rhetorical question construct]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the sake of [Postposition indicating purpose; combined with `ཅིའི་` to form 'for what purpose'; establishes the reason for explanation]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Conditional particle marking a rhetorical question; introduces an explanatory section; concludes the introductory rhetorical question]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱི་ : of the Blessed One [Genitive of `བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་`: the Buddha; indicates the source of the teaching; acts as Agent of the teaching]
- རྡུལ་ཕྲ་རབ་ཀྱི་ : of subtle particles [Genitive of `རྡུལ་ཕྲ་རབ་`: extremely fine particles/atoms; refers to fundamental material components; forms part of the central concept]
- ཚོགས་ : collection/aggregate [Noun; groups or collections of elements; central concept in Buddha's teaching; refers to collections that appear substantial but lack inherent existence]
- ཞེས་ : called/termed [Quotative particle; marks the preceding phrase as a specific term or concept; connects the concept to its explanation]
- གང་ : what/whatever [Relative pronoun; refers to the teaching that was given; connects the utterance to its content]
- གསུངས་པ་ : taught/spoke [Past verbal noun from `གསུང་`: to speak/teach (honorific); refers to Buddha's act of teaching; functions as the Process in the semantic structure]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the teaching mentioned; concludes the reference to Buddha's teaching]
- ཚོགས་ : collection/aggregate [Noun; same term as above; the concept under discussion]
- མ་མཆིས་པར་ : not existing [Negated verbal form of `མཆིས་པ་`: to exist (honorific); indicates the non-existence of the collections; expresses the philosophical concept that aggregates lack inherent existence]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པའི་ : of the Tathagata [Genitive of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: 'Thus-Gone One', epithet for Buddha; indicates the authoritative source; functions as Agent of the teaching]
- གསུངས་པའི་ : of having taught [Genitive of verbal noun from `གསུང་`: to speak/teach (honorific); refers to the act of teaching; links the teaching to its purpose]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the purpose of [Postposition indicating purpose; shows the reason or intention behind the teaching; connects the explanation to its purpose]
- སྟེ། : that is/it is because [Continuative particle; concludes the explanation; indicates that what preceded is the reason for what was stated earlier]

glossary:
- དེས་ན : Therefore [Instrumental + connective particle; from `དེ་`: that; functions as the Ground establishing the basis for the following statement; introduces the logical conclusion]

- རྡུལ་ཕྲ་རབ་ : subtle particles [Compound term; `རྡུལ་`: particle/atom + `ཕྲ་རབ་`: extremely subtle/fine; refers to the most fundamental material elements in Buddhist atomism; serves as an elaborator describing the type of collection]

- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle; connects `རྡུལ་ཕྲ་རབ་` to `ཚོགས`; indicates possession or attribution]

- ཚོགས་ : collection [Noun; root word meaning "accumulation, gathering, collection"; functions as the central concept being named or labeled]

- ཞེས་ : thus, so called [Quotative particle; marks the preceding phrase as what something is being called or named]

- བགྱིའོ : it is called [Honorific form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do, to make; present tense verb + final particle `འོ་`; functions as the main Process indicating the act of designating or naming; implies that this is a conventional designation]

- ། ། : [End of sentence marker]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ཞེས་གང་གསུངས་པ་དེ་ཁམས་མ་མཆིས་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ཞེས་གང་གསུངས་པ [Type: Scene | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: A | Desc: "Participant" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསུངས་པ [Type: P | Desc: "Process" | Implicit: ""]
        └── སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ཞེས [Type: C | Desc: "Content-Object" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས [Type: C | Desc: "Center" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ [Type: N | Desc: "Connector" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ [Type: R | Desc: "Relator" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཁམས་མ་མཆིས་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: A | Desc: "Participant" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསུངས [Type: P | Desc: "Process" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཁམས་མ་མཆིས་པར [Type: C | Desc: "Content-State" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཏེ། [Type: D | Desc: "Discourse" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [emptiness concept/śūnyatā] [Type: E | Desc: "Implicit-Content" | Implicit: "The philosophical concept of emptiness (śūnyatā) that underlies the teaching"]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : The Tathāgata [Ergative case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "One Thus Gone" or Buddha; acting as Agent/Participant in the UCCA structure; the authoritative speaker]

- སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་ : of the trichiliocosm [Genitive case of `སྟོང་གསུམ་`: the three-thousand-fold world system; part of Content-Object describing the cosmic realm being discussed]

- སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་ : great thousand [Genitive case of `སྟོང་ཆེན་པོ་`: great thousand; modifier specifying the scale of the world system]

- འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ : of the world [Genitive case of `འཇིག་རྟེན་`: world, universe; part of Content-Object defining the nature of the realm]

- ཁམས་ : realm [Root form of `ཁམས་`: realm, element, sphere; serves as Center of Content-Object in UCCA]

- ཞེས་ : called/named [Quotative particle indicating designation/naming; introduces Content-Object in the discourse]

- གང་ : what/whatever [Relative pronoun connecting the first clause to the second; creates reference to previously stated content]

- གསུངས་པ་ : taught/spoken [Past verbal noun of `གསུང་`: to speak, teach (honorific); Process that indicates the Buddha's act of teaching]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun functioning as Relator/Connector in UCCA; links what was taught to what will be stated]

- ཁམས་ : realm [Same as above, but here as the subject of negation]

- མ་མཆིས་པར་ : as non-existent [Negative + honorific verb `མཆིས་` (to exist) + terminative particle; Content-State indicating the realm's ultimate non-existence]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathāgata [Same as above; second mention reinforcing the Agent/Participant role]

- གསུངས་ : taught [Past tense of `གསུང་`: to speak, teach (honorific); Process in the second clause]

- ཏེ། : thus/therefore [Final particle marking completion of a statement; serves Discourse function in UCCA, indicating conclusion of teaching]

ucca_formatted:
དེས་ན་སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ཞེས་བགྱིའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene describing the naming of the world system" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Ground | Desc: "Provides the basis or reason for the naming convention" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [in conventional terms only] [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Implicit content indicating the designation is conventional only" | Implicit: "Indicates that the designation is conventional only"]
    ├── བགྱིའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of naming or designating" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཞེས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Connects the named entity to the process of naming" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The world system that is being named" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "First part of the compound description of the world system" | Implicit: ""]
            └── སྟོང་གསུམ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Specifies the number of world systems" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Second part of the compound description of the world system" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས [Type: Center | Desc: "The core entity being described" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [exists only as conventional designation and not ultimately] [Type: State | Desc: "Implicit state representing the conventional nature of the designation" | Implicit: "Represents the philosophical view that the designation exists conventionally but not ultimately"]
glossary:
- དེས་ན་ : therefore [Instrumental case of དེ་ 'that' + connective particle ན; indicates causal relationship; serves as Ground element providing the logical basis for the conclusion that follows]

- སྟོང་གསུམ་གྱི་ : of the trichiliocosm [Genitive case of སྟོང་གསུམ 'three thousand'; literally 'of the three thousand'; first part of the compound description of the world system]

- སྟོང་ཆེན་པོའི་ : great thousand [Genitive case of སྟོང་ཆེན་པོ་ 'great thousand'; second part of the compound description of the Buddhist cosmological system; modifies the world system term]

- འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ : of the world [Genitive case of འཇིག་རྟེན་ 'world, transient world'; literally 'of the destructible base'; forms part of the core entity being described]

- ཁམས་ : realm [Nominative form of ཁམས་ 'realm, element, sphere'; the central term of the compound world-system being named; functions as the core Patient in the semantic structure]

- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative particle connecting the named entity to the process of naming; indicates that the preceding phrase is what something is called]

- བགྱིའོ། ། : it is called [Honorific form of བྱེད་པ་ 'to do, make'; with final particle འོ indicating completed statement; functions as the main Process of naming/designating; conventionally implies the designation exists as convention only]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་གལ་ཏེ་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ཤིག་མཆིས་པར་གྱུར་ན། དེ་ཉིད་རིལ་པོར་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་བའི་སླད་དུའོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing the complete passage with a rhetorical question and its answer" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Rhetorical question that links to the following explanation, not an independent scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant | Desc: "Reference to the previous statement or concept being questioned" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཅིའི་སླད་དུ [Type: Ground | Desc: "Interrogative phrase asking for the reason or purpose" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཞེ་ན [Type: Function | Desc: "Question marker completing the rhetorical structure" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་གལ་ཏེ་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ཤིག་མཆིས་པར་གྱུར་ན། དེ་ཉིད་རིལ་པོར་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་བའི་སླད་དུའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene containing the conditional statement and its consequence" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant | Desc: "Addressee of the statement, referring to the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གལ་ཏེ་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ཤིག་མཆིས་པར་གྱུར་ན [Type: Conditional | Desc: "Conditional clause describing a hypothetical scenario" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གལ་ཏེ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Conditional marker introducing the hypothetical premise" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ཤིག་མཆིས་པར་གྱུར་ན [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene describing the existence of a world-system as hypothetical condition" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་ཤིག [Type: Participant | Desc: "The hypothetical entity being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
                └── མཆིས་པར་གྱུར་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "Process indicating the hypothetical existence including the conditional marker" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་ཉིད་རིལ་པོར་འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་བའི་སླད་དུའོ། ། [Type: Consequence | Desc: "Consequence of the conditional statement, showing what would happen if the world-system existed" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་ཉིད [Type: Participant | Desc: "Reference to the world-system mentioned in the conditional clause, which would be grasped as a substantial whole" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རིལ་པོར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Philosophical concept describing how things are grasped as substantial wholes, having two aspects: as a unified whole and as analyzed parts" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཛིན་པར་འགྱུར་བ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of grasping or apprehending that would occur" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འི་སླད་དུའོ [Type: Purpose | Desc: "Purpose marker indicating that this is the explanation or reason for the question asked at the beginning" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun: 'that', refers to a previous statement or concept being questioned; functions as a Participant in the rhetorical question structure]
- ཅིའི་ : for what [Interrogative pronoun in genitive case from `ཅི`: 'what'; used to ask about reason or purpose]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the sake of [Postposition: 'for the purpose of', 'for the sake of'; part of the interrogative phrase asking for reason]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Question marker: a quotative verb `ཞེ་`: 'to say' + conditional particle `ན`: 'if'; completes the rhetorical question structure]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for the Buddha: from `བཅོམ་`: 'conquered' + `ལྡན་`: 'possessing' + `འདས་`: 'transcended'; addressee of the statement]
- གལ་ཏེ་ : if [Conditional marker: introduces a hypothetical premise]
- འཇིག་རྟེན་ : world [Compound noun: `འཇིག་`: 'to destroy' + `རྟེན་`: 'support'; refers to the conditioned, impermanent world]
- གྱི་ : of [Genitive particle: connects 'world' and 'realm']
- ཁམས་ : realm [Noun: 'element', 'realm', 'sphere'; here refers to a world-system or sphere of existence]
- ཤིག་ : a [Indefinite article: marks 'world-realm' as indefinite]
- མཆིས་པར་ : exists [Honorific verb `མཆིས་`: 'to exist', 'to be present' + nominalizing particle `པ་` + terminative particle `ར་`; indicates hypothetical existence]
- གྱུར་ན། : were to [Completive verb `གྱུར་`: 'to become' + conditional particle `ན`: 'if'; completes the conditional clause]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun: refers back to the 'world-realm' mentioned in the conditional clause]
- ཉིད་ : itself [Emphatic particle: emphasizes the preceding demonstrative; 'that very one']
- རིལ་པོར་ : as a whole [Adverbial: from `རིལ་པོ་`: 'entire', 'complete'; describes how the world-system would be grasped - as a substantial, unified whole]
- འཛིན་པར་ : grasping [Verbal noun: from `འཛིན་`: 'to grasp', 'to hold', 'to apprehend' + nominalizing particle `པ་` + terminative particle `ར་`; describes the cognitive act of conceptual clinging]
- འགྱུར་བའི་ : would become [Verb `འགྱུར་བ`: 'to become', 'to change' + genitive particle `འི་`; indicates future consequence]
- སླད་དུའོ། : is for the purpose of [Purpose marker: `སླད་དུ`: 'for the purpose of' + final particle `འོ`: assertive marker; indicates this is the explanation for the initial question]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་རིལ་པོར་འཛིན་པར་གསུངས་པ་དེ་འཛིན་པ་མ་མཆིས་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པའི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene encompassing the entire statement about the Tathagata's teaching" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་རིལ་པོར་འཛིན་པར་གསུངས་པ་དེ་འཛིན་པ་མ་མཆིས་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པའི [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Contains parallel scenes about the Tathagata's teaching and its interpretation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་རིལ་པོར་འཛིན་པར་གསུངས་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing what the Tathagata taught about holding as a whole" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who did the teaching - the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གསུངས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of teaching or speaking" | Implicit: ""]
            └── རིལ་པོར་འཛིན་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The content of what was taught - holding as a whole" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Function | Desc: "Grammatical marker connecting different parts of the sentence" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཛིན་པ་མ་མཆིས་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object of teaching - that there is no actual holding or grasping" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པའི [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene explaining the Tathagata's teaching from an ultimate perspective" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who did the teaching in the second scene - the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
            └── གསུངས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of teaching or speaking in the second scene" | Implicit: ""]
        └── conventional holding is not ultimately real [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit philosophical concept that 'holding as a whole' is merely conventional and not ultimately real" | Implicit: "conventional holding is not ultimately real"]
    ├── སླད་དུ [Type: Purpose | Desc: "Indicates the purpose behind the Tathagata's teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པའི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "References what was taught by the Tathagata - that conventional holding is not ultimately real" | Implicit: ""]
    └── སྟེ། [Type: Function | Desc: "Marks the end of the statement, similar to 'that is' or 'thus'" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Ergative case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "thus-gone one", epithet for Buddha; acting as the Agent who performs the teaching; functions as the primary agent in both parallel scenes]

- རིལ་པོར་ : as a whole [Terminative case of `རིལ་པོ་`: entirety, wholeness; indicates the manner of grasping - completely or in entirety; modifies the following verb]

- འཛིན་པར་ : to grasp or hold [Terminative of `འཛིན་པ་`: to grasp, hold, apprehend; the content of what Buddha taught - the conventional concept of grasping phenomena as whole entities; functions as Patient in first scene]

- གསུངས་པ་ : taught [Past tense of `གསུང་བ་`: to speak, teach; the Buddha's action of teaching; main Process in first scene]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun connecting the preceding and following clauses; serves as a grammatical marker linking the two scenes]

- འཛིན་པ་ : grasping [Noun form of `འཛིན་པ་`: to grasp, hold; the concept being negated - that there is no actual holding/grasping in ultimate reality; part of Patient in overall structure]

- མ་མཆིས་པར་ : does not exist [Negative + honorific verb `མཆིས་པ་`: to exist, be; negates the ultimate existence of grasping; completes the Patient element expressing that grasping isn't ultimately real]

- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Ergative case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "thus-gone one"; second mention of Buddha as the teaching agent; acts as Agent in second parallel scene]

- གསུངས་པའི་ : taught [Past tense of `གསུང་བ་` + genitive particle; Buddha's teaching action in second scene; connects to the following purpose clause]

- སླད་དུ་ : for the purpose of [Purposive conjunction: "for the sake of", "in order to"; indicates the purpose behind Buddha's teaching; introduces reason why Buddha taught about grasping]

- སྟེ། : that is [Final particle indicating conclusion; marks the end of statement; serves as a discourse marker similar to "thus" or "therefore"]
