དེས་ན་རིལ་པོར་འཛིན་པ་ཞེས་བགྱིའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connects this statement to previous context" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རིལ་པོར་འཛིན་པ [Type: State | Desc: "A conceptual state or mode of apprehension rather than a patient in this philosophical context" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཛིན་པ [Type: Center | Desc: "The core concept of grasping or apprehension" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རིལ་པོར [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Specifies the mode of grasping - how the grasping is conceptualized" | Implicit: ""]
        └── conventional designation [Type: Implicit | Desc: "Represents the implicit understanding that this is merely a conventional designation (ཐ་སྙད) with no ultimate reality" | Implicit: "conventional designation"]
    ├── Buddha [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit agent (Buddha) who is doing the designation" | Implicit: "Buddha"]
    └── ཞེས་བགྱིའོ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on how the concept is conventionally designated rather than being the main process" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེས་ན། : Therefore [connecting particle; combination of དེས་ (instrumental of དེ་ "that") and ན་ (conditional or locative particle); functions as a logical linker connecting this statement to previous context]
- རིལ་པོར་ : as a whole [adverbial form (terminative case) of རིལ་པོ་ meaning "whole, entire, complete"; specifies the mode of grasping as encompassing entirety rather than parts]
- འཛིན་པ་ : grasping [verbal noun from root འཛིན་ "to hold, grasp, apprehend"; refers to a cognitive act of apprehension or conceptualization rather than physical holding; the core concept being discussed]
- ཞེས་ : thus [quotative particle; marks the preceding term as being designated or named; indicates conventional designation]
- བགྱིའོ། : it is called [honorific form of བྱེད་པ་ "to do, make"; here in present tense with final particle འོ་; implies the Buddha or authoritative source is making this designation]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་རིལ་པོར་འཛིན་པ་ཉིད་ནི་ཐ་སྙད་དེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing Buddha's statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The speaker (Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་རིལ་པོར་འཛིན་པ་ཉིད་ནི་ཐ་སྙད་དེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The content of Buddha's statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "The addressee of Buddha's statement" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རིལ་པོར་འཛིན་པ་ཉིད [Type: Topic | Desc: "The subject matter being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཛིན་པ་ཉིད [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of grasping or apprehension" | Implicit: ""]
            └── རིལ་པོར [Type: Manner | Desc: "How the grasping is performed - as a whole/aggregate" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཐ་སྙད་དེ [Type: Definition | Desc: "Definition explaining that 'grasping as a whole' is merely a conventional designation, not an ultimate reality" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ནི [Type: Linker | Desc: "Particle linking the topic and its definition" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to the Buddha who has conquered afflictions, possesses qualities, and transcended samsara; functions as the Agent/speaker in the discourse]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker indicating the agent performing the action; marks Buddha as the speaker/agent of the utterance]

- བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། : proclaimed [Honorific past tense of `སྩལ་བ་`: to give, bestow, proclaim; honorific form indicating Buddha's speech act; the main Process of the first clause]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; one of Buddha's chief disciples known for his understanding of emptiness; functions as the Recipient/addressee of Buddha's teaching]

- རིལ་པོར་ : as a whole [Adverbial form of `རིལ་པོ་`: whole, complete, entirety; indicates the manner of grasping - taking something as a solid, undivided entity; modifies the following verbal noun]

- འཛིན་པ་ : grasping [Verbal noun from `འཛིན་`: to hold, grasp, apprehend; refers to the conceptual act of holding onto or apprehending phenomena; the core Process being discussed]

- ཉིད་ : itself [Nominalizing suffix indicating abstract essence or very nature; emphasizes the concept of grasping as a whole; transforms the preceding verbal noun into the main topic of discussion]

- ནི་ : is [Topic marker highlighting the preceding phrase as the subject being defined; links the topic (grasping as a whole) with its definition]

- ཐ་སྙད་ : conventional designation [Noun meaning conventional term, designation, label; from `ཐ་` (meaning) and `སྙད་` (expression); indicates that the concept is merely a convention, not an ultimate reality]

- དེ། : that [Demonstrative particle concluding the statement; emphasizes that this is merely a designation with no inherent existence]

ucca_formatted:
ཆོས་དེ་ནི་བརྗོད་དུ་མེད་པ་ཡིན་ན། དེ་ཡང་བྱིས་པ་སོ་སོའི་སྐྱེ་བོ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས་གཟུང་ངོ་། ། [Type: Contrast | Desc: "Root node showing contrast between ultimate inexpressibility and conventional grasping" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་དེ་ནི་བརྗོད་དུ་མེད་པ་ཡིན་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First scene describing the inexpressibility of phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་དེ་ནི [Type: Participant-Center | Desc: "Central topic of discussion - the phenomenon/dharma being examined" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བརྗོད་དུ་མེད་པ་ཡིན [Type: State | Desc: "State of being inexpressible" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ན། [Type: Conditional Linker | Desc: "Conditional marker establishing relationship between scenes" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཡང་བྱིས་པ་སོ་སོའི་སྐྱེ་བོ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས་གཟུང་ངོ་། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scene describing how ordinary beings grasp at phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ཡང [Type: Participant-Center | Desc: "Refers back to the dharma/phenomenon that is the central topic" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྱིས་པ་སོ་སོའི་སྐྱེ་བོ་རྣམས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Agent performing the action - ordinary beings" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གཟུང་ངོ་། ། [Type: Process | Desc: "Action of grasping/apprehending" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [contrary to ultimate reality] [Type: Implicit Contrast | Desc: "Implicit philosophical contrast between conventional designation and ultimate reality" | Implicit: "Implies a philosophical contrast between conventional understanding and ultimate reality"]
glossary:
- ཆོས་ : phenomenon [noun, `ཆོས་`: dharma/phenomenon; refers to the central philosophical subject being discussed; functions as the main Participant-Center in the first scene]
- དེ་ : that [demonstrative pronoun; specifies the particular phenomenon being referenced; part of the Participant-Center]
- ནི་ : as for [topic marker; emphasizes the phenomenon as the main topic of discussion; completes the Participant-Center construction]
- བརྗོད་དུ་ : to express [verbal noun + purposive particle `དུ་`; from `བརྗོད་པ་`: to express/articulate; forms part of the negative construction indicating inexpressibility]
- མེད་པ་ : not existing [negative existential verb + nominalizer; indicates the impossibility or absence of expression; central part of the State description]
- ཡིན་ : is [equative verb; links the phenomenon to its quality of inexpressibility; completes the State construction]
- ན། : if [conditional particle; establishes the logical relationship between the two scenes; functions as the Conditional Linker]
- དེ་ : that [demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the same phenomenon mentioned earlier; begins the Participant-Center of the second scene]
- ཡང་ : also/nevertheless [connective particle; indicates contrast or continuation; completes the Participant-Center reference]
- བྱིས་པ་ : childish/ordinary [adjective, `བྱིས་པ་`: childish, immature; describes the undeveloped spiritual state of ordinary beings; part of the Agent description]
- སོ་སོའི་ : individual [distributive + genitive; from `སོ་སོ་`: separate, individual; indicates the multiplicity of ordinary beings; part of the Agent description]
- སྐྱེ་བོ་ : beings/persons [noun, `སྐྱེ་བོ་`: beings, persons; refers to sentient beings lacking enlightenment; part of the Agent description]
- རྣམས་ : plural [plural marker; indicates multiple beings; completes the nominal Agent phrase]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [instrumental case marker; indicates the agent performing the action; marks the Agent role]
- གཟུང་ : grasp/apprehend [future form of `འཛིན་པ་`: to grasp, hold, apprehend; indicates the conceptual grasping action; forms the Process element]
- ངོ་། ། : [final particle + shad punctuation; marks the end of the statement with emphasis; completes the Process construction]

རབ་འབྱོར་གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག་འདི་སྐད་དུ། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་བདག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བར་གསུངས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire passage" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "Subhuti is being addressed in this discourse context" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག [Type: Participant-Hypothetical | Desc: "Refers to a hypothetical person who might make the claim about the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    └── འདི་སྐད་དུ། དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་བདག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བར་གསུངས། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Embedded scene representing the hypothetical statement about what the Tathagata supposedly taught" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འདི་སྐད་དུ [Type: Discourse-Marker | Desc: "Marker introducing the reported speech that follows" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Tathagata (Buddha) as the agent of the teaching action" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསུངས [Type: Process-Communication | Desc: "The communicative action of teaching or speaking performed by the Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བདག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བར [Type: Attribute | Desc: "Philosophical concept of 'view of self' (ātma-dṛṣṭi) which in Buddhist philosophy is actually taught to be a non-view, relating to the concept of selflessness (anātman). This represents the content of what is allegedly taught by the Tathagata." | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར : Subhuti [Vocative; proper name of the Buddha's disciple who is being addressed in this discourse]
- གང་ལ་ལ་ཞིག : someone [Indefinite pronoun; refers to a hypothetical person who might make a claim; functions as the Agent of the hypothetical statement]
- འདི་སྐད་དུ : thus [Adverbial phrase introducing reported speech; literally "in these words"; marks the beginning of what someone supposedly claimed]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས : the Tathagata [Ergative of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ`: "Thus-Gone One," epithet of the Buddha; Agent of the alleged teaching in the reported statement]
- བདག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བར : the view of self [Terminative case of `བདག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བ`: "viewing as self"; philosophical concept of ātma-dṛṣṭi; object of what is allegedly taught]
- གསུངས : taught [Past tense of `གསུང་`: to speak, teach, say; here indicating what the Tathagata allegedly proclaimed according to the hypothetical speaker]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་སེམས་ཅན་དུ་ལྟ་བ་དང༌། སྲོག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བར་གསུངས་སོ། །ཞེས་ཟེར་ན་དེ་ཡང་དག་པར་སྨྲ་བས་སྨྲ་བ་ཡིན་ནམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node containing the entire sentence, comprising both the conditional claim and the questioning of its validity." | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་སེམས་ཅན་དུ་ལྟ་བ་དང༌། སྲོག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བར་གསུངས་སོ། །ཞེས་ཟེར་ན [Type: Scene | Desc: "The first part of the sentence presenting the hypothetical claim about what the Tathagata taught." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཞེས་ཟེར་ན [Type: Condition | Desc: "Introduces the conditional hypothetical statement that someone is making a claim about the Tathagata's teaching." | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་སེམས་ཅན་དུ་ལྟ་བ་དང༌། སྲོག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བ་དང༌། གང་ཟག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བར་གསུངས་སོ། [Type: State | Desc: "The reported speech about what the Tathagata supposedly taught, representing a state rather than parallel scenes." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who is claimed to have taught certain views." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སེམས་ཅན་དུ་ལྟ་བ [Type: Center | Desc: "The object of the first view attributed to the Tathagata's teaching, representing the concept being viewed rather than a scene." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྲོག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བ [Type: Center | Desc: "The object of the second view attributed to the Tathagata's teaching, representing the concept being viewed rather than a scene." | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གང་ཟག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བ [Type: Center | Desc: "The object of the third view attributed to the Tathagata's teaching, representing the concept being viewed rather than a scene." | Implicit: ""]
            └── གསུངས་སོ། དང༌ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of teaching attributed to the Tathagata, merged with the connector that was previously separate." | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་ཡང་དག་པར་སྨྲ་བས་སྨྲ་བ་ཡིན་ནམ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The second part of the sentence questioning whether the claim would be truthful speech, elaborating on the first part of the sentence." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཡང་དག་པར་སྨྲ་བས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Functions as an adverbial phrase modifying how the speech would be made rather than representing a separate agent." | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྨྲ་བ་ཡིན་ནམ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of questioning whether the claim constitutes truthful speech." | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The demonstrative pronoun referring back to the claim about the Tathagata's teaching." | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathagata [Ergative/Instrumental case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: literally "thus-gone one", honorific title for the Buddha; functioning as the Agent in the reported speech]

- སེམས་ཅན་ : sentient beings [Root term `སེམས་ཅན་`: beings with consciousness or mind; object of view/perspective]

- དུ་ : as [Terminative particle indicating "in the form of" or "as"; marks how sentient beings are viewed]

- ལྟ་བ་ : viewing [Verbal noun from `ལྟ་`: to view, to regard, to consider; here referring to a philosophical perspective or view]

- དང༌། : and [Conjunction particle connecting items in a list of views]

- སྲོག་ : life [Root term `སྲོག་`: life-force, vitality; object of the second view]

- ཏུ་ : as [Terminative particle indicating "in the form of" or "as"; marks how life is viewed]

- ལྟ་བ་ : viewing [Verbal noun from `ལྟ་`: to view, to regard, to consider; here referring to a philosophical perspective or view]

- དང༌། : and [Conjunction particle connecting items in a list of views]

- གང་ཟག་ : person [Root term `གང་ཟག་`: person, individual, pudgala; object of the third view]

- ཏུ་ : as [Terminative particle indicating "in the form of" or "as"; marks how persons are viewed]

- ལྟ་བ་ : viewing [Verbal noun from `ལྟ་`: to view, to regard, to consider; here referring to a philosophical perspective or view]

- ར་ : [Terminative particle often used before verbs to indicate manner or purpose; here connecting the views to the teaching]

- གསུངས་སོ། : taught [Perfect tense of honorific verb `གསུང་`: to speak, to teach; with final particle `སོ་` indicating completed statement; the Process attributed to the Tathagata]

- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative particle marking reported speech; indicates the end of the reported teaching]

- ཟེར་ན : if someone says [Conditional form of `ཟེར་`: to say, to claim; introduces a hypothetical claim]

- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun referring to the previously mentioned claim; functions as Patient in the second part]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : truthfully [Adverbial phrase derived from `ཡང་དག་པ་`: correct, true, perfect; modifies how the speech would be made]

- སྨྲ་བས་ : by speaking [Instrumental case of `སྨྲ་བ་`: speech, speaking; functions as an adverbial modifier]

- སྨྲ་བ་ : speech [Verbal noun from `སྨྲ་`: to speak; the object being questioned]

- ཡིན་ནམ། : would it be? [Interrogative form of copula `ཡིན་`: to be; with final question particle `ནམ་`; forms the Process of questioning the truthfulness]

རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་གསོལ་པ། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing Subhuti's statement to the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who is speaking (Subhuti)" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསོལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "The speech act (saying/responding)" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The embedded scene containing Subhuti's response to the Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས [Type: Participant-Addressee | Desc: "The Buddha who is being directly addressed by Subhuti" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་ནི [Type: Center | Desc: "The demonstrative with topic marker referring to the previous statement about Buddha teaching self-views" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Adverbial-Negation | Desc: "Negation response to the question about whether someone would be speaking correctly" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [previous question about Buddha teaching self-views] [Type: Implicit | Desc: "Implicit reference to the previous context" | Implicit: "Reference to the question about whether someone claiming the Tathagata taught views of self would be speaking correctly"]
glossary:
- རབ་འབྱོར་གྱིས་ : Subhuti [Agentive case of `རབ་འབྱོར་`: Subhuti, one of Buddha's main disciples; functions as the primary agent/speaker in this dialogue; the one who is asking or responding to the Buddha]

- གསོལ་པ། : said [Perfect tense of `གསོལ་བ་`: to request, say, speak (honorific); here indicates Subhuti's formal response to the Buddha; functions as the main process/speech act in the scene]

- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; from `བཅོམ་` (conquered) + `ལྡན་` (possessing) + `འདས་` (transcended); direct address to Buddha as the addressee of Subhuti's statement; vocative case]

- དེ་ནི་ : that indeed [Demonstrative `དེ་` (that) + topic marker `ནི་`; refers back to a previous statement or question about the Buddha teaching self-views; marks what is being negated in the response]

- མ་ལགས་སོ། : is not [Negation prefix `མ་` + honorific verb `ལགས་` (to be) + final particle `སོ`; a formal, respectful negation indicating "that is not the case"; negates the proposition implied in the previous discourse about Buddha teaching views of self]

བདེ་བར་གཤེགས་པ་དེ་ནི་མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire negation statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བདེ་བར་གཤེགས་པ་དེ་ [Type: Participant-Center | Desc: "The entity that is the subject of negation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདེ་བར་གཤེགས་པ་ [Type: Center | Desc: "Core reference to the Tathagata/Buddha" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་ [Type: Function | Desc: "Demonstrative modifier indicating reference to a specific Tathagata" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ནི་ [Type: Function-Elaborator | Desc: "Topic marker highlighting the preceding term as the focus of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མ་ལགས་སོ། ། [Type: State-Negative | Desc: "Negation of identity or existence" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [to be] [Type: Process | Desc: "Implicit stative verb (to be/is) that is being negated" | Implicit: "Implied copula/existential verb"]
glossary:
- བདེ་བར་ : happily, blissfully [Terminative case of `བདེ་བ་`: happiness, bliss; adverbial qualifier describing the manner of going/passage; indicates the peaceful state of movement]
- གཤེགས་པ་ : one who has gone [Nominalized form of `གཤེགས་`: to go, depart; honorific verb form used specifically for enlightened beings; forms part of the epithet for Buddha]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; specifies a particular Tathagata being discussed; functions as a definite reference marker]
- ནི་ : as for [Topic marker; highlights the preceding term (Tathagata) as the focus of the statement; sets up what follows as a comment about this topic]
- མ་ : not [Negative prefix; combines with ལགས་ to form the negative existential/copular verb; indicates direct negation]
- ལགས་སོ། ། : is [Honorific copula verb `ལགས་` with sentence-final particle `སོ`; formal equational verb denying identity; the final shad `།` marks the end of the sentence]

ucca_formatted:
དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་བདག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བར་གང་གསུངས་པ་དེ་ནི་ལྟ་བ་མ་མཆིས་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པའི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node containing the entire text" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Rhetorical question asking for the reason" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཞེ་ན [Type: Question | Desc: "Question marker" | Implicit: ""]
        └── དེ་ཅིའི་སླད་དུ [Type: Purpose | Desc: "Asking for the purpose or reason" | Implicit: ""]
            └── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Referent to previous statement" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་བདག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བར་གང་གསུངས་པ་དེ་ནི་ལྟ་བ་མ་མཆིས་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པའི་སླད་དུ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Explanation of the Buddha's teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the agent of teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བདག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བར་གང་གསུངས་པ་དེ་ནི་ལྟ་བ་མ་མཆིས་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པ [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Contrasting aspects of the Buddha's teaching" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བདག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བར་གང་གསུངས་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "First part of the teaching about view of self" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── བདག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Modifies how something is taught rather than what is acted upon" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── གསུངས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of teaching" | Implicit: ""]
                └── གང [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "That which was taught" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── དེ་ནི [Type: Relator | Desc: "Connects the preceding proposition to the following explanation" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ལྟ་བ་མ་མཆིས་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second part of the teaching that clarifies the nature of the view" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The Buddha as the agent of teaching" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── གསུངས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The act of teaching" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ལྟ་བ་མ་མཆིས་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The content of what was taught - that the view is non-existent" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── ཆོས་ཀྱི་བདག་མེད་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit concept that the view itself is non-existent in ultimate reality" | Implicit: "This is an implicit concept that is not in the surface text but represents the Buddhist philosophical concept being discussed"]
        └── སླད་དུ་སྟེ [Type: Purpose | Desc: "Indicates the reason or purpose for the Buddha's statement" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : why/that [Demonstrative pronoun; referent to a previous statement; functions as Patient in the discourse structure]
- ཅིའི་ : for what reason [Interrogative + genitive; from `ཅི་` meaning "what"; used to form the rhetorical question seeking explanation]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the purpose of [Postposition indicating purpose; marks the reason being asked for; part of the fixed expression introducing a reason]
- ཞེ་ན། : if one asks [Question marker; from `ཞེས་` + conditional particle; concludes the rhetorical question "Why is that?"]
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); functions as Agent of teaching]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathāgata [Instrumental/agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "Thus-Gone One"; another title for Buddha; the one who performs the teaching]
- བདག་ཏུ་ : as a self [Terminal particle + directional/purposive marker; from `བདག་` meaning "self"; indicates the object of the view being discussed]
- ལྟ་བར་ : view [Terminative of `ལྟ་བ་`: view, perspective, philosophical position; here referring to the conceptual view of selfhood]
- གང་ : whatever [Relative pronoun; refers to the teaching content; functions as Patient in the semantic structure]
- གསུངས་པ་ : taught [Perfect form of `གསུང་བ་`: to speak, teach (honorific); the process of Buddha's teaching about the view of self]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the teaching just mentioned; acts as a connector between propositions]
- ནི་ : indeed [Topic marker; emphasizes and isolates the topic being discussed]
- ལྟ་བ་ : view [Noun: perspective, philosophical position; the concept being negated in Buddha's teaching]
- མ་མཆིས་པར་ : non-existent [Negative prefix `མ་` + honorific verb `མཆིས་པ་` (to exist) + terminative particle; indicates the negation of the view's ultimate existence]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : the Tathāgata [Instrumental/agentive case of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་`: "Thus-Gone One"; repeats the agent of teaching to emphasize the authority]
- གསུངས་པའི་ : taught [Perfect form of `གསུང་བ་` + genitive; the Buddha's act of teaching with genitive connecting to purpose]
- སླད་དུ་ : for the purpose of [Postposition indicating purpose; introduces the reason for the teaching]
- སྟེ། : that is [Connective particle; concludes and summarizes the explanation]

ucca_formatted:
དེས་ན་བདག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བ་ཞེས་བགྱིའོ། ། [Type: Parallel Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Relator | Desc: "Causal connector introducing the definition that follows" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བདག་ཏུ་ལྟ་བ [Type: Center | Desc: "The central concept being defined in this sentence" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཏུ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Case marker connecting 'self' and 'view'" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [philosophical concept being refuted] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Implicit indication that this view is mentioned specifically to be refuted in Buddhist philosophy" | Implicit: "Indicates this view is mentioned specifically to be refuted in Buddhist philosophy"]
    └── ཞེས་བགྱིའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "Verbal process of naming or calling" | Implicit: ""]
        └── [the Buddha/scripture] [Type: Participant | Desc: "Implicit agent performing the naming action" | Implicit: "The agent performing the naming action"]
glossary:
- དེས་ན་ : therefore [Causal connector `དེས་` (instrumental of that) + `ན་` (conditional marker); connects the previous statement to the definition that follows; functions as a causal relator in the sentence structure]

- བདག་ཏུ་ : as self/ātman [Terminative/Purposive case marker `ཏུ་` with `བདག་` (self/ātman); indicates viewing phenomena as having an inherent self or essence; central Buddhist philosophical concept being defined]

- ལྟ་བ་ : view [Nominalized form of `ལྟ་` (to view/see); here referring to a philosophical position or viewpoint; specifically the mistaken view of self that is a target of refutation in Buddhist philosophy]

- ཞེས་ : thus/so called [Quotative particle; marks the preceding term as being named or defined; connects the concept to the naming process]

- བགྱིའོ། ། : is called/named [Honorific form of `བྱེད་པ་` (to do/make) with final particle `འོ`; indicates the formal definition or naming of a concept; implies an authoritative source (Buddha or scriptures) making this designation]

བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ལ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པས། འདི་ལྟར་ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་ཤེས་པར་བྱ། བལྟ་བར་བྱ། མོས་པར་བྱ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene of the Buddha's instruction" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Agent who is speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── བཀའ་སྩལ་པ། [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of speaking" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རབ་འབྱོར་འདི་ལ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པས། འདི་ལྟར་ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་ཤེས་པར་བྱ། བལྟ་བར་བྱ། མོས་པར་བྱ་སྟེ། [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Content of the Buddha's speech" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Recipient of the Buddha's teaching" | Implicit: ""]
        └── འདི་ལ་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པས། འདི་ལྟར་ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་ཤེས་པར་བྱ། བལྟ་བར་བྱ། མོས་པར་བྱ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main instruction about non-conceptualization" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ཐེག་པ་ལ་ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner of engagement with the Bodhisattva vehicle" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འདི་ལྟར་ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་ཤེས་པར་བྱ། བལྟ་བར་བྱ། མོས་པར་བྱ་སྟེ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Three progressive wisdoms: hearing wisdom (ཐོས་པའི་ཤེས་རབ), contemplative wisdom (བསམ་པའི་ཤེས་རབ), and meditative wisdom (བསྒོམས་པའི་ཤེས་རབ)" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── འདི་ལྟར [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Manner of the three activities" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད་ཤེས་པར་བྱ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First stage: hearing wisdom (ཐོས་པའི་ཤེས་རབ)" | Implicit: ""]
                    ├── ཆོས་ཐམས་ཅད [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object of knowledge - what is non-conceptualized" | Implicit: ""]
                    ├── ཤེས་པར་བྱ། [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of knowing through hearing" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── Linkage to the progression of understanding [Type: Linkage | Desc: "First step in the progression of hearing-contemplating-meditating" | Implicit: "Indicates connection to the next progressive step"]
                ├── བལྟ་བར་བྱ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second stage: contemplative wisdom (བསམ་པའི་ཤེས་རབ)" | Implicit: ""]
                    ├── [all phenomena] [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Implied object of viewing - coreference with 'all phenomena' in node 11" | Implicit: "All phenomena - coreference with node 11"]
                    ├── བལྟ་བར་བྱ། [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of contemplating" | Implicit: ""]

                ├── མོས་པར་བྱ་སྟེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Third stage: meditative wisdom (བསྒོམས་པའི་ཤེས་རབ)" | Implicit: ""]
                    ├── [all phenomena] [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Implied object of devotion - coreference with 'all phenomena' in node 11" | Implicit: "All phenomena - coreference with node 11"]
                    ├── མོས་པར་བྱ་སྟེ། [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of meditating" | Implicit: ""]
                    └── Linkage to the progression of understanding [Type: Linkage | Desc: "Third step in the progression of hearing-contemplating-meditating" | Implicit: "Indicates the culmination of the progressive steps"]
                └── Progressive relation [Type: Relational | Desc: "Indicates the progressive deepening of understanding across the three scenes" | Implicit: "Relation indicating progressive understanding"]
            └── ཡང་དག་པར་ཞུགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Who performs the non-conceptualization" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : The Blessed One [Honorific name for the Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); refers to the speaker who possesses conquest over afflictions and has transcended ordinary existence; functions as Agent in the sentence structure]

- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker indicating agency; attached to `བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་`; marks the Buddha as the Agent performing the action of speaking]

- བཀའ་ : speech [Honorific term for 'word' or 'teaching'; specifically refers to the Buddha's authoritative speech; part of the verbal phrase]

- སྩལ་པ། : proclaimed [Past tense of `སྩལ་བ་`: to give, bestow, proclaim (honorific); indicates the Buddha's act of teaching; functions as the main Process in the opening scene]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of the disciple being addressed; one of the Buddha's chief disciples known for his understanding of emptiness; functions as the Recipient of the teaching]

- འདི་ལ་ : in this [Demonstrative pronoun `འདི་` (this) + locative particle `ལ`; here referring to the present context or teaching situation; sets up the circumstantial frame for the instruction]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའི་ : bodhisattva's [Genitive of `བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་`: awakening-hero, one who seeks enlightenment for the benefit of all beings; modifies 'vehicle' in this context]

- ཐེག་པ་ : vehicle [From `ཐེག་པ་`: vehicle, path, approach to enlightenment; refers to the Mahayana approach to Buddhist practice; part of the adverbial phrase describing how one should practice]

- ལ་ : in, on [Locative particle indicating engagement with the vehicle; shows relationship to the bodhisattva path]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : correctly, properly [Adverbial phrase meaning 'perfectly' or 'authentically'; modifies the manner of engagement with the bodhisattva path]

- ཞུགས་པས། : having entered [Past tense of `འཇུག་པ་`: to enter, engage; with the instrumental/causal suffix `-པས`; indicates the condition or basis for the following instructions; functions as an Adverbial modifier]

- འདི་ལྟར་ : in this way [Demonstrative `འདི་` (this) + comparative particle `ལྟར` (like); introduces the manner in which the following instructions should be carried out]

- ཆོས་ : phenomena, dharmas [Buddhist technical term referring to all elements of existence, mental or physical; the direct object of the three activities to follow; functions as Patient in the structure]

- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [Universal quantifier modifying `ཆོས་`; emphasizes that the instruction applies to every phenomenon without exception]

- ཤེས་པར་ : to know [Terminative form of `ཤེས་པ་`: to know, understand; represents the first stage in the progression of understanding - hearing wisdom (ཐོས་པའི་ཤེས་རབ)]

- བྱ། : should do [Future/imperative form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do; creates a verbal imperative with `ཤེས་པར་`; indicates the first prescribed action]

- བལྟ་བར་ : to view [Terminative form of `ལྟ་བ་`: to look, examine, contemplate; represents the second stage in the progression - contemplative wisdom (བསམ་པའི་ཤེས་རབ)]

- བྱ། : should do [Future/imperative form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do; creates a verbal imperative with `བལྟ་བར་`; indicates the second prescribed action]

- མོས་པར་ : to have faith in [Terminative form of `མོས་པ་`: to have devotion, confidence; represents the third stage in the progression - meditative wisdom (བསྒོམས་པའི་ཤེས་རབ); implies not just intellectual understanding but experiential realization]

- བྱ་ : should do [Future/imperative form of `བྱེད་པ་`: to do; creates a verbal imperative with `མོས་པར་`; indicates the third prescribed action]

- སྟེ། : and, that is [Connective particle indicating that what comes after will elaborate on or explain what came before; here it marks the end of the initial instruction while suggesting more will follow]

ཅི་ནས་ཆོས་སུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ལ་མི་གནས་པར་ཤེས་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root node representing the entire instructional statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [One] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implicit subject who should understand" | Implicit: "The implicit subject who should understand"]
    ├── ཤེས་པར་བྱའོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main verb indicating the imperative instruction to understand" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཆོས་སུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ལ་མི་གནས་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The content of what should be understood" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── མི་གནས་པར [Type: State | Desc: "The state of non-abiding that one should maintain" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་སུ་འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ལ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The conceptual object that one should not abide in" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འདུ་ཤེས་པ [Type: State | Desc: "The conceptual act of perceiving" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཆོས [Type: Center | Desc: "The object of perception" | Implicit: ""]
        └── མི [Type: Function | Desc: "Negation marker indicating non-abiding" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཅི་ནས [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Emphasizes the importance of the instruction" | Implicit: ""]
    └── [to achieve non-conceptualization] [Type: Purpose | Desc: "The implicit purpose of the instruction—to achieve non-conceptualization (རྣམ་པར་མི་རྟོག་པ)" | Implicit: "The implicit purpose of the instruction—to achieve non-conceptualization (རྣམ་པར་མི་རྟོག་པ)"]
glossary:
- ཅི་ནས་ : by all means [Emphatic adverbial connector; from `ཅི` (what) + `ནས` (from); here expressing the absolute importance of the instruction; functions as an Adverbial modifier emphasizing the certainty or necessity of the instruction]

- ཆོས་ : dharma/phenomena [Noun, object case; root word meaning 'dharma' or 'phenomenon'; here referring to conceptual objects of perception; functions as the Center or focal object of perception]

- སུ་ : as [Terminative case marker; indicates transformation or classification; connects `ཆོས` with the perception of it]

- འདུ་ཤེས་པ་ : perception/conception [Verbal noun from `འདུ་ཤེས` (to perceive, conceive, recognize); here referring to the mental activity of categorizing phenomena; functions as the State of conceptual perception]

- ལ་ : in/regarding [Locative case marker; indicates the domain or object toward which action is directed; connects perception with the instruction not to abide in it]

- མི་ : not [Negation particle; negates the following verb; functions as the Function marker indicating negation]

- གནས་པར་ : abiding [Verbal noun from `གནས་པ` (to abide, dwell, remain); with terminative suffix `-ར`; indicates the state to be avoided; functions as the State component]

- ཤེས་པར་ : to understand [Verbal noun from `ཤེས་པ` (to know, understand); with terminative suffix `-ར`; indicates the cognitive action required; functions as part of the main Process]

- བྱའོ : should be done [Future form of `བྱེད་པ` (to do) with the final particle `འོ`; creates imperative instruction; functions as the main Process indicating the instruction]

- ། : [Sentence-ending punctuation mark]

དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། རབ་འབྱོར་ཆོས་སུ་འདུ་ཤེས་ཆོས་སུ་འདུ་ཤེས་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནི། དེ་འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node representing the entire passage" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Question asking for explanation" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object being questioned about" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ཞེ་ན [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of questioning why" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རབ་འབྱོར་ཆོས་སུ་འདུ་ཤེས་ཆོས་སུ་འདུ་ཤེས་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནི། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Introduction of concept being discussed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རབ་འབྱོར [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Person being addressed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཆོས་སུ་འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "First mention of the concept of perception of phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object of perception" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of perception" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ནི [Type: Relator | Desc: "Phrase connecting the concept with its explanation" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཆོས་སུ་འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Second mention of the concept of perception of phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Object of perception" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of perception" | Implicit: ""]
    └── དེ་འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་པར་དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་གསུངས་པའི་ཕྱིར་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Explanation that provides the reason for the definition" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "Agent who declares or teaches" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── གསུངས་པའི [Type: Process | Desc: "Process of teaching or declaring" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── དེ་འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་པར [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "Content of what was declared" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདུ་ཤེས་མེད་པར [Type: State | Desc: "State of non-perception that is being affirmed" | Implicit: ""]
                └── དེ [Type: Participant-Attribute | Desc: "Reference to the previously mentioned concept of perception" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཕྱིར་ཏེ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connective that establishes the causal or explanatory relationship between the statements" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers to previous statement or concept; functions as Patient/object being questioned in UCCA structure]
- ཅིའི་ཕྱིར་ : for what reason [Interrogative; composed of `ཅི་` (what) + genitive particle `འི་` + `ཕྱིར་` (for, because of); introduces a rhetorical question]
- ཞེ་ན། : if asked [Conditional clause marker; from `ཞེས་` (quotative) + `ན་` (if); signals a rhetorical question is being posed]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhūti [Proper noun; name of the Buddha's disciple being addressed; functions as Recipient in UCCA structure]
- ཆོས་སུ་ : as dharma/phenomena [Terminative case of `ཆོས་`: dharma, phenomena, teachings; object of perception; Patient in UCCA structure]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Verbal noun from `འདུ་བ་` (to gather) + `ཤེས་པ་` (to know); specifically refers to the mental function of recognition/identification; Process in UCCA structure]
- ཆོས་སུ་ : as dharma/phenomena [Second instance; repetition for emphasis; Patient in UCCA structure]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Second instance; repetition for emphasis; Process in UCCA structure]
- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative particle; indicates preceding term is being cited or defined]
- བྱ་བ་ : called [Verbal noun from `བྱེད་པ་` (to do); here used to introduce a definition]
- ནི། : regarding [Topic marker; highlights the preceding phrase as the topic under discussion]
- དེ་ : that [Demonstrative pronoun; refers back to the concept of perception of phenomena; Attribute in UCCA structure]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Verbal noun; same as above; part of the content being declared]
- མེད་པར་ : without [Negative existential `མེད་` + terminative particle `པར་`; indicates absence or negation; part of State in UCCA structure]
- དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པས་ : by the Tathāgata [Agentive/instrumental of `དེ་བཞིན་གཤེགས་པ་` (Thus-Gone One, epithet of Buddha); Agent who makes the declaration]
- གསུངས་པའི་ : was taught [Perfective of `གསུང་བ་` (to speak) + genitive particle `འི་`; Process of teaching in UCCA structure]
- ཕྱིར་ : because [Conjunction indicating reason or cause; introduces the explanation for the definition]
- ཏེ། : and so [Connective particle; links this explanatory clause with the preceding statement]

དེས་ན་ཆོས་སུ་འདུ་ཤེས་ཆོས་སུ་འདུ་ཤེས་ཞེས་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene of the statement" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Linker-Causal | Desc: "Causal connector establishing logical reason for designation" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ཞེས་བྱའོ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Relator indicating designation/naming rather than a process" | Implicit: ""]

        ├── ཆོས་སུ་འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Center | Desc: "First instance of dharma-perception" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་སུ [Type: Attribute | Desc: "Attribute specifying how the perception occurs" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདུ་ཤེས [Type: State | Desc: "The mental process of perception in first instance" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཆོས་སུ་འདུ་ཤེས [Type: Center | Desc: "Second instance of dharma-perception" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆོས་སུ [Type: Attribute | Desc: "Attribute specifying how the perception occurs" | Implicit: ""]
            └── འདུ་ཤེས [Type: State | Desc: "The mental process of perception in second instance" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [implied speaker] [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "Implied agent of the naming action" | Implicit: "The implied agent of the naming action"]
    └── [only conventionally real, not ultimately real] [Type: Elaborator-Implicit | Desc: "Implicit philosophical clarification about the conventional nature of dharma-perception" | Implicit: "Philosophical clarification about the conventional nature of dharma-perception"]
glossary:
- དེས་ན : therefore [Instrumental of `དེ་`: that + connective particle `ན`; functions as a causal connector establishing the logical reason for the designation that follows; serves as a Linker-Causal in the sentence structure]
- ཆོས་སུ་ : as dharma [Terminative of `ཆོས་`: dharma, phenomenon, teaching; specifies how the perception occurs; functions as an Attribute defining the content of perception]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Noun from `འདུ་`: to gather + `ཤེས་`: to know; refers to the mental process of perception or discernment; functions as a State element describing a mental activity]
- ཆོས་སུ་ : as dharma [Second occurrence of the terminative of `ཆོས་`: dharma; identical to the first occurrence; functions as an Attribute]
- འདུ་ཤེས་ : perception [Second occurrence of the term; identical to the first occurrence but repeated for emphasis; functions as a State element]
- ཞེས་ : thus [Quotative particle indicating that what precedes is being named or designated; connects the concept to its designation]
- བྱའོ : is called [Future/present of `བྱེད་`: to do, make + final particle `འོ`; indicates designation or naming rather than a process; functions as a Relator connecting the concept to its designation]

ཡང་རབ་འབྱོར་བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་གང་གིས་འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ཁམས་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་ཅིང་གྲངས་མེད་པ་དག་རིན་པོ་ཆེ་སྣ་བདུན་གྱིས་རབ་ཏུ་གང་བར་བྱས་ཏེ་སྦྱིན་པ་བྱིན་པ་བས། རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་གང་གིས་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་འདི་ལས་ཐ་ན་ཚིག་བཞི་པའི་ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་ཙམ་བྲིས་ནས་འཛིན་ཏམ། འཆང་ངམ། ཀློག་གམ། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་དམ། གཞན་དག་ལ་རྒྱ་ཆེར་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ་སྟོན་ན་དེ་ཉིད་གཞི་དེ་ལས་བསོད་ནམས་ཆེས་མང་དུ་གྲངས་མེད་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་བསྐྱེད་དོ། ། [Type: Linker | Desc: "Comparative discourse structure between two scenarios" | Implicit: ""]

    └── རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་གང་གིས་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་འདི་ལས་ཐ་ན་ཚིག་བཞི་པའི་ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་ཙམ་བྲིས་ནས་འཛིན་ཏམ། འཆང་ངམ། ཀློག་གམ། ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་དམ། གཞན་དག་ལ་རྒྱ་ཆེར་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ་སྟོན་ན་དེ་ཉིད་གཞི་དེ་ལས་བསོད་ནམས་ཆེས་མང་དུ་གྲངས་མེད་དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་བསྐྱེད་དོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second scenario in comparison: preserving and teaching perfection of wisdom" | Implicit: ""]

        └── as a result [Type: Relator | Desc: "Implicit connection showing the causal relationship between preserving/teaching and merit accumulation" | Implicit: "Implicit connection showing the causal relationship between preserving/teaching and merit accumulation"]
glossary:
- ཡང་ : Moreover [Continuative particle; marks transition to a new topic or continuation of discourse; functions as a discourse connector introducing a new point in the Buddha's teaching]

- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name; one of Buddha's chief disciples; functions as the addressee of this teaching]

- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattva [Sanskrit term for "enlightenment being"; one who seeks awakening for the benefit of all beings; functioning as part of the agent description in the first comparative scenario]

- སེམས་དཔའ་ཆེན་པོ་ : great being [Honorific title; mahasattva; qualifying the bodhisattva as advanced on the path; part of the agent descriptor]

- གང་གིས་ : who [Interrogative-turned-relative pronoun with instrumental case; introduces relative clause; identifies the agent who performs the action of filling and giving]

- འཇིག་རྟེན་གྱི་ : world [Genitive of `འཇིག་རྟེན་`; universe, world system; here used in a cosmological sense to indicate countless realms; part of the patient in the first scenario]

- ཁམས་ : realms [Sanskrit dhātu; basic elements or spheres of existence; here referring to world systems; part of the patient object]

- དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་ཅིང་ : immeasurable [Verbal adjective from `དཔག་`: to measure + negative; describes realms as beyond measurement; qualifying the world systems being filled]

- གྲངས་མེད་པ་དག་ : innumerable [Verbal adjective from `གྲངས་`: number + negative; describes realms as uncountable; second qualifier of the world systems]

- རིན་པོ་ཆེ་ : precious substances [Noun; jewels, gems; objects used for the offering; part of the instrumental phrase]

- སྣ་བདུན་གྱིས་ : with seven kinds [Instrumental case of `སྣ་བདུན་`: seven types; traditional list of seven precious materials; instrument used for filling]

- རབ་ཏུ་ : completely [Adverbial intensifier; thoroughly, utterly; intensifies the action of filling]

- གང་བར་ : filling [Verbal noun from `གང་བ་`: to fill; describes the action performed with the jewels]

- བྱས་ཏེ་ : having done [Verbal connector; past form of `བྱེད་`: to do + connective; links the filling action to the giving action]

- སྦྱིན་པ་ : offering [Verbal noun; act of giving, generosity; here referring to the act of charity]

- བྱིན་པ་ : gave [Past form of `སྦྱིན་པ་`: to give; completes the action of offering the filled realms]

- བས། : than [Ablative case marker; establishes comparative relationship between the two scenarios; indicates the first scenario is lesser than the second]

- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུའམ་ : son of good family [Compound term; noble person, spiritual practitioner; refers to male practitioners; first part of agent in second scenario]

- རིགས་ཀྱི་བུ་མོ་ : daughter of good family [Compound term; female practitioner; refers to female practitioners; second part of agent in second scenario]

- གང་གིས་ : who [Interrogative-turned-relative pronoun with instrumental case; identifies the agent who engages with the perfection of wisdom]

- ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ : of wisdom [Genitive of `ཤེས་རབ་`: wisdom, insight; modifies the perfection that follows; part of the text reference]

- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ : to the other shore [Directional phrase; "beyond," "to the far side"; Sanskrit pāramitā; part of the term for transcendent wisdom]

- ཕྱིན་པ་ : perfection [Verbal noun from `ཕྱིན་པ་`: to go, to reach; here as part of the Sanskrit term prajñāpāramitā]

- འདི་ལས་ : from this [Ablative of `འདི་`: this; specifies the source text being referenced]

- ཐ་ན་ : even [Minimizing term; "at minimum," "at least"; emphasizes the minimal action that still generates great merit]

- ཚིག་བཞི་པའི་ : of four lines [Genitive modifier; refers to a quatrain verse format; describes the minimal textual unit]

- ཚིགས་སུ་བཅད་པ་ : verse [Term for metrical verse; Sanskrit gāthā; the literary form of the text portion]

- ཙམ་ : merely [Limiting particle; only, just; emphasizes the minimal quantity of text]

- བྲིས་ནས་ : having written [Past form of `འབྲི་བ་`: to write + connective; first of several actions performed with the text]

- འཛིན་ཏམ། : holds [Present form of `འཛིན་པ་`: to hold, retain + alternative marker; second possible action with the text]

- འཆང་ངམ། : keeps [Present form of `འཆང་བ་`: to possess, maintain + alternative marker; third possible action with the text]

- ཀློག་གམ། : reads [Present form of `ཀློག་པ་`: to read aloud + alternative marker; fourth possible action with the text]

- ཀུན་ཆུབ་པར་བྱེད་དམ། : comprehends [Verbal phrase with `ཀུན་ཆུབ་པ་`: to comprehend fully + alternative marker; fifth possible action with the text]

- གཞན་དག་ལ་ : to others [Dative of `གཞན་`: others; indicates recipients of the teaching action]

- རྒྱ་ཆེར་ : extensively [Adverbial phrase; widely, broadly; describes the manner of teaching]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : correctly [Adverbial phrase; properly, accurately; qualifies the teaching as authentic]

- རབ་ཏུ་ : thoroughly [Adverbial intensifier; completely; intensifies the teaching action]

- སྟོན་ན་ : if teaches [Present form of `སྟོན་པ་`: to teach, demonstrate + conditional; final possible action with the text]

- དེ་ཉིད་ : this very [Emphatic demonstrative; this specific, this particular; refers to the person engaging with the text]

- གཞི་དེ་ལས་ : from that basis [Ablative phrase; from that foundation or ground; refers to the basis of merit generation]

- བསོད་ནམས་ : merit [Sanskrit puṇya; positive spiritual energy; the beneficial result that is generated]

- ཆེས་ : far [Comparative intensifier; much more, far more; establishes the degree of difference]

- མང་དུ་ : abundantly [Adverbial phrase from `མང་པོ་`: many; indicates quantity of merit]

- གྲངས་མེད་ : innumerable [Verbal adjective; uncountable; first qualifier of the merit]

- དཔག་ཏུ་མེད་པ་ : immeasurable [Verbal adjective; immeasurable; second qualifier of the merit]

- བསྐྱེད་དོ། ། : generates [Future/present form of `སྐྱེད་པ་`: to produce, generate + sentence-final marker; main verb of second scenario indicating the production of merit]

glossary:
- ཇི་ལྟར་ : how [Interrogative adverb expressing manner; literally "in what way"; functions as an interrogative adverbial asking about the method or approach]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly/correctly [Adverbial form of `ཡང་དག་པ་`: perfect, authentic, genuine; here qualifying the manner of teaching; functions as part of the adverbial phrase modifying the teaching process]
- རབ་ཏུ་ : thoroughly/completely [Intensifying adverb; from `རབ་`: supreme, excellent; intensifies the action that follows; part of the adverbial phrase]
- སྟོན་ : teach/demonstrate [Present form of `སྟོན་པ་`: to show, teach, demonstrate; the main verb of the question; functions as the core process]
- ཅེ་ན། : if one asks [Interrogative marker; introduces a hypothetical question; marks the end of the question clause]
- ཇི་ལྟར་ : how [Same as above; initiating the response; functions as an adverbial in the elaboration]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly/correctly [Same as above; modifying the manner of non-teaching]
- རབ་ཏུ་ : thoroughly [Same as above; intensifying the action]
- མི་ : not [Negation particle; negates the verb that follows; creates the paradoxical concept of "not teaching"]
- སྟོན་པ་ : teaching [Nominalizer form of `སྟོན་པ་`: to teach; here functioning as a verbal noun expressing the concept of teaching; part of the process of not teaching]
- དེ་བཞིན་དུ་ : in that very way/likewise [Connector; `དེ་བཞིན་`: in that manner + `དུ་`: terminative particle; establishes the paradoxical relationship between not teaching and teaching]
- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly/correctly [Same as above; modifying the manner of teaching in the conclusion]
- རབ་ཏུ་ : thoroughly [Same as above; intensifying the action]
- སྟོན་པ་ : teaching [Nominalizer form of `སྟོན་པ་`: to teach; the main process in the conclusion; represents teaching in conventional reality]
- སྟེ། : that is to say [Explanatory particle; marks that an explanation or clarification follows; emphasizes the paradoxical nature of the statement]

དེས་ན་ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ་སྟོན་པ་ཞེས་བྱའོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེས་ན [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connects the current statement to an implicit previous cause" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [Buddha/Tathagata] [Type: Participant | Desc: "The implicit agent (Buddha/Tathagata) who performs the teaching" | Implicit: "The implicit agent who performs the teaching"]
    ├── སྟོན་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of teaching/showing" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཡང་དག་པར་རབ་ཏུ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Modifies how the teaching is done - perfectly or completely" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བྱའོ [Type: Function | Desc: "Auxiliary verb indicating 'is called' or 'is termed'" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཞེས [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Connects the action to the auxiliary verb" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- དེས་ན་ : Therefore [Demonstrative pronoun `དེས་` in instrumental case + connective particle `ན་`; indicates causal relationship with preceding content; functions as a Linker connecting the statement to the previous context]

- ཡང་དག་པར་ : perfectly/completely [Adverbial form of `ཡང་དག་པ་`: authentic, genuine, correct; terminative particle `-ར`; modifies the manner of teaching as being genuine and thorough; functions as part of an Elaborator phrase]

- རབ་ཏུ་ : thoroughly/completely [Intensive adverbial modifier; intensifies the manner of teaching; functions as part of an Elaborator phrase with ཡང་དག་པར་]

- སྟོན་པ་ : teaching/showing [Nominalized form of verb `སྟོན་`: to teach, show, demonstrate; the main Process in the sentence; performed by the implicit agent (Buddha/Tathagata)]

- ཞེས་ : thus/so called [Quotative particle; connects the preceding content to the auxiliary verb; functions as an Elaborator linking the main action to its designation]

- བྱའོ། ། : is called/termed [Future form of verb `བྱེད་`: to do, make + final particle `འོ`; functions as an auxiliary verb indicating designation; completes the sentence by indicating "this is called/termed"]

ucca_formatted:
སྐར་མ་རབ་རིབ་མར་མེ་དང༌། །སྒྱུ་མ་ཟིལ་བ་ཆུ་བུར་དང༌། །རྨི་ལམ་གློག་དང་སྤྲིན་ལྟ་བུ། །འདུས་བྱས་ཐམས་ཅད་དེ་ལྟར་ལྟ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene containing the entire verse about viewing conditioned phenomena" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── འདུས་བྱས་ཐམས་ཅད [Type: State | Desc: "The subject state being examined, representing all conditioned phenomena in their nature" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── དེ་ལྟར་ལྟ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Modifier indicating how one should view conditioned phenomena - 'in that way'" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── སྐར་མ་རབ་རིབ་མར་མེ་དང༌། །སྒྱུ་མ་ཟིལ་བ་ཆུ་བུར་དང༌། །རྨི་ལམ་གློག་དང་སྤྲིན་ལྟ་བུ། ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "The nine similes presented as parallel scenes" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── སྐར་མ་ལྟ་བུ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene representing the stars simile" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྐར་མ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the nature of the first simile" | Implicit: ""]
            └── View as [Type: Process | Desc: "Implicit process of viewing conditioned phenomena as stars" | Implicit: "Implicit process of viewing conditioned phenomena as stars"]
        ├── རབ་རིབ་ལྟ་བུ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene representing the eye disease simile" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རབ་རིབ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the nature of the second simile" | Implicit: ""]
            └── View as [Type: Process | Desc: "Implicit process of viewing conditioned phenomena as eye disease" | Implicit: "Implicit process of viewing conditioned phenomena as eye disease"]
        ├── མར་མེ་ལྟ་བུ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene representing the lamp simile" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མར་མེ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the nature of the third simile" | Implicit: ""]
            └── View as [Type: Process | Desc: "Implicit process of viewing conditioned phenomena as lamps" | Implicit: "Implicit process of viewing conditioned phenomena as lamps"]
        ├── སྒྱུ་མ་ལྟ་བུ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene representing the illusion simile" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྒྱུ་མ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the nature of the fourth simile" | Implicit: ""]
            └── View as [Type: Process | Desc: "Implicit process of viewing conditioned phenomena as illusions" | Implicit: "Implicit process of viewing conditioned phenomena as illusions"]
        ├── ཟིལ་བ་ལྟ་བུ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene representing the dew simile" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཟིལ་བ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the nature of the fifth simile" | Implicit: ""]
            └── View as [Type: Process | Desc: "Implicit process of viewing conditioned phenomena as dew" | Implicit: "Implicit process of viewing conditioned phenomena as dew"]
        ├── ཆུ་བུར་ལྟ་བུ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene representing the bubble simile" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཆུ་བུར [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the nature of the sixth simile" | Implicit: ""]
            └── View as [Type: Process | Desc: "Implicit process of viewing conditioned phenomena as bubbles" | Implicit: "Implicit process of viewing conditioned phenomena as bubbles"]
        ├── རྨི་ལམ་ལྟ་བུ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene representing the dream simile" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── རྨི་ལམ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the nature of the seventh simile" | Implicit: ""]
            └── View as [Type: Process | Desc: "Implicit process of viewing conditioned phenomena as dreams" | Implicit: "Implicit process of viewing conditioned phenomena as dreams"]
        ├── གློག་ལྟ་བུ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene representing the lightning simile" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── གློག [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the nature of the eighth simile" | Implicit: ""]
            └── View as [Type: Process | Desc: "Implicit process of viewing conditioned phenomena as lightning" | Implicit: "Implicit process of viewing conditioned phenomena as lightning"]
        ├── སྤྲིན་ལྟ་བུ [Type: Scene | Desc: "Scene representing the cloud simile" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── སྤྲིན [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaborates on the nature of the ninth simile" | Implicit: ""]
            └── View as [Type: Process | Desc: "Implicit process of viewing conditioned phenomena as clouds" | Implicit: "Implicit process of viewing conditioned phenomena as clouds"]
        ├── དང༌ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connector linking the various similes in a list" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ལྟ་བུ [Type: Relator | Desc: "Indicates the simile relationship between phenomena and their impermanent nature" | Implicit: ""]
    └── Practitioner/Viewer [Type: Implicit Participant-Agent | Desc: "The implied practitioner or viewer who is being instructed to view conditioned phenomena" | Implicit: "The implied practitioner or viewer who is being instructed to view conditioned phenomena"]
glossary:
- སྐར་མ་ : stars [noun; `སྐར་མ`: celestial bodies; functioning as elaborator in the first simile, representing ephemeral, distant phenomena]
- རབ་རིབ་ : visual distortions [noun; `རབ་རིབ`: eye disease or blurred vision; functioning as elaborator in the second simile, representing deceptive perceptions]
- མར་མེ་ : butter lamps [noun; `མར་མེ`: oil lamp; functioning as elaborator in the third simile, representing temporary illumination that will eventually exhaust its fuel]
- དང༌ : and [conjunction; connective particle linking items in a list; serves as a linker between the various similes]
- སྒྱུ་མ་ : magical illusions [noun; `སྒྱུ་མ`: illusion or magic trick; functioning as elaborator in the fourth simile, representing deceptive appearances]
- ཟིལ་བ་ : dew [noun; `ཟིལ་བ`: morning dew; functioning as elaborator in the fifth simile, representing phenomena that quickly evaporate]
- ཆུ་བུར་ : water bubbles [noun; `ཆུ་བུར`: bubbles on water; functioning as elaborator in the sixth simile, representing momentary formations that quickly pop]
- དང༌ : and [conjunction; connective particle linking items in a list; serves as a linker between the various similes]
- རྨི་ལམ་ : dreams [noun; `རྨི་ལམ`: dream experience; functioning as elaborator in the seventh simile, representing non-substantial mental projections]
- གློག་ : lightning [noun; `གློག`: lightning flash; functioning as elaborator in the eighth simile, representing instantaneous, brilliant but fleeting phenomena]
- དང་ : and [conjunction; connective particle linking items in a list; serves as a linker between the various similes]
- སྤྲིན་ : clouds [noun; `སྤྲིན`: clouds in sky; functioning as elaborator in the ninth simile, representing ever-changing, insubstantial formations]
- ལྟ་བུ : like [adverbial particle; `ལྟ་བུ`: similar to; functions as relator indicating the simile relationship between conditioned phenomena and these impermanent examples]
- འདུས་བྱས་ : conditioned phenomena [noun; `འདུས་བྱས`: that which is composed or fabricated; the subject state being examined in the verse, refers to all compounded things in Buddhist philosophy]
- ཐམས་ཅད་ : all [determiner; `ཐམས་ཅད`: entirety, totality; qualifies the subject to include all conditioned phenomena without exception]
- དེ་ལྟར་ : in that way [adverbial phrase; `དེ་ལྟར`: thus, in such a manner; adverbial modifier indicating how one should view conditioned phenomena]
- ལྟ : view [verb; imperative form of `ལྟ་བ`: to view, examine, consider; the main action being instructed - to view conditioned phenomena as similar to the nine similes]

source: བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་ནས། གནས་བརྟན་རབ་འབྱོར་དང༌། དགེ་སློང་དེ་དག་དང༌། བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་དེ་དག་དང༌། འཁོར་བཞི་པོ་དགེ་སློང་དང༌། དགེ་སློང་མ་དང༌། དགེ་བསྙེན་དང༌། དགེ་བསྙེན་མ་དང༌། ལྷ་དང༌། མི་དང་ལྷ་མ་ཡིན་དང༌། དྲི་ཟར་བཅས་པའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་ཡི་རངས་ཏེ།
ucca_formatted: བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་བཀའ་སྩལ་ནས། གནས་བརྟན་རབ་འབྱོར་དང༌། དགེ་སློང་དེ་དག་དང༌། བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་དེ་དག་དང༌། འཁོར་བཞི་པོ་དགེ་སློང་དང༌། དགེ་སློང་མ་དང༌། དགེ་བསྙེན་དང༌། དགེ་བསྙེན་མ་དང༌། ལྷ་དང༌། མི་དང་ལྷ་མ་ཡིན་དང༌། དྲི་ཟར་བཅས་པའི་འཇིག་རྟེན་ཡི་རངས་ཏེ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "The root node representing the entire text, describing the Buddha speaking and the assembly's reaction." | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ : the Blessed One [Honorific title for Buddha; compound of `བཅོམ་` (conquered), `ལྡན་` (possessing), and `འདས་` (transcended); functions as Agent/Speaker in this scene]
- ཀྱིས་ : by [Instrumental case marker indicating that Buddha is the Agent who performed the action of speaking]
- དེ་སྐད་ཅེས་ : thus, in this way [Adverbial phrase referring to the content of Buddha's speech; `དེ་` (that), `སྐད་` (speech/words), `ཅེས་` (quotative marker); functions as Manner modifier]
- བཀའ་སྩལ་ : spoke, proclaimed [Honorific verb for 'to speak'; `བཀའ་` (word/speech of an exalted being), `སྩལ་` (to give/bestow); indicates the Process of formal teaching]
- ནས། : after, having done so [Converb marker indicating sequential action; connects the Buddha's speaking to the subsequent reaction]
- གནས་བརྟན་ : Elder [Title for senior monastic; `གནས་` (abide/dwell), `བརྟན་` (stable/firm); refers to a senior monk in Buddhist hierarchy]
- རབ་འབྱོར་ : Subhuti [Proper name of one of Buddha's chief disciples; known for his understanding of emptiness (śūnyatā); functions as Participant in the scene]
- དང༌། : and [Conjunction connecting items in a list]
- དགེ་སློང་ : monks [Buddhist fully-ordained male renunciants; `དགེ་` (virtue), `སློང་` (to request/seek); functions as Participants]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Plural demonstrative pronoun referring to the previously mentioned monks]
- དང༌། : and [Conjunction connecting items in a list]
- བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ : bodhisattvas [Beings aspiring to enlightenment for the benefit of all; `བྱང་ཆུབ་` (enlightenment), `སེམས་དཔའ་` (hero of mind); functions as Participants]
- དེ་དག་ : those [Plural demonstrative pronoun referring to the previously mentioned bodhisattvas]
- དང༌། : and [Conjunction connecting items in a list]
- འཁོར་བཞི་པོ་ : the four assemblies [Buddhist community consisting of four groups; `འཁོར་` (retinue/assembly), `བཞི་` (four), `པོ་` (nominalizer); functions as Participants]
- དགེ་སློང་ : monks [Fully-ordained male monastics; functions as first item in the enumeration of the four assemblies]
- དང༌། : and [Conjunction connecting items in a list]
- དགེ་སློང་མ་ : nuns [Fully-ordained female monastics; `དགེ་སློང་` (monk), `མ་` (female marker); functions as second item in the enumeration]
- དང༌། : and [Conjunction connecting items in a list]
- དགེ་བསྙེན་ : laymen [Male lay practitioners who have taken certain vows; `དགེ་` (virtue), `བསྙེན་` (to approach/rely on); functions as third item in the enumeration]
- དང༌། : and [Conjunction connecting items in a list]
- དགེ་བསྙེན་མ་ : laywomen [Female lay practitioners who have taken certain vows; `དགེ་བསྙེན་` (layman), `མ་` (female marker); functions as fourth item in the enumeration]
- དང༌། : and [Conjunction connecting items in a list]
- ལྷ་ : gods/devas [Divine beings in Buddhist cosmology; functions as Participants in a broader assembly]
- དང༌། : and [Conjunction connecting items in a list]
- མི་ : humans [Human beings; functions as Participants in a broader assembly]
- དང་ : and [Conjunction connecting items in a list]
- ལྷ་མ་ཡིན་ : asuras [Semi-divine beings characterized by jealousy; literally "not-gods"; `ལྷ་` (god), `མ་ཡིན་` (not being); functions as Participants]
- དང༌། : and [Conjunction connecting items in a list]
- དྲི་ཟར་ : gandharvas [Celestial musicians in Buddhist cosmology; `དྲི་` (scent), `ཟ་` (eat); functions as Participants]
- བཅས་པའི་ : including [Postposition indicating inclusion; `བཅས་པ་` (together with), `འི་` (genitive marker); connects all previous participants to the following]
- འཇིག་རྟེན་ : world [The conventional world or universe; `འཇིག་` (to perish), `རྟེན་` (support/base); collectively refers to all the assemblies mentioned]
- ཡི་རངས་ཏེ། : rejoiced [Verb indicating approval and joy; `ཡི་རངས་` (to rejoice/be delighted), `ཏེ་` (continuative particle); functions as main Process showing the response to Buddha's teaching]

ucca_formatted:
བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་གསུངས་པ་ལ་མངོན་པར་བསྟོད་དོ།། །། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Root scene representing the entire sentence" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── [The assembly] [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The explicit agent who is performing the praise" | Implicit: "The assembly who praised is implied but not explicitly stated in the text"]
        └── [monks, nuns, laypeople, gods, etc.] [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Elaboration specifying the various groups that comprise the assembly" | Implicit: "The specific groups that comprise the assembly are implied from context"]
    ├── མངོན་པར་བསྟོད་དོ [Type: Process | Desc: "The main action of praising or expressing admiration" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── གསུངས་པ་ལ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Adverbial phrase indicating what was being praised" | Implicit: ""]
        └── གསུངས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The process of speaking that produced the content being praised" | Implicit: ""]
    └── བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས [Type: Participant-Agent | Desc: "The agent who did the speaking (the Buddha)" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་ཀྱིས་ : by the Blessed One [Ergative case of `བཅོམ་ལྡན་འདས་`: "one who has conquered and possesses [qualities]", honorific title for the Buddha; functions as the Agent who performed the speaking according to the semantic structure]
- གསུངས་པ་ : what was spoken [Nominalized past form of `གསུང་`: "to speak" (honorific); refers to the Buddha's teachings or discourse; functions as the content that is the target of praise]
- ལ་ : to, towards [Dative/locative particle indicating direction or object; here connecting the teachings with the act of praise; marks what is being praised]
- མངོན་པར་ : manifestly, openly [Adverbial form of `མངོན་པ་`: "manifest, evident"; indicates the manner in which the praise was offered; as an intensifier for the praise]
- བསྟོད་དོ : praised [Past tense of `བསྟོད་`: "to praise, extol"; the main verb with sentence-final marker `-དོ`; indicates the main Process in the sentence, performed by an implicit Agent (the assembly)]
- །། །། : [double shad punctuation marks indicating the end of a section or text]

འཕགས་པ་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་རྡོ་རྗེ་གཅོད་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ཐེག་པ་ཆེན་པོའི་མདོ་རྫོགས་སོ།། །། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main scene representing the entire sutra title and completion" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རྫོགས་སོ།། །། [Type: Process | Desc: "Completion marker indicating the sutra has been concluded" | Implicit: ""]
    └── འཕགས་པ་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་རྡོ་རྗེ་གཅོད་པ་ཞེས་བྱ་བ་ཐེག་པ་ཆེན་པོའི་མདོ [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The sutra that is being completed" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── འཕགས་པ་ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ་རྡོ་རྗེ་གཅོད་པ [Type: Center | Desc: "The core title of the sutra" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── འཕགས་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Qualifier for the entire text, indicating its noble/superior status" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཤེས་རབ་ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ [Type: Center | Desc: "Main concept of the sutra - Perfection of Wisdom" | Implicit: ""]
                ├── ཤེས་རབ [Type: Center | Desc: "The core concept - wisdom" | Implicit: ""]
                └── ཀྱི་ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ཕྱིན་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Specifier indicating the perfection/paramita aspect" | Implicit: ""]
            └── རྡོ་རྗེ་གཅོད་པ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Secondary title/descriptor of the sutra" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཞེས་བྱ་བ [Type: Linker | Desc: "Connects the title with the description of the text type" | Implicit: ""]
            └── ཞེས་བྱ་བ [Type: Connector | Desc: "Connector linking the title with its description" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཐེག་པ་ཆེན་པོའི་མདོ [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Description of the type of text (Mahayana sutra)" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཐེག་པ་ཆེན་པོའི [Type: Elaborator | Desc: "Specifier indicating this is a Mahayana text" | Implicit: ""]
            └── མདོ [Type: Center | Desc: "The type of text - a sutra" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- འཕགས་པ་ : Noble [Honorific marker: from `འཕགས་པ་`: exalted, superior, noble; indicates the sacred and elevated nature of the text; functions as a qualifier for the entire text]
- ཤེས་རབ་ : wisdom [Noun: from `ཤེས་རབ་`: transcendent wisdom, prajñā; the core concept of the sutra referring to discriminating awareness; functions as the central concept being perfected]
- ཀྱི་ : of [Genitive particle: connects wisdom with its perfection; shows possessive relationship]
- ཕ་རོལ་ཏུ་ : to the other shore [Terminative case: from `ཕ་རོལ་`: other side, far shore; with terminative particle `ཏུ་`; indicates transcendence or crossing over to completion]
- ཕྱིན་པ་ : perfection [Verbal noun: from `ཕྱིན་པ་`: to go beyond, perfect, complete; refers to paramita or transcendent perfection; completes the phrase "perfection of wisdom"]
- རྡོ་རྗེ་ : vajra [Noun: from `རྡོ་རྗེ་`: diamond, thunderbolt; symbolizes indestructible, diamond-like clarity and precision; serves as modifier for the cutting action]
- གཅོད་པ་ : cutter [Verbal noun: from `གཅོད་པ་`: to cut, sever; refers to the sutra's function of cutting through delusion and ignorance; acts as secondary descriptor of the text]
- ཞེས་ : called [Quotative particle: marks the preceding text as a title or designation; connects the title with what follows]
- བྱ་བ་ : named [Verbal noun: from `བྱ་བ་`: to call, name; works with `ཞེས་` to mean "that which is called"; functions as connector between title and description]
- ཐེག་པ་ : vehicle [Noun: from `ཐེག་པ་`: vehicle, yāna; refers to spiritual path or method; part of the designation of the text type]
- ཆེན་པོའི་ : great [Adjectival + genitive: from `ཆེན་པོ་`: great, vast; with genitive `འི་`; modifies "vehicle" to specify Mahayana Buddhism; functions as specifier for the type of sutra]
- མདོ་ : sutra [Noun: from `མདོ་`: discourse, scripture; designates the text type as Buddha's direct teachings; the center of the text type description]
- རྫོགས་སོ།། །། : is completed [Verb + final particle: from `རྫོགས་`: complete, finish; with final marker `སོ།།`; conventional ending marking the conclusion of a text; functions as the main process indicating completion]
