ན་མོ་བྷ་ག་ཝ་ཏེ། པྲཛྙཱ་པ་ར་མི་ཏ་ཡེ། ཨོཾ་ན་ཏ་ད་ཏི་ཏ། ཨི་ལི་ཤི །ཨི་ལི་ཤི །མི་ལི་ཤི །མི་ལི་ཤི །བྷི་ན་ཡན་བྷི་ན་ཡན། ན་མོ་བྷ་ག་ཝ་ཏེ། པྲད་ཏྱཾ་པྲ་ཏེ། ཨི་རི་ཏི། ཨི་རི་ཏི། མི་ར་ཏི། མི་རི་ཏི། ཤུ་རི་ཏི། ཤུ་རི་ཏི། ཨུ་ཤུ་རི་ཨུ་ཤུ་རི། བྷུ་ཡུ་ཡེ་བྷུ་ཡུ་ཡེ་སྭཱཧཱ། [Type: Parallel Scenes | Desc: "Root node containing two parallel dhāraṇī invocations" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ན་མོ་བྷ་ག་ཝ་ཏེ། པྲཛྙཱ་པ་ར་མི་ཏ་ཡེ། ཨོཾ་ན་ཏ་ད་ཏི་ཏ། ཨི་ལི་ཤི །ཨི་ལི་ཤི །མི་ལི་ཤི །མི་ལི་ཤི །བྷི་ན་ཡན་བྷི་ན་ཡན། [Type: Scene | Desc: "First mantric invocation scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ན་མོ [Type: Process | Desc: "Act of paying homage or offering reverence" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྷ་ག་ཝ་ཏེ། པྲཛྙཱ་པ་ར་མི་ཏ་ཡེ། [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Deities or entities receiving homage" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བྷ་ག་ཝ་ཏེ། [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "First recipient of homage" | Implicit: ""]
            └── པྲཛྙཱ་པ་ར་མི་ཏ་ཡེ། [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Second recipient of homage" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ཨོཾ་ན་ཏ་ད་ཏི་ཏ། ཨི་ལི་ཤི །ཨི་ལི་ཤི །མི་ལི་ཤི །མི་ལི་ཤི །བྷི་ན་ཡན་བྷི་ན་ཡན། [Type: Center | Desc: "Mantric syllables forming the core of the first invocation" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཨོཾ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Sacred syllable introducing the mantra sequence" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ན་ཏ་ད་ཏི་ཏ། [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Ritual mantric syllable functioning as magical formula" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཨི་ལི་ཤི །ཨི་ལི་ཤི ། [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Ritual mantric syllable functioning as magical formula" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མི་ལི་ཤི །མི་ལི་ཤི ། [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Ritual mantric syllable functioning as magical formula" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བྷི་ན་ཡན་བྷི་ན་ཡན། [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Ritual mantric syllable functioning as magical formula" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [Implicit Invocation/Activation] [Type: Process | Desc: "Implicit ritual action of invoking or activating spiritual power through mantric syllables" | Implicit: "Implicit ritual action of invoking or activating spiritual power through mantric syllables"]
    └── ན་མོ་བྷ་ག་ཝ་ཏེ། པྲད་ཏྱཾ་པྲ་ཏེ། ཨི་རི་ཏི། ཨི་རི་ཏི། མི་ར་ཏི། མི་རི་ཏི། ཤུ་རི་ཏི། ཤུ་རི་ཏི། ཨུ་ཤུ་རི་ཨུ་ཤུ་རི། བྷུ་ཡུ་ཡེ་བྷུ་ཡུ་ཡེ་སྭཱཧཱ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Second mantric invocation scene" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ན་མོ [Type: Process | Desc: "Act of paying homage or offering reverence" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── བྷ་ག་ཝ་ཏེ། པྲད་ཏྱཾ་པྲ་ཏེ། [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Deities or entities receiving homage" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བྷ་ག་ཝ་ཏེ། [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "First recipient of homage" | Implicit: ""]
            └── པྲད་ཏྱཾ་པྲ་ཏེ། [Type: Participant-Recipient | Desc: "Second recipient of homage" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཨི་རི་ཏི། ཨི་རི་ཏི། མི་ར་ཏི། མི་རི་ཏི། ཤུ་རི་ཏི། ཤུ་རི་ཏི། ཨུ་ཤུ་རི་ཨུ་ཤུ་རི། བྷུ་ཡུ་ཡེ་བྷུ་ཡུ་ཡེ [Type: Center | Desc: "Mantric syllables forming the core of the second invocation" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཨི་རི་ཏི། ཨི་རི་ཏི། [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Ritual mantric syllable functioning as magical formula" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── མི་ར་ཏི། མི་རི་ཏི། [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Ritual mantric syllable functioning as magical formula" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཤུ་རི་ཏི། ཤུ་རི་ཏི། [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Ritual mantric syllable functioning as magical formula" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── ཨུ་ཤུ་རི་ཨུ་ཤུ་རི། [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Ritual mantric syllable functioning as magical formula" | Implicit: ""]
            ├── བྷུ་ཡུ་ཡེ་བྷུ་ཡུ་ཡེ [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Ritual mantric syllable functioning as magical formula" | Implicit: ""]
            └── [Implicit Invocation/Activation] [Type: Process | Desc: "Implicit ritual action of invoking or activating spiritual power through mantric syllables" | Implicit: "Implicit ritual action of invoking or activating spiritual power through mantric syllables"]
        └── སྭཱཧཱ། [Type: Adverbial | Desc: "Ritual exclamation that concludes and seals the mantra" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- ན་མོ་ : Homage [Sanskrit term 'namo': ritual act of offering reverence; functions as Process in first invocation scene marking the beginning of the ritual recitation]
- བྷ་ག་ཝ་ཏེ། : to the Blessed One [Sanskrit dative form 'bhagavate': addressing the Buddha or divine being; functions as Participant-Recipient of the homage]
- པྲཛྙཱ་པ་ར་མི་ཏ་ཡེ། : to the Perfection of Wisdom [Sanskrit dative form: addressing the female deity/concept embodying transcendent wisdom; functions as second Participant-Recipient of homage]
- ཨོཾ་ : OṂ [Sacred syllable: primary seed syllable that initiates mantra recitation; functions as introductory Adverbial in the mantric sequence]
- ན་ཏ་ད་ཏི་ཏ། : nata datita [Mantric syllables: untranslatable power syllables with specific vibrational qualities; functions as magical formula in ritual context]
- ཨི་ལི་ཤི། : ilishi [Mantric syllables: first set of repeated power syllables; functions as part of the magical formula sequence]
- ཨི་ལི་ཤི། : ilishi [Repeated mantric syllables: intentional repetition to enhance potency; continues the magical formula]
- མི་ལི་ཤི། : milishi [Mantric syllables: second set of power syllables; functions as progression in the magical formula sequence]
- མི་ལི་ཤི། : milishi [Repeated mantric syllables: intentional repetition to enhance potency; continues the magical formula]
- བྷི་ན་ཡན་ : bhinayan [Mantric syllables: third set of power syllables; functions as part of the culminating magical formula in first invocation]
- བྷི་ན་ཡན། : bhinayan [Repeated mantric syllables: intentional repetition to enhance potency; concludes first set of magical formulas]
- ན་མོ་ : Homage [Sanskrit term 'namo': second instance of offering reverence; functions as Process marking beginning of second invocation scene]
- བྷ་ག་ཝ་ཏེ། : to the Blessed One [Sanskrit dative form 'bhagavate': addressing the Buddha again; functions as Participant-Recipient in second invocation]
- པྲད་ཏྱཾ་པྲ་ཏེ། : to the Direct Perceiver [Sanskrit dative form: addressing deity associated with direct perception; functions as second Participant-Recipient in second invocation]
- ཨི་རི་ཏི། : iriti [Mantric syllables: first set of power syllables in second invocation; functions as magical formula]
- ཨི་རི་ཏི། : iriti [Repeated mantric syllables: intentional repetition for enhanced potency; continues magical formula]
- མི་ར་ཏི། : mirati [Mantric syllables: second set of power syllables in second invocation; functions as progression in magical formula]
- མི་རི་ཏི། : miriti [Mantric syllables: variation of previous syllables; continues progression of magical formula]
- ཤུ་རི་ཏི། : shuriti [Mantric syllables: third set of power syllables in second invocation; functions as further progression in magical formula]
- ཤུ་རི་ཏི། : shuriti [Repeated mantric syllables: intentional repetition for enhanced potency; continues magical formula]
- ཨུ་ཤུ་རི་ : ushuri [Mantric syllables: fourth set of power syllables in second invocation; functions as part of culminating magical formula]
- ཨུ་ཤུ་རི། : ushuri [Repeated mantric syllables: intentional repetition for enhanced potency; continues magical formula]
- བྷུ་ཡུ་ཡེ་ : bhuyuye [Mantric syllables: final set of power syllables in second invocation; functions as climactic part of magical formula]
- བྷུ་ཡུ་ཡེ་ : bhuyuye [Repeated mantric syllables: intentional repetition for enhanced potency; concludes the sequence of magical formulas]
- སྭཱཧཱ། : svāhā [Sanskrit ritual exclamation: "so be it" or "may the blessing be"; functions as Adverbial that seals and concludes the entire mantra, completing the invocation and activating its power]

རྡོ་རྗེ་གཅོད་པའི་སྙིང་པོ་འདི་ལན་གཅིག་བཟླས་པས་རྡོ་རྗེ་གཅོད་པ་ཁྲི་དགུ་སྟོང་བཀླགས་པ་དང་མཉམ་པར་འགྱུར་རོ། ། [Type: Scene | Desc: "Main sentence expressing equivalence of recitation" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── རྡོ་རྗེ་གཅོད་པའི་སྙིང་པོ་འདི [Type: Participant-Patient | Desc: "The object being recited once" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── ལན་གཅིག་བཟླས་པས [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of reciting with causal implication" | Implicit: ""]
        └── ལན་གཅིག [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Quantifies how many times the essence is recited" | Implicit: ""]
    ├── མཉམ་པར་འགྱུར་རོ [Type: Result | Desc: "The outcome or result of the recitation process" | Implicit: ""]
    └── རྡོ་རྗེ་གཅོད་པ་ཁྲི་དགུ་སྟོང་བཀླགས་པ་དང [Type: Participant-Compare | Desc: "The comparison point for the equivalence" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── རྡོ་རྗེ་གཅོད་པ [Type: Participant-Content | Desc: "The content of what is being read" | Implicit: ""]
        ├── ཁྲི་དགུ་སྟོང [Type: Quantity | Desc: "Quantifies how many times the Vajra Cutter is read" | Implicit: ""]
        └── བཀླགས་པ [Type: Process | Desc: "The action of reading" | Implicit: ""]
glossary:
- རྡོ་རྗེ་གཅོད་པའི་ : of the Vajra Cutter [Genitive of `རྡོ་རྗེ་གཅོད་པ་`: Diamond/Vajra Cutter Sutra; indicates possession/attribution; functions as a qualifier for the essence]
- སྙིང་པོ་ : essence [Noun: `སྙིང་པོ་`: heart, essence, core; referring to the condensed or essential form of the text; functions as the Patient/object in the sentence]
- འདི་ : this [Demonstrative pronoun: this specific/particular; identifies the specific essence being discussed; functions as a determiner]
- ལན་གཅིག་ : once [Adverbial phrase: `ལན་`: time, occasion + `གཅིག་`: one; quantifies the recitation frequency; functions as a quantifier for the action]
- བཟླས་པས་ : by reciting [Instrumental case of `བཟླས་པ་`: to recite, repeat; past tense verbal noun + instrumental particle; indicates the causal action; functions as the Process in the semantic structure]
- རྡོ་རྗེ་གཅོད་པ་ : the Vajra Cutter Sutra [Noun phrase: Diamond/Vajra Cutter; the title of the full sutra text; functions as the Content participant in the comparison]
- ཁྲི་ : ten thousand [Numeral: 10,000; part of the numerical expression; functions as part of the quantity]
- དགུ་ : nine [Numeral: 9; part of the numerical expression; functions as part of the quantity]
- སྟོང་ : thousand [Numeral: 1,000; part of the numerical expression "19,000"; functions as part of the quantity]
- བཀླགས་པ་ : reading [Verbal noun from `ཀློག་པ་`: to read; past tense verbal noun; indicates the comparative action; functions as the Process in the comparison]
- དང་ : and, with [Conjunction: connects elements in comparison; links the reading of the full sutra with the essence recitation; functions as a connective]
- མཉམ་པར་ : equal to [Adverbial form of `མཉམ་པ་`: equal, equivalent; indicates equivalence between the two practices; functions as part of the Result]
- འགྱུར་རོ : becomes [Future tense of `འགྱུར་བ་`: to become, transform + final particle `རོ་` indicating certainty/declaration; indicates the resulting state; functions as the main Result verb with certainty marker]
- ། : [Sentence-final shad punctuation mark]

glossary:
- ཡེ་དྷརྨ་ : All phenomena [Sanskrit term; `yē dharmā`: phenomena, elements of existence; functions as the start of the central concept being discussed per UCCA structure]
- ཧེ་ཏུ་ : cause [Sanskrit term; `hetu`: cause, reason; indicates the causal nature of phenomena; part of the elaboration on dharmas]
- པྲ་བྷ་ཝ་ : arise from [Sanskrit term; `prabhava`: arising, origination; describes how phenomena come into existence; completes the elaboration on causally conditioned dharmas]
- ཧེ་ཏུནྟེ་ཥཱན : their causes [Sanskrit compound; `hetu` (cause) + `teṣāṃ` (of those); further elaborates on the causal nature of phenomena]
- ཏ་ཐཱ་ག་ཏོ་ : the Tathagata [Sanskrit term; `tathāgata`: "thus-gone" or "thus-come", epithet of the Buddha; functions as the Agent who is speaking in the UCCA structure]
- ཧྱ་བ་དཏ : has spoken [Sanskrit term; `hyavadat`: explained, taught, spoken; the Process or action performed by the Tathagata]
- ཏེ་ཥཱཉྩ་ : and of those [Sanskrit term; `teṣāñca`: "and of those"; Relator connecting the previous phenomena to their cessation]
- ཡོ་ནི་རོ་དྷ་ : cessation [Sanskrit term; `yo nirodha`: the cessation, ending; refers to the ending of phenomena; functions as the Patient in the second scene]
- ཨེ་ཝཾ་ : thus [Sanskrit term; `evaṃ`: thus, in this way; Adverbial indicating how the Buddha explains]
- བཱ་དཱི་ : speaks [Sanskrit term; `vādī`: speaker, one who explains; the Process of explaining in the second scene]
- མི་ཧཱ་ཤྲ་མ་ཎ་ཡེ་ : to the Great Ascetic [Sanskrit term; `mahā śramaṇāya`: to the great renunciant/practitioner; refers to the Buddha; functions as the Agent to whom the teaching is dedicated]
- སྭཱཧཱ : svaha [Sanskrit term; sacred syllable traditionally used to conclude mantras; represents the Process of offering or dedication in the final scene]
